about: Rustic exterior, elegant interior, on 2 private wooded acres - 6 spacious rooms include LR w/ fireplace, formal DR, Kitchen, 2 BRs w/real beds and
description: Description The Space Great country setting in any season; enjoy hiking, biking and local theatre and fairs. Brass lanterns light the driveway as you return home each evening. The patio includes seating around a Firepit or a propane Grill. Indoors you can enjoy the wood-stocked fieldstone fireplace during cooler weather. Two second floor bedrooms with treetop views sleep 3 or 4 comfortably (one bedroom has a queen bed and the other bedroom has a double bed with a cot also available) and another person can be accommodated in the library with a sofa-bed. There is a charge of $20 for each additional guest if you have more than 5. We also have blocks and books, a high chair or pack & play crib for a child. Guest Access Guests will have exclusive occupancy of the home and grounds. Enjoy breakfast and snacks from our stocked refrigerator. A bicycle and walking trail is nearby and we have badminton and snow shoes to share. We are on the route of Manchester's 4 K race. Interaction with Guests We look forward to greeting you and answering your questions. If you let us know your interests, we'll be happy to give you some suggestions! The Neighborhood Manchester is 10 miles east of Hartford and is known as "The City of Village Charm" and it was the home of 19th century Cheney silk mills. Our home is in a rural area about a mile from downtown; downtown shops are along a classic 1950's style Main Street. A popular grocery store, new bicycle path, and entrance to Interstate highway 384 are just 1/4 mile from our house. Within a half hour or less, you can drive to interesting landmarks such as the Mark Twain House, the Nathan Hale homestead, the main campus of University of Connecticut or the Law School in Hartford, the State Capitol, Trinity College, The University of Hartford, or the Wadsworth Athenaeum. Getting Around No public transportation is available nearby. By car, Bradley International Airport is 25 minutes away and the Hartford train station is 15 minutes. Take a look at our Guidebook for nearby destinations you may enjoy. Other Things to Note Let us know if you wish to use our clothes washer and dryer or park your car in the attached garage. The inside stairway to the second floor is open and toddlers need supervision. + More
rules: House Rules Please treat our home with care. We don't permit smoking or pets. This home is not available for parties although we don't object if you wish to invite family members who may live in the area. + More

about: We're long time AirBnB hosts (and guests). Our condo is bright and spacious with wood floors and lots of light. The room is clean and comfortable with a private bath. Conveniently located to everything in downtown Hartford.
description: Description The Space Includes a double bed with a super comfortable tempur-pedic style mattress, a full en suite bathroom, a closet and dresser. A mini fridge, coffeemaker and microwave are provided in the room for your use. Other amenities include a luggage rack, hairdryer, fan and iPod dock. You have your own (optional) private entrance through our basement, if you prefer not to use the main entrance. If you are traveling with a child or other guest, we have a twin air mattress available to you for an additional $10/night. Message me before booking so I can charge you the correct amount. You are welcome to use our high chair, stroller, or any other of our child accessories while you are here at no charge. DISCLOSURE: We are adjacent to a busy clinic that opens early in the morning. Sleeping in can be difficult. We have a cat but he is not allowed in the guest room. Guest Access You are welcome to share our kitchen, living and dining rooms, front patio and backyard. You are also welcome to our W/D, iron, etc.. Our apartment is on the first and garden floors of a townhouse. The main living area is on the first floor and the bedrooms are downstairs in the garden level. Interaction with Guests As much or as little as you like! We are long time users of AirBnB and love to travel. We are also longtime residents of Hartford and love our city. We are happy to help you find your way but are also happy to leave you alone. The Neighborhood Our neighborhood is very pleasant and close to everything. We are walking distance to the Convention and XL Centers, Hartford Hospital, companies like Travelers and Phoenix, theaters, restaurants, parks, museums and so on! Getting Around We are walking distance from the bus and train station and all major city bus lines (as well as many express buses to other towns). We are also walking distance to the Mega Bus stop, and the Bradley Flyer which takes you to and from the airport for $1.50. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking indoors. Treat our home as you would your own. + More

about: Ranch & Retreat. Spacious, tranquil. 20 minutes to UCONN.
description: Description The Space This house is a simple sanctuary. Situated on hundreds of acres of protected farmland, your backyard view is of fields and sky. Beautiful sunsets. Deer, wild turkey, just some of the local life in the fields. Crops are corn, oats and wheat. Furnishing is minimal, that's just my style, with cozy spaces to read and talk. This property is close to one of the only wild trout streams in Connecticut. Fantastic place for a few friends to get together for an individualized yoga retreat, or just for enjoying the beauty and being. Guest Access I provide towels and individual soaps. Everything in the fridge is yours to enjoy. Please let me know how you brew your coffee, if you do have a preference, so I can have it ready for you. There is a grill on the back porch, as well as fire braizer for s'mores. If you are a runner, fabulous local runs if you head out of the driveway and to the right, and then at the end of the road, a left. Interaction with Guests Let me know what you need and how I can help. The Neighborhood Pretty walks, bike rides, hundreds of acres of protected farmland and a natural wild trout stream a short walk away. Catch and release only! Bring your bikes! Gorgeous hilly bikerides. Head into town, Willimantic, if you want a local meal. Top pick for breakfast is Nita's, off of Main Street in Willimantic, top pick by far for dinner is Cafemantic on Main Street. If you love beer, you must try the homemade brews at the Willimantic Brewing Company. Getting Around Car necessary. Other Things to Note This house has no AC. + More
rules: House Rules No indoor smoking . Prefer no smoking, but if you must, smoke outside of the house only. Please dispose of all cigarette butts in garbage, do not leave on property. Be safe. The pool is closed for the season, no swimming at the moment. + More

about: Welcome to The Regency!
description: Description The Space This contemporary raised ranch has been completely renovated over the past three years. There are three private bedrooms available, each room can accommodate up to two adults. All bedrooms feature large windows, closet space and comfortable full/queen mattresses. One full bathroom is shared between the occupants in the Morning Light and Northern View bedrooms. The Reflections bedroom features a larger space and private bathroom. Morning Light and Northern View bedrooms are $50/night. The Reflections bedroom is $70/night. Please specify how many rooms you desire to book. Weekend check in times are flexible. Guest Access Wifi, off street parking, bedding, towels, and shared kitchen (pots, pans, plates, silverware and appliances) are included. Enormous kitchen with new stainless appliances, ample natural and artificial lighting, and a breakfast bar style island. Kitchen is open to the vaulted great room and elevated rear deck which overlooks the .5 acre grassy lot. Interaction with Guests More interaction between host and guest results in a better experience for both parties! :-) The kitchen island quickly converts into a superb ping pong table, challengers encouraged. The Neighborhood The house is located in a quiet neighborhood with lighted sidewalks. Readily accessible from routes 91 and 291. Five miles from route 84, University of Hartford and other colleges. Fine dining in numerous locations and shopping locations within minutes by car. Historic downtown Windsor can be reached easily by bicycle. Getting Around One mile walk to city bus route, which only operates during the work week. Park and ride lot just outside neighborhood. The Windsor Train station is about 3 miles away. The Hartford Train/Bus station and Bradley Airport are just a quick taxi ride away. Rental car or Taxi will be your best options. Bicycling is a fairly viable option. New! Limited Uber service Other Things to Note If you have any questions or special requests, just ask! + More
rules: House Rules Please communicate your plans as far in advance as possible, so that I can better accommodate you! about: Yep, its the basics. Spacious home. One floor living with gas heat and cooking, three furnished bedrooms and two full baths. Parking in the driveway. The house has a dishwasher & a fireplace. You will be responsible for sheets & towels. *See details
description: Description The Space Hi, This is a three bedroom 1950s ranch, located in suburbia, the northern section of town in west Hartford called Bishops Corner. Note: Please contact me with your request for a specific timeline in that I have this space offered a few different ways (as a guest room also) so I need to be sure both calendars are clear. Its furnished and clean but just know its not fancy or renovated. I have expanded cable tv and wifi, and utilities are included. There is paved parking for 2 vehicles. maximum for this home is 6 people. Strict policy. There are cooking utensils, etc. and pretty much all you would need with the exception of sheets and towels. In a pinch I could work that out too. As a general rule, its $166 a night, Fri and Sat $198 per night. Pricing moderately higher in December, January, February and March, (+$15 per day $88 week or $337 per month to offset heating aspect) Weekly and monthly specials, as well as long term, just inquire, add this adjustment for the winter months to the posted weekly and monthly rate. Neighbor is a cop. Loud parties will last about 4 minutes before he or his wife is at the door. Guest Access The main house, or original dwelling. This home was expanded in the 80s and there is a guest suite attached to the home that does not share its access. Neighbor police officer will most likely be handing you the key. Interaction with Guests Its pretty much all yours. Its not a grand place but I appreciate your treating it with respect. You will find it clean and comfortable. If it were entered in some kind of a design show, it would definitely appear as the "Before" house. The Neighborhood Suburbia, but close to pretty much everything. Great for those visiting West Hartford or the area in general Getting Around Bus stop 5 minutes. It will take you to downtown Hartford where you may transfer to another bus that can take you to or from the airport. Other Things to Note A great neighborhood for walking, jogging or biking. Starbucks, chain restaurants, grocery stores, etc are a 5 minute drive or a 15 minute walk. + More

description: Description The Space A Private Island for Rent It's All Lakefront Laurel Island is a 5 acre Island on a Lake in Connecticut. It is a Retreat Location which is available for use by retreat planners or by individuals. Location Laurel Island is a perfect location to hold a retreat, reunion or family group that combines the privacy and peacefulness of an island and facilities for groups both large and small. Accommodations include 5 private cottages and a large main lodge for gathering. Local catering is available for group meals and will provide meals adaptable to different diets including vegan, vegetarian, gluten free, or others. The 5 acre island's canopy trees, blueberry bushes, rocky outcrops and large grassy field provide numerous spaces for activities and events. A huge covered deck overlooking the lake provides protection regardless of the weather, and is attached to the lodge for easy access. All of these spaces lend well for yoga, meditation, nature, wellness and other types of retreats, reunions or family groups. Accommodations In the cottages, guests choose to sleep in either community rooms (a room with no doors), a shared room, or a private room. In total, there are 14 rooms for shared or private stays. The island can accommodate 36 people. The cost for the entire private Island for a weekend is $180 per person, minimum of 20 people.The cost for a weekend retreat (Friday night, Saturday, and Sunday), including food and lodging is $320/person For a full week the cost of the entire private Island is $300 per person. Contact For more information www(URL HIDDEN) And for more photos http://www.airbnb.com/rooms/21060#photos Call or email Jack Solomon if you want to reserve a space. $100 deposit required email (EMAIL HIDDEN) (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Comments on Laurel Island- Wonderful Escape from the City. You won't be disappointed. Ann, Rockaway, NY June 2011 This was my second year at the Yoga Retreat on Laurel Island. Restorative! Lovely Island. Wonderful Lodging, comfort, safety, ambience and food. I'll be coming back as long as the Retreat is offered. Carlin, Churchville, NY June 2011 + More

about: Located on the historic Milford Green, the Greenside Guest Room is a great place to spend a night or the weekend. Whether you are in town for special event, to see the sights or just to relax, Greenside Guest Room is the perfect getaway for two.
description: Description The Space The second floor guestroom is an addition to the original Levi Langridge home (circa 1850) preserving the existing architecture. The sunny room features a queen sized bed and private bath with antique claw foot tub with a shower. The wide pine-board floor and fireplace mantle are original to the home. The gas fireplace, antique furnishings, private entrance with deck, complete the amenities. Guest Access Guests enter from off-the-street parking behind the house, up stairs to private deck. Driveway entrance to the right of the house. The Neighborhood Downtown Milford is one of the most picturesque towns in Connecticut and Milford Harbor is one of the most charming in the area. Milford's Green is New England's second longest and has been designated as The Milford Legacy Arboretum. A short walk brings you to the harbor, a scenic waterfall and duck ponds. An exceptional selection of restaurants and luncheonettes will satisfy all appetites and are only a short walk away. A myriad of small shops offer interesting and varied shopping. Downtown also offers evening entertainment. Seasonal events including the Oyster Festival, crafts fairs, Captain Kid's Day, the Candlelight Walk and summer Friday Night Concerts. The Historical Society Compound is within easy walking distance. Getting Around Just minutes walk to downtown and the three minute walk to the Metro-North Train Station offers easy access to New York City or New Haven. I-95 and Merritt/Wilbur Cross Parkways are less than five minutes away. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking or pets + More

about: Our spacious barn apartment with exposed beams, sun-filled rooms and delightful interiors is a true country get-away! Set on expansive lawns with magnificent old trees, just minutes to New Haven, Yale & beaches, it's paradise! Come visit!
description: Description The Space Beautiful, spacious 2-bd apartment in a traditional 1930s New England converted barn with many amenities. Situated on a gorgeous 1.5 acre property, minutes to beaches, Yale and downtown New Haven restaurants, shops and theaters. Perfect for weekend get-aways or long-term stays! Apartment has exposed beams, hardwood floors, 2 light-filled bedrooms (1 full size bed, 1 queen size bed), study/den, living and dining room, large kitchen with microwave, coffee maker, dishwasher. Washer/ dryer, wireless internet included. My home is also on the property, across the garden. The grounds (including four weeping cherry trees!) are lovely - perfect for summer picnics and bbq's. A family of deer visit the garden often, as well as rabbits, chipmunks and other garden critters! We are only a 15 minute drive to Yale University, and to the theaters, restaurants, and shops of downtown New Haven. There are several beautiful beaches nearby, and tennis courts, local parks and hiking trails within walking distance of the property. It is the country though, so you do need a car to get around :-) There's ample parking and easy access to I-95, the Merritt Parkway, and MetroNorth train stations. You will have your own key and complete access to the barn apartment while you visit. Woodbridge is a lovely and quiet country town with stone walls and historic buildings tucked into a corner adjacent to New Haven and within minutes to anything you might need. Guest Access Guests have full private access to the barn apartment and the beautiful grounds. Interaction with Guests I really enjoy meeting my guests, but I respect their need for privacy, too. I follow my guests in determining the amount of interaction they want. I'm available for anything guests may need or for providing directions to local shops, restaurants, etc. The Neighborhood Our neighborhood is a peaceful country setting with stone walls and quaint beautiful houses. It's lovely to walk past the gorgeous gardens and enjoy the peaceful surroundings. It's hard to believe you're only minutes to the great bars, restaurants, shops and theaters of New Haven. Beaches, movie houses and anything else you might want are only minutes away. A wonderful and popular brunch spot is Claire's, 10 minutes from the barn. Pepe's Pizza in New Haven is famous for its wood fired pizza oven and delicious pizza! There are numerous excellent restaurants in the area, including Indian, Middle Eastern, Chinese, and Kosher. The well known Long Warf Theater, which brings talented actors and excellent productions, is also situated in New Haven, as are several art and history museums. There is no shortage of things to see and do in the vicinity. But it's always nice to come back to the peace and quiet of the barn! Getting Around This is country life, so you do need a car. Car rentals are plentiful and taxis are also available. Parking is included and is located next to the barn. Metro-North train and bus station is a 15 minute drive, so a day trip to New York City is also easy! Other Things to Note Check-in time is 3:00PM, unless otherwise arranged. Check-out time is before 12:00 noon, unless otherwise arranged. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking in the barn please, thank you! + More

about: This is a great place located in the heart of New Haven, CT. Just across the street from Walgreens, Yale University, two blocks away from Yale Hospital, 1-2 blocks away from award winning restaurants, nightclubs, the apple store, shopping and more.
description: Description The Space This space is has just been renovated and furnished. Its also used as media production workspace and office space during the months of Sept - June and is then used as hospitality space from the months of June - September 2016. Guest Access While you are here you have access to the entire space. There is one main entrance and a fire escape access in case of emergencies. Interaction with Guests During the time that our space is being used to accommodate guest, you will have access to Jessica, whom lives within the next block to assist you with any questions and also serves as a concierge to the space. She is handy and also very familiar with the area. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is located near Yale University (2 blocks away) and Yale Hospital (1 block away). Other places that are located within 2 - 5 minutes walking distance are: Walgreens (Pharmacy & Store): 1 min walk Toads Place (Music Venue): 7 min walk Toads Place is a world famed music venue that has and continues play host to many of yesterday's and today most popular artist such as Bob Dylan, The Rolling Stones, Bruce Springsteen, U2, Kayne West, Drake and many others. You can see any genre of music on any given night as one night will be Rock, the next night will be Regge, another night will be country, followed by EDM music event or a dance party where you will her the latest dance hits. BAR (Restaurant & Nightclub): 2 min walk The pizza and beers at this place is nothing less than AMAZING. If you like to dance and let loose, this is definitely the spot. Lots of good-looking people that will make you feel like you are living a television or movie experience. Rudy's (Restaurant): 4 min walk Good food and social spot. Dunkin Donuts: 2 min walk Viva Zapta (Mexican Restaurant): 2 min walk Howe's Pizza: 4 min walk Brick Oven Pizza (Take out is best) 5 min walk Mamoun's (Middle Eastern Restaurant): 4 min walk Miya's Sushi (Japenese Restaurant): 3 min walk Very unique food my by my personal friend and award wining enterpreneur Bun Lai. Prime 16 (Restaurant and awesome burgers and craft beers): (Downtown) 7 min walk Chipotle (Downtown): 7 min walk Subway (Downtown): 7 min walk York Street Noodle House: 3 min walk Anna Liffey's (Irish Bar & Restaurant): 18 min walk Five Guy's (American Cuisine) (Downtown): 10 min walk Red Tomato (Downtown): 8 min walk China Palace (Downtown): 8 min walk Good Chinese Food & also delivers Apple Store (Retail): 4 min walk Barnes & Noble Bookstore (Retail): 4 min walk Urban Outfitters (Retail): 4 min walk Denali (Retail): 4 min walk Great Outwear Origins (Retail): 4 min walk American Apparel (Retail): 4 min walk Getting Around There is public transportation via bus that will take you around New Haven and to other cities with transfers available on the bus or you can purchase transfers and daily passes at the kiosk located in downtown New Haven on the Green. New Haven Union Station: 5 min via uber or cab or 20 min walk New Haven is the last stop if you are taking the train from Grand Central Station in NYC or if you are would like to to Grand Central to NYC you can take the train from New Haven and Grand Central Station is the last stop. Another plus about taking this is train is that you can use it to take you to Yankee Stadium. Public Other Things to Note During the summer months in New Haven there are many public events such as concerts, Arts and Ideas Festival, gallery shows, plays and other events that take place right on the New Haven Green + More
rules: House Rules Can have one additional guest for an extra $18 a night. There are tenants that live on the first and third floor. There is a strict quite rule that is enforce from 10pm to 9am. + More

about: Warm private room in my shared apartment. Super comfy queen size memory foam mattress. Located in Cedar Hill, 15 minute bike ride from downtown, close to hiking and jogging trails. Beautiful views of East Rock, river and downtown. Close to bus lines!
description: Description The Space The decor of my apartment is unique: fun stuff to look at, lots of books to read, spare art materials to try, burgeoning plant collection. The neighborhood is colorful and friendly, I have close neighbors who also host on air bnb who are here for an emergency if I'm not available. The apartment itself has a great feeling, lots of dark wood, vaulted ceilings, gorgeous views, feels like a tree house. The room is very warm and comfortable, good air and good light! I will be away in West Africa, you will be staying with my kind and wonderful partner Kenny, who has his own room. He goes to school and works full time. We have a cat, a hamster and a guinea pig in his room. I do have a lot of art and bric-a-brac up, so if you need a little visual space, tell Kenny and we can rearrange to your liking. We try to lead a pretty natural lifestyle, minimal chemicals, but begrudge no one their Clorox or whatever you need. Guest Access Kitchen, bathroom (with a lovely tub!), free washer and dryer in basement, wifi, books, coffee. You'll have keys, so come and go as your please. Interaction with Guests Friendly, calm, accommodating. We're out a lot, working or in the studio, so you'll have the apartment to yourself mostly. (You and the little animals!) The Neighborhood You can see East Rock park, river, mountain and distant hills from my kitchen (third floor on the top of the hill). Right next to East Rock Park, I-91, State Street and Hamden. 45 min walk from downtown New Haven, 15-20 min bike ride. Very family oriented neighborhood, super friendly; seconds from lots of hiking and jogging trails and even a public water park (it's as great as it sounds). Also close to soccer and basketball fields, I can't recommend any part of New Haven more highly, I adore it here. Getting Around There's the M bus on State Street, I've got a spare timetable. It's fast and easy to bike anywhere from here, 7 minute walk to Yale shuttle on Orange Street. I have a spare bike and lock, if you need one. Other Things to Note I meditate, so if you'd like to join me at the group I go to, you're welcome to... and maybe I'll paint your portrait! + More
rules: House Rules No smoking in the apartment, there's a balcony down stairs, no additional pets please, but there are lots of friendly cats and dogs in the neighborhood! + More

about: I'm renting the large attic of my house which has its own separate entrance and exit. The house is located in the East Rock neighborhood of New Haven, which is one of the safest and most popular places to live in the city, about a mile away from Yale
description: Description The Space This is the entire attic of my house, which is essentially two rooms. It is very minimal in that it really only has a bed and a futon so two or more people can actually stay here. The attic has a lot of empty space, one room is completely empty. I have some of my things stashed in the attic but they should not get in your way. The attic has windows and tall ceilings so it's more like an apartment floor. Guest Access There is a separate entrance and exit for the attic so you can come and go as you please. One caveat is that the attic does not have a bathroom so you will have to walk a short flight of stairs to my floor (10 feet) to use my bathroom. You can use my refrigerator and kitchen if you'd like, and there is a washer/dryer available for you to use. Interaction with Guests I am new to AirBnB which is why I don't have many reviews. I stay on the second floor of the house below the attic. So if I'm home, I'm around if you have additional questions or need assistance with anything. If you really need a ride somewhere, I may be able to help you out if it's not far and I'm around. The train station is only 2-3 miles away from my house and Yale University is 1-2 miles away. The Neighborhood The house is located in East Rock, which is one of the most popular places to live in New Haven. Many Yale students and faculty live in the neighborhood, it is safe, and quiet. Getting Around There is on-street free parking and it is easy to find parking spaces. Other Things to Note I have a medium size dog that does not really bark or make noise, so it will likely not impact your stay. + More
rules: House Rules I expect minimal noise, no loud partying or anything destructive. Just respectful guests. Please leave the way you found it. + More

about: Unique Riverview Historic Home on the Quinnipiac river just 5-10 minute drive to downtown New Haven and Yale. on the bus line. Master suite with steam shower, laundry big private yard with Hot tub, River view porch, directly next to park.
description: Description The Space 1890 victorian on the Quinnipiac river with all the New England charm. The location makes for great day trip to train to NYC. Adjacent to the historic district. The location is very convenient to the freeways and one of the safer New Haven areas. Access to the river and close proximity to Lighthouse point. The bus stop one block away Metro North runs to Grand Central NYC every hour Please be clean and considerate of the downstairs tenants and quiet after 10pm Only registered guests, no parties, Please no smoking on the property! Below is a review from a guest who rented the place from my other listing. 5 Stars "We rented this house as a place to gather our family for Thanksgiving since our kids weren't able to come home to California this year, and it worked out perfectly. The house was charming, with lots of interesting nooks and crannies, and an eclectic combination of old and new furniture. We stayed warm and cozy and the house was very light and cheerful during the day. With four bedrooms there was plenty of space for everyone, and we enjoyed the comfy bedding and furry blankets. The kitchen had nice appliances and all the necessities for cooking. An extra plus was seeing the moon through the skylights in the master bedroom!" Guest Access The entire 2nd and 3rd floor Master suite, front and back yard, front porch. Other bedrooms in the home may or may not have people in them. Interaction with Guests Unlimited phone and email communication. The house manager would like to be there for check in and check out if possible to answer questions. The Neighborhood Our area is one of the safer in New Haven, check Trulia crime stats. We have an amazing view, and more amenities than most. You can walk the river front, shops and parks, 1/2 mile from a golf corse and you don't have to fight traffic to get to the freeway. That being said, have realistic expectations! If you are not a city person or are afraid of minorities please find somewhere else. I don't want a negative reviews about typical urban issues. We are in a typical urban area but do not have the crime, parking issues, litter, homeless and noise of downtown and Yale. But be warned..... New Haven is a city, you will see some unlucky people and run down areas all over town on the way to our oasis. Getting Around You will want a car, but we are super close to the FWY and 10 min to downtown. 10 min cab to Union Station. Other Things to Note The parking area is 100' from the back door, one flight of stairs up to the main floor + More
rules: House Rules 'If you smoke, please find another place.' No unregistered guests or parties. Read the house manual for common sense rules. + More

Bathroom with shower outside, eliminating the wait. Lightning speed fast wifi and cable with HBO, Apple TV with Siri, Netfkix, Amazon Video Interaction with Guests I will be there to greet you for your arrival and available by phone 24/7 and within 30 minutes distance in case of any issues The Neighborhood The culture, the diversity, the eclectic melting pot that is New Haven. So many things to do: great restaurants(frank pepe and modern offer the best pizza in the country) great museums, fun bars, plenty of fun hipsterish events Getting Around There are buses that run in most areas till 11, Uber is cheap, fast, and dependable + More

about: Our lovely second bedroom is yours for your time in New Haven! It's spacious and well set out with a Queen bed. We're in central East Rock near the park and Nica's, 1 block from Yale, the free shuttle, and zipcars. Heating is always on in winter.
description: Description The Space The apartment is spacious and light, and very comfortable. The bed is a new super comfortable tuft & needle queen and the room has a desk for you to work at if need be. One of the best things is how close everything is; Yale is literally the next block over, and there are good coffee shops and a deli within 5-10 minutes walk. This is a very secure and safe area, and two of the free Yale shuttles (orange, blue) run past different ends of the street. The bedroom is set back from the street. There is a desk in your room, and washer/dri(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)) in the basement. You're welcome to make use of the full kitchen. There is occasionally some limited daytime noise from the above apartment. There is free on-street parking; let us know and you're welcome to use the parking pass. The Neighborhood East Rock is named for the nearby East Rock park. The area is home to a large group of Yale students, staff, and faculty, as well as many young professionals and families (wikipedia). Getting Around Yes; yale and public busses + More
rules: House Rules A few things; - Please either place any used dishes in the dishwasher, or wash them; - Sorry, no pets allowed in the building; - Similarly, no smoking (you can do so out the front); - Please try to leave the room relatively clean; - If you break anything by accident, please let me know and if it's significant it'd be great if you replaced it. Please do not use the coffee machine as it's easily damaged. - Please be sure to return the parking pass! If you take it home, you are responsible for either returning it or for the council's replacement fee. + More

about: Our family cottage has all of the amenities to make your stay at the lake one to always remember. Beach, dock, boats, hammocks and a picnic table to pass the day away. 3 bedrooms, full kitchen, bathroom and screened porch to relax in between.
description: Description The Space Our family cottage has provided us years of joy. While not the prettiest place on the lake, it is after all a cottage, the inside is very comfortable and set up to entertain and provide many amenities of home. 3 bedrooms: - First bedroom has a king bed - Second bedroom a full size bed - Third bedroom contains a bunk bed (2 twin mattresses) with an extra twin bed in the room. There is also a futon in the main cottage area and a large sectional couch on the all season (fully enclosed) porch. We offer clean sheets, comforters, and pillow cases for the beds as well as clean beach and shower towels - NOTE FOR 2015 SEASON A $50 SURCHARGE IS ADDED TO THE RESERVATION FOR THIS AMENITY. CONTACT US TO WAVE IT IF YOU WANT TO BRING YOUR OWN BED SHEETS AND TOWELS. Use of full size refrigerator/freezer, microwave, toaster oven, coffee maker, stove/oven and gas grill are included. Pots, pans, plates, glasses and utensils are also included. Hot and cold water kitchen sink. Bathroom has a toilet, shower/tub and sink. Large trash and recycling totes available outside for proper garbage disposal. There is NO provided WiFi or Laundry on premises. Guest Access Guests have access to everything at the cottage. The only requests are to ALWAYS supervise children near the water, wear proper safety vests when boating and respect the neighbors and property. Interaction with Guests Not much interaction is needed. If scheduling allows, we may visit with you upon arrival to show you around and quickly settle you in. If we can't meet you, instructions will be provided in advance on how to get in and close up. There is no land line phone at the cottage so we will exchange cell phone numbers. You will be able to contact us at any time to address any need or problem. Full cell phone service and data coverage is available across all major providers. The Neighborhood There are 5 cottages that surround ours with plenty of private parking. Designated beach area and private dock is yours to enjoy. All of the amenities of suburbia are one exit south (Exit 93) off Interstate 395. Supermarkets, Lowe's, Target, Kohl's, Bed Bath & Beyond, Liquor/Beer/Wine Store, Movie Theater, Fast Food, Coffee/Donuts Shops, Restaurants, Bank, Gas, Laundromat, and whatever else on Earth that you need. Getting Around Located in the "Quiet Corner" of Northeast Connecticut, easy access from exit 94 off CT Interstate 395. Cottage is less than 5 minutes from exit. - Mohegan Sun and Foxwoods are +/- 40 minutes away. - Providence, RI and Worcester, MA are +/- 30 minutes away. - Boston is +/- 1 hour away. - Hartford is +/- 50 minutes away. - Mystic Village and New London are +/- 50 minutes away. - Thompson Motor Speedway is +/- 15 minutes away. Other Things to Note Alexander's Lake is a gas motor free lake. This is why the lake water is so clear and clean. Please do not bring any boats in tow and attempt to launch. There is a 27" TV, but no cable or antenna TV signal as of now. We have a large bin of 70s/80s/90s classic comedy/action/drama/etc. movies in VHS format to play on the VCR. We also have a DVD player (Non-BluRay) with some DVDs available for viewing. There is also a Nintendo GameCube with a wide selection of games to play. The cottage has a stereo that can play the radio, cassette tapes and CDs. There is also a jack hooked up to the stereo to stream music from a phone or iPod / iPad. We do not offer an internet or a WiFi signal. As noted above there is full phone and data coverage at the lake from all major providers. There is no washer and dryer. You can wash clothes one exit down the highway (Exit 93 off CT Interstate 395). Quiet time at the lake is 10 pm so please limit outside noise after that time. Note: There is no controlled heat at the cottage sans a large wood burning stove in the middle common area. You may use it but please be careful and use responsibly. Firewood can be purchased at area gas stations, grocery stores and curbside stands. + More
rules: House Rules Be respectful of the property and neighbors. Do not litter outside. Wipe up any spills. If you break anything please note and either replace or compensate. about: Privacy on the 2nd floor of home midst acres of tall oak & pine, with an extra bed & bedrm available if you prefer a desk area, or you have an additional person or child. Beds are new and medium firm. You are welcome to use our breakfast bar.
description: Description The Space Idyllic country setting surrounded by tall trees with occasional sightings of deer or other woodland creatures! Second floor is warm, cozy and private. The large bedroom with a queen bed is perfect for a couple and an additional room with a double bed is available if you need it for another couple, a third person or child, at a slight additional charge. You can enjoy your morning coffee at the breakfast bar in the kitchen or on the patio! Or a nightcap before a cozy fire in one of our fieldstone fireplaces in the colder months. Guest Access The owners occupy the first floor so your bed and bath on the second floor are completely separate and private. You enter the front door to a large foyer, the kitchen and the stairs to your private "nest" are to your right. Interaction with Guests We think you'll be happy at our home. We will be delighted to greet you, answer your questions and make suggestions if you have some special interests. The Neighborhood It's a rural residential neighborhood amazingly close to Interstate 384 - so convenient if you plan to travel to other corners of Connecticut or New England. University of Connecticut football stadium or downtown Hartford, and Hiking and Bike trails are nearby. Getting Around You will need a car as there's no public transportation nearby. The airport is 25 minutes and train station in Hartford is 15 minutes by car. We are approximately midway between the main campus of University of Connecticut and colleges in Hartford. Mystic Seaport and beaches are an hour's drive through scenic country towns. Or visit the Mark Twain or Nathan Hale homesteads, each about 15 minutes away. Other Things to Note You'll have fresh soap, towels and sheets, as well as fresh well water from our own 500 ft. well. Our acreage adjoins our neighbors' property with similar settings. Easy to find at night as lanterns line the driveway; you may park your car in our garage or invite your family members for a cookout. + More

about: The House on the Hill is a charming historic cottage and garden set on 48 private acres of forestland and meadows about a five minute drive from the center of town with breathtaking 360 degree views over the Litchfield Hills.
description: Description The Space This special property - a charming cottage located on a private hilltop---is situated in between Litchfield and Bantam. Ideal for a couple or a small family it was built in the 1950s by Julie & John Forman, the founders of Litchfield's Forman School, and is still owned by their family. A two story house tastefully decorated with rustic country antiques, the ground floor features a newly renovated kitchen, a dining and living room with a dramatic open stone fireplace and a small sitting room and guest bathroom. Upstairs is a master bedroom with a very comfortable King bed, a walk-in-closet-sized attached guest room perfect for a child, and a small bathroom with separate shower. An ideal artist's retreat, there is purposefully no internet connection at the cottagethe owners use it as a place to escape and disconnect---so the house is best for those looking to read, meditate, unwind, cook and connect in real time. But don't panic: there is cell phone reception. And for those who must work on their laptops there are several cafes nearby with WIFI. The house is only about a 5 minute drive to Litchfield's center, with its stylish shops and restaurants such as the West Street Grill, and 5 minutes to Bantam, a tiny town that has been recently revived into a foodie destination (Arethusa Farm Dairy, Al Tavolo Restaurant and Bantam Bread), and about 20 minutes to New Preston and Washington Depot. Interaction with Guests There is access to nearby tennis courts. The owners are happy to recommend hiking and biking trails as well as nearby swimming spots. The area offers a bounty of places to buy excellent local produce from farms where you can pick your own berries and peaches and apples to weekly farmers markets. Getting Around A car is a must to get around the Litchfield Hills. + More

description: Description The Space Welcome to my beautiful apartment steps away from Trinity College, the Institute of Living and Hartford Hospital. The apartment is newly renovated and fully furnished with brand new furniture. There is a front and back yard, with a wrap around porch, perfect for barbequing and entertaining. Feel free to use the space for a gathering of friends, a party or a celebration. There is front wraparound porch and small back porch nice for watching sunsets and sunrises while drinking warm tea or coffee. There is parking off street parking in the backyard. There are restaurants, grocery stores and shops near by, as well as public transportation. I hope you decide to stay here, please contact me if you have any questions. Guest Access Guest will have access to the front wrap-around porch and the first floor back porch the front porch is furnished with a wicker patio set and guest are welcomed to bring the kitchen tables to the back porch to enjoy the space. Coin operated laundry machines are located in the basement. A parking space will be reserved for guests. Guests are free to enjoy the backyard however they see fit as in a picnic, tossing around a ball of any kind, or just to hang out in general. If you require anything, or would like to request any sort of accommodations please feel free to ask. I love to always add improvements and make the place more inviting :) Interaction with Guests I'm available as need be, but I like to give guests there space. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is very close to downtown and a very convenient location to anyone working at any insurance company, in the convention center, at the hospital or in the college. Getting Around The main attractions, restaurants, theaters and bars are all downtown which is a five minute drive or about a 25 minute leisurely walk. We have the Bushnell Theater and Front Street Movie theater, fine dining at the Max's Resturant, Trumbell Kitchen, Salute and many more, bars such as City Steam, Black bar and other very popular locations. Aside from fine dining we have great ethnic eateries like Aladdin's (Mediterranean), Royal Masala (Indian), and Fire and Spice (Vegan) and many different Spanish, Chinese and American places. Lastly Dunkin Dounts is about three blocks away for early morning coffee and breakfast. Other Things to Note I welcome all inquiries and requests. + More

About 2 hours from NYC, 2 1/2 hours from Boston, 5 miles from center of Woodbury where there are plenty of restaurants and grocery shopping. About 4 miles from Washington Depot. + More

about: A charming and antique bedroom is available in a beautiful house with a lot of history. The home was built in 1909 and has original woodwork, hardwood floors, and fireplace.
description: Description The Space This is a large, bright, and furnished bedroom. It sleeps two people comfortably. The price listed is for one bedroom (up to two people). I do have an extra bedroom that would be available to rent upon request for the same rate. The house is a large 1920's Arts & Crafts Colonial with beautiful woodwork and hardwood floors. We share our home with very friendly pets- a small dog and two cats. This is a great option if you'd prefer to avoid the noise and crime of downtown, and would like to stay somewhere roomier than a tiny apartment. I have a large kitchen and backyard for you to enjoy as well! Included with your stay Pillows, blankets, and towels included Wifi connection: high-speed cable internet provided Iron & Ironing board Complimentary coffee and tea (Keurig machine) Personal space heater in case you get cold Bed, nightstand and Papasan chair or desk Details Flexible check-in/checkout times with 48-hr advanced notice Well-behaved and house-trained pets are welcome. Must provide proof of up-to-date vaccine history. Plenty of on-street parking. About the host Alina is a former student and current employee at Yale University and has lived in New Haven for 12 years, so she can answer a lot of questions for you regarding Yale and New Haven! Guest Access You would have a private bedroom(s) and use a shared bathroom. Use of kitchen (appliances, dishes, cookware, etc.), living room, washer/dryer, and dining room Interaction with Guests My boyfriend and I work during the week and have things planned in the evenings and weekends, so we're usually not home. I am accessible by email and text/phone whenever! The Neighborhood I live very close to Yale University (1.5 miles away) and Southern CT State University (.5 miles away) I live a block away from a Natural Food Market (Edge of the Woods) and less than a mile from a major supermarket (Stop and Shop). There is a lovely pond and park to walk to down the block. Getting Around New Haven is easily reachable by train from NYC (the train station is about a $12 taxi ride from the house). Taxi: I recommend using Uber as it's much cheaper (it's like AirBnB for taxis) or you can call ((PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) for a local taxi. City bus: The New Haven bus stops at Goffe and Norton about every 20-30 minutes (Z line, two houses down) or at Whalley and Norton (B line, every 10-15 minutes). Both will take you downtown, and you can ask for a transfer pass if you want to go somewhere else. Yale bus: The closest Yale bus stop is about 1 mile away, at 25 Science Park. Other Things to Note Yale University has a beautiful campus. The Yale Visitor's center is at 149 Elm St if you'd like to take a tour. Pizza New Haven is serious about pizza. The best pizza places are Modern, Pepe's, Bar, and Sally's. You definitely shouldn't miss out on trying at least one of them while you are in town! Unfortunately, they don't deliver. Hamburgers The first hamburger was invented here at Louis' Lunch. Prime 16 has fantastic burgers. Restaurants Besides pizza and hamburgers, New Haven has an amazing array of restaurants. My favorite are 116 Crown for apps/cocktails, Cash Republic for beer selection, Barcelona for tapas, Meat & Co. for sandwiches, Bella's or Lena's for brunch, Claire's Cornercopia for deserts, and Caseus for everything cheese related. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking indoors. There's a covered porch with a porch swing for you outside! Keep objects clear of the heater. No unattended open flames. I'll give you a set of keys to use for your stay; cost for replacement is $20. The cleaning fee covers only moderate use of sheets and towels, and not anything that makes the space unpresentable for future guests. Please put your dishes in the dishwasher and otherwise leave the house clean or be prepared to have some of your deposit directed toward cleanup. Any deductions from your deposit will be made at my sole discretion. Please use common sense- this is my home. Check-in and check-out times are flexible depending on your ideal times, those of other guests, and my work schedule. I'll make every effort to make things convenient for you, and I can usually break away to meet you. Reference times: check-out by 11 am; check-in after 3 pm on weekends, after 5 on weekdays. You must give me a 48-hr notice of your intended check-in and check-out times. This is an old, antique home. A few things haven't been updated in a while (the power and the plumbing) so please go easy on the TP and don't run too many electrical appliances at the same time. Please respect our neighbors by keeping your noise to a reasonable level. + More

about: Studio apartment in historic brownstone. Private entrance. Walk from the train, walk to beach. Perfect for a getaway, ideal location for exploring Fairfield County, CT. Hop on the bikes!
description: Description The Space Room to relax and recharge. We've got books, records, bikes, a TV with lots of movies, a mini-fridge, private bathroom, closet, and a dresser. Fresh paint, newly furnished, original brick, gorgeous afternoon sun. Guest Access Guests have their own private entrance, and run of the studio space. Interaction with Guests We're doing our own thing, but will always let guests know about local happenings and recommendations. The Neighborhood So, there's this 376-acre park at the south end of the South End. Short walk from our place. It's called Seaside Parkoriginal name, for sure. Anyway, it's got 3 miles of Long Island Sound beaches, shoreline walking and biking paths, fishing spots, soccer and baseball fields, skate parks, volleyball courts, a concert band shell, a lighthouse, a snack bar, roaming Italian ice vendors, and plenty of spots to play Frisbee (invented right here in Bridgeport), drop a blanket, cast a fishing pole, or make out. You can catch a baseball game around the corner at the Bluefish stadium, where Two Roads Brewery is tapping and vending their latest magical beers. Check the Webster Bank Arena's schedule toothe Sound Tigers hockey games are tons of fun. They also have big music acts. There is also a multicultural mecca of food and booze happening in Bridgeport, including lots of great delivery. Cheers! Getting Around The Metro North line runs right into Bridgeport, as does the Amtrak Vermonter. You can actually fly to Sikorsky in Stratford, then take a cab, call an _ber, or whatever floats your boat. Speaking of boats, you can ride the ferry right from Port Jeff to our doorstep. There's even a brand new bus station. We've got you covered. Heck, you can even drive, as long as there's no traffic. And there's rarely traffic on one of the nation's most traveled Interstates. Never. In other words, take the train, chief. Guest Note: Our house is a safe 4-block walk from the train station. Easy peasy. You can grab a cab too. Once you're here, you're gold. We have bikes! Included in rental fee. + More
rules: House Rules Respect, and repeat. We have created a remarkable little sanctuary for the discerning traveler or couple. We ask that guests treat it like they would their own space. + More

about: Bedroom w/queen bed, private bath. Adjacent home entertainment room. A/c, WiFi, Cable TV, Netflix. Use of kitchen. Garden w/seating. 5 min to Sacred Heart, 5 min to Merritt Parkway, 5 min to St. Vincent's. 5 min to Mall. 7 min to Metro North. Bus 100 yards. Parking.
description: Description The Space Bedroom and adjacent bath is on second floor using staircase with handrail. Use of home entertainment on second floor included w/ large screen cable TV, DVD player, Netflix access, WiFi. Garden area offers table and chairs, lounge. Off street parking included. Guest Access Includes bed linen, towels, toiletries on short term stays. Limited kitchen use on short stays. Share kitchen with all modern appliances on extended stays with cleanup required after each use. Interaction with Guests I have lived in the area for 25 years and can make local recommendations for activities, restaurants, food delivery services etc. I work from home in my separate home office. It means that I am "around" most days including weekends. But my home is large enough so that guests can enjoy their privacy. I would not tolerate loud music or rambunctious behavior. No overnight guests. No smoking inside my home! The Neighborhood My home is in a residential area also known as "the North End". It is a safe neighborhood. There are a couple of restaurants and/or take out places within a short walk. There are no bars in close proximity. There is a large shopping Mall within a short drive or bus ride from my home. Merritt Parkway route 15 is 5 min drive away. Metro North is 7 min drive. Seaside Park, a popular summer place, is a short bus ride away. Getting Around Public transit is reliable and reasonable. A bus stop is only a hundred yards from my home. The bus connects travelers to many different locations. Taxis take people to Metro North Station for New York or New Haven within a 7 minute cab ride. Other Things to Note I have a small, short-hair Dachshund, Ruby, who loves visitors. However, she does not like other dogs. Ruby is well trained and obedient. + More

about: At this premier luxury 5 story community with a suburban feel, there is an assortment of urban amenities like award-winning landscaped grounds, a resort-style heated swimming pool and a 24 hour fitness center for residents to enjoy.
description: Description The Space Our beautiful apartment homes offer residents quality and comfort with excellent features like vaulted, nine foot ceilings, spacious walk-in closets and gas burning fireplaces. Your fully appointed apartment is furnished with all the necessities of home, including linens and towels. Property amenities include:  Resident Club Suite with Coffee Bar  24 Hour Private Athletic Club  Business Services Center  Billiards Room  Resort Inspired Pool with Expansive Sun Deck  Fully Landscaped Private Courtyard  Free assigned covered parking  In unit washer/dryer The private bedroom features a deluxe queen size bed with our indulgent custom linens, fluffy duvet, and plush pillows, two night tables with lamps, clock radio, dresser, and walk-in closet. The living room includes a sofa with pullout bed, club chair, an entertainment center with a flat panel LCD TV, DVD/VCR player, CD stereo system, a dining area with seating for four and a work desk with lamp and your choice of wired or wireless Internet access. The gourmet kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need including dishes, glasses, cutlery and pots and pans. The kitchen features full-size stainless steel appliances (four burner stove, oven, microwave, dishwasher and refrigerator), toaster, and coffee maker. Coffee, tea and sweeteners are provided. Guest Access You have access to the entire apartment, and all the fantastic amenities this building offers to its tenants. Interaction with Guests We have local staff that you might meet in person that meticulously prepares the apartments for your arrival. Your check-in is typically handled by the building's front desk staff. We provide all other customer service and are available via phone and email promptly. 24 hour support is available for any emergencies that may occur. The Neighborhood Less than a mile away is Stamford Town Center and minutes away is a variety of top restaurants and retail shops. Getting Around Metro-North within walking distance Buses just 1 block away Other Things to Note Although we do not allow pets in our apartment, this apartment is located at a residential property that allows pets and there may be pet owners in the building. + More

description: Description The Space Beautiful, large room with queen size bed and private bath. Post and beam loft style with central air and ceiling fan. Every morning breakfast will be served in the family/dining room. A home style country breakfast with the food from local farms. Enjoy the fire from the beautiful fireplace in the family room, surrounded by hundreds of books and cds. While at the house, spend time on the grounds. Enjoy the sun through the wisteria covered arbor, relax on the deck overlooking the garden or stroll over to the woods and find the stream running through the property. When you are ready to get out, drive over to Kent to enjoy the galleries, boutiques, restaurants, shops and farmers' market. Or find your way to Macedonia State Park, the Appalachian Trail or Kent State Falls for a hike up and down the hills and waterfalls. The area is chock full of antique stores and markets, including the famous Elephant's Trunk flea market every Sunday in New Milford. Just a few minutes to Dutchess County NY border and the Metro North train station. From there, explore the Hudson Valley with their great restaurants and shopping. A short drive away is Lime Rock raceway in Lakeville, CT. If you love NASCAR and other car races, spend the day in at a charming racetrack. We are centrally located - so take a drive to the Berkshires or New Haven or Hartford or Westport or Rhinebeck while enjoying the spectacular stone walls, farmland, vineyards and waterways. Our home is located at the top of one of the Litchfield Hills on a scenic road, surrounded by farms, woods + More

description: Description The Space We offer you a tidy, cozy bedroom with a comfortable, firm double bed for one or two people. The room is also furnished with a desk, large dresser, and cubby shelves. For longer stays, you might want to take advantage of the sizable closet. Guest Access Guests may access the kitchen, dining room, living room, family room, and deck. We have our own sitting room area on the second floor, which gives you a little more privacy. Hair dryer available upon request. Interaction with Guests We're friendly, but understand the need for space and privacy. We're happy to point you in the right direction of sights, entertainment, good food, or whatever else you might be looking for. The Neighborhood Our neighborhood is so peaceful, tucked away on a cul-de-sac. Getting Around The bus stop is about a 15-minute walk. We highly recommend a car for getting around, as we are in the suburbs. Other Things to Note From Monday evenings to Friday mornings, you share the bathroom with a very flexible, considerate tenant who spends little time in the bathroom. On the weekends, the bathroom is all yours. The sink on the right is for your use exclusively. + More
rules: House Rules Shoes off at the door, and no food or drink upstairs. No pets, as our two dogs think they rule the roost. No smoking or lit materials on the premises. Quiet hours start more or less around 11:00 p.m. during the weekdays, since we get up relatively early for work during the school year. Consider keeping your door closed when you're not in the room, to prevent the dogs from making themselves at home. Also, our hound has an exquisite nose, and will search and destroy anything with a scent that is within her reach! Otherwise, we're pretty relaxed. + More

about: Cape style home in a park-like wooded setting. Relax on the front porch and take a nap. Enjoy a cozy study room or living room with fireplace. Use the shared kitchen and laundry if needed. Close to trains to NYC or Hudson River Valley.
description: Description The Space The quiet wooded setting is perfect for a retreat away from the noise and busyness of life. The front porch is delightful for reading or napping while listening to the birds. The bed is comfy for a good night's sleep. Private bathroom is next to bedroom. Guest Access Shared laundry room and kitchen, living room with fireplace, cozy study next to bedroom, wifi, TV (no cable), lovely quiet places to walk in the countryside. The Neighborhood Our neighborhood is quiet and a safe place to enjoy long walks in the countryside. There are walking trails on the open space across from our home. about: Laurel Island is a 5 acre Island on a Lake in Connecticut. It is a Retreat Location which is available for use by retreat planners or by individuals. There are also cabins to rent for smaller groups.
description: Description The Space A Private Island For Your Rental Laurel Island is a 5 acre Island on a Lake in Connecticut. It is a Retreat Location which is available for use by retreat planners or by individuals. Location Laurel Island is a perfect location to hold a retreat, reunion or family group that combines the privacy and peacefulness of an island and facilities for groups both large and small. Accommodations include 5 private cottages and a large main lodge for gathering. Local catering is available for group meals and will provide meals adaptable to different diets including vegan, vegetarian, gluten free, or others. The 5 acre island's canopy trees, blueberry bushes, rocky outcrops and large grassy field provide numerous spaces for activities and events. A huge covered deck overlooking the lake provides protection regardless of the weather, and is attached to the lodge for easy access. All of these spaces lend well for yoga, meditation, nature, wellness and other types of retreats, reunions or family groups. Accommodations In the cottages, guests choose to sleep in either community rooms (a room with no doors), a shared room, or a private room. In total, there are 14 rooms for shared or private stays. The island can accommodate 36 people. The cost for the entire private Island for a weekend is $210 per person, minimum of 20 people.The cost for a weekend retreat (Friday night, Saturday, and Sunday), including food and lodging is $320/person For a full week the cost of the entire private Island is $350 per person. Contact For more information www(URL HIDDEN) Call or email Jack Solomon if you want to reserve a space. $100 deposit required email (EMAIL HIDDEN) (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Comments on Laurel Island- Wonderful Escape from the City. You won't be disappointed. Ann, Rockaway, NY June 2011 This was my second year at the Yoga Retreat on Laurel Island. Restorative! Lovely Island. Wonderful Lodging, comfort, safety, ambience and food. I'll be coming back as long as the Retreat is offered. Carlin, Churchville, NY June 2011 We can sleep 39 or it can be just a couple. Enjoy the tranquility and excitement on an Island There are 5 guesthouses on the Island - Deck House, Chalet, Bay House, A frame and Captain's Cabin- which sit on the lakeshore of the Island, all within an easy stroll yet distinctly private from one another. The cabins have 3 bedrooms, a living room and a kitchen area. Each has it's own dock and at least one water front deck to enjoy the view. There are plenty of windows. Each guesthouse has water, electricity and other facilities. We provide the facility which includes kitchens, stoves, refrigerators , pots and pans in each guest house. You take care of all other arrangements i.e. food, drinking water, bedding, etc. If you have a boat this is ideal, you can use the dock at your cabin for your boat. Rowboats are available for each cabin. The recreational opportunities of a lake are available: canoeing, kayaking, swimming, water skiing and more. On the Island are volleyball, badminton, bocce ball, croquet and other land sports. Per Cabin $145/day or part plus $45/person/day for more than two people plus refundable deposit of $300/cabin Weekends-$435 plus $135/person for more than two people plus a refundable deposit of $300/cabin For a mid week(M-W,Tu-Th or W-Fri) rental 30% off the above rate Come for a weekend or a week. For more pictures and information go to www(URL HIDDEN) Just send us half the cost to reserve your cabin. Call (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) or (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) e-mail (EMAIL HIDDEN) Guest Access Guests renting the entire Island will have the entire Island to enjoy. In any case there are canoes and kayaks to share and each cabin has a rowboat. There are horseshoes, volleyball, badminton, bocce ball as well as water sports Interaction with Guests When the entire Island is rented there is someone on the Island to help with the facilities. For cabin rental we are available to help with any problems also. The Neighborhood There is a 550 acre lake which is available for swimming, boating and other water sports. There is a float to lounge on and dive off. + More

Chapman Beach is a New England beach town neighborhood that has welcomed families year after year. During the summer season Chapman Beach offers a posted calendar of activities for everyone. The fall season is perfect for those seeking a quiet retreat and the opportunity to visit neighboring historic towns and enjoy pumpkin festivals, apple picking and the beautiful fall foliage. There is a bus line as well as a train station for easy access to Boston and New York City. Taxi service. There are kayaks and a paddle board available for rental. Fee upon request. Guest Access Private Chapman Beach district. Interaction with Guests Dialog through airbnb. Available for help if needed.Nearby. Phone call or text. The Neighborhood Chapman Beach neighborhood is a friendly place. It's a quiet spot where people are seen walking, running riding their bikes daily. Chapman Beach is family friendly, however it is a quiet retreat for those seeking solitude. Chapman Beach is a great private beach getaway, however close by are quaint New England towns, outlets, night life, casinos, museums and more. In the fall it's the perfect setting for seeing New England's fall foliage. Tag sales abound all Spring, Summer and Fall. Getting Around There are cabs available. Not far from a bus line. The center of town is only a mile and a half away.The train is close by as well. Just a mile and a half to Westbrook station and about four miles to Amtrak in Old Saybrook, Ct. Other Things to Note Normal check- in is at 3p.m. check out at 12 p.m. + More

about: Family friendly environment. Guests are treated like family. Theres always fresh eggs and coffee in the morning. 3 bedrooms are available and all must be booked separately and will accommodate roughly 6 guests or the entire home to sleep 10.
description: Description The Space What people love: *Lots of room *large outdoor spaces *new kitchens and baths *great for jogging or walking, lots of sidewalks *unique historical property *family environment Things to note: *older home, can be drafty, lots of character *located about 3 miles off the exit, away from downtown in a rustic setting *strongly suggest using a gps *no central air but there are window units in all except the captains room *shared bath The Captains room (this listing and booking) offers 2 built in twin beds. There is also some room for younger ones traveling with parents. This room was the original owners sleeping porch and is full of windows and can be a little drafty but a wonderful room with a view! The room is located in the front of the house. There's always a space heater in the room if it's drafty. Built in the early 1900's Sea Glass is historically unique with 9' ceilings and listed on the National Historic registry as a Colonial Revival, with baths and the kitchen redone in 2010. All living areas have been updated and completed, however we're always taking on more projects. Close to the Coast Guard Academy, Casinos, colleges and public transportation. Family friendly with 2 indoor cats and 1 small dog. The home has a unique history and was even a nursing home at one time. At one time, there was a wine cellar in the basement, beautiful gardens in the back, a large gazebo behind the house in the woods and functioning servant's quarters in the attic. The old owners were such garden enthusiasts that they used cold boxes outside with electricity running to them for early planting. It is a beautiful neighborhood nestled in the heart of historic Quaker Hill. Many of our neighbors will wave to you while you stroll around on wide sidewalks taking in the beautiful turn-of-the-century homes. All bedrooms are on the second floor. We share our home with our rescued pets. Our family consists of myself, husband, and five year old son. Guest Access The wrap around porch looks out over a large front yard and to relax after dinner, a hike, antiquing, or the bustle of the casino. There are plenty of places inside and out to read or relax. Feel free to explore the stream past the barn Interaction with Guests Our family lives on site and are usually around and are happy to give local advice. The Neighborhood It is a beautiful neighborhood nestled in the heart of historic Quaker Hill. Many of our neighbors will wave to you while you stroll around on wide sidewalks taking in the beautiful turn-of-the-century homes. -sidewalks for miles in both directions. Very safe neighborhood Getting Around The Yellow Cab company as well as others is just a phone call away and it's about a $20 fare to Mohegan sun. We're about 4 miles away from the new London train station and also have a main bus line called the SEAT. Uber is available in the area as well and our choice. Other Things to Note We live in a rural/rustic area. Down town and the casinos are a straight shot in either direction and about 6-12 minutes away. We're early risers and have a toddler that enforces it. He's well behaved but does make "child noises" :) Coffee, morning munchies and fresh eggs are provided. You are welcome to cook yourself breakfast-if we are around we're happy to pitch in! + More
rules: House Rules All smoking should be done outside. There is an ashtray on the front porch. We do allow pets on a case by case basis. Finally, please remove shoes upon entering and DO NOT roll your luggage. We're trying to preserve our 100 year old hardwood floors :) + More

about: My quiet comfortable home sits out in the woods, just a few miles from the beach. The area is quaint, filled with restaurants, beaches, vineyards, casinos, kayaking, biking and more. Within 2 hrs of Boston or New York, also minutes from the train.
description: Description The Space Welcome! Wake up in a virtual bird sanctuary, in my beautiful country home nestled in the woods, yet close to the beach. Surrounded by hummingbirds, butterflies, and peace my home makes for a great getaway. Enjoy a large room with double bed and light-blocking shades to enjoy a good rest, work, read or meditation. Take advantage of the large yard and deck with gas grill. Bikes, beach chairs and boogie board are available as well. Enjoy great nearby restaurants, shopping, small town villages, vineyards, casinos, museums, kayaking, biking or hiking in one of our state parks, amusement parks, downtown New Haven and easy access to NY or Boston. Perfect accommodations for 2-3 people. I do have two very sweet, lazy dogs so best not to have pet allergy. Fresh sheets & towels, soap, shampoo, books, magazines and many other essentials await you in this restful, non-smoking environment (except outside). If you are three guests, this bedroom is large enough to receive you. A child or additional adult can sleep on the comfortable Aerobed. The Aerobed, its bedding, and additional towels are gladly provided. PROCEDURE: Please contact host before booking. Post a recognizable picture and a profile, and send me any question you have and I'll respond promptly. Once you're decided, then click the "Book It" link. LISTING SPECIFICS: This listing is for rental of the one large bedroom and private bath shown in the pictures, and use of the entire first floor of home. Pictures of the house give you a good sense of the whole environment. The shared, open-plan dining area & kitchen contain a sizable fridge, microwave, toaster oven, rice cooker and gas grill are available for your use. Our water is filtered, so bring your reusable water bottle! LOCATION: Quiet, safe residential neighborhood with off street parking, close to I-95, Route 9 and Shoreline East. Big Y, Stop & Shop, Dunkin Donuts, Starbucks, Walgreens, and many other conveniences are within a few miles drive . PARKING: If you'll be driving your own or a rental car, there is plenty of off street parking in my driveway. Guest Access Clean 1 Bedroom with 1 Double bed and 1 Aerobed, 1 bathroom, and full access to first floor of home. This includes kitchen, living room, dining room & laundry. Deck, yard, bikes and off street parking. Interaction with Guests I reside in the home & will be available if you need anything at all, if not in person then by phone. The Neighborhood Picture perfect, safe with quiet setting, yet convenient to everything. Getting Around Having a car to get around would provide the best access, however just a couple miles from Shoreline East (train) and I-95. Other Things to Note Must be comfortable with dogs, both very sweet. Space available each yr, with the exception of Nov 1 - mid Dec. + More
rules: House Rules Smoking outside only, please be kind & respectful. Children age 8 and above please. Kindly give notice (24-48 hrs) if canceling. Check in time is 2pm and checkout at 11am, however can be flexible whenever possible. + More

description: Description The Space The Space Beautiful historical home in quiet neighborhood in New London, Connecticut. Built in 1852, the house offers spacious common areas indoors and out. WIFI is available throughout the home. We're a short walking distance to downtown New London where you can hop a ferry to the North Shore of Long Island (Orient Point/Greenport with connections to Shelter Island and South Shore), and Fishers Island. Mid-way between Boston and New York, New London has Amtrak service, and Union Station is a 10 minute walk downtown. A 10 minute drive gets you to Ocean Beach Park, on the water. Mystic, its Seaport and Aquarium are a 15 minute drive across the Thames River bridge. The casinos are a short drive, too. There is plenty of off-street parking available. There are restaurants and night spots of all shapes and sizes downtown (walkable), local bus service, and a spare bike or 2 as well. This lovely room on the 2nd floor has a double bed and shares a bath/shower in the hallway nearby. Ours is a big lovely old house - lots of stairs, corners to get comfortable in, views to take the breath away. Come enjoy it, and the Whaling City, as much as we do. NOTE: We have 3 other rooms available, and can accommodate larger parties. Full (hot) breakfast served Saturday and Sunday; continental breakfast Monday-Friday + More

about: Waterfront stone cottage with spectacular view of the Thimble Islands. The front and side of the house are on the water. On the other 2 sides are a patio sitting area and beautiful garden. It's a very relaxing, peaceful setting.
description: Description The Space Italian villa type stone cottage on waterfront. It's truly a breathtakingly beautiful spot. From the front of the house, there's a great view of the Thimble Islands. There's nothing more relaxing than to sit on the rocking chairs on the front porch, view the islands and watch the sunsets. There are many special spots to enjoy, from the hammock overlooking the waterfront, to the tiered gardens behind the house, to the stone porch off the lower floor of the cottage. The property includes a private dock with several rocks made of the pink Stony Creek granite. These rocks are great for exploring, climbing or fishing. The cottage has 2 bedrooms upstairs, an eat-in kitchen and a large living room with a fireplace and a baby grand piano. Downstairs there is a bedroom and sitting room/office suite. Guest Access Guests will be able to access the beach and the dock. The Neighborhood The house is on the end of a private road in Stony, Creek, CT. Stony is a very charming little town. It has the ambience of a small seaside village. The town has many attractions... the Thimble Islands, the Stony Creek Puppet House, the Stony Creek Museum, town docks with boat launch (narrated cruise giving the history of the islands depart hourly), playground and public library. Stony Creek is 15 minutes away from New Haven. House would be an ideal spot to stay for parents weekends/homecomings/graduations of Yale University. + More

about: Beautifully furnished beach cottage with water views on Mulberry Point!
description: Description The Space This 2 bedroom, 1 bath home is located just 3 lots back from the Long Island Sound and is less than a 5 minute walk to both a public and private association beach (you have access). The house is nicely furnished with 2 high quality Queen beds, linens and all the household items you could need to cook, relax and enjoy the area. A big deck off of the kitchen/dining area leads to a great side yard that faces the water in two directions. The home comes equipped with a gas grill and 2 kayaks for guest use. In addition, a toddler bed, baby crib and/or high chair are available upon request. Guilford, CT is the perfect, undiscovered escape! Just a 2hr drive from midtown Manhattan and 2hr 30min drive from downtown Boston, it's dotted with beautiful beaches, great restaurants and quaint historic New England scenery. Dogs considered on a case by case basis (sorry, no cats). Please contact us. Absolutely no smoking allowed anywhere on the property. Guest Access You will have access to the entire home and property except for the basement which we use for storage. Interaction with Guests We do not live locally, but are always available by email or phone to answer questions. We have several fantastic people who live locally and help us care for the home. They will be available during your stay should anything arise. Otherwise, the place is yours to enjoy as your own! The Neighborhood Mulberry Point Association is an amazing beach community with water views at almost every turn. There is a public beach at one end of the association and a private beach (to which you will have access) with a dock at the other. It's a peaceful area with stunning views, quaint homes and quiet streets great for walks or kid's bike rides. Getting Around Guilford is located just off of Route I-95 and easily accessible by car from all points. It is all accessible by train from NYC and Boston. From NYC: Amtrak and MetroNorth can be taken to New Haven's Union Station, which is a 20 minute drive away. From Union Station, you can also connect to Shoreline East, which brings you directly to Guilford. From Boston: Amtrak can be taken to Old Saybrook, CT or New Haven's Union Station, both are apx. a 20 minute drive away. We recommend having access to a car once in Guilford, but if you don't mind getting around by bike or Uber, it's also possible to enjoy our home without a car. Other Things to Note We have a dog and occasionally allow others to bring their dogs too. The house is immaculate and professionally cleaned between each stay, but if you are highly allergic, this may not be the place for you. + More
rules: House Rules Please treat our home as if it were your own. Beyond that, please abide by the following: 1.) No Smoking 2.) No Loud Noise or Music Outside after 9pm 3.) No additional guests or parties without permission + More
