about: A cozy 1 BR Apt in Downtown New Haven.
description: Description The Space We have 1 bedroom and a pullout couch in the living room. The bed in the bedroom is a king and the pullout becomes a queen. The living room is filled with light through three large windows. The kitchen is fully equipped. The bathroom has a shower and a tub. The apartment is downtown New Haven. We are close to several parking garages, a 15 min walk from the train station and have a bus/shuttle stop right outside the building. Downtown New Haven is filled with exciting restaurants, bars and local music venues, we're also next to a movie theater, and obviously YALE! Shopping, drinks and the New Haven Green are all less than a five minute walk away. I've been living in New Haven for several years now and will be happy to provide you with recommendations for whatever your taste/activity of choice might be. I think at this point I've stayed at more than 20 AirBnBs myself and know exactly what a guest needs and doesn't want. Looking forward to your stay. Interaction with Guests I can give advice on pretty much anything in New Haven or I can stay away and let you explore and enjoy on your own. The Neighborhood Steps from everything. Movie theater in the same building, 4 restaurants on our corner alone, steps to music and other bars. Yale and everything it has to offer within a 10 min walk. 5 min to multiple theaters. Great diner across the street. Lots and lots of exciting things in close proximity. Getting Around There is a free shuttle that runs every 20 min to and from Union Station where you can catch a bus (megabus/Peter Pan) or train(Metro North, Shoreline East, Amtrak) to most of New England and New York. We are a 15 min cab ride away from Tweed Airport. Plenty of Cabs, Ubers and Lyfts in the area. Public bus service is also available. multiple parking garages across the street. Other Things to Note Hope to help you enjoy #NHV + More

description: Description The Space About us: We are young, professional, and tidy. We also love to live, laugh and have fun. We are often away with our new baby visiting family on the weekends. In a world of giant houses but limited community... we are looking forward to making a bit of extra money and to sharing our great space with you. Are you wanting to come to New Haven to catch a show, visit friends or family, or just to get away? Come! More soon, Best, Jess and Andrew Guest Access Guest Access: Full access, except the two closets (one upstairs and one downstairs) which we will aim to tidy and clearly mark. There is an after-hours shuttle for Yale-affiliated. + More

about: A king and a queen bed in a huge light airy apartment! The entire second floor of a house, it boasts off-street parking, free laundry, a private enclosed sun porch, oversized living space. One block from the Farmington Canal Trail - bike, jog, hike!
description: Description The Space The bedroom pictured has a queen sized platform bed, large desk, two nightstands, a four drawer dresser, and a large closet. The second bedroom is a corner bedroom with a king sized pillow top platform bed, a large closet, and amazing morning light. If needed, a queen sized airbed can be set up in the living room or dining room, allowing the apartment to accommodate up to six guests. For parties over six, special arrangements can be made; please submit an inquiry. Guest Access Wireless internet with password, free laundry in the basement, off-street parking space. The Farmington Canal Heritage Greenway is one block away - a multi use trail for hiking, running, biking, etc. Full kitchen, microwave, Keurig machine, french press with Lavazza coffee, waffle maker, George Foreman tabletop grill, rice cooker, full sized juicer, rocket blender, and complete set of Calphalon cook and bakeware made available. Every window has venetian blinds and gauzy white curtains for maximum control of privacy and sunlight. Getting Around Yale Shuttle (red line) and public CT Transit ("O" route) pick up directly across the street. Steps from Science Hill, three blocks from "The Whale," eight minute walk to SOM, fifteen minute walk to central Yale campus. Other Things to Note There is a cat and a friendly eight pound dog (maltese) that live in the apartment. Though the apartment is frequently and thoroughly cleaned, if you are highly allergic to animals, unfortunately this apartment may not be the right fit! Furthermore, should your stay be short term or your inquiry be short notice, the cat may remain in the apartment during your visit. Please feel free to inquire for specifics. + More
rules: House Rules Please be respectful of the space, remove your shoes when inside the apartment, and clean up after yourself as much as possible. No smoking in the apartment or on the enclosed porch - back porch or outside only please. + More

about: Beautiful 7 bedroom, 7.5 bath home located on the stunning shores of Lake Waramaug in Warren, CT. This property has all of the amenities conducive to hosting an enjoyable and relaxing New England getaway!
description: Description The Space This home has 5,000 square feet of living space which includes: 7 bedrooms, 7.5 baths, a beautiful living room and expansive kitchen where you'll find all of the amenities required to prepare a home cooked meal. Outside you will find a gas grille on one of the two stone patios where guests are welcomed to barbeque and dine al fresco! Whether you are enjoying the beautiful lawns on the property or open access to the beachfront; there will be something for everyone to enjoy! Activities include: swimming, kayaking, canoeing, fishing, hiking, biking, sunbathing and nature gazing. Interaction with Guests The property management is available for assistance during your stay and you will find a comprehensive list of local dining (including catering options), shopping and other services such as childcare and private chef availability upon your arrival (for an additional fee). The Neighborhood There are many quaint shops and eateries in the neighboring towns which include New Preston, Washington, Washington Depot, Kent, Litchfield and Sharon. Other local activities include: -Winery tours -Museums -Fairs and Carnivals -Farmer's markets -Sledding/Skiing -Antiquing -Elephants Trunk Flea Market (CT's largest outdoor flea market) Getting Around While there is no public transportation system in the area, this property can easily be reached via car from New York City (2 hours), Boston (2.5 hours) and Hartford (1.5 hours). A rental car is recommended but absolutely not necessary as the property has all you could hope for in a beautiful New England retreat. Other Things to Note PLEASE NOTE: This property also has an 8 bedroom "Main House" (formerly the Boulders Inn- newly renovated) that accommodates 16+ as well as (3) 2 bedroom cottages (sleeps a total of 14) available for rent as well. Discounted rates will apply for combined rentals, please inquire for further information. A RECENT REVIEW OF THE PROPERTY: "We had a wonderful family reunion at the Boulders Inn on Lake Waramaug, Connecticut (24 adults and 14 children.) The Inn, carriage house and cabins sleep 38 comfortably. Almost all bedrooms have their own TV and private bath. Every room has been beautifully renovated and everyone commented on the ultra comfortable beds and beautiful linens. The adults would meet in the morning for coffee in the absolutely wonderful, state of the art, newly renovated kitchen at the Boulders. For those staying in the carriage house, (7 bedrooms, many with fireplaces) it also has a great ambiance and its own fabulous kitchen. Our family loved the brand new swimming dock A boathouse provided great fun for the children. There is a ping pong table, multiple fishing rods and kayaks for those who want to explore the lake. Our children spent all day swimming and fishing off the dock. There are wonderful lounge chairs for those who just want to relax and take in the spectacular view of the lake. Family dinners cooked on the two extra large grills were highlights of our trip. Cocktails on the terrace watching sunsets over the Connecticut hills was magical. The Inn is surrounded by beautiful gardens and expansive grounds. Needless to say, we had many exciting volleyball, badminton and soccer games. Our road bikers, who went out daily for 3 hour rides, gave the whole area a superb rating. The Boulders is located in a beautiful and historic part of Connecticut. There is wonderful antiquing, shopping and good restaurants in the immediate vicinity. There was something for every age group. It was our family's first major reunion and it was a huge success. I cannot say enough about the Boulders. We loved it!" To view the "Main House" please search: "The Boulders" Lake Waramaug Estate **Maximum cleaning fee option given for listing is $300, however an additional $100 is required- totaling $400. + More
rules: House Rules - No smoking - No pets allowed (unless otherwise arranged with management prior to lease agreement) - Must be at least 25 years old to book - Please note that guests are not permitted to use their own motorized boats on Lake Waramaug - Additional fees and taxes may apply + More

about: Vinola is closed for the winter. Please come back and visit us in April!
description: Description The Space Vinola is closed for the winter. Come back in March, please! Vinola has one bedroom with a queen bed. The main room has one single bed and two cots. The space is rustic yet functional. Full kitchen with stove, oven, refrigerator, and microwave. There is no shower, however guests may use shower in our sauna. (The sauna is a separate building a short distance away.) The bathroom has a small sink and toilet. There is no TV. (you won't miss it, we promise!) Vinola has a lovely porch on the front and a fire pit and swing set in the back. There are trails in Pachaug and Arcadia management areas that start at the end of the driveway. Guest Access Guests have private access to the entire cabin. A short 400 foot walk from the porch leads to the property's private beach which guests are welcome to use. There is a picnic table and multiple fire pits for campfires. Guests are also welcome to use our 10 person wood fired Finnish sauna. The sauna has a lakeside deck and direct access to the water for a dip. Guests are welcome to use kayaks, canoe, paddle boat, paddle board, and row boat. Interaction with Guests Typically, we will be on the property for some part of every day as we live in the main house. If for some reason, we are not around, we have a list of phone numbers in the cabin if you should need assistance with anything. The Neighborhood This is a small, rural, lakeside community. There is far more activity on the lake in the summer months and it is very quiet in the winter. We have one neighbor on either side of our 7 acre property and both are rarely occupied summer homes. Getting Around There is no public transportation here. The nearest train station is Westerly Rhode Island, or New London, CT both of which are about 40 minutes away. The nearest airports are Providence, RI (PVD) and Hartford, CT (BDL). Other Things to Note We have another cabin on the property, two camp trailers (in the summer) as well as two main houses. We have many family members on the property at any given time and all are friendly and happy you are staying with us! Just remember that there are other people living here, so we expect respect for them as far as noise. + More
rules: House Rules Check-in is 3 PM Check-out is 12 PM No smoking inside the cabin or on the porch. You may smoke a distance away, but please do not throw your butts on the ground. Please leave the cabin in the same condition you found it. This cabin has been rented to the same families for 44 years. Multiple generations have grown up here coming every summer. They love it and have many fond memories of it. Let's preserve it for the next 44 years! Please sweep and tidy up before you leave. Life jackets are required when taking any of the watercraft out on the lake. We have plenty that you can borrow. Pets: We do allow pets, however we expect our guests to take care of them. Please pick up pet droppings immediately and dispose of them property. If you need to leave your pets in the cabin when you go out, they MUST be in a kennel. We can provide one if needed. This is to protect our cabins from damage. Many pets get fearful when left alone in a new place. We've have dogs break screens and get out while owners were away. That is why we instituted the kennel rule. + More

about: Your room is large and bright, up on the second floor with private bathroom. Our home is conveniently close to all the many area attractions, yet very quiet at night so you can relax and rest well.
description: Description The Space A large bright room in our 80 year old country home, decorated with up-cycled nautically themed furniture. Located in a residential neighborhood 1 mile off of exit 91 on interstate 95. We are very well located for all your tourism needs: 5 miles to downtown Mystic and 4 miles to Stonington Borough, and 9 miles to Misquamicut State Beach. The room is equipped with a comfortable queen bed, a microwave, mini fridge, cable TV, WiFi and Keurig coffeemaker, with private bathroom (shower only no tub). The room is well ventilated and has separate zone heat and a ceiling fan. It is very temperate here and A/C is usually not necessary, if there is a heat wave during your stay we have a window A/C unit for your comfort. The room is stocked with a small selection of coffee for the coffee maker, we will supply fresh fruit, muffins, juice, and yogurt for a small "continental" breakfast. You have a mini fridge and microwave for limited food uses, and a small table to sit and enjoy your breakfast. We supply cups, dishes and silverware for your use Your room is at the opposite side of the house as ours, so you have complete privacy. This is set-up very much like a hotel room, at half the local prices! If you haven't been to this area, you must come! CNN just voted this area #1 in 5 Best Seaside Escapes! #4 is nearby Watch Hill RI. (8 miles from our house) Guest Access This room is NOT handicapped accessible. The room is accessed by a full steep interior set of stairs. We have two friendly cats that are not allowed into the guest room, but they do have free roam of the rest of the home. If you are very allergic to cats, this will not be a good situation for you. You will not have kitchen access, but can enjoy your coffee or a glass of wine on our back deck overlooking our private yard. Interaction with Guests Your privacy and comfort are important to us and we're more than happy to help with suggestions for dining and a wide variety of local activities. We are longtime residents of the area and have collected materials from local attractions and restaurant menus for you to reference while you are here. If you've come for some peace and quiet, that's ok too, let us know what your expectations are and we will act accordingly. The Neighborhood Our neighborhood is a quiet heavily wooded residential area, very restful and not suitable for loud activities. Getting Around As we are in a residential neighborhood, you will need a car. If you arrive by train, there is an Enterprise Rental Car within walking distance of the Mystic Train Station. (or they will pick you up) There are no buses that service this area, and taxi's are scarce. If you are a bike rider, this area is "Bike Friendly" and we can store your bike at night. Other Things to Note The guest room is on the second floor surrounded by trees, and we encourage wild birds to visit our property. It is very restful here at night with crickets and fireflies in the summer. We have plenty of off street parking, so bring your boat (local public boat ramp is right up the street) or trailer a motorcycle, not a problem. Bring your Kayaks or Stand-Up Paddle Boards, we know a great place for you to launch. + More
rules: House Rules We do not allow smoking on the premises, nor can you bring any pets. We observe quiet time from 11pm to 8am. (checking out early is not a problem) You may not use our home for a gathering or party. We can only accommodate 2 guests at a time. In case you missed it in the description, your room is accessed by a steep set of stairs. Whenever we can be flexible about check in and check out times, we will. Be aware that we cannot always accommodate special requests. Feel free to ask before you book, if this is critical to you, we will do our best. We expect you to be respectful of the fact that this is our home, and to treat it accordingly. + More

about: Private Room in a large 3 bedroom house with a Queen bed and bathroom in downtown New London, within easy walking distance to the train, bus and ferry terminals. We have off-street parking and WIFI. It is on the second floor, up one flight of stairs.
description: Description Guest Access WIFI and Off street parking, as well as a private bathroom. Interaction with Guests We live in the house as well and work some from home, so we are here a lot of the time. But we are not always available and some guests have stayed without meeting us. We host regularly and love meeting new people. But if for some reason we will not be able to receive you personally, we will make arrangements to leave a key and stay in touch. The Neighborhood We are about 2 blocks from the downtown restaurant, nightlife, shopping and arts district and only about 4 blocks from the public transportation hub. The room is on the side of the house away from the street and is very quiet. Getting Around Train, Ferry and Bus Other Things to Note This is an older home, built in 1840. Some folks have trouble with the steep stairs and lack of central air, so I wouldn't recommend it for folks with mobility issues or who can't abide heat in the summer. The bathroom is mostly private but occasionally shared if we have family/friends in another spare room visiting. + More

about: Our furnished BeachHouse on the shores of the Thames River has a stunning view of the Long Island/Fishers Island sound. Complete with hardwood floors, outside deck,Sun Room with big picture windows. In the Dinette have your meals watching the waves with boating/submarines. 1-3 Rooms/night/longer.
description: Description The Space This is a great weekend getaway or long term for writing, reading and lounging with great views and winter watercraft action, from weekend sailors to submarines. A few days here, will addict you to the constant action on the river, while double pane windows keep you warm and comfortable which makes you want to linger longer. The scene is just as awesome in the evening in the Sun Room with the lights and moon reflecting on the water. Inside the recessed ceiling lights gives the perfect ambiance for a relaxing evening with in-ceiling sound system. There is a large living room, sitting/reading room and a HDTV in the Sun room, if you can take your eyes off the water. Guest Access The house has the basic amenities from dishwasher, toaster, microwave. You'll find a couple ol' pair of binoculars for those times you want to see a bit closer. The bedrooms are basic Beach style with a minimum to clutter up your space. Interaction with Guests We look for guests that reflect sincerity, consideration and honesty in dealing with others. The Neighborhood As one of the nicer parts of the city with a private beach and the view...this is a true gem. Getting Around The city is easy to get around, close to highway 95, close to Foxwoods and Mohegan Sun casino's. But more than that...you can take a fast ferry to Block Island for a day trip, Mystic Ct. is just a few exits north on 95 and Eugene O'Neil/playwrite, grew up across the street. Other Things to Note Coast Guard Academy is close and for Coast Guard graduation a beach house with private beach, yard for overflow and the best views in town. The Groton Naval Base is just across the river so your will find this a fantastic way to have your guests really connect the majesty of a submarine plowing through the waves. They could very likely see a submarine gliding up/down the river. Exciting. Impressive. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking/at all, No animals/at all. Responsible guests are paramount. We have been fortunate that our guests have taken great care with the house, grounds, and therefore enjoyed a great time too. + More

about: Beautiful, custom built contemporary Colonial on 14 acres, surrounded by acres of open space with trails, yet 2 miles to downtown Mystic. The sun-drenched ambiance flows throughout the open layout that includes a 1st floor MBR and screen porch.
description: Description The Space Beautiful, custom built contemporary Colonial on 14 acres, surrounded by acres of open space with trails, yet 2 miles to downtown Mystic. The sun-drenched ambiance flows throughout the open layout that includes a 1st floor MBR and screen porch. For quiet get aways, no house parties or large groups 6 people at rate, additional fee for people over 6 up to a total of 8 people max for overnight stays. Open sunny floor plan, surround by woods yet 2 miles to downtown Mystic. Private, beautiful, secluded. Gorgeous kitchen, clawfoot tub in Master bathroom in addition to separate shower. Hiking trails on open space next to property. Washer and dryer available for use. Coffee provided. Dishes and cookware on premises for use. There are 2 double beds and a queen sized futon in the bedrooms (one bed per bedroom). MBR on main floor and other two bedrooms on second floor. Entire home. There are horses on the property as part of a nonfprofit horse rescue.We ask guests not to interfere with the horses or rescue operation. We will meet you at the house to let you in if you wish or we can leave house unlocked for your arrival. You can contact me by phone at (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) and i can be there in 5 minutes if needed. Quite secluded surrounded by woods yet minutes to downtown Mystic. Amtrak stops in Mystic and nearby New London. Note home has window AC not central AC. House is shaded by trees and with high ceilings is generally very cool but when needed window AC works great. No WIFI/Internet.Bring books, enjoy hiking on nature trails on open space next door (Merritt Family Forest), tour Mystic, Relax :-) + More

about: Its a cozy cottage, decorated to give you a warm welcome feel. Sits across from the Wequetequock Cove. A short drive to the ocean and Barn Island. On route 1 close to Mystic, downtown Stonington and Watch Hill, RI.Accommodating your boat and kayak is a possibility.
description: Description The Space A Warm and welcoming cottage that is created to help you relax in between seeing the area attractions of beaches, nature walks, or foliage. Fun spots include lists of local dining in downtown Westerly, RI and Stonington, CT. Plus Foxwoods Casino and Mohegan Sun Casino are very close by. Guest Access Close to downtown Stonington and Mystic, CT. and Westerly, RI. And RI beaches . Across the cove from Barn Island nature preserve. Close to I95. Local boat ramp across the street at the Stonington Marina or Barn Island. Close to Stonington Vineyards, Jonathan Edwards Vineyard and local casinos. Providence RI is only 50 miles away. New York City and Boston 2.5 hours away . Interaction with Guests As often as they want or as little as they want. I gladly give you my phone numbers if you need anything you just let me know. The Neighborhood The quaint borough of Stonington is just around the corner which has a small beach, great local dining and quaint village shopping. The Mystic Village, downtown Mystic for shopping and site seeing, the Mystic Aquarium and Seaport are all right here within 2 miles. Barn Island Nature Preserve is within two miles. Easy access to Biking, boating and beaching ! Misquamicut beach is 7 miles away. Foxwoods and Mohegan sun casino are very close by. Getting Around Local train stations 3 miles out in Westerly RI Other Things to Note Located off route one. Busy to some, but very convenient for others. Wonderful bike lane starts right at my house. See historic Stonington and Mystic along with Noank, and beaches in RI. Local boat launch at Barn Island Nature Preserve. Or dock your boat or kayaks at the Stonington Marina directly across the street. I can accommodate your boat or kayaks in my driveway. + More

about: This contemporary home is secluded and serene, yet 5 minutes from Madison, I-95, Hammonasset Beach, Chatfield Hollow Lake, hiking trails and horse farms. It is 90 miles from NYC and 5 miles to the train. The CT shore is filled with charming towns.
description: Description The Space This house is beautifully renovated with bamboo floors, granite kitchen, big windows, skylights, and an easy connection to the outdoors. It is build into a hill and surrounded by trees, creating a grown-up tree house affect. It feels serene and secluded despite great proximity to beaches, charming New England towns, grocery stores, parks, and transportation. Hamomassett Beach is a 5 minute drive and is the best beach along the shoreline. Downtown Madison is also 5 minutes away and full of charming restaurants, a movie theater, bookstore, and great shops. Chatfield Hollow is five minutes away for hiking and lake swimming amongst giant pine trees. Guest Access The House is private and has a large flagstone patio, 2 acres of land, and a garage. Interaction with Guests WE live 5 miles away and can help with anything needed. The Neighborhood The house allows a great shoreline vacation while still remaining close to NYC, Boston, New Haven, and Hartford. The casinos, outlet malls, Mystic Seaport, and other shoreline attractions and well as the charming River towns of Essex and Chester are all within 20 minutes. Getting Around There is a metro north train station in New Haven 20 minutes away, and a shoreline east commuter train in Madison 5 minutes away. Hartford is the nearest airport, 1.15 hour away. I-95 is five minutes away. Other Things to Note The house has a great walking path in the woods right down the street. The path leads to Deer Lake camp which is a huge series of hiking trails around two lakes owned by the boy scouts. Anyone is permitted to walk there. There is a lovely horse farm across the street. + More
rules: House Rules There is no smoking at all. (the security deposit will be kept if the house smells at all like smoke or pets.) The house is limited to 8 guests. No parties, no pets (without permission). Big messes must be cleaned, the usual mess can be taken care of by cleaning staff. + More

description: Description The Space Location is the best feature of the home, but the rest isn't so bad either! Guest Access Aside from your room, you will have access to a full bath, the kitchen, deck, yard, and family room (with t.v.). Interaction with Guests If we will not be home during your stay, we will discuss this with you beforehand and provide instructions. Getting Around We are within walking distance to the Madison train station. There is also a local bus a short distance away. When all else fails, there's uber! Other Things to Note I am only taking reservations up to 3 months in advance. + More

about: The Spirit Horse Farm offers a unique and inspiring rental experience. Generous amenities and fun activities indoors and out.
description: Description The Space The Barn at The Spirit Horse Farm is awe inspiring. Soaring ceilings, huge fireplaces, fully equipped gourmet kitchen, bar, bose bluetooth sound system, books, art and artifacts from around the world, plus outdoor activities that can't be matched. See our reviews on the web. Guest Access Guests have access to all the amenities listed on our site, plus farm fresh eggs, artisanal breads, organic produce, and more. The horses are friendly and always happy to stand for a photo with our guests! The gym is complete with treadmill, recumbent bike, rowing machine, free weights, and machines. The large back deck has a barbecue, with steps down to the heated pool. The grounds are spectacular, with peacocks, white doves, horses and free ranging jungle fowl. Interaction with Guests We live onsite, in the old farm house, and are here to show you around upon arrival. We can help with any questions you may have, and can facilitate travel, larger gatherings, and are always available to help you to make the most of your stay here in Kent. The Neighborhood We are close to town, and the Housatonic River is across the street. The Appalachian trial runs over the ridge, and the Sloan Stanley Museum is less than 1 minute's walk away. + More

about: Classic,charming, and beautifully furnished, this stone "cottage" on Candlewood Lake, 70 miles north of NYC, is the perfect weekend retreat. Lake views, sandy beach, swimming, tennis court, billiards, deck, grill, Aga kitchen, and quiet forest setting. 5 minutes off route 7, 10 minutes from Danbury CT.
description: Description The Space Classic,charming, and beautifully furnished, this stone "cottage" on Candlewood Lake, 70 miles north of NYC, is the perfect weekend retreat. Lake views, sandy beach, swimming, tennis court, billiards, deck, grill, Aga kitchen, and quiet forest setting. 5 minutes off route 7, 10 minutes from Danbury CT. The "gemutlich" ambiance of an original 30s lake house with its fieldstone walls, pine shiplap paneling, vaulted ceilings, wood-burning fireplace, and period antiques is what makes this house so charming. Flooded with natural light, with lake or lush green forest seen from every room, this is the perfect place to relax and enjoy the feeling of home. House, deck, yard, parking, lake beach (swimming, fishing), tennis courts. Weber grill on deck (except in winter) and hot tub right off the deck are yours to use--just please leave things clean upon departure. Washer and dryer in basement available to guests booking for a week or more; otherwise, basement and garage are not accessible. Other than greeting the guests and giving you brief orientation, the house is yours to enjoy. The house is in a private lake community, where 80% of the residents enjoy their lake houses in summer only, so in the off-season of September though May there is a lot of peace and tranquility! Walk across the lane (just 500 feet to the left is the community clubhouse, where you can sit on the deck, or descend the driveway or stairs down to the beach and hang out!). If the lake is frozen solid and smooth in the winter, ice skating is always possible, and if there is a blanket of snow on top, then cross-country skiing is at its finest. In the summer, swimming and lounging on the beach are your favorite pastimes, or rent a boat from Echo Bay Marina down the road and enjoy water skiing, wakeboarding, or tubing on Candlewood Lake. Things to do outside the community: ~ Farmer's Market in New Milford on Saturday mornings in the warmer months. ~ Many hikes in the area (Naromi Land Trust trails [(website hidden)], access to the Appalachian Trail + more.) ~ Pratt Nature Center, biking on Lake Waramaug, Elephant's Trunk Flea Market, Bank Street Theater, and more on Guidebook ~ Like to ski? The cabin is centrally located close to several ski slopes! * Thunder Ridge: a family oriented starter slope is about 20 minutes away across the NYS border in Patterson, NY * Woodbury Ski Area a family resort, has winter tubing and other fun activities...45 minutes from the cabin * Butternut in Great Barrington, MA is 1.5 hours away...a great family ski resort * Mohawk Mountain in Cornwall, CT is 45 minutes away The only convenient way to get to New Milford is to DRIVE--and you really will need to rely on GPS to find it. However, if you have friends coming from NYC, the closest train station is Danbury, CT (about 20 minutes away) but the most convenient --because it is a direct line and does not require transferring--is Brewster, NY (about 30 minutes away). A cab from either of these places will probably run $40-$50, so usually not feasible. If you are coming from an airport on CT Limo, your stop in Danbury is at the Maron Hotel, where you might catch a $35-45 cab to the house. There is plenty of shopping on Route 7 in New Milford (Walmart, Home Goods, TJ Maxx, etc.) and your best grocery stores are Stop & Shop, Big Y, and Aldi. If you want to hike, you are near the Appalachian Train entrance in Bull's Bridge and Kent, and there's great hiking at several state parks: Lover's Leap, Kent Falls, Mt. Tom, and Macedonia are the closest and most convenient. The local park is Harrybrook, and just down Candlewood Lake Road South is a small park called Dykes Point which gives you a lovely path along the lake. For Memorial Day through Columbus Day (end of May through mid-October, the house is rented by the WEEK ONLY at $2500 per week. A daily price might show up on these dates but the house is indeed only available weekly in summer. However, if you see that a summer week is NOT booked 24-48 hours in advance, feel free to inquire about specific dates within that week (two night minimum) and we will try to accommodate if possible. Important: the house is normally occupied by a cat named Mr. Magoo. He will be off-premises during your visit (unless you WANT to have a sweet cat around during your stay) but anyone with cat allergies should be warned, or bring your own Zyrtek! Some people are sensitive even no matter how well the house is cleaned... House, driveway (parking for one vehicle), deck, hot tub, yard, propane grill, etc. are all yours to enjoy. Beach access, boat slip, and tennis courts are possible with pre-approved monthly rental. Washer and dryer in basement can be made available to guests booking for a week or more (steep stairs, so preapproval is required to use them!). The basement, attic storage, and garage are off limits. Other than greeting the guests and giving you brief orientation, the house is yours to enjoy! While the house is located in a secluded, almost "rural" area of New Milford, it offers modern convenience in that there is plenty of shopping just a few miles away on Route 7 : Walmart, Home Goods, Hope Depot, TJ Maxx, Staples, Peach Wave, etc.). Your best grocery stores are Stop & Shop, Big Y, and Aldi, and you can seek out your favorite libation at Classic Liquors or Nejame package store. If you want to hike, you are near the Appalachian Trail entrance in Bull's Bridge and Kent, and there's great hiking at several state parks: Lover's Leap, Kent Falls, Mt. Tom, and Macedonia are the closest and most convenient. The local park is Harrybrook, and just down Candlewood Lake Road South is a small park called Dykes Point which gives you a lovely path along the lake. The house is centrally located close to several ski slopes: * Thunder Ridge: a family oriented starter slope is about 40 minutes away across the NYS border in Patterson, NY * Woodbury Ski Area a family resort, has winter tubing and other fun activities...45 minutes from the house * Butternut in Great Barrington, MA is 1.5 hours away...a great family ski resort * Mohawk Mountain in Cornwall, CT is closest, at only 30 minutes away The only convenient way to get to New Milford is to DRIVE--and you really will need to rely on GPS to find it. However, if you have friends coming from NYC, the closest train station is Danbury, CT (about 20 minutes away) but the most convenient --because it is a direct line and does not require transferring--is Brewster, NY (about 30 minutes away). A cab from either of these places will probably run $40-$50, so usually not feasible. If you are coming from an airport on CT Limo, your stop in Danbury is at the Maron Hotel, where you might catch a $35-45 cab to the house. Holiday weekends are priced accordingly. Summer (June 20- September 7th) stays are usually by the WEEK only at $2,500 per week or $8,000 per month. We will consider the inclusion of a well-behaved pet (dog or cat) on a case-by-case basis; just tell us about your pet to inquire. An additional cleaning fee is required for approved pets. Because the house is occasionally occupied by pets, people with allergies to dogs or cats should take note and be warned --this house may not be appropriate for people with allergies! Always ask if a dog or cat has stayed lately if you want to avoid allergic reactions. Tenants (staying 30 days or more) need to be preapproved by Community for beach, clubhouse, and tennis court access; please ask about this caveat if such access is important to you. description: Description The Space This recently renovated 25 acre property is nestled right along the shores of Lake Waramaug in picturesque Warren, Connecticut. With a boat house and lake front access there are a plethora of activities to engage in while enjoying your stay, including swimming, kayaking, canoeing, fishing, hiking, biking, sunbathing and nature gazing. If entertaining is your interest this property is perfect! The main house features a gourmet kitchen with top of the line appliances, two dishwashers and a multitude of other kitchen amenities. With two beautiful porches (one screened) and a patio just off of the media room you will be sure to find plenty of space for al fresco dining with amazing views of the lake. This home offers plenty of interior space allowing for guests to spread out (if desired) or enjoy a game/movie night in the media room or one of the several common living areas. This property truly has something to offer everyone! PLEASE NOTE: This property also has a 7 bedroom Carriage house that sleeps 14 and (3) 2 bedroom cottages (sleeps a total of 12) available for rent as well. Discounted rates will apply for combined rentals, please inquire for further information. To view the Carriage house please search: "Carriage House" Lake Waramaug 7BR **Maximum cleaning fee option given for listing is $300, however an additional $150 is required- totaling $450. A RECENT REVIEW: "We had a wonderful family reunion at the Boulders Inn on Lake Waramaug, Connecticut (24 adults and 14 children.) The Inn, carriage house and cabins sleep 38 comfortably. Almost all bedrooms have their own TV and private bath. Every room has been beautifully renovated and everyone commented on the ultra comfortable beds and beautiful linens. The adults would meet in the morning for coffee in the absolutely wonderful, state of the art, newly renovated kitchen at the Boulders. For those staying in the carriage house, (7 bedrooms, many with fireplaces) it also has a great ambiance and its own fabulous kitchen. Our family loved the brand new swimming dock A boathouse provided great fun for the children. There is a ping pong table, multiple fishing rods and kayaks for those who want to explore the lake. Our children spent all day swimming and fishing off the dock. There are wonderful lounge chairs for those who just want to relax and take in the spectacular view of the lake. Family dinners cooked on the two extra large grills were highlights of our trip. Cocktails on the terrace watching sunsets over the Connecticut hills was magical. The Inn is surrounded by beautiful gardens and expansive grounds. Needless to say, we had many exciting volleyball, badminton and soccer games. Our road bikers, who went out daily for 3 hour rides, gave the whole area a superb rating. The Boulders is located in a beautiful and historic part of Connecticut. There is wonderful antiquing, shopping and good restaurants in the immediate vicinity. There was something for every age group. It was our family's first major reunion and it was a huge success. I cannot say enough about the Boulders. We loved it!" Interaction with Guests The property management is available for assistance during your stay and you will find a comprehensive list of local dining (including catering options), shopping and other services such as childcare and private chef availability upon your arrival. The Neighborhood There are many quaint shops and eateries in the neighboring towns which include New Preston, Washington, Washington Depot, Kent, Litchfield and Sharon. Other local activities include: -Winery tours -Museums -Fairs and Carnivals -Farmer's markets -Sledding/Skiing -Antiquing -Elephants Trunk Flea Market (CT's largest outdoor flea market) Getting Around While there is no public transportation system in the area, this property can easily be reached via car from New York City (2 hours), Boston (2.5 hours) and Hartford (1.5 hours). A rental car is recommended but absolutely not necessary as the property has all you could hope for in a beautiful New England retreat. Other Things to Note Bedroom Layout: Master Bedroom: King-sized Bed and 2 ensuite bathrooms Bedroom 2: King-sized Bed and ensuite bathroom Bedroom 3: King-sized Bed and ensuite bathroom Bedroom 4: King-sized Bed and ensuite bathroom Bedroom 5: 2 Twin-sized Beds Bedroom 6: 2 Twin-sized Beds Bedroom 7: Queen-sized Bed Bedroom 8: Queen-sized Bed A "Pack and Play" portable crib/bassinet is available + More

about: This charming colonial sits on 2.5 acres of open land surrounded by nearby farms, trails and woods. The beauty of this location is it's easy access to the Metro North train stations taking you to NYC and highway to take advantage of CT's attractions.
description: Description The Space Our family welcomes you to our home! Our Airbnb room is clean and comfortable, and our family living spaces are open to your use. The room boasts: - a very comfortable full size bed with a memory foam mattress topper, bed linens, and two new pillows - double windows that look out upon the backyard and wooden blinds for privacy - ceiling fan - floor lamp - closet and hangers - nightstand and small lamp - rustic bookshelf with baskets for storage of your things - plush towels - a small collection of our favorite shampoos, conditioners, body lotions, and soaps for your use during your stay You will also have access to a full bathroom (right next to your room) that will occasionally be shared with our 3 year old daughter for her evening baths. You will have counter, cabinet, and drawers that can be used for storage of your bathroom items. Perhaps the most exciting features of our bathroom is the large Jacuzzi tub/shower... it's a great way to relax after a busy day! A full sized washer and dryer are also located right outside your room, so feel free to throw in a few loads. Guest Access Guests have access to the full main level of our home, which includes: - Full eat-in kitchen with modern appliances and plenty of counter space for cooking and creating - Dining room with rustic oval table - Living room with plenty of room for relaxing by the fireplace or watching our 60 inch TV (Netflix, Apple TV, and cable stations with DVR included) - Playroom with couch, fireplace, and lots of great toys and books to keep the little ones entertained (mostly infant to preschool toys) - Large deck with grill and patio table/chairs - Backyard with playground and lots of open space, natural fire pit area, and wooded space for getting back to nature We will provide you with access to our WiFi network. You will also have a space in our driveway to park your vehicle. Interaction with Guests Our family, which consists of husband Herman, wife Rachel, 3 year old daughter Hannah, 6 year old Boston Terrier Chester, and 9 month old Chihuahua/Terrier mix Decker will be in and out throughout your stay. We do occasionally have other family members at our home who help with babysitting. We do have a lot of great travel advice to share and love to provide recommendations for anything (from restaurants, farmers markets, CT attractions, vineyards, casinos, parks, hiking trails, etc). Other Things to Note We will provide you with a key so you can go in and out whenever you'd like. Our two small dogs get excited for visitors and will likely bark and jump upon your arrival. They are harmless, but we want to make sure that our guests are comfortable with dogs and this behavior. We are open to guest pets in our home as well. We do have packages that includes massage, yoga, vineyard tours, horseback riding, transportation to and from the train station, car rental, breakfast, etc. Please inquire if you are interested in learning more. + More

description: Description The Space Just 5 minutes from charming New Canaan and its 45 minute train to Grand Central in New York City, this hilltop estate nestled on four secluded acres offers an oasis of serenity from the pressures of business or travel. Designed by a Greek architect to fit its natural setting, the home offers four levels of terraced private gardens and a beautifully intimate swimming pool. Watch deer as you enjoy morning coffee from the Italian tiled exterior balconies. 7500 sq.ft. in four stories of open and expansive living area finished with hardwoods, marble, granite and stone will make your stay a delight to the eyes. Exterior doors from almost every room at every level access terraced, private gardens. The dining room has window walls on three sides with views toward majestic hardwood forest. The living room also has a cathedral ceiling with window walls and clerestory windows and a massive stone fireplace. A well stocked library has a balcony that overlooks the living room. Enjoy up to four bedrooms (master king, guest queen, guest full, kids two twin) with a separate studio apartment (queen), the master bath's double walk-in shower, and a cork paneled movie room with a 20 foot screen. For your convenience, offers two dishwashers, two washers, two dryers, and high speed Internet and WiFi. + More

From the gracious foyer to the well-equipped country kitchen and double-sided fireplace, every corner of this three bedroom, two bathroom property speaks to an understatedly luxe lifestyle. about: Situated in a quiet cul-de-sac in beautiful Wesport, CT., this spacious private suite has all the amenities to make you feel right at home. Enjoy the many cultural, recreational and gastronomical pleasures of Westport. Located just 1 hour from NYC!
description: Description The Space This is a large 450 sq. ft. ground floor suite that has everything you need contained within the suite: Bedroom with closet, flat panel TV, kitchenette, kitchen table and chairs, hotel-sized refrigerator, cook-top, private bathroom and washer and dryer. Guest Access You will enjoy a semi-private entrance to your suite and have your own key for entering. You will also have access to our spacious and relaxing back yard & deck. Interaction with Guests We will provide a detailed listing of the many amenities available to you in the area, and we'd be happy to answer any questions you may have. The Neighborhood This location is in a quiet Greens Farms neighborhood. Homes are on one-acre lots, and properties are quiet and pristine. While you enjoy the feel of being out in the country, you are minutes away from great shopping, exceptional dining and night-time entertainment in charming, downtown Westport. Theatre goers will love the historic Westport Playhouse, just minutes from our home. Getting Around It is so easy to get around! The Boston Post road is a 3 block walk from our home, where you can get bus service that will take you to Fairfield and points East or to Norwalk and points West. Also, just two blocks from the house, you can catch the Westport "Mini-bus" that takes commuters to the train station in the morning during peak hours and picks up commuters in the evening during peak hours. Westport is also a bike-friendly community. Other Things to Note This location is less than two miles from Sherwood Island State Park and Compo Beach and less than three miles to the Longshore Golf Course. We are also less than 10 minutes away from both Westport Saugatuck and Greens Farms Train Stations. New York City-Grand Central Station is approximately a one-hour train ride. + More

about: If you want to experience something totally different for a change, why not sleep on a sailboat, combined with a sailing cruise of the area, watch the sunset, drink a glass of wine in a very peaceful and natural setting.
description: Description The Space Nomade is a 35' sailboat with 2 double cabins and a center salon which turns into a double bed. Full details on Nomade on our website: sail-works .c o m . We also offer 1/2 day or full day trips. There is a bathroom and marine toilet and an outside shower. The kitchen comes with a stove, 2 sinks with hot and cold water, fridge, and 3 propane burners. 110V or 12V power. There is a sound system and 32" smartTV with 4 speakers in the salon, you can plug in your phone or music player to listen to your favorite music. Rates are for the entire Yacht , midweek, plus crew per evening aboard. The boat will sleep 2-4 guests in 2 cabins, the third cabin reserved for crew. You and your guests will board in the late afternoon and enjoy a relaxing sunset cruise to a secluded cove where you can spend a magical night under the stars. As dinner and wine are not included, Port Jefferson offers a wide variety of restaurants and night life. The galley is well stocked with a fridge, stove & BBQ grill. The next day , enjoy a morning swim and a leisurely french breakfast, you can either walk around the dunes or we can sail around the area then anchor for lunch, we will serve one of our amazing and healthy salad compose and even expresso coffee if you wish, more sailing, swimming or sunbathing as you prefer. Check out time is flexible but before sunset. While sailing, the captain will gladly teach you the basics of sailing if you are interested. Indoor towels and linen are provided. This is a unique experience for a couple anniversary, birthday event or just a group of friends wanting to do something different for a change. Fun and great memories guaranteed. We also offer adventure sailing trips in case you want to spend more than 2 nights on board and sail to more locations such as the Hamptons, Fisher's Island, Mystic, the Thimble Islands or Block Island. CREW GRATUITY IS NOT INCLUDED AND HIGHLY APPRECIATED :) Guest Access Access to the whole boat and everywhere around it :) Interaction with Guests Captain Eric stays aboard and will make your stay memorable. With 10 years of charter experience and familiar with a wide variety of guests on board, he combines a blend of discretion and good humor when needed. The captain is also a sailing instructor. More details on website: sail-works . c o m The Neighborhood Mystic, Ram Island, Fishers Island.... so much to choose from Other Things to Note Our overnight rates include a sailing cruise that varies on your likes, timing and weather conditions. Rate does not include docking fees ($150) per night. Boat can be anchored or at the dock. Marina has bathrooms and showers available. + More
rules: House Rules Common sense. No pets please. Smoking outside the boat only with no ashes on deck. Deck shoes or rubber soles only. + More

about: This private home is the perfect destination for a family or group of friends. Located on Bell Island in Rowayton Connecticut, this home has water views, a great deck that is perfect for entertaining and it is just steps away from 2 private beaches.
description: Description The Space You are renting the entire house. There is an apartment over the garage that will be kept open for the owner's use when needed. Guest Access The entire home, including decks, porch and yard. You have access to 2 private beaches within the association. Interaction with Guests Owner will be available by phone and email when needed. The Neighborhood Bell Island is a private association located in Rowayton. Bell Island offers 2 sandy beaches, several parks including one with a playground suitable for small children and Rocky Point which is a gorgeous spot to sit or fish for stripers or bluefish during season. Rowayton is a picturesque village, and the Rowayton Civic Association hosts a variety of activities and events throughout town during the year. You will find a calendar listed on their website. This homes is perfect for family reunions, or group getaways. It is family friendly and relaxing. Getting Around A car is recommended. There is off street parking for 3-4 cars at the house. The center of town, with a market, post office, hardware store, seafood market and two restaurants is a short walk or bike ride from the house. South Norwalk (SoNo) and Darien offer a variety of restaurants, shops, nightclubs and movies. The Maritime Aquarium and Stepping Stones Museum for Children are both a 10 minutes drive away in SoNo. Uber cars are readily available if you choose to not drive. + More

description: Description The Space You won't find a prettier backyard...you can even get married here! 3 Bedroom, 3 Full baths, Living Room, Dining Room, Huge Kitchen and Fireplaced Den make this house a perfect getaway for any group of family or friends. We love our neightborhood! It's quiet, friendly neighbors and best of all we just walk to the beach. What's great about heading into the fall is the kids are back to school, th beaches are quite and we can run the dogs for hours on end. The nightlife and activities here on the shoreline is what brought us here. You won't find us sitting home watching TV...just busy trying to decide wether it's a casino night, concert or show at the Garde Arts Center or a great dinner at the many diverse restaurants on and around the water. It's so easy to hop on a train downtown (minutes from the house) and be in Boston or New York City within 2 hours. Or be adventerous and hop on the ferry to Block Island, Long Island or Fishers Island. Or spend a leisurely day in Newport, a short drive from the house. With so much to do, you'll have to come back year after year as some of our guests have already found! Hope to see you soon! + More

about: Charming, updated 3 BR/2 bath home near beaches, town, culture, hiking!
description: Description The Space Gorgeous Home located in the Fairfield Beach area is an ideal spot for family reunions, weekend get-away, or convenient oasis for business travelers who need fast access to New York/Stamford/New Haven. The house features: 3 Bedrooms, one with a queen-sized bed, one with two twin beds, and the other with a twin-sized cot. Please see pricing guidelines for parties over four people. 2 full bathrooms. A newly remodeled kitchen with GE appliances. Lovely fenced in yard on a quiet cul de sac street A just-remodeled three-season porch with cozy wicker seating and table, R/C fan, and outdoor lighting for entertaining, morning coffees, or just relaxing. BBQ gas grill WiFi Weekend New York Times (delivered) Guest Access We have a two boy's bikes (and an adult bike) and helmets if you feel like leaving the car at home and heading to the beach, downtown, the local homemade ice cream shop, or activities. If you're bringing kids, we've got plenty of books, toys (Legos, blocks) and other toys so you don't have to pack a ton of entertainment. Interaction with Guests We usually don't see guests unless they have booked a long-term stay and we swing by to pick up mail. The Neighborhood Our block is a safe and friendly cul de sac located within walking distance of markets. Fairfield/Southport is an ideal get-away for adults, athletes, families and singles, thanks area's fabulous restaurants and bars and amazing outdoor life. Take a romantic walk on the beach or catch some live music at Fairfield Theater Company, one of several venues. Theater goers may want to check out Westport Playhouse, founded by the late Paul Newman, which is down the road or head up to New Haven. Athletes: We are 10 minutes from a ropes and zip line course, close to the Aspetuck Nature Reserve, with miles of woods and trails for hiking or mountain biking. Beaches have swimming and there are a ton of weekend summer road races, including a weekly summer racing series in nearby Westport and the Fairfield Half Marathon, for those who wish to participate. For those who want to stay longer and explore Connecticut, we are about an hour from Old Lyme and Mystic, outlet shops, close to Yale, and more hiking/beaches. In short, you can come and relax and unwind at the house or be as active and entertained as you want. Getting Around There are taxi cabs at the train stops, but if you wish, we are close enough to walk or bike to two Metro-North train stations (Fairfield Metro station, 1.07 miles away, and Fairfield station, 1.3 miles away) that go to New York City or up to New Haven. The bus stop is just outside of our cul de sac, and the local taxi cab company can whisk you to where you want to go, get you to the train station, etc. Two car rental agencies are within a half mile from the house. + More
rules: House Rules We have a strict No-Smoking policy (either inside or on the property). The house is thoroughly cleaned for your arrival. Please leave it looking and smelling in the same condition upon your departure! Garbage/Recycling pick-up is Friday morning for those who will be here then. Please leave cans for the service or make prior arrangements with us if you need help with this task. DO NOT THROW ANYTHING OTHER THAN TOILET PAPER IN TOILETS! Two tenants have now left us with huge plumbing bills. If plumbing backs up during your stay because of a baby wipe, paper towel, etc. tossed down toilet a claim will be filed. Turn off the gas from gas grill if you BBQ. Upon departure ... Please replace items you break and use: we appreciate your honesty! Please strip beds and put dirty linens and towels near washer (in basement) upon your departure. Please put dirty dishes in dishwasher upon departure using detergent provided. No need to empty. Put key back in designated spot and check for any items you might leave behind! Extra guests: We have four "real beds" (three twin, one queen) and air mattresses. Extra guests over four are $25 per person, per night. All guests must be preapproved! A fee of $100 per person, per night will be charged for any guests who are not preapproved during the reservation process. Allergies/Pets/Peanuts: We have a dog and while the she is always taken to her boarder before our cleaners prepare the house for you, you do not want to rent this house if you have a child who is deathly allergic to pets and peanuts, which are also in our kitchen. On the other hand, we understand that you may not want to leave Fido at home when you go away, so we will consider allowing well-manned, house-trained dogs to stay as guests, too. There is $25/night fee for a dog. Pet owners who do not get preapproval for their dog will be charged $100 per night. We cannot accommodate cats. + More

about: Fully accessorized, beautiful suburban space consists of large bedroom (queen) with sitting area, private full bath and shared dining area. Continental breakfast; access to working pottery studio. Easy walk to Fairfield University.
description: Description The Space The suite comes fully furnished and decorated and is in the upstairs of our home (no other occupants). Space and amenities for your exclusive use include: full bathroom, sitting/living area, microwave oven, small refrigerator, Keurig coffee maker, toaster, clothes washer / dryer, iron / ironing board, hair dryer, DVD player, 2 CATVs (one at the foot of the bed and one in the sitting/living area, the latter also equipped with Apple TV for movie access), wireless Internet access and USB charging plugs (with international combinations). In addition to being an easy train ride from NYC, an across-the-street walk to Fairfield University and a 5 mile drive to GE Headquarters, this space comes with access to a working pottery studio on the grounds (for visiting, playing or serious work). In combination, these features make for a truly unique listing for 1 or 2 people (possibly with a young child; "Pack N Play" also available). Guest Access In addition to 584 square feet of private space, you'll enjoy shared access to a dining area, a large, well-furnished kitchen and the living room. Access to the pottery studio is by arrangement with the potter, but she loves to show off her space and welcomes people that want to explore, learn, play or even work seriously (for the latter, a studio fee may apply) at making things from clay! Interaction with Guests The space is private enough that if the guests want total privacy, they can have it and not feel cramped. On the other hand, we enjoy meeting people and want them to feel welcome in our home, so we'll interact as they wish. + More

Large car with beach parking sticker also available. Walk to Fairfield University, easy train ride to NYC. The living space has a 50" plasma TV, CATV, wireless Internet access and USB charging plugs. The apartment has a private entrance, a patio with large grill, patio table and 6 chairs. Parking space included. A large car (plenty of space for beach gear) with beach sticker entitling the occupant to beach parking and access is also available at no additional charge. rules: House Rules HOUSE RULES AND NOTES Please refer to manual left at the house for your information, maps, menus, etc. Check in and check out times are flexible with adequate notice We offer a clean, well-appointed home that is perfect for people who want a viable and comfortable hotel alternative. We ask that our guests be respectful of our home, the furnishings and supplies, and also respectful of our fellow neighbors. Excessive noise will not be tolerated. Smoking is limited to outside the building. Pets, though we love them, are not able to stay in our home. Rental Agreement Damages: The Tenant(s) agree to be responsible for any and all damages howsoever caused, be same innocent, negligent or willful, and whether caused by the Tenant(s), any one of them or any person on the Rented Premises. The Tenant(s) further agrees to notify the Landlord immediately upon the Tenant(s) becoming aware of any damage. Maximum Occupancy: The maximum number of tenants and guests is limited to six (6) persons day or night. No weddings, graduations, receptions, parties, or similar events allowed. The Tenant(s) agrees to return the home in the same condition it was found. Wireless Internet: Password-protected wireless internet is available for all guests. Guests agree that if they use the wireless network, they will only use it for legal purposes and they promise not to use it for illegal uploading, downloading, or other illegal activities. Check-out: In the event that the tenants(s) and guest(s) do not execute the cancellation agreement, the tenant(s) agrees that the owner may charge the sum of $600 per night provided the tenants(s) and guest(s) do not check out on their pre-arranged check-out date. No Daily Housekeeping services: While linens and bath towels are included, daily maid service is not included in the rental rate, however, it is available at an additional rate. We do not permit towels or linens to be taken from the home. Falsified Reservations: Any reservation obtained under false pretense will be subject to forfeiture of advance payment, deposit and/or rental money, and the party will not be permitted to check in. Liability Waiver: The Tenant(s) agrees that the Landlord shall not be liable for any loss, injury or damage to persons or property, loss of enjoyment, whether direct or consequential, resulting from such being on or about the Rented Premises whether caused by fire, smoke, theft, burglary, conditions due to the weather such as ice on the grounds, or for any cause whatsoever. The Tenant(s) further agrees that their use of the Rental Premises is at their sole risk. Insurance: We highly recommend all tenant(s) and guest(s) purchase travel, personal liability and property insurance. Indemnification: The Tenant(s) for good and valid consideration, including the granting of possession of the Rental Premises pursuant to the terms of this Rental Agreement, hereby agree to indemnify the Landlord and save them harmless with respect to any claim, demand, cause of action or actions made by any person against the Landlord, their agents and servants for damage or injury arising during the period of the Rental Agreement on or about the Rental Premises. Use of Grounds: The Tenant(s), his/her family and guest(s) shall use the common areas and walks within the area owned by the Landlord in a quiet and proper manner and with due regard to the comfort and convenience of other Tenants and neighbors, and shall desist from any course of conduct considered objectionable by any agent of the Landlord upon being requested to do so. Parking: The one car garage, in addition to the driveway can accommodate at least 3-4 cars. Extra spaces can be found on the street outside the home. Any illegally parked cars in the area are subject to towing; applicable fines/towing fees are the sole responsibility of the vehicle owner. Pets: Pets are NOT allowed. Smoking/Smoke Detectors/Fire Extinguisher: There is no smoking permitted in the home/or throwing cigarette butts on the grounds, or in the surrounding walkways/parking areas. The Tenant(s), his/her family and guest(s) are permitted to smoke on the deck, but must use a proper ashtray and dispose of the butts in such a manner as to ensure the butts are extinguished fully. The Landlord ensures that there is a functional smoke detector/CO2 and fire extinguisher installed in the Rented Premises at the time the Tenant(s) takes possession of the rented premises. A Tenant(s), his/her family or guest(s) who disable(s) a smoke detector is subject to a fine under law. Both the Landlord and the Tenant(s) hereto agree and understand that this Rental Agreement shall be considered to be an original, and shall be legally binding upon all parties. Tenant(s) Travel Information: In order to ensure a smooth check-in and to better serve you, please be prepared to provide the following information: * Check in date and approximate hour of arrival. * Written listing and email addresses of all names of all guests who will occupy the home. * Check-in time is flexible with prior agreement and advance notice to landlord. Instructions for access will be provided when reservation is confirmed. * Your contact number during your stay. * Preferred method of contact while in Fairfield (email, phone, text). During the message exchange you will be asked to agree to the terms of our agreement. CHECK-IN: Please text or call me at (phone number hidden) let me know you've arrived safely! CHECK-OUT: Tidy house thoroughly to return to how it looked and smelled when you checked in yourself. Load up dishwasher and start cycle. Strip all bed linens and used bathroom towels, deposit in laundry basket/room. Remake all beds with extra linens in closets as you found them if possible. If beds or furniture was moved or airbeds used, please deflate and fold up airbeds/pullout. Lock all windows and doors and leave keys in designated spot. Failure to follow check out procedures could result in partial or total loss of security deposit. If an early departure precludes your ability to return the home to its original condition, please notify me IN ADVANCE. EXTRA GUESTS: House has 3 real beds, and sleeps 6 comfortably without using airbeds (second floor master suite king for 2, first floor suite queen for 2, and guest bedroom queen for 2). More than 3 guests will be charged $100/each/night unless we negotiate prior to booking. Failure to disclose total number of guests could result in forfeiture of deposit. + More

about: Beautiful 1-Br apartment in East Rock, just up the street from Yale University and historic downtown New Haven. Has the feel of an old New England colonial home with modern, updated appliance and fixtures. We love this place and hope you will too!
description: Description The Space Our apartment is large and spread out with 1 bedroom, living room, bathroom, kitchen and dining area. There is a queen size bed in the bedroom and the living room has a couch that easily sleeps one (or two if you snuggle), but there is lots of floor space and we also have an air mattress, so it can easily accommodate 4 or more. We are a 2 min drive to Yale campus, or about a 15 min walk. We are a 5 min walk from beautiful East Rock park. Guest Access When staying here you will have the full apartment to yourselves! You will also have access to off street parking. Interaction with Guests Key access will be arranged prior, and you can always contact us at anytime if you have any issues. The Neighborhood East rock is a quiet neighborhood just north of Yale. Its home to lots of Yale seniors, graduate students and New Haven locals. Getting Around Yale has a transit system that stops right in front of the apartment, so if you are coming to visit a Yale affiliate, this is a great options. If not, New Haven is very compact and accessible on foot or bicycle. If you're bringing a car, we have a free on site off street parking spot. + More
rules: House Rules We are opening the home to you, so please have a great time but try to leave it in the same condition as when you arrived. Feel free to use soap, shampoo, dishes, glasses, etc. We will leave out fresh bedding and towels too! + More

about: Roughland Estate is a lovely property with a main house, guest farmhouse, indoor pool, spa, swim pond, gardens, orchard and more, all on 30 acres! The property sleeps up to 30 guests total, offering larger groups ease & luxury.
description: Description The Space 20,000 sq. ft. architectural home, family-friendly, with heated pool, hot tub, spa with sauna & steam shower, ping pong & pool tables, yoga room. Two beautiful homes on 30 acres, including fruit trees, walking woods, outdoor chapel, and spring fed pond! Guest Access Travelers have access to all areas of the property. Interaction with Guests Guests will be greeted by the estate caretaker, who will do a walk-through upon arrival or shortly thereafter. The homes are well maintained and prepared for your arrival. Property manager, Claudia, from Berkshire Rental Properties, is also available if need be. The Neighborhood Roughland is located in a bucolic country setting. The town of Norfolk is a short drive of about 5 minutes away, where you can find Infinity Hall, the Yale Summer School of Music, Norfolk Chamber Music Festival, & other attractions. Getting Around There is plenty of parking at Roughland. Should you need parking in addition to the driveway & garage, there is an extra parking area just a few seconds down the road. The closest train is the Metro North Wassaic stop in Amenia, NY, & the nearest airport is Bradley International Airport in Hartford, CT. Other Things to Note Travelers can arrange for additional housekeeping or catering services at their request. + More
rules: House Rules Smoking is never permitted inside either of the houses. All cigarette butts outside must be collected and disposed of prior to departure. Pets are allowed as guests of the Farmhouse only for an additional $150 pet fee per pet. Tenancy is for not more than 30 guests. Roughland Estate is ideal for family gatherings, reunions, and corporate events. Tenants must be at least 25 years of age to book. + More

description: Description The Space Enjoy this green woodsy retreat in beautiful Litchfield County and relax in a charming farmhouse that is actually a terrific party house too! The dining room, once a rustic keeping room, has a stone wall, fireplace, and stenciled hardwood floors. You will feel as if you stepped back in time. The living room is the perfect size for intimate conversations or larger gatherings. Wide hardwood floors predominate throughout this comfortable home. Cook up a great meal or snack in the well-equipped kitchen with a professional Garland gas stove, microwave, two dish washers and other culinary gadgets. There is a full basement with washer/dryer/ironing board. Upstairs, there are three bedrooms and two baths. The master bath is spectacular with a Jacuzzi, European-style shower, twin sinks, and great views of mature hardwoods and old stone walls. Relax in a queen size four poster bed that is calming and nurturing. There is a huge walk-in closet with ample storage. The second bedroom has a shaker-like feel with its queen bed and two closets. The third bedroom is small with two twin beds, great for kids. about: Carriage House set in 2 acres of gardens at the heart of the historic village of South Britain. Recently renovated, fully furnished. Come explore the town, Its history, bird sanctuary, and area trails, antique shops and picturesque roadways.
description: Description The Space Historic coach house spaces consisting of large living room seating 8-10 comfortably, dining room seating for 6, full kitchen, bathroom, laundry facilities, and two patios, one open to views into the landscape, the other covered with flowering vines, each seating 4 each at 2 tables. The house is private with its own entrances, fully furnished with a complete cooking kitchen, and overlooks the 2-acres of gardens and woods. Sleeping accommodates 4 in one large bedroom with adjacent sunroom/office, one smaller bedroom The kitchen and bathroom are recently updated. Cable television is provided in its own viewing area and high-speed, reliable internet access is available throughout. Parking is ample and convenient to the main entrance. Guest Access The house and its patios are totally yours and you share with your host wandering about the gardens, orchard, forest and gazebo. Ample parking is close to your entrance. The main house next to your coach house has a three-season, glassed in living room with skylight ceiling, plants and an oversize fireplace. You are welcome to schedule this for parties and celebrations. Interaction with Guests Your host is an architect formerly from Chicago who has also lived and taught architecture in Malaysia and Iraq. He practices from his office in the main house. A specialty is restoration, adaptive reuse and design of additions for historic buildings. He's a member of the Southbury Historic Buildings Commission which oversees the Town owned historic's landmark buildings. The Neighborhood This little known, under-publicized Village is well preserved and historically important. It has 22 homes dating from 1690 to 1835, two churches from the 1830's, Southbury's first library (1904) and village hall (1893), a country store, and a mill building along the river currently being restored that remains from the days when the town was important for its manufacturing. Southbury's modern shops, restaurants and specialty stores of all types are convenient - a mile or two away on paved roads and there is an unpaved road that serves as a shortcut allowing one to pass through active farm land with cows grazing and barns full of hay. Within ten miles are dozens of thrift shops and vintage stores. The next town, Woodbury, has a significant 17th century house, a house where the Episcopal church of America was formed thus removing King George as head of the church, and an 1830's blacksmith shop which was in use till recent times. Further north are the towns of Roxbury, Washington Depot, and Litchfield - each with its own rich history and visitor attractions. World class musical performances take place summers at the Yale School of Music's summer home in Norfolk and the Annual Jazz Festival held in Litchfield. Southbury and the village of South Britain are remarkable for their history: General Rochambeau camped here in 1782 while engineers found ways of crossing the Housatonic River with the army's cannon on their way to join Washington's army near New York. Southbury is the only town in the US that threw out the Nazis who in 1938 were trying to build their 23rd German Bund Camp which were used to indoctrinate German-Americans. Getting Around The house is located 1 mile north of I-84's South Britain exit 14, one-and-a-quarter hours from midtown NYC by car on expressways. The Town of Southbury is served by regularly scheduled Peter Pan buses from NYC and pick ups can be arranged at the bus station. Metro North trains stop at Brewster, NY 25 minutes away. Rental cars, bikes and horses are available. Other Things to Note CTThere are few if any accommodations of this quality less than 90 minutes of NYC with the full attractions of hills, farms and country living, yet only minutes from consignment and antique stores, thrift shops, flea markets, farmers' markets, and trails for hiking and cycling. + More

The home features 18" soaring ceilings, an incredible wrap around deck overlooking lawns and gardens. Large Italian eat-in kitchen/family room. Office for 4. Home theater. Whole-house B&O system. The living room features a wood-burning fireplace and Italian furniture for relaxing, reading or entertaining. The family room features a 7.1 surround sound home theater and a 50" plasma TV. Weston is within an hour of New York City, ten minutes from world-class restaurants in Westport and Southport and within walking range of a 700 acre perserve filled with hiking and walking trails (you can even view Keith Richard's compound from the trails). We are also thirty minutes from New Haven and about three hours from Boston. Weston is a small town community of about 10,000 residents. It has a town center with just seven shops including "The Lunch Box", a small lunchonette that will remind some of their childhood. Weston has no highways, byways, or though roads. It is the perfect place for relaxing, bike riding, walking or just contemplating. The Westport MetroNorth stop is 17 minutes away and has frequent trains into New York City.
