rules: House Rules The house is kids friendly -- two boys grew up here and both attended K-12. Only the living room is adults only. No pets or smoking please. Everything is to be left as found. Maid service at additional charge is available upon request. The following "Agreement" will be issued and signed upon arrival along with photocopying you photo identification. AGREEMENT This Rental Agreement and Contract (the Agreement") is a legally binding agreement made and entered into as of the Reservation Date written below by and between the undersigned person(s) or company (the Guest") and the undersigned owner, manager or agent (Rental Agent or Host"), pursuant to which the Guest has agreed to rent the residence described below (the Property"), for the duration of the Rental Term for the Total Rental Fee and other good and valuable consideration as described herein. OCCUPANCY Guest agrees that no more than six (base rate) or ten (additional fees) persons shall be permitted on the Property at any time during the Rental Term, all of whom shall comply with the conditions and restrictions imposed upon Guest under this Agreement and in the House Book" issues upon arrival. The guest shall present photo identification upon signing this agreement. CONDITION AND USE OF PROPERTY The Property is provided in as is" condition. Rental Agent host shall use its best efforts to ensure the operation of all amenities in the Property, such as Internet access, satellite or cable TV access or hot tubs, fireplaces as applicable. Rental Agent shall not be held responsible for such items failure to work, but will make every effort to correct any issues as reported as quickly as possible. Guest acknowledges that use of amenities such as hot tubs, pools, spas, fireplaces, decks, and the like may be potentially dangerous and involve potential risks if improperly used, particularly with regard to children and such use is at the Guest's own risk. No pets or smoking in the house is allowed. The living room is not kids friendly and should not be used for drinking or eating. Guest shall use the Property for residential purposes only and in a careful manner to prevent any damage or loss to the Property and keep the Property in clean and sanitary condition at all times. Guest and any additional permitted guests shall refrain from loud noise and shall not disturb, annoy, endanger, or inconvenience neighbors, nor shall Guest use the Property for any immoral, offensive or unlawful purposes, nor violate any law, association rules or ordinance, nor commit waste or nuisance on or about the Property. The home is to be returned as found in the condition that it was rented. If the guest has to leave abruptly, and does not have time to clear and clean their dishes and replace items where they were found, the agent host has the right to bring in a cleaning service and back charge the renter guest for that work. DEFAULT If Guest should fail to comply with the conditions and obligations of this Agreement, Guest shall surrender the Property, remove all Guest's property and belongings and leave the Property in good order and free of damage. No refund of any portion of the Total Rental Fee shall be made and if any legal action is necessary, the prevailing party shall be entitled to reimbursement from the other party for all costs incurred. ASSIGNMENT OR SUBLEASE Guest shall not permit the use of any portion of the Property by other persons who are not family members or guests of the Guest and included within the number of and as permitted occupants under this Agreement. RISK OF LOSS AND INDEMNIFICATION Guest agrees that all personal property, furnishings, personal affects and other items brought into the Property by Guest or their permitted guests and visitors shall be at the sole risk of Guest with regard to any theft, damage, destruction or other loss and Rental Agent shall not be responsible or liable for any reason whatsoever. RELEASE Guest hereby waives and releases any claims against Rental Agent, the Property owner and their successors, assigns, employees or representatives, officially or otherwise, for any injuries or death that may be sustained by Guest on or near or adjacent to the Property, including any common facilities, activities or amenities. about: 5 bedroom home for a getaway from the city.
description: Description The Space 5 bedrooms and 4 baths, nestled on 11 beautiful acres surrounded by conservation land. Please tell us about yourself the people in your group . Please include # of adults/age of your kids. Check in time is 4 pm and check out time is 11:00am. Located in Sturbridge area and Brimfield between Boston (1 hour) and New York City Manhattan (2.5 hours) with an easy 10 minutes access to Mass Pike route 90 and interstate 84 . You will enjoy this beautiful jewel of a retreat! This charming cozy home was designed by Royal Barry Wills, a well-known American architect and a master of traditional Cape Cod style homes, particularly between the 1930s  1950's. Enjoy quiet dinners in the dining room with seating for 8, warm yourself or tell stories by the cozy stone wood or gas fireplace with wide plank pine floored living room. Enjoy all the comforts of home with modern amenities that include 5 TV with cable , DVD, NETFLIX, WI-FI, heat , fans, CENTRAL AIR and full use of washer and dryer. There is an old fashioned Pub/bar living room, 2 family rooms, 5 patios for your use. You will be amazed at the comfort, charm and warm inviting atmosphere of this beautiful home! Stroll along the well-designed spectacular landscaped grounds with the sounds of the chirping birds and you will discover natural beauty that will delight any outdoor enthusiast. Enjoy the peace and tranquility of the pond as you sit and read a book on the bench or observe the many frogs, turtles and fish that are in the pond. Relax and enjoy the fenced in IN GROUND SWIMMING POOL (pool towels, pool toys are for you and your family) or gather with your friends by the outdoor FIRE PIT or have a barbecue using our large, PROFESSIONAL GRILL. There is something for everyone here! Outdoor activities for adults and children include VOLLEYBALL badminton, croquet, soccer, football, hiking and jogging around pond, horse paddocks, wooded trails. We also have an assortment of sports equipment and indoor and outdoor toys (puzzles, building blocks, hula hoops) for children to enjoy. Great central location to visit New England area for families or couples, as Sturbridge is only 1 hour to Boston MA (the most European city in the USA with Harvard and MIT universities). There are so many attractions to this area such as Amherst MA ( town of 5 colleges with well known top liberal arts Amherst college ), Providence RI( Capitol of RI and home of ivy league Brown University and prestigious Rhode Island School of Design), Hartford CT ( Capital of CT and home of Mark Twain and Katherine Hepburn). Others are Mystic Ct (quaint old port town on Atlantic with wonderful aquarium ), and New Haven Ct ( home of ivy league Yale University). The estate is 1.5 hours to the Berkshires, MA area (summer musical/dance playground for NYC / Boston wealthy patrons in towns of Stockbridge (Norman Rockwell Museum), Lenox with Tanglewood music hall , Jacob's pillow dance center and Edith Wharton's home, Great Barrington for Monument mountain hiking) . The estate is also close to Newport RI (mansions and chateaus of the gilded age of Carnegie, Vanderbuilt and high society as well as sailing competitions), Watch Hill RI (most elegant town on the Atlantic ocean) , and 2 hours to Cape Cod (national seashore with bike trails, pristine beaches in quaint towns of Falmouth, Hyannis and Provincetown). The often visited Wachusett Mountain Ski area with Mount Monadnock and Quabbin Reservoir (where you can experience an abundance of outdoor activities) is also 1 hour away. This area offers much activity and major attractions such as Old Sturbridge Village ( 100 ACRES), where you can see life as it used to be, and the famous Brimfield Antiques Show of hundreds of acres of antiques from dealers nationwide (in May, July, Sept). Other nearby activities include horse back riding, antiquing, museums, shopping, biking, hiking, farms, fruit orchard pickings, boating, fishing, golfing, snowshoeing, and skiing, perfect for visiting any time of the year. Fall foliage is spectacular! Location is at the intersection of Interstates 84 and 90 (Massachusetts Turnpike). This is the PERFECT place to rejuvenate yourself and take a break from the hustle and bustle of everyday city life. Enjoy your getaway any time of the year! Sorry, no pets or smoking allowed Guest Access Guests can enjoy or play anywhere on the property, and use the pool. Guests can use any toys, bikes, puzzles , games , kitchen equipment, dishes, and toiletries. They can bring their own toys, games and puzzles. Guests can use the rowing boat in the pond with depth of 9 feet. There are no lifeguards. Interaction with Guests There will be caretakers who will be on the grounds to take care of your needs. The Neighborhood Lots of fruit orchards nearby , vineyards, antiques stores, quaint New England homes and villages just outside my door, various national parks for hiking, water for boating, golfing. Sturbridge Village is 10 minutes away, all type of museums within 30 minutes, Getting Around Only 10 minutes from Interstates 84 and 90. There are 4 major airports all within 1 to 1.2 hour drive ( Logan in Boston, Hartford Ct ( 45 minutes ), Providence RI, Manchester NH. Westchester county airport and all the NYC airports are withing 2.5 hour drive. The nearest train is Amtrak ( going into Boston) in Worcester Ma 30 minutes away. There are private limo services that can pick you up and drop you off at the airports, Boston , NYC or any nearby cities. Other Things to Note Note all Holidays weekends, Brimfield Fair week add additional 20$ per night per room There is an event fee. + More

description: Description The Space The main floor of the house has a large kitchen with seating for ten, dining room with seating for 18 with use of table topper, twin bedroom, laundry room, living room with wet bar, sunroom, library, full bedroom, terraces. 2nd floor: queen bedroom, full bedroom, twin bedroom. 3rd floor: full bedroom, bedroom with 2 twin beds. Guest Access Pony rides can be arranged and people who stay longer than a 4 day weekend may see someone exercising the horses which is fun to watch. There are 6 fireplaces in the house not set for summer use. Interaction with Guests A caretaker will feed the horses am and pm and will not disturb guests as the barn is away from the house. Pool man comes on wednesdays, the lawn is cut that day as well. The Neighborhood The CT River Valley has many attractions including museums, farmers markets, wine trails, world class dining and lovely beaches. The Ferry to the Hamptons/Long Island is 25 minutes by car. New York and Boston are roughly two hours away. Clover Hill Farm is also walking distance though the woods to Fox Hopyard Golf Club which is open to the public. Over 100 acres of hiking trails/open space is adjacent to the property. Getting Around The train station is located in Old Saybrook CT which services Boston and Manhattan. The station is 15 minutes from the house. Other Things to Note There is a 4 night minimum over New Years. Thanks ! Well behaved pets welcome. + More

about: Take this rare opportunity to spend a week or two at this fabulous beachfront home that was the life long summer residence of entertainment legend Art Carney. Available to rent weekly during the last two weeks of July and the month of August. With nearly 3,800 square feet to ramble around, this rustic charmer boasts plenty of space for the whole gang. This home will comfortably accommodate 11 guests with its 6 bedroom, 4 full bathrooms, and 2 half bathrooms. There is a fantastic, large bonus room over the garage for extra space. Soak up the rays on your own private waterfront enjoying all that Quotonset Beach has to offer. Had too much sun? While away the hours on the deck, patios, or screened in porch with a good book or a cold drink. In the evening let the sound of waves lull you to sleep. Conveniently located to Route 1, you will have restaurants and shopping at your leisure. Need to commute? The Shoreline East, Westbrook station with connections to Metro North is less than a mile away.

about: Spa Residence: Indoor Pool, Sauna, Hot Tub, Jacuzzi & Solarium
description: Description The Space Prana Residence  Spa is an environment for relaxation and rejuvenation of vital life (prana). For those who appreciate tranquility in the pursuit of personal happiness and who can be inspired by unique surroundings, personal spa facilities and selected services, Prana Residence  Spa is waiting for you. Prana Residence  Spa sits in a most tranquil and romantic setting that will rekindle your spirit and rejuvenate your body.We are located on five acres atop the forested hills of Cornwall Bridge in Litchfield County, Connecticut less than two hours from Manhattan. The structure of this residence is a timbered geodesic dome covered with foam. Its organic form, environmentally sensitive design and LEED chosen materials, keep the building cool in summer and toasty warm in winter. The large size indoor pool, sauna, deep cold plunge tub, indoor jacuzzi, outdoor hot tub, solarium and massage therapy room, plus on call professional spa services makes Prana Residence  Spa a sanctuary for a unique and memorable experience. The residence features a spacious living/dining room which has a dramatic 20-foot high dome ceiling with a signature wood burning fireplace. A red spiral staircase leads to the library/meditation area and the massage room. A fully equipped open kitchen with its stone countered bar looks out into the large yet cozy living room. This open design creates a homey environment while allowing an elegant place for entertainment. The residence also has two attractive bedrooms each with a private bath. Children of all ages are welcome with parental and/or guardian supervision and waiver of liabilities. For pet-lovers, Prana welcomes pets, except the following dog breeds: Pitbull, Rottweiler, Chow, Doberman, Wolf hybrid, Akita, Bull Mastiff. Each pet will be charged $50 per night. In addition, at your request we can book a variety of services including butler, private chef, daily housekeeping and chauffeured car service. We can also recommend and arrange outdoor recreational activities such as horseback riding, water sports in the summer and other season activities including trout fishing, canoeing on the scenic Housatonic River as well as bird watching at the nearby Audubon Center. ** Guests can enjoy year-round hiking on the Appalachian and Mohawk trails, skiing at nearby Mohawk Mountain, playing golf, and tennis at nearby facilities also swimming in scenic lakes. Prana Residence  Spa is also centrally located for antiquing, gallery hopping and fine dining. + More
rules: House Rules Agreement Rules, Regulations and Set Up In addition to Airbnb's Terms of Service", Airbnb Content" and their rules and regulations, by booking this Accommodation (property named: Prana Residence-Spa), Guest(s) agree that Guest and any individuals the Guest invites to the Accommodation, to abide by the following rules while at the property. Maximum Occupancy: The maximum number of Guests is limited to 7 persons. People other than those listed in the application form may not stay overnight. Also, name of any visitor shall be provided to us in advance. The number of your visitors cannot exceed more than three and that includes children. Property: The property is furnished and includes basic household cookware, dishes, glassware, linens, towels and limited toiletries. An inventory is available for you and can be sent to you on your request. Unlike what may have been stated at Airbnb's description, We (the Host) are not allowed to leave any perishable food; therefore the refrigerator will be left clean and empty. Although the property is secluded and you will be the sole user of Prana Residence-Spa, at the rear of the residence, an addition has been built for the caretaker of the property, and currently is rented to a couple. This addition has a different entrance and has no view of Prana Residence-Spa) except the view to the driveway. Set Up: Please note that there are 3 bedrooms with the following occupancy for each room: Master bedroom  Queen sized bed that sleeps two people. 2nd bedroom (upstairs)  Queen sized bed that sleeps two people. 3rd bedroom (upstairs with loft)  Two single beds that sleep one person each, and one loft with a mattress that sleeps one person. Check in/Checkout: The Check-in time is 2 p.m. and Checkout time is 12 noon. These are the expected arrival and departure times for all Guests. We will try to greet Guest on arrival and explain the operation of the facilities; however, if we are unable to receive the Guest, we will leave a key in an accessible location and inform You of where to find it. In addition, we will send a copy of Exhibit A Operation Guide", which details the operation of the facilities Duration of Stay: This property requires a two night minimum stay and during the National Holidays the minimum stay is three nights. Access: Guest shall allow Host and the Manager access to the property for purposes of repair and inspection. Host and Manager shall exercise this right of access in a reasonable manner. Additional Fees: The following fees are outside of Airbnb and must be paid directly to the Host. a. Pets: After approval of the pet type and guest signature on related form, a fee of $50 for each pet, per night and refundable security deposit for the amount of $100 for each pet is due immediately after the booking of the property and must be fully paid prior to Check-In Date. The following breeds are not covered by our insurance and therefore are not permitted: Pitbull, Rottweiler, Chow, Doberman, Wolf hybrid, Akita, and Bull Mastiff b.Security deposit: As stated by Airbnb's conditions c. la carte services: Based on availability, and additional cost, a variety of massages, facial treatments, yoga lessons and other additional services provided by independent professional vendors can be booked for Guest.(URL HIDDEN)Cancellation Policy: If Guest wishes to cancel his/her reservation, fees for the pets and or  la carte services, the deposit will be refunded as follows: 100% less a $200 administrative fee if cancelled 60 days prior to the Check-in Date 50% if cancelled 31-59 days prior to the Check-in Date 0% if cancelled within 30 days prior to the Check-in Date All deposits are non-transferable to another date. However, Guest can send a friend or family member in their place provided that the application forms are resubmitted with the new personal data. Should Guest depart earlier than their intended stay, Host will retain all amounts associated with their booking. Insurance: We encourage all guests to purchase travel insurance in the event of a cancellation or other safety related issues. Safety and Rules: Although we welcome children, some elements of the house and the spa facilities are not safe for them and need parental supervision at all times. No pets are allowed to any of the spa facilities including the swimming pool room and Sauna. Guest agrees to abide by this agreement at all times while at the property and shall cause all members of the rental party and anyone else Guest permits on the property to abide by the following rules at all times while at the property. a.Stairs: The spiral staircase and the stairs to the loft are not childproofed. You (Guests) are responsible for your own and your guests' children's safety at all times. b.Sauna: When using the sauna, remember there is a certain health risk associated with this facility and must be used at Guest's own risk. The sauna can be also dangerous for children and Host does not advise children to use it. If Guest chooses to allow children to use this facility, be sure that they are old enough and familiarized with the safety precautions. Adult supervision is essential. Do not take any alcoholic drinks in the sauna and do not take any glass in the sauna. Please do not add water to the stove. This is a dry sauna, not a steam one. Please do not sit directly on the wood and use towels that are laid out for you Avoid leaving wet towels on the wooden floor as the water mark cannot be removed. c.Deep Plunge Tub: Children cannot reach the bottom of the deep plunge tub and its setup is not childproofed. Therefore, children are advised to be kept away from it at all times. The Plunge Tub fills up only with cold water and is used after the sauna. However, most people use the cold shower instead. After each use, please wipe the wooden floor with the white towels located on the floor of the laundry room. d.Hot Tub: When using the hot tub and sauna, remember there is a certain health risk associated with this facility. It must be used at Guest own risk. The hot tub and sauna can be dangerous for children and We do not advise children to use them. If You choose to allow your children to use these facilities, be sure that they are old enough and familiarize yourself with the safety precautions. Adult supervision is essential. The housekeepers drain, sanitize, refill and replenish chemicals of hot tub prior to each Guest arrival and will bring the temperature to the requested level. In order to keep it hot and free of debris, when it is not in use please remember to leave the cover on. e.Indoor Swimming Pool: The indoor swimming pool is deep (on one side 5'6"deep and the other side is 3'6" deep). Adult supervision of children is essential. If needed, to avoid children accessing the pool, Guests are able to lock both entrances to the swimming pool. Please use the pool with care and note the following: The interior of the swimming pool is plastic vinyl and can be punctured by any sharp object and may cause a leak. The yellow rope on the right side of the pool is for decoration. Please do not touch it, as the rust of the ring will fall into the pool and damage the liner. This is an indoor swimming pool and has no skimmer therefore body lotion and hair can clog the system and cause a costly repair. To avoid you must take a shower before using the pool and wear a shower hat. There are some shower hats in the closet in the corridor toward the pool. Diving or water games are not allowed Do not take any alcoholic drinks in the Swimming area or any glass After each swim please wipe the floor of the swimming pool, corridor and connecting shower with the white towels located on the floor of the laundry room or floor of the pump room behind the pool. To avoid excess humidity in the house please keep the doors of the corridor to the pool closed at all times. Keep the corridor toward the pool warmer than the pool and the house. During summer time as long as weather permits the sliding door to the deck and one of the windows must remain open at all the times. During winter and when the weather turns cold, the dehumidifier is installed and must run 24 hours. In case of an electrical outage or malfunction, please open the sliding door of the swimming pool in place of the dehumidifier. Otherwise, the moisture will develop mildew. Smoking: There is absolutely no smoking or illicit drugs tolerated inside the residence. However smoking cigarettes outside of the residence is allowed as long as the butts are kept in a container and placed in the garbage. Care & Use: Keep the Accommodation and all its furnishings in good order and only utilize appliances for their intended use. Guest must notify the Host immediately of any damage or malfunctions. If for any reason some of the equipment goes out of order or property gets damaged, Host will make the best effort to fix them, but by no means will Guest fee (rent) be adjusted. The structure of the building is a geodesic dome and is covered by high density closed cell foam which is ecologically sound, cool in the summer and warm in the winter. For your curiosity and examination, a sample of the interior and exterior foam covering in a block form is available to you to touch and is located in the cubbyhole next to the entrance inside the building. Please note that the foam covering of the building can be easily damaged by sharp objects, such as needles, pens, finger nails, knives, animal teeth, etc. If the exterior or interior of the foam is damaged in any way, you will be asked to pay for its professional repair. 14. Parking: Please park parallel to the garage entrance (since the garage is not in use you can block the entrance). This way the driveway will remain clear for others to use freely. Photography &Video: Although Guest has the right to take photos and video of the house and property for use of personal memory, under no circumstances shall the house be used or exploited in pictures, films, videos or any other media for any commercial, publicity or illegal purposes. Housekeeping: The residence and its spa facilities will be given to You spotless and we expect to receive it back the same. While linens and bath towels are included in the unit, there is no daily housekeeping service as part of the rental rate. If You require this service, it must be requested in advance from the  la carte list. We do not permit towels, linens or any other items belonging to the property to be taken from the residence. Furniture is not to be moved or rearranged and sheets are not to be removed from the bed. You are responsible for the proper upkeep and cleanliness of the residence and your responsibility includes but is not limited to the following. Any damages to any apparatus, the cost of repairing stopped plumbing resulting from misuse by You or your guests, and or cleaning of the below items shall be borne by You and drawn against your security deposit. If the premises appear dirty or are damaged upon Check-in, Guest shall inform Homeowner immediately: a.All household trash must be disposed in the proper receptacles, complying with the Connecticut recycling program and sorting all cardboard, glass, plastic and aluminum. Your recycled items should be kept in the garage. b.All dishes, glassware, pots/ pans and all cutleries are to be cleaned and stowed away in their proper place. c.Countertops are to be kept clean and free from debris, food and other waste. d.Stovetops and oven including microwave as well as outside grills are to be kept clean and free of all grease, food particles and other debris. e.Floors are to be properly maintained and free of spills and damages. f.Doors and windows are to be kept closed during any inclement weather. g.Lavatories, sink, toilets, tubs, showers and all spa facilities including sauna, cold plunge, swimming pool and hot tub as well as other water and plumbing apparatuses must be kept in good order. Use them only for the purposes for which they are intended. No paper towels, sanitary napkins or other obstacles are to be disposed of in the toilets, sinks, or tubs. Fireplace: The fireplace is a non-vented log fired firebox and works well. Do not throw any colored paper or other household combustible materials in the fireplace. Water & Septic: The property is on a well and septic system. The mineral content in the water is controlled by equipment and the water is good to drink. Once a week, normally at night, the system backwashes automatically. This process can be heard and will last approximately 15 minutes. Guest will ensure that until the backwashing process is complete, water is not used. This includes the dishwasher, washing machine and flushing of toilets. Use of water during backwash will fill the pipes with residue. Guest will ensure that no items or feminine products other than toilet paper will be flushed in any of the toilets at any time. This can clog the septic system and Guest could be charged for the damages of up to $500.00 to cover the repair. Storms and Snow Conditions: In the event of heavy rain or snow storm, no refunds will be given. Local roads are curved and steep in places. Although local roads and the property's driveway are well maintained, Host highly recommends Guest to have four wheel drive and/or chains in snowy conditions. Electrical Outage: No refund will be given for electrical outages or malfunction of equipment that cannot be fixed while Guest(s) are on the property and there is no emergency generator on the property. However, if we find unexpected malfunctions of any equipment that cannot be fixed before Guest(s) arrival, we will offer the option of transferring the dates of your stay, but no refund. Security & Safety: Although to the best of Host' knowledge, within the area to date, there have been no issues in regards to security or safety on the property, Guest acknowledges that the Host has made no representation that the property is a secure" accommodation, or that Guest(s) are safe from theft, injury or other damage. Guest(s) shall take appropriate measures to protect their own belongings and remain safe. The Host is not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or safety of the Guest(s). Operational Guide: Guest must carefully read the instructions in the operational guide and ensure they are followed by all the invited guests. This guide must be kept accessible for use at all times(URL HIDDEN) Waiver of Liability: The Accommodation (Prana Residence-Spa) is privately owned. As stated previously, Prana Residence-Spa is not well suited for children. By booking this Accommodation, Guest agrees to hold the Homeowner harmless and waiver all potential claims for any loss or damage to Guest personal property, and of injury or death to Guests', and Guest's children and/or any invited guest or pets, occurs while using the Accommodation or its facilities. Guest also absolves Host from any and all liability for any loss or damage to their personal property or effects arising out of water leakage, breaking pipes, or malfunction of the equipments in spa facilities such as the swimming pool, sauna and hot tub or other causes beyond the reasonable control of Host. This includes damage to Guest's vehicles while parked on the property. By booking Prana Residence-Spa, Guest(s) agree to all the terms and condition stated above. Sign____________________________________ Date_____ + More

about: Just 1.5 hours from NYC, the Lodge has a unique mountain ambiance, overlooks a golf course and trout pond; a perfect retreat from the City, totally peaceful yet close to many local attractions, e.g. Candlewood Lake, Bulls Bridge and Kent Falls.
description: Description The Space The log and timber upper level has four large bedrooms (first floor master suite with jacuzzi), a great room with fireplace and open to gourmet kitchen and dining room. An 8 ft. wide porch and deck with balcony surrounds the home. The lower level is a massive (2200 sq. ft.) area with pool / games room (or 5th bedroom), sixth bedroom and family room, all with walkouts to garden lawns. The garage accommodates three large cars / SUVs and there is almost unlimited parking on the garage apron and circular driveway Guest Access Longer term guests, April-December, can generally obtain temporary golf and or country club membership but otherwise guests are restricted to the Lodge's two-acre grounds Interaction with Guests Graham will welcome you, organize the Lodge to suit your needs and as a Sherman resident for 16 years can advise you on almost anything available locally. The Neighborhood The Appalachian Trail and Berkshire foothills sort of collide just north of Sherman and Bulls Bridge that is astride the mighty Housatonic River that forms two borders for the golf course on which the Lodge is prominently situated. Sherman town itself lies five miles south of the Lodge and in summer has a private beach open on Candlewood Lake. The towns of "quinesstial" Kent, New Milford and Washington are all within ten miles and along relative traffic free, attractive and scenic routes. Getting Around As an alternative to coming up by car from or visiting the Big Apple by car along the least congested routes north of NYC, 6 miles west of the Lodge, guests have the option of using the train from / to Wingdale station. It links us to Grand Central Station in midtown Manhattan and takes 1.75 hours. A plus is that this avoids parking in NYC and can be a useful and safe way to shop, see a show and/or have a dinner (with a glass or three of wine) in Manhattan. Other Things to Note Sherman is most often voted Connecticut's Top Small Town and most guests just don't want to leave! + More

about: The property is a great 3200sq feet house, very large back yard (2 acres), beautiful & very clean swimming pool, bordering Branford water community hiking trails. 2 minutes away from Branford center but yet very private and secluded. B&B / Full house
description: Description The Space Important: please note, this property is only available as an entire house rental IF there are at least 6 guests booked. Below 6 guests, the house is a bed and breakfast with shared space with us unless agreed otherwise. Our winter rates are (11/1 - 5/1) : $200 per bedroom, $400 for 2 bedrooms, up to 4 people. No cleaning fee or security deposit. During the spring and summer season (5/1 - 11/1), we require a 2 night minimum stay on weekends. Although the house can sleep up to 10 people, the 5th bedroom is in the finished basement with no windows but very quiet and private. As this is our primary residence, we also tend to prefer smaller groups and families. For a group of 6 guests, the master bedroom is not available for rent. The house is only a short drive away to the beach and is located in one of the nicest and most safe neighborhoods in Branford. Our house is very spacious therefore offers a great amount of privacy. Your bedroom would also come fully furnished, bed, lovely dressers. The master bedroom is a king size bed and all the other bedrooms are queen size beds with mattresses. Guest Access In addition to your bedroom you would have full access to the house, all 3 living rooms including a 110" screen movie room with fireplace, kitchen, pool, backyard, bathrooms, dining room; everything is yours to share responsibly. Interaction with Guests We also offer sailing cruises and charters on our 35' sailing boat to the Thimble Islands or Branford area (boat listed on Airbnb).Why not combine a few hours of relaxed sailing with your stay. More details here on our site: sail-works . c o m The Neighborhood Hiking trails right off the house, a short drive away to the beach, very private, quiet and safe. Secluded yet 5' drive from town. Other Things to Note Please note that we CANNOT call you back and discuss prior to a reservation since Airbnb hides phone numbers and emails. Once you make a reservation, phone numbers are available, you can always cancel the reservation afterwards if need be. On weekends (FRI, SAT, SUN), we require a minimum of 2 nights reservation. + More
rules: House Rules We expect our guests to behave responsibly. This is our primary residence and we must feel comfortable with the guests involved taking over our house. No smoking, no heavy drinking, no loud shouting or irresponsible behavior. + More

about: A 19-century Italianate Victorian-architectural masterpiece restored by renown architect Maya Lin. Each bedroom designed with a theme. Great for family reunions and group retreats or wedding accommodation. 20 mins to tourist attraction & casinos.
description: Description The Space The mansion also known as Bill House (1856) is located at the "Millionaire Triangle" of city of Norwich. The facility has spacious parlous and living rooms, a library room shelved with some unique and antiquarian books, glassed-in dining porch, a pool table, and a tennis court. 7 bedrooms with themed interior design: Rose, Mountain, Crescent, New England Four Seasons. Enjoy the beauty of arts and architecture details throughout this national registered historic mansion. Immerse yourself in the gilded age of Norwich, Rose of New England. Guest Access Entire mansion Interaction with Guests Come explore the rich history of Norwich, enjoy the natural beauty of New England distinct four seasons. I love my city and look forward to sharing with you all this forgotten treasure has to offer. The Neighborhood walk to Slater Museum, Saint Patrick Church, downtown Norwich, Mohegan Park. 20 minutes drive to Foxwood, Mohegan Sun casino. Getting Around 2-hour drive from NYC, 1.5-hour from Boston. You can also take casino or Greyhound bus to Foxwood or Mohegan Sun casino and then take taxi or Uber to the mansion. Other Things to Note 30% discount for students. This special offer applies to majority of the group are students. + More

about: A rare Greek Revival architecture Mansion, a New Haven Landmark, was built in 1830 and restored in 1999. Now a private Wooster Square residence at the center of the Historic District, 3 blocks from Yale. The privacy of a Hotel. The comforts of Home
description: Description The Space Aside from the building's originality and history, guests can also enjoy the creature comforts and serenity of the deeply padded armchairs and period couches in the two (2) elegant living rooms connected through a twelve-foot archway and mahogany double doors. Or you can retire with your favorite book to the privacy of the sitting area in your bedroom. Each bedroom has its original marble fireplace, initially the mansion's heating system and now impressively decorative, and its own private shower bathroom. Furniture are replicas of Queen Anne style: four-posters high rise queen-sized bed; cherry wood armoire; sitting area with gooseneck stuffed chairs; writing desk and chair. Guest Access Access to the residence and private bedrooms: privacy and easy access is assured; at check-in guests will be given a key for the locked front door and their private bedroom. Interaction with Guests Hosts are in separate private quarters on premises 24/7 and available to address guests's needs and questions, as well as any information or special accommodations that may be required. The Neighborhood The Wooster Square Historic District is a neighborhood filled with architectural gems and fabulous Italian Restaurants. Only blocks from Yale University and the vibrant New Haven Green, it is a residential and fine restaurants hub and center of attraction for visitors as well as locals. Getting Around The Chapel Street/Wooster Square area is one of the main city bus lines, as well as on the Yale University's private transportation system. Other Things to Note All shower bathrooms in guests's rooms are handicap enabled. Full tub&shower bathroom on first floor for common/visitors use. + More
rules: House Rules The original artworks in the mansion (paintings, mixed media sculptures, bas-relief collages, etc.) are by the resident artist. No photos allowed without prior consent. For long term stays (week or month) a deposit of 50% of the reservation is required. No refunds for cancellations of long term reservations (one week or longer) within one week of check-in. + More

about: A charming country home in a peaceful country setting, a short drive from Hotchkiss, Lakeville CT and Salisbury CT.
description: Description The Space This house is not a rental property, but a well-maintained weekend home for our family. On the main level, the house features a warm living room with comfortable leather seating and fireplace as well as a full kitchen, and small dining area for four, and a bar area that overlooks the great room below. Also on the main level are the master bedroom with a queen bed and ensuite bath, and a second full bathroom. Downstairs from the kitchen, the great room is a very light and open recent addition, with high ceilings, another comfortable seating area, and a large flat panel TV with cable service and AppleTV. Just inside the large bay windows is a large dining area with farm table seating for ten. Downstairs are three additional bedrooms: bedroom 2, with a queen bed; bedroom 3, with a queen bed; and bedroom 4 with two singles and two trundle beds. Also on this level is the third full bathroom and the washer/dryer. The house has a large rear deck, with a full view of the yard, garden and pool, and comfortable patio furniture for eight. The pool is a (roughly) 20x40ft heated pool with a wooden deck, a screened-in porch and a poolhouse with a foosball table. For the fitness inclined, the garage features a workout area with a rowing machine, weights and bench, exercise ball, jump rope and heavy bag. Guest Access Guests have the property to themselves, with access to all of the amenities, including 2 flat panel TVs (cable TV and AppleTV), wifi, swimming pool and poolhouse, fresh vegetables from the garden (seasonal), gas BBQ, the gourmet kitchen, fireplace, and exercise equipment (rowing machine, weights, bench and heavy bag) in the garage. The rear deck collects sunlight, and is furnished for 8. Interaction with Guests We will not be present during your stay, but we will provide a detailed set of operating instructions for the house, and you are free to contact us at any time via phone, email or text. We also have a caretaker in the neighborhood in case of emergencies. The Neighborhood The property is a serene natural setting along a quiet street on Sharon Mountain, 1.5 miles from the center of town. The yard is excellent for birdwatching, and has two Eastern Bluebird houses visible from the rear deck. The property is surrounded by forested area and open fields, with only a few, distant neighbors. Despite the serenity, the property is close to town - only 1 mile from groceries, gas, liquor, pharmacy, restaurants and hospital. There are a few nice restaurants in Sharon, and many more in the neighboring towns of Amenia NY, Millerton NY and Lakeville CT - each a 10 min drive. The Hotchkiss School is 10 minutes away and offers public golf. Lime Rock Raceway is a 15 minute drive, and Catamount Ski Area offers skiing (winter) or the ropes course (summer) only 40 minutes away. The Appalachian Trail and Housatonic River are only minutes away, and offer excellent outdoors activity. Getting Around You will need a car for getting around. Driveway parking is available, and the garage can accommodate 1 car or SUV. Other Things to Note We will provide a detailed set of operating instructions for the house. The house is monitored by a security service, and a caretaker lives right down the street and can be called in case of emergency. + More
rules: House Rules Please, no smoking or pets in the house. Trash and recycleables are to be bagged separately and stored in bins in the garage. We do also ask that you take care around the great room furniture, in particular the sofas, coffee table and rug. + More

about: Our Bell Island home is on a tidal estuary called Farm Creek. The creek is fed by the Long Island Sound and the rear porch faces west for incredible waterfront sunsets. Bell Island is a private community and the perfect place to relax and unwind!
description: Description The Space This unique home perched on the waters edge can comfortably sleep five. Guests have two private waterfront decks overlooking a garden with firepit and seating for four. The first floor deck has two loungers and a dining table that seats six. The third floor deck has two comfortable adirondeck chairs looking out over the water and enjoys views of the abundant wildlife of Farm Creek, a protected preserve. The view from the third floor is exceptional and our favorite place on the property. It's the perfect spot to enjoy a morning coffee, evening cocktail, or sit with a laptop or tablet to work or hop on the internet. There is cable television in the living room and each bedroom and also air conditioning and wifi throughout the grounds. We usually see about two tide changes per day and at high tide you can launch one of our two kayaks or a paddle board right off the back deck. We live here year round but we feel like we are constantly on vacation : ) Another notable aspect of the property is a private courtyard between the house and the garage. The entire property is fenced in at the front of the house too, so it's set up to allow your dog to roam freely without worrying they will get into the street. The first floor is an open format and very family friendly as you can always have your eyes on your little ones. The kitchen was updated with brand new appliances only two years ago and is perfect for the home chef. From the kitchen island you can look out onto Farm Creek and enjoy the water view at high tide or sunset in the evening. What we find most appealing about the property is the location. We are a short 1-2 minute walk from two beautiful private beaches on the Long Island Sound. Our favorite is East Beach, which looks out over a mooring field and onto nearby Tavern Island and Sheffield Island. Both islands are navigable by kayak or paddle board if you are willing to expend some effort and get a good workout in! Another great aspect of the location is a large private park a couple hundred yards from our front door. The park has a backstop and some benches along the water and is a perfect place to take your kids or your morning coffee...or espresso from our Nespresso esspresso maker! Then there is Rocky Point, a truly magnificent private park about a five minute walk from our front door. The park juts out into the sound and on a clear day you will enjoy exceptional views of Long Island and the NYC skyline about 35 miles away. As for the general accommodations, the master bedroom on the 2nd floor has a queen bed for two. The space can accommodate a crib at the foot of the bed but a crib would also fit in the master bathroom which is quite large, about 12ft x 8ft, and only steps from the bed. The third floor has another queen bed and a single bed and there is an aero mattress in the closet should you need it. We've also had guests sleep on our couch in the living room, which is deep enough one might refer to it as more of a daybed than a couch. So all in, the house can comfortably accommodate five people; two in the master queen, two in the 3rd floor queen, and then one more in the 3rd floor single bed. But if you needed to, you could fit two more on the aero bed and another on the couch in the living room. From NYC, our house is about a one hour train ride on the New Haven train line out of Grand Central Station. Guest Access Our guests enjoy access to three bicycles, two kayaks, two paddle boards, and access to two private beaches on Long Island Sound. The house has two full baths (one off the master and one in the 2nd foor hallway) and and two half baths, (one on the first floor off the living room and one on the third floor). The back patio has a large three burner grill and is an incredible atmosphere for a BBQ. Interaction with Guests How much we interact with you is up to you. You can reach us if you have questions but our goal is to truly let you enjoy the comfort of your temporary home. The Neighborhood We live in a private association called Bell Island. We are surrounded by incredible views of Long Island Sound and Farm Creek Preserve and our beaches are reserved for use by residents and their guests only, so you never have to worry about crowds. Getting Around There is not public transit but taxi's are available and parking is included with your stay (up to four cars). The best way to get here from the airport is a taxi or rental car. As for local transportation, a bicycle or kayak is the best way to get around and explore the area, and we have three bikes, two kayaks, and a paddle board that you are free to use. You can also easily walk to main street where there is an ice cream parlor, a country market, post office, hardware store, pizza shop, and two incredible restaurants. Other Things to Note The private deck faces west and we think the sunset from the deck is one of the best in the world : ) + More

about: A private, outdoor retreat set on the historic Farmington River. The property is available for people looking for a natural space to spend time with family and friends. It is also available to television and film production studios for set locations.
description: Description The Space This totally private retreat has 500 feet of river frontage and great water views from every room. The wooded lot sweeps down to a camp site on the river with a gazebo, fireplace and electricity. The home sits back 75 feet from the banks of the Farmington River, a famous fishing stream in the Northeast. The kitchen/dining area is designed for gourmet cooking and big dinner parties ... complete with Viking appliances. The great room overlooks the river and has a cozy stone fireplace. Downstairs there's a movie studio and an exercise room. An 10 mile path loops along the river to provide outdoor opportunities for hiking, mountain biking and cross country skiing. Owner provides guided hiking tours (if scheduling permits). High speed Internet access, cable TV and parking. Thirty minutes from historic Hartford. Approximately 2 hour drive to New York or Boston. The property is also available for television and film sets. Many productions have been filmed here, including PBS productions. Special rates apply, please contact me via airbnb to learn more or to scout the property in advance of your production. There is a large garage for staging equipment. Guest Access Internet, washer, dryer, garage, exercise room, television, Apple TV, Netflix, river camping. Interaction with Guests I'm happy to meet guests upon arrival to show them around the home and the river to provide information about the area. description: Description The Space This listing is for the entire home available a few dates in summer 2016. The master suite has a private deck that overlooks a 70 foot tall copper beech. Master bath is a full with a large shower (not a bath tub). The two additional bedrooms share a hall bathroom which is a tub/shower. The laundry room is in a bright white space in the lower level basement. about: Family friendly with lots of room.
description: Description The Space What people love: *Lots of room *large outdoor spaces *new kitchens and baths *great for jogging or walking, lots of sidewalks *unique property Things to note: *older home, most rooms are remodeled *located about 3 miles off the exit, away from downtown in a rural setting *suggest using a gps *no central air but there are window units in all except the captains room Located in the Quaker Hill section of Waterford, Connecticut "Sea Glass" is a historic home listed on the national registry in a rustic setting. Master: large room, queen bed and bathroom with shower Greenroom: large room, queen bed Orange room: smaller room, lovely full bed Blue room: full bed, currently used as a childs bedroom Captains room: large room, two twin beds Built in the early 1900's Sea Glass is historically unique with 9' ceilings and listed on the National Historic registry as a Colonial Revival, with baths and the kitchen redone in 2010. All living areas have been updated and completed, however we're always taking on more projects. Close to the Coast Guard Academy, Casinos, colleges and public transportation. Family friendly with 2 indoor cats and 1 small dog. The home has a unique history and was even a nursing home at one time. At one time, there was a wine cellar in the basement, beautiful gardens in the back, a large gazebo behind the house in the woods and functioning servant's quarters in the attic. The old owners were such garden enthusiasts that they used cold boxes outside with electricity running to them for early planting. Guest Access guests have full access to the house Interaction with Guests We are always reach reachable but will not be on site The Neighborhood It is a beautiful neighborhood nestled in the heart of historic Quaker Hill. Many of our neighbors will wave to you while you stroll around on wide sidewalks taking in the beautiful turn-of-the-century homes. Close to new London, montville, Norwich, niantic, old Lyme and many more shoreline towns. Groceries can be deliverd through peadpod Getting Around The Yellow Cab company as well as others is just a phone call away and it's about a $20 fare to Mohegan sun. We're about 4 miles away from the new London train station and also have a main bus line called the SEAT. Uber is all available in the area and is our choice These make Sea Glass a convenient option when concerts or game playing go late into the night. + More
rules: House Rules clean up after yourselves Dishes should be washed and put away Trash taken out No guests in the house that aren't on the original reservation or pre-approved. about: A truly unique house, located just 1.5 hours from NYC, features fireplaces, a ping pong table, and indoor lounge areas. The house sits on a 50 acre property with a brook, wooded trails, and plenty of nearby activities. Perfect for a relaxing trip!
description: Description The Space The house features 5 bedrooms, 4 full and 3 half baths. The large kitchen is fully equipped with plates, pots, and utensils and has a large island with stools, great for cooking with a group. There are three separate terraces for hanging out in small groups, an entertainment room with a large TV, and a full-size ping pong table for indoor entertainment. In addition, the following amenities are included: *Kitchen with the essentials, a stove, refrigerator, and microwave *Wifi & Smart TV *Indoor fireplaces *Large charcoal grill and ample outdoor seating *Outdoor games, croquet set, and board games *A/C, heating, doorbell and dimmable lights *Washer / dryer *Hangers and closet space *Pillows and comforters / blankets for each bed. Guests need to provide their own towels (indoor and outdoor if needed), sheets, pillow cases, etc. One roll of toilet paper provided in each bathroom. Guest Access Guests have completely private access to the house and a few of the surrounding woodland trails. The house is a 20-minute drive from the closest Peter Pan bus station and Metro North train station in Danbury, CT. Interaction with Guests We're available to answer questions you have and give recommendations in the area. Take a look at the Guidebook for a few of our favorite places! The Neighborhood The house is surrounded by a beautifully wooded area, a brook, historic dirt road, as well as lake Lillinonah. There are nearby walking trails and always a sense of serenity. If you'd like to take a break from relaxing, there are some great places to eat, a winery, mini-golf, theater, and plenty of shopping and entertainment within a 10-20 minute drive. Check out the Guidebook / Map for a few of my favorite places. Getting Around The house is a ten minute drive from the center of town and a seven minute drive from I-84. The nearest train and bus station for picking up guests is Danbury, CT, a 20 minute drive from the house. Other Things to Note This house is located in the middle of woodlands / nature, it's likely you will see animals like deer, possums, insects, butterflies, birds, etc. This should be part of the charm for anyone staying here! + More

description: Description The Space The house has recently had a complete renovation and is decorated to luxury standards. There is a concert quality Steinway grand piano in the living room and seating for ten in the dining room. Kitchen use under the supervision of the caretaker. Limited number of children under the supervision of adults at all times. There are five available bedrooms and two and a half bathrooms, one of which has an over-sized vintage tub. The library has a large collection of books plus an entertainment center hidden behind closing panels. The house has WiFi and also has a security system. Outside there is a flagstone patio that can accommodate twelve for outdoor eating. A smaller brick patio can seat six for breakfast outdoors. The extensive grounds (26 acres) include formal and informal landscaping, a perennial border, a croquet lawn, a vegetable garden and woods with paths and a stream. Located on a little used dirt road, the house has almost total privacy. We are located 5 minutes away from a lake with a beautiful sandy beach. Guest Access Wildlife Viewing Horseback Riding Camping, Hiking Downhill Skiing, Cross Country Skiing, Swimming, Sailing Fishing Theaters, Cinemas, Tennis, Sightseeing, Shopping, Restaurants, Racquetball, Museums, Golf, Fitness Center, Gym, Biking, Basketball Some of these activities require fees or special equipment. Interaction with Guests Guests will be greeted on arrival and given breakfast service on the first night. Resident caretakers are in an adjacent apartment and are available for help with luggage or any questions regarding the mechanics of the house or things to do in the area, The Neighborhood Beautiful natural surroundings with lush gardens and plentiful wildlife. Charming traditional town green with colonial buildings, Near to Appalachian trail and regional Audubon nature center plus canoeing or fishing on the Housatonic River Getting Around No public transportation; cars or bikes are the best way to get around. description: Description The Space Our newly built Spacious 4 Bedroom Nantucket Shingle Style home is located at the end of a quiet cul de sac, Situated on 4+ private acres, in a park like setting. Expansive flat lawn. French Doors Galore! Light Bright & Open! Large Gourmet Kitchen, Nice Deck for relaxing! A Private yet convenient getaway! Living Areas - Gourmet Country Kitchen with French Doors open to Deck for entertaining & adjoins Family Room. - Family room with Walls of French Doors, Large Flat Screen TV & Fireplace. - Living Room with Fireplace & Wetbar, & Flat Screen TV Bedrooms 1- 1st Floor Bedroom Suite, Flat Screen TV 2- Spacious Master suite with Fireplace, & Flat Screen TV 3- Bedroom with Cathedral Ceilings 3- Bedroom with twin beds Outdoors - Cedar Deck with Adirondack Chairs for Relaxing - Hammock - Fire pit -Wifi -Cable TV w/ Premium Channels Guest Access Guest will have use of Entire House We have a cat named Pepper that lives on the Property. Interaction with Guests We are there to meet guests on arrival, & be accessible buy phone if needed during your stay. The Neighborhood Our home is privately located at the end of a quiet cul de sac in a suburban neighborhood just minutes from Simsbury town center. It is located near scenic bike trails, & picturesque Tobacco Barns, you can enjoy a nice walk/run anytime of the day. 15 Minutes From Bradley International Airport 20 Minutes to Ski Sundown Ski Area Other Things to Note The Town of Simsbury is the quintessential New England town, situated on the Farmington River. Enjoy a stroll through town, dinner at one of our towns casual or fine dining restaurants, shopping or ice cream parlors. Simsbury Meadows is home to the Talcott Mountain Music Festival and The Hartford Symphony, where many gather during the Summer months with a picnic basket & bottle of wine for a night of music & dancing. Looking for some Winter Fun? Ski Sundown is just 20 minutes away. The East Coast Greenway runs through Simsbury and provides bikers, runners and walkers an opportunity to enjoy the Beauty of the Farmington Valley. Bikes are available free of charge in several locations throughout town. There are also many parks, pools & golf courses in town. about: ASK FOR OUR SPECIAL LIMITED OFFER *BUY 2 NIGHTS GET 1 FREE* Large Charming Historic New England Ppty, nice garden,25,000 SF, central, up to 14 guests, 5 mins to Beaches, walk to restaurants, ideal for family and friends reunions, weddings and events.
description: Description The Space ***The discount is mainly for July-August 2015 bookings. The 3rd night free must be a weekday: no Saturdays or Sundays. It may apply to other off-season dates. Feel free to ask. How to apply directly ? If your booking is for July-August 2015, inquire or book directly 2 nights only and we'll adjust for the 3rd without charge provided it's not a Sunday or a Saturday**** Note: in the past we had to cancel some double bookings because of technical issues with AirBnB calendar not synchronizing with the calendar of other websites. The issue has been resolved since then. __________________________________ This is a Large and Charming Historic house in the pure New England Style, with a fire place, perfect for family reunions, weddings and other gatherings of responsible guests, but absolutely not for prom parties and alike =:) . We offer catering for weddings and similar events at a very affordable price when the cook is a 5 star chef and the quality is top ! There is plenty of parking space available in the backyard. The garden in front and on the side can welcome your party on a quarter of an acre. The house is ***HUGE***, most of the pictures show a fraction at a time. It sleeps up to 14 persons, in 5 bedrooms. It has 2 bathrooms, a kitchem a dining room and a living room, and a ***fireplace*** It's located close to the Old Saybrook Beaches and in the Center of the town.J The house features 3500 square ft and a barn. Also includes a large yard with a beautiful wrap around porch. . This house has 5 spacious bedroom. , 2 bathrooms and a brand new washer and dryer. GREAT PLACE TO HOLD EVENT, ANNIVERSARY, MEETINGS,REUNION, GETAWAYS ETC. Conveniently located at equal distance of of New York City and Boston, with AMTRAK train station. Offering three homes on the Connecticut shoreline as vacation rental properties in Old Saybrook and Guilford for the past seven years, we take great pride in caring for our guests as well as in accommodating and tending to their needs and comfort. Our homes are designed with local art and treasures and reflect our love and passion for decoration, beauty and the creation of aesthetic surroundings which welcome and embrace you. Our goal is to provide a setting where you, your family and your friends can enjoy, relax and create memories that will last a lifetime. Our reviews testify to this and consistently reveal the happiness and joy our guests have experienced while staying at our properties. ------------------------- The Area... Experience New England's shoreline year round at one of Old Saybrook's most desirable and family friendly areas. Spend the day basking in the sun at the Saybrook Manor Association private beach club, have your children playing at the children's playground of the Club, enjoy all sort of social events, or go for a change to one of the 2 beaches just a five-minutes walk away. Need a break from the beach ? Stop to dine at some fine restaurants nearby. Travel just a little further and visit Mystic Aquarium, Mystic Seaport, take a ride with your kids across the countryside, see Beautiful New England the old-fashioned way on the Essex Historic steam train, enjoy a cruise on the Connecticut River or enjoy an evening at the Mohegan Casino. Peddle along the ocean side at sunset, head to the shops along Main Street or take a ten-minute drive to the shopping outlets ! Guest Access You have a huge garden, a porch, a nice greenhouse and other charming places to sit and relax on the property. Plenty of parking space. Interaction with Guests I am available to assist my guests from 8 AM to 8 PM and later in case of serious emergencies that can't wait until the next day. I live in a house 2 blocks away, nearby. I have been hosting guests on the 3 properties listed here in CT since 2005. The Neighborhood We are 5 mins from beaches by car (beach passes provided), walking distance to restaurants on Boston Post Road and minutes from food stores and commercial centers, including organic food stores. + More

about: Beautifully renovated Federal style home nestled in country, private walking trails with breathtaking views in a natural setting abutting a state park with waterfalls and streams. Perfect for a large family, several couples or six singles
description: Description The Space Our listing is unique due to the many walking trails throughout the 400 acre estate. We have a beautiful pond, open fields and we are right next door to the Devil's Hopyard State Forest. If you enjoy hiking, you will love it here! Nearby is the Goodspeed Opera House, Gillettes Castle State Park, and the quaint towns of Chester and Essex with galleries, shops and restaurants. Interaction with Guests We try to give our guests as much privacy as possible during their stay. We do not stay on the premises so that you have the whole house to yourselves. We will always be a phone call away with any problems that may be encountered or any questions you may have. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is quite rural with winding country roads, farm markets, pastures and several State Parks within our town alone. East Haddam is located along the CT River and has many streams running through the area. We are known for excellent hiking locations. We are very close to Chester and to Essex, both quaint little towns for shopping and sightseeing with many choices for dining. Getting Around The CT Town Transit Bus is available when you call ahead for pick-up reservations and is very economical. + More
rules: House Rules We expect our guests to be respectful of our house and leave the house in the same condition it was upon arrival. We prefer not to have parties or events that can cause damage to the property. Some gatherings are OK with prior approval. + More

about: Unique country property in bucolic Litchfield. Perfect for artist retreats, gallery showings, parties, company retreats and family reunions. We can accommodate various size groups for events or overnight stays.
description: Description The Space The large barn's beautiful main gallery can be used in so many creative ways: use your imagination! Sleeping accommodations for 8-12 guests are available. The Neighborhood The property is centrally located in the beautiful hills of Litchfield County, minutes from the quaint town of Litchfield. White Memorial Preserve with more than 35 miles of trails is only ten minutes away and is open year around for hiking, biking, cross-country skiing and horse back riding. Ski at nearby Mohawk Mountain, pick pumpkins across the road and explore Mt. Tom, Steep Rock, Cornwall covered bridge, Kent Falls, Lake Waramaug, Squantz Pond and Roxbury Land Trust. Visit Arethusa Dairy in Bantam and beautiful White Flower Farm. Go antiquing or visit the many art galleries and museums in the area. Shop at the Litchfield Farmers Market on Saturdays and South Farms Market in Morris on Sundays or drive the Connecticut Wine Trail. Visit the nearby villages of Bantam, New Preston, Kent, Cornwall, Morris, Bridgewater and Washington. Getting Around You will need a car to enjoy the sights. We are one hour from Bradley International Airport in Hartford, two hours from New York City and three hours from Boston. The closest public transit is Southbury with Peter Pan Bus service from NYC or Boston. MetroNorth has trains from Danbury to New York and into Brewster NY. Other Things to Note We will work with you to accommodate your special event or gathering. + More

The property is direct waterfront and is on the east shore, so it is wonderfully situated for viewing evening sunsets over the water. The cottage offers 2 bedrooms plus a loft, a large country style kitchen, a fieldstone fireplace and beautiful covered front porch facing the water. The grounds of the property include a private waterfront dock, expansive lawn, children's swing set, outdoor dining area and an outdoor shower. The cottage is designed to suit living outdoors in the beautiful Spring, Summer and Fall months. This cottage is well appointed and very private. This is a very unique property located on the sought after East Shore. We accommodate non-smokers only. Pets negotiatble. Kayak available. + More

about: This professionally decorated home is only a few years old and includes everything you will need to enjoy a great vacation in Downtown Mystic CT including central air conditioning for summer months. Just bring your toothbrush!
description: Description The Space This professionally decorated home is only a few years old and includes everything you will need to enjoy a great vacation in Downtown Mystic including central air conditioning for summer months. Just bring your toothbrush! We are located within a 5 minute walk to downtown Mystic and Seaport. This private home also includes a garage, family room with a sauna, work out equipment, tv, stereo & bar and Wi-Fi. With french glass doors that open to a beautiful landscape back yard. 5 Elm Place is a 3,000 sq ft home with 3 floors of living space that offers an open floor plan with central air conditioning. The first floor has a fully equipped granite/stainless steel kitchen which open to a dining & family room area with a flat screen tv & stereo system. Along with a half bath and laundry room there is a separate formal sitting room. Porches adorn the front with rocking chairs and back porch with table and chairs and propane gas grill for barbecuing and a outdoor patio area with seating for Al Fresco dining and fire pit! The 2nd floor consists of a master bedroom ensuite with full bath, king size bed and flat screen tv. There are two additional bedrooms on this floor with queen size beds and another full bath. An additional queen size air mattress is available if needed. The lower level consist of another large family room with TV, exercise equipment, sauna and bar. If luxury and comfort with all the modern conveniences and close proximity to downtown Mystic is what your looking for, it's all right here! We look forward to having you stay! If we don't have availability for the dates you are looking for check out our Groton Long Point Home only a few miles away. Guest Access The entire house Interaction with Guests Only a phone call away The Neighborhood Walking distance to Downtown Mystic, Seaport and Mystic Train Depot, shops and restaurants. + More

description: Description Other Things to Note GUESTS/RENTERS Please list the names of all guests that will be occupying the property. Only registered guests will have access to the property in case of emergency purposes during your stay. GUEST NAMEAGE GUEST NAMEAGE GUEST NAMEAGE GUEST NAMEAGE + More
rules: House Rules SECURITY DEPOSITS The purpose of the security deposit is to protect the home and it's contents from malicious or negligent damage and/or the home being left in abnormally dirty conditions resulting in excessive cleaning costs (i.e. carpet/furniture stains, furniture damage, broken or stolen items, etc.). The house should be kept in the same condition as guest check in. It is unlawful to remove any items from the home. It is the tenant's responsibility to report, upon arrival, any damages found and/or any repairs or maintenance needed. You are responsible for any and all damages that occur to the property or its contents by you or any other member of your group while you are the registered occupant of the property. If the cleaning company detects any evidence of smoking in the home you will be billed an additional $250 to deodorize the home. CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT TIMES In order to supply our guests a clean unit and avoid delays we ask that all guests abide by our check-in time of 4:00 pm. and check-out time of 11:00 a.m. $25.00 per hour charge for early/late check in/out, if available. KEYS There is no need for us to mail you keys because you will gain access to our home with a combination lock code, which will be sent to you prior to check-in. Early check-in is strictly prohibited, without prior consent from The Beach House, as time is needed to clean the premises for your arrival. LINENS AND HOUSEWARES All bed linens and towels are provided. A washer and dryer are on the premises for your use. An initial supply of hand soap and toilet paper are provided along with house wares. We suggest you bring your own beach towels and beach chairs, and other kitchen and bathroom convenience items. Bath towels are not to be taken out of the property for any other use. MAXIMUM OCCUPANCY The number of guests occupying the property is limited to 6 tenants with the exception of an infant requiring a crib. The named guests as shown on attached Exhibit A shall be a complete listing of all guests from arrival date until departure. These limits are strictly enforced. No mobile homes or campers of any sort will be allowed on the property. No visitors are allowed without prior written consent from the owner. Violations of any occupancy conditions is grounds for your security deposit not being refunded and immediate eviction without refund of rent or deposit. PARKING All watercraft and watercraft trailers are to be parked on parking lot. We respect the rights of our neighbors and strictly enforce parking. This agreement allows for a total of 3 parking spaces. Any illegally parked cars are subject to towing; applicable fines/towing fees and is the sole responsibility of the vehicle owner. NO BOAT OR WATERCRAFT USAGE IS INCLUDED WITH RENTAL Half and full day boat rentals are available through local marinas. Feel free to bring your own canoes and kayaks. NO SMOKING IS ALLOWED Any extra cleaning charges, including but not limited to carpet, furniture, draperies or bedding, because of smoking will be deducted from the security deposit. Smoking is not allowed inside or outside. Candles are not to be burned inside or outside the premises. Violations will be charged $500 fees. CHILDRE(URL HIDDEN) The home is NOT child proofed. We do not have child proof locks on any cabinets or doors and there are not gates to keep children from entering specific rooms. The yard is NOT fenced. Upon arrival, you may want to put items you think your child may get into away or up on higher shelves. Any child proof items needed for your children must be brought with the renter. NO PET AGREEMENT No pets are allowed on the property. Penalty will include forfeiture of security deposit plus an additional breach of contract fee of $500.00 and eviction of tenants. There are no exceptions to this policy. QUIET TIME/RESIDENTIAL PURPOSES Our quiet time rule is 11 pm to 7 am and is strictly enforced. The premises shall be used for residential purposes only. Renter(s) shall peacefully and quietly occupy the premises and shall not interfere with the rights of our neighbors/tenants. We respect the rights of our neighbors. Renter(s) shall permit no activities on the premises, which are contrary to any law, ordinance and/or applicable health and/or fire department or insurance policy provisions. Penalty will include forfeiture of your security deposit. OUTSIDE ACTIVITES The Town of Old Saybrook" strictly prohibits bonfires or contained fires. Our home is located within the limits; therefore, this rule is strictly enforced. REPAIRS Appliances, toilets, heating /air conditioning systems and all mechanics are continually checked and kept maintained. However, we cannot guarantee a mechanical may not malfunction during your stay. We make every effort to have repairs made as quickly as possible. No refunds will be made for failure or damage HOUSEKEEPING There is cleaning fee per rental period. The home will be ready for you upon check-in and will be cleaned after you depart. If you require additional housekeeping during your stay please contact the owner. Please rinse the sand off your feet and shoes before entering the house, extra charge for removal of sand in the house. If the place is left exceptionally messy, owner reserves the right to charge extra cleaning fee. BEFORE DEPARTING GUESTS ARE REQUIRED TO Clean dishes and cookware and place in cabinets. Lock all windows and doors. Leave furniture and dcor/games/accessories in original location and condition. Turn air conditioner off in summer and heat to 54 degrees in winter. Leave the beach house in as good condition as when you receive it. USE OF WASHER/DRYER The use of our washer and dryer is available to all guests. SKIS/BOARDS/WATER TOYS Please refrain from bringing water skis, snow skis/boards into the interior of the (URL HIDDEN) BOOK/USER GUIDE To make your vacation more enjoyable, we have tried to think of everything and include it in a binder...your "Area Guide" can be found on the kitchen counter. Please DO NOT remove from the property. This guide is filled with brochures from restaurants, retail shopping stores, attractions, maps, phone numbers and numerous things to do during your stay. INDEMNIFICATION The guest agrees to indemnify and save individual homeowner and the Beach House free and harmless for any liabilities or any loss or damages whatsoever arising from, related to, or in connection with rental of the premises. This includes, but is not limited to any claim or liability for personal injury or damage or loss of property, which is made, incurred or sustained, by guest or guests of guest, or any occupants of the premises. Renter(s), their family and guests bear the risk of any injury. It is further understood that the Beach House and owner shall not be responsible for any personal property left at the property by renters. TERMINATION OF RENTAL We reserve the right to refuse or discontinue tenancy if in its opinion the guest is detrimental to the property. We reserve the right to enter the property should we believe any of the above policies are being violated. Any violation of the above mentioned policies would result in immediate eviction with loss of the entire rental and security deposit amounts. HOLDING OVER Guest agrees that occupancy of the premises beyond the ending date and time shall be considered a trespass unless this Agreement is extended in writing. Guest acknowledges their status as a Guest within the meaning of the innkeeper statute, subject to removal at the end of the term agreed upon herein. + More

description: Description The Space Canoe, 2 kayaks, hot and cold outside shower, large side yard with beach views, NO TENTS ALLOWED, deck overlooking water, stairs down to beach. We don't have wifi or cable. There's a TV and DVD player. This is a Saturday to Saturday rental. Interaction with Guests Please don't hesitate to call with any questions during your stay. Other Things to Note The kitchen is fully equipped with food processor, lobster pot, pots and pans, juicer, spices and a variety of cook books - all that you need to cook elaborately or throw together a quick meal. Amenities include a hot outdoor shower (This is an old house-hot water is affected when more than one person is using it!), a large, screened porch with ping-pong table and wicker furniture, 1/4 acre lawn (croquet!), and an outdoor dining and seating area with a charcoal grill. Stairs lead down past a small storage house filled with beach chairs, umbrellas and sand toys to a private beach that boasts beautiful sunsets and an amazing sandbar at low tide. (The beach is shared by 4 other nearby homes.) The neighborhood has quiet streets for morning and evening walks, runs or bike rides. The Westbrook Outlets and Clinton Crossing Mall are minutes away. The Casinos and historic Mystic Seaport (and Aquarium) are 30 minutes away. Also nearby are the Ivoryton Playhouse, the Goodspeed Opera House, the Essex Steam Train, Gillette Castle, and many Connecticut Vineyards. Easy access to the Westbrook, Clinton and Old Saybrook train stations (trains to New York City or Boston). + More
