about: Relax at our comfortable home on one of the most peaceful lakes in Connecticut. Located 2 hrs from NYC and 2 1/2 hrs from Boston, perfect for a weekend getaway to enjoy swimming, canoeing, kayaking, fishing, hiking, biking, or skiing in the winter.
description: Description The Space This elegant home has recently been remodeled and refurnished. It has 4 bedrooms and 7 beds. It has a gigantic screened in porch overlooking where you can enjoy the fair breezes coming off the lake and dive into a good book. The property has a nice sized level yard, perfect for playing a game of badminton, catch, or kicking around a soccer ball. There is a gazebo under some birch trees on the waterfront. There is a small sandy beach area with kids toys and a fire pit for roasting marshmallows over a campfire. It has a cozy wood burning fireplace in the living room. The house has extensive marble throughout the main floor, including the bathrooms. The master bathroom also has a large jacuzzi bath tub. The entire house rents together as a package, individual bedrooms rooms of the house are not for rent. We will not be living at the house when you come to stay, it is all yours to enjoy. The house is on West Hill Lake which is one of the cleanest lakes in Connecticut. The lake has an 8 horse power motor restriction, which makes it one of the most peaceful lakes and allows everyone to enjoy swimming, sailing, canoeing, kayaking, and paddle boarding safely. We are also located nearby Ski Sundown for winter skiing and the Boy Scout Camps on the lake have abundant cross country skiing trails. The lake also sustains an abundant variety of fish and is stocked by the State of Connecticut. It has Kokanee Salmon, Rainbow Trout, Brook Trout, Brown Trout, Small Mouth Bass, Blue Gill, Sunfish, Bullhead, & Pickerels; a record 16lb. Brown Trout was just caught this year from the lake. We are conveniently located 40 minutes from Hartford (Bradley International Airport), 2 hrs from NYC, and 2 1/2 hrs from Boston by car. There is a canoe and 2 kayaks available for your use. Help yourself to the Bowflex exercise machine in the basement. The Neighborhood West Hill Lake is the perfect place to relax and rejuvenate in scenic, peaceful Northwest Connecticut. Our lake is on a hilltop, surrounded by hundreds of acres of lush forest of evergreens, sugar maples, and birch trees which is a spectacle to see when the fall colors come out. Outdoor enthusiasts have a lot of choices for recreation. In addition to all the different ways to enjoy the lake, there are also quiet scenic roads for road biking, shady bike paths for family riding, hiking trails along the Farmington river, vineyards for wine tasting, cross country ski trails, downhill skiing at Ski Sundown is only 10 minutes away, or go prowling for antiques at antique malls, shops or tag sales. Getting Around We are conveniently located 40 minutes from Bradley International Airport (Hartford), 2 hrs from NYC, and 2 1/2 hrs from Boston by car. The closest train stop is Amtrak in Waterbury which is about + More
rules: House Rules Sorry, but we do not allow smoking in the house. We also do not allow underage drinking of alcohol or drug use. West Hill Lake is a very quiet place to visit and enjoy relaxation and recreation. We are only looking for guests who are going to be respectful of our neighbors and our property. If you are interested in throwing a party at our house, then keep looking for another house to rent. + More

description: Description The Space This just-renovated small country estate dates from the 1700s, with original wide chestnut floors, and all the period detail preserved. Gathering spaces are large and gracious, with two living rooms, each with a fireplace, and a dining room looking out onto a backyard terrace, pool, stream, pond, and two red barns (one is early 1800s original). Altogether 12+ acres and across the street from the expansive Steep Rock nature preserve with excellent hiking and cross-country skiing. Two minutes to adorable, classic New England town center, with excellent restaurants, the outstanding Hickory Stick bookshop, coffee shop, and shopping. Also close to Lake Waramaug, 25 min from Mohawk Mountain for skiing in winter, and near many apple orchards and blueberry farms. There are 5 bedrooms, 3 with queen beds (one on the ground floor), one with two twin beds, and one with one twin. Three full bathrooms, including three showers and one bath. A recently updated heated gunite pool has a jacuzzi spa (open only in summer). Beautiful perennial gardens bloom throughout the spring and summer. There is an enormity of wildlifebirds chirping in the maple, hemlock, and apple trees, and frogs croaking in the pondso that you feel truly removed from city life. Please note: We are not set up for large events (e.g. weddings) at our home. + More

One bedroom features a double bed and the other a Queen size bed. Of the five bedrooms, three have tv's in them. The bedrooms are all generous in size, comparing them to other waterfronts Guest Access This wonderful large home is ALL yours for your elected dates. about: Contemporary home in rural Redding, CT. Secluded property with views of Saugatuck River. Protected land across the river connects with miles of hiking trails and NYC train is 1 mile down the road. House includes hot tub, steam room and home theater.
description: Description The Space Located in rural Redding, CT, the home is an updated contemporary 5-level space with three individual bedrooms. Large multi-story windows look out across the River and connect the downstairs living area and home theater to the lofted kitchen and dining. A 'yoga/fitness' space with floor to ceiling windows looking over the river includes a TV, rowing machine, spin bike and weights, this room can be converted to another sleeping space upon request. The Master Suite is on the main level and includes a king-bed as well as free-standing soaker tub, dual shower and steam room. The other bedrooms share the top floor with one queen bed and the other two twin beds, the bedrooms share a full bath with tub. Outside there is a 700sqft 3-level deck with lounge chairs, dining area for 6, gas grill and 6-person hot tub. In addition there is a natural stone fire-pit with ample supply of firewood. Across the river the "Firehouse Trail" connects with the nearby Saugatuck Falls Recreation Area. Guest Access Guest will have access to all of the house including 1 garage bay. Interaction with Guests Depending on arrival we may be around for introduction but will provide a detailed guide. The Neighborhood Redding is sometimes referred to as the "Vermont of Fairfield County". Large trees, steep hills and numerous parks and protect areas make it a wonderful place to enjoy nature. Several local farms, creameries and orchards can be found in Redding or in the nearby towns of Bethel and Ridgefield. But even with that nature and seclusion Danbury Fair Mall is just 10 minutes down the road and CT's Gold Coast is 25 minutes South. Getting Around While only a mile from the Redding MetroNorth train station having a car is highly recommended, very limited restaurants and no grocery stores are within walking distance. + More

about: Classic Craftsman Shingled Beach Cottage built in 1917. Wrap-around porch, Balcony, Waterviews, flower-filled yard. Beach only 75 ft away. Unique New England community with seaside walks, 3 beaches, woodland paths. Private home, not a typical rental
description: Description The Space Groton Long Point, Connecticut. PLEASE NOTE: This is our private home, rarely rented. It may be available for longer-term or shorter- term stays that are difficult to post here on Airbnb. The best thing is to contact us directly at the email below in the body of this message before trying to book specific dates. Whenever possible we would like to meet our guests in advance to give them a house tour & orientation. Nonetheless, some last minute stays may be possible. * 5 miles from Mystic Seaport; 4 miles south of I-95, Exit 88 or 89. * Several nearby, marinas. * Airport: GON (Groton-New London) is 6 miles away. * Train: AMTRAK service to Westerly, Rhode Island, Mystic Seaport, & New London, CT. * Ferry Service from Fisher's Island & Orient Point, Long Island to New London, CT Contemplative space for an artist or academic. Ideal for a single person or a couple. This year round home is furnished with antiques and a scholarly library; it is 75 feet from the beach. Built in 1917, the twostorey cottage has views of Long Island Sound & Noank Harbor. The main floor has a wrap-around porch. Upstairs, two of the bedrooms open to a shaded balcony. Approximate interior space is 1300 sq ft. Original beaded boarding and yellow pine floors still grace the interior. Upstairs: * 4 small rooms w/ closets (2 are currently furnished w/ beds(URL HIDDEN)room w/ double bed & covered balcony, 1 small room w/ a single bed 3rd room with daybed/banquette under a sloping ceiling. 4th upstairs room is owner's storage area * Glassed-in sun-porch * Bathroom w/ large shower (no tub) * Hallway * Exterior balcony w/ water views Downstairs: * Living room * Dining room * Spacious kitchen * Powder room (sink & WC only) * Large, covered porch with dining table & seating areas. Wicker porch furniture. Basement: * Location of washer, dryer, water heater, furnace, electrical panel. Parking: Gravel driveway w/ space for 2 medium-sized cars GLP Porch Front Steps in July Please noteours is one of the few early, shingled homes remaining in Groton Long Point. To protect its unique character, it has had minimal remodeling. There is a dishwasher, refrigerator, and updated electrical panel w/ circuit breakers. No TV now. Bathrooms and kitchen retain their vintage character. Washer & dryer are in basement, which has separate ground-level entrance. The house is raised on stone pillars; two exterior sets of steps lead to the porch and first floor. There is one interior staircase from living room to bedrooms and full bath on second floor. Our home would not be practical for small children or anyone with restricted mobility, but it might be the right nest for you. Online photo album available; please ask owner for link holly (EMAIL HIDDEN) * No smoking, no pets. Credit check, security deposit, and personal references will be needed. * Available (June-Oct) $8,000 per month + utilities * $2,900 per week, for a minimum of 7 days, will be considered. * Possible off-season rental $1950 month + utilities: heating & electricity. Cottage has oil-burning furnace. Cleaning costs and any security deposits to be determined on a case-by-case basis. Guest Access Generally, the whole house, except our storage areas. IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN A SHORT STAY-- B & B only-- WHILE OWNERS ARE ALSO IN RESIDENCE , please contact us to discuss. Interaction with Guests We want to speak with you and-- under most circumstances-- meet you in person to show you around our home. The Neighborhood Trees, vintage cottages, tidal marsh, beaches, saltwater swimming close to the house. Getting Around No public transportation. But walking and biking are very safe and enjoyable here. Other Things to Note Very Quiet. A fine place for walks and recreation. Home is filled with scholarly library and vintage furnishings. An unsual home with a distinctive personality! + More

about: In the charming village of Stony Creek, CT, right on Long Island Sound in a quiet spot, our beloved salt box style house from 1850 offers you 2,200 sq.feet of living space. Explore the beauty of the famous Thimble Islands- or go to New York City!
description: Description The Space This house used to be a Swedish quarry workers boarding house when it was built in the 1850's. The ceilings are high and the floors are mostly original wood. It sits cradled on a hillside on a dead end road, facing the water, (which is not visible due to trees). There is a baby grand piano in the living room. Guest Access 2 Floors of living space Interaction with Guests We will not be around in person, but someone will be able to assist you with problems should any arise. The Neighborhood Picturesque and walkable village of Stony Creek with its famous Thimble Islands right offshore. Stony Creek Market, Stony Creek Marine & Cuisine, the public beach and the docks with tourist boats leaving frequently for the Thimble Islands, as well as a boat launch, are a 5 minute walk away. The library is 2 houses down, as is the Stony Creek Puppet theatre. there is a trolley trail to hike along, with paths branching off into the forests and marshes around. Right up the road on the other side of I-95 is the Stony Creek Brewery- a more than somewhat popular brewery for afficionados. New Haven with its Yale and festival attractions is a 15 minute drive away, the towns around all abound with summer farmers markets and festivals. Getting Around There is on-street parking available. a car is necessary to get around outside of Stony Creek, even though in the Creek use of a car is not necessarily advisable in the summer. Branford, the town which Stony Creek is a part of, has a train station for travel to New haven and New York, Old Saybrook, 20 minutes away, has an Amtrak station. Other Things to Note The stairs are typical of New England houses- fairly steep but not necessarily the best for toddlers. + More
rules: House Rules Be respectful of neighbors and avoid noise after 10 pm, please. No smoking in the house. Pets only by special agreement. + More

about: Relax and enjoy the old world charm of this beautiful year round
description: Description The Space While enjoying the amazing views and ocean this house is also a short 10 min. drive (or train) to Yale/downtown New Haven. Also a 1.5 train ride to NYC or 2.5 to Boston. Downtown Branford has excellent shopping and many wonderful restaurants both casual and refined. Guest Access Entire home is yours to enjoy including beach, ocean, and outside decks and porches. There is also a two car garage available and parking for 4 cars. Interaction with Guests We have lived in this house and town for 40 yrs. and are more than happy to share any information that will make your stay perfect. The Neighborhood The Short Beach neighborhood of Branford was historically a beach destination at the turn of the century. It is now a beach community that is 90% year round residents but maintains an old world charm and character. Getting Around 2 miles from the house there is a commuter train station that services New Haven and the shoreline communities. You can catch a train in Branford that will connect you with service to New York and Boston. Other Things to Note This is our permanent residence so it is only available when we are traveling. However, we are also very flexible in terms of travel (one of us is retired; the other semi-restired) so please let us know if there are times you would like to be in Branford and we can try to coordinate. + More

description: Description Guest Access Living Rooms -Apple TV and Roku on 2 Samsung HD TVs (with Netflix/Hulu/HBO Now) -Hi-speed Wifi (25 mbps) -2 fireplaces (one gas with remote) -Binoculars for birdwatching -Martin acoustic guitar -Yoga mats and weights -Philips HD radio Kitchen -Thermador oven -Subzero fridge -All-Clad pots and pans -Williams Sonoma dishware -Cuisinart griddler, KitchenAid Mixer, Nespresso frother, All-Clad wafflemaker, Cuisinart coffeemaker -Robert Welch silverware -Gourmet cookbooks -Stocked spice cabinet and pantry for basic ingredients Property -Private, expansive deck -4 acres of mountainside woods -BBQ -Long, private driveway -Landscaping with new blooms every week in the spring and summer, breathtaking fall colors, or "winter wonderland" The Neighborhood Bayberry Hill Road winds up Talcott Mountain from the Talcott Notch neighborhood of Avon and Farmington. 10-15 mins to West Hartford Center and I-84. The immediate area includes historic barns, the Farmington River, stonewalls, and country estates. Several nature preserves including Fisher Meadows and Nod Brook are minutes away. Getting Around 25 minutes from Hartford Bradley Airport, 20 minutes from Hartford Amtrak. Uber available. Other Things to Note Outdoor opportunities nearby: hiking, horseback riding, fly-fishing, mountain biking, canoeing, snowshoeing, x-country skiing, downhill skiing. about: Our three bedroom, two bath home is just a two minute walk from private white sand Guthrie Beach! The home has upper and lower decks, with lovely water views from the upper deck. Spacious kitchen, dining room and game room with ping-pong table.
description: Description The Space Available for the holidays! Please inquire for rates. THE HOUSE We are located just four houses in from the water- a two minute walk, with a lovely water view from the front yard. On the first floor, there is a large eat-in kitchen, a dining room that easily seats eight, living room, sun-room with table and chairs, and a full bathroom. Upstairs, there are three bedrooms (all with queen beds) and a full bathroom. Additionally, upstairs, there is a den with 60 inch flat screen TV. This converts to a sleeping area for three (futon and single sofa bed). The den has sliding doors that open to an outside deck. Also, an upstairs sitting area can sleep one on a rollaway bed. In the back yard the house has a large deck with picnic table and charcoal grill. There is also an outside shower. We have converted the one-car garage to a game room with a ping-pong table, games, toys, books and a VCR with a wide selection of videos to keep the kids (and adults!) occupied on those rainy days. The house is fully equipped with linens, towels, paper supplies and even some sodas in the fridge to welcome you to the beach. The spacious kitchen has a dishwasher, side-by-side refrigerator, and gas range/oven. It is equipped with pots, pans, utensils and dishes. There is a microwave, blender, toaster and coffee maker. You can eat at the kitchen table or serve a larger group in the dining room, have an intimate meal in the sun room or enjoy a family picnic out on the back porch/deck. Smoking outdoors only, please. During the summer season, the house is available by the week only. Your stay begins Sunday at 3 pm and extends until the following Sunday at 11 am. During the rest of the year, it is available for rent by the weekend, week, month, or longer. You can park three cars in the driveway, with additional parking on the street. The neighborhood is safe and wonderful for walking, biking and running, with stately homes and trees. THE BEACH: Private Guthrie Beach is sandy and pleasant, only steps away and right on Long Island Sound. The beach is yours to enjoy while renting the house. It has restrooms and is attended in season for your comfort and security but there is no lifeguard on duty. There is a roped swimming area and sunning/diving platform. Bring your picnic lunch and enjoy the picnic tables. We provide beach chairs, umbrella and coolers. The house has plenty of beach towels and beach toys for the family! THE AREA: Bring along your bike and take a ride or walk along the seawall about a half mile to Ocean Beach Park with its boardwalk, kids water park, rides, food and activities. Drive five minutes and hop on a Ferry to Block Island or Orient Point, Long Island. Mystic is only a ten to fifteen minute drive away and features Mystic Seaport and Mystic Aquarium. A 20-30 minute car ride gets you to the three largest casinos in the world, Mohegan Sun, MGM Grand and Foxwoods, with entertainment and dining options too numerous to count. The family will love the Jimmy Buffet Margaritaville at the Mohegan! We are only two hours from Boston and 2 1/2 hours from New York City. Summer at the Connecticut shore is beautiful! One of the high points of summer in New London is Sailfest - a celebration of ships and the sea in early July, with its huge fireworks display over a harbor absolutely alive with colorful boats and visitors. Walk a few blocks, pick out your viewing spot and let others deal with the traffic. New London is an arts lovers haven with galleries, artist colonies, live music, theatre and performing arts. Guest Access Beautiful and private GUTHRIE BEACH! Interaction with Guests The home and yard are yours during your visit and you will have total privacy. We are nearby and available should you need anything! The Neighborhood Besides the gorgeous sandy beach, you will love strolling along lovely Pequot Avenue with its charming homes sweeping water views. It is a great neighborhood for walking, running, biking and admiring the beautiful early twentieth century homes. Getting Around Yes, the house is just two miles from downtown New London. The transportation hub of southeast Connecticut, Amtrak and Greyhound service is available to New York or Boston and beyond. Taxi fare to the home runs about $13. Other Things to Note The backyard has a fire pit, so bring some firewood and enjoy! + More
rules: House Rules Linens and towels (including beach towels) are provided, but must be laundered prior to checkout. Detergent is provided. + More

description: Description The Space Antique wood dining table seats 8 comfortably. Artisanal lamps, and a handmade cherry wood bookcase, add character. King bed and marble powder table in the bedroom. Carlyle sofa and ottoman in the living room fold out into a queen guest bed. Apartment has black granite counters and kitchen/bathroom floors, central air, 3 closets, dishwasher, in-sink-disposal, and washer/dryer unit. Photos here: (website hidden)(phone number hidden)/albums(phone number hidden)?authkey=CIDvss7axNKs_AE Guest Access Building info here: (website hidden) The rooftop sundeck boasts 360 degree views, including sunset over the distant harbor. Church bells ring softly at noon and 5 PM. Building amenities include a gym and basketball court; daytime and evening staff in the building office and concierge desk to manage deliveries and answer questions; nighttime doorman; dry-cleaning service, maintenance staff to change light bulbs and fix things. Interaction with Guests I am looking for a responsible, monthly subletter who would like to stay in the apartment during the summer. The Neighborhood The Eli is in the heart of the downtown area, within a 10 minute walk of most Yale facilities; the State Street train station (where you can catch the train into New York City); and New Haven's 3 main spots for shops, restaurants, and entertainment (9th square -- where you can find yoga studios, restaurants, galleries, the Elm City Market for sustainable, local and organic groceries; Audubon/Orange -- where you can find an excellent massage studio, restaurants, cafes, and Italian food markets; Chapel street -- the primary spot for shops, theater, concerts, and museums). You won't need a car or public transport. The artsy movie theater (Whitney Humanities Center) is right across the street. Everything you need is accessible by foot. :)! Getting Around 1 block to yale shuttle for local transport, and 1 block to train station for commuter rail into NYC. Other Things to Note Security deposit, background and credit check required by building staff for entry into The Eli. Electricity and Internet not included. + More

about: A Beautiful 4BR, 1 & _ bath winterized home in Westbrook, CT. Waterfront-1 of the best beaches in CT. Available May 1st through October 3rd. Fully furnished and applianced. All utilities, cable, internet, beach dues & garbage pickup included.
description: Description The Space Welcome to the beach house! Message from the owners to you: "We have great memories of this house growing up; spending time with family, swimming, boating, cooking out, and enjoying the beach. We hope you will enjoy your time here as much as we have over the years." Step out of the house and straight onto the beach. This location boasts private access to one of the best beaches on the Connecticut shoreline. Check-in:_Generally, check-in is at 12pm and check-out is by 9am  arrangements can be made in advance for other times. Kitchen: The kitchen has dishes, pots, pans, etc., stove, dishwasher and microwave. Grill: Onsite for use by guests Linens: Towels and sheets are provided in ample supply. Key: If you forget to leave the key upon check-out or lose it, $100 will be charged to your security deposit for lock replacement costs incurred. Windows/Heat &_AC: Please enjoy the fresh air; the windows have screens and work. There are several fans to assist with the breeze. The thermostat (to regulate the heat) is in the dining room. Extra Guests: You can add extra guests with proper notification through Air bnb, not to exceed 10. Enjoy Your Stay, Laura Guest Access Parking: You can park 2 cars in the driveway, 2 across the street. Drive-on beach access for trailered boats. Interaction with Guests On the day you I arrive I will meet you at the house to give you the keys and introduce myself. I am happy to show you around the house if you like, and answer any questions that might come up. I live nearby and will be available should you need to reach me with any concerns about the house. Call or text and I will respond as soon as possible. I am also available to give you some of the local color, the go-to restaurants, shopping, hiking and area destinations. + More

about: This 2-acre CT River estate combines the best of luxury, history and adventure! 3,400 SF 3-level renovated Victorian features 5 bedrooms, 3-1/2 baths, gourmet kitchen,wraparound deck, tennis court and 40' dock. A magical place to relax & recharge...
description: Description The Space Knowles Landing is one of the most beautiful waterfront estates on the Connecticut River. This maritime historic landmark is centrally located midway been NYC_and Boston, 25 minutes south of Hartford, and 45 minutes north of New Haven. This stunning 5-bedroom renovated Victorian Captain's House has an open floor plan and all the modern conveniences you could want  from AC to granite kitchen counters, wifi, a wraparound porch (with a working signal light) and a delightful afternoon breeze to relax and celebrate life. (URL HIDDEN) smoking or (URL HIDDEN) lab mix Sophie, however, will be thrilled to receive some extra attention. Located in a quiet historic village, Middle Haddam has a rich and colorful history of shipbuilding, sea captains and commerce. This 2-acre property includes the 3,400 SF, 3-level Captain's House which sleeps 10 in style; a 2,100 SF, 3-level renovated Carriage House (host's studio); gazebo; Hartru tennis court and deep-water 40' dock. 5 Bedrooms Bedroom #1: The 3rd floor master bedroom suite with a walk-out deck offers a commanding view of the River and property. Queen size raised bed for exquisite river views, skylights, exposed brick with dramatic lighting, sitting area, large bathroom with shower, 2 sinks, stained glass windows and Jacuzzi is the ultimate private getaway from which to reflect and begin anew. Bedroom #2: The 2nd floor master bedroom has a Queen size bed, wonderful vets of the River, marble bathroom with a shower, 2 sinks, and skylights. This bedroom opens up to a spacious bedroom with panoramic River views and serves as an extra bedroom (see below). Bedroom #3: The 2nd Floor sunroom is accessed either through two French doors off the den, or through a door from the 2nd floor master bedroom. This light-filled bedroom has 3 walls of windows offering a 180-degree riverscape and a delightful afternoon breeze. The daybed opens to a King-sized bed with storage drawers below. There is a large wardrobe closet and a desk stocked with office supplies, a Mac computer and a wireless printer. Bedroom #4: The 2nd floor bedroom off the main stairs has a full-size bed and a bathroom next door off the hallway with tub and shower. This bedroom faces the River and offers a lovely view of the glimmering waters from the comfort of your bed. Bedroom #5: A cozy library faces the River on the 2nd floor and also has a pull-out full-size futon. There is a large closet, and bookshelves filled with great eclectic reads. A full bathroom with a tub/shower is just across the hallway. 2nd Floor Den From the hallway you can access the den with a 42" Smart TV and incredible River views. This large, window-filled room has two coaches, one of which is a very comfortable pull-out Queen size bed with a Posturepedic mattress. 3-1/2 Bathrooms The 2nd and 3rd floor master bedrooms have bathrooms ensuite with double sinks and sunlight flooding in thru skylights and windows. The 3rd floor bathroom also has a Jacuzzi. The 2nd floor hallway bathroom has a bathtub/shower. The 1st floor 1/2-bathroom is off the side entrance and kitchen. This large, airy bathroom/mudroom has a gas log fireplace, washer-and-dryer, skylight and closets. You can also access the backyard from the mudroom where there is a clothesline. Kitchen The first floor has a flowing, open floor plan with 9' ceilings, downlights and large windows to capture gorgeous views of the River. The kitchen is a cook's dream with granite counters, 2 large sinks for the sous chefs, a brass bar sink, Subzero frig, regular and convection ovens, and gas stove top. Eat in the kitchen for a casual meal or savor your gastronomical feat in the dining room (seats 6-8) with wonderful etched granite fireplace and river views. The kitchen is stocked with cooking and serviceware, utensils, microwave, toaster, blender, coffee maker, French press, Keurig, water boiler and electric kettle, and basic supplies (oil, vinegar, spices, fresh ground coffee, tea, mustard, ketchup). Living Room Off the kitchen, the large living room faces the river with breathtaking views out the picture window. Facing west, the sunsets reflecting off the water are simply spectacular! Open the screened French doors, turn on the paddle fan and choose from settle in on one of many comfy chairs and coaches. There is also a gas log fireplace and a stereo with a collection of jazz CDs. Dining Room Entering from the kitchen or the foyer, this stunning dining room seats 8-10 with wonderful lighting and river views. There is a wet bar located in the adjacent kitchen. For larger dinner parties, the foyer serves as a wonderful extra dining space to seat an additional 10 guests. Wraparound Porch When I give my guests a tour of the Captain's House and bring them out to the wraparound porch with the awesome river views, the lush green trees across the water, the gentle sloping lawn to the tennis court and dock_they absolutely melt. Most of my guests enjoy using the porch, complete with lighting and power, as an outdoor family and dining room. Guest Access The Captain's House (Victorian) is for you and your guests to enjoy. There are chaise lounges and chairs available on the lower riverfront lawn to bask in the sun or under the shade trees. I will also be happy to loan you the electric golf cart, picnic basket and cooler if you would like to feast down by the water. Power is located by the tennis court and in the pump house. You are welcome to play on the Hartru tennis court. There is a net, but no striping  great for a friendly volley and exercise. Please brush the court after you are finished for the next round. Up for a game of croquet? The lawn on the River offers the perfect level playing field  just ask. The river is usually at its calmest in the early morning and late afternoon. A kayaker's paradise, there is an easy launch area just to the right of the dock. There are 4 very stable kayaks for your use with flotation devices. Arrangements can also be made if you would like to dock your motor or sail boat at my 40' deepwater dock. I have mooring whips which worked well for my 25' fiberglass Chris Craft and power is available. The Connecticut River stretches 407 miles from Canada to Long Island Sound and captivates even the most reserved observer with its beauty. Known to have the best carp and channel cat fishing in the country  42 pounds is the state record and was caught in the CT_River. We also have the best striped bass fishing in the Northeast! Every Spring, the bass chase the herring up the River. A salt water fish, bass have a high tolerance for fresh water. Striped bass over 40 pounds have been caught in the River and there are bass tournaments all season  many fishermen cast in front of the dock where the fish like to gather. In the late afternoon, seize the opportunity to sit on the dock and just watch the River life. Be patient and you may see the fish jump, an eagle soar, or blue heron fly by in search of their next meal. If you would like to fish, you will need to purchase an inland fishing license  $28 for residents (resident senior citizens 65 and over can register for free) and $55 for nonresidents which can be done online. Who Should Stay Ideal for couples, groups of friends, families with teenage or older children, history buffs, adventurers, nature and water lovers, fishing enthusiasts, runners, bicyclists, boaters, artists, authors, lovers of life. This property is not ideal for individuals who might have difficulty with many stairs and hills. Interaction with Guests You will be greeted when you arrive and be shown around the Captain's House and the Landing. I live in the Carriage House, my studio, just up the hill from where you will be staying. Call or text and I will respond as soon as possible. I am available to give you some of the local color, the go-to restaurants, shopping, hiking and area destinations...or not ;) It's really up to the individual guest and I am very respectful of their privacy. There is a House Guide explaining where everything is in the house and how to operate it, as well as a Destination List. There is also a folder of brochures for you to peruse with hiking maps, restaurants, shopping and other local and regional destinations. The Neighborhood Knowles Landing: This quiet River oasis was once a destination for vacationers to get out of the City back during the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Many would travel by steamboat to the Landing where there was a steamboat house for tickets and baggage (the steamboat house burned down before the property was purchased, but the foundation still remains in front of the dock). Shipbuilding History: Situated atop a commanding hill, this landmark Victorian was built in 1886 by the daughter and son-in-law of local steamboat Captain Edward W. Simpson. Middle Haddam was home to more than a dozen sea captains  some credited with capturing British ships off Long Island during the Revolutionary War. Trade to the West Indies is documented as far back as the 1770s. The local taverns, shops and inns, which were later converted to lovely homes and a local library, enjoyed financial success until the early 1930s when steamboat service died out along the Connecticut River. The Connecticut River: The Connecticut River has been named one of the Last Great Places" by the Nature Conservancy. One of the most beautiful rivers in the world, it has no industrialization along its shores and its waters are rated clean enough for anything but drinking. It is a summer breeding ground for osprey and the largest concentration of wintering eagles on the East coast when it is a common sight to see eagles flying above the River in search of food. The Neighborhood: Walk to the Middle Haddam Library, just up the street with a wonderful collection of books, DVDs and historical references, or take a stroll down Shad Row past the waterfalls and onto Shipyard Road. The Middle Haddam Post Office is also an easy 10-minute walk over a wooden bridge off of Blacksmith Road. Nearby: Stop & Shop and other stores are just 2 miles away up RT_66E. Less than a mile away is the best takeout pizza in the area. Great hiking at the 130-acre Hurd State Park is just 2.2 miles south off of 151, or travel east on 66 and follow the signs to the East Hampton Air Line State Park trailhead  a great path that extends 22 miles to Windham. Local Entertainment, Theatre & Art: Mohegan Sun Casino is an easy 32-mile drive, and the award-winning Goodspeed Opera House is 9.5 miles off of Route 151 (Fiddler on the Roof is playing from 6/27-9/7. Be sure to visit nearby Chester with wonderful one-of-a-kind shops, fantastic restaurants, the Norma Terris Theatre and Connecticut's acclaimed contemporary impressionist artist Leif Nilsson's Studio  all less than 15 miles away. Destinations: Gillette's Castle and State Park are just 13 miles south in East Haddam. The visitor's center and tour provides an exceptional view into William Gillette's inspiring life as an inventor, playwright and actor. In neighboring Portland, check out the Brownstone Exploration &_Discovery Park  an outdoor adventure sports park with rock climbing, swimming, kayaking, snorkeling, cliff jumping, scuba diving and much more! Kayakers: For the sports-minded adventurers, you might enjoy paddling down the CT_River to the wonderful Blue Oar Restaurant (we can arrange to pick you and the kayaks up at the Blue Oar). Outside waterfront casual dining with a Caribbean flair. It's BYOB, open 7 days a week through Labor Day for lunch and dinner. You want to plan to paddle down with the current going out. Depending on wind, current, paddle speed and rest stops, it will take you 2 to 3 hours. Golfers: Less than 6 miles away is the public 18-hole regulation Portland Golf Course set in the rolling hills of the Connecticut River Valley. Challenging and enjoyable for players of all ages  excellent turf conditions, restaurant, pro shop and friendly staff. Food Lovers: Across the River, Middletown boasts 133 restaurants from sushi and Thai to Italian and Mexican. Plan to go to O'Rourke's Diner, for a special breakfast treat; just over the Middletown-Portland Bridge on the left  get there before 8:30 to avoid the line out the door on weekends. Local Vineyard: Priam Vineyards in Colchester, just 10.5 miles from Knowles Landing, offers tours and wine tastings March thru December. Concerts are scheduled every Friday night ($12/ticket). Wesleyan University Center for the Arts: Check out Wesleyan's calendar for wonderful concerts, film and dance programs just 8 miles away! Getting Around Come by car, plane or boat! Knowles Landing is conveniently located midway between NYC and Boston (about a 2-hour drive). The nearest private airport for land and seaplanes is in East Haddam, 10 mile south of Knowles Landing. Bradley International Airport is about 40 minutes north off of I-91N. By boat, we are just south of Daymarker 72, seaplanes have landed here, picked up passengers at the dock and refueled at the East Haddam Airport. Other Things to Note Photo Portraits: Whether you are traveling by yourself, with friends or with family - think about scheduling a photo session with me. We can shoot in my studio with different backgrounds...or select a favorite global destination and voila - you are in the mountains of Peru or a cabaret in Paris! Both the River and the Captain's House offer endless possibilities for locations. And ask me about getting a 'family' discount ;) Samples available. + More
rules: House Rules Non-smokers only, absolutely no smoking allowed in the house. At least 2 guests must be over 30. We are sorry, but no pets are allowed. My rescue dog, Sophie, will be all too happy to receive your attention! My home is your home! Unwind, recharge and enjoy! If you have questions  24/7  call or text  whether looking for that perfect restaurant, hiking adventure or shopping. If you've forgotten something, maybe I can help. Parking: You can park 3 cars in the driveway without blocking access to the Carriage House (host's studio) up the driveway. There is parking on the street as well. Check-in:_Generally, check-in is at 3pm and check-out is by 10am  there is flexibility depending on reservation schedules. Suggestion: I ask that guests leave their troubles and their shoes at the door! You might want to bring slippers or some extra socks. Kitchen: Tea and coffee are complimentary; please enjoy the condiments; kitchen has dishes, pots, pans, etc.; lightly stocked with basic staples (butter, oil, vinegar, cream, sugar, etc.); coffee maker, French press, Keurig, toaster, blender, dishwasher and microwave. Linens: Towels and sheets are provided; please let me know if you are allergic to down pillows or comforters. Please leave tired linens and towels in the laundry basket on top of the washer/dryer in the downstairs mudroom. Key: If you forget to leave the key upon check-out or lose it, $100 will be charged to your security deposit as the door locks will need to be changed for security purposes. Windows/Heat &_AC: Please enjoy the fresh air; most of the windows have screens and work. There is one thermostat to regulate the heat in the dining room; thermostats for the AC are located in the 2nd floor den to the right of the fireplace and the 3rd floor bedroom on the right wall before the bathroom door. Please be energy conscious and comfortable. There are three working paddle fans located in the living room, 2nd floor den, and 2nd floor master bedroom - enjoy! Extra Guests: You cannot add extra guests or bring guests unless the reservation has been officially revised on AirBnB under terms accepted to both parties (host and guest) prior to the reservation. On a case by case basis, visitors are allowed during your stay as long as you have given me 24-hours notice with the number of guests and when they will be arriving and departing. Please be respectful of my neighbors_(and your host up the hill) while enjoying Knowles Landing. Sounds carry incredibly well on the water and at the Landing! Enjoy life, Sue + More

description: Description The Space 1830's Antique house has 3 floors, with a bathroom on each one. Swimming and fishing in the pond in summer, sledding in winter. Perfect for a family reunion, wedding or just relaxing in the Hammock. Have a party or a wedding for over 25 people, add a $500 fee for the day or evening. Guest Access Full use of the house. May make an appointment at the Spa next door, for Massage Therapy, Reflexology, Lymph Drainage Therapy or CranioSacral Therapy. Open Tues-Saturday. Interaction with Guests Randy and I live in the apartment above the Spa, which is also on the property, but separate from the house. I will also be available next door if needed during Spa business hours. We will meet and greet you and give you a short description of things and answer any questions you may have. The Neighborhood Total privacy in the backyard, pick an apple, go for a swim or a hike. State forest surrounds property. Airline trail is right down the street, perfect for cross country skiing or biking/hiking. Only one neighbor in sight during the winter months. Walk to Pizza 101 or Baker's Dozen. Sharp Hill Winery is 3 miles away, as well as We-lik-it homemade ice cream. Getting Around Plenty of parking is available. TFG Airport is the closest, approx. 45 miles. Bradley Airport is 50 miles, Boston Airport is 75 miles. You will need a car out here in the Country, but may barrow our two bikes. Other Things to Note The Vanilla Bean Cafe is 3 miles, Sharpe Hill Winery is 5 miles. Pomfret Prep School is 2 miles, Rectory School is 2 1/2 miles away. + More

about: This entire house is all yours! Yes, the entire 2300 square ft house with 3 bedrooms and 2.5 baths! Host your Yale Graduation Weekend here and feel right at home as you entertain your family and friends in this beautiful and comfortable space.
description: Description The Space The wood floors will blow you away immediately when you walk in. The space is open and perfect for socializing with families and friends. The house is spacious and charming with a lovely combination of rustic and modern. Dining room table seats ten and dining area is connected to the kitchen and bar area. The kitchen is great for breakfast seating with 4 stools to sit on the large island. Natural light from the sun fills the house in every room. Relax in the Jacuzzi tub before breakfast or after a night out. A hidden gem and rare find for this neighborhood. Close to everything New Haven has to offer. Kitchen, 3 Bedrooms, Jacuzzi Tub (master bedroom), living room, dining area, and driveway. Wi-Fi password available upon request. There are no land lines for the phone and we do not have cable. But a large, crisp flat screen with direct internet connection is available for DVDs/Hulu/Netflix. The owners will not be on site in the event that the entire house is rented, but we will be readily available and easy to reach. The Neighborhood Wooster Square is the most historic and peaceful neighborhood in the city. The house is Just 2-3 blocks away from famous Wooster St (Pepe's, Sally's, Etc). If pizza isn't your top choice there are a dozen other restaurants within walking distance that cater to a variety of tastes and preferences. The square itself is delightful and quintessential New England. Getting Around You can walk most places to downtown or Yale. If you have a car you will have no problems parking anywhere in NH. Other Things to Note There is a small driveway for off-street parking for 2 cars. There is a fenced in backyard. Pets are OK for an additional $50/night. There is a 2 night minimum for all bookings except for Yale Graduation Weekend, where there is a 3 night minimum. Since we can only offer our home to one family at a time and we do receive several inquiries for each weekend, we do have a "Super Strict Cancellation Policy". We will assure you a great time and a great space, and we just ask that you be sure for that particular weekend when booking please. + More
rules: House Rules We expect you to use the space for what it's worth: A fun and comfortable social area for family and friends. Throw a party if you want, have a celebration for your son or daughter when they graduate from Yale. Host a family dinner that everyone will remember. Try not to break anything and clean what you use, simple enough. There is a dishwasher and full laundry on site. This house is for the sophisticated family who can entertain in a responsible manner. No smoking anywhere in the house, but you may smoke outside on the deck or the back garage. + More

description: Description The Space Large 6000 square foot living space in restored barn. If you like open, airy loft living, this is your property in the country. 2 large master bedrooms, one with Jacuzzi, 1 smaller bedroom and 3 unique bedroom/baths each located in a converted silo. Large kitchen with professional appliances, dining area, fireplace area, living room. 600 square foot deck overlooks a 24 acre private lake. Gunite pool. The property has many trails for hiking, and there is the opportunity (under a separate arrangement) to participate in a working cattle ranch featuring grass fed beef. Located 5 miles from the Town of Litchfield, the property is in a very private area and is in the midst of a 700 acre grassfed beef farm ((URL HIDDEN) Surrounding the farm are 2000 protected acres of the Waterbury Water Company. Litchfield is a short drive away and features numerous bars and restaurants, museums, nature preserves, antique shops and general sight seeing opportunities. The Barn is about 2 hours drive from both New York and Boston. The city of Waterbury, CT is about a 15 minute drive away, and from there you can take a train or bus to New York City. There are no other properties of this size in the Town of Litchfield and few others this size in the state of Connecticut. The farm it is in is one of the largest cattle ranches in Connecticut. A working farm experience is available at an additional cost, depending on group size and how involved you want it to be. Please note that from June 15 through Labor Day and over Thanksgiving, and Christmas, we have a 7 night minimum stay. + More
rules: House Rules -The person renting the house and signing the lease at check in must be at least 27 years old. -We reserve the right to ask for names and addresses of all the people who will be staying at the house. - No smoking inside the house - No pets allowed unless approved by owner - Signed rental agreement required prior to or at check in. -Check in is at 4 PM and check out by 11 AM unless special accomodations are made at the time of rental. -Check in must be made by 9 PM on the date of rental. - No loud music - House when left needs to be "broom clean" (no large messes on floor or in house, trash placed in outdoor receptacle, dishwasher loaded and run) beds stripped and linen and towels put into laundry bags provided and left in the laundry room. Perishable food removed; appliances left in clean condition; windows closed, lights turned off. Furniture returned to original position if moved. Counter tops and tables wiped down, Floors swept/vacuumed/mopped if necessary. + More

about: This home built in 1792 and 1850 is fully updated & offers a main house, guest house and a post and beam barn with ping pong loft. There is a heated pool, fitness space, antique ice house, a well house rumored to be the original Roxbury town well, and private pond.
description: Description The Space This is a renovated historic home. Each bedroom has its own en suite updated bathroom. The master bathroom has both a claw foot tub and a shower. There are three TV's with cable and Wifi. Guest Access Our guests have access to the main house, the guest house and the barn with it's upstairs loft with ping pong and some fitness equipment. The pool is open Memorial Day to Labor Day. Upon request we try to leave it open a couple more weeks, if guests ask in advance. Interaction with Guests We rent this house when we are out of town. We have a point person who comes to clean and offers catering services and can be in touch as well as a caretaker on call in case of some issue or need.. Their contact information is in the House User Manual which will be sent to you upon confirmation of reservation. The Neighborhood This property is over 200 years old in is the center of a small town. Guests can walk to the library, the town park and to some stores, including a deli and a farm stand. It's one of the few roads in the township that has a. It of street life, and many walkers, bikers and joggers go by. There is a large town pond behind this property and the house has it's own small pond. Roxbury is next to Woodbury, CT which is famous for antiquing and offers restaurants and access to the highway. It is ideal for people who enjoy peace and quiet, hiking and being outdoors. Near by Washington CT offers the Mayflower Hotel, Marty's for coffee, lunch and treats, as well as a few other really nice restaurants like CT, and a smattering of shops, the best of which being an upscale, vintage resale shop called Grape in the Shade. Roxbury itself has Mamies Restaurant with gourmet country fare in a cool setting. And next door is a burger stand if you are in a hurry. Getting Around The closet public transit is Metronorth with trains into Brewster NY or Stamford CT. Peter Pan has a bus from NYC or Boston that arrives in Southbury just 5 miles from the house. From there you can book a cab or arrange for Enterprise rental car to meet you. Other Things to Note There is cable TV and wireless internet. + More
rules: House Rules Stuff: This is our home so please respect and leave in place any belongings that are there. We want you to enjoy them but just leave them where they are happiest. Feel free to read the books but don't leave with them! Use towels the way you would at home. Same with the sheets. Precaution: No burning of anything at any time in the House. No candles, not fires in fireplaces. These are antique chimneys and require a lot of specific knowledge to use. Usually they are blocked for insulation purposes. So please do not use and do not use the candles. It's an antique house and we don't want it to go up in flames because of a forgotten candle. Cleaning: Leave all the towels washed & in the laundry room on the date of your departure. (the washing machine is on the 2nd floor near the bedrooms. This includes guest house towels. Charges for leaving unwashed towels is $100 dollars. It's ok if they are still in the dryer when you leave. Leave dishes hand washed or in the dish washer and washed. There will be a surcharge of an additional $100 if the house is exceptionally messy, surfaces are not cleared, dishes are dirty or mud is tracked through the house. If you are staying longer and want the house cleaned mid-stay, you will have the contact information for our house keeper and would pay her directly. If there are any mishaps, you will be charged for the removal of any stains on carpets or upholstery. (Receipts will be provided if needed.) So try to be conscious and operate with shoes off whenever possible. Age of home: The house is fully updated however we have chosen to preserve the character of the home. This means we have original, refinished antique floors in a few rooms. Upstairs in the front rooms you will find wavy floors and in a couple of places there are burnished square head nails that stick up a bit from the floor's surface. Be cautious or throw a rug over that spot to avoid snagging your sock on it. Kitchen Stuff: Please send us a note if you break any dishes that you use during your stay. (Receipts will be provided to you in that instance. ) Please hand wash anything in the kitchen made of wood (cutting boards and salad bowl) and also sharp kitchen knives, as just a few turns in the dishwasher will dull a knife. Pets: If you bring a pet, please clear up all pet waste left in the yard. Only non-shedding dogs or caged rodents are allowed inside the house. Reminder on AirBNB rules. If you do not accurately report the number of guests at the house, you could be evicted at any time in your stay. Keep in touch and don't under report your guests. + More

about: If you want to experience something totally different for a change, why not sleep on a sailboat, book a sailing cruise, watch the sunset, drink a glass of wine in a very peaceful and natural setting.
description: Description The Space Nomade is a 35' sailboat with 2 double cabins and a center salon. Full details on Nomade on our website: sail-works .c o m There is a bathroom and marine toilet and an outside shower. The kitchen comes with a stove, 2 sinks with hot and cold water, fridge, and 3 propane burners. 110V or 12V power. There is a sound system and 32" smartTV with 4 speakers in the salon, you can plug in your phone or music player to listen to your favorite music. Guest Access Access to the whole boat. The boat is at a marina dock. Interaction with Guests Anything is possible. You can decide to just sleep on the boat for the night and we can combine a sailing cruise of the Thimble Islands with the captain ($150/hour) or even sail away to Port Jefferson,NY for the weekend. Rates on request for a weekend with captain. The captain is also a sailing instructor. More details on website: sail-works . c o m The Neighborhood Quiet, peaceful, gorgeous views of the Branford river with plenty of wildlife action (some humans too). The Branford beach is within 15 minutes walking distance. Getting Around The train station is a 5 minute walk. Parking is included. Nelly's Green restaurant is right on the marina premises or across the river, the Lobster Shack. Many restaurants to choose from within 5-10 minute driving distance. The Branford public beach is within 15 minutes walking distance. Other Things to Note Our sailing rate with captain is $150/hour with a minimum of 2 hours sailing for a up to 4 persons. Gratuity not included. For groups over 4 people but not exceeding 10, please contact us. See details on sailing trips and charters on our website: sail-works. c o m + More

description: Description The Space Welcome to MaWink's House! The area has certainly developed since my German barber and hairdresser great grandparents bought this house over 60 years ago! But with three generations still living in the area and using this as our central meeting spot, we still lovingly refer to it as MaWink's house. The home, a stone built 'cottage' built at the turn of the century, is four bedrooms/three bathrooms and sits a hundred yards from our cabana and doc on scenic Lake Waramaug. THE UPSTAIRS * Master bedroom with a four post bed, private balcony to admire the perfect view of the lake, private sink, and a shared bathroom with... * Second large bedroom with stunning views of the lake, private sink and currently two brass single beds (although there has been discussion to upgrade it to two full size beds). THE DOWNSTAIRS: * renovated kitchen with back door entrance (leads to car parking area and garage) and breakfast bar. It's open plan with... * Large living room/dining area that includes a large flat screen TV, dvd player, stereo and collection of dvd's. * The front closed in porch (my favorite area!). There is a table that sits 6-8 where we usually eat and a sitting area to admire the views. * The den/library - a smaller room off of the living room with windows to the porch. There is a large indoor/outdoor couch that we often use for the extra guests * The back bedrooms/bathrooms: *** There are two cosy back bedrooms that we call MaWink and Gaga's rooms after my great grandmother and my great aunt. Always the host, MaWink never slept in the big bedroom upstairs, but instead kept that for her constant flow of guests coming to the house! MaWink's room is en suite with a brand, spankin' new bathroom with shower. There is an additional bathroom with full bath in the hallway for Gaga's room ;) THE CABANA: With one of the few cleared views of the lake from the street we always have bikers and walkers stop to take a picture... but don't worry, the cabana is set below on the lake so you'll barely notice them! A two room cabana with gas grill, fridge, prepping space and sitting area. Two wood docs - one attached to the cement based area and one that we float to swim out to! You can climb down to the 'beach (water height dependent ;) ) to play in the water or just get thrown in from the doc! Lots of comfy furniture including lounges, wicker table and chairs and a outdoor couch! AMENITIES: Washer/dryer in basement full kitchen/appliances/dishes etc linen/towels/blankets included Digital Cable, large DVD collection, stereo, telephone (cell phone reception is not great around here) Wireless internet THE AREA: We are based on Lake Waramaug, in Warren, CT. Litchfield county was ranked one of the top 1000 places in the WORLD to see before you die, and I can attest to it. With rolling hills, adorable villages, hikes, rivers, lakes, antiquing, art, fantastic restaurants... its a dream getaway only 1.5 hours from NYC. At the foot of the lake is New Preston, a small village filled with quaint antique shops, a couple lovely restaurants and a nice cafe/bakery. Kent town center is a ten minute drive and famous for its adorable high street and art scene. If you want to hang out with the townies (from the billionaires to the gas station attendant) head to GW's in Washington depot for great food, live music and plenty to drink. If you don't want to drive anywhere, take a five minute walk up the road to Hopkins Inn, restaurant and vinyard for some wine tasting and traditional Austrian cuisine. As a family we feel so lucky to have this home and while my mother now owns it (and will retire there and move from NJ) my grandparents, aunts and uncles all put their love, time and energy into the place so you might run into one of them as they mow the lawn or trim the hedges! I am now based in London (see my other listing) but I take every opportunity I can to head home for the tranquility of Mawink's house! + More

about: Welcome to this sunny, chic 4BR, 4BA updated North Stamford country house with a huge backyard! Great for families. Light & bright, open flow, skylights galore, updated kitchen & baths, deck and grill, playroom. Master suite. Just 50 mins from NYC.
description: Description The Space Just one hour from New York City, this is a very charming and stylishly updated old house that is perfect for families. It was built in 1869 (there is a hitching post out front), and then was updated twice recently with a sunroom with woodburning stove, large playroom stocked with toys, and a master suite and bath. It has 3,880 square feet. There are 4 full bathrooms, 2 with tubs. The house can comfortably fit 8-10 people. There are 4 bedrooms: -- HUGE master suite (on second floor) with queen bed and private bath with large spa glass door shower and jacuzzi tub. Sleeps 2. -- 2nd bedroom (on 2nd floor) with twin bed and a trundle single bed underneath. Sleeps 2. You share the bath with the 3rd bedroom. -- 3rd bedroom (on 2nd floor) has a double bed in it. Sleeps 2. Shares bath with 2nd bedroom. -- 4th bedrooom (on 3rd floor) is very large and on its own floor with private bath. Double bed. -- Den on first floor has a double-sized pullout couch. So you could sleep 2 more there. There is a large backyard. At the far end of the yard is a pond and stone patio. In the spring and summer there are frogs in the pond, and the occasional turtle. The playroom is large, sunny, and stocked with toys that kids are welcome to play with. Our outdoor swingset / playset accommodates small children - best for children 10 and under. Please no adult use. Thanks. Guest Access This is a rental for the whole house and yard. During winter months, the garage (with two automatic doors) can accommodate two cars. Interaction with Guests Sometimes we are in the area and able to meet you at the house, others times we coordinate with you to leave the key. We always leave a binder in the house that is full of detailed info about the house, wireless access, garbage pickup, the area, shopping, activities, restaurants, recreation, etc. We are very easy to contact via text or phone with any questions at all you have during your stay -- no matter how small. Thanks! The Neighborhood The neighborhood is bucolic and rural. There's a horse farm nearby, down a winding road. The forested Mianus River Park, with its lovely hiking trails that run alongside the river, is a 3-minute drive from the house, great for jogging, hiking, mountain-biking or walking the dogs (or kids!). The house has easy access to the Merritt parkway (Route 15) so getting into NYC or to nearby Greenwich, CT is easy. Shopping on trendy Greenwich Ave. (Saks, Tiffany, J. Crew, etc.) is 15-20 minutes away. Stamford train station is about 15-20 minutes from the house, and has many trains running into New York's Grand Central station, a 1-hour train ride away. Getting Around You will most likely want to have a car if you plan to leave to sightsee etc. You could cab it to Trader Joe's or A&P and stock up on groceries. You could also cab it to two restaurants which are about five minutes away, Madonia and Long Ridge Tavern, as well as several others about ten minutes away. There is a local small grocery store, Mish Mosh, that delivers, and several restaurants deliver. Other Things to Note We like to have a sense of who will be renting the house. Please tell us who will be staying at the house, including number of adults and children, and ages of children. We really appreciate hearing a bit about you, your travel plans, etc. Thank you!! :) Please do not bring any additional guests to sleep at the house beyond the number you listed when you made your reservation. If you need to change the number of guests coming after you have already booked just let me know and we will work it out. Thank you! We have two small boys -- ages 3 and 5 -- and all the corresponding gear and toys. Highchair, pack and play, changing table, tricycles, bicycles, sleds, etc. There is a large and sunny playroom stocked with toys that kids are welcome to play with. We also have a swingset / slide in the backyard that accommodates smaller children - best for children 10 and under. There's a "cul de sac" neighborhood across the street from our house that has little traffic and is great for walks or riding bikes. We have two air mattresses - one QUEEN and one DOUBLE. You do not need to bring sheets and towels. All sheets and towels will be freshly washed for your arrival. The house itself will be professionally cleaned for your arrival, and will be professionally cleaned upon your departure. (This departure cleaning is the cleaning fee that you are charged when you book.) We ask that you kindly leave the house tidy and put dishes in dishwasher and turn on dishwasher when you leave. No need to strip beds. Thank you! The outdoor grill on the deck uses propane. There is an upright piano in the living room that was recently tuned. We cannot accommodate gatherings or parties of more than 15 guests for delicate plumbing reasons and also we want to be respectful of our neighbors. Thank you. + More
rules: House Rules We want you you enjoy the house to its fullest! We encourage you to contact us with any questions - no matter how small - anytime. If you are ever wondering whether something can be changed or fixed or if we have something and you cannot find it, etc., I really encourage you to text or call and ask! It is never a bother. :) Yes we do allow Dogs. No Cats, sorry. Please put ONLY toilet paper down the toilets. NO baby wipes, paper towels, or feminine items, or we run into plumbing problems. Thanks! NO SMOKING inside the house. Smoking on deck is fine. Please be sure to throw away cigarettes safely. Thanks. Please do not bring any additional guests to sleep at the house beyond the number you listed when you made your reservation. If you would like to invite a group of friends or family for a meal etc. we appreciate if you mention it to us beforehand. We will almost certainly agree that it's fine, we just like to know who will be in our home. Thank you!! + More

Big fenced in back yard with fire pit and sunny patio. Directly across the street from the park. Large Living Room with fireplace, great natural light. Beautiful dining room with table equipped to seat up to 8 people. 3 bedrooms with clean linens, and towels. Kitchen is fully equipped with range, pots, pans, utensils, espresso coffee maker (pods for guests included), gas weber grill, and fire-pit in our backyard. 1.5 baths with tub and shower. Large 46" LED Samsung TV comes with full DVD player, Netflix, bookcase with DVDs, books, magazines, and a massive sectional sofa. Wireless internet available throughout home. Large front porch and patio with table and chairs is great place to eat a meal or relax. Washer and dryer available in finished basement. Guest Access The entire house is yours to enjoy! There is a 2 night minimum for all bookings except for Yale Graduation Weekend, where there is a 3 night minimum. Since we can only offer our home to one family at a time and we do receive several inquiries for each weekend, we do have a "Super Strict Cancellation Policy". rules: House Rules We expect you to use the space for what it's worth: A fun and comfortable social area for family and friends. about: Intimate dwelling nestled into undulating landscape and overlooking a most extraordinary view: A salt marsh, the Long Island Sound, and the tidal sluiceway connecting them.
description: Description The Space This 1900 square foot house, with a ship-lapped cedar exterior and polished concrete floors within has been designed with intimacy and tranquility in mind. Built-in elements, nooks, window seats surround an open central space that can accommodate a large gathering. Open and yet private. More astounding is the surrounding terrain, punctuated with great trees and boulders, and deceasing into a grassy marsh that fills and empties with the tides. Five acres and the adjacent State Forest invite adventure, relaxation, and visiting with family and friends. The Salt Marsh House has two disparate bedrooms and a den with a pull-out couch for overflow guests. All the amenities one would expect, including Wi-Fi and Apple TV. Guest Access Everywhere besides storage. Go explore! Interaction with Guests We move regularly between Hartford and Guilford and are a phone call away, but figure our guests appreciate some time to themselves The Neighborhood The charms of Guilford's town green and marina, dating to the 1600s, are a 4-minute drive away; but the water, grasses, and shifting light that surround the house may hold you in place Getting Around Driving everywhere is easy; We also suggest hiking, canoeing, or riding bikes Other Things to Note Property is bordered by a ridge on one side and state forest on the other, so the tranquility is yours + More
rules: House Rules Treat the place as if it belonged to your best friend's parents. And when you publish your novel, be sure to mention the Salt Marsh in your acknowledgements. Pets welcome, with an additional $40 cleaning fee + More

about: Come share our newly renovated, warm and inviting cabin in a private gated community overlooking Candlewood Lake.
description: Description The Space Green Pond is our serene weekend getaway from the vigors of city life, just 90 minutes from Manhattan on the border of New York and Connecticut. Secluded high above Candlewood Lake you can watch the seasons change and enjoy the peacefulness and beautiful scenery. There are lake views from all three bedrooms, the living and dining room and a deck for alfresco eating or afternoon drinks watching the sunset over the lake. A short 5 minute walk away is Green Pond, a tranquil and private spring-fed pond with two beaches  it is truly one of the loveliest places to swim. Alternatively, head down to Candlewood Lake and access one of the two private beaches for boating, fishing and water sports . There's also a back garden with lake views and fire pit for lazy afternoons reading beneath the trees and watching the boats go by. Most of all, Green Pond is a place to detach, unwind and enjoy the beautiful views and nature at its best. Highlights: Living room  large comfy sofa and cosy armchair, perfect for reading a great book or taking in the view Fireplace  featuring modern black glazed brick tile Dining  spacious farmhouse plank table Deck  opens up from the living room with views over Candlewood Lake and an outdoor table setting Master bedroom  luxurious king-sized bed, stylish lighting fixtures, rocking chair, lake views Bedroom 2  twin beds, great for kids, Eames chairs, lake views Bedroom 3  king bed, lake views Kitchen  fully-stocked with modern appliances including blender, coffee machine, juicer; woodland views Library  get inspired with our magazine collection or lose yourself in a good book Laundry  washer and dryer available to use during your stay Garden  garden with a fire pit, shady trees and lake views Nature  watch the local woodpeckers, northern red cardinal, squirrel, chipmunk, deer, fox, wild turkey, eagles; and wild raspberry picking in season * there is no TV, but wifi internet is available if you have the need to connect * we have a 3 year old and all baby/ child related paraphernalia can be made available upon request. Getting Around The cabin is easily reached from New York City by both car and train (Metro North Wassaic line to Pawling). Taxi's and car services are available from the train station. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking inside the cabin. No pets. No gatherings of more than 6 people without prior permission. + More

about: Beautiful mid-century modern glass and wood house in the forest, featuring designer spaces and brand new bathrooms. Only 2 hours from New York City and Boston, by train or by car, this is the ideal sanctuary for a perfect getaway, minimum 3 nights.
description: Description The Space Bright and modern home built in 1977 with contemporary clean lines and interesting architectural details. There are lots of rooms, 2,580 sqf. of them, on several split levels offering the perfect balance between open living and intimate spaces. The many walls of glass make you feel that you are part of the surrounding nature yet the modern decor and amenities provide for all the luxuries you deserve. Complete privacy is guaranteed by the surrounding trees and 3,8 acres of land. The Bedrooms (3 full, 2 convertible) There are three proper bedrooms, the master bedroom with fireplace as well as the second bedroom with en-suite bathroom are on the second floor with lots of natural daylight and an airy feel, both feature queen size beds. The third, slightly smaller bedroom also features a queen size bed is on the lower ground floor with its own patio and direct access into the lawn. Both the office, overlooking the kitchen dining area, as well as the media room which is completely private, have sleeper sofas that can be converted into comfortable single (or lovers) sleeping quarters. The Bathrooms (3.5), 2.5 Brand New! The bathrooms have just been fully redone, combining luxurious elegance with 21st century style. The master bathroom has double sinks and a large walk-in shower and serves the master bedroom and both conversion rooms. The second bathroom featuring shower and sink is an en-suite to the second bedroom. The third bathroom is down the hallway of the lower level bedroom, this one is a little small and not yet renovated, some guests prefer to use the master bath. Next to the main entrance is a stylish and well-designed half bath or powder room with toilet and sink. Living & Dining The centerpiece of the property is the large living room with a beautiful fireplace, a designer sofa, two arm chairs and a rocking chair. A split level up is the dining area seating 8 very comfortably. The sun room, adjacent to the living room, which is ideal for aperitifs or a quiet read, leads onto the outdoor patio for dining, BBQs or lounging. The kitchen is equipped with all the modern appliances one would expect, it has lots of natural daylight and is spacious enough for a serious team cook out, adjacent is the kitchen dining area, seating 6 to 8. This area features 3 sides of glass walls and leads onto the surrounding patio, this is our favorite place to enjoy breakfast. Other Perks 1/4 mile driveway off the main road CT-156 and Saunders Hollow Road ensures absolute calm and total privacy. Two car garage on property and plenty of outdoor space for additional cars Media room with large 50" TV, Xfinity & Rokku, surround sound throughout the house, iPod docking station Separate office area if you must catch up on emails, although wireless is available throughout the house and the outdoors. Who should stay: Ideal for couples of all genres, groups of friends, families with teenage or older children, architect and design admirers, adventurists, nature and outdoor sports lovers. Not so ideal for families with very young children, elderly or physically challenged people as there are many stairs throughout the house. Beaches & Water Sports Whilst not directly located on the water, there are many water fun options nearby. The closest beach, Old Lyme's very own, is a 10 minute drive from the house, 20 minutes by bike. Connecticut River access is 3 minutes drive or 10 minutes walk from the property or Rodgers Lake is a 10 minute drive; for both there are excellent options for kayaking, canoeing, even swimming and fishing. Other things to do Great biking, cycling, hiking opportunities, explore the uniqueness of Connecticut River whether it be the ferry crossing, Gillette Castle or the Goodspeed Playhouse. Our favorite and best kept secret dining and antique or art shopping recommendations can be provided upon request. Getting there Old Lyme is exactly two hours from both New York and Boston. Take exit 70 on I95 and go east on CT-156 for 2 miles to reach the property. It is recommended to have a car (or bike or roller), however there is an Enterprise rent-a-car close to the Old Saybrook train station (they pick you up at the train, if you ask). Old Saybrook can be reached by Amtrak from both New York and Boston in 2 hours or from New York via Metro North and Connecticut Shoreline changing in New Heaven. For more questions or tips, please contact us directly. Guest Access Guests have access to all the rooms and facilities of the house and the surroundings including outdoor patio, charcoal grill, two bikes and 3.8 acres of forest. Interaction with Guests We interact with guests pre and during the stay, and if possible we try to meet the guests either at check-in or check-out but if we are not able to be on location, our very friendly and helpful property manager will be there to greet you. + More

about: Lovely, renovated 4-bedroom house located in the center of West Cornwall, CT. Walk to farmer's market, Housatonic River and restaurants. 10 Minute drive to public lake. 3 king beds/2 twins, full-kitchen, dining area, living room, patio, W/D, parking.(2 night min)
description: Description The Space This New England vacation home is secluded but not isolated. Your family can enjoy the 1/2 acre of yard around the house. This house is generously sized and accommodates up to 8 people comfortably. There are four bedrooms and four full bathrooms with comfortable cotton linens and pillows, towels also provided. Bedroom/Bathroom Description: 2nd Floor Bedroom #1 (pictured) - includes twin beds/comfortable chair/dresser and closet space - adjacent bathroom with jacuzzi tub Bedroom #2 (pictured) - includes king bed (can be converted to twin beds, if needed) dresser, full closet - connected bathroom with shower, sink, toilet 1st Floor Bedroom #3 (pictured) - includes king bed (can be converted to twin beds, if needed) dresser, full closet, separate entrance if needed - adjacent bathroom (handicap accessible) with shower, sink, toilet Bedroom #4 (pictured) - includes king bed (can be converted to twin beds, if needed) dresser, mirror, full closet and connected bathroom (handicap accessible) with shower, sink, and toilet. Laundry facilities are available on each floor (full W/D). The first floor also boasts handicap accessible bedrooms/bathrooms. There is a full kitchen open to the living room with extensive windows offering natural light all day. French doors from open living room/kitchen lead to open to a full patio including a grill, sun protection and seating for 4. Perfect vacation home/spot for couples or families with children. Guest Access Guests will have access to the entire property during stay, except the top porch. Interaction with Guests Owners will be available to answer questions and assist with accommodations upon arrival and departure. Please feel free to contact with any questions or concerns. The Neighborhood West Cornwall is a historic New England town with a few restaurants, nearby stores, and local farmers' market. Public clay tennis courts, as well as local beach (for a nominal fee) are also available to guests. Mohawk Ski mountain is a 10 minute drive away or a 35 minute drive to Butternut Ski area. The Covered Bridge located in the town is a historical landmark. Getting Around Car needed for this rental. Nearby Metro-North Railroad (20-25 mins drive) (website hidden) - Harlem Line (Wassaic stop), however, will need a car to travel to/from train station. Other Things to Note West Cornwall is a historic New England town with a few restaurants, nearby stores, and local farmers' market. Public clay tennis courts, as well as local beach (for a nominal fee) are also available to guests. Mohawk Ski mountain is a 10 minute drive or a 35 minute drive to Butternut Ski area. The Covered Bridge located in the town is a historical landmark. + More
