about: Beautiful 3 bedroom ocean view home w/ private beach access. 5 min walk to public Penfield & Jennings Beach or Metro North Train (75 min direct to NYC). Private patio, balcony, garden, kayak, bike, loft & laundry. Great for entertainment & retreat.
description: Description The Space Beautiful 3 bedroom ocean view home w/ private beach access. 5 min walk to public Penfield & Jennings Beach or Metro North Train (75 min direct to NYC). INSIDE: Walk into a beautiful mud room, drop of your beach towels, chairs and sunscreen, kick off your shoes and come upstairs. There are two full bathrooms, 2 private bedrooms and an entertainment room that includes a ladder up to a loft and meditation room that can be used as a third bedroom. In the entertainment room enjoy a desk (if you need to work while you stay), garden views from the back window and ocean views from the front private balcony and a skylight. Our book shelf in this room is full of sailing tips, travel guides, marketing books, self help, personal development, success secrets, energy healing, entrepreneur inspiration and more. Feel free to kick your feet up on the extra wide coach or soft chair with chaise and get lost in a book or our massive big screen T.V. Climb up the ladder to find a private meditation room, window overlooking the garden and a super comfy air mattress where you can clear your mind and take a nap. Just off the entertainment room/bedroom there is a washer and dryer tucked away behind rolling doors. In this nook you'll find a window overlooking the garden and shelves for folding also full of all the essentials for keeping fresh and looking fine during your stay. Continue into the living room where there is plenty of seating and 360' windows all around for tons of natural light. Enjoy the charm of the spiral staircase and ocean home decor. We've got board games galore, puzzles and surround sound built into the ceilings. Plug your Iphone into the doc, switch on Pandora with our WIFI and enjoy your favorite music throughout the house. Head right into the dining room and kitchen. We have all brand new appliances, electric stove and a dishwasher for easy clean up. We've got all the dishes you could need for entertaining, a coffee bean grinder, french press, soda maker, ice machine, tea set and more. Eat at the table natural wood table (seats up to 7) and enjoy a night cap on the attached and enclosed sun deck for a gorgeous view and ocean breeze. Head up the spiral stairs, noticing the open skylight and into to the master bedroom. We've got a salt air lamp ready to purify the air and a beautiful and soft queen size bed for a good nights rest. Enjoy the private balcony and master bath with shower and jacuzzi tub. Next to this room you'll find the guest room/nursery with a daybed and ocean views. This room has a lusciously soft twin size bed with 3 drawers below that can pull out. This allows you to instantly turn it into a queen size bed by flipping over the doubled up mattress. This room is also equipped with a baby changing station and crib if you have a young one joining you. EXTRA PERKS INSIDE: The house if fully heated with adjustable thermometers in every room for cold fall and winter days/nights. There are 360' windows and sky lights that open up allowing a fresh, cool breeze in spring. There are 3 window unit air conditioners throughout the house that keep the whole house cool in summer. All of the water throughout the house is filtered and Flouride free. You're skin will feel so soft and you can drink the freshest water you've ever had from anywhere in the house. OUTSIDE: If you're here to enjoy the outdoors you'll find a beach cruiser, mountain bike, Kayak, Scooter, Roller Blades, Basketball and Frisbee's in the garage. There's a big private grass area just downstairs and outside the double french doors with a basketball hoop and play area too. You can take the Kayak down the private creek from the backyard and paddle directly to the ocean. Or enjoy a picnic in our garden patio, kick up your feet on our cushioned patio furniture and block the sun with the solar twinkling umbrella. The garden is beautiful during spring and summer so enjoy all the flowers and butterflies (they love the lush butterfly bush). There's a vegetable garden in the backyard, feel free to pick fresh herbs for your at home meals and enjoy the BBQ and picnic table. There's private parking for up to 6 cars. Our street attracts runners, bikers and families who like to walk along the water views so feel free to join in on the fun. THE SURROUNDING AREA/TOWN: Enjoy private beach access right across the street. We're walking distance to the main town where you can enjoy shopping and some of the best restaurants in Fairfield County. You've got Penfolds and Jennings Public Beach (just a 10 minute walk from our door step). The Metro North Train is a 5 minute drive or 15 minute walk from door to door that will take you directly to Stamford, NYC or any main surrounding town. Guest Access You will have access to the full home and one garage. Interaction with Guests We are fully available if you have any questions and have a house manager that lives in town who is accessible for any special needs or concerns. The Neighborhood Our street attracts runners, bikers and families who like to walk along the water views so feel free to join in on the fun. Enjoy private beach access right across the street. We're walking distance to the main town where you can enjoy shopping and some of the best restaurants in Fairfield County. Whole foods is a 5 minute drive if you'd like to stalk the fridge with food for the week. You've got Penfolds and Jennings Public Beach (just a 10 minute walk from our door step). Getting Around We're walking distance to the main town or a 5 minute drive with tons of parking there. You've got Penfolds and Jennings Public Beach (just a 10 minute walk from our door step). Or you can drive over, just beware it's $20 to park. The Metro North Train is a 5 minute drive or 15 minute walk from door to door that will take you directly to Stamford, NYC or any main surrounding town. You can also call a cab or use Uber at anytime. + More
rules: House Rules Our home is beautifully decorated and kept super clean. You will be responsible for taking great care of everything and leaving it just as you came. Any broken or stained items will be covered by your deposit. Members of our family have potentially fatal allergies to pets and smoke. Therefore we do not allow pets and there is NO smoking anywhere inside the house. We have a a very high NO tolerance rule for both of these and will keep the full $1,000 deposit for extensive cleaning if there is any hint of these occurring inside the house. Because there is white furniture and breakable items we ask that you choose this home for your stay when you are certain you and your guests will be cautious and respectful. For this reason we have a policy for a maximum of 6 overnight guests. We also ask you to use your discretion on whether this is the right space for young children who are mobile and may have trouble keeping the furniture clean and items on the shelves. about: Sunrise over the water! Sunset too, from the deck that faces east, over the water on exclusive Masons Island, in Mystic. You won't want to leave, it's Paradise!
description: Description The Space Beautiful home on the water, facing east. Watch the sunrises, or sunsets, looking over Long Island Sound. Refinished hardwood floors, and a brand new kitchen make this a unique place to spend a few days to relax. Guest Access Take long, or short walks around the exclusive Masons Island. Go for a swim on the sandy beach down the street, or bring your bikes and go into downtown Mystic for dinner. But you will want to eat here, and enjoy the quiet, and the views Interaction with Guests I will be away when you stay in my home, so I might not be able to meet you, but someone will, or I can tell you where the key is. The Neighborhood Exclusive Masons Island is a place out of the past. Ride your bikes, or take walks with virtually no traffic, or noise. The home is on a dead end street, making it all the more peaceful. Getting Around Drive your car, or your bike, or even walk into Mystic if you want to leave the peace and quiet of my home. Amtrak services Mystic, so arrive by train and take a taxi to the house. Other Things to Note In the area is the famous Mystic Pizza, but also recommended are many fine restaurants. The Historic Mystic Seaport Museum, and the Aquarium are just minutes away, and if you want, Foxwoods, and the Mohegan Sun are close by too. I prefer the peace and quiet of my back yard, overlooking Long Island Sound. + More
rules: House Rules We have simple rules on Masons Island, such as turn the music down after 10pm. Be respectful of the neighbors, and the community. No more than four people please, and prefer you don't have a party with other visitors here. + More

about: Our charming and roomy three bedroom, two bath beach house with yard has all the comforts of home! It is just half a block from beautiful Ocean Beach Park, with a pass that provides parking and beach use for your carload! www.o(URL HIDDEN)
description: Description The Space Welcome to our comfortable Cape Cod style house in a picturesque beach community - just a 3 minute walk to Ocean Beach Park! Our home is located on a quiet one way street. It is freshly painted and has newly refinished wood floors throughout. On the first floor, the home has a living room with sofa bed and 32 inch flat screen TV, dining room, recently remodeled and fully equipped kitchen, double bedroom, enclosed, three season front and back porches for lots of extra space, and bathroom with shower. You can also eat on the back porch at our large dining table. Upstairs, three people can be accommodated in the king bedroom, since it also has a twin bed. Across the hall is a queen bedroom. This room also has a futon to sleep two. The full bath has a tub/shower. There are room air conditioners throughout the house for your comfort. The pretty, fenced back yard has a new large wood patio for relaxation. Enjoy the ocean breezes! During the summer months, free family passes to Ocean Beach Park are included with your reservation. You can walk or drive into Ocean Beach Park, rated as one of the best beaches by National Geographic. You and the kids will love the long white sand beach, boardwalk, arcade, ice cream, Olympic-sized pool, water slides, and a water spray park for young children. Evening activities include Monday night Classic Car shows, Tuesday night family movies on the sand and Wednesday night magic shows. Live music shows and fireworks are also scheduled during the summer season. During the summer months (late June through Labor Day), we prefer to rent the home by the week, from Saturday to Saturday, but will consider shorter stays or arrivals on other days. Multi-week discounts are available. The house is available year-round. Guest Access You will have sole use of the house and fenced yard. We have a lovely outdoor wood patio that you will enjoy. You also have a vehicle or walk-in pass to beautiful Ocean Beach Park, a three minute walk away. Interaction with Guests We live a mile away and hopefully will have the opportunity to meet you at some point and will be responsive should an issue arise. However, the home will be yours and we respect your privacy. The Neighborhood It's beachy, casual and quiet. The neighbors are friendly and welcoming. Getting Around The house is located three miles from the downtown New London transportation center which offers Amtrak train service and Greyhound bus service. Taxis are also available in New London. + More

description: Description The Space Rate is for largest room in weekend in high season. Contact us for more rates! Lookup our own site on the internet (type: Orange Gild Washington CT) for detailed rates and details. Our luxurious guest rooms are well equiped (air-conditioning, wifi, TV, alarm clock, hair dryer) and they both have a private bath room. 3 or 4 persons can sleep in these rooms without a problem! Included in the room rate is a luxurious full breakfast and free use of the spa with a Finnish (traditional) sauna, infrared sauna and steam shower. The owners have their own quarters so you can also use the living room and dining room. The dcor throughout the house can be described as European Comfort: comfortable stylish modern beds and chairs mixed with antiques and modern art (some paintings are made by the owner) We opened our doors for you this summer and you will find luxury, comfort and relaxation at our recently renovated Saltbox: spacious rooms - one is big enough for a small family - with king beds, comfortable chairs and tastefully designed private bathrooms. Your stay includes access to our spa (with several saunas) and complimentary refreshments from our wet bar all day. Our lavish breakfast with a choice of cold and hot American and Dutch dishes completes your upscale Bed & Breakfast experience! Ron and Marian have their own quarters so your privacy is guaranteed. Take a rest in our garden or go for a trip in the beautiful surroundings: we are after all located in the center of the Litchfield Hills CT, the perfect base for excursions. Enjoy shopping at the many antiques shops and art galleries, visit the local bookstore with many book signings or try some wine tasting. Visit historic houses and gardens. Or just go for a drive in the wonderful rolling Litchfield Hills and discover quaint New England towns. If you are looking for a more active stay you should try some of the wonderful hiking routes or go canoeing at one of the lovely lakes in the area. Mohawk Mountain Ski Area is only a half hour drive away and offers good possibilities for a nice day of skiing. Whatever you decide to do you will not have any problems finding a nice restaurant in the area to end a good and relaxing day! You can find all this in less than two hours from New York and three hours from Boston! Our luxurious Bed and Breakfast is located near many boarding schools in the Litchfield Hills of Connecticut. Because we have just opened our business we have rooms available for you most of the time this year. Our prices vary so please contact us to get your rate! Guest Access Rented room + SPA + Living room + Wetbar + Dining room + private hall Other Things to Note Rate is for largest room in weekend in high season. Contact us for more rates! about: Gentle breezes grace the River~Star* house, located on the river road opposite Mystic Seaport. Sea chanties from Seaport sailors fill early evening hours, while periodic whistle calls from steamboat Sabino provide a sense of living history.
description: Description The Space Come enjoy an authentic 19th century captain's home with morning breakfast served on a sun-drenched deck overlooking Mystic Seaport, and evening cocktails enjoyed in the lovely gardens shaded by a Connecticut-designated Notable Giant Sequoia redwood tree. A scenic five-minute walk from downtown Mystic, this home provides easy access to numerous area attractions, including: Mystic Seaport, Mystic Aquarium, and Mystic Village; the USS Nautilus Museum; the Revolutionary-War era forts, Griswold and Trumbull (attacked by native son Benedict Arnold); Foxwoods Casino; and the traditional fishing/lobstering villages of Stonington and Noank. With an average of 211 days of sunshine annually, River~ Star* enjoys one of New England's loveliest micro-climates and a lifestyle that allows you to fully experience the romance of the sea. River~ Star* is an historic, three-story, 4-bedroom, 4-bath house with a fully-equipped kitchen. Bedrooms are configured as follows: Captain's Room, upper floor: Sleeps 2 in queen bed. En suite bath with modern shower tower Dormer Room, upper floor: Sleeps 2 in antique twin spindle beds. Shared bath. First Mate's Room, upper floor: Sleeps 3 in antique poster double bed + twin-sized built-in bunk. Shared bath. Queen Anne Room, lower floor: Sleeps 2 in antique poster queen bed. En suite bath with tub. For interior photos, visit (URL HIDDEN) Rentals are available for a minimum of one week during the summer season. Guest Access River~Star* sits on a 1/2 acre-lot overlooking the Mystic River. Guests have use of the attached elevated deck overlooking the river, as well as the beautiful garden in the backyard. Interaction with Guests The house will be your private home during your stay. The Neighborhood River~Star* is part of the Mystic River Historical District. According to the 1979 National Register nomination, the importance of the district "...derives from the completeness of the 19th-century community here preserved. Seldom are houses, public buildings, stores, and factories of a 19th century town all in place, in good condition, and still in use, as they are in Mystic. The variety of architectural styles that the prosperous seafaring citizens employed in building up their community provide fine examples of the ongoing, 19th-century development of taste and design." Downtown Mystic, with numerous stores & restaurants, the Mystic River waterfront wharf, the Mystic River Art Society and the Mystic-Noank library are all within a 10-minute walk from RIver~Star*. The Mystic Train depot and Mystic Seaport are also walkable distances (~15 minutes). Getting Around Mystic is easily accessible by car or rail from Boston and New York, by ferry from Long Island, or by private plane into nearby Groton airport. Other Things to Note This is an historic house, built in mid-1800's. Modern amenities include a fully equipped kitchen with gas stove, 4 newly-renovated bathrooms (including a powerful shower tower), wireless internet and a Roku video streaming device. The house has 3 stair cases and may be difficult for those who cannot easily climb stairs. Rooms are equipped with fans, but not AC. + More
rules: House Rules This is a treasured historic house and we ask that guests treat River~Star* with respect and gentle care. There is strictly NO SMOKING allowed. Pets over 20 pounds are not allowed. The area is vibrant, but residential, and we ask that guests not disturb neighbors with loud noises. Limited areas of the house (e.g. basement workshop) are set aside for owner's use only. + More

about: Top rated luxury bed & breakfast in the picturesque village of Stony Creek in Branford CT right on the water with magnificent views of Long Island Sound from every room. There are two elegant guest bedrooms each with private baths. Full breakfast.
description: Description The Space Thimble Islands B&B is an elegant home featuring magnificent views of Stony Creek harbor, the Thimble Islands and Long Island Sound. It is ideal for guests seeking a quiet, romantic, relaxing getaway in one of Connecticut's most scenic locations. Innkeepers Julie & Tony Broom are proud of their renowned hospitality and excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. Guest Access Thimble Islands Bed & Breakfast has two private guest rooms, each with private bath, a large living room, television room, dining room for serving breakfast in winter, screened porch for summer breakfasts, large garden terrace and pier, and driveway with ample parking. Interaction with Guests Innkeepers Julie & Tony Broom extend a warm welcome at check in (normally 1-6pm), provide recommendations on local dining and touring, assist with restaurant reservations, and sit with our guests for a late afternoon happy hour of complimentary wine and cheese. We are always available to chat or answer questions. The Neighborhood The scenic village of Stony Creek in the Town of Branford, CT is unique with its cluster of tiny islands hugging its shoreline: the Thimble Islands. There are 23 inhabited islands off the coast of Stony Creek, the smallest of which are just large enough for one house and the largest accommodating 30 summer homes. The homes vary from small bungalows that have been in families for generations to seaside mansions. Narrated boat tours are available from Memorial Day through mid October. Getting Around A car is desirable for getting to Stony Creek and for touring the local area. Metro North trains from New York to New Haven connect to Shoreline East trains that stop in Branford. The bed & breakfast is about five miles from either the Branford or the Guilford train stations. Other Things to Note The entire Shoreline region offers magnificent New England scenery with charming seaside towns, quaint village greens, boutique shopping, fine dining, local lobster shacks, Hammonnassett State Park, and outlet malls. The vibrant cultural life of New Haven is 15 minutes away, and the Connecticut River valley and Mystic Seaport are less than one hour away. + More
rules: House Rules We ask our guests to respect our quiet residential setting, to drive slowly down our private road, and to not make noise outside after 10:00 pm. The kitchen is available only for storing essentials in the refrigerator and for getting ice, not for cooking. Guests are served a full breakfast and are requested to eat their lunch and dinner at local restaurants. + More

about: Beautiful private home with 2 private rooms, bath, laundry and use of kitchen, beach,gardens. Owner in residence for work on the lower level. Rent entire home (excluding lower, basement level with full use of home and it's beachside amenities.
description: Description The Space A charming shoreline home that is 300 yards from my association beach in beautiful Madison, CT. A/C, ceiling fans, continental breakfast, laundry and a warm and welcoming hostess and her two King Charles Cavalier dogs, Blanket and Summer. The space is open and relaxing. Bring your jet skis, kyacks, bikes and boats. A car is highly recommended since we are not close to public transportation. We are located on the shoreline of Connecticut directly off Route 1 (aka Boston Post Rd) and close to 95. . The closest towns are Madison and Guilford, is located approx 2-3 miles away where you will find great restaurants, shops, a new french bakery, and the town green. No minimum stay during the week, however, during the summer months (June, July, August) I request a 2 night minimum stay if booking between Thursday and Sunday. But please inquire, as I may be able to accommodate a 1 night rental if I have an opening. Perfect for a couple. Private bedroom with King size tempeurpedic bed; high ceilings; Modern Bath with beautiful fixtures, a jacuzzi and shower; large glass sliding french doors. A gorgeous Front stone patio overlooking a beautiful garden. A 2nd bdrm with laundry and full size bed. I do provide an extra aero bed with bedding that can accomodate an additional 1-2 guests and/or children for an additional $25 per person. A vacay spot for sure. Guest Access Access to entire home accept lower level where homeowner works. Laundry, kitchen, common room, garden area, patio, and beach. Interaction with Guests Interaction will be based on the guests needs. I will not interfere at the guests requests but will be most helpful as needed. I will be there to bake, make coffee, afternoon tea and scones as well as recommend places to go and see. I know the entire surrounding areas and all this beautiful area has to offer. i.e., great restaurants, cool bars, music, lawn concerts, shopping, boat rentals, cultural activities, and more. The Neighborhood I am located inbetween the Long Island Sound (moonrise) and the Neck River (Sunset). 1/8th of a mile away is a retreat environment where they offer Yoga on the beach (their beach) every Sat and Sun morning. There is a boat launch at the end of my street for larger boats and Jet Ski launch. At the beginning of the street, exactly 1 mile down, there is a country store and deli and a package store. The Package store is open on Sunday's. The town green is 2 miles away. Farmer's market is on the green every Fri afternoon. The town had restaurants, a cinema, coffee shop, apparel boutiques, golf driving range, large grocery store which is located behind the town shops. And, of course, there is a Starbucks, if you so desire. Hammonassett State Park is 3 miles away from the house. The largest sandy beach state park in CT. Breathtaking. Getting Around There is no convenient transit to get around town, but there is a train that will take you to New Haven and NYC.There is a commuter train to take you to Old Saybrook and New London. Otherwise it's a car bike, scooter or your own legs. Other Things to Note This is a comfortable environment. I'm layed back, low key, and honest. I trust you will treat my home the way you would want to have your home treated-like its your own. This is a fabulous space with everything you could possibly need. Please note, this house is for sale so it may be shown during your stay. Please keep house tidy. Thank you very much. + More
rules: House Rules Please be respectful of my home and neighbors. I have two small dogs who hang out in the kitchen or with me in my studio. I prefer no babies or pets. Upon acceptance, I will email you area fun spots, house rules, etc. Sometimes, I've made special offers to those that can care for my dogs if I have to travel the days you are here. + More

Downstairs you'll find a nice living room with a fireplace that has been with the house since it's creation in 1898. about: Our home is a classic shingle-style beach house with tons of light, plenty of space, comfortable and classic furnishings and loaded with modern conveniences. Just three houses from the water in a quiet safe neighborhood on a dead end road.
description: Description The Space Our home is a classic shingle-style beach house with tons of light, plenty of space, comfortable and classic furnishings and loaded with modern conveniences. The best part, however, is the location - just three houses from the water in a quiet safe neighborhood on a dead end road. Our beach is private and for the residents of our neighborhood, but since it is rarely occupied, you will likely have your very own private beach experience! The CT shoreline is full of beach alternatives, should you want variety; Hammonasset Park is a short stroll away. There is even a hiking/biking trail at the end of our street that leads to the Park if you are looking for more vigorous activity. Other activities popular to the region include hiking, biking, kayaking (3 included), paddle boarding, fishing, bird watching, just to name a few. Guest Access The house itself has three bedrooms and an open loft, all fully furnished with all necessary linens. The master is a large room with water views, a new and super comfortable king sized bed, HDTV with cable access and a DVD player. On the same level are two additional bedrooms making this a perfect family or large group get away  one is outfitted with a full bed, the second with two twin beds. The loft space can be used as an additional sleeping space. The kitchen is modern and comfortable for a group to gather and offers a breakfast bar for additional space. It is fully furnished and the stainless appliances are new. In the living room you will find space to relax. On cooler evenings, there is even a gas fireplace for your comfort. This is my personal favorite room to put my feet up and relax with the Sunday paper over coffee or to enjoy a glass of wine in the evening. Lastly on the main floor is a den with lots of light and French doors leading to the large deck where you will find a gas grill and outdoor furniture for dining al-fresco on a nice summer night. For the older kids in your group, there is a teen room" on the lower level with a Wii, HDTV, and streaming video. Interaction with Guests I'm available 24 hours a day by phone or text. My permanent residence is less than a mile away, so I can be on site on short notice. The Neighborhood Madison is a quaint New England town on the Long Island Sound which attracts a sophisticated mix of residents and visitors from all over the world. People are drawn to the town by its traditional New England feel coupled with breathtaking waterfront vistas. While downtown Madison is full of quaint shops and fine dining, nearby towns offer several alternatives - I'd be happy to be your guide to the shoreline while at the house! During the summer season, special events are plentiful and the quaint church greens and downtown areas come alive with concerts and other attractions. Additionally, Madison's own R.J.Julia bookstore hosts an ongoing lecture series by world class authors while next door, in Branford, the Thimble Island Cruises take visitors past the summer cottages of the rich and famous, both past and present. Madison is less than two hours from NYC and just slightly further from Boston. It is an ideal place to explore the beaches, shopping, fine dining, endless activities, in addition to the history of the CT shoreline. At our house, you can do it all! + More

Enjoy the community amenities all located right on the property like the resident lounge equipped with a fireplace, basketball & racquetball courts and landscaped BBQ & picnic areas. description: Description The Space Unique luxury getaway in the beautiful Litchfield Hills of Connecticut, and Southern Berkshires. Elegant 23-acre estate and year-round getaway. Room includes gourmet breakfast, wi-fi, free parking, TV. Onsite Amenities: spa services, fitness room, billiard room, library, media room; seasonal pool, jacuzzi & tennis court; bicycles, hiking path. Located just 3 miles from historic Norfolk, CT town center, Infinity Hall Norfolk Chamber Music Festival and Yale Summer School of Music; just 30 miles from Tanglewood, Jacob's Pillow and Hartford, CT. Area has great vineyards, art, dance, music, theater and shopping. The estate has gardens, large collection of specimen trees, apple orchard & berry patch where you you are welcome to pick from. Our breakfast features fresh fruits, juices, Greek yogurt, local granola, artisan breads & cheeses, house-cured gravlax, and a vegetarian friendly frittata. Spa, massage and wellness services are available with prior reservations, including Swedish massage, couple's massage and reflexology. We are located in the heart of New England country villages with nearby State Parks, hiking, biking, skiing, ropes course / zip line, antiquing, fall foliage, and Mark Twain House. A great destination year-round! + More

about: Unplug and unwind. Enjoy peaceful island living in a charming summer home located on one of the larger Thimble Islands in Long Island Sound. The home is located directly on the water and has a sunny, bright southern exposure with panoramic views.
description: Description The Space Awake to spectacular sunrises from the large porch that sits just above the water. Relax and dine on the porch watching boats sailing by and enjoying the unparalleled views, summer breezes and gorgeous moonrises. Enjoy the landscaped yard and beautiful gardens, or kayak, swim or fish from the private floating dock in front. Guest Access Transportation to and from the island by water taxi is easily accessed from Stony Creek and runs on the hour (by request). Interaction with Guests If you have questions we will always available to your call. The Neighborhood The cottage is located on a beautiful island with 12 other homes. It is a friendly family-oriented community who are living there to enjoy the peace and beauty that island living provides. Other Things to Note A lovely additional in-law cottage is available for rent with rental of main house only with kitchen, bathroom living area and bedroom with queen-size bed. All glass front overlooking large 300 sq.ft. deck built over the water. This cottage is available for $900 per week. + More

about: Built in 1853, this 3700 sq ft South Sherman historical home nestled in the woods was once a Quaker church. Main house features 3 bedrooms, 2 baths and 2 fireplaces, and the detached studio guesthouse overlooking the terrace provides extra space to relax or work.
description: Description The Space This is a truly secluded antique home at the top of a dead-end road, nestled in the northern Fairfield County woods and surrounded by hiking trails, just 90 mins outside New York City and a stones throw from Mauweehoo and Candlewood Lakes. The house is perfect for either an escape from NYC, a destination immersion in the spectacular fall foliage, or visiting one of the many local boarding schools (including Kent, South Kent, Marvelwood, Trinity Pawling and Canterbury). Guest Access The main house has an upstairs master bedroom and bath with attached sitting area (also a good place for small children to sleep), a woodburning stove in the formal living room, a stone fireplace in the great room, and a vintage kitchen straight out of Leave It To Beaver (linoleum and all!). There is also a dining area, sunroom, sitting room/office, and two more bedrooms. The guest cottage has a studio bedroom, and can double as an artist's studio or second office. + More
rules: House Rules This home is dog-friendly and the yard is fenced in so your pup(s) can run around outside carefree. Just remember we're in the country and 'tis the season for ticks, so it's a good idea to check for them. Leave all the towels washed and in the laundry room (off the kitchen) on the date of your departure. It's fine if they are still in the dryer when you leave. There is laundry detergent by the washing machine and dryer sheets on top of the dryer. Remember to turn off the water source to the washing machine when you are done to save energy and prevent leaks (little black lever to the left of the machine: forward is ON, back is OFF). Strip the beds of the sheets and pillow cases before you leave, and leave the dirty linens in the laundry room (on the floor is okay). No need to wash them_unless you want to! Leave dishes hand washed or in the dish washer and washed. There is dishwasher detergent under the sink. The dishwasher doesn't turn off by itself, so when the countdown clock is at 1 press the power" button to manually turn off. Please hand wash anything in the kitchen made of wood and also sharp kitchen knives Bag up garbage, separating out recycling, and leave either in the kitchen or near the laundry room. There is no garbage pick-up here. Do not leave outside as the animals will get into it. No smoking indoors. You may smoke outside, but do not throw butts in the yard or flush them down the toilet  dispose of them properly in the garbage. There will be a surcharge of an additional $100 if the house is left exceptionally messy (surfaces are not cleared, dishes are dirty or mud is tracked through the house). Accidents happen, so if you do break any dishes or glasses please let me know. There will be a charge for broken crystal or stemware. If there are mishaps resulting in stains on the carpets or upholstery, you will be charged for professional cleaning. + More

about: Escape to The Lakehouse on Spur: A perfectly peaceful home, appointed to make you feel at home with hotel touches. Every season in the region offers guests great opportunities for fun, relaxation: skiing, swimming, hiking, shopping and play.
description: Description The Space Nothing compares to being close and yet feeling so far away. Enjoy the escape to Candlewood Lake. The Lakehouse on Spur is nestled in a small lake community with direct water access on a rare no-wake-zone stretch of Candlewood where you can enjoy peace and quiet. Powerboats putter-by, waving hello. No loud jetskis or waterskiing to wake you in the morning or disturb your afternoon reading or fishing. If you are an antique lover, you are close to several nearby towns offering plentiful antique shops and 'picker's' paradise thrift shops and flea markets. New England's largest outdoor flea market, The Elephant Trunk is a 15 minute drive. Epic Summertime County fairs, farmer's markets, farm stands and farm to table dining make country living or visiting ideal. Hiking, biking and all manner of water sports are available for you to choose. Nearby Marinas rent powerboats, etc. The owners provide optional rental Kayaks, a Sunfish sailboat and a 4 person pedal-boat to make your way across the lake to the town beach to meet the ice cream truck, have your kids play at the playground or to listen to music performed at the town's pavilion. The house has a large private dock for afternoon drinks, dining, fishing, swimming, with plenty of space to dock watercraft. Homebody guests can enjoy books, DVDs and boardgames for all ages. Winter provides other fun outdoor activities. Skiing is nearby. All the comforts of home await your arrival in a lovingly furnished 3 bedroom 2 bath cottage. There is an outside area for barbecuing, deck or patios for dining, sunbathing and taking in the views. The 1000 sf home offers a large living, kitchen and dining area. The unique, handmade walnut dining table seats 6+ comfortably. The kitchen island has three counter height chairs for additional dining space and for hanging out chatting with the chef (if you love cooking!) It's ideal for parents to feed hungry children after a full day of swimming, skiing or exploring the region. The kitchen is fully equipped for entertaining. The Master bedroom has a Queen-sized bed, TV and views of the lake. The gracefully appointed Guest room has a full size bed. The children's room also boasts a view of the lake and sleeps 3 (a bunk bed and trundle for 3rd child or friend). A modern touch inspired the newly renovated bathroom with a deep tub/shower combination. Ample linens and towels provided. (Beach towels too!) In the hall, a cubby was designed for you to keep your shoes and hang your coats. The unfinished basement offers a bonus full bathroom with a shower for those times you need the extra space. Pets are considered on a case by case basis. Regular housekeeping is available. This is a private home for your use with lakefront enjoyment, a private dock and yard The house is in a quiet beach community with incredible peace and nature surrounding you. It is in Sherman CT, voted the safest town to live in in CT and is quaint, small and centrally located to reach many nearby towns for antiquing, shoping, dining. This is a rural region with no public transportation. Guest Access This is a private home for your use with lakefront enjoyment, a 16' private dock for your boat, patios for dining and cocktails and a yard to play. Interaction with Guests Because we are nearby, in most cases we are available to welcome our guests and help respond to any specific needs or area recommendations. We respect our guests need for privacy, and let you be. We are not always free to welcome you, so have a convenient lock box for self service. The Neighborhood The house is in a quiet beach community with incredible peace and nature surrounding you. It is in Sherman CT, voted the safest town to live in in CT. It is quaint, small and centrally located to reach many nearby towns for antiquing, shoping, dining. Getting Around This is a rural region with no public transportation. A car is a necessity. + More

about: This Cape Cod style beach house gives you the true New England experience, with a small private beach just steps away! With 3 bedrooms and 2.5 bathrooms a group of 11 can be very comfortable.
description: Description The Space This Cape Cod style beach house gives you the true New England experience, with a small private beach just steps away! With 3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms a group of 11 can be very comfortable. The outdoor space was created for lounging all day long! Enjoy your morning cup of coffee and breakfast on the huge custom table that seats 11 very comfortably, then go to the beach and return to the house for lunch ( or pack a lunch - there is a picnic table at the beach as well!) Have your dinner outdoors, then move over to the other side of the outdoor area with Adirondack chairs to relax in the evening to stare at the stars! Guests have access to the entire home except for the use of the indoor fireplace and desktop computer as well as other areas which will made aware of when checking in. They will also have access to Guthrie Beach which is just steps away where an umbrella and chairs will be set up by our summer beach crew! We supply beach towels which are stored in the house. The beach also has a picnic table, showers & bathrooms which is amazing to have at as a convenience! All you need to bring is the suntan lotion! We will be waiting at the home to give you a key and show you around the house. The surrounding area offers guests the opportunity to visit well known historic areas such as, Mystic Seaport, Mystic Aquarium, Harkness Memorial Park, Fort Trumbull, Fort Griswold and Ocean Beach Park which has a boardwalk, minigolf, pools, water slides, playgrounds and food vendors. The legendary Ledge Rock Lighthouse is your view from your private beach ( Guthrie Beach)! There is also the Submarine Force Museum and USS Nautilus - Groton, CT which very interesting if interested in Maritime history. If you want a hearty breakfast before your day on the beach, take a short walk to The Yolk Cafe, which is on our Guidebook, you can enjoy an outdoor or indoor breakfast of eggs and pancakes in your bathing suit! Down the street is Michael's Dairy - which is a local ice cream parlor that serves up unique flavors that are always changing. All in all there is so much to do in New London. The house has a driveway that can fit 2 cars, and there is always free street parking right in front of the house. There is an Amtrack and ShoreLine East train station just a short 5 minute drive away in Downtown New London, as well as a Greyhound Bus station and Major Ferry Station - The Cross Sound Ferry that goes to Orient Point Long Island, where you can explore the wineries. There is the Block Island Ferry and the Fishers Island Ferry. There is no shortage of day trips you can take and only have that 5 minute drive back to the house when you return! There is the Bradley International Airport under an hour away, as well as the Providence Airport within 30 minutes away. Visit this link for things to do in New London! about: Our 3 bedroom Bi-level can be your home away from home. Enjoy our spacious accommodations, walk to Ocean Beach. Bike ride to the nearby park. Sit on our deck and enjoy the sunshine. Relax! Don't sweat the small details, we've covered your needs.
description: Description The Space Located only .8 miles from Ocean Beach, and less than 2 miles to downtown restaurants and shops. Our home is situated on a quiet street with minimal traffic and near children's park. You will find plenty of room and privacy in our fully furnished 3 bedroom, 2.5 bath home. Lovely hardwood floors throughout the second floor. On second floor: MBR has Queen bed, private bath, 33 inch flat screen tv, 2nd BR Full bed, 27 inch flat screen. Full bathroom. First floor : 1 bedroom with 2 twin beds. Large Family room with 2 full size futons, fireplace, family game area, 55 inch flat screen television. Half bath and laundryroom. Wifi and Satellite TV. You and your guests will enjoy entertaining on the deck, a picnic in the backyard, a BBQ or perhaps join the kids in an outdoor game in the backyard. Full kitchen with amenities. Guest Access Guests have full use of our home. 1 car beach pass. All toiletries and condiments, BBQ utensils, propane tank and beach cooler. Excludes use of the garage and private office. Interaction with Guests When possible, we will personally greet you upon your arrival, walk you through our home and answer any questions. We, or a Property manager will be available should you need assistance during your stay. The Neighborhood New London is a family friendly town. Enjoy Ocean Beach. Stroll the boardwalk. Olympic size pool, water slides, fireworks, music, volleyball and amusement rides. Explore the wonderful gardens at Harkness Memorial State Park. Walk to Mitchell College. Shop the local, one of a kind merchants or dine while downtown. Centrally located in downtown are Amtrak, Ferry to Block Island. Close to US 395 and US Coast Guard Academy. Nearby UCONN. Short drive to Mystic CT and nearby Foxwood and Mohegan Sun casinos. Getting Around Walk, drive, bike around town. Bus is available at the pedestrian gate but does not run often. We are a 15 minute walk to Ocean Beach and 10 min drive downtown. Other Things to Note It is our goal to make your stay enjoyable. Please feel free to contact us should the need arise. + More
rules: House Rules Positively No Smoking in or on property. No pets allowed. *Feel free to use all of the amenities in our home. *For your convenience, washer/dryer/dishwasher are available. Before departing Guest are required to: 1. Wash dishes, clean countertop and dining room table. Remove perishables from refrigerator. 2. Sweep all floors. 3. Empty all house garbage cans and put garbage / recyclables in appropriate outside trash can. 4. Clean outside grill after each use. Clean deck. 5. Turn off propane tank. 6. Remove all bed linen and towels and put in downstairs laundry room. 7. Turn off heat, central air, ceiling fans, lights, televisions. 8. Close and lock all windows. 9. Place beach pass in marked envelope on kitchen counter. 10. There is a $50.00 charge for lost, damaged beach pass. 11. Departure time is 10am sharp. 12. *Security deposit will be refunded less replacement cost for lost, damaged, missing items, as well as the cost for additional cleaning due to Guests failure to reasonably clean and overuse of property. + More

about: Newly renovated 100 year-old carriage house located on a 4-acre lot with 2 other cottages overlooking a saltmarsh, Long Island Sound and beyond to the Atlantic Ocean. Surrounded by a nature preserve and frequented by a variety of friendly wildlife. Another cottage on property also may be rented!
description: Description The Space This is a beautifully renovated 100 year old carriage house, in a tranquil setting overlooking eastern Fishers Island and Long Island Sound! The cottage shares 4 acres with two other old cottages, and a great deal of wildlife...yet it is minutes from historic downtown Mystic and all of the amenities the area has to offer! Guest Access Folks are welcome to walk around the 4 acre property... just be mindful of ticks, poison ivy other guests privacy who might be staying there at the same time. Interaction with Guests You will be met by our property manager, Sandy Chiangi, a local who can tell you about all of the best places to eat, shop and explore. The Neighborhood Mystic is considered one of the most picturesque coastal villages in New England! From the historic Mystic Seaport, to the Mystic Aquarium, to too many wonderful colonial homes, museums and historical homes to list! Getting Around There is no public transit system in Mystic, but many things are within biking distance. We do recommend renting a car for the best experience possible. There is a small train station in Mystic, with quick, cheap Amtrak tickets to NYC and Boston! Other Things to Note My family has owned this property for almost 100 years. We love to come with our family, but are also happy to share with our airBNB guests! + More
rules: House Rules There is absolutely no inside smoking or pets allowed, out of consideration for other guests. If you do smoke, please do so outside, and help us keep the place beautiful by disposing of your butts in the garbage, not on the patio or green spaces. + More

about: A quiet and serene setting located in the small town of Washington CT. Placed atop a hill on 18 acres of land you will enjoy peace of mind during your stay. Access to all 12,000sqft of the house. Privacy is our priority.
description: Description The Space There are currently three available rooms each with their own bathroom. We are working on a wing of the house built solely for guests. This wing will include an office, bedroom, and lounging area. This private area also includes its own bathroom and staircase to the garage downstairs. There is a four car garage if you wish to bring a vehicle and store it. Guest Access Guests will have access to any of the rooms in the house. Including: Weight room, living room, kitchen, home theater, poker room and more. There is also access to a piano (I give lessons if you would like one). Of course the house includes the essential amenities. Wifi, clean towels, washer/dryer, etc. Interaction with Guests My mother and I are very friendly so if you would like to interact with us that is up to you. The house is very big so if you do want to keep to yourselves that is fine too. We cook ourselves dinner every night and you are more than welcome to join, we love company. The Neighborhood There are a few local spots that are worth mentioning. The GW is a small tavern converted from an inn. Named after the first president in honor of his passing through our small town. There are also a few small shops in town; The pantry is my favorite. The town is small but there are many hiking trails that are beautiful and worth the visit. One such trail is accessible through our backyard, to which I would be more than happy to be a guide. If you're a fan of great wine there is a vineyard a couple towns over (just under 20 minutes). A great spot to relax and overlook beautiful lake Waramaug. Getting Around There is no public transit. You will need to provide your own transportation. Or for an additional fee I will be willing to drive you around. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking in the house. Shoes off at the door. + More

about: Our farmhouse was built in 1793 and renovated early in the 21st century. The house features 4 bedrooms, a master suite w. jacuzzi, ample common spaces, huge kitchen, enclosed porch, a luxurious pool, pond, and 16 acres of well-maintained park.
description: Description The Space We are an American/Scandinavian couple who moved to the Litchfield area less than a year ago, because we fell in love with the beauty of this property & its surroundings. Our home is warm and full of love, and we are excited to share it with people while we are away. We want you to enjoy your stay as much as we enjoy living here! The house itself is beautiful and filled with amazing 18th century details. It is also roomy and comfortable. It has four bedrooms and ample common space - living room, dining room, library, large kitchen, enclosed porch, and large patio. The house is surrounded by 16 acres of gorgeously designed park, filled with flowers and trees, ready for exploration. There is also an elegantly designed pool next to the historic barn. The house sleeps seven. Guest Access We have a home office above the garage that we will not make available to guests. Interaction with Guests We will not be living there during your stay. The Neighborhood Litchfield county offers ample opportunities for hiking, dining, and shopping. There are plenty of antique shops, local farmers stands and farmers markets, a nearby vineyard, and exceptional restaurants in the area. Getting Around Our home is accessible by car. Other Things to Note Some traffic is audible from a nearby road. + More

It's located at the beautiful historic Aspetuck Corners which is on the border of Westport, Fairfield, Easton and Weston. Lots of cultural activities as well! + More

about: This charming lakefront home is located in a gated community on the cleanest lake in Connecticut and is only 85 minutes from New York City.
description: Description The Space In the Private Gated Community of Candlewood Lake Estates. Beautiful Greenpond aka 'Emerald Lake' is a natural spring-fed glacier lake and is the cleanest in Connecticut. Green Pond is nestled in the glacial depression between the two northern fingers of Candlewood Lake. Enjoy swimming, fishing, sailing (no motors allowed) from the private docks. Includes Kayak, rowboat and more. Roast marshmallows by the fire or take a quiet snooze on the deck. This year-round home is a winter wonderland as well. Cozy-up by the fire or strap on your skates or x-country skis. Enjoy the spectacular Fall Foliage while hiking or around the lakes. It is in walking distance to Candlewood lake and guest can relax on one of two beaches. Guest can also enjoy there own waterfront with rowboat, dock and swim ladder. You will need a car the get here Guest Access Guest have access to a double kayak and a rowboat. Two beaches both in walking distance, one located on Candlewood and the other on Green Pond. There is a washer dryer located in the basement of the home. The Neighborhood Private Gated Community in Candlewood Lake Estates. description: Description The Space Set on an historic property, this guest house has been renovated and furnished for the sophisticated visitor. The house has rustic charm in its structure that is balanced by the worldly elegance of its furnishings. It is set off from the main house for partial privacy - we do share a driveway, but I am respectful of your privacy. The fully furnished top of the line gourmet kitchen has been recently built and offers custom cabinetry, Miele and Sub Zero appliances as well as most kitchen tools imaginable. There is an expansive food pantry replete with most any staple you may need to enjoy cooking during your stay. I just ask that if you use something other than flour/sugar/spices, that you replace it. The dining area seats up to six with the built in table extender (larger table cloths are in the chest next to the door along with napkins and serving bowls). Outdoors there is cushioned seating and a low table along with a gas grill and a propane fueled heater for cooler nights. I have a charcoal grill and a smoker I'd be happy to share too if you are so inclined... The living room is perfect for entertaining a large group or family with multiple seating options, a wood burning stove and TV equipped with Netflix streaming video, a DVD player, and cable. There are IPhone speaker docks in the kitchen as well as connected to the surround sound system in the living room. The furnishings are largely a combination of Grange Furniture (available through decorators only) and internationally sourced art and antiques from the owner's own collection. The lower bedroom offers two twin beds and a full bath with either Ralph Lauren or Nancy Koltes linens. There are extra pillows/linens in the armoire. The second level of this house is an extraordinary master suite with palatial arched windows (from Choate Rosemary Hall) and views of an open field and barn. This room boasts a king sized bed dressed in Ralph Lauren Suite linens, a sitting area, a chaise lounge by the television, streaming video from Netflix, and a DVD player. There is a closet area with a shoe rack and rolling rack with hangers. A small but full bath completes the upstairs bedroom. We have additional sleeping options - two twin cots with feather beds as well as a queen sized raised inflatable bed (the Frontgate version of an air mattress). Lyme is an upscale country destination with gourmet restaurants, farmers markets, endless hiking trails, numerous kayaking locations as well as world class beaches, all just minutes away. Lyme is two hours from NYC or Boston on the CT Shoreline. I am happy to help with any plans you would like to make and are happy to offer eggs for breakfast, fresh from our own chickens. We have bicycles (nothing fancy but they have wheels), picnic baskets, blankets, coolers and other accessories available for a beach picnic or a night of outdoor music at one of many local venues. We are pet friendly too! Guest Access The guest house is entirely open for guest use. I have set up a fire pit in the alpaca field and am happy to set that up for you. The barns may be messy so I prefer no guests visit the animal enclosures but feel free to roam the property! Interaction with Guests I am always available to help with adventures, dining, or anything else you may need during your stay. Call or text me at any time and I will get back to you the next time I find my phone. You can drop in to my house at any time as well! You let me know how much you want to see me. I am here to help but want to give you privacy at the same time. If you want me to check in with you, I will. If you prefer to be left completely alone, I am fine with that too. The only thing I need to do is check on animals and that involves walking toward the Guest House to get to the barns and using the hose in the back yard to fill the waterers. I do not to do this when guests are enjoying the outdoor deck but please just let me know if you prefer more privacy! The Neighborhood We are a rural residential neighborhood with the best coffee shop in New England a short walk down the road. This is a popular walking route - the triangle formed by the two roads on either side of the property and the connecting road is a 1.4 mile walk and you will likely see walkers out and about, especially on weekends, undoubtedly heading to the coffee shop. Getting Around There is public transportation in Old Saybrook (Metro North and Shoreline East trains). There is a cab service available out of Old Saybrook too. Car rentals are also in Old Saybrook. Public transportation locally is pretty much non-existent and you will need a car. The beaches are too far for me to bike but if you are a seasoned triathlete and a glutton for punishment on a basic three speed, then perhaps that is an option for you. The entire area along the shoreline (but particularly Lyme) is a very popular area for cycling. Large groups go up and down Bill HIll on weekends on a regular basis so if you are so inclined, bring your bike and experience the hills of lyme! Other Things to Note The house was an old barn. It is rustic. This is a farm. The furnishings are high end, eclectic and international. This would not, however, be a good choice for those with a minimalist aesthetic or need for a sterile environment. just saying. If there is anything less than a 5-star rating, please let me know so I can fix it for you and/or for future guests! + More
rules: House Rules Here is the most unpleasant: I hate to say this but I have had things go "missing." Any decorative objects, personal effects, artwork, etc should remain in the house. I'd also appreciate your making sure all game pieces make it back into the boxes so future guest can enjoy the same activities. Now on to the more mundane: No smoking indoors and please let me know if I can provide an ashtray for outdoor use. Please pick up after your pet(s) and inform me immediately of an accident. Pots and pans are all calphalon or copper and do not go in the dishwasher. There are butcher block boards for cutting so please don't use the countertops. If you don't remember where something belongs, leave it out (my cleaners don't remember where things go on the shelves either...) and I will put it away for the next visitors. Please do not put anything away if it is not in the same condition in which you found it (yes, someone put a waffle maker on the shelf without cleaning it... Luckily I found it first!) Not to mention the coffee put in the water reservoir... If you do not know how to use one of the appliances, ask and I will tell you! If you break something, let me know. Or if someone else broke something and didn't let me know, please let me know! If you leave the house, please remember to turn off the lights and televisions. Please turn off the outside lights at night. The switch is in the downstairs hallway. The property is old and so is the septic... so please don't tax it with excessive water flow. Also, if everyone in your group wants a hot shower, the first ones in shouldn't stay too long. Nothing other than toilet paper should be flushed down the toilet. Feel free to feed the chickens! They eat leftovers of most every kind. I have a plastic compost bucket in the kitchen (above the stove) for those who are interested/willing to compost kitchen scraps. The alpaca are friendly but fearful; please let them approach you if you want to pet them. They really do not like to be chased. Especially by dogs. Dogs must remain on leash - they are unfortunately the biggest danger to both chickens and alpaca. The chickens do range freely and occasionally leave behind a mess... I hose off the deck daily but am happy to do so upon request as well! Enjoy playing in the alpaca field or reading the Sunday Times in the adirondack chairs in the orchard field - the NY Times is available upon request on Sunday mornings. We have several lawn games available - bocce, croquet, and many others. Ask and I will share. If ANYTHING is not clean/working/up to your expectations, please let me know so I can fix the situation! I can't examine every pot/pan/appliance between visitors and therefore may miss something that a previous guest put back on a shelf in a condition not up to my standards. My apologies if this happens but please let me know! Have fun and relax! And let me know what I can do to make your stay more enjoyable. + More

about: Charming sunny cottage steps from the beach. Water views in several directions. Three bedrooms, one bath, plus wonderful private hot water outside shower.
description: Description The Space The cottage is on a rise, a bit elevated from the street. It has many windows on all sides so it has lovely light and is always cooled by the breeze. GLP is consistently a good 15 degrees cooler in summer than the city. Guest Access Whole house. Garage for bikes, etc. Narrow driveway (we use for bikes, etc.) and parking for 3-4 cars on the grass. Interaction with Guests We are available by phone and email: Please call anytime with questions, etc . Home (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Cell (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Email: (EMAIL HIDDEN) and we have a local agent who is right in GLP for key pick up and drop off and any issues that might arise if we are not around... The Neighborhood GLP is the perfect family vacation spot. It is a small private community with several beaches, tennis courts, nature trails, and a scenic marsh full of birds. A reasonably priced monthly yacht club membership is available which allows for wonderful children's programs in sailing, tennis, swimming, sports, and more, as well as events for the grownups. There is no through traffic, so streets are full of children on bikes going from class to class, draped with life jackets and tennis rackets. In the center of GLP you will find the very popular Spa, which serves ice cream, and breakfast and lunch. The Noank Community Market, with local meats, produce and general groceries, the friendly Universal Package Store, and Pearl Street Bakery are all 2 miles away in the picturesque village of Noank. Getting Around Amtrak services Mystic (5 miles) and New London (10 miles). You can also get from NYC to New London via Metro North to New Haven and Shoreline East commuter lines at much lower fares. Groton New London airport is 6 miles away. If you arrive by air you can rent a car there. Other Things to Note GLP is the perfect family vacation spot. It is a small private community with several beaches, tennis courts, nature trails, and a scenic marsh full of birds. A reasonably priced monthly yacht club membership is available which allows for wonderful children's programs in sailing, tennis, swimming, sports, and more, as well as events for the grownups. There is no through traffic, so streets are full of children on bikes going from class to class, draped with life jackets and tennis rackets. + More
rules: House Rules No Smoking No Cats Dogs allowed on a case by case basis with an additional $250 deposit. Parking in GLP is by permit only, but you can park on our property without one. if you are here for more than a few days and want a permit they can be obtained from the GLP Association. + More

about: Our Litchfield County retreat sits on 23 acres with a serene, private pond down a wooded path. Newly built in 2012, it has 3 bedrooms, 3.5 baths, woodburning fireplace, modern art & beautiful furnishings. Near Hotchkiss, Tanglewood, hiking & more.
description: Description The Space We built our beautiful dream house--and then I got a job in California! Barnlike on the outside, inside our place is sleek and modern and built for a relaxed, elegant, grownup life. We like to cook and eat with friends, tramp through the woods to the dock and dive into our pond, watch the sunrise through the trees, sit outside under the stars at night, and curl up with a good book in the afternoon in one of our two hammocks. Two queen beds, one double, and a convertible single in the office, plus 3.5 baths mean there's plenty of room and privacy. Front porch gets sun in the morning, back patio in the afternoon, and the dock and utterly private pond are beautiful in every season. Guest Access Guests have access to the entire house, the front porches and outdoor patio, and the private trail to our pristine dock and swimming pond. Interaction with Guests We live in California so leave keys in a lockbox on the side of the house. Our housekeeper will be available for any questions. The Neighborhood Salisbury is a beautiful colonial town with one main street, a well-stocked grocery (LaBonne's), several very good restaurants (The White Hart in Salisbury, The Woodland in Lakeville, Serevan in Amenia, No. 9 in Millerton), a beautiful historic library, and numerous outdoor attractions, from the Town Grove (swimming in summer) to hiking on the Appalachian Trail (trailheads just down the road). In Sharon (15 minutes), several farms host pick-your-own apple weekends, and Lime Rock racetrack has frequent events including antique car shows. Great Barrington (shopping, concerts, movies) is 25 minutes, Millerton about 15 (good movie theater and restaurants), Catamount ski area is 20 minutes, and Hudson's antiques and art galleries and great food are 35 minutes away. Getting Around You'll need a car, though guests could take a train from Grand Central to Wassaic (35 minutes away). Other Things to Note Some history: The 23 acre property was the site of a Revolutionary War-era iron mine (which is why we have a deep pond in the woods). You'll note cylindrical holes just off the path that were used to make charcoal to smelt the ore. Our road is dirt but plowed in winter; our next door neighbors are lovely people and always available in an emergency. We have a whole-house generator, which means you don't have to worry about losing power in a storm. We have good wi-fi, plus Blu-Ray with Netflix and Amazon Prime access. + More
rules: House Rules Leave outside shoes in the mudroom as our floors are light oak and the rugs rather precious. No pets, sorry. No smoking in the house, and use caution if smoking outside. Please treat the house and its contents as you would your own. (This was not built as a rental house with cast-off stuff that we don't care about; this is our real house!) Swim in the pond at your own risk and be wary on the dock, which tends to be slippery when wet. (The water in the pond is very clean, but it's deep and cold!) Stay on the trails and no fires in the woods. All refuse goes to the transfer station; our house cleaner will handle that. Be sure to follow the lock-up instructions and make sure the heat is turned DOWN, not off -- and that the fire is completely extinguished. Thank you for taking good care of our dream house! + More

description: Description The Space Our 2 room guest house is on the property of The Adams House B&B and is 2 miles from downtown Mystic Harbor and Mystic Seaport. We have ample off street parking and a large yard with gardens and pergola for your enjoyment. Each room has TV and A/C and WiFi access. www.ada(URL HIDDEN) for photos and info. Guest Access Guests are welcome to use the gardens and yard as a place to relax and picnic. The cottage is separate and has ample parking for cars and bikes. The public boat launch for kayaks and canoes is 1 mile down the hill at the river basin. Local area maps and restaurant information are available. Interaction with Guests We are usually on site at the B&B for any questions and to help with your plans to visit the many sights and beaches nearby. We are also available by cell phone if we are off the property. Fresh baked goods are available each morning that the B&B is operating. Just ask! The Neighborhood We live in a residential neighborhood at the top of the hill outside of Historic Mystic, CT. Our large corner lot provides privacy and lots of space for guests to play croquet or relax outside. Lawn chairs, picnic area and hammock are for your use. Getting Around Mystic is a bit short on public transportation, however, there is an AMTRAK stop and we can pick you up with advance notice. Car rentals are available, typically from Enterprise, they will pick you up! Bicycle rentals and courtesy bikes are also available on request. Other Things to Note The Mystic Seaport Museum and the Mystic Aquarium are ten minutes away. Rhode Island beaches and Watch Hill are 20 minutes away. Foxwoods and Mohegan Sun Casinos are also nearby. Newport, Rhode Island is a one hour day trip as is Block Island which is accessible by ferry from Point Judith, RI or New London, CT. We are close to Connecticut College, UCONN at Avery Point, United States Coast Guard Academy and several historic forts. Amtrak stops in Mystic several times a day and we can provide pick up if needed. + More
rules: House Rules We would like guests to treat our property as if it was their own. We are smoke and pet free. Only registered guests are allow on the property without owner consent. + More

about: A beautiful renovated turn of the century beach cottage 1/2 a block from the Long Island Sound and steps to Walnut Beach awaits in the historic town of Milford!
description: Description The Space A beautiful newly renovated turn of the century beach cottage 1/2 a block from the Long Island Sound and steps to Walnut Beach in historic Milford, Connecticut awaits! Perfect for vacationers who enjoy kite and wind surfing, sand up paddling, cycling, sailing or kayaking. If you enjoy tennis, the local recreation center up the block has a court The nearby Audubon Nature Center on the Housatonic River provides excellent summer programs for families with young children. Enjoy casting for blue fish at the end of the street or building a sand castle during the annual competition. Artist fairs on the historic town green are a local attraction as are the oyster and lobster festivals each year. Listen to music or a warm summer night by the harbor or just enjoy a stroll along the boardwalk which connects to Silver Sands State Park and explore Charles Island at low tide. Enjoy reading the morning paper with your espresso in the sun room or gaze at the water from the front yard bench. Grill out in just the right sized backyard and enjoy tiki torch dinners in this quiet beach community. Cycling is a nice way to explore the downtown with it's quaint shops, restaurants and harbor. A lovely cafe bike with wicker basket is available for use for local errands as is a kayak. Additional bike and kayak rentals are available from the local bike shop Tony's Bikes on the town green or just around the corner from Scoot and Paddle on Naugatuck. On cooler fall or spring nights, snuggle by the back yard chiminea and roast some smores. If you want to explore the excitement of New York City for the day, it's an easy trip by Metro North train and only 1 1/2 hours away. Or take a boat tour of the Thimble Islands just 25 minutes up I-95. If cooking is your thing, the kitchen boasts a professional Ilve 5 burner duel fuel range with built in rotiserrie and a brand new Bosch side by side refrigerator. Addtionally, the house comes completely stocked including espresso and pasta machines, juicer and waffle iron along with cook books. The cellar holds not only the washer/dryer, but a wine cooler as well. Or if you want a holiday, but still need to be commuting distance to your New York City office, this is the place. The house has wi-fi and a home office in the sun room. So whether you just want to relax and get away from it all or a combination of both, Milford is a great destination! Filming in Connecticut and want a cheaper alternative to hotels for your crew? Inquire about extended stay rates for off season. Guest Access 3 bedroom house (king, double, single) with queen sleeper sofa. Washer/dryer in basement. Charcoal grill and chiminea on the patio. The beach is a 2 minute walk away. Shed contains a cafe bike for guest use and a kayak. Interaction with Guests I'm always available to help answer my guests' questions and make suggestions as to what to see and where to eat. The Neighborhood It's right on the Long Island Sound and is great for water sports and biking. Lots of festivals in the summer including the Pirate, Oyster and Lobster festivals. The little shopping district at the beach entrance adds the convenience of a deli, pizza/bar with live music, art gallery, and liquor store. Getting Around There is a bus at the end of the street and Metro North is just a 5 minute drive. I-95 is also convenient. Other Things to Note The Milford Ct Post Mall is a big attraction. There are numerous shops and malls all along the Boston Post Road including Whole Foods Market. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking No pets unless approved in advance and additional deposit secured No loud parties. The community is made up of small beach homes in close proximity to one another No removal of dishes or silverware to beach Adherence to all policies stated in house information binder which is on site and also will be emailed in advance upon receipt of final payment is required + More

about: Windy Hill is a charming 3BR/2.5 bath 1900 antique home located just a short walk from Stonington Borough. Set on a hill, you will enjoy summer sea breezes and limited water views. Fall asleep listening to fog horns and relax in the gardens.
description: Description The Space Tucked away at the end of the street, you will have the privacy you desire yet Stonington Village is just a quick 10 minute walk away. Also located down the street from The Velvet Mill, which has been transformed into artist studios, and houses a variety of small artisanal shops including a bakery, cheese - maker, and brewery and more. Plus, every Saturday in the fall and winter, the Stonington Farmer's Market is held in the Great Hall of the Mill. Talk about convenient! This spacious home boasts 3 bedrooms, a living/dining room, gourmet kitchen and large family room. But wait, that isn't everything. The home also has a private outdoor shower off the back porch and wrap around porch in the front of the home with rocking chairs for evening gatherings. The garden has a lovely pergola with comfortable chairs and a couch for lounging as well. And if you get in the mood for a game, there is a horseshoe pit in the front yard. Unlike the borough, this home also has plenty of parking options. We own the slip of property across the street, so not only do you have 2 parking spaces at the top of the hill by the house, there is also plenty of space in the gravel parking area for 3 more cars. **note there is air Conditioning downstairs and a window unit in the Master bedroom. The other bedrooms have window fans. Because the home is on a hill and we have such nice breezes we almost never use the AC. Don't seem to need it. Guest Access You have access to the entire home. There is a washer and dryer in the basement you are welcome to use. You are welcome to use anything in the refrigerator in the kitchen and any food in the pantry if needed. Please let us know when items are depleted so that we can resupply. Interaction with Guests My husband and I live and work in New York city and travel back to Windy Hill as much as possible, But, while we are away, we hope that you enjoy our home as much as we do. With that, we have a manager, Lori Moore, who will be happy to greet you when you arrive (if you choose) and will be available throughout your stay to assist you if needed. Prior to your arrival, we will connect you with her so that your stay will be as smooth and relaxing as possible. The Neighborhood Stonington Village and the Borough are a special place. The village centre has a European feel with all of the small boutiques and restaurants. Just a short drive away is Historic Downtown Mystic, where Mystic Pizza was filmed a long time ago (yes, there really is a Mystic Pizza) and in the other direction you have the beautiful beaches of Rhode Island and Watch Hill where the wealthy and Taylor Swift have their summer "cottages." Our house is a 20-25 minute drive to Rhode Island beaches depending upon when you go. Getting Around While there isn't a lot of public transportation, we are right on the Amtrak line, so it is easy to get here via train from either Boston or New York. You have the choice of arriving here at New London, Mystic, or Westerly. A cheaper way to travel by train from New York is to use MetroNorth to New Haven and then take Shoreline East to New London. Check the schedules since the train only stops in New London periodically. Otherwise, we are a car friendly town, just off I-95 (exit 91) and you will see people walking and riding bikes everywhere. Our home has enough space for two cars at the top of the driveway and 2-3 at the bottom. Please do not park in the dirt road as that does not belong to us. Also, on Fridays the Landscaping company comes to mow the lawn so the car at the top of the driveway closest to the house will need to be moved to the lower parking area so that the mowers can get into the back yard. Other Things to Note Once you arrive, you will find that we have left a book with helpful hints in the kitchen, with instructions on how to run certain appliances, wifi, and suggestions for fun things to do and places to eat. + More
rules: House Rules Please remember that this is our home and not a house used simply as a rental. We ask that you leave the home exactly as you found it when you leave and that you strip all of the beds and place used towels in the bathtubs before you leave. Also, please take all trash out the the bin by the garage as well. If you move any furniture, we ask you to replace it where it was when you arrived. + More
