about: Just renovated, spectacular country house on 2 acres at the private Woodridge Lake Club in the Litchfield Hills, only 90 m from NYC. Great family fun for all. Activities for the kids and adults alike. Happy and safe. Whole Summer rate available.
description: Description The Space The home has 3 bedrooms/2.5 baths and a large loft upstairs. Indoor wood Fire Place, large screened in Porch, farm style dining table, Heavy Duty Propane Grill. Our home is clean & well maintained. (Winter) Ski Mohawk Mt with your friends/family! 5 Mins from the house with great trails. Fun for all! (Summer)The lake is private and can be accessed by residents only. This includes all boating activity on the lake. It is pristine, clean and well maintained and not over crowded! Guest Access Membership access to our Beach, Tennis, Pool Club Included in rental rates! ** (Pool is closed after Labor Day). Club also has a snack bar (summer), basketball court, gym & playground. Social events/concerts at the clubhouse (summer). Clubhouse is walking distance from the house (less than 0.5 mile) 14,000 square-foot Clubhouse with lounge, gym, yoga classes 4 Private Residents Only Sand Swimming Beaches 8 Tennis Courts & 1 Basketball Court. Tennis lessons available. (Lessons and court fees are separate and not included in the rental fee). Small Playground Quiet roads for jogging & biking NOTE: All boats must be pre-registered with the Association before launch (max of 20 feet, 90 hp, outboard motor). Any boating fees are not included in the rental fee. (URL HIDDEN) Interaction with Guests Any questions, please don't hesitate to call! The Neighborhood The Litchfield Hills is a Vacation Paradise! There is an endless list of 4-Season activities for Sports and Non-Sports people alike, Antique Shoppers, Arts/Theatre/Music, Country Fairs, Wineries, Arts/Craft shows and classes. First-class dining and terrific smokehouse BBQ! Or just kick back and enjoy the peace and tranquility of this wooded paradise. Getting Around From NYC by car is approx. 2hours. MetroNorth Train from Grand Central to Wassaic train station which is about 25 mins from the house. PeterPan bus from Port Authority to Torrington which is approx 15 mins from the house. If you are traveling from the North, Boston is approx. 3.5 hrs by car. Other Things to Note Litchfield area has some of the finest private schools in the USA. There are many Summer programs available including children's camps as well. Summer at the Lake: Swimming, Fishing, Tubing, Kyacking, Sailing/Boating. Winter in Litchfield: Nearby Skiing at Mohawk Mtn. 5 mins away Wonderful parks/trails for Cross Country skiing Horseback riding all the time! Rental: Weekend/Weekly/Monthly/Season Inquire for rates 50% rental fee deposit is due at signing. Cleaning fee will apply depending on number of people and length of stay. Please inquire. Prices are in U.S.$ and include taxes and final cleaning + More

description: Description The Space New construction home in pristine condition. Three levels: Level 1: Living/dining/kitchen/den/hallway/half-bathroom/mud room/outdoor fireplace. Level 2: Two bedrooms (one with king bed and setback terrace, one with queen bed)/full bathroom. Level 3: Two bedrooms (one large with double bed, one small with single pull-out/trundle bed). There is an outdoor enclosed shower for showering/rinsing off after return from beach. Air-conditioning on levels 2 and 3. Short ( 2 minutes) walk down bucolic pathway to small sandy private beach (shared with immediate neighborhood residents only). Short (3 minutes) walk to nearby bar/restaurant and also Madison Beach Hotel (new luxury boutique hotel on beach). 1-mile walk to old New England-style town center - library, coffee shops, restaurants, supermarket. Outdoor fireplace is also available for use. Guest Access Access to entire house. No access to garage. Interaction with Guests Owner will meet guests on arrival and answer any questions. Any further contact will generally be by phone or email/text. The Neighborhood Neighborhood is friendly and quiet. Guests are expected to respect this tone of neighborhood. about: This is a Sacred Space. Chic furnishings lend to a Hollywood glam vibe whilst being surrounded in amazing landscaping and grounds. Extra large pool gets direct sunlight all day long. Very close to town as well as all the major thoroughfares.
description: Description The Space 3 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms one level living with expansive yard and gardens Our fabulous home has got it all...chic designer furnishings, a cozy environment, huge antique trestle dining table, a great pool in direct sun light, plenty of parking, wonderful privacy and easy access to both the Merritt and I-95. Interior: Home is gorgeous and expansive. Pure Hollywood Glam style! You enter via a formal entryway and are soon enchanted with the wall of windows scaling the living room. There are plenty of seating areas around which to relax and entertain and a lovely wood fireplace in the living room for those chilly nights. The adjacent dining area boasts an antique trestle table 10 feet long! Home has three bedrooms - the master is rather large with white pile carpeting and a wood stove. The other bedrooms are on the other side of the house - one has a queen bed and the other has 2 twin beds. There are 2 bathrooms in the house both outfitted by Waterworks. One has a shower while the other has a jacuzzi tub. The kitchen has been recently remodeled with black granite counter tops and stainless appliances include a Viking stove and Miele dishwasher. Grounds: The property lets you feel like you are miles away from civilization, yet it is all around the corner from you. There is also a small country store and restaurant within walking distance of the house. The home is secluded on an acre of land ensuring plenty of privacy. The gardens are lovely and are English inspired. There is a large Wagner pool which is amazing for swimming and relaxing. Guest Access Everything. Interaction with Guests Privacy is respected. The Neighborhood Westport is a great town full of great restaurants, shops and close to Manhattan. Getting Around Metro North. Other Things to Note Inquire if you would like to rent a room only during any open periods. + More
rules: House Rules Respectful, private, clean guests. + More

about: Cloud 9 is the sweetest dollhouse around. Three houses in from the water at Saugatuck Shores, close to all the town's amenities and local transportation. Most of the time you will simply want stay put to soak up the fabulous sacred energy at home.
description: Description The Space 3 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms Our fabulous beach house is available in the exclusive Saugatuck Shores area, literally steps to the water (150 steps to be exact!). The neighborhood is great for walking, running, roller blading or biking. The house is located on a peninsula, so there is water at every turn. You will experience the truly spectacular morning sunrises and afternoon sunsets! In the summer, you can walk to the yacht club for an informal lunch and choose to lounge on several small beaches. The home is located within easy distance of the highways (I-95 and the Merritt Parkway), the train station and the downtown areas of Westport and South Norwalk with all their shops and restaurants. Our beautifully decorated home has loads of color and is arranged with the principles of feng shui in mind. The home has three bedrooms downstairs. Upstairs is an entire second floor loft space done in bright white strips making it a wonderful work space or yoga / mediation room (no beds in this space any longer). Two bathrooms were done by Waterworks and the petite yet gourmet kitchen boasts a Viking range, Miele dishwasher, and farmhouse sink with Italian marble counter tops. The dining alcove is especially sweet as it is strewn with seashells! And, there are two enclosed porches plus an extra large yard enclosed with a white picket fence. One car garage and plenty of off-street parking in front of the house. Fully furnished executive rental great for short-term stays in the area for business or pleasure. Guest Access Everything. Interaction with Guests We respect privacy. The Neighborhood The laid back casual beach vibe amidst multi-million dollar homes. Getting Around Very close to Westport train station as well as East Norwalk. Taxi service is plentiful too. + More

about: This cottage comfortably sleeps 6, perfect for families seeking the ultimate beach escape! Home is at the end of a quiet private road and is surrounded on two sides by water boasting unparalleled ocean views and an experience of complete solitude.
description: Description The Space This 3 bed/1 bath home provides the ultimate beach escape to its guests. Property is at the end of a private road, safe for children and elderly. Complete with screened in porch, patio/picnic area, grill, front lawn, off street parking, and private beach front. Make your stay yours! Do as little or as much as you want. The options are limitless at the beach. Be sure to walk, run, or explore the extensive sandbar formations that occur during low tide periods. Guest Access Everything except shed storage area and attic. Interaction with Guests I'm happy to be as hands on or hands off as desired. The Neighborhood Old Saybrook is a peaceful beach town but also has many local attractions. Only minutes from main street shops, historic sites, movie theaters, restaurants, and bars, as well as two of the nicest outlet malls in the north east. Saybrook point is only a few minutes away for stunning views of long island sound, light houses, boating, fishing, dining, and mini golf. Getting Around Everything is accessible by car. 3 available off street spots are available with this rental. You are also only 5 minutes away to the nearest Amtrak station that can plug you into all major east coast destinations (NYC, Boston, etc.) Other Things to Note Please bring your own sheets and linens. There currently is no washer/dryer on the premises. + More

about: Rural comfort & privacy for the whole family. Room to relax, dine & entertain. Livingroom, diningroom, eat-in kitchen, solarium, library, porch, balcony, pool, manicured grounds. Enjoy antiquing, award-winning restaurants, rural attractions & more.
description: Description The Space Fully appointed 3-story residence in front portion of lovingly-renovated post & beam dairy barn with exposed wooden beams throughout the premises. The walls of the fully-equipped eat-in kitchen, entertainment area and solarium are dressed in wide 200 year old barn boards. Enjoy a quiet read by the fireplace in the library/study stocked with hundreds of books. Or fire up the working wood stoves. Firewood is included. Original artwork on the walls and antiques throughout. Guest Access Fully-appointed eat-in kitchen. Access to 40 ft in-ground pool in season. Stroll the grounds, lunch at a picnic table or bask in the sun on your private patio. Private screened porch off kitchen and 2d floor deck off master bedroom. Interaction with Guests Doug & MaryBeth live in separate quarters in the rear of the Barn and are available to answer questions, provide assistance, etc. The Neighborhood Located halfway up Gray Mare Hill in Brooklyn, CT, on 4+ acres with flower gardens and surrounded by stonewalls and woods. In Historic Village District 1/2 mile north of town green with Colonial era town hall, meeting house, churches, Historical Society Museum, statues and Brooklyn Fair Grounds. Other Things to Note In addition to 6 conventional beds (1 king, 1 full, 4 queen) and 2 pull-out queen sized sofas, there are three 6.5 ft long and one 5.5 ft long non-pullout sofas. WE MUST COLLECT TAX: Unfortunately, the State of Connecticut imposes a room occupancy tax equal to 15% of the rent and cleaning fees. Besides not currently being able to disclose this cost in the Pricing section of this listing, AirBnB also currently is not set up to collect the tax. Therefore, we will be collecting the tax from you by check or cash upon your arrival. We apologize for this unavoidable cost and inconvenience. Thank you. + More

about: Private 3-bed, 1-bath apartment fully equipped. Walking distance to bars, restaurants (pizza!), East Rock Park, & 300ft to Yale Shuttle access to campus & downtown for free- even if not a student! Whether work or pleasure, you will enjoy your stay.
description: Description The Space 3 bedrooms with queen bed in each, clean linens, and towels. Kitchen is fully equipped with gas range, pots, pans, utensils, nespresso coffee maker (pods for guests included), charcoal weber grill, and fire-pit in our small backyard. Bathroom is recently updated with large soaking tub. Large 52" LED Samsung TV comes with full cable package, bookcase with DVDs, books, magazines, and a massive sectional couch. Wifi (105mb/s) and Sonos hifi sound system available throughout home. Large front porch with table and chairs is great place to eat a meal or relax. Washer and dryer can be made available upon request. Guest Access Encourage guests to make themselves at home! You will be able to come and go freely through your own private entrance. Interaction with Guests This listing is for an entire apartment on the second and third floor of a private home. I live in the first floor apartment so I can help you out if needed, otherwise respectful of your privacy. Free to come and go with your own set of keys. The Neighborhood East Rock is the best neighborhood in New Haven. It is a safe neighborhood, and many people get around by walking and biking. There are many local shops, restaurants, bars and cafes, many with outdoor seating (unlike downtown). Easy access to downtown but also to highways. Getting Around Yale shuttles are free to public and stop within 300ft of house. Metro North train from Union Station to NYC is 1.5 miles away. I often bike, walk, take Yale Shuttles, and Uber. Other Things to Note If you have any questions, or special requests please just ask! + More

about: The 1820 House has stunning views, a park like yard and awesome style.
description: Description The Space Set on the edge of a valley with westerly views on a beautiful street in Litchfield this vintage home has all modern amenities and style. Has a well in the mudroom and the steep staircase to give you a really authentic 1820's retreat. A large park-like yard with old granite barn foundations and rock walls facing a nature preserve. Sit in the adirondack chairs and watch beautiful sunsets every night. In the home there is a queen bed, 2 twin beds and another room with a twin bed: Sleeps 5 in all. The home has 2 full baths. Guest Access You will enter the home via the mudroom. Interaction with Guests Property Manager will have the house ready for you and be available to answer questions and assist with any issues during your stay. The Neighborhood The house is located on a beautiful street between Litchfield and Bantam. The street has numerous homes from the 1800's, but this house has fantastic westerly views of the valley and nature preserve. Beautiful sunsets! Other Things to Note Our favorite breakfast place in Litchfield is Patty's. Favorite bread Bantam Bread. Favorite dinner spot The Village. Favorite ice cream Arethusa Dairy. Best market Bantam Market. Best ski spot 15 minutes from the house Mohawk Mountain. Best pumpkin farm Bunnell Farm just up the road 5 minutes. Best lake experience Bantam Lake. And the Elephant's Truck Flea market every Sunday only 25 minutes away, my absolute favorite. ENJOY!!!!!!!! + More
rules: House Rules No smoking No subletting No pets Beyond 5 guests requires owner approval. about: Perfectly appointed sailing yacht awaits your dreams minutes from Westport train station. All the amenities of home; freezer, fridge, hot water, wifi, projector, sterling, crystal, linen, and down. Your glorious slumber awaits at anchor or sea.
description: Description The Space This rental is for "bed and breakfast" in the space on the mooring buoy, not a cruise, charter or otherwise, nor a provisioning service. That's available too. Just ask! Guest Access Access by water: dinghy, rowboat, $20 water taxi before 8pm, kayak, dhow, raft, SUP, backstroke, et cetera. Or, throw some rope in the inflatable, wait for the tide to come in and just drift the two hundred feet to shore. Tie off, and you've made yourself an old fashioned ferry! Also, the boat has 6 berths, two of the beds are doubles and we've had groups of five twice. Once, all sisters. The other time, a repeat guest and his small children. I do not think the boat is comfortable for more than two adult men or anyone over 6' or 200lbs, so I've decreased the listed capacity from 6-4. If you are all my size or children, please ask and maybe we can squeeze five. :) Interaction with Guests We'll happily pick you up at the train by motor boat (3 ppl or fewer) or meet you at the marina. The Neighborhood Within 4 minute dinghy ride of Compo Beach, Longshore Country Club, The Whelk, Tarry Lodge, Black Duck etc. Tennis, golf, swimming, hiking, shopping, theatre. The day pass for the pools overlooking the Sound is $10 were anyone to ever ask to see a pass. A ten pack is $80. There are always a couple on the boat. It really is an awfully nice place to visit. Getting Around Free parking. 24hr Taxi. Kayak, bike, walk... Other Things to Note Sailing is $65 per hour. about: Beautiful, high-elevation waterfront, amazing views & very centrally located Mianus riverfront house in Greenwich, Connecticut. 5-min to town, train (Metro North) & I-95. 40-min to NYC. Double-height Living/Dining Room. Master suite. European linens.
description: Description The Space Beautiful, sunny, 3,600 sf Greenwich riverfront country house. A true retreat. 4 bedrooms total: - (2nd Floor) Master bedroom (king bed with en suite full bathroom) - riverfront view - (2nd Floor) Bedroom #2 single bed (full bathroom adjacent) - riverfront view - (2nd Floor) Bedroom #3 single bed (full bathroom adjacent) - riverfront view - (1st Floor) Bedroom #4 queen bed (full bathroom adjacent) - street view Note: * a queen air mattress can be set up in bedrooms #2 or #3 (please let us know at time of booking) * 2nd floor single beds are a little lower to the floor, but can fit an adult in length. Closets: All bedrooms have full closets en-suite (master has full walk-in closet). Coat closet on main level. Linens: All bedrooms/bathrooms come with European linens, Down Comforters, and 100% Egyptian cotton towels. Best riverfront view on the the Mianus River - nature at it's best - see swans, ospreys, hawks, herons, ducks, geese, turtles from every window in the house (season permitting :-)) Guest Access Entire house can be accessed. Kitchen fully stocked & operational with appliances (including Garland professional stove, Subzero refrigerator, microwave, 2 ovens) housewares, dishes etc. Use of full laundry room on main living level permitted. No garage access, but driveway can accommodate 3-4 cars. You can also take MetroNorth train to Greenwich station, then cab 7 minutes to house, if no car. Snow plowing service & utilities included in rental price. Interaction with Guests Happy to help and recommend - please e-mail requests/questions. You'll have the house to yourselves & privacy. We stay off-site. The Neighborhood Unique setting overlooking Mianus River from high elevation over river. Convenient to everything. Beautiful, peaceful getaway. Upon booking, we'll forward a stay guide with recommended places nearby. Getting Around 5 minutes to train (Metro North); 5 minutes to I-95; 5 minutes to town and shopping (Whole Foods, Balducci's, new organic/farm cheese, fish & meat shop); many restaurants & shops; 40 minutes drive to NYC. Other Things to Note This riverfront setting is an outdoor paradise: Winter: XC ski, snowshoe, ice hockey; Spring/summer/fall: Canoe & leaf peepers; biking; hiking/walking (Mianus River Gorge, Audubon Center, Tod's Point) Excellent shopping on Greenwich Avenue too.... Counting by "adult-sized sleepers", this house can accommodate up to 8-10 guests; including queen airbed and using (2) large couches (one in TV room, one in Living Room). Note: Parties of 4 guests or less, pay the stated base rate per day. There is an additional fee of $25.00 per guest (child or adult)/a night for each guest after 4 guests. There is no additional charge for kids under 2 years of age. + More
rules: House Rules Absolutely no smoking please, or security deposit will be forfeited. Dogs (no more than 1) allowed but please let us know at the time of booking. + More

about: Charming 18th century home with a serenity that is rare, as it sits 25' from babbling Chester Creek. European in it's setting, with a beautiful pond and waterfall, on a quiet street, sleeps 6 and is steps to a storybook village.
description: Description The Space If you enjoy a home with a bit of history yet modern in all it offers, a historic structure dating back to the late 1700's, with additions made in each century to date, a serenity that is rare as it sits twenty five feet from a babbling to rushing brook (depending on the season) that flows into a beautiful pond with waterfall, located within walking distance from a postage stamp of a village filled with artists, five star restaurants, farm markets, nationally reknown historic live theater, art, antiques, rich cultural opportunities and the surrounding beauty of the Connecticut River Valley where the fresh water turns brackish and the ocean just a few miles away this is the place for you. As an overnighter under special circumstances I will be present as your host, tapping into my background as a performing artist, boater and collector of antiques sharing with you my knowledge of the local theaters, seaports, artists, museums and sailing; all of which I am familiar. Whether you want a guided journey or left to be your own navigator, the morning will begin with a gourmet breakfast of your choice (included with your stay) at Simon's Marketplace, a local institution and favorite breakfast destination, which is casual, but delicious. If you are long term I will welcome you with the key and be on my way so you can get at it. Guest Access Guests will have full access to the first, second and lower level for laundry and pool table. Interaction with Guests I will not be present, but available by phone to answer any questions. The Neighborhood It is bucolic bliss at it's best, very quiet and private, with rushing brook into a pond and waterfall just steps to the village full of dining, shops and galleries. Getting Around It is within walking distance to village, about a mile from the Connecticut River making it centrally located in the eastern coastal shoreline between Manhattan and Boston, an hour from Bradley ( a little more than that to Providence) airport and ten minutes from Amtrak and Metro North. Other Things to Note Not at this time. + More
rules: House Rules NO SMOKING, NO PETS, NO PARTY! + More

about: This luxurious community known as one of the finest residential communities in Fairfield County, is equipped w/unparalleled amenities like a resort style courtyard w/BBQ area, 24 hr cyber cafe & swimming pool. Private balcony & free parking provided.
description: Description The Space Apartments include a variety of superior features including wall-to-wall carpeting, 10 foot ceilings, large walk-in closets, ceramic tile kitchens with microwave and breakfast bar, private balconies, garbage disposal, central air conditioning and in unit washer/dryer. Your fully appointed apartment is furnished with all the necessities of home, including linens and towels. Property amenities include:  Outdoor swimming pool (open seasonally in summer)  State-of-the-art fitness center  Business center  Club house  24 hour cyber cafe  Sun deck  Landscaped courtyard with BBQ area, fire pits and picnic area  Reserved garage parking  Walking distance to Metro North train  In unit washer/dryer The private master bedroom with en-suite bathroom features a deluxe queen size bed with our indulgent custom linens, fluffy duvet, and plush pillows, two night tables with lamps, a clock radio, a dresser and a very spacious walk-in closet. The spacious second bedroom features a deluxe queen size bed with the same great linens, two night tables with lamps, a clock radio, a dresser and a spacious closet. A second bathroom is available. The living room includes a sofa with pullout bed, club chair, an entertainment center with a flat panel LCD TV, DVD/VCR player, CD stereo system, a dining area with seating for four and a work desk with lamp and your choice of wired or wireless Internet access. The gourmet kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need including dishes, glasses, cutlery and pots and pans. The kitchen features full-size appliances (four burner stove, oven, microwave, dishwasher and refrigerator), toaster, and coffee maker. Coffee, tea and sweeteners are provided. Guest Access You have access to the entire apartment, and all the fantastic amenities this building offers to its tenants. Interaction with Guests We have local staff that you might meet in person that meticulously prepares the apartments for your arrival. Your check-in is typically handled by the building's front desk staff. We provide all other customer service and are available via phone and email promptly. 24 hour support is available for any emergencies that may occur. The Neighborhood Explore the area and visit some of the museums, parks, historical buildings, zoos and sports venues in Norwalk and its surrounding towns. Restaurants and retail are close by. Getting Around The property is within a walking distance from Metro North and CT transit bus. Other Things to Note Although we do not allow pets in our apartment, this apartment is located at a residential property that allows pets and there may be pet owners in the building. + More
rules: House Rules Please remember that this is a residential building. The building rules, apartment occupancy restrictions and the year-round tenants must be respected. Parties, pets and smoking are not allowed under any circumstances and incur significant fees. + More

description: Description The Space Two level 4bedroom 2 1/2 bathroom Lake Tahoe house in CT. Two bedrooms downstairs w/full bath sleeps 4. First bedroom contains 2 twin size beds and a 42" Smart TV, second bedroom has a full size sleeper couch. Second floor has a fully equipped kitchen, living room w/a fireplace and a 46" TV, dinning room for 8, master bedroom w/a queen size bed and a full bath, another bedroom with bunk beds. The couch in the living room can also be used as a bed. Living room opens up to the porch w/a grill and a picnic table for 6-8. The house comes w/a 2 car garage. Guest Access Guests will have access to the entire house. Interaction with Guests We'll be happy to help our guests with information about the area. The Neighborhood Sears Park on the other side of the lake w/tennis courts, skate park, boat ramp, snack bar, playground, and a public beach. Next to Sears Park is a Marina w/kayak, canoe, and a peddle boat rentals. Airline trail is 5 minutes away and is great for hiking, walking, jogging, and biking. Getting Around You can find everything you need right in town. Grocery store (Stop & Shop), 2 pharmacies, Dunkin Donuts, McDonald's, Subway as well as fine dining at Loco Pero, Governor's Tavern, and Angellico's Lake House with Tiki Bar and live music on the weekends. There is a snack bar and a bowling alley in walking distance from the house. Other Things to Note The guests will be given a pass to the private beach that is right across from the house. Inquire about our private pontoon boat cruises. + More

description: Description The Space The master bedroom boasts a nice queen bed while the guest bedroom offers a comfortable double. The third bedroom, used as a children's room, has one twin bed. We also have a pack-and-play available for guests with small children. Additional accommodations are possible, feel free to ask! Guest Access Small office, with desktop computer and printer. 1 Living and two sitting areas. Three Bed and Bath, two showers and a claw-foot tub. Ample Parking. Washer & Dryer. One-acre Backyard. Additional $10 to cover nearby gym access for the duration of your stay (per guest). Interaction with Guests We will not be present. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is close to downtown Norwich, Backus Hospital, and runs adjacent to the beautiful Mohegan Park. With numerous historical homes, a drive around the neighborhood is always a pleasure. Getting Around Parking included. 45 minutes from Hartford, New Haven, and Providence Airports. 25 minutes from New London train station. Public bus transit. And car available for rent (depending on availability). Other Things to Note Situated on the Norwich/Norwichtown border, we are minutes away from Mohegan Sun, Foxwoods Resort and Casino, and the Minor League Dodds Stadium. A little further (25-30 minutes) there are beaches, the Naval Subase New London, and historic downtown Mystic. We also have a kitten. If allergies are an issue please notify us in advance and we will gladly make accommodations for our feline friend. + More

about: This Cape Cod in Trumbull, sleeps up to 8 people depending on arrangement. House is on a Horse Farm, near Lakes, Mountain Biking Trails, State Parks, Golf and Restaurants! For weekend or corporate short term rentals! No Cats. Dogs considered.
description: Description The Space This house is situated next to an 18 acre horse farm that also has a tennis court. That horse farm happens to be related to this house! If you are interested in a unique experience in the country - to work on the farm - and take horseback riding lessons or have your children participate in our summer camp program, this house is for you! If you love to run - there is the best 4 - 5 mile running loop around Pinewood Lake... If you love tennis, we can have you enjoy the game in the back yard on the tennis court. In general, this house is adorable. Fairfield offers great dining - there is tons of shopping for all interests in the Trumbull Mall, Downtown Fairfield or Westport. Milford too! If you are visiting family and don't want to be in a hotel and have a family or friends that need to be in the area, this house is the best! Guest Access Tennis, Running Trails, Parks, Beaches, Golf Courses and a Horse Farm where renters can take lessons for a 10% discount. Interaction with Guests If you need help in the area we can help! If you want to be left alone! Fine with us! The Neighborhood This area of Trumbull, Connecticut is called Nichols. It is a historic section of the town, so you are surrounded by beautiful old homes. This house is perfectly located just off the Route 15 where you can even escape to new york city in 75 minutes! We have a mall, we are minutes to beaches, parks, mountain biking trails, golf and shopping! Getting Around Although close to the Stratford Train Station on the Metro North Line - we don't have public transportation in town that would suit a non driving renter. Other Things to Note The House is adjacent to a Horse Farm and Tennis Court. Feel free to walk in the back yard and follow the patch through the raspberry patch to pet horses or hit the tennis ball. Should you want to take horseback riding lessons - we can arrange it for you in advance. Same with use of the tennis court. + More
rules: House Rules I love this house. Most of the decorations are personal items from my travels and collections. I hope you enjoy the decor as much as I do. No Shoes are always a big help and always turn off the lights - to save on electricity! + More

description: Description The Space Comfy 4 bedroom country cottage recently restored. Drop dead sunset view over private lake. Located on Litchfield's largest private parcel of land-700 acres of fields, forest, trails, and lakes . Located 5 miles from the Town of Litchfield, the property is in a very private area and is in the midst of a 700 acre grass fed beef farm. Surrounding the farm are 2000 protected acres of the Waterbury Water Company. The Town of Litchfield is a short drive away and features numerous bars and restaurants, museums, nature preserves, antique shops and general sight seeing opportunities. Cloud Cottage is about 2 hours drive from both New York and Boston. The city of Waterbury, CT is about a 15 minute drive away, and from there you can take a train or bus to New York City. There are no other properties of this size in the Town of Litchfield and few others this size in the state of Connecticut. The farm it is in is one of the largest cattle ranches in Connecticut. A working farm experience is available at an additional cost, depending on group size and how involved you want it to be. + More

about: Smith Tavern is a 1770 Colonial with exquisite interior details dating back to the Revolutionary era, when it was a Tavern used by travelers coming to visit Litchfield, then the 2nd most populous town in Connecticut.
description: Description The Space Smith Tavern is a 1770 Colonial with exquisite interior details dating back to the Revolutionary era, when it was a Tavern used by travelers coming to visit Litchfield, then the 2nd most populous town in Connecticut. It remains a great place to entertain guests or to be by yourself to enjoy the solitude of the surrounding countryside. There is a Master Bedroom suite in the upstairs of the original portion of the house consisting of the Master bedroom with its own fireplace, a bathroom, an office/den that has a daybed with a trundle bed, a dressing room and a walk through closet. The living space consists of a formal living room with a fireplace, a TV area with its own fireplace, a dining room with beautiful wood paneled walls and wide plank flooring and a fireplace, and a kitchen with an eat in dining area. Adjacent to the kitchen is a newer bedroom wing consisting of a master bedroom and bath, and two smaller single bedroom, each with private bath. There is also a powder room off the main entrance hallway. The house has two decks, one on the eastern portion of the house overlooking a private pond, and a more secluded and larger deck on the western side of the house that features gorgeous sunset views over a hayfield ridge. Smith Tavern is approximately 2900 square feet. Guest Access There is a private 12 acre lake with a swimming area across Wigwam Road. There are also walking trails and a path around another 22 acre private lake. Interaction with Guests There is the possibility of a cattle ranch experience. Smith Tavern is located on a working cattle farm, and for an additional fee, guests can participate in the daily feeding and moving the cows during the season when grass grows and the cows are on pasture. The Neighborhood We are in one of the most secluded parts of Litchfield. The property is a 700 acre farm that is surrounded on 3 sides by the Waterbury Water Company's 2000 acres. There is a beautiful sunset view from the back deck over a nearby pasture as well as a morning view over a private pond. Getting Around The City of Waterbury is a 15 minute drive away and has bus and train connections to NYC. + More

about: Fantastic, authentic log cabin on 7 acres of wooded land with private pond that's good for a dip and with a sandy beach. Charm throughout with beds for nine to ten people.
description: Description The Space AN AUTHENTIC LOG CABIN IN THE BERKSHIRE MOUNTAINS OF LITCHFIELD COUNTY CONNECTICUT. Our log cabin is located on seven wooded acres with a lovely private, natural swimming pond, fire pit and sandy beach. Inside our cabin, a soaring beamed ceiling, skylights, and stone fireplace enhance the rustic charm. The cabin is furnished with everything you need for your stay, including bed linens, towels, kitchen equipment, cooking staples and basic toiletries. The house is on two levels. A master bedroom with Queen sized bed and loft bedroom with three twin beds are on the second floor along with a convertible sofa on the large landing. This makes sleeping for six on the 2nd floor. On the first floor, a double bedroom and a library with pull out sofa provides private sleeping accommodations for 4 more people. Playtime in the basement with pool and air hockey. There is also a television set with DVD player. A large front porch overlooks the garden and into the woods. A screened/sliding glass door sun porch on the side of the house looks out onto the path to the swimming hole. We have a large 6-8 person hot tub on this sun porch. A meadow in the back of the house is the perfect place for kids to play. We have a large trampoline here. Beyond the meadow is more woods for them to explore. Our pond is large, cool and refreshing. Children can swim and wander along the edge looking for tadpoles and frogs. In the center of the pond is a mini island for more exploring. The log cabin is close to skiing, the public town pond and recreation area, four state parks, Music Mountain and tubing on the Farmington River. This is the setting for a family vacation you will always remember. Guest Access The entire house and 7 acre wooded grounds are available for our guests to enjoy. Keep in mind a few things. This is a house in the country and there are bears, foxes and smaller critters on the property. The bunk beds are full size, but adults may not be comfortable sleeping in them and the bed on the landing is intended to accommodate a 10th person in the home, but it is not private. Finally, while our beach and pond are available for swimming, it has a leafy bottom and it is not crystal clear. A public pond and beach with lifeguard, changing area, toilets, parking, picnic tables and playground is located one mile from the cabin and is open to our guests at no charge. Most people enjoy our beach and pond for watching the wildlife, ducks, frogs and herons, barbecuing and using the firepit at night. Interaction with Guests We will communicate by email and phone, but we are not located on or near the property. This is our second home. A caretaker will be available should any problem arise. The Neighborhood This is a fabulous, rural area, practically a step back in time. We come here to relax and get away from the hectic pace of our regular lives. You'll find it perfect for that. Getting Around There is no public transit in this area. You will need a car. There is a lot of parking at the cabin. + More
rules: House Rules We do not allow smoking anywhere on the property, nor do we allow pets. Please do not ask. The fireplace on the main floor, and the fire pit by the pond are to be used responsibly. The fireplace in the rec room is not to be used. Please refrain from excessive noise at the pond and beach after 9pm and respect our neighbors. All guests must complete a reservation form and sign a waiver of liability. Number of beds used should conform to the number of guests. A fee will be charged for excessive use of linens. Please follow the departure checklist which will be sent to you after booking. + More

description: Description The Space Our lovely classic 1930s beach cottage is beautifully light and clean and a wonderful place to relax. The views onto Long Island Sound are fantastic; the sand and surf are right out the front door! The cottage is fitted out with comfortable vintage and minimalist furnishings and has wood floors throughout. The kitchen has top-of-the-line appliances including a Sub-Zero refrigerator, Gaggenau cooktop, and Miele oven and dishwasher. The cottage has two bedrooms and a spacious living area comprised of an open kitchen and large dining and living room. The two bedrooms have full-size beds. An extra-long twin in a quiet corner of the living area is both a daybed and extra accommodation at night. The bathroom has a stall shower, a claw-foot tub, and limestone floors. A deck right outside the front door provides additional space to relax and enjoy the sun and beautiful views. Walking and biking are favorite past times. Sailing, wind-surfing, golf, fishing, and bird watching are other popular activities. Make sure not to miss a trip to Marnick's, a venerable seaside diner just down the way, for ice cream and family meals. Amenities include wireless internet, cable television, washer/dryer, dishwasher, and gas grill. One hundred percent cotton linens and towels are included. The cottage is located only minutes off of interstate I-95, and is quickly accessible from Stamford to New Haven. Local train service from Stratford and Bridgeport to New York, Stamford, and New Haven is easily accessible. (NOTE: During the summer months, we prefer to rent by the week. We will not begin taking reservations for summer 2016 until January 2016.) + More
rules: House Rules No pets. No smoking inside the cottage. No gatherings of more than six persons without our permission. We have neighbors close by, so please no loud music and gatherings. about: A large, warm, and comfortable house set in pastures, woods, and glorious gardens. We have horses in our barn and pastures, an apple orchard, fireplaces, lots of space in and out. 2 hours from NYC by car. MetroNorth station 10 minutes away in Naugatuck.
description: Description The Space Our new barn and vintage farmhouse are on a sleepy country road surrounded by old growth maples, pastures, lawns, and flower gardens. While only a two hour drive from the City, the place offers a serene privacy. It is a great place for kids, in and out. We have a blazing red and orange New England Fall. Miles and miles of trails go through the mostly private land surrounding us. Great for biking, walking, hiking, and cross-country skiing. The house has two living rooms, a library, dining room, 5 bedrooms, two staircases, 3 TVs, stereos, books and books galore, two fireplaces and an outdoor fire pit near the apple orchard. A large terrace covered by a grape arbor is an extra room with chaises, chairs, a dining table, two grills and twinkling lights at night. Toys, puzzles, balls and bats, croquet, kites, frisbees, hula hoops,a plastic slider for sledding, floats and noodles for swimming. Guest Access Guests will have full use of the house and grounds. We have a kitchen stocked by a well - intentioned cook. A place in the garage for bikes and skis. Interaction with Guests Our caretakers live nearby and are on call. The Neighborhood We love the beauty and character of our place where we can be relatively close to the City and yet in serene quiet and privacy. Here we have gatherings of our large family and friends. Not far away are museums, nature preserves, swimming, skiing, biking, the Ct. Antiques Trail, a first-class restaurant and fabulous donuts. We are about half an hour from Litchfield, less than an hour from Yale, and 2 hours from NYC. Close to many prep schools. Getting Around The MetroNorth train stop is ten minutes away in Naugatuck. Bus service from Southbury or Waterbury, 20 minutes away. A car is a necessity unless you can manage a train/bike way of traveling. Food shopping is ten minutes away. Other Things to Note We cannot have pets or smokers. + More
rules: House Rules We would ask guests to take good care of our place and enjoy themselves as we do. While we love our dogs, we cannot invite them here. Ditto smokers. + More

rules: House Rules SECURITY DEPOSITS The purpose of the security deposit is to protect the home and it's contents from malicious or negligent damage and/or the home being left in abnormally dirty conditions resulting in excessive cleaning costs (i.e. carpet/furniture stains, furniture damage, broken or stolen items, etc.). The house should be kept in the same condition as guest check in. It is unlawful to remove any items from the home. It is the tenant's responsibility to report, upon arrival, any damages found and/or any repairs or maintenance needed. You are responsible for any and all damages that occur to the property or its contents by you or any other member of your group while you are the registered occupant of the property. If the cleaning company detects any evidence of smoking in the home you will be billed an additional $250 to deodorize the home. CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT TIMES In order to supply our guests a clean unit and avoid delays we ask that all guests abide by our check-in time of 4:00 pm. and check-out time of 11:00 a.m. $25.00 per hour charge for early/late check in/out, if available. KEYS There is no need for us to mail you keys because you will gain access to our home with a combination lock code, which will be sent to you prior to check-in. Early check-in is strictly prohibited, without prior consent from The Beach House, as time is needed to clean the premises for your arrival. LINENS AND HOUSEWARES All bed linens and towels are provided. A washer and dryer are on the premises for your use. An initial supply of hand soap and toilet paper are provided along with house wares. We suggest you bring your own beach towels and beach chairs, and other kitchen and bathroom convenience items. Bath towels are not to be taken out of the property for any other use. MAXIMUM OCCUPANCY The number of guests occupying the property is limited to 6 tenants with the exception of an infant requiring a crib. The named guests as shown on attached Exhibit A shall be a complete listing of all guests from arrival date until departure. These limits are strictly enforced. No mobile homes or campers of any sort will be allowed on the property. No visitors are allowed without prior written consent from the owner. Violations of any occupancy conditions is grounds for your security deposit not being refunded and immediate eviction without refund of rent or deposit. PARKING All watercraft and watercraft trailers are to be parked on parking lot. We respect the rights of our neighbors and strictly enforce parking. This agreement allows for a total of 3 parking spaces. Any illegally parked cars are subject to towing; applicable fines/towing fees and is the sole responsibility of the vehicle owner. NO BOAT OR WATERCRAFT USAGE IS INCLUDED WITH RENTAL Half and full day boat rentals are available through local marinas. Feel free to bring your own canoes and kayaks. NO SMOKING IS ALLOWED Any extra cleaning charges, including but not limited to carpet, furniture, draperies or bedding, because of smoking will be deducted from the security deposit. Smoking is not allowed inside or outside. Candles are not to be burned inside or outside the premises. Violations will be charged $500 fees. CHILDRE(URL HIDDEN) The home is NOT child proofed. We do not have child proof locks on any cabinets or doors and there are not gates to keep children from entering specific rooms. The yard is NOT fenced. Upon arrival, you may want to put items you think your child may get into away or up on higher shelves. Any child proof items needed for your children must be brought with the renter. NO PET AGREEMENT No pets are allowed on the property. Penalty will include forfeiture of security deposit plus an additional breach of contract fee of $500.00 and eviction of tenants. There are no exceptions to this policy. QUIET TIME/RESIDENTIAL PURPOSES Our quiet time rule is 11 pm to 7 am and is strictly enforced. The premises shall be used for residential purposes only. Renter(s) shall peacefully and quietly occupy the premises and shall not interfere with the rights of our neighbors/tenants. We respect the rights of our neighbors. Renter(s) shall permit no activities on the premises, which are contrary to any law, ordinance and/or applicable health and/or fire department or insurance policy provisions. Penalty will include forfeiture of your security deposit. OUTSIDE ACTIVITES The Town of Old Saybrook" strictly prohibits bonfires or contained fires. Our home is located within the limits; therefore, this rule is strictly enforced. REPAIRS Appliances, toilets, heating /air conditioning systems and all mechanics are continually checked and kept maintained. However, we cannot guarantee a mechanical may not malfunction during your stay. We make every effort to have repairs made as quickly as possible. No refunds will be made for failure or damage HOUSEKEEPING There is cleaning fee per rental period. The home will be ready for you upon check-in and will be cleaned after you depart. If you require additional housekeeping during your stay please contact the owner. Please rinse the sand off your feet and shoes before entering the house, extra charge for removal of sand in the house. If the place is left exceptionally messy, owner reserves the right to charge extra cleaning fee. BEFORE DEPARTING GUESTS ARE REQUIRED TO Clean dishes and cookware and place in cabinets. Lock all windows and doors. Leave furniture and dcor/games/accessories in original location and condition. Turn air conditioner off in summer and heat to 54 degrees in winter. Leave the beach house in as good condition as when you receive it. USE OF WASHER/DRYER The use of our washer and dryer is available to all guests. SKIS/BOARDS/WATER TOYS Please refrain from bringing water skis, snow skis/boards into the interior of the (URL HIDDEN) BOOK/USER GUIDE To make your vacation more enjoyable, we have tried to think of everything and include it in a binder...your "Area Guide" can be found on the kitchen counter. Please DO NOT remove from the property. This guide is filled with brochures from restaurants, retail shopping stores, attractions, maps, phone numbers and numerous things to do during your stay. INDEMNIFICATION The guest agrees to indemnify and save individual homeowner and the Beach House free and harmless for any liabilities or any loss or damages whatsoever arising from, related to, or in connection with rental of the premises. This includes, but is not limited to any claim or liability for personal injury or damage or loss of property, which is made, incurred or sustained, by guest or guests of guest, or any occupants of the premises. Renter(s), their family and guests bear the risk of any injury. It is further understood that the Beach House and owner shall not be responsible for any personal property left at the property by renters. TERMINATION OF RENTAL We reserve the right to refuse or discontinue tenancy if in its opinion the guest is detrimental to the property. We reserve the right to enter the property should we believe any of the above policies are being violated. Any violation of the above mentioned policies would result in immediate eviction with loss of the entire rental and security deposit amounts. HOLDING OVER Guest agrees that occupancy of the premises beyond the ending date and time shall be considered a trespass unless this Agreement is extended in writing. Guest acknowledges their status as a Guest within the meaning of the innkeeper statute, subject to removal at the end of the term agreed upon herein. + More

description: Description The Space The cottage, surrounded by 30 acres of open space is only 1.25 hours from NYC. It's a great place for a relaxing getaway. Enjoy the seasonal swimming pool, patio, cable, WiFi internet and close proximity to Fairfield/Litchfield County attractions. There is one large bedroom with a queen bed, plus a fold out queen sofa in the living area. There is another small bedroom with a futon, suitable for a child. The cottage has a fully equipped kitchen area, with dining table. Or dine on the screened in porch, above the stream. Towels and linens are furnished and there is a small washer/dryer in the closet. As we are in the country, you will need a car. Some guests from NYC take Metro North to Danbury and have Enterprise Car Rental meet them. The cottage is well situated for day trips to state parks, museums in Hartford and New Haven and several wineries on the CT Wine Trail. + More

about: Located on the top of a hill, our restored farmhouse is over 250 years old and surrounded by protected farmland. Less than half a mile away there is a farm that offers apple, blueberry, and strawberry picking. (URL HIDDEN)
description: Description The Space Welcome to 430CB. Perched on top of a hill and overlooking a vast expanse of protected farmland, it is easy to see why someone chose this spot to build a house over 250 years ago. Today, this newly renovated farmhouse still retains much of the original charm. Downstairs, low ceilings supported by the original hand hewn beams emerge from freshly plastered walls. A cozy, built in window bench with a twin mattress and nearby wood stove provide cozy winter retreats, and breezy spots for summer afternoon naps. The new kitchen, outfitted with a Viking stove and gargantuan farm sink, makes you want to cancel your plans and spend the day cooking. Upstairs, the deep soaking tub and skylights are perfect for long baths. The long, south facing, windows in the master bedroom allow you to see for miles. Come spend some time here and relax in the country. The Neighborhood Sharon is incredibly beautiful. There is a farm less than half a mile away where one can pick fresh blueberries, strawberries, and apples. Getting Around The metro-north train to NYC is 19 minutes away. + More
rules: House Rules Please be considerate of the belongings in the house. Feel free to read through the vast collection of books, utilize the kitchen and have an amazing candlelit dinner, but make sure you clean up after yourself. When you leave, please strip your bed and bring any linens or towels used down to the washing machine. + More

about: Light filled, private, peaceful, with mountain views! Unique 7 & 1/2 acre property.
description: Description The Space Entire house is an open plan and is in immaculate condition! Lie in bed and watch the sun come up over the mountains. You may see deer, fox, eagles, hawks or wild turkeys as well! Over sized living room with a wood burning fireplace surrounded by three sliding glass doors to let the sun shine in! Mountain and nature views from every direction! Enjoy sitting on your private deck sipping your favorite wine, listening to the birds, watching the wildlife, smelling the flowers. Near Candlewood Lake, the largest lake in Ct. with over 5,400 acres and 60 miles of shoreline. Great recreational area, offering some of the best all-season sports and activities.( Swimming, boating, snowmobiling, ice skating). Property is located approximately 1 1/2 hours from New York City, and about 1 1/4 hour from Hartford, Berkshires, Tanglewood. Close by are beautiful parks : Mohawk Mtn 30 mins., White Memorial State Park 25 mins.( canoe here early in the day to see the beavers!), Kent Falls State Park 20 mins, Mt. Tom State Park 20 mins., Appalachian Trail 12 mins. , Bulls Bridge Falls, 12 mins. 10 minutes from New Preston and Lake Waramaug. Raft, kayak, or canoe the Housatonic River or the mighty Shepaug River! The Kent School, Canterbury School, and South Kent School are all within a 12 minute drive! Close to restaurants, town, theater, stores, mall. Stunning Fall Foliage on and surrounding property. Wineries, Wine Trails, farms, orchards. Travel scenic roads, stroll through quaint and historic villages, shops, festivals, country fairs, flea markets, antiques, museums. Hike numerous trails, preserves, overlooks, waterfalls, covered bridges, wildlife sanctuaries. Spring and Fall foliage tours. Winter snowmobiling, ice skating, ice fishing, and ice boats, cross country and downhill skiing, snowboarding. Much to do in this beautiful location, information and maps provided. Owner is a reiki and reflexology practitioner, and can offer therapy for an additional fee. Massage therapist within a 5 minute drive! Ah, paradise! ( This is a no smoking, no pets allowed rental.) ***A few rescued cats live here when you are not renting, so people with cat allergies may have symptoms even though the house is immaculate and the cats go into the apartment with me! *** Guest Access Four bedrooms. Full Kitchen, dining room, huge living room and deck with propane BBQ grill, seating for 7. Interaction with Guests As much as you like! ***A few rescued cats live here when you are not renting, so people with cat allergies may have symptoms even though the cats go into the apartment with me! *** The Neighborhood This is in a designated scenic area. + More

description: Description The Space Bedroom with en suite bath in turn of the century Victorian home with extra room in renovated barn (with 'fridge). Queen beds and fresh flowers in both cozy, clean spaces. Lavish continental breakfast and locally roasted coffee in the morning. This is a wonderful space for couples, families and for solitary quiet and meditation Close to restaurants and shops in Rowayton, Darien, Norwalk and New Canaan. Guest Access Many guests have made use of our kitchen and living spaces upon agreement. There are porches and a yard for outdoor dining, play and rest. Interaction with Guests Guests will be personally welcomed. Our habit is to offer privacy and to make ourselves available when needed. The Neighborhood Our neighborhood is part of a beach town with a real New England flavor. The Saugatuck River is right across the street and we always suggest a morning walk up the river which spills into Long Island Sound. People in town are welcoming and kind and the beach is near by. Getting Around You can walk into the picturesque village where there are a number of restaurants, a gallery, wine shop and a small bit of shopping available. There is ample parking on our property and it is a 15 minute walk to the Metro North train station which travels both North and South from here. (It's a 45 minute ride into NYC.) + More

description: Description The Space Our beautiful apartment homes offer residents quality and comfort with excellent features like vaulted, nine foot ceilings, spacious walk-in closets and gas burning fireplaces. Your fully appointed apartment is furnished with all the necessities of home, including linens and towels. Property Amenities  Resident Club Suite with Coffee Bar  24 Hour Private Athletic Club  Business Services Center  Billiards Room  Resort Inspired Pool with Expansive Sun Deck  Fully Landscaped Private Courtyard  Free assigned covered parking  In unit washer/dryer The spacious private master bedroom suite features a deluxe queen size bed with our indulgent custom linens, fluffy duvet, and plush pillows, two night tables with lamps, clock radio, dresser, en-suite full bathroom and walk-in closets. The spacious second bedroom features a deluxe queen size bed with the same great linens, two night tables with lamps, clock radio, dresser and a spacious closet. A second full bathroom is available. The living room includes a sofa with pullout bed, club chair, an entertainment center with a flat panel LCD TV, DVD/VCR player, CD stereo system, a dining area with seating for four and a work desk with lamp and your choice of wired or wireless Internet access. The gourmet kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need including dishes, glasses, cutlery and pots and pans. The kitchen features full-size stainless steel appliances (four burner stove, oven, microwave, dishwasher and refrigerator), toaster, and coffee maker. Coffee, tea and sweeteners are provided. about: Four bedroom beach cottage with direct waterfront. Built in 1910 and maintains its original charm. Sit on the beach or front porch enjoying the views of Long Island Sound. Beach is great for swimming and playing. Perfect for a family vacation or long weekend getaway!
description: Description The Space Direct waterfront seasonal cottage. Four bedrooms. Full kitchen with amenities for cooking and eating. Dinning room table seats up to 10. Full bath. Front porch with swing. Watch the tides change and enjoy the sandbars at low tide and swimming at hide tide. Outdoor hot shower. Row boat available to use. Guest Access Private beach. The cottage is equipped with beach chairs and beach toys. Row boat for use with life jackets. Linens and towels and full kitchen. Interaction with Guests We will meet you upon arrival with a key. We are available by phone during your stay. The Neighborhood Close to downtown Milford and metro north train station. Milford offers fine dinning and shopping. Getting Around Trains and city bus are available. Other Things to Note The cottage was built in 1910 and maintains its original charm with period details and furnishings. It is seasonal and only available from May through September with off season rates during May and after Labour Day. During the months of July and August we prefer a 4 night minimum stay. + More

about: This cozy seaside cottage with sleep loft has the look and feel of an old classic yacht inside with modern amenities. Couples will love the water views, screened porch, gas-wood stove, heated stone floor in cedar bathroom, outdoor shower and patio. Another cottage on property for rent also.
description: Description The Space After many years of designing and building this unique maritime sea-side cottage we are finally offering it to AirBnB travelers. This is a nature-filled getaway location -- bordered by nature preserves and a tranquil salt water cove. Our 4-acre site is frequented by deer, rabbits, chipmunks, woodchucks, foxes and myriad of birds. Enjoy the private field stone patio and view cove-side sunsets, fireflies and skies that are never the same twice. The cottage also has a queen-size, pullout sofa downstairs. There is a spiral staircase up to a sleeping loft which features a great view in every direction and a comfy padded queen-size bed. All of the interior was handmade by a local yacht cabinet-maker and carpenter -- we personally added the maritime style and details. Very nice quality linens and toiletries are provided, a built-in bookcase library richly stocked, WIFI, cable TV and a Bose ipod/iphone speaker. Rain or shine or snow, we are sure you will enjoy this cozy cottage by the sea! Guest Access There are 3 cottages on the 4-acres and each has its own gas grill, tiki torches, patio furniture and other equipment. We ask guests to respect others privacy and personal belongings and not take boats, bicycles or furniture without permission from the manager Sandy who will greet you upon arrival. Interaction with Guests Either we or our property manager will personally meet each guest and answer questions about the cottage and the area. We are all local people and know where to eat, about all of the great local museums and attractions, farmer's markets, etc. The manager will be on call if anything arises! The other 2 cottages are usually very quiet and my one long term tenant is rarely there except in the evenings during the week. The other cozy cottage is used by our family and sometimes other Airbnb visitors. The Neighborhood Ideally located, our property is within 1-5 miles of The Mystic Seaport and Mystic Aquarium, the quaint little Mystic Amtrak Train Station (that runs to and from Boston and NYC), Mystic Schooner Cruises, historic downtown Mystic (shopping, drawbridge, river walk, art galleries, restaurants), Olde Mistick Village (outdoor shops, boutiques, cafs), historic Stonington Village (boutiques, cafs, lighthouse museum, the Captain Nathaniel Palmer house, local fishing fleet and town docks). Just 15 minutes north off I-95 there's also Foxwoods Casino, the Rhode Island State Beaches and shoreline. Just over the state border is Watch Hill, RI, featuring East Beach, Napa Tree Beach, The Ocean House Hotel and Residences, boutiques, restaurants and more! Getting Around Downtown Mystic is only 5 minutes away and easy to reach via bicycle or car. Once parked, all of Mystic's shops, businesses, galleries and restaurants are accessible by foot. There are nice green spaces to enjoy on both sides of the Mystic river complete with public restrooms and handicapped access ramps. Other Things to Note We just ask all our guests that you leave whatever you use as you found it:) + More
rules: House Rules All food items and beverages are for guests to enjoy and any perishables can be left for the cleaning crew to sort out. There is no smoking at all in the cottage and please dispose of filters if smoking outside. Out of respect to those with allergies we can no longer allow pets of any kind. + More

about: Our bird's nest perch in New Preston CT. This is a charming guest house, very privately positioned near our Lake Waramaug house. Complete with huge dock, a short walk thru the property, across shore rd., down to the lake.
description: Description The Space Our bird's nest perch in Washington CT. This is a charming guest house, very privately positioned near our Lake Waramaug house. Complete with huge dock, a short walk thru the property, across shore rd., down to the lake. Fantastic restaurants, antique shops and prime hiking locations are everywhere. This is a perfect hotel alternative for your short term visit to CT. Whether your grabbing dinner and drinks at the Mayflower after spending a perfect day paddling around Lake Waramaug, taking a tour of the of the Hopkins Vineyard while enjoying the beautiful fall colors, Skiing at Mohawk mountain before a gourmet dinner at RSVP or The Community Table this is the place for you. Clean and charming, with low ceilings, a large screened porch and exposed stone giving you more than enough space to entertain without paying hotel suite prices. The cottage is fully furnished, including linens and towels and possibly even a welcoming bottle in the fridge. Contact me for more info Cottage Features: 2 Bedroom - Large porch with lake views. -Stove,Microwave,Refrigerator, BBQ Grill - Short walk to access large dock and lake - Charming town filled with amazing restaurants, vineyards hiking trails. - 20 Minutes to Mohawk Mountain Additional Dock house available to sleep 3/4 more for an additional $100 per night Dock/Lake Features: - morning and evening lake jogs/ great cycling -great fishing - kayak - water bike + More
rules: House Rules No smoking indoors please. Additional Dock house available to sleep 3/4 more for an additional $100 per night. about: This is a great house and area for your spring and summer! We're looking for a full-summer renter (2016 - May 27th through September 6th - $21,000 (approx $205/day). Monthly rentals at $7,000 per month (approx $225/day).
description: Description The Space The house itself is bright and modern, built in 2006. Open entertaining area and comfortable private bedrooms all overlooking the garden and woods. Beautiful details and materials. Kitchen for a cooking enthusiast. Indoor and outdoor dining areas. You can search online using "Sharon, CT, Dwell, Beavers" and you'll see a great Dwell article and slide show on house. We open our house to you and we're sure you will enjoy it thoroughly. Guest Access Main house and one space in garage during winter months. Interaction with Guests There will be weekends that we will stay in the apartment above the detached garage. It is completely private and separate. The Neighborhood This rural setting includes our 8 acre property with protected wetlands a half mile around. Local outdoor activities - hiking (5 minutes to Appalachian Trail), swimming in nearby lakes, biking and running the quiet country roads, skiing (Mohawk Mountain is 10 minutes away), rafting or fly-fishing the Housatonic River (7 minutes away), apple/berry orchard farm for pick-your-own fruits (Ellsworth Farm is 3 minutes away), car racing (Limerock Race Track is 15 minutes away) and nature preserve (Audubon Center is 5 minutes away). This area has it all. Local culture and dining in Kent (CT), Salisbury (CT), and Millerton (NY) - all within 15 minutes from the house. We are also within 20 minutes from four premier boarding schools. Getting Around A wonderful getaway just 2 hours north of New York City by car or train (Wassaic MetroNorth station 15 minutes away). + More
rules: House Rules We look forward to meeting our renter prior to contract. We are available to do so in NYC or up at house. This is our private home although we remove personal items. No smoking - no pets. The house in NOT baby and toddler proof, please use common sense and discretion. The house accommodates 6 people but we'd like to know if there will be more guests than 4. Please note there is TV via direct TV. Please note the internet is via satellite dish and usually works fine but not during stormy weather - this is not the house for continuous gaming/streaming until cable finally reaches us. Please note cell phone access is spotty in our rural area but you can find a signal and we will give use of land line. + More

about: Private, pretty antique home , less than a 2 hour ride from NYC and a 10 minute walk to the historic Washington Green and Gunnery School. The property is graced with mature gardens and trees, a large covered porch, pond and abundant wildlife.
description: Description The Space The space provided includes three bedrooms, one large bedroom with a queen size bed, the other with a standard bed and another with a single bed. A full bath with tub on the second floor services these bedrooms. The third floor (the tree house) has a cathedral ceiling, a full bath and soaking tub, a large flat screen TV, an L shaped deep sofa (perfect for sleeping in front of the TV!) and a large library of movies for all ages. Deep, wide windows bathe the room with light on two sides while providing a view of the grounds and pond. The covered porch, overlooking the gardens is perfect for morning coffee and evening cocktails. A cacophony of bird songs will entertain you in the morning and the frogs will begin the songs at night to be followed by hoot owls. Guest Access Guests will have access to the second and third floor, the grounds, porch, patios and pond. Although there are no kitchen privileges (except for use of the refrigerator) a continental breakfast will be served and prepared to your specifications for dietary limitations. We live in the lower level of the house. Interaction with Guests I tend to be an "Italian Mother" when it comes to servicing your needs. I respect the value of letting everyone do their own thing in privacy. We're there for any question or concern but won't hover. The Neighborhood We live in one of the most bucolic, iconic New England destinations. The beauty year round is a draw for people from all over the East Coast and beyond. People who could live anywhere in the world choose to live here. Washington is centrally located in Litchfield County, 15 minutes or less from dozens of great restaurants, lakes, hiking trails, antique centers, cross country ski & bike trails, apple orchards (Avrill Farms!) and so much more. We're 20 minutes from Mohawk Mountain, 40 minutes from Infinity Hall and a bike ride away from some of the most glorious landscape you'll ever experience. All one has to do is walk out of my door to experience quintessential, classic country Connecticut. Getting Around For a fee, I am available to pick you up from the Wingdale or Brewster stations in New York and we will take you back if you don't have a car. I can also drive you to the Enterprise car rental in New Milford, CT. for a much more reasonable rate than the NYC car rental prices. I know this county quite well, having lived here for more than 30 years and selling real estate for almost as many years .Whatever your preferences and interests I have insights and guidance for you. Other Things to Note No matter what the season, there is always beauty and interesting things to do here. Please let me know what your interests are (even if it's chilling out in private, undisturbed peace and quiet) and we will guide and provide for you accordingly. We have two friendly, non territorial dogs who love the company of other dogs. If you choose to bring your dog please bring a crate when unsupervised, we do not have fencing around the property. A fee of $35 will be charged for a two day stay with your dog. If you have a sixth person who doesn't mind sleeping on the sofa on the third floor (there is a full bath there) an extra $35 a day will be charged. The sofa is wide, long and quite comfortable. + More
rules: House Rules There's no smoking inside and no kitchen privleges. Pets are allowed if they will get along with my two friendly dogs but they must be crated or kept inside the room when not here. + More

about: Charming 250 year-old colonial located on a quiet county road in Litchfield County, Connecticut. Perfect for hiking, skiing and swimming. Wonderful spot for weekends away from the city. Close to Hotchkiss, Lime Rock and the Berkshires.
description: Description The Space This is the perfect spot for one or two families to enjoy country weekends full of outdoor activities, or just sitting around the fire. The road is super-quiet, the gardens are lovely, the fireplaces huge. The kitchen is equipped with all you need to create big meals. It's minutes from Mohawk Mountain skiing, the Appalachian and Mohawk Trails hiking routes, and the Housatonic River. It's also great for families wanting to visit their kids at nearby Hotchkiss or watch the races at Lime Rock. Guest Access The whole house. Interaction with Guests You will have complete privacy--I am not in the house. I do have a handyman in town and neighbors who know the house. A housekeeper can be arranged to help with cleaning. The Neighborhood Red Mountain Farm is on a quiet road. It's a 5 minute drive to to village of Cornwall, where there is a library, public clay tennis court and playground. It's also 5 minutes to West Cornwall, home of one of Connecticut's beautiful covered bridges. Getting Around House is located about 90 miles from New York--about a 2 hour drive. It's 30 minutes from the Wassaic train station. There is a taxi service from the train. There is plenty of parking at the house. Other Things to Note There is a convenience store 2 minutes away, but the nearest supermarket is a 25 minute drive. The nearest movie theater is a 20 minute drive. The tiny village of West Cornwall has a restaurant and Cornwall village has a library and public tennis courts, but not much else. All to say--this is quiet country life! + More
rules: House Rules Pets are allowed, with prior consent. Absolutely no smoking. Please leave the house broom clean, with beds stripped and dishes cleaned or dishwashing running. about: FALL IN LOVE WITH NEW ENGLAND any time of year at our four season cottage in Litchfield County. Our waterfront home is on Connecticut's 76-acre Park Pond in the foothills of the Berkshires, with scenery and proximity to many activities.
description: Description The Space The cottage has a great-room design with living and dining room all connected and offering views of the water. Sliding glass doors lead to a large deck. A barbeque grill is on the lower deck making it easy to cook and eat up on the deck or down on the beach. The lawn ends at our small grassy beach and dock. On the first floor there is 1 bedroom with a queen bed, a new bathroom with tub/shower, and kitchen. The second floor has two more bedrooms with twin beds in each. There is a brand-new bathroom with generous sized-shower on the second floor. Good airflow and ceiling fans in every bedroom maintain a comfortable temperature throughout the house. There is no air conditioning and none is needed. Forced air heat keeps the house toasty in winter. Cable television and high-speed internet is available and you can watch DVDs on the color TV in living room and downstairs bedroom. A telephone is available for local, emergency and calling card calls. Children are always welcome but their adults must understand that this property is on the water. Guest Access The house, garden, back deck, swimming pond, dock, kayaks, grill, and front parking lot are all for you to use and enjoy. Interaction with Guests You will not see me at this property but a caretaker and cleaning lady will see to your needs. The Neighborhood Litchfield County is classic Connecticut. Historic, beautiful, rural with rolling hills and water everywhere. There are a few other homes and two summer camps on the pond. Our street is quiet. Most homes are located within sight of the water. Its like our big, common, back yard. You will see our friendly neighbors as the homes are close but there is a surprising amount of privacy if that's what you prefer. Four state forests are nearby and every drive is a scenic one. In winter, the pond is used for cross-country skiing, snow-mobiling, snow shoeing and ice fishing. Downhill skiing is 15 minutes driving distance from the house. The town of Winsted, three miles away, offers many activities including antique and curio shops, festivals and community events, restaurants, wineries, go carts, batting cages, a free-public skate park, a multiplex movie theatre for everyone, and a dinner movie theater for adults. Getting Around This is a rural home and you will need a car. There is no public transportation available. Other Things to Note ACTIVITIES: Leaf-peep, nature and bird watch. Fish and kayak in the fall and spring. Snow shoe, ski, skate and ice fish in the winter. Swim, tube and kayak or canoe in the summer. + More
rules: House Rules Our guests are encouraged to go "green" by being conservative in the use of water and soap. For this reason, the property is not appropriate for large parties. There is no dish or clothes washer. Children must be watched at all times. We cannot accommodate pets or smokers. Personal floatation devices (some are provided at the house) must be worn at all times when using the kayaks. Check in is at 6pm and check out is 2 on weekends and 12 during the week. Check with us in the week prior to your stay if you would like to arrive earlier or depart later. Please respect our neighbors and do not make loud noises after sunset or before sunrise. This house is in the country which means you will see animals like chipmunks, mice, foxes and sometimes bears. If this bothers you, this may not be an appropriate place for you to stay. The pond has an 8 mph speed limit. It is used mostly for recreational boating and fishing. In the winter there is ice fishing and sometimes if it is cold enough there may be snow mobilers. The house uses a septic tank. Careful and judicious use of water and soap assures that the pond will remain clean and clear into the future. While a professional cleaner will arrive on your departure day, you are expected to leave the home reasonably tidy, dishes washed, food removed and garbage emptied. Dirty sheets and towels should be placed in the basket for the housekeeper. All adult guests will have to sign a waiver of liability before the key is sent. We do not allow pets. Please do not ask. + More
