about: We are sharing our gorgeous georgian colonial with guests this spring to fall. There are many surrounding towns and neighborhoods that are worthy of exploring and having a cozy base such as our pretty little house will make you feel at home!
description: Description The Space Welcome to Essex! The quintessential New England town. Known for producing Witch Hazel, and Ivory, and our famous steam train that will bring you back to another era long gone. We are one mile walk from the center of Essex Village. We are located in Essex, CT. We are also 5 minutes from Old Saybrook, 8 minutes from Old Lyme, and 9 minutes from Deep River. Our house is a 5 bedroom, 6 bathroom house. You will be staying in the Master Suite and we would inform you if other guests are staying at the same time. We usually only like to take on 1 couple at time to keep it as private as possible. You will have either a queen or king bed, extremely comfortable with luxurious linens, and tons of pillows. Its a bit over the top but hey, we love our sleep as much as you. Lots of light and lots of windows, fresh air and beautiful pool, pond and wooded views. Be sure to visit all the cute shops and restaurants in the area! Guest Access You will have access to our gourmet indoor and outdoor kitchen to cook whenever you want. Please make sure you wash the dishes and put everything back how you found it. You will be assigned to one of our spacious bedrooms with private bath. Everything else is common space. You can have your own private access to your bedroom if you're staying downstairs with patio views. You may use our pool, outdoor shower and outdoor kitchen for lunch and dinner time depending on what we are doing, you may join us of course! Feel free to pick fresh herbs and vegetables from our organic garden, and take a walk on the Heron Pond Reserve trails across our road. There is a creek that runs through the property and gives us ambient noise, as well as the crickets and frogs that chirp at night. Children are 125 extra, and adults are 200 extra. Please inquire before booking to get special rates. Interaction with Guests We tend to do our own thing and leave guests to themselves, however we are filled with lots of information and helpful tips on what to do and where to go in the area, the best places to dine at night, or relax for coffee and have delicious breakfast by the pool or on the deck or on the patio. We have two dogs so you must be dog friendly, although we don't accept new dogs on our property. The Neighborhood We love Essex. We are orginally from NYC and started spending our weekends here to get away from the hustle and bustle of city life. Essex is the best of both worlds, located 5 minutes from Old Saybrook where are the big stores are such as Walmart, Ocean state job lot, and home goods, and only 1 hr and 40 minutes from NYC. Our nearest beach is 7 minutes away, or 30 minutes by bicycle. Our giant pool might just entice you to spend the entire day lounging out relaxing in the sun. Chester is 10 minutes away and is a great thriving artist community with delicious restaurant. If you plan on sticking around in Essex, don't miss the Griswold Inn for its nightly live music, and the amazing wine bar. How about take a nice day or sunset cruise on the CT river museum's Schooner? You can bring your own picnic and wine while enjoying an idyllic river cruise. Interested in fishing? You can drive to 20 min to Niantic and take a saltwater fishing trip with the crew. That's one way to bring food home for dinner. Yum, Fresh Sea Bass on our Gas Grill! Getting Around You must have a car to get around, although if you don't have one, taxi service is easily booked but you may have to wait 20 minutes to an hour depending on slow they are. In the spring and summer, it is easy to walk around everywhere, we are only 5 minutes away from the Old Saybrook train station (metronorth and amtrak). Please let us know if you need a car while you are here. We can put you on the insurance for the time being. It is an additional charge per day- we have 2 luxury vehicles, a 2015 Porsche and a Mercedes SUV. Other Things to Note Essex, Ct was voted more than 10 times in a row for being the best smallest town in America. Come stay with us and find out why! + More
rules: House Rules We look forward to hosting responsible professional or retired adults looking to get away for the weekend. Please treat our beautiful house as you would your own. We put a lot of TLC into this house to make it special for you and others after you to enjoy. We expect you would treat our peaceful and idyllic environment as special as we treat it. Our lawns and gardens are manicured and our linens are freshly pressed- No smoking inside or outside our house or on our property. Please take care as to not disturb or damage the lawns and gardens. The flowers are irresistible to pick, but please refrain from picking any flowers or disturbing the wild life on the property or on the trails across from our house at the conservation. We are your hosts and not your cleanup crew. If you use any of the dishes, please make sure you wash the dishes and put away everything. You can use our washer and dryer but do not use it excessively and unnecessarily. We function on well water for the entire house, please make sure to conserve water and electricity while you are staying here. "Please leave only footprints, and take only photographs." + More

description: Description The Space This apartment in a 19th century house was recently remodeled with modern amenities. Granite countertops, hardwood floors throughout, exposed brick, breakfast bar, and stainless steel appliances. The sleeping accommodations consist of 2 bedrooms with queen size beds, and a large rollout couch that sleeps 2 comfortably. We are really into cooking, so our kitchen is well equipped with everything you might need should you decide to prepare your own meals. There is a grill and fire pit out back for barbecues. Guest Access In addition to the apartment, you will also have access to our backyard, which includes a gas grill, patio set, hammock, and a fire pit with a seating area. Interaction with Guests We will not be in the apartment, but will be available should the need arise. The Neighborhood East Rock is beautiful tree lined neighborhood full of historic homes. Within a 1 block radius, you can find Italian markets, coffee shops, several wine bars, pizza, pastry shops, restaurants, brunch, and a free shuttle giving access to downtown and Yale. Although there is free parking provided, the neighborhood is very walkable, and it's only a short walk downtown to Yale. Getting Around 2 guest passes for free on street parking are included. (It's easy to find spaces on our street). Free Yale shuttle is located 1/4 block away, and can take you anywhere on the Yale campus or downtown New Haven. There are also bike lanes for those looking to get around on 2 wheels Other Things to Note For nights in, or entertaining, you will have access to our home theater setup, which includes Netflix, HBO, and Amazon prime video, as well as a high end surround sound system. + More

description: Description Guest Access fully furnished, wifi, washer/dryer, fireplace, yard, deck, parking Interaction with Guests Plenty of online and cell communication as needed. Upon your arrival, we are available for any questions. Open communication at all times is appreciated. The Neighborhood Orange is a comfortable suburb of New Haven with a population of 13,000 and a feel of, small town blended with rural suburbia. It is a very safe community with little crime. Most homes are single family, owner occupied and are situated on 1/2 acre of land. Trees, shrubs and some woods decorate the area but houses are within sight of each other. Most neighbors are private but not unfriendly. Many supplies and resources are available approx .2 mi away on Route 1. Other Things to Note Our very independent cat, "mister", comes and goes between the mudroom, the garage and the outdoors via a garage door doggie door. Occasionally he comes into the house. You do not to feed or care for him. His meals are provided by a neighborhood girl who drops his food off at the mudroom twice a day. She does not need to come into the house or disturb you in any way. He is a 15 yrs old male cat and very sweet. If you prefer he not come into the house, simply do not let him in. He usually sleeps in his bed located in the mudroom. + More

about: An architectural masterpiece, our rental is situated on 11 landscaped acres featuring mature fruit trees and extensive gardens which continuously flower from March thru October. Perfect as a skiers retreat (Ski Sundown), whatever the season, our guesthouse will offer you a warm welcome and a peaceful stay of quiet enjoyment.
description: Description The Space Our rental guest house is an architectural masterpiece designed and painstakingly built by the acclaimed artist Richard Harden. A little over 2 hours by car from Boston and New York City, we are located in the lovely hamlet of Barkhamsted in Northwest Connecticut, one of Litchfield County's best kept secrets. With the beautiful lake McDonough Recreational Area and the Farmington River just a stone's throw away, our guest house is surrounded by nearly 4,000 acres of State forests, with miles of walking trails punctuated with dramatic mountain outlooks all within walking distance of the property. Air and light permeate the guest house space, which is constructed around the beams of an 18th century barn once situated on the coast of Maine. The guest house features wide floor boards, plastered walls, custom molding, oak paneling preserved from a turn-of-the century estate in Bridgeport Connecticut, and walls of mini-paned leaded glass windows composed of antique glass. Each of the windows frames a picturesque view of the stately property. The guest house inherits the main house's architectural style and aesthetic; clean, simple, open, friendly. The kitchen is the focal point of the studio. It boasts unique hand-crafted cabinetry, granite countertops, accent lighting, and top of the line appliances. The large dining table was hewn from local timber. This is not a Bed & Breakfast, and thus there is no predetermined meal schedule to adhere to. Food-loving cook guests are free to use the kitchen to prepare their own repast at their leisure. In season, guests may pick salad from our vegetable garden, and apples and peaches from our small orchard. The master bedroom with its cathedral ceiling gives a sense of spaciousness. It features a full-sized antique brass bed and a primitive iron twin-sized bed. A day bed adorns the sitting area. The bedroom exudes comfort and warmth. The exquisitely tiled bathroom features a claw-foot tub and a pedestal sink from a bygone era. Guests can behold a breathtaking view of the pine forests while enjoying a relaxing bath in the tub. Guests with an appreciation of nature and the environment will particularly find our place worthy of a stay with us. The area is renowned for its hiking, bicycling, fly fishing for trout and kayaking on the Farmington River that flows nearby, and kayaking/canoeing/swimming on Lake McDonough. Olga and John can point you to the most scenic and exhilarating outlooks and most adventurous hiking trails, and John might be convinced to guide you to some of his favorite stretches of trout waters on the Farmington. For ski enthusiasts (like us), Ski Sundown is only 12 minutes away by car. Whether you are an advanced, intermediate or beginner skier or snowboarder, Ski Sundown has terrain to suit your needs. Set in a beautiful mountain setting, the resort boasts 100% snowmaking on every trail, with excellent grooming and reliable conditions. Ski Sundown offers day and night skiing. The Snowsports School at Ski Sundown is made up of over 200 dedicated staff members whose mission is to share their love of skiing with you and your family, and its cadre of professional ski instructors will meet the need of any level of skier through a number of lesson packages. Whatever the season, our guest house will offer you a warm welcome and a peaceful stay of quiet enjoyment. We love our charming country estate, and would love to share it with discerning travelers. Please note: Absolutely no smoking permitted on the property No Parties Maximum Capacity: 3 Adults or 2 Adults & 2 Children No pets There is no air conditioning in the guest house, but Summer nights are usually cool, and the guest house is fully screened in the Summer. In Winter, it is fully and comfortably heated. Guest Access Guest may feel free to stroll the grounds of the estate. Guests may use the picnic table and charcoal grill (seasonally). Guests may use washing machine and dryer in main house upon request. We kindly request that our guests refrain from wandering onto our neighbors property, which borders our property to the North. The property boundary is clearly delineated. If there is any doubt about the property boundary, please don't hesitate to ask us. Interaction with Guests Our guests will have quiet enjoyment of the premises during their stay. While the owners will be present in the estate's main house, they will have little if any interaction with the guests unless desired by the guests for a particular inquiry. Olga and/or John will most likely be present during guest stays. The Neighborhood Our property is surrounded by State and private forests. We have a small, naturally fed pond, which is full of gold fish and home to frogs and a few turtles. There is an abundance of wildlife in the area, and guests should not be surprised to see whitetail deer, bobcat, turkey, many song birds, and even black bear which time to time roam the area undisturbed. We kindly request that our guests refrain from wandering onto our neighbors property, which borders our property to the North. The property boundary is clearly delineated. If there is any doubt about the property boundary, please don't hesitate to ask us. Getting Around Of course there is no public transport. Guest have plenty of space to park a car (or two). Other Things to Note The Guest House has a working smoke detector and CO detector. We only accept reservations from adults 18 years and older. We are generally flexible with check-in/check-out times. In the event that there are overlapping reservations, we ask that the current guests check-out at 11:00 am. Where there are overlapping reservations, we ask that arriving guests check-in is 3:00 pm + More
rules: House Rules There's an extensive library in the guest house, with a wide selection of books, which guests are free of course to read. We ask that Guests not take books with them on their departure (unless they plan to return for another visit with us!). For skiers, we have plenty of room to store ski equipment. Ski equipment may not be brought into the Guest House. + More

about: This renovated train station features a large, high-ceilinged atelier and comfortable living area. Perfect for artists or sportsmen, it's located on the Housatonic River- a peaceful spot immortalized by James Thurber and in photos by Walker Evans.
description: Description The Space This historic 1880s train depot is located in the quiet town of Cornwall Bridge, Connecticut, about two hours' drive north of Manhattan. The two large downstairs rooms feature feature high ceilings, plenty of light and stunning woodwork. Wonderful for an artist or photographer, this space can be used as a studio, or simply as a relaxing living room. The adjoining open, modern kitchen has a full refrigerator and freezer, oven and dishwasher. The renovated second floor, which has gables and beautifully angled walls, has two sunny bedrooms and an office with a working fireplace. The Weber BBQ grill is perfect for outdoor cooking. There are one and a half bathrooms; the upstairs bathroom has a shower in an antique claw-foot bathtub. Renowned for fly fishing, the peaceful Housatonic River is just across the lawn. Mohawk Ski Area is ten minutes away and other ski areas north on route 7 in Mass. Guest Access Access is to the entire house and property. Interaction with Guests The owner will not be on site during guests' stays, but is available for any local recommendations or questions. The Neighborhood Cornwall is a picturesque New England village, located in a beautifully wooded expanse of northwestern Connecticut. A few hours' drive from New York City, it seems another world; covered bridges, rolling hills, state parks and farmland make it a rustic getaway that's easy to get to. Local attractions include the Appalachian Trail, Mohawk Ski Area, Kent Falls, Music Mountain and historic Litchfield. From rafting, fishing, hiking and cycling, to quaint local restaurants and antiquing, you'll want to stay more than a weekend! Lime Rock Race Track is also close by. Getting Around This property requires a car or other transportation, and free parking is available on site. The closest Metro North train station is Wassaic, about a 25 minutes' drive; local taxi service is available. Other Things to Note The depot is located near train tracks, which are used once or twice a day, for a small local freight train. A thrill for train buffs! + More

about: Cozy up and enjoy the serenity of winter in quiet, retreat in wooded setting. Easy 1 hr train ride to NYC; hiking; walking distance to restaurants and shops, enjoy day trips skiing, snowshoeing, indoor rock climbing, shopping or art galleries. There's much to do year round! Couples/families welcome!
description: Description The Space Cozy, sophisticated home in wooded setting on .6 acre of land with updated amenities is a home away from home for the entire family (sleeps 6). Quiet peaceful getaway yet close to all the action! Only 1 hr train ride to the heart of NYC. Nestled in a quiet neighborhood yet walking distance to shops and restaurants. Easy day trips skiing/snowtubing; 10-15 min. from beaches; music concerts/symphonies; art galleries; bustling SONO nightlife; excellent spa treatments; the Children's Museum; Maritime Aquarium; Stew Leonards Market which has the largest dairy store in the world! Endless activities year round for the whole family to enjoy! Open and light living room/dining room features reclaimed wood floors and custom table makes for easy entertainment. Kitchen overlooks the yard. The kids will love the full wall blackboard, bunk beds and the playground in the yard! Bring your yoga mat because there is a private yoga/meditation studio to which you will have part-time access!!! The 190 sq ft private yoga studio with separate entrance and private bathroom is attached to the house. It is newly renovated with cathedral ceilings and large windows with garden view. Renters will have access to this studio space when it is not being used by other yoga teachers/therapists. After yoga, enjoy a nice shower in the built-in steam shower! Harvest ripe fruit and vegetables (seasonal). We will vacate the house while renter is there, however, we will be readily accessible via phone or email if any questions arise. Guest Access Walking distance Walmart, restaurants and other shops within walking distance. Train to NYC, Boston or other cities 10 min away. Easy day trips to: historic Mystic Seaport, Rhode Island beaches, skiing/snowtubing, NYC, Boston, local farms or farmers markets (seasonal), or local wineries. Interaction with Guests We will vacate the house while renter is there, however, we will be readily accessible via phone or email if any questions arise. The Neighborhood Take in the innovative museums, shop till you drop, wine and dine, go to local theaters or off to nearby Stamford to the performing arts center, sledding, farmers markets. Downtown SONO nightlife or day trips skiing or to NYC! Much to do during every season!! Peace and quiet in the heart of the action. Getting Around Only 1 hr train easy commute to Grand Central NYC (train station is 10 min. away from house) Other Things to Note Yoga studio with separate entrance and private bathroom is attached to the house. Renters will have either full or part-time access to this studio space depending on whether or not another yoga teacher/therapist is using space. + More

description: Description The Space Large A-frame vacation cottage on private lake. Large great room with stone fireplace, private bedroom, sleeping loft, wrap-around screen porch. 1.5 baths, full kitchen, 2.5 wooded-acres with lake view and private dock. Wireless internet. Swim, boat, sail, fish. (no gas motors allowed on the lake or outside/unregistered boats). Easily sleeps 5. Can sleep more. Pets negotiable. No Smoking. Summer only. Available May 1 - October 1 (flexible). 20 minutes by car to New Haven and Yale University. Stratford Train Station for commuter rail to NYC a 10 minute drive away. Family home that has been used and loved for many summers, but we can't get there this summer and would love to have others enjoy it. description: Description The Space Compass Furnished Apartments at Parc Grove in Stamford is a unique mid-rise nestled in the heart of downtown Stamford. Shopping, Dining, entertainment and transportation are all within walking distance. In the core of the property lies a picturesque courtyard complete with a heated swimming pool and sundeck making it hard to believe that the city is just outside your door. Relaxed living in our temporary furnished apartments with endless amenities. Parc Grove is the place to be! *More options available in Parc Grove *More options available in Stamford and surrounding areas Property Amenities -Close to I-95 and Stamford Mall -Complimentary Java Bar -Complimentary Shuttle To Metro North Train Station -Indoor Basketball Court -Indoor Racquetball Court -Landscaped BBQ and Picnic Areas -Recently Renovated Amenity Space -Sparkling Outdoor Heated Swimming Pool -State-of-the-art Two Floor Fitness Center -Underground Garage Parking -Valet Dry Cleaning Service -Wii Room, Resident Lounge & Media Room Apartment Features -Beautifully Furnished & Equipped -Full-size Washer/Dryer in Every Apartment -Gas Burning Fireplaces in Select Apartments -Lofts Available in Select Homes -Private Patio or Balcony with Seasonal Outdoor Furniture -Spacious Floorplans -Spacious Walk In Closets **Newly Renovated Apartment** **Furniture in Living Area has changed since** Guest Access Guests will have access to all of the amenities on the property including the outdoor heated pool, courtyard, indoor basketball court, indoor racquetball court, fitness center, residents lounge, and underground parking garage. Interaction with Guests We will provide step by step interactions before, during, and after the reservation. We will provide move in and move out instructions in order for the resident knows exactly what to expect. The Neighborhood Downtown living in Stamford is convenient and easy. Within one mile from the Stamford Train Station, you are only a 45 min express train to Grand Central Terminal. Parc Grove is located across the street from Stamford Town Center Mall and just steps from tons of shops and restaurants. Take advantage of live music and entertainment during the summer concert series or see a show at the Avon Theater. Temporary living at Parc Grove puts you in the center of it all. Getting Around - 15 Minute Walk to the Train - Shuttle for Commuting Hours to the Train - 45 Minute Train Ride to NYC - Easy Access to I-95 + More

about: How about being able to walk to the beach (about a seven minute walk, or park right next to it if you prefer) and then retreat to a woodsy setting for grilling and relaxing on the deck? This little cottage has delivered true rest for guests for the last ten years.
description: Description The Space Located in Niantic, Connecticut, Waxwing End is offered to the vacationer as comfortable and affordable lodging. This two-bedroom, one-bath, vacation home comfortably accommodates parties of four with one bedroom furnished with a king-sized bed and the other with twin-sized bunks. The large living room comes with cable TV and wi-fi Internet access. plus a DVD/VCR player. The deck off the fully equipped kitchen makes dining outside a cinch. Also, as a member of the Giants Neck Heights Beach Association, Waxwing End amenities include playgrounds, basketball courts, private beach, a boat launch for small craft, and walking access to all that adjacent Rocky Neck State Park has to offer, including a mile-long, sandbar beach and miles of walking/cycling trails. Guest Access The guests have access to the house, neighborhood beach, state beach, fruit patches (when in season), and we welcome any questions regarding any matter of permission. Interaction with Guests We like to interact with our guests but interactions can be experienced as interruptions so we are sensitive to the guests expectations in that area. Leading up to the guest's stay is the period of most interaction while detailed questions are answered. But once the guest is checked in we like to touch base to be sure the guest is comfortable and not wanting anything. The Neighborhood Slow and quiet, walks along the shore at night, singing birds in the morning. Getting Around No public transit. For folks who'd rather not walk to the beach, a parking pass is provided so that a car can be stowed only steps from the sandy edge. The Old Saybrook train station is about 15 minutes from the house. Other Things to Note Small craft can be launched nearby. Ask us for more details. + More
rules: House Rules Beds: 1 King, twin-size bunks, full size metal frame futon. No smoking indoors. Pets, extra person? Ask us ... Guests provide their own linens and towels. Guests can help themselves to the blueberry and strawberry patches. + More

about: The beach is beautiful all year round. Our cozy 3 bedroom cottage is ideally located at the entrance to Ocean Beach. Walk on the boardwalk, relax on the wrap around porch, sunrise or sunset. A great getaway spot, 2.5 hrs to NYC, 2 hrs to Boston.
description: Description The Space Our cottage is a magical, romantic place, perfect for a beach getaway for couples, families or friends. 1100 square feet, 2 story, 3 bedroom, 1.5 bath, wrap around porch, fully furnished, laundry, off street parking, wood floors. Beds: 1 double bed in MBR, 2 twins in 2nd BR upstairs (Captain's bed), 1 twin bed downstairs BR, Pullout dble/Q sofa in LR. Sleeps 5-7 adults max. Great location! Ocean Beach has entertainment, fireworks, boardwalk, large beach, beach volleyball, restaurant, bar and concessions. Guest Access Rental includes 4 walk-in beach passes, off street parking in driveway, laundry area in basement. The rest of the basement is not for guest use. Interaction with Guests We will greet you on arrival and show you around and answer questions. We are available if you need anything during your stay. The Neighborhood At the tip of the peninsula, we are flanked by the beach and sound to the south, the Thames River to the east and Alewife Cove to the west. The Cove provides peaceful water strolls and a lovely nature walk that leads to the marsh observation deck at the end of the boardwalk. A more ambitious walker can walk to the O'Neil Theatre grounds and on to Harkness Memorial State Park where there are lovely gardens, historical mansion and public picnic grounds. To the east, a walk along Pequot Avenue provides a view of the river where boats come and go. There are tall ships for Sailfest, and lighthouses at the mouth of the river. Historical New London is located half way between Boston and New York City, and one hour from New Haven and Providence, 20 minutes from Mystic Seaport and Aquarium or the casinos. Getting Around Walk, bike, car, bus. City bus is located at the pedestrian gate to Ocean Beach but does not have a frequent schedule. If you judge your time everything is walkable or bike-able and lovely. By car we are just a five minutes to downtown. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking allowed on the premises No pets allowed. *Guests are welcome to use washer and dryer in the basement but the rest of the basement is not for tenant use. *Before departure @ 10 AM, please do the following: 1. clean all dishes and wipe counters, remove perishables from fridge and cupboards 2. put all garbage and recyclables in containers in driveway 3. sweep floors 4. strip beds, put sheets and towels down by laundry 5. about: The property is located down a dirt road off of the beaten path. Enjoy an extraordinary country wooded vacation, holiday, getaway or reunion retreat for the two of you, the whole family, or up to 6-8 friends and family.
description: Description The Space Situated on 40 wooded acres of absolute privacy in the middle of 1100 acres of undeveloped private land, public forest preserve and significant wild life habitat. There are miles of hiking and mountain biking trails, a large spring fed pond, a pasture and large yards for sports and events, surrounding hills and rock ridges and endless wildlife visible throughout the day.You will marvel at the natural beauty, privacy, comfort and accessibility of this remarkable estate! Guest Access Three bedrooms and large guest suite with 3 full bathrooms and one half bath can accommodate up to 8 guests. Fully furnished with 2 car garage, modern kitchen, laundry, living room, dining room, bedrooms, spacious decks with gas grill, central air and heat. Interaction with Guests I am available by request throughout your stay but will leave you to enjoy the privacy otherwise. The Neighborhood The property is located in the middle of a state designated "significant wild life habitat" area . There are over 1100 acres of undeveloped property and hiking trails right out the back door. The back of the property borders the Rockland Preserve in Madison Ct. and the Braemore Preserve in Guilford ct. which were purchased by the towns to preserve the Hammonasset River watershed and to preserve open space. The old Crooked Hill Road once know as the highway to Madison and was a stage coach, walking trail and horse and buggy line. Other long abandoned roads offer easy hiking and mountain biking trails. The views are of ledges, rocky cliffs and a water fall and wooded areas. Trail maps are available on the Rockland and Braemore preserve websites. A GPS map is also available. Getting Around Easy access to Durham Ct. stores and restaurants, I91 from Route 68 and I95 from Route 77. Located in North Guilford near the Madison and Durham town lines. Other Things to Note Rental of this property requires a rental agreement. All payments are through AirBnB. + More

about: This luxury 15 story community offers great on-site amenities including a roof terrace with a swimming pool, lounge area and fire pit, a State of the Art fitness center and concierge services. You will be close to the best attractions in Stamford.
description: Description The Space Each apartment home features beautiful kitchens with granite counter tops & cherry cabinetry, wood flooring, ceramic tile bathrooms and much more. Your new home is beautifully designed with a gourmet fully equipped kitchen including stainless steel appliances, granite counter tops and island, beautiful hardwood flooring, an open layout with 10 ft. ceilings and stunning views. Your fully appointed apartment is furnished with all the necessities of home, including linens and towels. Property amenities include:  Sparkling outdoor swimming pool (open seasonally in summer)  State of the Art Fitness Center with Cardio Equipment  Stunning club house with complimentary Wi-Fi  Community dog run  Garage parking (fee)  Lush landscaped BBQ area  Spacious outdoor sun deck  In unit washer/dryer The private bedroom features a deluxe queen size bed with our indulgent custom linens, fluffy duvet, and plush pillows, two night tables with lamps, a clock radio, a dresser and a very spacious walk-in closet. The living room includes a sofa with pullout bed, club chair, an entertainment center with a flat panel LCD TV, DVD/VCR player, CD stereo system, a dining area with seating for three and a work desk with lamp and your choice of wired or wireless Internet access. The gourmet kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need including dishes, glasses, cutlery and pots and pans. The kitchen features full-size appliances (four burner stove, oven, microwave, dishwasher and refrigerator), toaster, and coffee maker. Coffee, tea and sweeteners are provided. Guest Access You have access to the entire apartment, and all the fantastic amenities this building offers to its tenants. Interaction with Guests We have local staff that you might meet in person that meticulously prepares the apartments for your arrival. Your check-in is typically handled by the building's front desk staff. We provide all other customer service and are available via phone and email promptly. 24 hour support is available for any emergencies that may occur. The Neighborhood Living at this exquisite property in Harbor Point, residents will find the best of Stamford with its eclectic eateries, great shopping, and countless recreational opportunities right at their doorstep. The Stamford Town Center and Majestic Theater are just minutes away. Getting Around Transportation: Metro north, CT transit, I-95 linking to New York City Other Things to Note Although we do not allow pets in our apartment, this apartment is located at a residential property that allows pets and there may be pet owners in the building. + More
rules: House Rules Please remember that this is a residential building. The building rules, apartment occupancy restrictions and the year-round tenants must be respected. Parties, pets and smoking are not allowed under any circumstances and incur significant fees. + More

about: The Little House is a small antique (pre-1800) fully furnished and equipped guesthouse on @150 acres of secluded fields and woodlands in the Quiet Corner of Connecticut, 3 hour's drive from Ny, 1.5 hrs to Boston & 45 min from Providence/Hartford. It comfortably sleeps no more than four people
description: Description The Space The location is very quiet and the property in organically managed with no pesticides or herbicides used. Mattresses are organic cotton and organic latex. However, the roped beds are antique, slightly smaller than full double size, as they are for 18-19th century people. Guest Access There is a pond to fish in, a tennis court and lots of walking paths through the woods, a huge deck and excellent birdwatching. In winter, you can snowshoe or cross country ski. We are adjacent to the airline trail, which is excellent for skiing, as well as the Wolf Den State Park and the New England Forestry Foundation's Chase Kimball Memorial Forest Interaction with Guests I live in the Big House in front, so am there for check in, and if they need anything, but otherwise leave them alone The Neighborhood It is paradise- far away from civilization, yet close enough to take day trips to Boston, Hartford, Worcester, Providence, Old Sturbridge Village, Mystic Seaport - all of Southern New England Getting Around No- you need a car Other Things to Note The beds and furniture are not really satisfactory for very large or seriously overweight people + More
rules: House Rules No smoking is allowed, or excessive drinking, or pets ( the house is very old with pine floors that came from a church, and would be scratched by dog claws. Also, I keep it very clean). I have a dog, but he is not allowed in the Little House. No hunting is allowed in the woods. This is a peaceful healthy place. + More

about: Stunning art-filled loft apartment just off New Haven Green, 5 minute walk to Yale campus. Open floor plan w/ huge living room, modern gourmet kitchen, jacuzzi tub, limestone shower. Perfect for 2, can sleep 2 more as needed. No pets, no smoking.
description: Description The Space This is the only building of its kind in downtown New Haven, a perfect spot for parents visiting their children or those making a weekend in this charming college town. The loft is a converted department store from the early 20th century - high ceilings, brick walls, arched entries. We have a very extensive collection of art, most by artists that we know and collect avidly. It's classic loft - all open spaces, with huge windows facing west overlooking the city. 1/2 block from the New Haven Green. Guest Access The place is all yours - gourmet kitchen, several seating areas, space for two additional guests on an inflatable air mattress. Limited privacy for guests; we'll give you details. Interaction with Guests You will have the entire space entirely to yourselves during your visit. We are available by cell / email to answer any questions. The Neighborhood Ninth Square is the vibrant center of downtown New Haven, filled with the city's best restaurants, art galleries, a great jazz club, and a bevy of nightclubs. It's also a thriving residential neighborhood, with an excellent gourmet market. 5 minutes walk to Yale, 10 minutes walk to historic Wooster Square. Yale's art galleries are among the best small museums in the world, with extraordinary collections in architecturally significant buildings. Getting Around Walking distance to both New Haven train stations - Union Station is a 10-minute-walk, or a 5-minute cab ride. The downtown State Street station is open at commuter hours only, infrequently otherwise - a 3 minute walk from the flat. There is a Hertz car rental agency around the corner. There is no parking in the building, but there is an open-air lot directly behind us. They charge about $20/day, but one can come and go throughout the day for this fee. Other Things to Note 3-night minimum for weekend stays. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking, no pets of any size. + More

about: Beautifully restored and maintained family-friendly colonial home in Falls Village, CT. Sleeps 5 adults. Features an open living and dining area with comfortable furnishings. 20 minutes to Great Barrington, and very close to several ski areas.
description: Description The Space Beautifully restored colonial house with lots of living space. We have two small kids and the house is great for anyone with a family; we have a crib, pack n play, toys, and baby gates as needed. We are a short drive to Great Barrington, and are an easy drive to several ski areas, such as Mohawk Mountain, Catamount, and Butternut. Guest Access Huge landscaped yard and gardens with tons of room for running around. Interaction with Guests We have a caretaker/handyman who will be on call if any issues arise. The Neighborhood Falls Village is charming country village with a fantastic inn at the center of town with a great pub. An easy 20 minute drive to shopping and dining in Great Barrington, 30 minutes to Catamount, and 10 minutes from Mohawk mountain. + More

about: Renovated Litchfield County farmhouse (c.1890) with a modern studio addition and mid-century modern interiors and furnishings. Owners are a writer and an architect/artist who have built a truly unique property and home. Perfect for relaxing inside and out, private rear-yard patio for outdoor cooking and dining.
description: Description The Space Fully-stocked eat-in cook's kitchen. Outdoor bbq grill is close at hand. Three bedrooms, Living Room, Dining Room, Playroom in basement, big screened in porch with fireplace. One full bath with a huge clawfoot tub and shower upstairs and a half bath downstairs. Guest Access Free WIFI. Kid friendly areas (and toys) are separate from the main living spaces -- includes a playroom in basement, kid bikes in garage and a swing-set/sandbox in the back yard. Interaction with Guests Hosts are available by cell phone and text anytime you need them, but otherwise, you have privacy, we will not be around. The Neighborhood Enjoy scenic walks past farms and grazing cattle, truly a special corner of Litchfield County with wildlife galore. Every Sunday there is a great farmer's market within walking distance -- (URL HIDDEN) -- featuring organic vegetables, local food trucks and kid's play time catching frogs down by the creek. Southfarms offers hay-rides and other seasonal activities such as a corn maze and a sunflower walking trail. House is private but not too secluded, views of a 100 acre cornfield to the north and a grass pasture to the south are breathtaking in any season. Huge bird population, wild rabbits, and a woodchuck we call Earl even though it's probably a female. Getting Around Very safe roads nearby with little traffic so they are great for walking and biking -- enjoy scenic views to nearby farms and grazing cattle. Swim/Hike/Explore: 15 minute drive to Mount Tom State Park (Litchfield/Morris) 5 minutes to White Flower Farm (Litchfield) and 20 minutes to Cornwall Bridge where you can do a day-hike of the Appalachian Trail and view Connecticut's oldest covered bridge. Movie Night: 15 minute drive to historic Bantam Cinema, offering state of the art digital projection in Connecticut's oldest continuously operating movie theater (built in 1927). Restaurants: 10 minute drive to fine dining such as Oliva's (Bethlehem), GW Tavern (Washington) and Community Table (New Preston). Also great kid-friendly places like Bohemian Pizza (Litchfield), The Painted Pony (Bethlehem) and Poppy's (Morris). Other Things to Note Get your hands dirty: Organic garden on the property, feel free to pick your own apples, plums, tomatoes, peas, lettuce, squash, fresh herbs. Wild blackberries are all over the property in July/August. There is a family of woodchucks living under the barn and a large group of rabbits in the back near our starter-orchard of apple and plum trees. + More
rules: House Rules We expect guests to leave the house tidy when they leave; it will be fully cleaned after each guest leaves but please be respectful of the space and leave it as it was when you arrived. Thank you! Feel at home, we've left the place how we like to enjoy it. We have a unique mix of farmhouse vintage and modern objects on display. Please look all you want but leave things as you found them. The house holds our art collection (mostly unknown minimalist artists) and a collection of modern furniture by Norman Cherner, Donald Judd, Charles and Ray Eames, Harry Bertoia and Marcel Breuer. Absolutely no smoking indoors. Please. + More

description: Description The Space Relax in a large master bedroom or spacious living room with premium cable and internet. The beach is steps away and rental includes 2 kayaks to enjoy your days throughout long island sound. Full bath room and outdoor shower make it easy for multiple guests. Guest Access Guests will be able to enjoy the entire neighborhood from beaches, to bike riding. about: Luxury Stamford 3 bed, 2 bath condo. The unit is fully furnished and has hardwood floors throughout the unit, chef's kitchen with island and GE Profile Stainless Steel appliances. Building amenities as well to enjoy! This is for long term stays only.
description: Description The Space Luxury Downtown Stamford 3 bedroom, 2 full bath condo. Built in 2008, the unit is fully furnished and has hardwood floors throughout the entire apartment, chef's kitchen with island and GE Profile Stainless Steel appliances. Additional features include crown molding, 9ft ceilings, private balcony, ceiling fan in master bedroom, ceiling lights in every room, lots of closet space, washer and dryer in unit, additional window insulation for energy efficiency and sunlight all day in the unit! Minimal lighting needed during daylight hours! 1400 sq ft of space with full size bedrooms and large closets. 1 bath with tub and master bedroom has large walk-in shower. Building amenities includes a full-time concierge, shuttle to train station, 24 hour gym, club room with fireplace, pick-up dry cleaning service in the building, garage parking, courtyard with gas grills and bicycle room. Dogs are welcome. The Neighborhood Stamford is a city rich in diversity of companies, restaurants and shopping. This apartment is in the heart of Stamford and walking distance to most of the restaurants, shopping and amenities that Stamford has to offer. Getting Around Easy access to 95, Stamford beaches and Stamford organizations like Chelsea Piers CT, NBC Sports, Hospital for Special Surgery, WWE, Deloitte and more! Great commuting location to local Stamford organizations as well as easy access to train station to NYC. description: Description The Space A circular staircase brings one up to the bedroom with private bath. A French balcony with cafe table and chairs is perfect for morning coffee and a Juliet balcony on the other side of a spacious room adds to the country feeling. Guest Access The cottage has a complete kitchen and washer and dryer. The upstairs of the cottage is a bedroom suite with balcony. rules: House Rules We use the cottage frequently for our own guests and we live on the property. We requests our guests be respectful of our privacy and in turn we shall respect theirs. about: Winter Prices!! Newly built lg barn on my N Stamford, Wooded Farm. Gated property w/ peacocks, lambs, and more. Peaceful, lovely and very private. 2 story, Open plan. 1.5 bths, sm. kitchenette, sep entrnce, htd floors, ctrl air, sleeps 4+, Nice!
description: Description The Space Winter Pricing in effect!! This barn is 100 years old and was moved from PA and rebuilt here as a guest space and music studio. It (and the house that is next to it) sits on family property that my grandfather bought as his country place in the 30's. In the early 50's he rented the studio cottage on the property (which currently has tenants,) to JD Salinger as a writing/living space. It is a rambling, natural 6 acres with original stone walls, that backs up to the Mianus preserve (for hiking, bird watching, and there is some fishing nearby...just ask!) I have a farm on the property and I sell fresh eggs at a roadside stand. I keep all kinds of chickens, peacocks, guinea hens, turkeys, a pig, friendly Icelandic Sheep, and rescue dogs. The Barn has its own entrance, and is very private. It has some musical equipment available because my son is a musician, (currently at music college;) so there are amps and a small drum set, congas and a couple of guitars there. Feel free to use them if you are a musician or feel the inspiration, (just not in the middle of the night!) This place is magical and beautiful; it is inspiring. The house and barn/coops are built out of 100 year old barn wood with adobe finishing in the house and barn; many of the fixtures are vintage ones that I had refurbished. The barn doors come from an antique house in North Stamford....everything has been carefully sourced and/or handed down through my family. Come and enjoy this beautiful space. It is excellent for writers and artists, musicians, or even travelers or travelling business people. I would not bring small children under 5, (it depends on your kids, but probably will be difficult with toddlers.) Note that there are roosters, guineas and peacocks, which can be loud from time to time during the day...the turkey gobbles and the lambs baaaa, but usually not at night... so it is peaceful but it is not silent;-) Guest Access Guests can walk around the farm and enjoy the animals as much as they want. They can hike on the land or walk on the streets in this walkable neighborhood (when the weather is good.) Guests can sit on the porch if they want...Please smoke outside!! Interaction with Guests I will meet with and show the guests around and will be available to answer any questions, but the beauty of this place is the privacy and peacefulness. I am around the property but am usually pretty busy. The Neighborhood Stamford is a very mixed bag. There is a real city downtown with large corporations and the young workers that come with that, night life and fine dining. We have a mall and some great shopping and a few outlets.... and then north of the parkway it is fully wooded and like a different world. I love it up here; I have been coming here for my whole life and living here full time for 20 years. Up the road is a gourmet deli and there are many full delivery restaurants. There is also a nice tavern in an antique building, right up Erskine Rd. We have access to NYC (50 mins by car or train) and all the best that country living offers. There are even some ski resorts not too far away. The shopping is great at Lord and Taylor (the best sales!) and there is a mall downtown that is nice. We also have Target and all the usual chains around here. The museums are fantastic and we are close to Caramoor with its offerings and high teas. A nature center with an antique zoo is not far, and the Katonah Museum always has something great going on. There are also some great estate sales on the weekends, antique centers downtown and a lively auction community. Ask me if you want to know if there are any when you are here. This is an excellent place for a getaway, or meeting, or for business travel; It is also a great place to come and paint or write....or just kick back and read our extensive collection of books. Getting Around there are buses that run hourly down long ridge rd. and there are metro north trains to NYC. Parking at the station is cheap for an entire day and its as easy to take the train as it is to drive in and leave your car in a lot. I often get a groupon for parking in the city and go down for the day by car. Metro North, New York City, I-95, Merritt Parkway, I-684, Broadway, NY, Manhattan. Bedford NY, Pound Ridge NY, Bedford Village NY, Mt. Kisco NY. upstate NY, Brewster NY, Carmel NY. Hudson NY (2 hrs away but great auctions) Other Things to Note This is a place for for corporate meetings travelling for business, visiting in-laws and friends , or just a getaway from your normal existence, It is a perfect writer or artist's retreat which has been designed to be restful, thoughtful, and stimulating. Please ask me about anything, and if you would like to have a meeting or house some of your travelling clients here, it is ideal. I am open to negotiation and though I likely wont allow wild parties, I am happy to hear your ideas. Please have a look at our new Barn Store of carefully sourced vintage and antique items to take home with you, along with fresh eggs and raw honey, as available. We even offer peacock feathers for your cats; they make the best toys and they smell like a real peacocks and the farm! + More
rules: House Rules There is total privacy here. I am very easy going and nice, and you wont see me much unless you need me. I hope for the same from any guests that stay here. Please ask before you bring pets here. No parties unless you book the place for a party and have cleared it with me. I am not encouraging any sort of wild parties with drinking, and will only consider adult gatherings on a case by case basis. no smoking in the house Please. If you smoke outside please ask me for an ashtray and smoke away from the house. Please do not chase or grab the animals. They are mostly tame but they can be shy if they don't know you. Do not feed the sheep or other animals! If you would like to give them anything please ask first. I can also give you some snacks for the animals if you want to give them a treat. Sheep can get very sick if they get too much (URL HIDDEN) only use my designated sheep treats! I am often out or in the chicken coops, so to reach me, please text or phone me. Automatic gates on the property have codes which I will give you upon check in. Please let me know if the gates are not functioning properly. You will have a separate key to the barn. + More

description: Description The Space Spacious, completely updated apartment in lovely rural setting but close to everything. Get away without going very far. Take a break from sterile hotel rooms while on business. Private entrance, 2 bedroom, 1.5 bath, fully equipped kitchen, dining room, living room, french doors to patio, balcony off bedrooms, free WiFi, cable flat screen TVs, washer/dryer, bbq, garden, backyard overlooking pond. Very romantic spot for a couple's weekend. Luxury sheets and pillows. Advance arrangements can be made for stocked refrigerator (additional). For those on business, office space has free wifi, printer/copier/scanner and office supplies. Faxes sent/received on request. The setting is rural and bucolic but at the same time under four miles to the parkway. Guests will want to have a car to get around, but a wonderful country grocery is within walking distance with a excellent butcher shop and deli. A great tavern is only about a half mile away, serving lunch and dinner, and has live music on Friday and Saturday nights. Downtown Stamford - a 10 minute drive, features many bars, clubs and restaurants. Great shopping/dining is available at the many restaurants and luxury boutiques/shops in nearby New Canaan and Greenwich. Metro North railroad is 15 minutes away and midtown Manhattan 45 minutes by train. Families are welcome, but the apartment is not suitable for very small children. Very private and peaceful yet convenient to all. This unit is strictly No Smoking. Guest Access The home is on well and septic. Accommodation of 4 maximum guests is strictly adhered to. Other Things to Note Rental Agreement required + More

about: Great vacation home in lake community. Cozy A-frame with 3 bedrooms, 2 baths and large deck. Seasonal views of Candlewood lake. Great place for entertaining or just relaxing. Wooded surroundings provide private setting.
description: Description The Space You will truly feel like you're on vacation in this charming wooden cottage! Surrounded by trees, the space is airy and modern while still maintaining a rustic cottage feel. Deisgned by a Finnish architect in the 1960s, the house has unique details including vaulted ceilings, a free-standing fireplace, a wooden sauna, and large windows that offer seasonal lake views. It's a retreat among the treetops! Comes with access to a private community beach on New Milford Bay. One bedroom (queen bed) on ground floor Loft (full bed overlooking great room and another bedroom will two full beds) Furnished basement: queen-sized futon and bathroom Guest Access Guests have exclusive access to the entire house except for the owner's closet in the basement. about: The Bee and Thistle Inn has ten beautiful and unique guest rooms. All rooms have their own private bathrooms and amazing views of the grounds.
description: Description The Space The Bee and Thistle Inn, nestled in historic Old Lyme, Connecticut, was built in 1756 as a residence for Judge William Noyes and his family. The house originally sat near the Boston Post Road but was moved back to its present position and lovingly renovated by the Hodgdson family at the turn of the last century. At that time, the sunken garden, the porches and back portion of the house were added. In the 1930's, Henrietta Greenleaf Lindsay, a widow with a large house to maintain, followed the advice of her actress friend, Elsie Ferguson, and opened the Bee and Thistle Inn to the public. Because it was Elsie's idea, it was named the Bee and Thistle Inn after the Ferguson clan emblem in Scotland. It has remained an inn since that time offering charming accommodations, award-winning dining and gracious service. Guest Access Guest have access to our boule court, all of the property and the amenities here on property. Interaction with Guests There is always someone here on property, if anything is needed or if you have any questions, please let us know. The Neighborhood The town of Old Lyme is known for it's Arts and it's History. The Town has many art and antique galleries. Getting Around We are located right off of I-95, we sit right next door to the Florence Griswold Museum, and within walking distance to art galleries and our local chocolate shop. Other Things to Note We have kept the romantic historic charm by not having televisions or whirlpool tubs here on property, but we do offer complimentary wireless internet. + More

about: Just steps away from the Stonington Borough, this quiet and stylish oasis is the perfect place to relax or launch day trips to some of the best attractions in New England. This 3BR/2.5 bath home was built in the 1920's and fully renovated in 2012.
description: Description The Space This dutch colonial home has two large bedrooms upstairs, each with an en suite bathroom. The main level has an open floor plan consisting of the living room, game room, dining area, and kitchen. There is a private room also on the main floor which includes a daybed and a 1/2 bath. The basement includes a washer and dryer. The backyard is primed for entertaining with a finished patio, lots of grass for croquet, and blooming perennials. Guest Access Entire house and fenced yard. Wifi exists throughout the house. Cable TV includes HBO, Showtime, and most sports channels. The garage is not accessible to guests. Interaction with Guests Our property manager will be happy to assist with anything you need. The Neighborhood The Stonington Borough is truly a magical place (URL HIDDEN) Our home is approximately a 15 minute walk into the center of it all. Within the area we would recommend the following activities: Restaurants: - Water Street Cafe (have a Top Hat for dessert!) - Dog Watch Cafe (perfect for outdoor drinks on the water at sunset) - Bravo Bravo in Mystic - Zest Bakery - The Ocean House Adult things to do: - Saltwater Farms Vineyard - Beer'd Microbrewery - Saturday morning farmers market Kid things to do: - Mystic Aquarium - Mystic Seaport - Dubois Beach Within 30 minutes drive: - Misquamicut Beach - Historic Watch Hill - Buttonwood Farm Ice Cream - Florence Griswold Museum Nature trails: - Barn Island Wildlife Management Area (lots of sea birds to see) Grocery Shopping and Provisions - Big Y Grocery Store (Mystic) - Stop and Shop (Westerly) - Walmart (Westerly) Getting Around You'll need a car to reach the house, but once here it is very walk-able and bike friendly. Stonington is convenient to both the Westerly, RI and Mystic, CT Amtrak stations. Other Things to Note 1. Parents are responsible for monitoring children and guests with respect to basement access and a pond in the backyard. Renters indemnify the owners against any responsibility for accidents which may occur. 2. There are three webcams on the property which monitor weather conditions and status of the yard. They will be turned off during rental periods. + More
rules: House Rules 1. No smoking 2. No pets 3. Garage is not accessible to guests. 4. Basement area outside of the washer/dryer areas is not accessible to guests. 5. Relax and have fun + More

about: Our comfortable 3-story, 5BR/3BA townhouse can accommodate 5+ and is located just 1/2 block from the Peabody Museum and Yale Management School. It features an updated kitchen, an outdoor patio, and easy access to bus lines and bike routes.
description: Description The Space The location of the townhouse is absolutely perfect, near downtown but quiet, near Peabody Museum, Yale Management School and campus, easy walking/biking distance to downtown. The house is ideal for families or couples traveling together. Guests have access to a galley kitchen, dining room, living room, laundry in basement, and back garden patio area. We live nearby but not in the house, so can generally be available if needed. The neighborhood is safe, and there is a steady flow of pedestrian traffic. Beautiful large houses on the block are well landscaped and views are lovely. Public transit is very easy - buses run in both directions (to and from downtown) 1/2 block away. There is a bike lane on the street. Parking is on-street, and residential permits are required. We will have guest permits available if needed. Guest Access Guest have access to 5 bedrooms, 3 baths, living room, dining room, kitchen with 6-burner range and double oven, microwave, coffee maker, laundry room in basement, working fireplace, backyard patio area. Interaction with Guests We generally don't interact very much with guests except to give them a tour, keys, and some general information. We like to give guests their privacy and independence. We live one mile from the townhouse and close if any problems come up. The Neighborhood Our neighborhood is walking distance from Yale and downtown New Haven. about: "Serenity", our fully renovated vacation home, sits next to a lovely brook and waterfall on a peaceful, heavily wooded lot in beautiful Litchfield county. Three comfortable bedrooms, plus a fold-out. All the amenities for a perfect country getaway!
description: Description The Space We call our wonderful vacation home, 'Serenity', because all your stress and worries will disappear when you're here! This beautifully renovated, 120 year-old former mill sits just feet away from a lovely brook on a 7-acre, heavily wooded lot just off of Route 4 in Litchfield county, CT. In the summer, open the windows and you can hear the water flowing by from every room in the house. You'll love falling asleep to the sound! There's lots of room to explore on the property. Splash around in the brook, watch for trout, or just sit and gaze at the waterfall. We're very close to the Audubon preserve, so you never know what rare birds you might see (there's a Blue Heron that loves to stalk the brook trout right next to the house). Like looking at nature but don't want to be out in it? You'll love the screened in Arizona Room with large sliding glass doors on three sides. Feel like relaxing with a good movie? You'll enjoy the flat-screen TV and 24 hr. On-Demand movies through Comcast. Classic movie buffs will enjoy our Alfred Hitchcock movie library. Alfred Hitchcock was a good friend of a previous owner and often vacationed at the house! Of course, you'll never find a better spot for curling up with a good book. Check out all the dining, shopping, and other activities available in beautiful Litchfield County, then come home and relax with a bubble bath in the huge clawfoot tub. There's a fully-stocked kitchen with everything you need for whipping up a great meal and a nice big gas grill for those summer cookouts. In the winter months, you'll love being surrounded by a wintry wonderland as you are warmed by the cozy fireplace. Winter sports fans will enjoy the nearby Mohawk Ski Resort. We know once you've experienced 'Serenity', you'll never want to leave! Guest Access The main house and surrounding yard and brook will be yours for the duration of your stay. The driveway and garage, separated by a stone path from the main house, is shared by our main house guests and our caretaker apartment tenants (the apartment is on the opposite side of the garage from the main house, and cannot be seen from the house and yard areas). Interaction with Guests We manage the rental of "Serenity" remotely, so our interaction will only be through email and phone. You are unlikely to come into contact with our apartment tenants excepts possibly when taking out your car. They do not use the main house areas, and they know our guests come here for privacy and peace and quiet. The Neighborhood Litchfield County is one of the most beautiful areas I've been to, which is, of course, one of the reasons we bought "Serenity"! It is the perfect mix of peaceful countryside living, with the benefits of great restaurants, historic sites, culture, shops/galleries, wineries, and plenty of festivals and activities throughout the year. Our place is located on a designated Scenic Drive, and whether you're in town for the fall colors, summer festivals, or snow season, it's just gorgeous! Getting Around It's the middle of the country, no buses, ha! We're about an hour and a half drive from the Hartford airport, and 15 or 20 minutes from the Amenia trainstation, which is about an hour & 45 minute train ride from Grand Central. At "Serenity", you will have access to one garage space, and two driveway parking spaces. Other Things to Note We have a two night minimum normally, three night minimum during Holiday weekends and the peak summer season. The $200/night rate is for 1-2 adults using only the Master bedroom. Additional bedrooms used are an extra $20 flat fee for each room used (this helps offset the extra cleaning costs for groups while keeping the rate lower for couples). ***Please note: AirBnB options only allow us to list the $20 fee as "Per Person/per night", but in fact it's only per extra BED used. If your "automatic" total comes up too high, we will send you a Special Offer price once you've sent an inquiry.) The rental rate is higher during our peak summer months as well as Holiday weekends. Peak rates: $250/night, $1250/week, $4000/month. We generally require month-or-longer rentals during June-August, but will open any unsold dates up to shorter stays around May. The refundable security deposit is $100 for weekend and weekly stays, and $500 for month-long rentals. ***Please note: we are new to AirBnB, but have been renting out "Serenity" for several years now to many lovely, satisfied guests through other vacation rental by owner websites. Unfortunately, AirBnB blocks us from posting links to other websites here, but we'd be happy to send you info on previous reviews if requested. + More
rules: House Rules Because the house is on a well and septic system, we do have a strict eight person maximum occupancy, and the number of overnight guests must be stated in our rental agreement. We do allow one or two well-behaved pets, with an additional refundable pet deposit, between $50-$200, depending on the size, type (cat or dog), and number of pets. ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING INSIDE THE HOUSE! + More

description: Description The Space Unique midrise in the heart of downtown Stamford. While being close to transportation Parc Grove offers a heated swimming pool, fitness center, and courtyard. Furnished apartments include a washer/dryer, balconies, and fully equipped kitchens. Compass Furnished Apartments at Parc Grove in Stamford is a unique mid-rise nestled in the heart of downtown Stamford. Shopping, Dining, entertainment and transportation are all within walking distance. In the core of the property lies a picturesque courtyard complete with a heated swimming pool and sundeck making it hard to believe that the city is just outside your door. Relaxed living in our temporary furnished apartments with endless amenities. Parc Grove is the place to be! *More options available in Parc Grove *More options available in Stamford and surrounding areas Property Amenities -Close to I-95 and Stamford Mall -Complimentary Java Bar -Complimentary Shuttle To Metro North Train Station -Indoor Basketball Court -Indoor Racquetball Court -Landscaped BBQ and Picnic Areas -Recently Renovated Amenity Space -Sparkling Outdoor Heated Swimming Pool -State-of-the-art Two Floor Fitness Center -Underground Garage Parking -Valet Dry Cleaning Service -Wii Room, Resident Lounge & Media Room Apartment Features -Beautifully Furnished & Equipped -Full-size Washer/Dryer in Every Apartment -Gas Burning Fireplaces in Select Apartments -Lofts Available in Select Homes -Private Patio or Balcony with Seasonal Outdoor Furniture -Spacious Floorplans -Spacious Walk In Closets -Wall-to-Wall Carpeting Guests will have access to all of the amenities on the property including the outdoor heated pool, courtyard, indoor basketball court, indoor racquetball court, fitness center, residents lounge, and underground parking garage. We will provide step by step interactions before, during, and after the reservation. We will provide move in and move out instructions in order for the resident knows exactly what to expect. Downtown living in Stamford is convenient and easy. Within one mile from the Stamford Train Station, you are only a 45 min express train to Grand Central Terminal. Parc Grove is located across the street from Stamford Town Center Mall and just steps from tons of shops and restaurants. Take advantage of live music and entertainment during the summer concert series or see a show at the Avon Theater. Temporary living at Parc Grove puts you in the center of it all. - 15 Minute Walk to the Train - Shuttle for Commuting Hours to the Train - 45 Minute Train Ride to NYC - Easy Access to I-95 *More options available in Parc Grove *More options available in Stamford and surrounding areas + More

about: Gorgeous 1BR/1.5BA apartment in the heart of Stonington Borough located centrally on Water Street - just steps from great restaurants, shops and the waterfront. Apartment is the entire second floor with vaulted ceilings, wall to wall windows, a charming balcony and fenced back yard.
description: Description The Space Best location in Stonington Borough - huge space with vaulted ceilings in the heart of downtown, centrally located on Water Street. Fully equipped apartment with hardwood floors, new furniture, oversized windows, all appliances, big-screen TV, charming upstairs balcony and a small, private back yard. There is one queen bed with plush tempurpedic mattress pad, and also a new queen sized air mattress with sheets and blankets that you can easily set up in the bedroom or living room. Guest Access A few minutes to Downtown Mystic and 20 minutes from Foxwoods and Mohegan Sun Casinos. Steps away from charming Dubois Beach at Stonington Point, and larger beaches are just a short drive away. Steps from your front door are dozens of quaint shops and amazing restaurants - all with a beautiful sunset view from Stonington Borough. Watch Hill is just across the harbor and Block Island and Fishers Island are a short ferry ride away. Interaction with Guests Feel free to email, call or text me with any questions while you are visiting! The Neighborhood Everyone here is very friendly and familiar with one another - you will feel right at home! A wonderful, safe and special place for a romantic, family or solo weekend getaway. Stonington Borough is one of Southeastern Connecticut's best kept secrets, and is located five minutes down the road from Historic Downtown Mystic. Getting Around You can walk everywhere in Stonington Borough easily, but I would recommend bringing a car to go elsewhere. There are two train stations, both 5-10 minutes away, the New London ferry dock 15 minutes away, and the closest airport is about a 40 minute drive in Providence, RI. Other Things to Note I prefer a two night minimum on weekends. Will consider one night only on Friday or Saturday but the nightly rate would be slightly higher - email me for more details! + More

about: Located directly across from the Mystic River on Water Street in Downtown Mystic. Great views from the front porch! The house was originally built in 1845 but this apartment has been completely renovated with high end materials.
description: Description The Space Completely renovated 2 bedroom / 2 bathroom apartment with high-end finishes. First floor is open concept with living room (featuring a full sleeper sofa), dining area (seating for 6-8 people), kitchen with large island, granite counter tops, stainless appliances and spacious bathroom. Second floor features 2 identically sized bedrooms with queen-sized, memory foam beds, great views of the Mystic River from the front windows and an additional bathroom with full-sized soaking tub and full-sized washer and dryer. The front porch is great for sitting around and sipping coffee while watching the sunrise from the East over the Mystic River or for relaxing after a long day with a cold beer or a glass of wine. Guest Access Guest have access to the entire 1200 square foot 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment with shared front porch and separate back porch. Interaction with Guests While I don't meet many of my guests face-to-face, I am never more than a call, text, or Airbnb message away. Guests will receive a PIN number to unlock the front door after booking so there is no need to coordinate for key pick-up upon arrival. The Neighborhood This apartment is walking distance to dozens of local restaurants, bars, shops and attractions and only a 5 minute drive to the Mystic Aquarium and Mystic Seaport. Foxwoods Casino and great local beaches are all within a 20 minute drive. Getting Around 2 off-street parking spaces are included in this rental. They are conveniently located directly across the street in the marina parking lot. I have secured these parking spaces through a long-term lease agreement with the property owner. The Mystic Amtrak station (MYS) is about 1 mile from the apartment which is easily walkable. Taxis are readily available at the train station as well. T.F. Green Airport (PVD) is a 35 minute drive. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking indoors. Please limit excessive noise between 10 pm and 8 am per local noise ordinance. + More

about: Each room has a queen and a single bed. Features close proximity to Lime Rock Park, boarding schools, outdoor recreation, gourmet and cultural attractions. Upon request to book we will confirm availability. We look forward to hearing from you.
description: Description The Space Private location, rural and close to attractions. Patio areas for entertaining, lounging with pastoral views. Comfortable independent rooms, queen and single bed. Each room has its own private bath. Can accommodate larger family gatherings by using both rooms. Guest Access Large secure parking area, can accommodate single vehicle transport trailer for LRP track events. Guest sleeping rooms are on second floor. Smoke and pet free, please. Interaction with Guests Many repeat guests for LRP events, boarding school interviews, parent visits, class reunions, Music Mountain, Infinity Hall, hiking, canoeing, tourism, skiing (three areas close by). Continental breakfast available, lounge, library areas. The Neighborhood Ours is a rural residence, among woodlands and open fields. We are located overlooking White Hollow surrounded by the Berkshire Foothills. Getting Around Six miles from Connecticut U.S. rt 7. Six miles to the New York state line, ten miles from Massachusetts (Berkshires). Great Barrington, MA has 35 restaurants. Access to Suburban Farifield, Westchester Counties and NYCity is via Metro North commuter rail running south from Wassaic, NY (20 minutes). + More

about: Beautiful lake cottage, sleeps 6, in bucolic Litchfield Hills area of Connecticut. Book now for fall at the lake! Great country spirit, apple picking, vineyards..
description: Description The Space Private lake cottage, c 1920's, on a quiet country dirt road, with access to the lake. House comes with canoe and paddle boat for lake fun. Don't forget the fishing pole! Sleeps 6. Dining both inside and out on the rear deck. Goshen is amazing!! Litchfield spectacular! Only 2 hours out of NYC. Located, on quiet dirt road, with lake views, and direct lake access via shared dock, across the road. Also 10 minutes from Litchfield, Cornwall, 15 minutes from Kent, CT. House is on 2 floors, sleeping accommodations on second floor, with front and rear patios for hanging out, eating and watching the stars.. Fire-pit is in the back yard. Don't forget the marshmallows! PS. The sunsets are beautiful! Guest will be on their own. Private house. We are down the road a bit if you need. This amazing part of northern Connecticut has lots of fabulous activities, great culture, concerts, wonderful local vineyards, antiquing, great farms, wonderful little shops and restaurants, local farms, and yet very rural. Bike the Hills!!! Amazing biking in Litchfield County.. And then... Highlights include the lake of course. In the area, there are historic villages, lots of antique shops, a world class racetrack, great music, great summer and fall festivals & much more. Spring & summer bring great concerts, wine tours, house tours, antiquing, historic tours, or if you prefer.. just the lake. Come to relax. Lake fun includes a paddle boat and a canoe for your use. On the lake, there is an eagle's nest, beaver dams, and just plain fish, and lots of swimming! Tour the hills with great cycling and hiking trails. Visit Lime Rock Race Track for great racing, For great music, visit Music Mountain, Yale School of Music, and Infinity Hall in Norfolk, and the Litchfield Jazz Festival In August. Labour Day there is the famous Goshen Fair! Foodies, locally, there are amazing eateries or share in the bounty of great local farms for fresh produce in season and farm raised meats for your table. If you are a fishing enthusiast, take advantage of the best fly fishing on the Housatonic River just minutes away. Surrounding hIstoric towns include Cornwall, Kent, Litchfield, Norfolk, New Preston, Woodbury, all located in CT and Great Barrington, in Mass. Come join us and have some fun!!! You'll need a car.. There is no public transportation. Lots of hiking and biking is the other option. You are in the country. Enjoy quiet time and the lake. No internet. No TV. No Dishwasher. No Hairdryers. No Washing Machine or Dryer. And there is an private outside shower only. Nothing like taking a shower under the stars!!! Guest Access Located, on quiet dirt road, with lake views, and direct lake access via shared dock, at our right of way. Also 10 minutes from Litchfield, Cornwall, 15 minutes from Kent, CT. House is on 2 floors, sleeping accommodations on second floor, with front and rear patios for hanging out, eating and watching the stars.. Fire-pit is in the back yard. Don't forget the marshmallows! PS. The sunsets are beautiful! Interaction with Guests Guest will be on their own. Private house. We are down the road a bit if you need. Fall brings fall harvest festivals, great concerts, wine tours, house tours, antiquing, historic tours, biking, apple picking, or if you prefer.. just the lake. Come to relax. Tour the hills with great cycling and hiking trails. Getting Around You'll need a car.. There is no public transportation. Lots of hiking and biking is the other option. Other Things to Note You are in the country. description: Description Guest Access You have access to the entire grounds, the fire pit on the river is a favorite for glorious, grand fires. Delight in the sculpted landscape and natural beauty of the location. Cross the river to Bitner Park and there are miles of trails to explore, a skate board park, basketball courts, a baseball field and a football field that are all open to the public for free. Interaction with Guests Depending on my schedule, I can be present or disappear, whatever you require. The Neighborhood I only have one neighbor in my wooded location, but if you are seeking culture just down the road is the quintessential Guilford Green, replete with excellent restaurants, art galleries and shopping. If you continue from the Green on Old Whitfield Street south you'll come upon Guilford Harbor. Here there are beautiful views of long Island sound, Grass Island and the iconic "Red Shack". The Moorings is a great spot for a drink and a bite to eat while watching the fishing boats come in and of the harbor. Getting Around There are 2 bicycles availablle + More
