about: 2 bedroom, 1 bath third floor apartment located in the scenic New England town of Madison, CT on Long Island Sound. Open floor plan accommodates up to five people. Walk to beach or town in 10 minutes. Centrally located withMarshViews!
description: Description The Space Sleeps five. This flat is centrally located, yet tucked away in a wooded enclave. It is within a 10 minute walk of local town beaches as well as the in-town independent theatre. A fine French Bistro can be found a block away, right behind the local Audubon Shop. Hammonasett State Park is only a mile up the road. Madison is one of a series of small seashore towns where boating, beaches, swimming, and gorgeous water views keep visitors coming back year after year. Day trips to Providence and Newport Rhode Island, Old Essex CT, Yale/New Haven and Mystic Seaport and Aquarium, as well as Lake Compounce (the oldest continuously operating amusement park in North America) are among the local venues for daytrips. Madison is fortunate to have an independent theatre and one of America's finest independent book stores, RJ Julia. And of course there is a diverse selection of restaurants in Madison and surrounding towns. If you are bringing children, the town of Madison hosts a variety of summer camps (sailing, soccer, swimming etc.). Horseback riding camps for children and lessons for adults minutes away at fabulous Guilford Riding School. After a fun-filled day, visit Stone Temple Sanctuary for a relaxing massage. They are located just down the street from this conveniently located rental! Guest Access Beach towels and chairs, and beach umbrellas Internet access provided Interaction with Guests Very little interaction with guests, but am available for questions, suggestions, or directions. The Neighborhood Can easily walk to town for shopping, dinner, or movie. Can walk to nearest beach in 10 minutes! Getting Around You can walk to everything in town and to the beach. Railroad station is 1 mile away. You can arrange with host to be driven to and from. Other Things to Note For groups over 4, a fee of an additional $50/person is added. There is a one time $100 cleaning fee. + More
rules: House Rules RENTAL POLICIES Check in is 4 pm or later. Please don't try to check-in early unless already arranged as the cleaners need this time to prepare the rental for your arrival. Check out is at 11AM or earlier, on day of departure. (URL HIDDEN) Please call owner Criss, with your estimated time of arrival and when you're on your way to the house at (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). She will arrange to meet you (or the first person from your group to arrive) or give you information to enter the property. - Only the confirmed number of guests are allowed on the property. We do not allow parties on the property. This includes weddings or receptions. (URL HIDDEN) Be considerate to your neighbors! Quiet hours are from 9 pm to 8 am, during which time the noise from the rental shall not unreasonably disturb adjacent neighbors. Sound that is audible beyond the property boundaries during non-quiet hours shall not be more excessive than would be otherwise associated with a residential area. - Amplified sound is prohibited. - Vehicles shall be parked in the designated onsite parking area which is on the gravel drive way. Please do not park on the street. (URL HIDDEN) This unit comes equipped with high speed wireless Internet Access. (URL HIDDEN) Observe removing your shoes before entering. (URL HIDDEN) Clean any spills up immediately. (URL HIDDEN) Do not sit on furniture in wet swimsuits or with suntan oil on. Do not leave wet towels on furniture or beds, please hang up in bathroom (URL HIDDEN) Wash all sand off before entering the building using the hose outside. (URL HIDDEN) Do not flush sanitary products down the toilet. (URL HIDDEN) Turn off all heat, AC units, lights and fans while out to conserve energy. (URL HIDDEN) NO SMOKING in the unit. (URL HIDDEN) Trash collection is Tue early morning. Please place your trash in the green garbage bin by the garage by Monday night. Use recycling bin by your front door for recyclable items. Place this bin near trash bin Monday night for Tuesday pick up. Checkout time is 11:00 am. Please notify Criss if you will be checking out earlier, so cleaning can be started. Do not make the beds before you leave. Leave all used towels and washcloths on floor in the shower. Take out the trash and place in green garbage can near garage. Turn off all lights, heat or AC and fans. Close and lock all doors. Leave the keys on the coatrack at the front door. We want to thank you in advance for your attention to our house rules. We look forward to meeting you and hope you have a wonderful stay! + More

about: Quiet, new 2 bedroom apartment in the second floor of a vacant house. Walking distance to downtown shopping and great restaurants, steps from Trader Joe's! Bike to the beach in 15 min (2 bikes included). Relax and enjoy Westport like a local!
description: Description The Space Newly furnished 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment on the second floor of a (vacant) house. The apartment includes an open kitchen, living room and dining room area. There is access to an outdoor deck overlooking the yard with grill and outdoor dining area. Two (adult) bikes are available for your use. The apartment can sleep 6; there is a king bed in room 1 and a queen bed in room 2 with a queen sofa bed in the living room. The apartment has washer/dryer, central air, dishwasher, WiFi and cable TV. Parking is available on site. This apartment on the second story and is not handicap accessible. Guest Access We will give you instruction to enter the apartment before you arrive. We won't be on site (unless you need us!) Interaction with Guests We won't be on site during your stay, but please feel free to contact us with any problems you face or for suggestions on where to go and what to do! The Neighborhood The apartment is centrally located in Westport, Connecticut. 10 minutes walking from downtown shopping and dining. 2 minutes walking from Trader Joes. Westport's Compo" beach is a 15-minute bike ride, or 5 minute drive from the apartment. Westport is a 1-hour train ride from Grand Central terminal in NYC (or 1-hour drive from NYC). The Westport train station is a 7 minute drive (or cab ride) from the apartment. Getting Around If you don't have a car, you can take a cab from the train station, there are plenty available there. There will be 2 bikes available for you at the apartment and walking to downtown is a 5-10 minute walk. + More

about: This exquisite property located in the heart of downtown Stamford offers luxurious apartments. Residents will enjoy great amenities such as a furnished sky terrace with outdoor grills & fire pits, a lounge & screening room and a 24 hr fitness center.
description: Description The Space Our fabulous apartments offer residents spectacular features including fully-equipped kitchens, spacious closets, hardwood flooring, individual washer/dryer, double pane windows, and much more. Property amenities include:  Fitness center  Sky terrace with outdoor grills & fire pits  Lounge & screening room  Clubroom with billiards  Cafe & cappuccino bar  Gallery art exhibits  Community social events  In unit washer/dryer The private bedroom features a deluxe queen size bed with our indulgent custom linens, fluffy duvet, and plush pillows, two night tables with lamps, a clock radio, a dresser and a spacious closet. The Living Room includes a sofa with pullout bed, club chair, an entertainment center with a flat panel LCD TV, DVD/VCR player, CD stereo system, a dining area with seating for four and a work desk with lamp and your choice of wired or wireless Internet access. The gourmet kitchen features full size stainless steel appliances including a four burner range with oven, a refrigerator, a microwave and a dishwasher. It is fully equipped with everything you need including dishes, glasses, cutlery, pots and pans. A toaster and coffee maker are also included in the apartment. Coffee, tea and sweeteners are provided. Guest Access You have access to the entire apartment, and all the fantastic amenities this building offers to its tenants. Interaction with Guests We have local staff that you might meet in person that meticulously prepares the apartments for your arrival. Your check-in is typically handled by the building's front desk staff. We provide all other customer service and are available via phone and email promptly. 24 hour support is available for any emergencies that may occur. The Neighborhood Downtown Stamford, this property offers residents the best of city living with restaurants, bars, shopping, theaters, park, entertainment and transportation all within walking distance. Getting Around Metro North - Stamford Station - 3 blocks - 15 minutes walk. Other Things to Note Although we do not allow pets in our apartment, this apartment is located at a residential property that allows pets and there may be pet owners in the building. + More

about: First built as a country Gothic-revival church in 1885 on the edge of farmland in Sharon Valley by the Parish of Saint Bernard's. Rebuilt in 1915 as a family farmhouse with adjacent farrier's shed. Rebuilt again in the 1990s as a weekend home.
description: Description The Space Breezy and light-filled. Close to great restaurants, Mohawk Mountain skiing, Indian Mountain and Hotchkiss Schools, Lime Rock Park, recreational trails, the Village of Millerton, and farmers' markets. Built as a country Gothic-revival church in 1885 on the edge of farmland in Sharon Valley by the Parish of Saint Bernard's. Rebuilt in 1915 as a family farmhouse with adjacent farrier's shed. Rebuilt again in the 1990s. Engineered to accommodate 180 people on Sundays, the first floor's oak joists are 2x10 inches and 12 inches on center. The home unbuttons in the late spring and remains airy and cool all summer. Westerly winds from upstate New York glance off Indian Mountain and head south down Sharon Valley, making the neighborhood ten degrees cooler year-round than Brooklyn's Park Slope, where the owners live and work during the week. By mid-autumn the home buttons up for a snug, warm winter. Careful use of building materials containing no volatile organic compounds makes the home a delight for anyone sensitive to allergens and irritants. Sharon Valley is lush with water, its drainage established at the end of the last Ice Age, and our land is home to the tallest tri-leader birch in Litchfield County, nearly 85 years old. We furnish the house with cotton sheets, cotton and wool blankets, and feather comforters and pillows. There's a hair dryer under the sink in the en-suite bathroom, and a steam iron and ironing board for do-it-yourselfers, but we very much like New England Dry Cleaners in Millerton on US Route 44 near the Connecticut state line. Guest Access Everything except, perhaps, our too-cluttered red barn and the attic loft space. Feel free to use all appliances, including the dishwasher, clothes washer, dryer, clothesline, clothes racks, hair dryer, steam iron and ironing board, refrigerator, freezer, and propane oven and range (similar to natural gas). We mostly brew with a Cuisinart coffee maker, and we love our old Revere Ware pots and pans. There's always ground coffee, and help yourself to anything you see in the pantries and cupboards. There are a couple of Apple chargers on a table in the mudroom off the driveway, one of which converts to micro-USB for use with Android phones. Interaction with Guests Sometimes on arrival and on weekends. The owners are often working in the City when they'd rather play in the Country. The Neighborhood Nearby restaurants are Monte's and Serevan in Amenia, the Oakhurst Diner, Manna Dew, and No. 9 in Millerton, the Boathouse and Woodland in Lakeville, and Pastorale and the White Hart Inn in Salisbury. Nearby hiking and nature observation on the Harlem Valley Rail Trail, South Taconic Trail, and Appalachian Trail. Sharon Valley was, we can report, once a world center for the manufacture of mousetraps, but that hasn't been true for a hundred years. Note the ancient tri-leader birch in the photograph from the rear yard, looking north: it is the tallest in Litchfield County and nearly 85 years old. The most remarkable views are from the South Taconic Trail near the boundary where Massachusetts, New York, and Connecticut all meet. (North of the Village of Millerton, take Dutchess County Route 63 (the road to Boston Corner) to Deer Run Road, and park along Quarry Hill Road at a trail head.) The South Taconic Trail has some segments best climbed with both feet and hands. The much gentler, nearly level Harlem Valley Rail Trail is a particular favorite and a stroll in the country, illustrating the differences among fens, marshes, and bogs. Sharon Valley is a part of the Taconic Range and Litchfield Hills, small segments of the Appalachian Mountains. Getting Around If you have a car, park in the gravel driveway. Or use Dutchess Taxi Man or your bicycles to ride over from Wassaic train station: 13 minutes by car, or 48 minutes by bicycle on the rail trail via the old Sharon (Train) Station. The walk from the train station on foot via the Harlem Valley Rail Trail is 155 minutes. (Though we carried no backpacks, we recommend comfortable boots for all hikes.) Dutchess County long-ago stopped running buses between Amenia and Millerton. In Sharon, Doug Hobby's Autosport at ((PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) has an auto rental service that picks up people at the Wassaic Station on weekdays, and allows for drop-offs on Sunday. Other Things to Note 100 miles north of New York City. Two hours by train from Grand Central Terminal to the end of the Harlem Valley Line at Wassaic Station. Thirteen minutes by car from Wassaic Station. One mile from the New York State line at Amenia and Millerton. Ten minutes by car to the Village of Millerton. Eleven minutes by car to the Hotchkiss School. Nearly three minutes by car to Sharon Hospital. + More
rules: House Rules Visitors might be quiet and polite, similar to the neighbors. The neighbors all have grandchildren who visit and play in their yards, so bring your kids with you. Please moderate any amplified music by 9:00 PM: our neighbors turn in early. Yes, children may ring the ship's bell during daylight hours. Please, no pets. We are allergic to most pet danders, and gave up smoking a few years ago, so we ask visitors to smoke outside. (While the house smells fresh, the owners still associate alcohol and tobacco with fun.) When present the owners will serve cocktails at five o'clock. Please take out all garbage and compost before leaving. Please use the garbage pails next to the red barn at the top of the gravel driveway. (There are clear plastic bags underneath the easternmost kitchen counter.) Visitors may optionally sort for recycling (glass, plastics, metals, and papers) and for composting. If composting, there's a brown copper compost pail on the kitchen countertop that accepts *all* food scraps -- greens and proteins, including animal bones, fats, and gristle. The south side of the red barn has a Jora composter from Denmark to cook the food scraps. Spinning the composter will bring up a hatch door with a latch, where you can empty the pail. The Danes know how to make composters that cook in cold weather, and we are huge fans of Bud Trillin's essay "Letters to the Solid Waste Commissioner" and his command to 'see page 347 of Volume 3 of "A Simple Guide to Recycling" (third edition)'. If we're not here when you leave, please strip the beds and place all the linens and towels in the laundry room on the first floor. (Connie launders all the linens and blankets within 48 hours.) In the summertime, please close all windows to within a few inches to keep out rain. Please turn off all lights and appliances. Please re-lock the door from the kitchen into the rear yard. Please leave the house key on a table in the mudroom where you first entered, pulling the door closed and locked behind you. Don't worry if you forget anything: we like our postal clerks and enjoy having an excuse to visit them at the post office the next weekend. Oh, and don't hesitate to call with any questions: Walter's cel (phone number hidden) and Brooklyn landline (phone number hidden). The landline in Sharon Valley where you're staying is (phone number hidden), and the internet connection is from Frontier Communications (AT&T's successor) using a WiFi access point named ATT672. + More

about: This quaint cottage has unobstructed views of Norwalk Harbor and is a short drive/walk (1.4 mi) to the food and drink of SoNo. Enjoy the 4 season beauty of open water and great food.
description: Description The Space This cottage has a fantastic view of the harbor and is a great place from which to look at the houses across the inlet. There is no beach per se, as this is a harbor off of Long Island Sound (no waves). Guest Access The house is yours to enjoy, other than the master bedroom. Feel free to swim, cook, or stare out at the harbor. The TV is connected to an Apple TV with Hulu and Netflix available for your viewing. Interaction with Guests The front door is electronically coded and you may come and go as you please. **Please be sure that the door is firmly closed when you leave. This is an oddly ongoing issue... The Neighborhood The neighborhood is very heterogeneous. Depending on your direction of travel, through town or along the water, it can feel like a different world, but I have yet to meet an unfriendly face. Feel free to walk around and enjoy. There are several hidden mini-"beaches", if you know where to look. The neighbors are all friendly and I assure that although one end of the street does not look like the other, there are no safety concerns whatsoever. The Port Jefferson ferry is nearby for those traveling from LI. Getting Around There are public buses but these are a bit tough to navigate. You can park in the driveway or on the street and drive anywhere. You can also walk in to SoNo or along the harbor and circle around to the park on the far side. Weekenders from the city: it has both Metro North and I-95 nearby. The Port Jefferson Ferry makes eastern Long Island access easy. Other Things to Note The house has one full bed and one bunk bed (kids only). There are also 2 couches for your sleeping pleasure. Events can be held at the property. Please contact for details and pricing. + More
rules: House Rules Please treat the house and everything in it as if it were yours. My neighbors' backyards are not public beaches - feel free to travel around to the nearby public areas or stay in my backyard, which has a pretty amazing view. **Please be sure that the door is firmly closed when you leave. This is an oddly ongoing issue... Please keep the outdoor noise to a minimum after 10 pm. + More

about: You are renting a private bedroom for two with a private bath in this home occupied by its owner. The house features 18" soaring ceilings, an incredible wrap around deck overlooking lawns and gardens. Large Italian eat-in kitchen/family room. Home theater. Whole-house B&O system.
description: Description The Space Your bedroom is upstairs and private. The host will be sharing the house with his bedroom on the ground level. This home is large, airy and light filled. It opens onto the landscape, which is lighted at night. Inside and outside blend together. The atmosphere is both fun and sophisticated. The electronics feature various lighting scenes controlled by "graphic eyes". The living room features a wood-burning fireplace and Italian furniture for relaxing, reading or entertaining. The family room features a 7.1 surround sound home theater and a 50" plasma TV. Guest Access The guests will have access to the entire house with the exception of the master bedroom and office. Weston is within an hour of New York City, ten minutes from world-class restaurants in Westport and Southport and within walking range of a 700 acre perserve filled with hiking and walking trails (you can even view Keith Richard's compound from the trails). We are also thirty minutes from New Haven and about three hours from Boston. Interaction with Guests As much as necessary and as you like. I work from an office within the house and spend most of my time in New York at meetings. The Neighborhood Weston is a small town community of about 10,000 residents. It has a town center with just seven shops including "The Lunch Box", a small lunchonette that will remind some of their childhood. Weston has no highways, byways, or though roads. It is the perfect place for relaxing, bike riding, walking or just contemplating. Getting Around The Westport MetroNorth stop is 17 minutes away and has frequent trains into New York City. Amtrak has a regional hub located in Stamford about 25 minutes from Weston. Westchester Airport is located about 30 minutes from Weston. It is small, convenient and had direct flights to most of the country. Other Things to Note The house is very large. It is over 4300 sf with tall double story ceiling heights in almost every space. Two bedrooms have sleeping lofts and sitting rooms. The home theater festures hundreds of HD channels, many movie channels, Netflix and Apple TV all in 7.1 surround sound. A DVD library is available for your use. + More
rules: House Rules The living room is adults only and not child friendly. No pets please. AGREEMENT (to be signed at checkin) This Rental Agreement and Contract (the Agreement") is a legally binding agreement made and entered into as of the Reservation Date written below by and between the undersigned person(s) or company (the Guest") and the undersigned owner, manager or agent (Rental Agent or Host"), pursuant to which the Guest has agreed to rent the residence described below (the Property"), for the duration of the Rental Term for the Total Rental Fee and other good and valuable consideration as described herein. OCCUPANCY Guest agrees that no more than six (base rate) or ten (additional fees) persons shall be permitted on the Property at any time during the Rental Term, all of whom shall comply with the conditions and restrictions imposed upon Guest under this Agreement and in the House Book" issues upon arrival. The guest shall present photo identification upon signing this agreement. CONDITION AND USE OF PROPERTY The Property is provided in as is" condition. Rental Agent host shall use its best efforts to ensure the operation of all amenities in the Property, such as Internet access, satellite or cable TV access or hot tubs, fireplaces as applicable. Rental Agent shall not be held responsible for such items failure to work, but will make every effort to correct any issues as reported as quickly as possible. Guest acknowledges that use of amenities such as hot tubs, pools, spas, fireplaces, decks, and the like may be potentially dangerous and involve potential risks if improperly used, particularly with regard to children and such use is at the Guest's own risk. No pets or smoking in the house is allowed. The living room is not kids friendly and should not be used for drinking or eating. Guest shall use the Property for residential purposes only and in a careful manner to prevent any damage or loss to the Property and keep the Property in clean and sanitary condition at all times. Guest and any additional permitted guests shall refrain from loud noise and shall not disturb, annoy, endanger, or inconvenience neighbors, nor shall Guest use the Property for any immoral, offensive or unlawful purposes, nor violate any law, association rules or ordinance, nor commit waste or nuisance on or about the Property. The home is to be returned as found in the condition that it was rented. If the guest has to leave abruptly, and does not have time to clear and clean their dishes and replace items where they were found, the agent host has the right to bring in a cleaning service and back charge the renter guest for that work. DEFAULT If Guest should fail to comply with the conditions and obligations of this Agreement, Guest shall surrender the Property, remove all Guest's property and belongings and leave the Property in good order and free of damage. No refund of any portion of the Total Rental Fee shall be made and if any legal action is necessary, the prevailing party shall be entitled to reimbursement from the other party for all costs incurred. ASSIGNMENT OR SUBLEASE Guest shall not permit the use of any portion of the Property by other persons who are not family members or guests of the Guest and included within the number of and as permitted occupants under this Agreement. RISK OF LOSS AND INDEMNIFICATION Guest agrees that all personal property, furnishings, personal affects and other items brought into the Property by Guest or their permitted guests and visitors shall be at the sole risk of Guest with regard to any theft, damage, destruction or other loss and Rental Agent shall not be responsible or liable for any reason whatsoever. Guest hereby covenants and agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Rental Agent and their agents, owners, successors, employees and contractors from and against any costs, damages, liabilities, claims, legal fees and other actions for any damages, costs, attorneys fees incurred by Guest, permitted guests, visitors or agents, representatives or successors of Guest due to any claims relating to destruction of property or injury to persons or loss of life sustained by Guest or family and visitors of Guest in or about the Property and Guest expressly agrees to save and hold Rental Agent harmless in all such cases. RELEASE Guest hereby waives and releases any claims against Rental Agent, the Property owner and their successors, assigns, employees or representatives, officially or otherwise, for any injuries or death that may be sustained by Guest on or near or adjacent to the Property, including any common facilities, activities or amenities. Guest agrees to use any such facilities or amenities entirely at the Guest's own initiative, risk and responsibility. ADDITIONAL TERMS TO THE RENTAL AGREEMENT In addition to the standard terms included herein, Guest acknowledges and agrees that the following additional terms and conditions apply to the Guest's rental of the Property and that the Guest has received and read the House Book" that is issues upon arrival. GENERAL PROVISIONS This Agreement contains the entire agreement between the parties with regard to the rental of the Property, and any changes, amendments or modifications hereof shall be void unless the same are in writing and signed by both the Guest and the Rental Agent. The words Rental Agent" and Guest" shall include their respective heirs, successors, and representatives. The waiver or failure to enforce any breach or provision of this Agreement shall not be considered a waver of that or any other provision in any subsequent breach thereof. If any provision herein is held invalid, the remainder of the Agreement shall not be affected. Any notice required to be given under this Agreement shall be in writing and sent to the contact information included herein. This Agreement may be signed in one or more counterparts, each of which is an original, but taken together constitute one in the same instrument. + More

about: Minutes to Foxwoods and Mohegan Sun casinos and the new Tanger Outlets at Foxwoods! Mystic is a lovely country ride, just 20 minutes from this historic John Meech homestead. Noted for its gardens, 2014 winner by Yankee magazine as best garden B&B!
description: Description The Space This east room has views of the front gardens. A queen-size handmade pencil post, a pull out full size trundle bed, making it a perfect room for families, children age 6 and older. Real wood burning fireplace, pre-set for you each day in season. Private in room bath with a shower/tub combination. Our B&B offers genuine hospitality, organic living, country air, all in a historic setting. Also on the property is our country farm shoppe. Sit and have tea or lemonade in the gardens, relax with the song birds in the hammock, or fill your camera with amazing pictures of our gardens, colorful chickens and lovely stone walls and other interesting colonial features to this homestead built in 1720 by John Meech. Roseledge Country Inn and Farm in Preston CT is open year round and is only 1 1/2 hours from Boston and 2 hours from New York City, 45 minutes from Providence RI and Hartford CT. A great mid-way between NY and areas south befor you get to the cape! We're located a step away from the busy Mystic area. This popular New England vacation destination is famous for its historic Mystic Seaport and Mystic Aquarium., Mystic Pizzas. There is so much to see and do anytime of year in our popular Mystic area - from wineries, historic museums, shopping and antiquing to golfing, hiking, sailing, boat and lighthouse cruises and fishing charters. Just 4 miles from Foxwoods and MGM Casinos and a country drive of 12 miles to the quaint Mystic Seaport area. We are a "leave your shoes behind" property in respect for this 300 yr old house. Please bring socks or slippers for inside. Taxes included in total price. + More

about: Welcome to Bantam Lake Cottage. 2 hours from NYC and Boston, this area of Litchfield County is known for it's magnificent beauty. Come and paddle on the lake, stroll in the woods or BBQ on the deck for a true country experience.
description: Description The Space Built as an artists studio, the guest cottage is a private and lovely get away from our main house. When not rented it is used as an artist studio and meditation space. The place has great energy, and is just 50 yards from the lake with lake access. It has a modern and lofty feel but is also comfortable and cosy. This is a two story guest cottage with 1 full bedroom with a queen bed, and separate loft area. There is a counter with mini fridge, toaster oven, microwave, coffee maker and water fountain: perfect for breakfast. (however the sink is upstairs in the bathroom). There is a grill on the deck, or if you opt to eat out, there is a plethora of restaurants nearby, including Community Table, Tabla, the Hopkins Inn, Oliva and Winvian down the street. Guest Access Though we live in the main house, the yard is big enough to accommodate a game of badminton, or bacci ball. Our property goes to the lake and you are welcome to use the kayaks, row boat and small beach area. (there are 2 bigger beaches down the road) Interaction with Guests Usually we greet our guests at check-in time, offering a brief tour and whatever area suggestions they may like. From that point on, they are welcome to the privacy of the property and the all that the country offers. We are a fun-loving, warm family, with 2 cats and we enjoy having guests. The Neighborhood There are kayaks and a canoe which you are welcome to use on Bantam Lake. Our property abuts the White Memorial Preserve with more than 35 miles of trails. Open year around for hiking, biking, cross-country skiing and horse back riding. Go antiquing in Woodbury or at the Elephant Trunk in New Milford. Visit the newly-renovated South Farms Market on Sundays down the hill. Sip your way along the Connecticut Wine Trail (Hopkins Winery, Haight Vinyards) Ski at nearby Mohawk Mountain. Explore the quaint towns of New Preston, Kent, Cornwall, Litchfield, Bridgewater, Washington, Bantam, New Preston and more. Other attractions: Mt. Tom, White Memorial, Steep Rock, Cornwall covered bridge, Kent Falls, Lake Waramaug, Squantz Pond, Roxbury Land Trust. Getting Around You'll need a car to explore all Litchfield County has to offer. The closest public transit is Southbury with Peter Pan Bus service from NYC or Boston. Metronorth has trains into Brewster NY. We are just one hour from Hartford's Bradley International Airport, two hours from New York City and three hours from Boston. Other Things to Note For a true country experience, our organically-fed, free-range chickens often roam around the yard and our 8 baby chicks arrived in early May. Country fresh eggs are available. They do roost and crow as chickens do and the chicken coop is close to the cottage. + More
rules: House Rules No Smoking. We require a waiver to be signed because of the Lake. If you would like to bring your dog, we do add a small fee, and ask that he/she be crated when you are away from the cottage, and be on a leash when outside. Have fun but be respectful. + More

about: Highrise living at 360 State Street in New Haven offers 700,000 square-feet of "green" living, fitness center, and an outdoor heated swimming pool. Our furnished apartments include fully equipped kitchens, washer & dryer, and views.
description: Description The Space Compass Furnished Apartments at 360 State Street gives you what you've been looking for. 360 State Street is the second-tallest building in New Haven with 700,000 square-feet of green" living. Our beautifully furnished apartments include oversized windows with beautiful views, Energy Star stainless steel appliances, and lustrous parquet floors. Whether you work out in the state-of-the art fully equipped fitness center, relax by the heated outdoor swimming pool, or hang out with friends and family in the residents lounge you'll know that 360 State Street is the place to be! Community Amenities - Business Center - Private Party Room with Catering Kitchen - Resident Lounge with Adjoining Game Room - State-of-the-Art Fitness Center - Landscapped Rooftop Sun Terrace - 24 Hour Concierge Service - Bike Racks and Bike Storage - Heated Outdoor Swimming Pool - Childrens Play Area - Pet Friendly - Screening Room ** Pay by the day garage parking available at the property Apartment Features - Washer/Dryer in Unit - Oversized Windows with Views of Long Island Sound, New Haven Green & East Rock - Lustrous Parquet Floors or Chic Carpet Tiles - Gourmet Kitchen with Stone Countertops - Energy Star Stainless Steel Appliances - Open Floor Plans with Ample Closet Space Guest Access Guests will have access to all of the amenities on the property and everything in the apartment. Interaction with Guests We will provide step by step interactions before, during, and after the reservation. We will provide move in and move out instructions in order for the resident knows exactly what to expect. The Neighborhood Downtown New Haven offers comfort and convenience for day and night. Take a trip to the Peabody Museum of Natural History or to the Yale University Art Gallery. Go out to eat on the famous Wooster Street or to a concert at Toad's Place. Downtown New Haven is one of the most residential downtown areas in the United States, offering a variety of things to do such as seeing a show at the Shubert Theater or going to see the New Haven Symphony Orchestra. Other Things to Note For 30 or more day stays there will be a $1000 security deposit and a $200 cleaning fee. + More

about: Log cabin, close to Lime Rock Race Park (1 mile). Sleeps 6 easily. Two full-length porches; two bedrooms; modern kitchen. 6 acres of woods; access to Appalachian Trail a 5-minute walk away. Close to Berkshires attractions; 2 hours from NYC. Parking.
description: Description The Space This is my home, but I'm happy to share it. Just please treat it the way you would your own. Or, just to be sure, please treat it the way I do - with respect. It is simple, but comfortable and has what you need for a relaxing vacation in the country. No smoking anywhere on the premises, please. Guest Access Guests have access to the whole house and yard and woods behind. The property is safe for children since the yard is back from the street. There are books, board games, cable TV and ping pong for rainy days; a fire pit and sleeping balcony for starry nights. Fully-equipped kitchen and a gas grill on the porch. You'll bring your own food, of course; but help yourself to coffee, tea, spices, oil, flour, sugar,etc. A small office with wifi and a basement laundry room for your convenience. Hiking and mountain biking trails nearby; steep, rocky hills out back for the adventurous. Interaction with Guests The owner can be reached by cell phone during your stay. If it is not possible for him to come and deal with any issues that may arise, arrangements have been made for somebody to do so. The Neighborhood This property is in the middle of one of Litchfield County's most beautiful valleys, bounded by the Housatonic State Forest and the Appalachian Trail on the east and by Red Rocks Mountain, protected by the Sharon Land Trust, on the west. Lime Rock Park* is at the lower end of the valley; an Audubon nature preserve is at the top. Small farms, historic homes and long views to distant hills fill the spaces in between. *If you're not a race car fan, please check the (URL HIDDEN) for schedules; it can get loud here when the cars are running. But they do not run after 6pm nor on Sundays. Getting Around MetroNorth railroad, Wassaic station: 20 minutes Taconic State Parkway: 20 minutes I-90: about 50 minutes Harlem Valley Rail Trail: 15 minutes by car; about 8 miles away Hotchkiss, Salisbury and Indian Mountain Schools: within 15 minutes Great Barrington, MA: 30 minutes (shops, restaurants, movies, performing arts venues) Millerton, NY: 15 minutes (coffee shops, cinema, shopping, bike trail) LItchfield Jazz Festival: 20 minutes (in Goshen, CT) Music Mountain: 15 minutes Tanglewood, Shakespeare & Co., Berkshire Theater Festival - all about 1 hr Jacob's Pillow: 1:15 Sharon Hospital: 5 miles Other Things to Note On arrival you will find a binder of information about local attractions, stores and restaurants; maps; tips on how to find things in the house; etc. You will also receive directions about how to find the key to get in. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking anywhere on the property, please. Please tidy up (load and run dishwasher; pack out your trash in case the house is going to be empty for a few days) when you leave, but there is no need to deal with the bedding - unless you want to. Cleaning supplies will be available for your use should the need arise. Leave things pretty much as you found them; but don't do a big cleaning - this is supposed to be your vacation, right? Sorry, no pets allowed. + More

description: Description The Space The room is a great place to hang out in and look at the surrounding Long Island Sound. Interaction with Guests We can offer you great dining tips in the area and ideas for local attractions to make your stay more memorable. description: Description The Space Enjoy spectacular views (with a private beach) from this 1836 broken-back saltbox, situated next to an 1801 lighthouse, only fifty-five feet off Long Island Sound. This period home, in a quiet neighborhood, has 4 bedrooms, 2.5 baths, 3 fireplaces, a beautiful sun porch, and a gorgeous patio. Guests have access to the entire first floor, including the outdoor patio, outdoor shower and private beach. The kitchen is located on the first floor and includes access to the microwave, coffeemaker, refrigerator, range, rice cooker, pots/pans, utensils, etc. The washer and dryer are located on the second floor. Off-street parking is available for up to two vehicles. I can also accommodate bicycles in my garage. The surrounding area offers sailing, cycling, parks, and access to historic sites (e.g., Mystic Seaport, Harkness Park, Fort Trumbull, Fort Griswold, Ocean Beach, etc.). Minutes from Connecticut College, the Coast Guard Academy and Mitchell College; one hour from Yale and Brown University; and the site of the oldest collegiate sporting event in the country, the Harvard-Yale Regatta. Ferry service to Block Island, Fishers Island and Long Island is within cycling distance, as is rail service. Just 10 minutes from I-95, it's ideally located between Hartford, Providence, New Haven, New York and Boston, with an international airport only one hour away. The Neighborhood The serenity, ocean and lighthouse are Getting Around Train, plane, bus, taxi are all nearby. + More

about: Private, pretty antique home, less than 2 hours away from NYC and a 10 minute walk to the historic Washington Green and Gunnery School. The property is graced with mature gardens and trees, a large covered porch, pond and abundant wildlife.
description: Description The Space We are providing your choice of three bedrooms available: one with a queen size bed, one with a standard bed and one with a single with a full bath. In addition on the 3rd floor there is another full bath with soaking tub and a large media/family room with a large flat screen TV, an L shaped deep sofa (great for falling asleep in front of the TV) and a large library of movies for all ages. Deep, wide windows bathe the 3rd floor TV room on two sides while providing a view of the grounds and pond. The covered porch, overlooking the gardens, is perfect for morning coffe and evening cocktails. A cacophony of bird songs will entertain you in the morning and the frogs will harmonize with the hoot owls at night. If you're a couple with a child you may use the single room in addition to the other bedroom for an extra charge of $25 a night. Guest Access The guests will have access to the second and third floor, two full baths, the grounds, porch, patio and pond. Although there are no kitchen privleges, (the refrigerator is yours to use) a continental breakfast will be served and prepared to your dietary specifications. Interaction with Guests I tend to be an Italian mother when it comes to servicing your needs but I respect the value of letting everyone do their own thing with privacy. We're there with any questions or concerns but won't hover. The Neighborhood We live in one of the most bucolic, iconic New England destinations with year round beauty that draws people from all over the East coast and beyond.People who could live anywhere in the world choose to live here as a vacation and week end destination. Washington is centrally located in Litchfield County, 15 minutes or less from hundreds of great restaurants, lakes, hiking trails, antique centers, cross country ski areas, bike trails, apple orchards, music venues, two 5 star resorts and so much more. For a short list of great places to check out: Avrill Farm....a great apple orchard in Washington Steep Rock Land Trust for hiking in Washington just down the road from me Mohawk Mountain Infinity Hall...a great venue for concerts Lake Waramaug...5 minutes away Some great local restaurants include: The George Washington Tavern in Washington The Community Table, Washington The White Horse, Washington Carol Peck's Good News Cafe, Woodbury The Village restaurant, Litchfield The West Street Grill, Litchfield ...just to name a few! All one has to do is walk out my door or bike ride about to experience quintessential, classic country Connecticut. Getting Around For a fee, I am available to pick you up from Wingdale or Brewster on the Harlem Valley train out of Grand Central. I can also drive you to the Enterprise car rental for a much more reasonable rate and more availablity than there is in NYC. I know this county quite well, having lived here for more than 30 years and selling real estate. Whatever your preferences and interests, I have much insight and guidence for you. Other Things to Note No matter what the season, there is always beauty and interesting things to do here. Please let me know what your interests are (even if it's chilling out in undisturbed peace and quiet) and we will guide and provide for you accordingly. We have two friendly, non territorial, peaceful dogs who love the company of other dogs and children. If you chose to bring your dog please note that the dog will have to be confined to a crate or a room when you're not here since the property is not fenced. A fee of $35 for two days will be charged for your dog. + More

about: Ski season is upon us, ski Catamount,Mohawk or Butternut. Three bedroom home located in Lakeville CT. Walking,to town lake access,restaurants.Three acres on a quiet deadend road. Located within minutes to Hotchkiss, Indian Mountain and Salisbury.
description: Description The Space Enjoy. Three bedroom one and a half bath updated home located in Lakeville CT. Walking, to town lake access, (the grove) restaurants etc. Our house is situated on three acres on a quiet deadend road. Located within minutes to Hotchkiss, Indian Mountain School and Salisbury boys school. Furnished with updated modern furnishings, Design Within Reach leather sectional, modern walnut and steel table. You will indeed be comfy. King bed in master, two twins and full bed will sleep six comfortably. Enjoy the sun porch while inside and the slate patio while outside. Guest Access Full house, no other houses on the property The Neighborhood There are a few restaurants in Lakeville that you can walk to. A health food store is down the road. Also at the end of our road there is a little shallow brook that my kids use to love playing in. They would make bridges out of rocks. It is fun little activity. Getting Around Best to have a car Other Things to Note Bring your bikes for long flat joy rides on the Millerton rail trail. During the winter enjoy skiing at Mohawk, Catamount or Butternut. House comes with a canoe that is stored on a rack at the grove (public beach) we will supply you with the lock code if you would like to go canoeing. Depending on how long you rent fee's to access the grove may be required. The grove is wonderful, has both sand and grass, grills, picnic tables and lots of lifeguards on duty and a great playground. + More

about: Cozy house in a very private setting on 6 acres of woods and gardens, a 3-minute walk to a pristine lake. Relax on the large covered porch or the private deck off the bedroom. Enjoy our heated in-ground pool, playground, and hot tub.
description: Description The Space Nestled in the woods in the beautiful Litchfield Hills, our house has lots of personality, and an artist's touch wherever you look. Sit in a rocking chair on the covered porch and look down on beautiful gardens, or meet some wildlife as you explore the walkway through wetlands. Stop in the rustic gazebo on the way to the pool, and see if you can spot all the hand-carved sculptures on the grounds. Enjoy breakfast on the sunny deck outside the bedroom. Bring your kayak or canoe and push off from our dock on the lake. Guest Access You'll have the run of the house and grounds, except for the apartment downstairs where the owner will be staying. Interaction with Guests I'll usually be reachable during the workday, cell service permitting, and I'll be right there to help with anything you need on the weekends and evenings. The Neighborhood Only two hours to NYC. Close to the Hotchkiss, Salisbury, and Berkshire schools. Shop in lovely Salisbury, just minutes away, or enjoy all the Berkshires have to offer -- Great Barrington, Tanglewood, Stockbridge, hiking, biking, skiing at Butternut or Catamount. Getting Around A car is really a necessity. Guests can take the train from Grand Central to Wassaic, 30 minutes south. + More

about: 4 bedroom, 2 bath home; minutes from beaches, town, casinos, wineries. Character, charm & convenience. Full kitchen, grill, arbor, garden setting. King suite w/adjoining room full size mattress; downstairs 2 bedrooms. Can sleep 6 comfortably.
description: Description The Space This is my home--a turn of the century mill house I lovingly restored and renovated a few years ago. The neighborhood is safe and convenient to town, and the best beaches in the world are 15 minutes away. The house fits 6 people like so: 2 in kingsize bed/master suite; 1 (or 2) on full mattress upstairs in adjoining room, 2 in twin beds downstairs, 1 in smaller guest bedroom. (pics will be updated by May 1--the pink bedroom will have 2 beds, the smaller "wooden headboard" bedroom will have one.) Ceiling fans , new windows, comfortable seating. Gas fireplace heats large living space downstairs. Cute little garden outside to relax in or barbecue. You can see the river from the upstairs master bedroom with skylight. Plenty of room, plenty of privacy. Some have noted that the house is on a well-traveled street, with a neighborhood restaurant bar-restaurant half a block away. This is a plus for some, since great bars and restaurants are walking distance. Neighbors look out for one another here, but of course, lock your car and the house doors. Also, the Amtrack train runs just across the street on a raised track at regular hours (about 4 times a day and night). One more thing in the spirit of full disclosure: there are hourly church bells. Some like it, some don't: ear plugs provided to every guest ;) Guest Access When guests are staying, my 21 year old daughter Emma and I move out. She or I may be staying in the adjoining studio. You will have the house to yourselves. House used to be 2-family, renovated to one (not a duplex), and there is plenty of room and privacy-door and stairway between main part of the house and master suite, which is a large space w kingsize canopied bed and 5' double shower in bathroom. There is a full sized bed in the adjoining upstairs bedroom on the floor. Downstairs bathroom has shower and bathtub. Downstairs guest bedrooms: the pink room has 2 twin beds. The middle bedroom has one single. Towels and sheets are included, full kitchen with all utensils, state of the art refrigerator/ freezer, dish washer, washer and dryer. 44" Smart TV; Wi-Fi; Private grape arbor and al fresco dining, lawn chairs, fire pit and grill. If you bring a dog, (the house is pet-friendly for well-trained dogs) there is a totally fenced in safe area in the back you are welcome to keep him or her. Interaction with Guests I would love to greet you when you arrive if I am not traveling myself; I am available by phone to call, text, and email. The Neighborhood A safe, friendly commercial and residential neighborhood with shops and restaurants a minute's walk down Mechanic St towards Westerly. You are right around the corner from Donahue Park, which overlooks the river, and another few minutes walk to the fabulous Wilcox Park and Westerly Library, both 19th century architectural wonders; cool bars and a variety of restaurants and shops in Westerly. (People have said Westerly is like Bedford Falls, but for real, if you get the reference!) 5 minutes to Rt 1 and the best beaches in New England. Wonderful Watch Hill minutes away by car. Farmers markets nearby; vineyards in Stonington 10 minutes away. Providence 45 minutes north; Narragansett half hour. Area is chock full of fitness/yoga studios, some walking distance-in town. Because the town is so close by , the place becomes a wonderful retreat and escape--privacy and solitude if you like, or just a walk down the block to sit at neighborhood pubs (CC OBrian's, Perks & Corks, Twisted Vine, etc ) I did have one guest out of 20 mention that the church bells and train sounds were a bit bothersome, but at least one other thought they were charming additions and he never needed to check his watch! (website hidden)(phone number hidden)z/data=!(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)d(phone number hidden)d(phone number hidden) above is a link to a good map of Westerly Beach area. Getting Around Best to have a car, but you can have a terrific time car-less. Take Amtrack from up or down the NE corridor, walk here from the Westerly, RI station--everything is walkable to in town, and bike-able to-beaches, vineyards, etc. The house shares a driveway (entrance is to the side, not facing the street)-room for 4 cars. Other Things to Note Fully equipped kitchen:Toaster, coffee-maker, blender, juice extractor, etc. Non-password Wi-fi...(TP-Link...).This is a lived in home and everything you need to use or borrow, you can! If you charge a movie on Xfinity cable, just leave me the $ on the kitchen counter. Thanks! + More
rules: House Rules Please treat my home as I would treat yours-- If you smoke, please do so outside, not in. Pets are ok if well trained and you are willing to clean up after them. When you leave, please strip the beds and place sheets in washing machine, used towels on floor of downstairs bathroom. Thank you! + More

description: Description The Space Captain Grant's is a fully furnished home on five acres of lawn. It is located in in an historic area near the center of the Mystic Coast and Country area of Connecticut, On our website is a virtual tour that will allow you to see the home and grounds in their entirety. Go to ww(URL HIDDEN) and click on our 360 virtual tour. Each bedroom has its own bathroom. One has a jetted tub. Two of the beds have canopies.Each bedroom has a TV. A unique room is our billiard room with an authentic 1907 pool table, large screen TV and poker table.There is also a full gourmet kitchen, fireplaces, outdoor grill and firepit plus three decks. We offer discount tickets to area attraction and restaurants. Maps and off street parking are on the property. If you need anything, Ted and Carol are ready to help. There is cable TV and WIFI. Guest Access If you rent a room you have access to all common areas. If you rent the entire home you have access to everything except the basement and attic. Interaction with Guests If you rent a room we talk to you over breakfast which we serve our guests. If you rent the entire home we only interact with you if you want us to. The Neighborhood It is beautiful here; both inside and outside. There are trees and greenery everywhere. The neighborhood is a National Historic Village. Getting Around You will need a car. + More

about: Bramasole is located on 7 private acres. We offer Spa Services, Guided Hikes, Yoga, and Tai Chi, if our guests desire these services. Our breakfast is organic, healthy and always special. Private bath, covered porch, amenities, turn down service.
description: Description The Space Bramasole Bed And Breakfast is privately located on peaceful 7 acres. We have beautiful panoramic views of the skyline, great for leaf peeping. We offer Spa Services, Private Yoga or Tai Chi, Guided Hikes, Turn Down Service, Massage, Reflexology and many other blissful healing services. We have hardwood floors throughout the house, plenty of windows for natural light, all amenities, game boards, piano, outdoor basketball hoop. Guest Access When you stay with us, you will have access to an outdoor covered porch area with beautiful panoramic views of the sky. Great for Fall Leaf Peeping! Interaction with Guests I visit with the guests during breakfast and give my guests privacy. However I am always accessible to guests. The Neighborhood Our neighborhood is very quiet and peaceful. Close to beautiful antiques shops and art galleries. Local restaurants offer true dining experiences. Enjoy a visit to one of our local vineyards! Getting Around We are centrally located and have easy access to New York City, Hartford and Danbury. + More

about: Newly furnished, renovated contemporary style condo in the Waterfront District, 1 mile from beaches, parks, colleges, hospital. Situated in New London's Historic Waterfront District on the border with Waterford. A great location in the heart of New England's coastline near Mystic, Niantic & two casinos.
description: Description The Space This is a newly furnished and remodeled contemporary condo in the best section of New London and near Waterford. The condo includes all basic appliances, silverware, dinning ware, dishes etc. Guest Access The whole condo area. Interaction with Guests Direct communication with owner throughout the rental process and stay. The Neighborhood - Situated in the safe and attractive New London's Historic Waterfront District . - Convenient location to colleges, hospital. - 1 minute from two area beaches, Harkness Park. - Short drive to Mystic Seaport & Aquarium and some of the most beautiful East Coast towns and villages. - Nearby ferry to Block Island, Fisher's island etc. Getting Around Near Bus, train, ferry + More

about: Our lakefront 'cottage' is great for a secluded escape. 2 BR, 2Baths. Fabulous sunrises and full moons. Middle Bolton Lake is a very quiet lake (no more than 6hp). Private dead end road just 2 miles from major highways. Two hours to NYC or Boston
description: Description The Space Large upper level cathedral ceiling master with large skylight. Fully equipped kitchen with slider to gas grill and lobster pot. Two outdoor sitting and eating areas, outdoor wood stove, beautifully landscaped grounds with quiet and shady sitting areas to read, paint and enjoy this nature wonderland. Guest Access Cottage is set for romantic adult weekends, yet has all the amenities needed for you children accompanying family. There is even a 'cabin' play house for adventurous kids. Interaction with Guests This is a private home with all the solitude and privacy one desires. We are available at all times and gladly share rides on our pontoon boat. Kids of all ages love the ride around the lake with snacks, drinks or wine. The Neighborhood As you enter Wildwood Rd, through stone columns, you will feel like you are going into the woods. The road is quiet, only residents use the dead end street. This is a very private lake with a few fisherman, kayaks and canoes, a couple of sailboats and several laid back pontoon boats. The only sounds you hear are nature, children laughing, and an occasional party across the lake that ends quietly by 10 pm. It is a real gem of tranquility. No one wants to leave. Getting Around You will need a car but this hidden world is just 20 minutes to Hartford, a couple of miles to major highways and 2 hours to NYC and less to Boston. Other Things to Note Sleeping on the sun filled porch by the lake is a special treat. The house has two levels so another couple or children will have their own private place. + More
rules: House Rules Treat it like it was your own. No smoking or pets. Extra guests must be pre-approved. + More

about: Quaint three bedroom New England castle with expansive grounds and charming views.
description: Description The Space Our castle was built in 1917 on seven acres by a prosperous Ellington family whose trip to England had inspired the fulfillment of a childhood dream to own a castle. In early 2000, a brilliant artist purchased the castle and dedicated five years to refurbishing and beautifying it. The kitchen is modern with new appliances, the dishwasher having been replaced last year. Downstairs there is a large dining room, a living room with a fireplace, and an inside porch guarded by a medieval knight. Upstairs, each spacious bedroom announces a theme: the jungle room, the Romeo-Juliet room, and an elegant burgundy room with a balcony and bistro set for morning coffee. The grounds offer gardens, a fountain, a gazebo by a pond, and a pergola overlooking another garden with a gargoyle hunched on its pedestal. There is also a trail for leisurely walks up and behind the woods. Points of interest: Bradley Airport, Mark Twain Museum in Hartford, The Bushnell, and The Atheneum Museum are all 20 minutes away by car. Also, 1.5 hours from Boston and 2.5 hours from New York City. + More

about: The Ashford Lake house is a the perfect place for your quiet getaway or relaxing family vacation. Enjoy lake life with all the amenities, surrounded by beautiful wooded eastern Connecticut forest- Hike, kayak, fish, swim, sit fire side, it's here.
description: Description The Space The house, originally a cabin, was converted into a two bedroom year-round home in the 1980s. You walk into the main floor that features a full-sized kitchen, a full bath, and lovely open dining room and living room that walks out onto a gorgeous deck. The living room also has a Hearthstone wood stove available for use in the colder months (November-March). A spiral staircase takes you up to the loft room, which has a full-sized bed and skylights. Heading down the spiral stairs you will find another bedroom with a full sized bed with an attached full bathroom, and a third bedroom with twin bunkbeds. The downstairs master bedroom has sliding doors that access the lower deck and yard. Take the stone path down to the dock to Ashford Lake, a small and peaceful private lake. There is a pull-out sofa in the living room that sleeps one comfortably. There is free parking for two vehicles adjacent to the house. Guest Access Take the stone path down to the dock and find a hammock, a fire pit, and two kayaks, all for your private use. You will also have access to the private beach minutes down the road. There is free wifi in the house, as well as Amazon FireTV(Netflix, AmazonPrime), DVD player, and a small selection of movies and board games. There is a CD player and AM/FM stereo combo, as well as an ipod dock for iphone or ipod generation 4. Interaction with Guests We try and meet all guests at check-in, and give tips about the house. If for some reason we can't make it over, we live close by, and if you need anything during your stay we are a short drive away. The Neighborhood The house is situated in a quiet residential community in Connecticut's Quiet Corner. Come stay for your next antiquing trip to Putnam, or visit to UConn, or trip to the Woodstock or Brooklyn Fairs. Take in a show at Putnam's Bradley Play House or UConn's Jorgensen Center. The lake community is home to families that live there year round, as well as some who keep seasonal homes. The speed limit on the roads surrounding the house is 15 miles per hour and is strictly observed. The community has covenants/ rules we will familiarize you with before your stay. Getting Around There is no public transportation locally. A car rental would be recommended for the duration of your stay. There are beautiful hiking trails in the woods nearby, and quiet dirt roads for mountain biking. Other Things to Note If you are traveling with children, contact me and I will send you a special offer. We charge extra per night for more than 4 adults, but if you are a group of 6 with 2 or more children it will not be any additional money per night. Find and like us on (website hidden) to follow lake house news! (website hidden) The area is flush with wildlife- birds, woodpeckers, bunnies, deer, turtles- we also have an outdoor cat that you will see roaming about on the property, or out on the deck. The lake is quite a different place in the winter compared to other seasons. The lake itself freezes, and the only activity on it is the occasional ice fisher and perhaps some skaters. Our rule of thumb is that we don't go out on the ice unless others are already out. We advise people to use extreme caution on and around the lake at all times and do not take responsibility for our guests use of the lake or any accidents associated with use of the lake or our equipment. + More
rules: House Rules We hope you will come and experience the tranquility and beauty of our home and the surrounding area. We are not looking to rent to those who are planning to have loud parties or make excessive noise. There are no gas-powered boats on the lake, so it is very peaceful. Guests are welcome to use the boats provided, but no outside boats may be brought to the lake. Though we will rent to responsible families with children, the house does not accommodate more than 6 people total. Wipes and sanitary items should not be flushed in any of the house toilets. There is no smoking allowed in the house, and we also do not allow pets. We reserve the right to ask people who aren't following the rules and guidelines to vacate before the end of their stay without a refund. Please see the complete house manual before your stay. Thank you! + More

about: If you're looking for peace and tranquility, this cottage is the answer. The cottage sits privately in the woods with views of the creek and pool from the sunroom, charming space for your perfect getaway!
description: Description The Space The setting is above a lovely brook with views of woods, acres of ferns, stone walls, and hiking trails. The property is surrounded by 175 acres of a land trust. Acres of gardens are available to stroll in. The cottage is really homey with comfortable furniture, a large living room/dining combination, a large sunroom with gorgeous views, a computer for your use,and a complete kitchen with some groceries for preparing simple breakfasts or snacks. Upstairs there is a queen sized bed with two built in twin beds and a bath with shower. Guests are allowed access to owners gardens and private pool in season. We are happy to give our guests any information about the gardens, hiking area and local interest. Guest Access The guests will have access to the private gardens, the pool in season, and land trust with hiking trails all to yourself! Interaction with Guests Happy to answer any questions about the area, gardens etc. Buddy the border collie is available for ultimate frisbee games, chickens are happy to share their eggs. The Neighborhood Our road is so quiet, only a few cars an hour, There is no road noise since the cottage is set away in the woods. Our town which is five minutes away has a small and wonderful grocery store with a fabulous selection. There is also a pharmacy and wine shop and a few restaurants. Middletown is twelve minutes away and has become a restaurant destination. Getting Around Happy to answer any questions on how to reach areas to visit. Parking is available with a short walk up a private path to cottage. Our town is set along the Connecticut river. Haddam has more antique homes than Historic Williamsburg. The towns of East Haddam, Chester and Essex are nearby and are beyond charming. Other Things to Note Older children are welcome but not a safe location for tots because of the creek, ponds, pool and stone cliffs. The pool area is very serene. Please avoid loud games in the pool. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking please. We would prefer you not bring your pet because of freshly sanded floors and new carpeting. If you have a special need to bring a pet, please call us to discuss. + More

about: Your home away from home in Woodstock, CT! Our colonial reproduction is the perfect place to stay with your family while visiting the "Quiet Corner." This colonial reproduction is spacious and comfortable, with all the modern amenities.
description: Description The Space (See my other listing for more pictures of the house!) The house is tastefully decorated with baskets, braided rugs and primitive country decor. All of the bedrooms are located on the second floor. There is separate heat (forced hot water) through radiators on the first and second floors. The kitchen, dining room and living room are all connected to allow for easy quality time spent among family and friends. There are three bedrooms on the second floor - The Master Suite, with a queen sized bed, a second bedroom with a full sized bed, and a third bedroom with a twin bed. There is a full bath in the Master Suite and another full bath in the hallway. There is a half bath on the first floor as well. Guest Access You will have access to the whole house, though there will be some of the owner's items in closets and some cabinets. Guests may use the garage, though we may have personal items there as well. We ask that guests do not go into the basement unless you speak with us first. Guests may use the yard, chiminea and fire pit as long as they adhere to the house manual. Interaction with Guests We live close by, and are available for maintenance issues or questions at any time. If we are away from home, we will still be available by phone. The Neighborhood The house is situated in scenic north east Woodstock, CT in a quiet residential neighborhood. Sweet Evelina's Stand is minutes away, as well as Devon Point Farm. Enjoy everything that Putnam has to offer, antiques, good restaurants and more, only 20 minutes away. Sturbridge village and Brimfield Fair are also easily accessible from the house. Woodstock is also a reasonable commuting distance from Hartford, Worcester and Boston. Getting Around Though there is not a lot of options for public transportation in the area, the house is convenient to rts (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). Other Things to Note We are on a septic system and asks guest to not dispose of anything other than toilet tissue down any of the drains. No oils or liquids other than water should be poured down the sink. + More
rules: House Rules We cannot host pets or allow smoking on the property. We reserve the right to ask guests to leave the property without refund if they aren't adhering to the house rules or the house manual. + More

about: Nestled in the idyllic coastal community of Village Creek, South Norwalk, private community beach and marina a two minute walk. Tennis courts. Bike and hike. 1.5 miles from hip downtown historic SONO. Great family or romantic getaway. Easy access to NYC - Metro North, 1 hour. Short term rental Jan/Feb
description: Description The Space Built in 1952, this 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom mid-century modern house possesses casual charm, ease of circulation and an open-floor plan, in a picturesque tranquil setting. Set on the foot of a hill and surrounded by towering trees, you will feel cocooned in your own grown-up tree house. It's called an upside down house - the bedrooms on the lower level and the living area is on the upper level to make the most of the views. This house is part of the coastal community of Village Creek, close to Rowayton and South Norwalk. Kitchen The designer kitchen is perfect for casual dining and relaxing. Grill on the deck. Kitchen is fully furnished with refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave and a 6 burner gas range. There are local supermarkets, Whole Foods and Trader Joes, that you can shop at,if you are planning more elaborate meals. Beautiful living areas The primary living area includes a gorgeous marble fireplace, modern furniture, glass rail deck that look out into marsh and Long Island Sound views Sunroom adjacent to kitchen makes a perfect spot for napping. Or simply sit on the tree shaded deck and take in the view. Bedrooms Within the house there are two bedrooms: the master and the second. The master has plenty of natural light and a queen-sized bed. The second bedroom has two twin beds, and room to play. Upstairs, the couches can accommodate up to two more guests in a pinch. Bathrooms The master bathroom features a step-in tub with shower attachment. The second bathroom has a shower/tub combination and a sink + toilet. Beach access Access to private beach for the neighborhood, is a 3 minute walk Ideal for Ideal for couples, group of friends, families with young children, outdoor lovers. Other Things To Do Great biking, hiking opportunities. Explore Coastal Connecticut towns. Stepping Stones Museum for Children (Norwalk), Maritime Aquarium (Norwalk), Westport Playhouse, fine dining in Norwalk and surrounding towns of Westport and New Canaan. Movie theaters, shopping Just an hour by train or car to NYC, take a day to be out in the Big Apple Notes Makes a great getaway from the city for an idyllic weekend. Ideally a car is good for getting around. Guest Interaction When you rent the whole house, you have it all to yourself. There will be no one else (including host ) on the property. Provisions for tea and coffee and basic kitchen pantry ingredients will be there for your use. You are free to prepare meals in the kitchen or dine out in neighboring SONO or Westport. Getting here! Airports: NYC area - JFK, La Guardia (40 miles), Newark, NJ (60 miles), Hartford Bradley (84 miles) Amtrak: From Stamford (10 miles) or 3 train stop from South Norwalk Metro North: Frequent express service to NYC (Grand Central) 1 hour (at least 1 train an hour , more during rush hour) 40 miles Easy accessibility by road through Interstate 95 (Exit 14) or Meritt Parkway (Exit 37). More questions? Contact us! Guest Access Guest Access Access to all areas of the house. All kitchen equipment and dishes are available for guest use. Pantry ingredients and refrigerator stuff are available for use if specified. Laundry washer dryer available. Interaction with Guests Interaction with Guests There will be no other guests on property or the host when you reserve it. However, I am always reachable via phone, email or text and me or my caretaker will meet you upon arrival, if feasible. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is extremely quiet and idyllic, while being close to downtown SONO restaurants and bars. The private community beach is a two minute walk from the house, perfect for a day at the beach, a quick swim or a nice walk. Downtown SONO has vibrant restaurants, movie theaters, galleries and shops. If you have children, Norwalk makes a great quick escape with it's acclaimed Stepping Stones Museum for Children and the Maritime Aquarium. You can easily spend a day at these two places followed by a day at the beach. Getting Around Easy access to I95 and Merritt Parkway and Metro North. The house is a five min cab ride from South Norwalk station (1 hour to NYC) Other Things to Note Quick escape for families ! Visit the acclaimed Stepping Stones Museum for Children and the Maritime Aquarium. Grown ups have a variety of restaurants to choose from in downtown Sono combined with galleries and shops. + More
rules: House Rules Keep the place as you found it. Check in is at 4pm. Checkout at noon. Please be understanding of the fact that this reservation is strictly for the guests on record. No additional person is allowed on the property at any point in time, without our prior consent. After a few unfortunate incidents with guests that have not honored this, we can definitively say no parties at the house". If you are celebrating a special occasion, please check with us on the rules. This house is part of the Village Creek Home Owners Association. As such we are very mindful that we be a good neighbor and respect common areas (the tennis court, field, beaches and road). It is common practice for neighbors to acknowledge residents and if you were to be asked which house are you from", please let them know you are guests at 28 Dock". Since it is a pretty old school neighborhood, any mention of AirBnB is likely to be met with a quizzical look. Please do not hesitate to ask or inform me with any questions at any point of time. + More

about: This historic single family home has been in our family for over 100 years. You will be steps from the mystic river, downtown shopping, and restaurants. It has been rejuvenated and given fresh paint, new furniture, and charming decor.
description: Description The Space Large rooms, historic charm, and serene decor all combine to make this apartment a place you will not want to leave. Complete with a queen bed, full sized sleeper sofa, washer, dryer, walk-in closet, full bath, full kitchen, and dining area.The dining area features a sliding glass door leading to the back deck. Guests can enjoy grilling outdoors on the new grill and dining outside. Guests with small children will find a pack-n-play, toys, cups, plates, and utensils all suitable for little hands. Upon entering the front door you will walk down the hall into the laundry room which includes a washer and dryer, then turn left into the living room. The bedroom is to the left, kitchen and dining room to the right. The full bathroom is located off the living room. Guest Access Guests will be invited to stay on the first floor. The second floor is unoccupied but off limits to guests. Interaction with Guests We welcome as much interaction with guests as you would like! The Neighborhood The house is located on a quiet side street a minute's walk from the best restaurants in town. Our house is located around the corner from the newly established Engine Room restaurant, Anthony J's, and the Mystic River drawbridge. The famous Mystic Pizza is less than a 10 minute walk from the house with wonderful trinket shops, clothing stores, a playground, and other cafe's/restaurants lining the way. Guests can venture further than downtown Mystic by taking a short car ride to Old Mystick Village, the Mystic Seaport, Mystic Aquarium, Foxwoods Casino and Mohegan Sun Casino. Local area beaches are also within a short drive. Getting Around Most attractions in downtown Mystic are within walking distance; however, guests that would like to visit the casinos may need to call a cab or provide their own transportation. Other Things to Note We provide all confirmed guests with a welcome packet (both via email and hard copy at the house) that details the specifics of the house, house rules, area attractions and restaurants, etc. as well as provide informational pamphlets inside the house. + More

about: Escape city life to this wonderful, recently renovated, two bedroom apartment in historic Stonington Borough. The house is a one block from the center of the village and the beach is a 5 minute walk down to the point.
description: Description The Space Escape city life to this wonderful, newly renovated, two bedroom apartment in historic Stonington Borough. Eclectically decorated with modern and vintage furnishings. The house is one block from the center of the village and the beach is a 5 minute walk down to the point. The apartment is on the 2nd floor of the house. A large loft bedroom is on the top floor and with a bedroom on the main level. The living room and kitchen are laid out in an open floor plan on the main level as well. The kitchen has a small island that seats 2 with brand new appliances. There is a large flat screen TV on the wall in the living room that has access to Apple TV and wifi. The apartment can accommodate 4-5 people and there is access to an outdoor shower in the backyard. The apartment is bright, cozy and perfect for a getaway. The restaurants in downtown Stonington are fantastic along with the farmer's market on Saturday mornings down at the fishing docks. Guest Access Beach Paddle tennis courts Playground Interaction with Guests We live in the area and are always available by cell and email. The Neighborhood Stonington Borough is a shore line village on Fisher's Island Sound. We have a beach, fresh fish coming in on the docks, walk-to library and post office right here in town. The restaurants in downtown Stonington are fantastic along with the farmer's market on Saturday mornings down at the fishing docks. Getting Around The house is conveniently located and very easy to walk anywhere in town. Shopping for essentials - drug store, small grocery, etc. are within 5 miles.
