about: Connecticut shore cottage with ocean views, sun porch, and knotty-pine great room. Historic New England vibe--seashore style with vintage details and modern updates. 50-yard walk to private or town beach. Laid-back & mellow beach neighborhood.
description: Description The Space A slice of New England coastal charm--with vintage style, modern updates, and ocean views. You will not find a cottage of this size, this close to the beaches, at this price. Knotty-pine great room has cozy hangout area for lounging. Sun porch has lots of seating--for breakfast coffee or an afternoon of reading. Quiet with ocean breezes. Perfect cottage for the full shoreline experience, from the mellow beach neighborhood itself to local woodland walks and marina kayak rentals. Close to lots of restaurants and sightseeing. Guest Access During their visit, guests will have access to all rooms in the cottage. The rooms are fully furnished with a full kitchen. Small fenced yard and four parking spots included as well. The attic and three storage closets are restricted and off-limits. Interaction with Guests During their visit, guests will immediately call the owner with any emergencies or urgent questions about the cottage. Guests will text or call the owner for any questions about the cottage. Guests will text or email the owner requesting more general support or information about the cottage. The Neighborhood Cozy seaside street runs along the ocean, looks onto Long Island Sound and Duck Island. Quaint side streets run toward the creek and wetlands. Narrow sandy street with people walking and jogging in the summer. Special little spot with nestled cottages--and two types of beaches just a one-minute walk in each direction. Walk to the quiet Coral Sands private beach tucked behind the dunes. Or walk to the public town beach with its full services, folks coming & going, and a playground for the kids (but you don't have to pay for parking). Major grocery stores (Shop Rite and Stop&Shop) a couple miles west on Route 1. Town park, with athletic fields and playground, and town library a mile away in the center of Westbrook. Look for area parades and festivals--towns are known for their colonial fife & drum corps. Valley-Shore YMCA a couple miles away. Easy access to Boston, Providence, New Haven, and New York City. Pilots Point Marina at the end of the street--boat slips and charters. Tidewater Bait & Tackle, half mile west on Route 1. The famous Bill's Seafood by the Singing Bridge, half mile west on Route 1. Hammonasett State Park, Old Saybrook Point, and Rocky Neck State Park all close. Tanger Outlets in Westbrook. Clinton Crossing Outlets in Clinton. Close to Mystic Seaport & Aquarium. Getting Around Perfect midpoint on the Connecticut shoreright in between New Haven and New London, for full access to everything the shoreline offers. The cottage's street is directly off historic Route 1. Easy and quick access to Interstate 95. Four free parking spots in front of cottage. CT Commuter Train--Shore Line East has a full station 1.5 miles away in the center of Westbrook. It connects to Metro North at New Haven! Other Things to Note SUMMER: (June-August) $175 a night, $1225 a week. Includes electricity and WiFi. (Discount to $2100 for two weeks and $4410 for a month-long stay.) ACADEMIC YEAR: (September-May), two-month minimum stay. $1300 a month. If you take the full academic year, discount to $1100 a month. (Cable access and WiFi router available.) + More
rules: House Rules Minimum age of 30 for renters. Please read the "House Manual" you can access upon acceptance of your reservation. Please minimize toilet flushing and flush only septic-safe toilet paper--the shoreline cottages use small septic systems. All other waste must go into the trash. Thanks for being careful! Park only in FRONT of the cottage. By CT state law, no parked cars, standing vehicles, or furniture allowed in the shared right-of-way between cottages. The right-of-way is for walking or passing through. Please bring your own towels and bed linens (three double/full mattresses). Lock cottage when you leave it empty. Please do not go into the attic or into the three porch closets. The clothesline is for wet clothes; please do not leave or hang wet clothes in the cottage. Be gentle with the vintage wood & string window shades! Please close the porch windows during rain storms. No smoking anywhere in the cottage. Pets are not allowed (but they have lived in the cottage in the past). Please wash and dry all dishes & kitchenware before leaving at the end of your stay. Do not leave any food & drink in the refrigerator or cabinets at the end of your visit--other guests bring their own or the cottage is empty, so it all spoils. When you depart, please leave the cottage exactly as you found it--return all furniture and items to their original locations. + More

about: This 6-BR house, only 2 hrs from NYC, has the feel of a bygone era and all the comforts of modern living. 70 acres, surrounded by fields, orchards and foothills of the Berkshires. It is perfectly located for a fun and relaxing summer. SUMMER RENTAL
description: Description The Space (This listing is for a monthly summer rental only. There are no daily or weekly rates.) The house is on a beautiful scenic road, 5 minutes from Lake Waramaug State Park with it's lovely beach, canoe & kayak rentals and a boat launch. The house has its original central hearth and wideplank floors, is simply decorated and very comfortable. There is a large dining room and a sunny eat-in kitchen, but in the summer the screened-in porch with its view of the hayfields is the place to be. The owner lives at the far end of the driveway in a converted tobacco barn. The houses are separated by a wide lawn, perfect for barbecues, badminton, picnics, croquet or just rolling around. Guest Access Guests are free to enjoy the restored English perennial garden, catch frogs in the pond, wander along the brook in the back woods or pick berries at the pick-your-own organic blueberry operation that is up and running on the back acres July-Sept. Guests are also welcome to use a portion of the vegetable garden for their own planting. Interaction with Guests I am usually around all summer and can answer any questions and offer suggestions. But it is a big property and you can have as much privacy as you want. The Neighborhood This part of Litchfield County is a vacationer's paradise. Golf, tennis, horseback riding and fishing are all within a 20-minutes drive. Hiking ( including The Appalachian Trail), biking and birding are just out the back door. Good restaurants and garden tours, markets (flea and farmers') art galleries, auctions and antique shops abound. 1 1/2 hours to Tanglewood or Jacobs Pillow; 2 hours to Sturbridge Village and many other cultural attractions. Getting Around The house is 2 hours from NYC and 25 minutes from the Harlem Valley/Wingdale Metro North train station. Other Things to Note One more authentic feature of the house: steep staircases. Charming -- but not for the weak-kneed. The house was rented last summer to two families. We were all new to Airbnb and so didn't realize that we had to write reviews within two weeks. These reference can be provided on request. + More

about: Middletown is a small city on the Connecticut River. Walk downtown and to Wesleyan University. The rear unit (this listing) has 2 bedrooms: 1 w/ king bed, 1 w/ 2 twins (second floor). A very small WC, a kitchen, and a parlor make up the first floor.
description: Description The Space Clover Nook, named by the builder, is set next to a ravine. The millstream, Pameacha Creek, becomes a torrent in the spring. This two-family house has a door between the kitchens, which is often open during the summer.The larger bedroom, with a king bed, faces the rising sun. The small bedroom is suitable for two kids; it's on the driveway, which we share with the house next door. If a family needed more room, we could discuss putting an airbed in the parlor. I work at home, so I need access to my office, but I promise to stay out of your way. Guest Access The house has wireless Internet. I don't have much in the way of TV (very basic cable), but I do have Netflix. There is only one TV, which is in the parlor. When the weather is good, guests are welcome to use the garden and the back area. I hesitate to call it a patio because it is where I pot plants, but it is where we grill and build fires. We have a battered fire pit and plenty of wood. If you are traveling with small children, I would be happy to lay in some basic supplies for you. Interaction with Guests During your visit, I will be in my office during the day and in the apartment next door at night if any questions or problems come up. The Neighborhood This is an ethnically and culturally mixed neighborhood, and it is mixed zoning. Clover Nook once housed a beauty parlor; we found two of those old-fashioned hair dryers with the huge hoods in the basement. Toward the end of the street stands a collection of very small houses that were probably built to house mill employees. At the very end is the house where the songwriter Henry Clay Work was born. Among his best-known tunes are "Marching Through Georgia" and "My Grandfather's Clock." There is a statue of Work on Middletown's South Green, which is a few blocks from the house. Getting Around Middletown does have a bus system, and I have a schedule, but most people drive, walk, or bike. Parking is available in the driveway or on the street. Other Things to Note When a guest arrived recently, she asked if we could recommend a good massage therapist. We said sure--ours. Lugging her table, Joan made a house call. Everyone was pleased, and Joan decided she would be happy to do it again. If anyone who books at Clover Nook would like to arrange for a massage, I will pass along Joan's number after the booking, and Joan and the guest can make whatever arrangement they like. We have an ancient cat who has the run of the house; however, she hasn't been in either bedroom for years. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking is allowed in the house. I cannot welcome pets at this point because of the cat, but in the future, I plan to accommodate well-behaved dogs. + More

description: Description The Space Thank you for your interest in renting our cozy 2 bedroom, 1.5 bath home at 1007 Reef Road in Fairfield, CT. We hope you enjoy your stay and all that Fairfield has to offer. Our elevated beach cottage is a walker's paradise! It's a 5 minute walk to Penfield Beach with views of the lighthouse, 10 minute walk to Penfield Beach Pavilion and playground, 2 minutes to a park with playground and tennis courts, and a 15 minute walk to vibrant downtown Fairfield and train station. Bring your bikes and enjoy one of the best neighborhoods for casual biking in all of Connecticut! Spend your summer with us enjoying the peaceful beaches, parks, and relaxed feel of Fairfield (70 minutes on the train from New York City's Grand Central Station). We are pet and family friendly! Amenities include: Washer/Dryer; Full kitchen open to living/dining room and beautiful marsh views; central air and heat; ceiling fans; Internet and Cable; doggy door to fully fenced yard (through the garage); ample closet space; comfortable beds. Bedroom descriptions: Spacious master bedroom with queen size bed. Small guest bedroom/office with adult bunk beds (weight limit of 250 pounds). Other Things to Note ******For senior guests or guests staying with children: Our home is elevated and requires ascending approx. 10 stairs to enter the home. Therefore, our home is not suitable for anyone who has trouble climbing stairs or helping small children on stairs. There are sliding doors from the living room to an elevated deck. There is a baby gate from the top of the deck stairs to the yard. There is a creek running by the property. Children should be supervised at all times when on the deck or in the yard. + More
rules: House Rules We hope our renters relax and enjoy themselves in our beautiful home. This is a NO smoking home. about: Unique modern home on 1.5 acres. With cathedral ceilings and huge windows, our home is full of light and beautiful views of the outdoors. Relax in the hot tub, go for a hike, take a horseback riding lesson, or visit Yale's beautiful campus (~20 min).
description: Description The Space Our house is on a 1.5 acre lot and is very private. A modern home full of light, with hard wood floors and carpeting, a large eat-in kitchen, a living room with huge windows, a master bedroom with a hot tub, an additional bedroom, a deck, and a large private yard with a barn. Perfect for a quiet and relaxing getaway. Guest Access You will have access to 2 out of the 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, living room with pullout sofa, kitchen/dining area, laundry room with washer and dryer, deck and the yard. Interaction with Guests We will not be on the premises, but will be available by phone or email any time during your stay. We would also be happy to tell you all about the area in advance of your visit! The Neighborhood A beautiful wooded neighborhood. If you are looking for a rural getaway that is not too far from New Haven (20 min) and NYC (~2 hrs) you will love Bethany. There are horse stables all over town, several of our neighbors have chickens and the hikes are beautiful. Not to mention the amazing feeling of breathing in the incredible fresh air when you first step out of your car! Getting Around You will need a car to get around, but there are plenty of places nearby for hiking and riding bikes. Other Things to Note Please note, we have temporarily taken our beds apart and put the mattresses on the floor because our baby crawls on our bed and can fall off. The mattresses are still very comfortable, as long as you don't mind that they are on the floor and not raised up. Also, we don't have a television, but we have wireless internet. + More

description: Description The Space Less than 2 hours from New York City, this bucolic area (Litchfield County, CT) is known for it's beauty, social luster and solitude. Many noteworthy people have made it their second (home away from) home. Our masterfully restored and enhanced 1779 Colonial property is on the Connecticut State Register of Historic Places, and is rich with history yet modern comforts, offering you a sophisticated, private country experience on 7 acres, replete with horses. Our 15 baby chicks arrived in early May, and guests can now help themselves to fresh eggs laid by organically-fed, free-range chickens. This two-story cottage includes a cobblestone (propane-fueled) fireplace, and a gourmet kitchen fully appointed and stocked so that you can cook and eat in if you so choose. Awaken to a selection of coffees, teas, hot cocoa and/or hot cider. And while nearby Marty's Cafe in charming Washington Depot is a favorite for our guests who like to slip out for a cappuccino or latte early in the AM, we have just added a Jura Capresso F9 semi-automatic espresso machine, complete with fresh-roasted "Inspiration" beans from a local coffee roaster so that you can stay in and make your own. And, for foodies that crave a "farm to table experience"--we can provide you with lots of suggestions re: where to find local, sustainably and in many cases organically grown produce, poultry and beef. If you choose to eat out over cooking in, we are near an eclectic selection of restaurants, ranging from a Southern Barbecue to a British pub, and one that features organic/sustainable fare that you won't have to procure or prepare yourselves. And for those that love live music, we are just one-half hour away from the Infinity Music Hall. And the highly acclaimed Warner Theater in Torrington CT (also just one half-hour away) has a great variety of both shows and performers. We are near fabulous antique shopping, numerous artist's studios, independent bookstores and boutique shops, and several highly renowned spas (The Mayflower and the Winvian). In the alternative, for those that like to be pampered--we can arrange for you to have a Shiatsu massage right here in the privacy of the cottage. And for those that love the outdoors, walking, running and cycling trails abound! Kent State Park, White Memorial and Steeprock Preserve are all less than 20 minutes away. And of course, there are several fantastic, scenic and challenging golf courses nearby. (Want to train out of New York with just a backpack and your bikes? We'll pick you up and drop you off at the Metro North station at Harlem Valley/Wingdale--just 20 minutes away). For skiers, Mohawk Mountain is less than 20 minutes away. They literally invented snowmaking, so as long as it's cold enough out during the evening hours (11P-7A) for them to have their snow guns operating (which cover 100% of the mountain), they'll be white and deep enough for you to ski to your heart's content. Guests who like to challenge themselves by visiting different ski areas over the course of their stay can also venture East to Ski Sundown (which is 40 minutes away) or North into the Berkshires, and traverse the trails of Berkshire East, Butternut and/or Catamount ski areas--all less than 90 minutes away. Regardless, we are confident that you will enjoy your recreational time skiing in the area, and your aprs-ski time relaxing by our (thermostatically-controlled) fireplace, or by taking a rejuvenating steam shower in our (heated) marble-floored bath. During the Summer, with advance notice (your car's registration info and an $80.00 fee payable to the Town of Warren), you can have access to a private, beautiful and secluded town beach located just 5 miles away on one of the cleanest lakes in New England. Do you have a child attending a private school in Litchfield County? We are proximate to many area schools, including Canterbury, Kent School, South Kent School, Hotchkiss, Rumsey Hall and the Taft School. Guest Access Our guests are free to roam the property, feed the horses, gather eggs from the chicken coop, swing on our tree swing and even pounce on our trampoline. Interaction with Guests We normally greet our guests at check-in time, offering a brief tour and whatever area suggestions they may like. From that point forward, they are entitled to the privacy our property (and County!) offers. That said, we are a fun-loving, gregarious family (especially Jax, our dog) and just love getting to know our guests that would like to get to be known! Other Things to Note We have just installed a Level 2 charging system, so for our green-minded, like-minded guests, we offer a complementary charging station for your Volt, Leaf, Prius or i3. With our WiFi, and a super-duper, semi-automatic espresso machine, our setting and our guest cottage rivals (and beats!) any Starbucks you'll find. + More

about: This loft-like one-bedroom apartment is attached to our home and has its own driveway, deck and entrance. Situated on a three-acre property with woods and an organic garden, you'll have privacy with great dining and amenities just down the street.
description: Description The Space You'll sleep well in this comfortable, large one-bedroom private apartment attached to our home (over the garage). The bedroom is cosy and private and the large open living space is filled with natural light. The bedroom has a double bed and the living room will have either a futon or air mattress for an additional 2 people. The bathroom has a jacuzzi tub / shower. The kitchen has a four-burner stove, toaster oven and microwave and a small fridge.. The apartment has its own deck, private parking and a private entrance. Our property has an organic vegetable garden that you are welcome to share and a flock of laying hens that will entertain you. Guest Access Guests have access to the three-acre property at your own risk. If there's anything you need, you are welcome to come to the main house and we will make sure you are accommodated. Laundry room is available on a limited basis upon request. Interaction with Guests One of us will always be home to welcome our guests upon arrival and show you around. We are always happy to offer visiting tips and occasionally invite guests to join us for a drink or a shared meal on our terrace. The Neighborhood We are in the Connecticut countryside a little over an hour from NYC, 45 minutes to New Haven and right off the historic Route 7 Antique Trail. Although our home is officially in the town of Weston, this neighborhood is known as Georgetown and was the site of a mill-town years ago. Georgetown has maintained its local flavor with a tiny Main Street filled with restaurants and bars. There's a terrific family-owned grocery store that rivals Whole Foods, and all the other amenities of a small town just down the street. Getting Around The Branchville train station (Metro North Danbury line requires a change in Stamford or South Norwalk) is about a mile away. We are happy to pick up / drop off guests at the train, but recommend a car for getting around. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking in the apartment, no pets allowed. Our town recycles paper, plastic and metal. Garbage and recycling go in the garbage hut at the foot of the main driveway. Collection is Monday at 6AM. Washer / dryer by arrangement. Use of the space is limited to the specified guests and no more than 4 people. We welcome guests to visit the garden and chickens but please ask us to show you around first. + More

about: This is the home-away-from-home for you! Quiet cul-de-sac. Private yard.
description: Description The Space Updated 4BR/2BTH Cape on a quiet cul-de-sac in prestigious Southport CT. Walkable distance to Southport train station for New York City or Stamford commuters and quick car or bike ride to Southport Pequot Beach and Yacht Club. Rustic treehouse for children with 4 bunks for summer camping: it has electricity! Fenced in yard fully covered in specimen perennials. Modern kitchen with every conceivable appliance. Gorgeous and unique deck for outdoor entertaining including charcoal grill. Fully finished basement with 2 queen futons! Separate laundry room. King-sized bed in master, single beds in each guest bedroom, can put a single in first floor 4th bedroom if needed. More space in fully finished basement/bedrooms/office for extra airbeds which are on site. Guest Access Entire home! Combo to lock box with key enclosed provided prior to check in. Interaction with Guests I limit contact with guests to email, text and phone. Long term guests will most likely meet when I pick up the mail. The Neighborhood Cul-de-sac great for biking, strollers, jogging, etc. Nearby beach and Southport village. Great shopping in Westport and Fairfield villages. Easy train service to Manhattan. Getting Around Car is VERY important. Commuters can easily walk to Southport train station. Taxi's available from station for weather, etc. Transport: local excellent limo/car service: King Kahn Limo(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) (EMAIL HIDDEN) There's a very good airport shuttle to the WESTPORT INN : (URL HIDDEN) called red dot: (URL HIDDEN) which services all airports. Best option of course is the Westchester airport: HPN which is close with cheap parking and age of a place to go to a fro with kids in tow. If you're frequent flyering, sometimes there's difference in travel time and mileage.... A couple of groovy hot spots nearby for parents: Gray Goose (URL HIDDEN) Artisan (URL HIDDEN) Paci (URL HIDDEN) Friends in the neighborhood babysit but the more notice the better. Nearby National Registry of Historic districts: Greenfield Hills: (URL HIDDEN) Southport Village: (URL HIDDEN) Fairfield Village: (URL HIDDEN) Other Things to Note Please treat our home the way you would treat yours. We do not provide hotel services such as valet, room service, laundry, housekeeping, etc. Long term guests can request extra service from our contracted cleaners but will need to pay them directly. + More
rules: House Rules HOUSE RULES AND NOTES xx Arbor Terrace Southport CT 06890 MOTTO: Take whatever you need and replace whatever you use! And remember to enjoy! Please refer to manual left at the house for your information, maps, menus, etc. Check in is anytime after 3 pm. Check out must be no later than 11 am. (we need the 4 hours in-between to clean for the next guests). We offer a clean, well-appointed home that is perfect for people who want a viable and comfortable hotel alternative. We ask that our guests be respectful of our home, the furnishings and supplies, and also respectful of our fellow neighbors. Excessive noise will not be tolerated. Smoking is limited to outside the building. Pets, though we love them, are not able to stay in our home. Rental Agreement Damages: The Tenant(s) agree to be responsible for any and all damages howsoever caused, be same innocent, negligent or willful, and whether caused by the Tenant(s), any one of them or any person on the Rented Premises. The Tenant(s) further agrees to notify the Landlord immediately upon the Tenant(s) becoming aware of any damage. Maximum Occupancy: The maximum number of tenants and guests is limited to six (6) persons day or night. No weddings, graduations, receptions, parties, or similar events allowed. The Tenant(s) agrees to return the home in the same condition it was found. Check-out: In the event that the tenants(s) and guest(s) do not execute the cancellation agreement, the tenant(s) agrees that the owner may charge the sum of $600 per night provided the tenants(s) and guest(s) do not check out on their pre-arranged check-out date. No Daily Housekeeping services: While linens and bath towels are included, daily maid service is not included in the rental rate, however, it is available at an additional rate. We do not permit towels or linens to be taken from the home. Falsified Reservations: Any reservation obtained under false pretense will be subject to forfeiture of advance payment, deposit and/or rental money, and the party will not be permitted to check in. Liability Waiver: The Tenant(s) agrees that the Landlord shall not be liable for any loss, injury or damage to persons or property, loss of enjoyment, whether direct or consequential, resulting from such being on or about the Rented Premises whether caused by fire, smoke, theft, burglary, conditions due to the weather such as ice on the grounds, or for any cause whatsoever. The Tenant(s) further agrees that their use of the Rental Premises is at their sole risk. Insurance: We highly recommend all tenant(s) and guest(s) purchase travel, personal liability and property insurance. Indemnification: The Tenant(s) for good and valid consideration, including the granting of possession of the Rental Premises pursuant to the terms of this Rental Agreement, hereby agree to indemnify the Landlord and save them harmless with respect to any claim, demand, cause of action or actions made by any person against the Landlord, their agents and servants for damage or injury arising during the period of the Rental Agreement on or about the Rental Premises. Use of Grounds: The Tenant(s), his/her family and guest(s) shall use the common areas and walks within the area owned by the Landlord in a quiet and proper manner and with due regard to the comfort and convenience of other Tenants and neighbors, and shall desist from any course of conduct considered objectionable by any agent of the Landlord upon being requested to do so. Parking: There are 2 tandem parking spaces available. Extra spaces can be found on the street outside the home. Any illegally parked cars in the area are subject to towing; applicable fines/towing fees are the sole responsibility of the vehicle owner. Pets: Pets are NOT allowed. Smoking/Smoke Detectors/Fire Extinguisher: There is no smoking permitted in the home/or throwing cigarette butts on the grounds, or in the surrounding walkways/parking areas. The Tenant(s), his/her family and guest(s) are permitted to smoke on the terrace, but must use a proper ashtray and dispose of the butts in such a manner as to ensure the butts are extinguished fully. The Landlord ensures that there is a functional smoke detector/CO2 and fire extinguisher installed in the Rented Premises at the time the Tenant(s) takes possession of the rented premises. A Tenant(s), his/her family or guest(s) who disable(s) a smoke detector is subject to a fine under law. Both the Landlord and the Tenant(s) hereto agree and understand that this Rental Agreement shall be considered to be an original, and shall be legally binding upon all parties. Tenant(s) Travel Information: In order to ensure a smooth check-in and to better serve you, please be prepared to provide the following information: * Check in date and approximate hour of arrival. * Written listing and email addresses of all names of all guests who will occupy the home. * Check-in is anytime after 3 pm. Instructions for access will be provided when reservation is confirmed. * Your contact number during your stay. * Preferred method of contact while in Southport (email, phone, text). During the message exchange you will be asked to agree to the terms of our agreement. CHECK-IN: Please text me at (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) to let me know you've arrived safely! CHECK-OUT: Tidy house thoroughly to return to how it looked and smelled when you checked in yourself. Load up dishwasher and start cycle. Replace used items (laundry detergent, dryer sheets, food items, toilet paper, papertowels, etc.) Strip all bed linens, deposit in laundry room. Remake all beds with extra linens in closets as you found them if possible. Remove all used bathroom towels and replace with extra towels in bathroom cupboards. If beds or furniture was moved or airbeds used, please deflate and fold up airbeds/pullout. Remove all garbage from inside the house and deposit into large garbage bins outside and securely fasten lid. Blue bin is for paper, glass and metal. Green bin is for garbage. Lock all windows and doors and leave keys in designated spot. Failure to follow check out procedures could result in partial or total loss of security deposit. If an early departure precludes your ability to return the home to its original condition, please notify me IN ADVANCE to provide written consent to a $250 deduction from your security deposit. EXTRA GUESTS: House has 6 real beds and sleeps 8 comfortably without using airbeds (king for 2, singles for 2, queen futons for 4). More than 6 guests will be charged $150/each/night unless we negotiate prior to booking. Failure to disclose total number of guests could result in forfeiture of deposit. + More

description: Description The Space This house is adorable has beautiful energy and is affordable. The NW CT location is IDEAL. Two hours from Manhattan, 20 min from Great Barrington MA and Millerton NY and 10 min from Salisbury, CT. Biking on The Rail Trail, swimming, hiking, antiquing, rafting, Tanglewood, Kripalu are at your doorstep. The patio and BBQ are perfect for summer cocktails and dining. If not amazing restaurants abound. The Berkshires and Litchfield County are pure magic in the summer. Come enjoy... Guest Access Guests have access to everything except the basement and one upstairs bedroom. Two are available for use and each has a double bed. There is a laundry mat across the street. Interaction with Guests I will not have much if any interaction with guests unless they come at the very beginning. Someone local will be managing for me and be available to answer questions if needed. I want people to fall in love with the Berkshires so anything I can do to help facilitate that I will do. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is a regular neighborhood. Sweet neighbors, nice street. The property has a good tree line that fills in nicely during summer. Getting Around No public transportation. Must have car. Other Things to Note This house, location and price are awesome. And we want you to ENJOY and fall in love with the Berkshires...ask us anything you want to know about fun things to do and we will help you. Dates could be flexible and could be available for whole month........ + More

description: Description The Space Large loft with sectional, 42" TV, pool table. Has 2 bedrooms (queen, double) and a large sectional sofa that can sleep upwards of 3. There are 2 sinks (1 for each bedroom) and a shared shower/toilet. Generally speaking, it's a great place to hang out. With a kegerator, pool table, large ceilings, lots of art on walls, and xbox/N64 (with rock band and classics). It's above a restaurant/bar and the walls to the bedroom do not go all the way to the ceiling, so be prepared to use a white noise machine to rest peacefully. The bar closes at 1am on weekdays and 2am on Friday/Saturday. Two off street parking spaces in the back of the building. High speed wi-fi. Great for teams or just one person. There is a cat living in the apartment that will be there while you rent. One of the bedrooms is always kept cat free in case guests are allergic (Queen bed), and because of the hard wood floors there is not a large issue with allergies. There are nearby bus lines and Yale shuttle lines. 2 blocks to Yale and Yale-New Haven Hospital. 5 blocks to St. Raphael campus. + More
rules: House Rules You'll be renting a lived in apartment. You're expected to replace anything broken (normal wear and tear excepted). Apartment is located walking distance to train station (5-7min walk) and about 2 blocks walking to main street where it is filled with restaurants and shops. 2 supermarkets are located walking distance, absolutely the best location!! There is a beutiful working fireplace to enjoy for the winter season Apartment comes fully furnished and equipped with heat, air conditioning, cable TV and internet. Stay at one of the most beautiful towns in Connecticut and close to New York City. There is a lso a wonderful library, walking distance from the flat Apartment has capacity for 2 people. about: Our fully-furnished, 1000-square-foot, attached apartment makes sustainability comfortable. From the solar panels outside to the life-affirming wood interior, this apartment exudes positive energy. Relax and enjoy the architecturally unique features.
description: Description The Space Amazing views of the Quiet Corner of Connecticut await you. Come enjoy this retreat, fully equipped to "recharge your batteries" after your days of vacationing, researching, or conducting business. Being two miles from UConn and Storrs downtown, with easy access to public transportation, this location remains convenient while helping you feel that you've gotten away from it all. We hope you will love the natural feel of the wood as much as we do in our architecturally-unique home. Guest Access The apartment is equipped with its own modern kitchen, patio and deck areas, independent of the main house. The private, upstairs bathroom is right off the main bedroom and includes a tub and shower. The futon in the living room downstairs folds out into another queen-sized bed, accommodating additional guests. The half-bath downstairs is also private to our guests. The dining area takes in views from the south and west; the upstairs seating area looks south and east. High-speed wireless internet is available throughout the apartment. Interaction with Guests The apartment is attached to the main house, so we are only a text away should you need anything. There is a bulletin board in the apartment with brochures and menus from some of our favorite places to visit. Though this area is called the Quiet Corner, having UConn so close provides us with many culinary and cultural treats. The Neighborhood Located right next to the Spring Hill Historic District, our property is surrounded by the open space of UConn fields and Joshua Trust land. Walking along Route 195 is not recommended, but hiking along the Nipmuk Trail is! Our view rivals 50-foot, which is another vista along the Nipmuk trail, a short hike east from the house. We are two miles from downtown Storrs and the UConn campus to the north and Willimantic is not much further to the south. Storrs is located en route between Boston and New York City in the Quiet Corner of Connecticut. Getting Around Bicycle riding is pretty hilly around Mansfield, but the ride to UConn is gradual. The Willimantic to Storrs bus runs regularly and stops just a short walk away from the apartment. Two parking spaces on the property are available for free during your stay. Other Things to Note The apartment is a pet-free zone. Our dogs, Keepsie and Hawk, live in the main house and don't have access to the apartment interior or patio deck area. Sustainability reigns at the EcoHaven as the 27kW solar PV system provides the energy for the high-efficiency geothermal heating and cooling units. The apartment is equipped with energy-saving Nest thermostats and LED (warm) lighting. The house is oriented south, with few windows on the north side to maximize passive solar gain and keep the New England elements at bay. We encourage you to plug in your all-electric or plug-in hybrid vehicle to recharge its battery as you charge your own. + More
rules: House Rules We do not allow our guests to bring their pets with them to stay in the apartment. Smoking anywhere on the property is prohibited. We live in a residential area where families and students need their sleep. We want you to have fun and relax while you're here, but this is not a space for you to host a party that includes outside guests. Please keep conversations and music low after 11 pm. Thanks! + More

about: 2 bdr apt in private house. Owner on premise. 2 blocks from downtown, Yale campus, shops, restaurants. Fully equipped kitchen for preparing own meals. Free WiFi. Off-street parking available. Beautiful backyard with bbq grill for guest use.
description: Description The Space Located on Pearl Street in New Haven's desirable East Rock neighborhood, this two-bedroom rental apartment is fully furnished and fully equipped. It is conveniently located on the first floor of a private 2-unit home. The apartment is spacious and bright with ceiling fans in all rooms. The rooms have been decorated with modern, European-style furniture and artwork. Amenities include free WiFi internet access throughout the property; a washer and dryer in the basement; and a spacious, shaded garden with a sitting area and barbecue grill for outdoor cooking. It is an ideal rental for a couple, two roommates or a family with children. Pearl Street is ideally located only 2 blocks to Yale's School of Management (SOM) and campus; only 1 block to the Yale shuttle for easy transportation; and a short distance from neighborhood grocery stores, shops, restaurants, and downtown New Haven. Guest Access Private 2 bedroom apartment, backyard, off-street parking Interaction with Guests I live on the 2nd floor of the 2 family house and I am there to give suggestions for dining and area activities. The Neighborhood Welcome to New Haven, a very vibrant and beautiful city! There are many great places to live in or around New Haven, but East Rock is quite special because it is a very active and caring community and because it is within walking distance of grocery stores, restaurants, shops, a great park with hiking trails, and, of course, Yale campus and downtown. My house on Pearl Street is sandwiched between Orange Street to the east and Upper State Street to the west. Orange Street stretches from the New Haven downtown area in the south to the north with East Rock Park, a 10 mile network of hiking trails and a summit overlooking New Haven and the Long Island Sound. The weekly bike rides, organized by Elm City Cycling, are a great way to explore the area while making new friends. Although the East Rock part of Orange Street has mostly residential homes, it also has a good number of family-owned grocery stores, restaurants, coffee shops, and a neighborhood pharmacy and postal service. Just a block from Pearl Street is Cafe Romeo where one can sit on the outside patio to enjoy a cup of coffee and delicious home-baked muffins. Nica's Market is a wonderful grocery store and yet another favorite place for locals to meet for breakfast or lunch on the patio. Joe, the owner, always welcomes his customers with a big smile and makes sure they get the freshest produce. To the west of Pearl Street is Upper State Street, a historic district with mix of restaurants, bars, cafes, bakeries, boutiques, delicatessen, and a weekly farmers market. Just a couple of blocks away is Modern Apizza, my favorite place to order brick-oven pizza to take home. Besides Italian, you'll also find a number of other cuisines including Mexican, Chinese and Thai. Pearl Street is also part of the SoHu (South of Humphrey Street), a very active neighborhood with great residents, many of whom grew up here. The community spirit of East Rock, but in particular being part of SoHu, is what makes living here in New Haven so enjoyable and memorable. Getting Around Easy entry to I-95 and I-91 (only a couple blocks away) Public transportation on nearby State St., Orange St. and Whitney Ave Yale shuttle a block away on Orange St. 2 blocks from Yale's School of Management & Peabody Museum and easy walk to Yale campus and downtown locations + More

about: House, 2 Bedrooms + Loft + Den, 1 Bath, (Sleeps 6)
description: Description The Space This is a very unique property. It is a converted ice house (originally built in 1840s and converted in 1940s) complete with thick oak-paneled walls, fieldstone fireplace and lofts. It sits on an acre of wooded property and is very private. It is a short walk (3-5 mins) to the waterfront on the East Side of third bay of Highland Lake just down the road. The waterfront area is a peaceful little piece of forested land right on the water with a dock and swimming area. If you have a motorboat, you can tie it up safely at the dock. You can also launch our canoe or sailboat from there. It's the best of both worlds - you can swim and paddle all day but then unplug from the lakeside hubub, return to the woods in the evening and relax with the sound of crickets and toads. Guest Access The kitchen is fully stocked with everything you need to cook & enjoy your meals. There is a gas BBQ on the outdoor deck. Linens are not provided so be sure to pack sheets and towels. The Neighborhood It's SO CLOSE to NY but feels SO FAR! It's a great balance of access to water sports and access to pristine nature. I get such a sense of peace and enjoy the nature and the community when I'm there. Tanglewood nights are so fantastic. The bike path along the Farmington River is exquisite. The weather is always so great there - even when it's unbearably hot everywhere else. Other Things to Note During peak season (Memorial Day to Labor Day) the property is available for weekly rentals only. Check in at 3pm on Sunday and check out at 11am the following Sunday. 3 NIGHT BOOKING MINIMUM! + More

about: 2 Bedroom Suite in suburbs near beach, town center, working pottery studio and NYC. Private to guests: 1 queen; 1 double; 1 futon, full bath, living space, kitchenette; whole upstairs; entrance with digital locks. Walk to Fairfield University.
description: Description The Space The suite is the upstairs of our home and comes fully furnished and decorated. Space and amenities for your exclusive use include: full bathroom, sitting/living area, microwave oven, small refrigerator, Keurig coffee maker, toaster, clothes washer / dryer, iron / ironing board, hair dryer, DVD player, 3 CATVs (two in one bedroom and 1 in the other; 2 Apple TVs for movie access), wireless Internet access and USB charging plugs (with international combinations). In addition to being an easy train ride from NYC, an across-the-street walk to Fairfield University and a 5 mile drive to GE Headquarters, this space comes with access to a working pottery studio on the grounds (for visiting, playing or serious work). In combination, these features make for a truly unique listing for 2-6 people (possibly with a young child; "Pack N Play" also available). Guest Access In addition to 584 square feet of private space in the main room and 250 in the second bedroom, you'll enjoy shared access to the main dining area, a large, well-furnished kitchen and the living room of the home. Access to the pottery studio is by arrangement with the potter, but she loves to show off her space and welcomes people that want to explore, learn, play or even work seriously (for the latter, a studio fee may apply) at making things from clay! Interaction with Guests The space occupies the entire upstairs of our home and is large and private enough that if the guests want total privacy, they can have it and not feel cramped. On the other hand, we enjoy meeting people and want them to feel welcome in our home, so we'll interact as they wish. + More

about: Historic but thoughtfully renovated; while appreciating the 5 fireplaces & wide-board floors, you will also enjoy the deep soaking tubs in the floor heated bathrooms. Is in a beautiful garden-filled setting next to hiking trails. Gourmet breakfast.
description: Description The Space Henrietta Suite is a beautiful light-filled space with cathedral ceilings and exposed beams. It has its own brand-new bathroom with deep soaking tub, heated floor tiles, and skylight. If you stay in this room you will have a private entrance and your own balcony from which you can view our small farm and gardens. You can have your tea or coffee out there in the morning or a snack in the afternoon. Enjoy a late lie-in under the down comforter in the queen-size bed. Guest Access You can choose to read in the library downstairs or enjoy the fire in the living room in winter or the porch swing in the other months of the year. Breakfast will be served on the deck or in the dining room, whichever you prefer. Tea/coffee is available at all times. Enjoy the plants and animals in garden and on the farm and take a hike on the adjacent Byles trail. Interaction with Guests Jasmine and I will be happy to tell you about the attractions, food, performances, and other goodies in the area. We'd love to sit and talk with you about our individual adventures or leave you to yourselves if that is what you prefer. The Neighborhood Henrietta House is located in Ashford, CT, which just celebrated its 300th anniversary. We are located in the "Quiet Corner"/Last Green Valley of Connecticut, one we consider to be one of the most beautiful in the area. Many adventures await you here: hiking, biking, swimming, kayaking, horse-back riding among other nature loving activities. In addition, antiquing, gourmet dining, professional performances, sporting events, wine-tastings, as well as more down-home activities, such as local fairs, pick-your-own, and farmers' markets can be found within minutes of our house. One very bright spot on our event calendar is "Walktober." Please visit in October to take part in the many, many activities offered by the towns and villages throughout our region. Getting Around To really enjoy all that our area offers, a car is pretty necessary. However, hiking trails are adjacent to the house and biking can take you into other areas fairly close by to explore. We are on the B&B bike trail and also the Connecticut Historic Barn Trail. With advance notice and a few dollars, we might be able to pick you up from the bus, train station, or airport. Buses run from nearby Storrs to Hartford and from Hartford buses and trains are available to take you anywhere you desire. Other Things to Note We are just beginning to farm our property and have recently planted over 100 blueberry bushes, 50 strawberry plants, 4 fruit trees, and multiple herbs. We plant a big organic garden every year and will be adding more fruits and veggies this next year. We also plan to have animals so that we can grow most of the food we serve for our breakfasts and snacks. You are welcome to help out if you care to but get our permission before starting. + More
rules: House Rules We allow no smoking in the house or close to it and especially not in the barn. We love to have visitors and expect you to act courteously as we will act toward you--this includes quiet time between 10 pm and 8 am. + More

about: The perfect getaway. 1 1/2 hrs from the city, on a lake with stunning views and sunrises, 2200 acres of state forest with miles of trails. Fish, swim, mountain bike, kayak, canoe. Apartment has its own separate entrance for privacy. Come relax :))
description: Description The Space 1 1/2 hour from the city - a perfect retreat. The apartment is adjacent to a larger home with views of a 12 mile lake and stunning sunrises. We live on the lake. Stone steps lead to a private stone patio & dock. Take a kayak or the canoe out for a spin or just jump in the water on a warm day. We'll leave the paddles and life jackets inside the apartment for your use. This sunny and spacious apartment is adjacent to the main house. It is brand new with its own separate entrance and privacy. Walk out the door to 2200 acres of Paugusett State Forest with miles of hiking, trail running, birding, the foliage is sublime in the fall, snowshoeing, serenity. A bird watching haven, we have bald eagles, osprey, goshawks, swans, ducks, song birds galore... People come from all around to fish on lake Zoar. When you're on the property you are surrounded by water and forest. Looking down the lake, there are no homes in sight, they're all behind you on the approach to the driveway. You'll think you're all alone here. There is a queen size sleep sofa/pull out couch in the living room, so the apartment sleeps four. The whole house is for sale - check out William Raveis/Connie Widman. You may be asked to tidy up for an occasional showing. This is only if you've left a big mess. _: )) If you can help us out, we'll give you a $25 discount OR buy you a drink or appetizer at the Foundry. Text or call me from there during the showing. I'll speak to the server and make it happen. :)) (Check the guidebook I set up.) You won't have to leave for more than 1/2 hour - the apartment doesn't take long to look at. Because the house is for sale, please don't book more than 2 months in advance. Guest Access You will be able to use the entire apartment with its own separate parking and entrance. The main house is downhill towards the lake. There is a separate path that leads to the lake for Airbnb-ers. You will be able to use the dock, kayaks, canoe exclusively when we are not up from the city and share when we are there. Interaction with Guests We will be there some but not all of the time. My neighbor will be greeting you and keeping an eye on things when we're not home. Of course, I'll be available by text and email for any questions. The Neighborhood I am on a private road that backs into the state forest. When you arrive, you'll wonder where you are but once you find the gravel driveway with the stone pillar at the end, you'll understand that this is a one in a million place. Getting Around You'll need a car :)) Other Things to Note Buy your food on the way and settle in. I have set up the Guidebook so you know your way around but you'll probably never want to leave this gorgeous retreat. :)) I live on a private road so the only people who enter the forest at my end are people from the neighborhood. We have Eagles year round. If you want a better chance at spotting them, go to Shepaug Eagle Observation Station, it's right up the lake. Often, you'll see people pulled over on the side of the road on your way. Stop, pull over, look where they're looking - they've spotted an eagle. Take the back way in along the Pootatuck River. (Check the Guidebook for this listing.) + More
rules: House Rules No smoking, no parties, no pets please. + More

about: Sophisticated & whimsical. Built in 1890 spacious, cozy, exposed brick, wood beams, 5 skylites, stained glass, spiral staircase, big loft. Pretty. Romantic. Very Quiet. Sunny.
description: Description The Space Sophisticated & whimsical. Built in 1890 spacious, cozy, exposed brick, wood beams, 5 skylites, stained glass, spiral staircase, big loft. Pretty. Romantic. Very Quiet. Sunny. Perfect: solo or for a couple with baby Park in driveway. Use Yale shuttle. Close cafes/shops/bars. Sophisticated & whimsical. Perfect: solo or for a couple with baby Park in driveway. Use Yale shuttle. Close cafes/shops/bars. Turn of the century exposed brick Carriage House! Enjoy charming 2 stories. 1st floor =living room, 2 skylights,kitchen, dining area, bath with skylight,cathedral ceilings, hardwood floors. 2nd floor take a spiral staircase to the bricked loft, 2 skylights. Outdoors enjoy a private stone ivy patio. Set back from the road. Listen to the birds. Romantic, cozy, fun, private and casually elegant. Safe! Parking. Yale Shuttle, walk to Campus ( 10-15 min) TV, cable, wireless, full kitchen. You will like walking around. Charming,old houses. Good sidewalks. Walk to ice cream, dinner. But also can walk downtown (15-20) to College St. Guests control heat and air conditioning in each room, ceiling fans too. Rent: $150 night up to 2 people in the loft. $200 up to 4 people. (Extra 1st floor room, queen bed). Linens/towels (website hidden), full cable, 2 wifi choices, equipped kitchen. Keurig coffee. Linens & towels provided. Heat & Air conditioning controlled by the guest. PARKING : available in my driveway. Also on the Yale shuttle and downtown bus line. I can be present or disappear as needed. I am always reachable by phone or text. Sometimes, when I'm not traveling, I stay in a separate wing of the carriage house that does not cross paths with guests on any level. I use a separate entrance. Your complete privacy is assured. PLEASE FILL IN YOUR PROFILE with significant identifying information. It will help you have a speedier approval response. Suggestions include: -Where you live, work, go to school and approximate age, etc. -Your reasons for visiting New Haven. -Any references or ties to the area you are visiting. Remember most airbnb hosts are owners And you are asking to stay in our homes. and we cannot function like an impersonal hotel. Please take the time to hassle through the AIRBNB sign up process. Thank you, Nancy Orange ST and East Rock are fabulous to walk. Cute cafes every couple of blocks. State ST has great places to eat and drink. Love L'Orchio. Gourmet shops are nearby. You don't need a car. $7 cab to the train station. Walk downtown or hike in East Rock Park. 12 minute walk to Yale @ Grove and Prospect. Yale shuttle stops here. Train station 7$ fare. 10 min. Guests control the heat & air conditioning. Each room has its own thermostat. In the summer, the ceiling fans are great. A/C used up and downstairs. Shades drawn also keep it cooler. If you have a car please park close to the green garage door. rules: House Rules There are not rules per se ( except no smoking). I made an information list to help guests enjoy a quirky and fun place. LIGHT SWITCHES 1) Living room: under the clock, on the left wall as you come in the door. 2) Kitchen: under the counter by the stools 3) Loft: spiral staircase light by kitchen table in hall. KITCHEN bags under gold curtain. Please empty the garbage daily or make mice friends. 1) Microwave: hit start =30sec. Hit#1=1 min 2) Electric stove hits up very quickly! Don't walk away. Living room: Cable TV: ON/OFF use LEFT button circled. Takes a few seconds to see red light-lower right side. WIRELESS: NoirWireless security Wap2 phone number hidden) By chance if the Internet slows I would need to call Comcast. Do not suffer in silence. Please call me and I will fix it. KEY: only use the top lock! BATH 1) paper/cleaning supplies, under the sink 2) sockets can only take 1 plug use at a time. THERMOSTAT 1) each room has its own heating dial. 2) the main unit is in the hall to the bath. Instructions are on the wall (Also space heaters are in each room.) When you leave the house for the entire day please lower the heat to 65. It comes back on quickly. Thank you. TOWELS 1) THE BASKET BY THE BATHROOM DOOR. Keep the doors locked. Park close to the garage. Tickets on the street are 30$. (I hate that.) ODD STUFF Animals run across the roof. Please call if you have questions. + More

description: Description The Space Secluded lakefront home is perfect to get away and relax. Our custom built slate patio is ideal to barbeque and enjoy a day of lounging by the water. Plenty of boats and floats to enjoy the lake. Explore the lake via rowboat or kayak. Walking distance to miles of hiking trails. Guest Access Most of the house, kitchen, large family room with fireplace and large screen TV. Patios by the water and off the kitchen with gas and charcoal grills. Interaction with Guests Access to the entire house. We will be away most of the day, but are available if you have questions or need anything. The Neighborhood Private suburban area with lots of woods, parks and hiking trails. Getting Around We are available to pick guests up from local train station if they do not have a car. Prior booking is required and a $50.00 round trip charge. Other Things to Note Hiking trails are walking distance. + More

about: This peaceful, safe and private cottage is located in the village of Short Beach and overlooks tidal marshes and the Farm River. It's walking distance to the beach and hiking trails, yet just a seven mile drive to Yale and downtown New Haven.
description: Description The Space This fully renovated cottage features a full kitchen, high-end bedding, WiFi, basic cable and all the amenities one might want for a comfortable stay. It has central heat and a fireplace for cool evenings and window air-conditioning for those rare hot days. It's located at the end of a short lane and sits on a bluff overlooking tidal marshes and the Farm River where Osprey, egrets, kayaks and boaters play. It's also just a short walk to the local beach and hiking trailheads, while just a ten minute drive to Yale and New Haven or five minutes to the shops and restaurants surrounding the Branford green. Guest Access Guests have undisturbed access to the entire cottage and grounds, which (in season) include a large deck with gas grill, patio furniture, lovely gardens and spectacular views. The fully equipped kitchen includes a refrigerator, electric range and oven, microwave, coffeemaker, tea kettle, blender, plates, cookware and utensils. Interaction with Guests We are available for questions but otherwise allow our guests total privacy The Neighborhood Short Beach is a residential seaside village on Long Island Sound with its own Post Office and a single restaurant, located in the town of Branford and easily accessible by car to New Haven and Yale. The Farm River and Long Island Sound provide a rich habitat for birds and wildlife and offer opportunities for a wide array of outdoor activities or peaceful meditation. Two trail heads are within a short walk from the Guest Cottage. The views from the cottage are spectacular! (binoculars and bird guide books can be found in the study) Getting Around A car is recommended. Train service to New Haven with NYC and Boston connections is available from the Branford train station (with free parking!) + More
rules: House Rules The cottage is perfect for one or two people, and we allow up to three overnight guests. We ask our guests to limit social gatherings to no more than four people and be respectful of the peace. Check-in is at 3 pm and check-out is at 11 am. Early arrivals or departures require permission. + More

about: Note that the pricing is for 2 persons per night. June-Oct 15 $150, All other dates $130. Additional guests up to 4 are welcomed for an additional $50 per night. This is a two family home with two entirely separate apartments.
description: Description The Space Norfolk, Connecticut is central to Berkshire mountain hiking and cross-country skiing. This Victorian 2-family house is located a few blocks from Infinity Hall (see performance schedules online). In summer, Norfolk offers a private lake plus 3 nearby summer classical music festivals: Yale Summer Chamber Festival, Music Mountain and Tanglewood. The private apartment consists of 3 bedrooms with a kitchen, a simple backyard with picnic table and grill. Located in the village yet far away from the noise of the road, adjacent to beautiful trails, restaurants, antiques stores, AND a drop-dead gorgeous library - all within walking distance. There is no public transportation directly into the town. It is a quiet, safe, and highly enjoyable neighborhood with lots to offer. Guest Access This is a two family home with two entirely separate apartments. Guests have the 2nd floor. There are two separate entrances and no shared interior spaces between the apartments. The downstairs is occupied by one courteous, quiet, working person. Interaction with Guests The guests have the apartment to themselves. Booking for the entire space is the norm, and unchanged once booked. Getting Around There is no public transportation to and around Norfolk. Restaurants, the bank, post office, liquor store, antiques and craft shopping, and the library are within a block or two away. Trails too! + More
rules: House Rules Completely house trained dogs are allowed, a medium sized crate is available on premises. NO smoking indoors please and no cats. + More

about: A fully furnished, newly constructed 5 bedroom / 4 bathroom home complete with a beautiful kitchen, fireplace, deck, state-of-the-art home theater system and all the amenities of Woodridge Lake.
description: Description The Space Newly constructed 5 bedroom, 4 bathroom home in Woodridge Lake. Available for weekly, monthly and seasonal rental beginning July 1st. The fully furnished house has a beautiful kitchen, fireplace, deck, state-of-the-art home theater system. Cable TV, WiFi & telephone are included. You will have access to the Woodridge lake clubhouse, tennis courts, swimming pool and of course, the lake. Woodridge Lake is just 90 miles from New York City and there are many weekenders in the community. Guest Access Clubhouse, Pool, 8 Tennis Courts, Basketball court and the lake. Imagine a large, tree-lined lake in the spectacular Litchfield Hills that has been rated one of the cleanest bodies of water in the state, a lake so clear you can often see the bottom in five to ten feet of water -- with a five-mile shoreline, graced by sandy swimming beaches, lovely homes on generously portioned lots, all of it centered around a new and spacious clubhouse. Interaction with Guests Owner will not be present, but you can email or call with any questions. + More

about: The king size bed with antique fainting couch and spinning wheel, with a view of the village and the river .
description: Description The Space Overlooking the wild and scenic designated west branch of the Farmington River and less than a mile from Peoples State Forest, the area abounds with outdoor activities including excellent trout fishing, canoeing, hiking, cross-country skiing, biking, tubing, picnicking, and nature watching Guest Access The Old Riverton Inn boasts ten novel guest rooms, each complete with a private bath and cable television. We have a variety of room sizes and sleeping accommodation's to suit you and all your special guests. Interaction with Guests The innkeepers are available throughout your stay, there is an outgoing calls only phone in the room which can be used to call for any requests you may have of the innkeepers. The Neighborhood Nestled along the Farmington River, the town of Barkhamsted, and the village of Riverton within, has something to offer everyone. History, nature and outdoor activities abound. Riverton appears today just as it must have 100 years ago with its colonial houses, general store, churches, inns and trees lining the streets. The landmark factory, Hitchcock Chair Company Store, began manufacturing chairs here in 1826. By 1928, the elaborately stenciled chairs and cabinets made in Hitchcocksville, now called Riverton, became famous throughout America. Stroll through our little village by the river with its collection of shops, and restaurants. Getting Around on site parking + More

description: Description The Space Historic, lovely, renovated 125-year-old home in historic area. Sleeps 6, 2 bedrooms. No carpets or clutter.Two queen beds and 2 singles. One bathroom with a large shower stall. Kitchenette with small frig, microwave, toaster, electric kettle, slow-cooker (like a Crock Pot), but no stove or oven, and laundry facilities. Remote and spectacular hiking and biking are close by. We are in the southern Berkshire Hills with beautiful, quiet back roads. Stunning New England scenery. We are a short drive toButternut Ski area,Mohawk Ski area, 40 min. from Tanglewood and Stockbridge, and 30 min. from Great Barrington, MA. Easy 5 min. stroll to Infinity Music Hall. Guest Access 2 bedrooms (2 queens and 2 singles), 1 private bathroom and large shower and key for locking, washer/drier, 1 t.v. in one of the bedrooms, a small kitchenette with sink/toaster/microwave/French press coffee pot, electric kettle, slow-cooker, small refrigerator. No oven or stove available. Interaction with Guests Very little. We respect your privacy and want you to feel that the apartment is totally yours. We may bump into each other as we come and go, but may not. The Neighborhood It is really quiet! There are only a few houses on the street. Sidewalks for safe and enjoyable strolling. Really beautiful area. Getting Around A car is a must. Very rural area. You may park in our driveway and walk to the front of the house to enter through the front porch. Other Things to Note The southern Berkshire Hills have a lot to offer, from shopping in Great Barrington, exploring countless miles of hiking trails available everywhere, or catching a concert at the gorgeous and historic Infinity Hall in Norfolk, CT. Past and present performers there include Taj Mahal, Roseanne Cash and Buckwheat Zydeco, to name just a few. Check out their schedule online! w(URL HIDDEN) The Salisbury ski jumping event is only a short drive away, as are both the Salisbury School and Hotchkiss School. There is much to do in the Berkshire Hills! + More
rules: House Rules Guests can come and go at any hour of the day they choose. There are no keys or locks for the bedrooms, but there is a skeleton key that will lock the bathroom door. We live on the first floor of this house. We welcome children and students. + More

about: WELCOME TO OUR GUEST HOUSE.
description: Description The Space IT IS THAT TIME OF YEAR--HAPPY HOLIDAYS!! We are offering a discounted rate of $150/night for the entire month of December with a 2 night minimum so book now to experience a slice of heaven for a weekend getaway or a place to stay over the holidays. We have had beautiful weather during the days and coolish nights. We will be closed for the months of January, February, and March but plan ahead and book for next summer. We fill up fast. The guest house is in a private setting surrounded by stunning stone walls and next to a vernal pond. Birds sing; frogs croak; owls hoot. Walking distance to a shell beach and the beautiful CT coastline. Very close to picturesque Stony Creek and Guilford--historic towns in Connecticut. Great restaurants; and hiking. Gorgeous oceanside Hammonasset State Park in neighboring Madison, CT--and nature preserve. This guest house is just a few years old and beautifully sited and designed by STUDIOATE; an architectural firm formed by two Yale Architecture graduates. Perfect for a couple or up to 4 people. The guest house has a private bedroom with a King size tempeurpedic bed; high ceilings; Modern Bath with beautiful fixtures and shower; large glass windows and doors. We also provide a pull out sofa with full bedding in the front room that overlooks the pond that will accommodate 2 adults or children for an additional $25 per person. A gorgeous Front Deck overlooks a frog pond. NOTE: There is no additional fee if you have young children that do not require an extra bed setup. The guest house is equipped with AC/Heat; full bedding; towels; a kitchenette that includes a refrigerator; sink, french press with delicious coffee; hot water pot; microwave; cups, glasses, plates and bowls. (There are no cooking facilities in the guest house.) Also Wifi is provided. Short distance to Westwood hiking trails (Land Conservation Trust), shell beach; historic coastline of ct; great restaurants, great shops, antique stores, and museums. Neighborhood is friendly and quiet at night. Easy access from I95. Parking is included. Guest Access The guest house is located at the back of a 3 acre property with its own driveway and parking. Guests have access to a beautiful setting overlooking a vernal pond and very private with stone walls that surround the guest house. Interaction with Guests We will greet our guests and hand off the key. We are always available for any questions and/or assistance with information, but we leave our guests to enjoy the beautiful private setting of the guest house to themselves. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is beautifully layed out with houses typically on 1-4 acre lots. Very quiet at night and directly off a scenic road that winds through the shores of Connecticut. 1/2 mile from the coastline and beautiful bird watching. Egrets; osprey; blue herons; kingfishers, etc. Getting Around A car is highly recommended since we are not close to public transportation. We are located near the shoreline of Connecticut directly off a beautiful scenic road. The closest town, Guilford, is located approx 2-3 miles away where you will find great restaurants, shops, a new french bakery, and the town green. Other Things to Note You are welcome to bring your bikes; running shoes; and for the warmer months--kayaks; canoes. There are great hiking/running trails close by, challenging biking; and great beaches not too far to launch your boat and/or take a quick swim. + More

description: Description The Space "Meadow Cottage" is tucked back in its own private pastoral setting and is ideally situated between the towns of Kent and New Milford, with easy access to all local attractions. The cottage is beautifully furnished with a mixture of antiques and vintage pieces. There is a spacious 2-story living room, a large upper level loft bedroom and a fully equipped kitchen and dining area leading to an ultra private 19' x 10' deck. There is also a small fenced-in yard area - perfect for a small to medium-sized pet. It is 10 minutes each to the town of Kent and Metro North's Harlem Valley/Wingdale train station. Just five minutes to the Appalacian Trail and other hiking areas. Plenty of nearby skiing, fishing, dining and antiquing. Located less than an hour from the Berkshires and less than 90 minutes to Manhattan. Guest Access Full kitchen, washer/dryer, private deck with farm views. Plenty of off-street parking. Interaction with Guests We welcome guests and will stock food items for an additional charge. The Neighborhood Quintessential New England town and vistas. about: This small (700 square feet) cottage is a perfect four season retreat, located directly on Squantz "Pond", a 2 mile by one half mile natural lake, part of Candlewood Lake. The Cottage overlooks the lake and Pootatuck State Forest on the western side.
description: Description The Space Enjoy swimming, canoeing, and fishing on the property on Squantz Pond in summer. There are great hikes across the lake and beautiful foliage in the fall. In the winter, enjoy sledding, ice skating, and cross country skiing. The cottage consists of a small kitchen area, a living room. a completely new enclosed porch, and two small bedrooms, one with a full size bed and the other with two toddler beds. The porch and a large stone terrace provides memorable views and are ideal locations for lunch or dinner. The entire house was renovated in 2009 with new plumbing and electrical systems, new kitchen, new bathroom and shower and new hardwood floors. The heat is forced air and is quite effective. There is also a Weber gas grill on the back terrace. In 2015 we completed a renovation. The rear enclosed porch measures 20 by 10 and has many windows offering fantastic views of the lake. Ideal for a single individual, a couple, or a family with small kids... PLEASE NOTE THERE IS ONE FULL SIZE BED IN THE HOUSE. THE OTHER TWO BEDS ARE TODDLER BEDS--ONLY LARGE ENOUGH FOR CHILDREN 6 YEARS OF AGE AND YOUNGER . Guest Access Everything except the Sunfish sailboat. Interaction with Guests We try to be available at all times by phone, email or text. Getting Around This home is accessible only by car. There are Metro-North stops nearby in Danbury, Patterson, Southeast and Brewster. + More

about: Rent April-October, a furnished 4 room cottage on 2 wooded acres with 200 foot frontage on the Housatonic River by the trophy stocked trout fishing area, in Sharon, Ct. Canoe/raft rentals available nearby. Hike at Appalachian Trail, waterfalls, dam.
description: Description The Space Have your own private access to 200 feet of prime trout stocked river. See an occasional deer at dawn or blue heron fishing in the river. Enjoy the outdoors. Watch people in canoes and/or rafts float down the river...or join them for the ~10+ mile trip with canoes/rafts and pick up available. Guest Access Bedroom, kitchen and living room totally available for your use. The side porch is used for storage, but does have another bed set up if needed. Interaction with Guests Property manager lives next door to help if needed. The Neighborhood The cabin is on a tree lined dead end road with most neighborhood homes only secondary tranquil retreat places. Getting Around The location is rural yet only about a mile from West Cornwall, a quaint village with its one lane covered bridge, post office, restaurant and a few shops. Canaan is about 16 miles away, Torrington about 20. Other Things to Note A filtration and uv system insures high quality well water. + More
rules: House Rules As anywhere, courtesy to neighbors is a must. No excessive noise late at night. + More

description: Description The Space This is a lovely home close to Yale and other colleges are nearby. Perfect for incoming family weekends, celebrations and happenings in the area. Please note when booking popular weekends/holidays may have a 2 night minimum stay. Special requests welcomed. 15% CT Occupancy Tax is included in all reservation pricing. (URL HIDDEN) Close by to New Haven link: (URL HIDDEN) Guest Access You will have access to all common areas. There are three bedrooms, the master bedroom and two bedrooms with twin beds. Private bathrooms. Upstairs and downstairs suites are private areas. Interaction with Guests There is a caretaker that lives on the property who watches and cares for the property. If you need assistance you may contact me direct and he will assist you. The Neighborhood Hospitals: 1. Yale-New Haven Children's Hospital; 4 miles 1 Park St; ((PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). VA Connecticut Healthcare System, West Haven Campus; 4.4 miles Veterans Hospital 950 Campbell Ave; ((PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Other Things to Note Please bring your necessary toiletries and any cooking needs as that is not provided. We do request that guests comply with electronically signing a guest contract for your stay outlining some fairly simple rules and requests. PLEASE SEE HOUSE RULES BELOW If you agree kindly acknowledge by messaging through AirBnB, you may cut and paste the contract from the House Rule section. Kindly list all names who will be staying and agree to the stated rules and expectations listed within the Guest Contract under House Rules. Your electronic signature to the contract will be legal and binding. + More
rules: House Rules Guest Contract Dear Guest, Thank you for choosing our home for your vacation. We hope that you have a pleasant stay. The property is located at: 5 Prospect Court, Hamden, CT. 06517 Your confirmation is as follows: Check in/out ____________dates as per agreement on AirBnB *Check-in time: 2 pm (No early check-in please) *Check-out time: 11 am (No late stays please) Rental rate and fees are as follows: as agreed upon on AirBnB, 15% CT occupancy tax is included in the reservation pricing. By responding via AirBnB messaging it will serve as your electronic agreement to this Guest Contract Thanks, and have a great stay! SHORT TERM RENTAL AGREEMENT This Short Term Rental Agreement (the Agreement") is made by and between __David Nyberg________ (Homeowner") and ______ AirBnB Guest ______ (Guest") as of the date last set forth within the reservation made through AirBnB. For good and valuable consideration, the sufficiency of which is acknowledged, the parties hereby agree as follows: (website hidden). The property is located at: ____________________5 Prospect Court, Hamden, CT___________________________ 2. NO pets 3. Maximum Occupancy: The maximum number of guests is limited to not more than 2 persons per bedroom. An additional charge or $75 per person per night for guests in addition will be assessed and MUST be agreed to prior to booking. 4. Term of the Lease. The lease begins at __2___ p.m. on the Check-in Date" and ends at __11___ a.m. on the Checkout Date." 5. Minimum Stay: This property requires a 1 night minimum stay. Longer minimum stays may be required during holiday/special event periods. 6. House is NOT child proofed. 7. Rental Rules: 1. No smoking in the house or around house property. 2. All trash to be placed in proper containers. 3. Please do not leave any food in the refrigerator, please take all your items with you or dispose of them properly. 4. You have access to all common areas; please refrain from accessing the master bedroom unless prior permission has been authorized. 5. Please place all towels and bed linens in the bathroom upon checkout. 6. No extra guests or overnight guests are allowed unless prior it has been agreed upon with landlord; if so, the additional charge of $75 per person will take effect. 8. Access: Guest shall allow Caretaker/Homeowner access to the property for purposes of repair and inspection. Homeowner shall exercise this right of access in a reasonable manner. 9. Rental Rate and Fees: As agreed upon on AirBnB 10. Cancellation Policy: If Guest wishes to cancel his/her reservation, the deposit will be refunded as follows: _50_ % if cancelled _5_ business days prior to the Check-in Date _0_ % if cancelled under _24_ hours prior to the Check-in Date ________________________________________________Electronic signature + More
