about: I love the peaceful quiet setting, yet central to everything! Close to Train, highway,colleges,outlets, entertainment, and art venues. The house has amazing sunrises and sunsets. Amazing views from decks. Beach rights.House is uncluttered and clean.
description: Description The Space There is a large living and dining area and deck that overlooks the marsh, Hammock river, and Long Island sound. House has 360 views. Kitchen and office downstairs. Two large bedrooms upstairs. Owner will give full bath to guest. Central air, High quality linens and furnishings. original art Guest Access All access except office and owner bedroom. On occasion owner will allow both upstairs bedrooms to be rented for additional charge . Use of fully equipped Kitchen Interaction with Guests I will be available in my downstairs office or art studio, but generally unobtrusive . However, every late afternoon I have my "porch time" and love to sit and relax on the deck with beverages and snacks, and good company to talk to The Neighborhood Neighborhood is great for walking, biking , fishing, crabbing, and kayaking. There are Osprey nests nearby in the Vast Marshes in the neighborhood, and a local birdwatching club. Two large state parks Hammonassett, and Chatfield Hollow offer miles of beach, and hiking. Getting Around I am willing to pick traveler's up at the train station if it fits my schedule. Metro north is five minutes away, Amtrak fifteen. there is Taxi , and buses into New Haven, Ct Other Things to Note I have no pets, the house is low allergen, and passive green. Mattresses are extra firm and off excellent quality. There is a selection of pillows to choose from. + More
rules: House Rules It is a quiet neighborhood, I respect my neighbors by requesting a low noise policy. No fireworks or glass are allowed on our private beach. about: This home was built in 1785 and has many rooms, much character and a beautiful property to explore! Come visit us in Northern Connecticut!
description: Description The Space Large private restored Connecticut historic home. Built in 1785, this home boasts five fireplaces, wide board floors, original fixtures and lots of room. Enjoy the convenience of being close to Hartford, Springfield and Boston. Explore the area and come home to a comfortable spot! Guest Access The bedrooms are on the second floor. There are two bedrooms with Queen beds and two bedrooms with twin beds. You have a full bathroom upstairs, with a claw foot tub and shower, across from the bedrooms. Access to a modern kitchen, tv room, laundry room, half bath, dining room and sitting areas. There is a seasonal porch and a large yard with rare trees, flowers and an antique barn full of treasures to discover. Interaction with Guests The Property Manager will be on site, in a separate guest apartment attached to the barn. You have complete privacy in the entire house! The Neighborhood We are located near grocery stores, golf courses, six flags, state parks, major cities and much more. The immediate neighborhood is residential, with farms mixed in. We have about 200 acres of privately owned land behind the house. This provides lots of wildlife, rare trees and fishing opportunities. Getting Around The Bus Route is a few miles away. People usually drive. If you need suggestions on car rentals, taxi service or private drivers let us know! Other Things to Note Clean sheets and towels provided. Shampoo and toiletries also available upon request. Smoking in designated areas only. + More
rules: House Rules Please leave the place the way you found it. Noise level after 11:00 should be minimal. Respect privacy of others on the property. Property Manager is usually on site at all times. + More

about: Clean, cozy and relaxing house in the heart of downtown Bethel. Tastefully furnished and set up for your comfort and relaxation.
description: Description The Space The house is built in 1910 and has plenty of character and charm. There are two bedrooms, one master with the worlds most comfortable king size bed and an adjacent guest room with an equally impressive queen bed. The kitchen is fully equipped for your cooking needs. There is a comfy living room area with fireplace, tv and large seating area. The house comes equipped with two furry cat friends to enjoy during your stay. They are clean, friendly and well behaved and we ask only that you do us the small favor of feeding them! Guest Access The house, basement with laundry facilities, garage. Interaction with Guests Rarely The Neighborhood The great thing about this house is that you can relax in and around the house or you can easily walk downtown. Within five minutes you can be enjoying an omelette at Oneils, drinking a beer at Greenwood Tavern or enjoying a rooftop dinner at La Zingara. Getting Around Easy walk to town Driving distance to many nearby attractions for hiking, apple picking, shopping and more! Other Things to Note This listing is only for those who are okay with taking care of two loving cats during their stay. + More
rules: House Rules The neighborhood is quiet and we ask that you respect this. No loud parties or noise late at night. Please treat the house and cats with respect as if they were your own. Please no smoking inside the house. We do not allow other pets. + More

about: I hope you like to eat, because, I like to cook. Or, if you prefer, I can direct you to the best restaurants around. The room is comfortable with good storage, WiFi, cable TV, well lit, with a QUEEN sized bed. You're welcome to breakfast and dinner.
description: Description The Space Comfort and Convenience you can afford! Located on the Greenwich / Stamford border, close to I-95, minutes from downtown Stamford & Greenwich Business Districts, Metro North Railway to New York or Boston. Enjoy our Italian "Family Style" hospitality (with fine hotel cleanliness you will love). Guest Access Kitchen, Bathroom, Patio, Yard are all shared space. Interaction with Guests Guest will generally see me in the Kitchen, the yard, or online (looking up new recipes). I can formulate meal plans around a guests diet, so as to really help the guest feel at home. I am here almost all the time, I keep the place clean and strive for my guests to eat and sleep well every night. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is nice, we have 2 grocery stores, Carvel, Subway, Dunkin Donuts, NYSC, and Dry Cleaners just down the street (5 minute walk). We are a 4 minute drive (15 minute walk) to the Metro North Station of Old Greenwich, CT. The street is quiet and mainly full of Long Term residents of Italian decent. Getting Around I prefer walking, to the local shops, unless heading Downtown Stamford (which I would recommend an Uber car for). Other Things to Note Plenty of room in Closet to hang garments. Plenty of storage in drawers to keep clothes. + More

about: I hope you like to eat, because, I like to cook. The room is spacious, has good storage, WiFi, cable TV, well lit, with a comfortable Queen sized bed. You're welcome to breakfast and family style dinner.
description: Description The Space AFFORDABLE + COMFORTABLE way to stay in Lower Farifield County. I know from my own travels that it's one thing to find a decent place to stay (for a decent price) but it's an entirely different animal paying for food when traveling. When I chose to list my space on AirB&B, I thought of what I liked most about hotels and what I miss most when traveling. I love the cleanliness of a great hotel, but I hate trying to find food (reasonably priced and good) in a foreign place. I chose to include a meal service plan with your stay!! Now I am no world renown chef, but I know my way around the kitchen and can cook some great Italian food. So the long and short of it is, bring your clothes, your laptop, and your appetite ! See You Soon ! Guest Access Kitchen, Bathroom, Patio, Yard are all shared space. Interaction with Guests Guest will generally see me in the Kitchen, the yard, or online (looking up new recipes). I can formulate meal plans around a guests diet, so as to really help the guest feel at home. I am here almost all the time, I keep the place clean and strive for my guests to eat and sleep well every night. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is nice, we have 2 grocery stores, Carvel, Subway, Dunkin Donuts, NYSC, and Dry Cleaners just down the street (5 minute walk). We are a 4 minute drive (15 minute walk) to the Metro North Station of Old Greenwich, CT. The street is quiet and mainly full of Long Term residents of Italian decent. Getting Around I prefer walking, to the local shops, unless heading Downtown Stamford (which I would recommend an Uber car for). Other Things to Note Perfect for someone new to town, in transition, visiting, whatever. Very clean house, good food, great location. Contact me with any questions. + More

description: Description The Space THE APARTMENT: Fully furnished garage apartment , separate from owner's house. Full bath with a tiled stall shower. Kitchenette with sink, under-counter fridge, one burner induction cooktop, Breville smart oven (basically a large & fancy toaster oven), and a microwave. There is a small chest freezer in the garage for your use. There is no full size range/cooktop/oven. Silverware, plates, glasses, etc. are all provided. There is one large combination bedroom/dining area/living area with a queen size bed and a pull out couch. Radiant heat with window air conditioner & ceiling fan during the summer. There is access to both hardwired and wireless internet, and basic cable on a 32" Sony TV and a DVD player. Phone needs to be your cell phone, although land line can be available in an emergency. ** Sleeps 4: here's how. 2 in Queen bed, 2 in pull out couch ** No pets , please. Garage space available for bikes and/or skis. Owner does not use the garage for vehicles, but owner does need access so the garage door may be opening and closing. We will be considerate about time of day for access. The only real downside is that there is no deck or terrace attached to this apartment, although there is lawn space. Of course if we get along, there could be an invitation to use our outdoor spaces. **NOTE THAT WE ARE IN THE COUNTRY, A MILE FROM ANY TOWN. A CAR IS A NECESSITY** ACCESS: 2 hour drive from NY and 2 1/2 hrs from Boston. Twenty minutes from Metro North Wassaic train station from NYC Train (URL HIDDEN) Taximan (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) ACTIVITIES: 5 minutes from Lake Wononscopomuc, one of Connecticut's premier deep water lakes with swimming and boating. 10 minutes from the Appalachian Trail. 30 minutes from Catamount Ski Area. 45 minutes from SkiButternut. 45 minutes from Tanglewood Music. 30 minutes from Norfolk's Infinity Music Hall. If you hit it right there are the US Eastern Ski Jumping Championships in nearby Salisbury every February. 5 minutes up the road takes you to hiking or snowshoeing by our local reservoir. THE AREA: Lakeville is home to The Hotchkiss School and The Salisbury School, two top preparatory schools. Also nearby is The Lime Rock Park, Road Racing Center of the East. There are many fine restaurants in the area, multiple art galleries, and the Scoville Memorial Library, the oldest publicly funded library in the country. As well as local galleries and shops, a 10 minute drive takes you to Millerton, NY with a movie theater, art galleries, bookstore, an old fashioned diner (with updated menu) and the Rail Trail for walking and biking. A 30 minute drive takes you to Great Barrington , MA for even more shops, restaurants and movie theater. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking, No pets Check in and check out times may be flexible. Check with us in the week prior to your stay if you would like to arrive earlier or depart later. Please respect our neighbors and do not make loud noises after sunset or before sunrise. This house is in the country which means you will see animals like chipmunks, mice, foxes and maybe even bears. If this bothers you, this may not be an appropriate place for you to stay. Cleaning fee ($25).You are expected to leave the apartment the way you found it, that is reasonably tidy, dishes washed, food removed, floors swept and garbage emptied. Dirty sheets and towels should be placed in a pile. Thank you for your consideration. + More

about: Newly-renovated, sun-filled room on the third floor of a historic home, located on the CT/NY border.
description: Description The Space There's a beautiful brass queen-sized bed in this sun-filled newly renovated room. The third floor has a bathroom with a brand new stall shower and an old claw foot tub. Guest Access Guests have access to the downstairs common rooms - kitchen, family room with television and living room. They can also enjoy the front porch, back patio and the arbor in the backyard. Interaction with Guests If we're home, we'll be happy to meet you and have a chat and, perhaps, a glass of wine. If we're not, there will be a friendly house/dog-sitter and substitute innkeeper, who will be happy to make your acquaintance. The Neighborhood We live on the Port Chester/Greenwich border, a short drive from downtown Port Chester, an old mill-town that has become a destination for interesting restaurants and bars. Getting Around We are a little over a mile from the Metro North New Haven Line station, which runs trains to downtown Greenwich, Stamford, and, of course, NYC. There are cabs you can call to get there or to Westchester County airport, three miles away. Other Things to Note Our dog, Samson, loves company. + More
rules: House Rules You are welcome to treat this house as your own. The top shelf of the refrigerator is full of breakfast foods for you. Please don't smoke in this house or light candles in your room. + More

description: Description The Space There are no other locations within such close proximity. Spacious three bedrooms on a first floor and two bedrooms on a top floor with beautiful sunrises and view of the southern part of Hartford and Ct river. Friendly family neighborhood. Guest Access Park. Walking distance ( one block) to Trinity College. Great local restaurants and Cinestudio. T.V and wireless internet. Interaction with Guests As much as they require, we are just a text or phone call away. The Neighborhood Three bedroom apartment with three full size comfortable beds and a futon. Two bedroom apartment as well. A block away from Trinity College. Very clean and spacious. It's a short distance away from some of our favorite restaurants, including a pizza place, Peruvian and European cuisine. Stop and Shop is a five minute drive away. There are three parks less than a mile away. One park across the street with a playscape and newly built state of the art baseball field. Getting Around The bus line is located a block away on New Britain Ave. A private driveway is also available. Other Things to Note Children and pet allowed + More

about: Welcome to the Cute Cape: you're home away from home! Our 3 bed/2 bath home sleeps up to 8, and is located close to everything. Walk to West Hartford Center, Blue Back square, and the Park Road Business district and very quick access to highway 84 for everything.
description: Description The Space Bedroom 1: spacious first floor bedroom with 1 full sized temperpedic bed and desk/vanity. Bedroom 2: first floor 4 season sunroom space with 2 twin sized beds (also can be arranged as a king). The Yellow Bathroom: First floor 3 piece bathroom (tub/shower combo) shared between Bedroom 1 and Bedroom 2. Bedroom 3: Cozy second floor bedroom with 1 queen sized bed. Bedroom 4: Typically our office space, can be outfitted with an air mattress for 2 additional guests. Green bathroom: Upstairs 3 piece bathroom (stall shower) shared between Bedroom 3 and Bedroom 4. Guest Access During your stay, guests have access to the entire property including... Kitchen: well appointed kitchen with all major appliances, cooking utensils, and espresso machine. Note: no microwave. Backyard: featuring a relaxing hammock (in the warm season), propane grill, and yard games. Living room: cozy living space with large sofa, wood burning fireplace, and large flatscreen television. Note: no cable. HD antenna gets local stations, and iphone/ipod/ipad cord allows screen to mirror video. Dining room: seating for 6. extra chairs can be added to seat up to 8. The Neighborhood West Hartford, CT is a fantastic neighborhood to stay to enjoy all the New England has to offer. From our house you can walk to: -Park Road Business district: Hall's Market, Quaker Diner, 3 Sisters Antiques, J. Rene Coffee Roasters and Cafe, Park Tavern, Plan B burger bar, Thai, pho, wings, pizza -West Hartford Center (~1/2 mile): a picturesque few blocks of brick sidewalks with tons of restaurants, bars, boutiques, etc -Blueback square (~1/2 mile): REI, movie theatre, more restaurants, Crate and Barrel, Cheesecake Factory, Whole Foods, lots more! -Trout Brook walking/biking trail: paved trail that takes you to Blueback square. The greater Hartford Area boasts many attractions that include: -the Mark Twain house -the Harriet Beacher Stowe center -XL center -several local breweries Easy Day trips are limitless, but include: -CT coast (40-50 minutes): Many adorable New England costal towns such as Mystic and Old Saybrook. Beaches here are on Long Island Sound, so waves are minimal. -RI coast (50 minutes): Westerly and other famous New England beach towns are an easy day trip. These beaches are open to the ocean, so the water can be rough. -Boston (1.5 hr) -New York City (2 hr, no tolls!): parkway 15 runs strait into Manhattan, rarely has traffic, and there are no tolls! -Vermont: Reach the natural beauty of southern vermont in 1.5 hr and the Canadian boarder in 4 (not really a day trip). Getting Around -The closest airport is BDL (Hartford Bradley) and is about 20 minutes north towards Springfield, MA. There is no shuttle, or public transportation into Hartford that I know of. -Rental Cars are inexpensive from the airport and several locations around Hartford. There is an Enterprise ~1/2 mile from our house on Park Road. -City Buses: There is a bus stop at the end of our street and goes directly to downtown Hartford. Trip time is around 30 minutes. -Amtrak: Union Station in downtown Hartford is about an 8 minute drive. Several trains pass through on their way to New Haven (1 hr), New York (2 hr), Vermont (depends), etc. -Uber is now available in the Hartford area! Fares are low, $4-$20 just about anywhere in the Hartford area. Other Things to Note As this is our full time residence. Please adhere to house rules and be respectful of our home. Due to allergies, no cats permitted, well behaved dogs considered with advanced notice. + More
rules: House Rules -Absolutely no smoking in the house. Smoking is OK in the back yard as long as respectful disposal of butts is practiced. -Due to allergies, no cats permitted, well behaved dogs considered with advanced notice. -Because this is our full time home, you will notice some "installation art" representing evidence of our residence in the space. Most closets and drawers will contain personal items such as clothes, food, and beverages. We do our best to make the room for guests to temporarily occupy the space, so please be respectful of the "art" around you. + More

description: Description The Space 1 bedroom apartment in the historic town of Guilford. The place is equipped with a full kitchen, dining area, living room with TV, full bathroom, and a queen-sized bed. The futon in the living room can be pulled out to accommodate one more. The apartment is attached to a larger house, but has its own entrance. Parking is available in the driveway. A private pool is open for your enjoyment during the summer months, and the hot tub can be used year-round. If you enjoy hiking, there are marked trails behind the property. - 20 minute drive to New Haven via I-95 - 10 minute drive to the Guilford Town Green - 15 minute drive to Jacob's Beach and the town marina Guest Access Guests will have access to a private apartment with central air conditioning/heat, a full kitchen(electric stove, microwave, fridge, Keurig coffee/tea maker, electric coffee pot, French Press coffee pot), dining area, living room with TV(cable & wifi)and piano, full bathroom, and a queen-sized bed. A futon in the living room can be pulled out to accommodate one more. The apartment is attached to a larger house, but has its own entrance. Washer/dryer facilities, iron and ironing board, off-street parking, hiking trails, a private pool during the summer months, hot tub and outdoor BBQ year-round. Interaction with Guests Guess can interact with us as often as necessary via text, calling, or just knocking on our door. Getting Around Public transportation is not immediately assessable. The apartment backs up to GUILFORD land trust and is easily assessable by car. + More
rules: House Rules Please set up a time with me to check in so I can make sure your arrival is as smooth as possible. If you would like to use the pool or hot tub, let me know so they are available and ready for use. We have a dog and a cat in the house, but they will not be in the apartment during your stay. You can find coffee and tea in the cabinet above the Keurig machine and water heater. You may also use the outdoor grill, accessible from the sliding door. Please double-check that the gas is off after use. We expect all messes to be cleaned up by the guest. Cleaning supplies for spills/messes can be found under the sink in the kitchen, and rags next to the oven. Leave used towels and rags on the top of the washing machine or on the counter next to the refrigerator. Place used dishes in the dishwasher. + More

about: My cozy, secluded and very private guesthouse is where people feel replenished. A very special, quiet & beautiful energy fills the space. Best for a couple but a few kids can share the futon if you don't mind sleeping in one room. A true getaway.
description: Description The Space We are totally secluded and private. Most people have no idea the guesthouse space even exists! Guest Access In the summer guests may have access to the pool Interaction with Guests I like to give all the privacy you need. We like to have bonfires at night and BBQ, drink wine or beer on the porch and will always invite our guests to join. I am available all the time for ANY questions/concerns. I rely on you to make contact once you are -- for I do not want to disturb you. The Neighborhood Newtown and the surrounding area is just beautiful countryside. Lots of walking/hiking and parks. Great drives. Getting Around No public transportation. You will definitely need a car. However I am happy to bring you to the train if you want to day trip to New York City. Other Things to Note 1-There is no TV in the guesthouse. We don't even have one in our home. We have to store things there in the winter so it may appear as a "less than beautiful" approach to the guesthouse door. It's definitely not "Sanford & Sons" though. Just FYI... + More

about: Whether you are house hunting, leaf peeping, antiquing, discovering vineyards, visting family or friends, or simply want to get away for a few days, we would be happy to host you in our neck of the woods. We are less than 90 minutes from NYC.
description: Description The Space The original part of this house was built as a hunting lodge by two master craftsmen from Poland (pretty much by hand) in the late 1980s. The subsequent owner put on an addition for his mother-in-law - which became the main Guest Room when we moved in a few years ago. Guest Access The primary Guest Room is located on the main level of the house, but is separated from the living space by two doors. It has a Queen Bed with a Tempurpedic Mattress on a remotely controlled adjustable base, an A/C unit and overhead fan. The ensuite bathroom has a shower, a whirlpool tub, and a bidet. We have a second bedroom upstairs which sleeps one person. The bed in that room also has a Tempurpedic Mattress on an adjustable base. This room is best suited for a child or young adult. Should you need more space, there is an additional bedroom (with bunk beds) that we can put at your disposal - so feel free to ask. If we can accommodate you, we will. If you would like to use the Sauna or the Pool, you are welcome to do so as long as we are home. The Wood Stove will only be on if we are in the house. You can sit outside on the flagstone patio any time you wish - and on a nice night, if we are home, we can put some wood in the Chiminaea. If you have younger children, they are welcome to use the swing set. If the weather is not as cooperative as you would like, you are welcome to avail yourselves of our Netflix and Hulu+ subscriptions or watch a movie from our collection. We have several from the 1940s and 1950s. Interaction with Guests We are a homeschooling family who love meeting people and learning about different cultures. If you are inclined to share, we would love to listen. Various family members have food restrictions, so we are not in a position to allow guests to use the kitchen to cook their own food. However, we are more than happy to treat you to breakfast. If the hens are laying, we will have even fresh eggs available! If you are here while we are having lunch or dinner, and are happy to eat whatever we are having, you are welcome to share. If you have special dietary needs, chances are we've already got them covered! Celebrating a special occasion? Please do let us know. We love to come up with creative ideas for surprises. If you want total privacy we are fine with that, too. The Neighborhood There are plenty of beautiful places to visit in our general area. Feel free to ask us for recommendations. Getting Around You will need a car if you are going to take trips (and there are a lot of pretty places to visit around here). However, if you are coming up from the city just to get away for a few days and enjoy the country air, we'd be happy to work out a Bethel Train Station run at no extra cost - if we can make it work with our schedule. Other Things to Note We have two hens - Trumpet and Zephyr. We also have a gecko (Perseus) who lives in a terrarium in the kitchen. If you believe the sight of him will make you uncomfortable, please let us know and we will relocate him for the duration of your stay. We have a generator - so there are never any electricity issues. + More
rules: House Rules We have a boy and a girl, aged 12 and 9. If you are bringing children they'd be more than happy to play with them - but they do ask that young guests not wander into their bedrooms unless they are invited to do so. Smoking and inebriation are NOT permitted, and we ask that you supervise your children at all times. + More

about: This is a newly renovated loft, blocks from Yale University campus, is a modern/minimalist apt. with beautiful interior appointments. It has 2 outdoor decks, fully equipped kitchen, hydronic floor heat and high ceiling living room with
description: Description The Space This is a newly renovated apartment with an upper bedroom loft space in an historic 1876 brownstone. It is blocks from Yale and in the Wooster Square area (great farmer's market on Saturdays!) offering some of the best pizza around. The space is bright, clean and is just a really amazing space (in my humble opinion). It offers 2 decks and a gorgeous bathroom with a skylight. It also comes with a Washer/Dryer and a full kitchen should you wish to use it. The apartment is on the 4th FLOOR, so please consider that before booking. Not really a big deal for most, but I imagine for some, this is might be a deal-breaker. The apartment has hydronic (ie. floor) heat, and so is very comfortable and quiet. Guest Access Guests will have high-speed internet, linens, towels, full kitchen, washer/dryer. If one large bath towel and a smaller towel for each person is insufficient and you like additional hand or face towels, they must be brought by the guest as this is not provided. Interaction with Guests Minimal, as in very private and no intrusions basically. The apartment is very private with key code access on front (outer) door and inner (apt) door. If there is a problem, it will be dealt with immediately, of course. There is a cleaner who comes in after every stay, or, if longer than a week stay, can come in during your stay. The Neighborhood We have been living in this neighbourhood since 1997! We love New Haven. We went to Yale and met in this (URL HIDDEN) we're biased! It not only has great pizzerias (of course!) but great food options outside of pizza as well. Wonderful Farmers markets, nearby hikes, waterfront vistas and, of course, the university offerings of music, theatre/plays and arts in general. All of which are excellent. I highly recommend visiting the BAC (British Art Center) on Chapel St. and across the street from it the recently renovated Yale University Art Gallery. Just down the street from there is the well renowned Yale Repertory Theatre. Please don't hesitate to ask for any recommendations - we have plenty and love to offer up our favorites. :-) Getting Around Should you have a car, there is on-street parking on Jefferson street (the side street of the building). It is usually easy to find a spot. Should that prove difficult, there is additional parking further down Jefferson and on Grand Avenue. If on-street is a problem for you, please ask and I can usually provide off-street parking for a reasonable fee. Thanks! For Yale visiting scholars / guests there is the Yale Shuttle Bus which stops directly in front of the building to take one to the various departmental buildings. 2 blocks away is the State street train station. Uber taxi service has a strong/reliable presence in the city and a very convenient way to get around should the weather not cooperate. Other Things to Note Please enjoy yourself while here. It is very private, but very centrally located. We just hope you have a lovely, comfortable stay. + More
rules: House Rules There is no smoking allowed anywhere on or around the premises. Strictly no more than 2 persons, unless expressly discussed with host beforehand. There may be a chance to blow up air mattress for a 3rd person (if child, preferably, as space is best for a couple). No pets of any size / kind allowed. Sorry. No parties. I trust you to respect the space and leave it the way you found it, like you would if this were your own home. Pretty straight-forward. + More

description: Description The Space See my reviews : I am renting my cottage since 2006. I own the lot next door, a tiny wood, so the back yard is very private. The house is on a private dirt road....the home has a large deck, front porch, fireplace, I provide linens, spices,paper towels, trash bags.. This is the home I raised my boys in. Its was always filled with love.... ----------------------------------- Date of stay 05/11/13 Review Submitted 05/22/13 .Absolutely loved this house and will definitely plan on staying here again! My husband is originally from Connecticut and his entire family still lives there. Traditionally we stay with family when we visit but I decided to rent a house this trip so we could entertain and have everyone over. This house was charming and very comfortable. It was my mother in laws 80th birthday and I had about 25 family members over for a dinner party. Every person who entered the house commented on what a terrific cottage it was. Having the upstairs loft was a perfect space for my son to have his privacy and a place to relax. He (and I) loved having the wireless internet connection that worked great! The outdoor area was very private and the deck was a wonderful space to hang out and kick back. Everyone really enjoyed the art work throughout the house and commented that it provided warmth and character to the cottage. Lastly I want to share my comments on the owner Yvette, she was very prompt in her responses to me and a real pleasure to work with through the rental process. Yvette thank you so much for sharing your beautiful home with us, it was the most memorable visit to Connecticut that our family has ever had. Take care, my best, Julianna (This was the first time I ever rented a home online or used the Home Away site, it was a great experience!) Our Beach house is tucked away in a quiet private Connecticut shoreline neighborhood. Bike or flip-flop to our private beach and fishing pier. Our Cottage boasts a large, private, yard that affords lively games of horseshoes or croquet. Nap or read in a hammock or relax with a cold refreshment under the gigantic trees. Back deck offers a picnic table and grill for hotdogs, hamburgers or lobster. Cottage Amenities - Fresh and Vibrant Decor, books to read, sea treasures, fresh linens, coffee maker, teapot, dishes.(not limited to). Your flip-flops are a must! The Town beach is Amazing and within biking distance. The 'Kate' offers sophisticated entertainment. Penny Lane Pub is a lively Irish watering hole and Dock and Dine is situated on the waterfront for sea-fare dining. Stroll downtown and browse the plethora of Antique Stores and Seaside Treasure Shops where Katheryn Hepburn was often spotted. Wander over the causeway and down RT.1 and keep exploring the Connecticut Shore! Offering three homes on the Connecticut shoreline as vacation rental properties in Old Saybrook and Guilford for the past seven years, we take great pride in caring for our guests as well as in accommodating and tending to their needs and comfort. Our homes are designed with local art and treasures and reflect our love and passion for decoration, beauty and the creation of aesthetic surroundings which welcome and embrace you. Our goal is to provide a setting where you, your family and your friends can enjoy, relax and create memories that will last a lifetime. Our reviews testify to this and consistently reveal the happiness and joy our guests have experienced while (EMAIL HIDDEN)e stay with us and see for yourself what our homes are all about. ________________________ The area Experience New England's shoreline year round at one of Old Saybrook's most desirable and family friendly areas. Spend the day basking in the sun at the Saybrook Manor Association private beach club, have your children playing at the children's playground of the Club, enjoy all sort of social events, or go for a change to one of the 2 beaches just a five-minutes walk away. Need a break from the beach ? Stop to dine at some fine restaurants nearby. Travel just a little further and visit Mystic Aquarium, Mystic Seaport, take a ride with your kids across the countryside, see Beautiful New England the old-fashioned way on the Essex Historic steam train, enjoy a cruise on the Connecticut River or enjoy an evening at the Mohegan Casino. Peddle along the ocean side at sunset, head to the shops along Main Street or take a ten-minute drive to the shopping outlets ! + More

description: Description The Space Water view and short distance to downtown Mystic. Safe environment. Great security. Free parking, wifi, kitchen, beautiful views. I live in the main house so I am on the property across the walkway from the guest house. My street is runs along the Mystic River. Unit contains a small dinette area, living room with 50" flat screen TV, bath and a bedroom with an adjustable Sleep Number Queen mattress.
description: Description The Space Location- Safe, exclusive neighborhood, very private and quiet. Guest Access Completely private apartment with it's own separate keyed entrance. Interaction with Guests I try to let my guests set that tone. I prefer to stay out of guests space and allow for their privacy, but do see them in the shared driveway as we each come and go. Easy to get to restaurants and shopping- major malls and stores in larger cities of Norwalk and Stamford but not a lot of traffic and congestion locally. Very cute and unique town and neighborhood! Getting Around Bus system runs by very close to the house and the Metro North train station is 2 mins away. Other Things to Note The library is brand new and within walking distance. about: Work or vacation directly on Greenwich Avenue. No car needed in this chic studio near shopping, nightlife and train!
description: Description The Space Positioned on the 2nd floor of an historic pre-war building situated in a premier location on Greenwich Avenue near Hermes, Starbuck's, fine dining, movie theater, food markets and walking distance to the train, this chic studio apartment is bright and airy, with a clean, contemporary look and features high ceilings, hardwood floors and large windows. The fully equipped kitchen includes a gas stove, microwave and Nespresso maker and the living area has leather club chairs, a comfortable desk, high-definition television, high-speed wireless Internet, Apple TV and abundant closet space. Elegantly appointed, relax on the queen pillow-top mattress with down duvet and pillows. The bathroom is equipped with luxurious bath products, a salon hair dryer, fluffy white towels and most importantly, strong water pressure. Enjoy world class shopping, restaurants and nightlife right outside your front door. An easy commute to NYC- trains run every 30 min and more during peak times. Westchester County Airport is just 15 minutes away, Laguardia is 30 minutes. A short drive or bicycle ride to beach, tennis, golf, park, museums and concerts. Guest Access Entry: Please download August Smartlock and sign-up after booking. Entry to the apartment is via an e-key using your smartphone or tablet. Parking: Overnight parking is free in the lot directly across the street. There's metered parking from 9-5. In front of the building are 2 hour meters at .75/hour and behind the building are all day meters at .50/hour. There's also $5.35/day parking in designated areas of the train station payable via the Parkmobile app. Saturday afternoon and Sunday parking is free. Interaction with Guests Enjoy complete privacy in your own apartment! + More

about: Our spacious, modern home is a perfect weekend retreat. Choose between 2 private guest rooms: 3rd floor twin beds and beautiful 360 views or 2nd floor cozy queen bedroom. Relax in our outdoor hot tub. Enjoy Sunday flea market, antiques, and local vineyards.
description: Description The Space We built much of this home ourselves, and the space reflects our family's personality. It's relaxed, informal, idea-driven, and welcoming. We have several multi-use rooms, a very spacious kitchen, a large deck and terrace, and ample parking. We live in a quiet neighborhood about 75 minutes NNE of NYC, about 20 minutes from the CT antiquing, wine, hiking, and leaf-peeping areas. Guest Access Choice of two guest rooms, one with double bed, one with two singles. Private bath (w tub & shower). Full kitchen, deck, outdoor shower, fire pit, fireplace, hot tub. Interaction with Guests We are a typical, busy family. We're happy to play host or to leave people alone  depending on what you're looking for. We enjoy the chance to make big dinners and chat over wine, especially in front of a warm fire. The Neighborhood Quiet, small New England town with local lake, nearby vineyard. Lovely neighborhood for flat or challenging walk/bike/run (HS w track, tennis courts is around the corner). Several nearby towns offer good food, pubs, skating, etc. Getting Around You need a car to get around. Other Things to Note We have 2 cats and a guinea pig. We lots of windows and shadebut no air conditioning. + More
rules: House Rules We expect a reasonably quiet atmosphere, as we have 2 elementary aged kids. We love to share our space, we count on guests to be respectful. + More

description: Description The Space Come enjoy a family farm experience getaway ... - Beautiful second story balcony with a grill, Adirondack chairs, a new retractable cover for the porch perfect for relaxing evenings overlooking the farm - Full size bed in the one room & bunk bed with a twin size bed on top and full size bed on the bottom in other room - Solar heated water and electric, a/c, pellet stove for heat - Lots of GREAT books and toys provided for kids use - Family room has a 32" flat screen with 20 channels/DVD player. Pellet stove with glass door for viewing fire - Three Large closets - Fully equipped kitchen - Washer and dryer downstairs - Fridge stocked with our " Farm Fresh Eggs" muffins,pancake mix, juice,milk,cream and coffee/tea - Peaceful meadows and walking trails - Access included to the petting zoo during and after office hours Note: Additional fees for services including Farm Tour, Collecting Eggs, Hayride, and Pony Rides $270.00 for 2 nights ... or just a weekend away with your best friends! Guest Access Free access to the petting zoo whenever you would like to see the animals. Interaction with Guests As much as they would like. The Neighborhood Quaint quiet neighborhood in a rural farm setting. BEAUTIFUL open space and wooded trails for walking across the street. Getting Around I would recommend renting a car. Simsbury has a free bike rental program also. Other Things to Note The weekend days on the farm tend to be pretty busy (April thru November). We have children's Birthday parties going on and petting zoo visitors. The farm closes at 5 pm to the public and the nights are very quiet and private other than the barnyard sounds of the animals. + More

about: I hope you like to eat, because, I like to cook. Or if you prefer, I can direct you to the best restaurants around. The room is comfortable with tons of storage, WiFi, cable TV, well lit, with a full sized bed. You're welcome to breakfast and dinner.
description: Description The Space Comfort and Convenience you can afford! Located on the Stamford / Greenwich border, close to I-95, minutes from downtown Stamford or Greenwich, Metro North Railway to New York or Boston, enjoy our Italian "Family Style" hospitality (with fine hotel cleanliness). I know from my own travels that it's one thing to find a decent place to stay (for a decent price) but it's an entirely different animal paying for food when traveling. When I chose to list my space on AirB&B, I thought of what I liked most about hotels and what I miss most when traveling. I love the cleanliness of a great hotel, but I hate trying to find food (reasonably priced and good) in a foreign place. So when I decided to list on AirB&B, I chose to include meal access with the room!! Now I am no world renown chef, but I know my way around the kitchen and can cook some great Italian food. So the long and short of it is, bring your clothes, your laptop, and your appetite ! See You Soon ! Guest Access Kitchen, Bathroom, Patio, Yard are all shared space. Interaction with Guests Guest will generally see me in the Kitchen, the yard, or online (looking up new recipes). I can formulate meal plans around a guests diet, so as to really help the guest feel at home. I am here almost all the time, I keep the place clean and strive for my guests to eat and sleep well every night. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is nice, we have 2 grocery stores, Carvel, Subway, Dunkin Donuts, NYSC, and Dry Cleaners just down the street (5 minute walk). We are a 4 minute drive (15 minute walk) to the Metro North Station of Old Greenwich, CT. The street is quiet and mainly full of Long Term residents of Italian decent. Getting Around I prefer walking, to the local shops, unless heading Downtown Stamford (which I would recommend an Uber car for). + More

description: Description The Space Relax in this 1 bedroom cozy cottage. Queen size gel/memory foam bed. Full kitchen, granite counters, stainless appliances & tile shower. The cottage is fully equipped with most everything that you will need and is offered exclusively to AIRBNB guests. Complimentary light breakfast supplies are graciously provided. Check in 2:00PM Checkout 11:00AM Guest Access Access to entire cottage, yard, porch and off street parking. Interaction with Guests Available by text and cell. We are close by if needed. Although sometimes not possible, we do like to meet our guests. The Neighborhood Walking distance to two restaurants (Gaylordsville Diner, Alfredo's Italian & Pizza ).. There is also a farm stand 1/4 mile from the cottage. Everything you need is a short drive away. The lovely walkable town of Kent is a 10 min ride, and Historic walkable New Milford 15 minutes away. Washington and Sherman are also nearby. Antiquing, Elephants Trunk Flea Market, Kent Falls State Park, Lovers Leap State Park, Macedonia State Park, Housatonic River, Candlewood Lake, Lake Warmwaug, Bulls Bridge Recreational Area & Covered Bridge, Conway Hardwoods, Big Al's Toy Box, Alpaca Farm and Yoga Retreat Center, Mohawk Mountain Ski Area, Lime Rock Raceway all a short drive away. Several sections of the Appalachian trail are nearby with awesome hiking. Hike, Bike, Kayak, relax..... Please check the Guidebook for some of our area attractions etc. Getting Around Metro North Harlem Valley, Wingdale/Dover train station 10 minutes away. Other Things to Note Available by the night (2 night minimum), week, month or longer. Please feel encouraged to inquire about longer term stays. + More

Small outdoor deck with chairs. Air-conditioning and gas fireplace. Parking on site. about: Skylit apartment with water view sleeps four, 2 miles from
description: Description The Space This is a brand new, beautifully decorated space filled with light, and tasteful details such as a custom-tiled bath and shower, collections of sea glass and sea shells, skylights and ceiling fans. Guest Access Guests can relax in a large private yard or on the porch. A kitchen, wifi and office complete with printer are available. Off-street parking or ample on-street parking are both options. Interaction with Guests I work at home, so am almost always available to greet guests, answer questions or make restaurant recommendations. The Neighborhood I grew up on the ocean, so I love living so close to it that I can see it all the time. And in this beautiful place, we have all the convenience of city living close by: restaurants, music, arts and culture. My street is very quiet, and on a hill, so you can see the water from every window. My neighbors keep beautiful yards and window boxes! Getting Around Buses run through the downtown, and to Connecticut College, Norwich and Old Saybrook. The train station is in downtown New London, and I can pick you up there. Amtrak trains run from Boston, New York, Hartford and Providence. Other Things to Note At City Pier, you can take ferries to Block Island and Orient Point, N.Y. The U.S. Coast Guard will open a museum in New London in 2016. We are home to Connecticut College, the U.S. Coast Guard Academy, the Garde Arts Center, the Custom House Museum, the Nathan Hale Schoolhouse, Revolutionary War-era Fort Trumbull, the Monte Cristo Cottage (Eugene O'Neill's boyhood home), and the seventeenth-century Hempstead Houses, among other attractions. We are an hour from Hartford, New Haven and Providence, and two hours from New York. You can reach the casinos in 25 minutes. + More

about: Open floor plan, 1400 square feet, includes bedroom and sleeping loft, both on second floor.
description: Description The Space Perfect country location! Only 3 minutes from the interstate, 5 minutes from Stonington Borough, 7 minutes from Mystic and 15 minutes from New London. Listen to the birds, watch the horses graze ... relax and unwind. Minimum ONE WEEK rental from May 1 to October 31. You may stay for a shorter time period but the charge is not pro-rated. Thanks for understanding! Saturday arrival/departure for one week visits; longer visits may begin/end on different days of the week. Sleeps 2 in the bedroom and 4 in the sleeping loft (both on the second floor.) ONE friendly, well-mannered pet is welcome with a refundable $150 deposit. Children of all ages are welcome; however, we do not have a crib or child gates for the stairs. Full kitchen includes: electric stove/oven, microwave, coffee pot, refrigerator/freezer with ice maker, toaster, espresso maker, pots, pans, dishes, cutlery. Full bath includes: large pedestal sink, toilet (of course!), tub/shower combination. There is also an outdoor charcoal barbecue built into one of our many large rocks. Rental includes linens and dish towels. Guests provide their own bath towels. This rental is called "the Red Barn" for a reason ~ it is a converted barn for the original farmstead. We live in the historic house on the property and have a dog, cat, chickens and two horses on the premises. There are land trust trails through the woods less than 1/4 mile away and the oldest church in town, as well as a historic graveyard, is just a couple of hundred yards down the road. Bring your bikes or rent locally as Stonington Borough with its shops, restaurants, lighthouse and beach is just 2 miles away. Mystic is also within biking distance (but with a hill) at 3-4 miles and Watch Hill and Misquamicut, RI are a 20 minute drive. 2 1/2 hours from NYC and 1 1/2 hrs from Boston by car. There's a train station in Mystic (Amtrak) and car rental available or taxi cab. The Connecticut shoreline is beautiful and unique in all seasons with lots to see and do! Guest Access Large yard, covered porch and patio. There is a barbecue (charcoal) built into the rock. Plenty of room to wander and sit outdoors. Interaction with Guests We generally work days but are home in the later afternoon and evening and, weather permitting, are often outdoors. We're happy to visit with guests; we'll also leave you alone if you prefer. The Neighborhood Great access to Stonington Borough, Mystic, Westerly and the interstate and still quiet and peaceful. + More
rules: House Rules There is absolutely no smoking indoors! That's the big one; otherwise, we expect that our guests will treat our property with respect. Children and one dog or cat are welcome but must be under adult control (seems obvious but you'd be surprised.) There is a strict limit of 6 people, including babies and children ~ extra people must be approved by us before we accept your booking request. + More

description: Description The Space The house that contains this apartment was built in 1888. It used to be a boarding house where guests would rent individual rooms. It has long since been turned into three apartments. Located in the heart of the Pawcatuck/Westerly historic district, it is within walking distance to many restaurants, shops, a library and beautiful park. It is a short drive to Misquamicut and Watch Hill beaches. It is about a 20 minute drive to Foxwoods and Mohegan Sun Casinos. The house has 2 bedrooms. Each bedroom has a queen sized bed. There is a also a futon in the living room that can be opened up to a queen sized bed. Guest Access Guests may park one car in the rear parking lot and additional cars may be parked on the street out front. Guests may also use the laundry room downstairs free of charge. There is a washer and dryer marked for the first floor apartment. Guests also have use of the front porch and back and front yard. Interaction with Guests We own the building but do not live on the premise. There are two long term tenants who live on the second and third floor apartments. So interaction will be mainly through messaging and phone calls. The Neighborhood We love the proximity to yummy restaurants! Getting Around We are within 1 mile of the Westerly train station which is serviced by Amtrak. 1 hour from Bradley Airport in Hartford and 40 minutes from TF Green Airport in Providence, RI. + More

about: Spend some time in a charming New England rural town. New Preston CT, a quick 90-minute drive from New York City, provides rustic charm and outdoor attractions, as well as shops and restaurants.
description: Description The Space The 7C Herb Garden Bed & Breakfast is a labor of love for Hansel & Alicia Collins (My parents). By way of Jamaica, they've lived in this house since 1968, and have been running the bed and breakfast since 2000. Situated on 4 acres in the Berkshire Hills and surrounded by fields and woods, it's easy to forget that New York City is only 2 hours away. Although it's close by to state parks, hiking trails and other outdoor activities, and only a short drive to shops and restaurants in New Preston and Washington Depot, it can be hard to move beyond a sunny spot in the yard or the shade of the maple trees. The bed and breakfast offers 2 spaces: The Suite (which is this listing) is actually 2 adjoining rooms with 2 beds (one queen, one single) that share a full bath. The other space, "The Breeze", is one room with a queen bed and a private bath. Guest Access Guests have full run of the property, access to the kitchen, use of the washer and dryer. There's free high speed WIFI in the rooms, but no TV. Interaction with Guests Your'e free to relax in your room or sit and chat with Alicia and Hansel. You have a choice of breakfast each and every morning, cooked to order, that's included with your stay. Any special requests should be made the day before to allow time for grocery shopping and preparation. Many guest choose a traditional Jamaican breakfast, but anything and everything from pancakes to waffles, omelets to oatmeal can be requested. The Neighborhood This is New England, with rolling hills and old colonial towns tucked between orchards, farms and vineyards. You'll find numerous antique shops and small mom-and-pop stores, as well as cafes, restaurants and pubs. New Preston and Lake Waramaug are a short, 5-minute drive, and Washington Depot is about 10 minutes away. Getting Around To explore the area, a car is a must. There's ample free parking. Other Things to Note Pricing is as follows: $135 per night - double occupancy $25 per night extra per each additional person CANCELLATION POLICY: You will receive a full refund if you give us at least 7 days notice. + More
rules: House Rules With a private entrance, you're free to come and go whenever you'd like. Sorry, no pets allowed. There is one cat, Andy, who's not allowed in the guest rooms. There's no smoking or food in the rooms. + More

description: Description The Space The cottage is an ideal retreat - any season for 2 or 3 people. It is perfect for parents visiting local schools - Hotchkiss, Salisbury, and Indian Mountain - or those wanting a brief sojourn as they consider relocating to the Northwest Corner. Nestled well off a quiet country lane which, just beyond the property, becomes a steep hiking path - highly favored by locals seeking a challenging workout. At the top (.7 mile) is a cross country ski area, view of Wononscopomuc Lake and the surrounding South Taconic Range and Berkshires. The cottage is fully furnished - living room, eat-in kitchen, one bedroom with a queen bed and second very tiny bedroom with a double bed. My residence is also on the property, so if you like, introduce yourself. I am often there with my family including my grandchildren who may be playing frisbee in the yard, if the weather permits. Pastorale, a nice restuarant is .7 mile - a lovely evening walk, if you are so inclined. A babbling brook runs throug the property. In the summer take a glass of wine in the evening and relax in one of the Adiirondack chairs streamside. Or have dinner on the patio. Lakeville Lake - Wononspocomuc - with swimming, boating and fishing - and the hamlet of Lakeville with yoga classes, art galleries and restuarants - is 1 mile. Salisbury village with cafes, grocery, and gifts shops is 2 miles. Nearby attractions include Music Mountain summer music festivals and Lime Rock Race Track (too far, however, to hear it, except under the rare conditions when the cloud cover and humidity is just right) Butternut, Catamount and Mohawk skiing. Horse back riding Appalacian trail hiking Counrty roads for cycling Housatonic River for canoeing or fishing Salisbury Ski Jump - February 7 - 9, 2104 Nearby schools include the Hotchkiss, Salisbury, Indian Mountain, and Berkshire Schools Car Rental: Autorent, 130 Main Street, Sharon, CT (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) miles from Wassiac Metro North Station - Harlem Line) Stay for a long weekend, week or month. 15% CT room occupancy tax included in room price.. Interaction with Guests I love to meet my guests - send me an email when you arrive, if you would like to meet or knock on the front door. Or if you prefer not to meet, that is fine too. Please feel free to browse in the garden or take a walk along the creek where I may see you, but will not disturb you. The Neighborhood My neighborhood is usually quiet - there is the occasional lawn mower. A car comes down the road once a every few hours, but many locals wave hello on there way up the hill for a hike. Getting Around There is no public transportation. You can get a taxi at the train station - 15 miles away - for about $35.00 to the property. You can bike to the lake (about one mile) and grocery shopping.(2 1/2 miles). Other Things to Note 15% CT room occupancy tax included in price. WiFi is working (one recent review said it wasn't. ) + More

about: Just a block from the water: Lovely two-bedroom house with a nice back yard and veggie garden, welcoming front porch, and a great kitchen. (Two Wolf stoves, Miele dishwasher, microwave.)
description: Description The Space Just a block from the water: Lovely house with a nice back yard and veggie garden, welcoming front porch, and a great kitchen. (Two Wolf stoves, Miele dishwasher, microwave.) Upstairs are two bedrooms--the master with a king bed and the front room with a twin and a fold-out queen-sized futon--and a full bath with a shower. Downstairs is a couch (which can sleep one more if needed) and a full bath with a soaking tub. We are in the lovely, tight-knit New Haven neighborhood of Oyster Point, so called because oystermen used to live in its Victorian houses. We are just a block to the water, and two to the pier, marina and Sage Restaurant, which is a great place to go have drinks on the deck in nice weather. There is a bus stop a block away, and the train station is a 20-minute walk, but the location is best enjoyed with a car: We have ample parking in our six-bay garage and are right off of I-95 for easy coming and going. West Haven beaches are a few minutes in one direction, Yale is a few minutes in the other. (Caveat: Though they won't be with you when you visit, we do own two cats, so this is probably not the best place for those who are very allergic.) NOTE: In August 2014 we would prefer to have reservations of 4 days or more. The Neighborhood Estamos situados en Oyster Point, un hermoso y unido vecindario de New Haven, llamado as_ porque ostreros sol_an vivir en sus casas de estilo victoriano. La casa est a una cuadra del ocano y a dos cuadras del muelle, de la marina y del restaurante Sage, un sitio muy agradable para departir en la terraza en buen tiempo. + More
rules: House Rules We're delighted to have you to our house! description: Description The Space Our guesthouse is on the Connecticut River in the treasured small town of Chester, half-way between New York and Boston  a little over two hours from each city and 45 minutes from New Haven and Hartford. The cottage features a wide porch, private front yard overlooking the river; a living room with a couch that pulls out to sleeps two comfortably, a dining area and kitchen at one end with a dishwasher. There's a bedroom with a queen-sized bed and a good-sized bathroom with tub and shower. The house, on our four-acre property, is private and quiet and about two miles from the center of the village which is well-appointed with wonderful restaurants, a professional theater, galleries and one-of-a-kind shops. There is endless hiking and kayaking possibilities with a boat launch ramp adjacent to the property. Theater, music and a variety of activities and things to do are all close by. The cottage is $130 a night; $700 a week or $2000 a month. We'd love to have you stay. Guest Access Guests will have access to the front lawn in front of the cottage and to the dock on the Connecticut River. Interaction with Guests We don't interact much with our guests. We make an effort to meet them on their arrival or soon after. We're always available to help and to answer questions. The Neighborhood We live in a quiet, pretty exclusive neighborhood on a private road on the Connecticut River. The houses are quite far apart. The lively village of Chester is about two miles away where there is a theater, galleries, great restaurants, shops etc. All around is hiking and kayaking and boating as well as picturesque, colonial villages. Getting Around You need a car. + More

description: Description The Space Room with private entrance and full bath on 8 acre property with trout stream. The mill, surrounded by 30 acres of open space is only 1.25 hours from NYC. It's a great place for a relaxing getaway. Enjoy the seasonal swimming pool, patio, cable, WiFi internet and close proximity to Fairfield/Litchfield County attractions. As we are in the country, you will need a car. Some guests from NYC take Metro North to Danbury on the New Haven Line or Southeast on the Harlem Line and have Enterprise Car Rental meet them. The mill is well situated for day trips to state parks, museums in Hartford and New Haven and several wineries on the CT Wine Trail. Sorry, no smoking or pets. + More

about: Welcome to the elegant, historic mansion, known as the Farnam Guest House, 1.25 mi from Yale and the center of New Haven. You can find us online for lots more information. Your room is quiet and private. Includes a fully equipped guest kitchen.
description: Description The Space We have a variety of spaces with private baths. These rooms are beautifully furnished with a table and chairs, dresser, bedside tables, complimentary WiFi, DVD, cable TV, and parking. I am a warm, friendly hostess. We are in a beautiful neighborhood with many mansions. There is public transportation across the street. The closest restaurant is one mile away. The central town area is straight down the street 1.25 miles where there are many restaurants, art galleries, theaters and shops. You will be surrounded with beautiful furnishings and lovely decor. You can see the rooms online at Farnam Guest House. Rates go up to $199 a night for Yale Reunion Weekends, Parents Weekend or Yale Graduation with a two-night minimum. I look forward to hearing from you!!! Guest Access Guests are given a front door code for convenient self-entry and have a key and 24/7 access to their room, the fully-equipped guest kitchen, the parlor, the dining room and the beautiful outdoor patio and garden. Interaction with Guests I often see guests in the morning but they are completely on their own. I am available about 80% of the time for guests needs as I live in a small apartment at one end of the house. The Neighborhood Walk or drive or take the free Yale shuttle bus straight down our street to downtown New Haven and Yale University - about 1.25 miles or a 30 minute walk. Getting Around We have 3 off-street parking places in the circular drive in front of the house and lots of free parking anytime on the streets. The free Yale shuttle bus will pick you up directly across the street and take you downtown and to Yale University. Take a taxi from the airport ($20) or from the train station for about $10.Walk or drive or take the free Yale shuttle bus straight down our street to downtown New Haven and Yale University - about 1.25 miles or a 30 minute walk. Other Things to Note Use our coffee/tea/cookie bar which is available 24/7 This is a beautiful neighborhood filled with mansions to the North, South and East. + More
rules: House Rules There is no smoking in the house. No loud noise after 11 pm please. We are 100% pet free. + More

about: Enjoy water views of the Mystic River. Relax on the front porch and watch the boats go by. You will literally be steps away from the best restaurants and attractions in downtown Mystic. Fully furnished 2 BR apartment with everything you need.
description: Description The Space Fully furnished apartment with everything you need to feel right at home. Parking: Two off-street parking spaces (single file) are included with the rental. There is enough room for one vehicle and a small boat on a trailer (there is a public boat ramp across the street). Sleeping accommodations: This property comfortably accommodates up to 6 guests. Bedroom one has a real queen-sized bed. Bedroom two has a real queen-sized bed. Living room has a queen-sized sleeper sofa. A queen-sized air mattress is also available. Full kitchen: When you are not dining out at the local restaurants, take advantage of the full-sized kitchen to prepare your own meals. -Refrigerator with freezer -Electric stove with oven -Dishwasher -Coffee maker -Toaster -Microwave -Pots & pans -Plates & bowls -Pint & wine glasses -Flatware & knives -Serving utensils -Soap, towels, etc. -Herbs & spices -Baking essentials (flour, sugar, oil, etc) Full bathroom: You will be provided with fresh towels for up to 6 guests. The bathroom is newly renovated and features a full-sized, extra deep tub with luxurious Kohler shower. Other amenities: Air conditioning On-site laundry (full sized washer and dryer) High speed internet Cable TV (32" LCD TV in living room, 22" LCD TV in one bedroom and 19" LCD TV in the other bedroom) Gas grill Games Puzzles Available Upon Request: Highchair / booster seat Pack-n-play / playpen Insta-bed air mattress Guest Access Private 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment in a side-by-side duplex style home with full kitchen, living room and laundry. Front porch is shared with other unit. Back porch is private with gas grill. Interaction with Guests I'm only a call or text away. I live and work locally. Most guests have a smooth check in and stay so there isn't a need to meet personally. Keyless entry makes check in very convenient. The Neighborhood Great views of the Mystic River, off-street parking, easy walkability to the best local restaurants, bars, art galleries, parks, landmarks and downtown shops. Getting Around Within 1 mile of the Mystic Amtrak Station (MYS). Taxis available. Uber available. + More

about: Two adjoining private rooms in antique farmhouse. Double bed with new deluxe mattress. Library can accommodate an additional guest on an air mattress. Private bath with tub/shower. Down the street are great restaurants and all amenities.
description: Description The Space This historic home was built in 1771 before the American Revolution. The house has been lovingly restored with original character and details preserved. Owned by two documentary filmmakers, the rooms are decorated with eclectic art they have collected in their travels. You will be staying in two adjoining rooms - one a former parlor and the other a library filled with art books and cook books. The rooms can be separated by a pocket door and an air mattress can be provided for an extra guest. A private bathroom off the kitchen is just one step from the library and includes a tub / shower. Towels and bed linens are included. Guest Access Guests have access to a stone patio out back, and are free to tour the organic vegetable garden and grounds (three acres of garden, lawn and woods). Kitchen is accessible for breakfast, and coffee and tea are provided by the hosts. We are happy to share our kitchen with you most anytime - we just ask that you let us know ahead of time what your expectations are so that we can plan accordingly. Interaction with Guests The owners will be on the premises and will be happy to answer questions about the area. The Neighborhood The house is in Georgetown, a hamlet encompassing parts of Weston, Redding, Wilton and Ridgefield. Several terrific new restaurants including farm-to-table, Mexican, pub, and Italian are located right in Georgetown. A great grocery store (Caraluzzi's), several banks, gas, post office, Metro North train, etc are all right in the neighborhood. Getting Around Nearest public transportation is 1/2 mile away: bus on Route 7 and Branchville Metro North train station. Hosts may be available to pick you up at the train station but a car is recommended for getting around. Other Things to Note Ask to seek the original deed to the property signed by King George III. Our house is also home to two cats and two dogs and some chickens out back. The animals are very friendly and respectful of guests and the house is kept very clean, but if you have pet allergies, this is not the place for you. + More
rules: House Rules Hosts go to bed at 11PM and prefer quiet in the bedroom (which is below theirs) after that time. Guests are welcome to stay up late on the patio or in the library area. Smoking is allowed outdoors only and proper receptacles must be used for cigarette butts. Two dogs and two cats live in the house so guests must pay attention not to let them out without the owners' okay. + More

description: Description The Space Campbell Hill Farm is a unique setting for guests to stay while seeing the sites and travelling through New England. The house is a ten sided rustic/contemporary set into a bucolic hillside with views that offer the comfort and quiet of country life. Your stay here would afford you the privacy of your own bath and bedroom with a very comfy king size bed. Stroll the grounds in the evening, relax on the deck or enjoy an evening out for dinner at some the best restaurants around at the local casinos or drive to the coast for fresh seafood. Breakfast can be served in the spacious dining room that overlooks woods and fields, in my comfy rustic kitchen or out on the deck under the great oak tree. There will be 2 or 3 choices for breakfast. Either way you will find yourself feeling at home here. You will meet my Pomeranian, two cats, and horses who are an integral part of life here. If you want to stay and see what south eastern CT has to offer there is Mystic Seaport, Village and Aquarium 1/2 hour away, Mohegan Sun Casino, Foxwoods Casino and Mashantucket Pequot Musem not more than 8 miles away which offer a variety dining and entertainment , or drive down to the Rhode Island shore for beaches and more. There the CT wine trail with Preston Ridge Vineyard right next door and Maugle Sierra VIneyard 15 minutes away and several others at nearby locations, the 18 hole River Ridge Golf Course less than 6 miles away. However if you are coming to simple get away for a day or two to rest you will find the house quiet and relaxing. There is wifi, a dvd player and Deluxe Scrabble. Those of you interested in the fine arts can arrange a studio visit if so inclined. My studio is here on the property where I paint professionally (see sample photo). My work is represented by galleries around the country, has been in museum shows and is in many prestigious collections. So please get in touch with any questions you may have and I will do my best to accommodate you on your visit to Campbell Hill Farm and make it a pleasant experience. One weeks advance notice would be appreciated. Guest Access Private bathroom, the deck, and comfortable living space indoors. Interaction with Guests I am happy to make breakfast or even dinner where I can arrange a menu but need to know that ahead of time. (Dinner would have to be an extra fee). Feel free to come and go as you please. I have a busy life so if you are off and running have a great time but I am happy to settle you in, chat and inform you about the area etc. The Neighborhood The neighborhood of Campbell Hill Farm is a quiet, rural community with a dairy farm right down the road adjacent to a winery that is open during the summer months. Peep frogs in the spring and crickets during summer months will lull you to sleep. Getting Around You need a car. Other Things to Note Pets are a possibility but the arrangements must be discussed in advance. Not all situations are acceptable but I am willing to listen to what your needs are. + More

about: Your own private space on scenic Pulpit Rock Rd. in historic Woodstock, CT (one mile from town center) near quality dining in Putnam, Pomfret School, and the Rectory School, in Pomfret, and the Hyde School in So. Woodstock. Private entrance.
description: Description The Space We built our home about 18 years ago with a separate apartment for Jamie's parents. When they passed away the apartment was occupied by one of our sons for several year. After being vacant for one year we decided to offer it for short-term rentals through AirBnb. The apartment is handicapped accessible and has its own fully equipped kitchen. Our B&B is fully licensed by the Northeast District Department of Health and the Town of Woodstock, CT. Guest Access The apartment has its own private exterior entrance through the three season room/screened in porch. The Neighborhood Woodstock, Connecticut is considered part of the "Quiet Corner" of Connecticut. It is known for its history and rural landscapes. Woodstock has more operating dairy farms than any other town in Connecticut. But there are many types of farms, craft shops, antique shops, and restaurants intermingled with light industry. The scenery is spectacular, and the residents are friendly. Woodstock is about one hour from both Hartford, CT, and Providence, RI. Downtown Boston is one and a half hours away. + More
rules: House Rules We expect guests to be friendly, and considerate of our property and others. We love pets and have to two cats who are outside most of the time and have never been allowed in the apartment. Unfortunately we cannot welcome other pets. For everyone's comfort, we are also smoke-free. + More

about: The apartment has two bedrooms (one queen-size bed, one comfortable futon), a cozy living room that gets a lot of sunlight, a fully equipped kitchen (microwave, toaster, pots, pans, dishwasher, etc), washer-dryer in-unit, and free off-street parking.
description: Description The Space With hardwood floors, lots of windows, and two bedrooms, this apartment is a great spot to spend a few days or a week! It easily accommodates two to four people. Guests will have access to the whole apartment. There is a washer/dryer in-unit, I have enough sheets and towels to accommodate four, there is one off-street parking spot guests can use, I have fast wifi, a flat screen TV (which can be used with my roku or to plug your laptop into), games (scrabble, backgammon, resistance, cards, taboo, life, and scattergories), and a fully equipped kitchen (feel free to borrow spices and oils - I have a pretty good collection). In addition, I offer guests complimentary coffee, tea, and hot chocolate. I do not have air conditioning but there is a fan in each bedroom and a third in the living room. The apartment is located in the heart of East Rock, a safe and vibrant family-filled neighborhood about a mile from East Rock Park (which offers hiking and running trails and boasts the best views of New Haven), just down the street from Modern Apizza (arguably the best pizza around), and a mile from Yale University and downtown New Haven. The apartment is an easy five-minute taxi ride from Union Station, a block from the Yale shuttle route, and includes a free parking spot. Other Things to Note After you book, I will email you a detailed apartment manual I have put together with everything you need to know about the apartment and the neighborhood and some suggested restaurants and activities. + More
rules: House Rules Please be conscious of energy consumption (turn off lights when you leave, turn heat down to 60 when you are out of the apartment, etc). Please no pets! No smoking in the apartment, and if you would like to smoke outside, please walk away from the building a bit. I have neighbors so please be courteous - no loud parties, etc. In the interest of keeping the apartment as clean as possible, I do ask that guests remove their shoes before coming in. + More

about: Two large windows light this bedroom complete with memory foam king size bed and thick blackout curtains, in case you want to sleep in. A neighboring room provides our guests with a private den and 46" LCD. 1.5 bathrooms are shared by all housemates.
description: Description Guest Access Guests can access our semi-private shaded backyard area with a relaxing hammock and lower level with maturing flowers, a stone wall and gas grill. Indoors guests are welcome to the kitchen. Stainless appliances and gas stove sit below the antique tin-stamped ceiling. A butler's pantry provides guests with separate storage space. Our full bath on the second floor has a new tile shower stall with 12" rain shower head and separate jet tub. The home's 1.5 bathrooms are shared by all. Guests have their own private den with TV adjacent to their bedroom. Interaction with Guests I will be available to answer any questions and provide help if needed. The Neighborhood This home is located on the upper west side of town in the predominately Italian Town Plot neighborhood. Walk within a few blocks to find two small parks, a coffee shop, bakeries and restaurants. Our house sits on the corner lot of a no-thru road with very little traffic. Although located above and set far back from a highway, it is not visible. Getting Around A public bus line is nearby. + More
rules: House Rules No pets and no smoking please. Quiet hours are 11pm to 8am. Please be respectful of the home and property, clean up after yourself and leave the house locked and secure when you are away. No house guests are permitted without being noted on your reservation. + More
