about: minimum 2 night rental, comfortable cottage, large deck, 4 acres of woods, with brook and 200 foot Housatonic River frontage. In lovely Litchfield Hills, close to West Cornwall, the Appalachian trail, Mohawk Mtn Ski Area, sports and nature sites.
description: Description The Space The cottage is in the woods, with a brook, plus 200 foot frontage on the Housatonic River, on a rural dead end road that leads down to the River. The bridge over the brook, the large deck, the extensive lawn, and the surrounding woods, provide a calm and beautiful spot in nature. The river is a five minute walk from the cottage through the property woods. It is one mile from the charming town of West Cornwall, with its covered bridge, the wonderful Wandering Moose Cafe, unique gift shops, and Shaker furniture store. The newly renovated cottage interior is 900 square feet with two bedrooms, sunroom, living room, kitchen and eat-in cove. Guest Access The house is not wheelchair accessible. The entire house is available to guests, though one closet is locked to store some personal items. Interaction with Guests The house and wooded property are all yours to enjoy. I will not be there though I am "on call" for any questions. The Neighborhood Located in the beautiful Litchfield Hills, the cottage is surrounded by lovely countryside and quaint and welcoming New England villages. It is 2 minutes from West Cornwall and its covered bridge, and less than 10 minutes from the Appalachian Trail, Mohawk Mountain Ski Area, Music Mountain, The Lime Rock Park, Road Racing Center of the East, Clarke Outdoors for kayaking, canoeing, and rafting on the Housatonic, and the Housatonic Meadows State Park for fishing, boating and swimming. It is 15 minutes from Lakeville and Lake Wononscopomuc, one of Connecticut's premier deep water lakes with swimming and boating, Lakeville is also home to The Hotchkiss and Salisbury Schools, many fine restaurants, multiple art galleries, and the Scoville Memorial Library, the oldest publicly funded library in the country. It is 20 minutes from the famous Sharon Green and Sharon's beach, tennis courts, and children's play area, and from Millerton, NY with its movie theater, art galleries, bookstore, an old fashioned diner, and the Rail Trail for walking, jogging and biking. A 35 minute drive takes you to Great Barrington , MA for even more shops, restaurants and movie theater. It is 55 minutes from Tanglewood, and 25 minutes from Norfolk's Infinity Music Hall. For skiing, it is 10 minutes from Mohawk Mountain Ski Area, 38 minutes from Catamount Ski Area and SkiButternut. There are the US Eastern Ski Jumping Championships in nearby Salisbury every February. Getting Around You are in the woods and in the country. A car is a necessity. Other Things to Note This is Connecticut and there are ticks in the woods and bushes. You must check for ticks after walking in the woods or near bushes. + More
rules: House Rules The house has recently been refurbished, repainted, with new furniture and rugs. We expect you will take good care of the house. For allergy reasons, no pets and no smoking. Maximum number of 4 adults. No events or parties with people not staying at the cottage. The wood stove is locked and cannot be used by renters as insurance companies will not cover this risk. + More

about: Our guesthouse is a serene space above our yoga studio "Open Sky Yoga Barn." Bordered by 100 acres of open land beyond the deck, a sacred, tranquil energy abounds ... peace, calm, magic. Best for a couple yet kids can share the futon & single bed.
description: Description The Space The guesthouse is secluded and private, a true retreat from our fast paced society - a great getaway from NYC only 1.5 hours away. It is located over our yoga studio -- so when classes are in session we ask for you to be respectful and very quiet. You are welcome to join regular classes for free if you choose. The regular weekly schedule includes morning classes on Mondays, Thursdays & Saturdays. Please inquire about additional class times & events prior to your booking as we host monthly Guided Meditations, JourneyDance and seasonal concerts, films and workshops. For these extra (non weekly) events regular fees or donations apply. Guest Access There are hiking trails and lots of open space to enjoy on the property including the Little River Trail & Preserve. The space is set up as a restorative space for relaxation, self-reflection, restoration. When there are no classes and the studio is not being used in another fashion, feel welcome to take your personal yoga/meditation practice downstairs and roll your mat out in front of the beautiful candlelit alter. There is a large, private sun drenched deck out the apartment door facing the forest, where wildlife activity abounds. Find yourself here star-gazing, birdwatching, or meditating in nature. There is an infrared sauna on site guests are welcome to use. There are basic kitchen necessities; cooking utensils, pot, pan, oil, vinegar, some spices, plates, cutlery, coffee and tea. There is laundry soap, dish soap and cleaning supplies. There is limited cell service on the property, however, at the end of the driveway and certain parts of the property it comes into full use. Interaction with Guests We are a friendly and cool family of 5 with lots to do but always available to give info and chat. We don't like to disturb you so we leave it to you to choose how much contact you'd like. Come join us at the bonfires we have on gorgeous summer nights! The Neighborhood Rustic, quiet, beautiful natural wooded environment. Getting Around You must have a car as there is no public transportation. Other Things to Note We must reiterate that the yoga studio is our livelihood and our priority. We enjoy sharing our guesthouse but request that out guests are in tune with the sacred nature of this practice. Quiet and serenity are of utmost importance. There is wireless that can be accessed from the house though stronger in some parts of the studio and apartment than others. + More
rules: House Rules We are loving, caring, respectful, wonderful people and will only host guests who are the same. Our home is our sanctuary and we want to share it with you if you are of the same mindset. Also, absolutely no smoking. + More

about: This sweet little cottage on our pond is your perfect mini vacation with direct access to one of CT's best kept secrets, Huntington State Park is steps away. Peaceful and quiet you can also hike, bike, kayak, x/c ski and explore the countryside.
description: Description The Space Our little cottage on the pond behind our house was built around 1920. We have recently updated it and kept its beautiful rustic charm. We hope our guests will enjoy all that nature has to offer here. The pond and woods are filled with the peaceful sights and sounds of myriad birds, frogs and wildlife. Guest Access The entire cottage is yours for your stay and is very private save for the shared driveway. The path from the driveway parking to the cabin is about 125 ft. This is a family property with three houses including this cottage. Jamie and I live in the front house with our daughter, and Penny lives next door. You are welcome to stop by the house and chat or ask for anything you need. You are welcome to store any kayaks, bikes etc up near the driveway rather than haul them down to the cottage. We will show you the best spot to easily store any equipment you bring. The yard surrounding the cottage and pond is yours to enjoy. Interaction with Guests Either Jamie, Rose or Penny will greet you. We have some dogs that are friendly greeters as well but they are confined from the driveway by a fence. Sometimes they get out so be aware when pulling in and out of the driveway. We are very easy going and we love the outdoors so you will see us running, biking or paddling in Huntington Park if you decide to go there. I am a willing guide to the trails if I am available. Mostly you will be left on your own unless you need something. The Neighborhood Redding CT is a peaceful rural and historic town surrounded by similar towns, but each unique in historical, natural and architectural features. Many artists choose this area as home because the of the light and natural beauty. The cottage is nestled between Putnam Park and Huntington Sate Park. There are miles upon miles of great trails in this area and right out side the door step of this cottage! There are many farm stands, wine country tours, antiquing trails and cultural activities. Check out our guidebook for our recommendations of places to eat. Getting Around You really need a car. Bethel CT - 15 minutes away is the nearest Metro North train station. This is on the Danbury line that comes off the New Haven Line at South Norwalk. If you are an avid cyclist with light packs you can bring your bike on the train and ride here. Its about 6 miles mostly climbing. You can rent a car in Danbury. Other Things to Note Heat is provided by wood-stove. We provide wood. We cannot have guests stay for longer than one week. While we love all creatures, please no cats because of allergies. + More
rules: House Rules 1. We recognize that our land is environmentally sensitive so you will not see much if any thing in the way of toxic chemicals used as pesticides, fertilizers or cleaning solutions. We ask our guest to respect this and will help them in any way they need to help take good care of the cottage and the surrounding property. 2. Smoking is not permitted on the property. 3. Heat is provided by wood stove. We provide wood. 4. Well cared for dogs are welcome. They should not be left alone in the cottage for longer than an hour. If they are left alone and barking I will need to call you to come get them. Huntington Park is a great place for dogs. Scoop the poop please. 5. Please do not let your dog on the furniture. I can provide a dog bed, blankets and towels for them if needed. thx. 6. All exterior lights (porch light and pathway) need to be turned off when not in use. There are lights for the pathway. Make sure you know where the switch is by the garage and on the cottage stoop in case you come home late. We like it dark and quiet here. 7. Our septic is sensitive so please do not throw any thing in the toilet except small amounts of the toilet paper (we provide). Sanitary napkins and tampons are a big no no and will cause problems if they go in to the toilet. 8. Please conserve energy and water. + More

about: Large master suite with private bath including claw foot tub and stall shower. Queen bed with sitting room area antique furniture, window air conditioner, radiator heat. Shared living room, dining room, porch and kitchen. On Main Street in town.
description: Description The Space Beautiful Victorian home right in town. This room is the master suite and it has been completely renovated. The bathroom is very large and has a full size dresser and an antique scale. There is a large sink and hair dryer. Relax in the claw foot tub or shower in the large tiled stall shower. Guest Access Access to the shared kitchen and the downstairs parlor and dining room. Interaction with Guests Other guests will may be staying in one of the five rooms in the house. Please be respectful of their privacy and sensitivity to noise. The Neighborhood On Main Street right in town. Across the street is a bakery, restaurants, super market, hardware store, dry cleaner, bank and other stores. A short five minute walk brings you to the center of town and all the shopping and restaurants. You can also walk to The Kent School and even the Appalachian Trail. Getting Around The nearest train station is in Wingdale, NY around 15 minutes away. You can walk to most everything in Kent or drive past the town limits. Biking is also a common activity in the area. Other Things to Note The front and side porch are great areas to sit in the wicker furniture and listen to the birds. + More
rules: House Rules Be Kind, no smoking, no pets, please do not pull out the pocket door between the living and dining room. Please clean your dishes + More

description: Description The Space Want to get away from it all? Just 2 hours away from New York City. This house is the perfect getaway situated at the end of a small private road. Located in Sharon, Litchfield County, Connecticut which is in the foothills of the Berkshires. Sharon is the quintessential New England small town. Quiet and elegant and near everything you want to do. The house is a three bedroom home (queen, full and twin size beds) situated on two acres of open land. The location offers you 360 degree vistas that enable you to view sunrises and sunsets. Watch wildlife from the breakfast table and stargaze at night. Rolling hills and farmland surround you and nature's beauty is in your backyard! Just behind the property is an easy hiking trail that takes you to Indian mountain, a beautiful mountain where you can see Deer, Bluebirds and even Bald Eagles. On the property is a charcoal grill and outdoor dining furniture. There is also a swing, hammock, some sports equipment and games. The house was renovated in 2011 including a new kitchen and bathroom, the house is very clean and tastefully decorated with modern as well as local antique furniture and accessories. The house is suitable for families and the elderly. Just steps away is Mudge Pond, a tranquil lake with a beach and playground less than a mile down the road. Bring your bicycles and bike in the neighborhood or on the rail trail just minutes away. You are also just a few minutes drive from the historic towns of Millerton in Columbia County, Lakeville, Salisbury, Falls Village, Cornwall, Litchfield, and more! the NY and Mass borders are just minutes away in this ideal location in the northwest corner of CT. Nearby Attractions only minutes away: Butternut Ski Resort Thunder Ridge Skiing Apple Picking at Ellsworth Daisi Hill Farm Mohawk Mountain Ski area Catamount Ski area Salisbury Ski Jump and winter festival Hotchkiss School Salisbury School Indian Mountain School Camp Sloan Housatonic River with Fly fishing and rafting Covered Bridges Pick your own Farms Petting Farms Columbia County NY Great Barrington MA Lenox MA Tanglwood Jacob's Pillow Music Mountain Yale School of Music Mahaiwe Performing Arts Center Tri Arts Theater Barrington Stage Company Berkshire Theater Festival Norman Rockwell Museum Willliamstown Theater Festival Mount Greylock Appalachian Trail Monument Mountain Hancock Shaker Village Mass MoCA Clark Art Institute Shakespeare and Company The Mount, Edith Wharton's House Williams College of Art The Red Lion Inn Ventfort Hall Sharon Audubon Center Action Wildlife Center Kripalu Yoga Center Limerock Racetrack + More
rules: House Rules Must be responsible, respectful of home and neighbors. Clean and non smoking. Please do not wear outside shoes in the house - slippers preferred! Please, no dirty dishes or food left and garbage must be bagged and left in the garage. Any questions - please ask! + More

about: Get Kissed by the Sun, Toes in the Sand and Relaxation at Hand!
description: Description The Space Oxoboxo Lake This cozy and newly renovated cottage sits on private Oxoboxo lake in Montville, CT. From the moment you walk into the cottage you see a wall of windows with a million dollar view of the lake. There are views of the lake from every window on 3 sides of the cottage. Once you come in you will find the cottage is nicely furnished inside and out. In the family room you have leather furniture, glass top tables, TV with DVD, stereo and in ceiling speakers. In the eat in kitchen you will find nice new concrete counter tops, plenty of cabinets, table with 4 chairs, dishwasher, stove, refrigerator, coffee maker, toaster and microwave. In the sun room you have a nice chaise lounge looking out at the lake. The bedroom offers a full size bed, wardrobe closet, night stand with alarm clock and lamp. The bathroom offers a stand up shower, toilet and sink. Hardwood and tile floors can be found through out the cottage as well along with a washer/dryer for your convenience. Once outside you will find a large deck with furniture and a Weber gas grill . Next you will see your very own private sandy beach, dock and fire pit. Since the lake has no motor restrictions please bring your boat or jet ski to enjoy some water sports, like tubing or skiing, or just relaxing. We also have a kayak and paddle boat you may use at your own risk with some life vest. Perfect for short term temp stays or vacation. Guest Access Beach, Kayak(s), dock, grill, fire pit, beach chairs, sun lounges, table and chairs on deck, umbrella, linens, beach towels. Interaction with Guests We meet guest (s) with the keys. We are not present during your stay. The Neighborhood Close to Mohegan Sun Casino, Foxwoods Casino, Shopping, and Parks. Getting Around Car needed. Other Things to Note This cottage has its OWN Beach, Dock, Firepit! We have kayaks to use and a great view. You can bring your own boat for your pleasure as well. Boat launch is nearby. + More
rules: House Rules The cottage is clean upon arrival. Please make sure the cottage is in the same clean condition upon departure. Please respect our cottage as if it were your own. Please respect our occupancy limit. Check in time is 3pm, check out time is by 10am. Parking is for only 2 cars only. Absolutely no Parties, family Bbq's, or events of any kind. Rental agreement must be signed. No Pets! Please ask for special pricing for longer stays. Must be 25 unless accompanied by parent. Price is for up to 2 persons. Max occupancy is 4, no exceptions. No Smoking. + More

about: This vintage Air Stream Trailer has been lovingly restored and is the perfect get away for a peaceful respite.
description: Description The Space Glamping at its Best! Situated in my private backyard off a country road, "Ms Amelia" is a 1975 Airstream Trailer. She is a graceful dame who has been thoroughly updated and refurbished. At 30 feet long, there is ample space. She provides a private bedroom with a queen size bed on a raised platform. The bathroom has a toilet, basin, a travertine floor and a cozy aromatic cedar-paneled shower. There is a large (well, large for a trailer!) closet to store your suitcase and clothes. In the living area, there is a marbled-topped kitchen counter, small refrigerator, air conditioner/heater and coffee maker. There is a small couch/futon and a chair. Bamboo floors throughout. This trailer is probably best for people 6 feet or under. Though I was told that those over 6 feet will usually know how to duck around the lights! Please note that Ms Amelia has a camping aspect to her. She is not a hotel room but is a charming trailer with all that that would imply, and is certainly gloried camping! She is 40 years old, which in trailer years is equivalent to 90+ years old. Please respect her and understand that, as with older individuals, she takes some care and kindness! Outside is a table and chairs and garden area for relaxing. Park in my driveway. There is also an outdoor shower with hot and cold water in my very private backyard. Wifi is available for your laptop or notebook. "Ms Amelia" is on a private country road, quiet and secluded, and my yard is a certified Wildlife Habitat. I feed the birds and have a lovely garden. At night you may hear the owls hooting or the buoys sounding on the water. Keep a lookout for the hummingbirds that feed outside the door. Pets, smoking, drugs are not allowed. Polite, reasonable behavior is expected. Quiet time is from 11 pm to 7 am. There is a 2 night minimum in the summer months. Off season there is a two night minimum during the weekends, one night during the week (Sunday through Thursday). Ms Amelia is not available to rent in the colder months - Dec. 1 though March 31. In the morning I will provide muffins or scones and fresh fruit. Coffee and juice is stocked in the trailer. Should you wish, I can provide a delicious dinner (vegetarian or fish) with wine for an additional $20 per person. The Borough of Stonington, chartered in 1651, is a beautiful and historic seaside village that is a couple of miles away. It has great restaurants, bars, shops and art galleries. Mystic is about 5 miles down the road, with shopping, coffee shops, bookstore, restaurants, Amtrak station, and bars. Mystic Seaport and Aquarium are about 5 miles away. There are opportunities for hiking, kayaking, biking, boating and exploring the shoreline. Watch Hill and the beautiful Rhode Island beaches are 20 minutes away. A wonderful vineyard with wine tasting is just down the road. Before booking, I would appreciate you setting up an AirBnB profile. Or send a message - I would like to get to know you a bit and be sure that this is a good fit. I look forward to hosting you! Guest Access You are welcome to use our backyard. We have a lovely gazebo to dine in, or you can play one of the many lawn games (Corn hole, Petanque, Croquet). Interaction with Guests I am available for all your needs. However, I respect people's privacy and will not disturb you unless absolutely necessary. The Neighborhood Ms Amelia is situated in my private backyard/garden on a country road. You will be surrounded by greenery and birds. Getting Around There is no convenient public transportation. A car is really needed to get around. Other Things to Note Ms Amelia is located on a country road in a wooded section of Connecticut. Please let aware that there may be ticks, mosquitoes and poison ivy on the property. I provide insect repellent and mosquito repellent lanterns. + More
rules: House Rules NO pets or smoking. Quiet time 11pm to 7am. Check in/out time is somewhat flexible. + More

about: Close to town; private & accessible. Enjoy tempurpedic bed, modern large bathroom.
description: Description The Space We offer a comfortable guest room with three twin beds and an oversized tile shower. There is central air conditioning in the common areas, and each room has its' own heat and cooling controls. Guest Access We offer a comfortable Living room, a large dining area, multiple outdoor sitting and lounging areas in the Gazebo, on the sun deck, in the backyard or by the stream. Interaction with Guests Arrive when you can, and leave when you'd like. We'll have breakfast set up to accommodate your schedule. We are available to provide direction, suggestions, or assist with time sensitive issues. The Neighborhood We are conveniently located near Salisbury School, Hotchkiss School, Berkshire School, Lime Rock Park, Mohawk Mountain, Music Mountain, Twin Lakes, Lakeville Lake, the Appalachian Trail, fine hiking trails and preserves, and many casual and fine dining establishments, on an easily accessible road. Getting Around There is a local livery service as well as private transportation options. If you need transportation to or from Bradley International Airport, Westchester or Albany Airport, or the Wassaic or Dover Plains train station, we can arrange it for an additional fee. Other Things to Note There is wifi and internet access. + More

about: Nature Lovers Paradise! Light filled, private, peaceful, fantastic mountain views! Unique 7 & 1/2 acre property.
description: Description The Space Lie in bed and watch the sun come up over the mountains. You may see deer, fox, eagles, hawks or wild turkeys as well! Over sized living room with a wood burning fireplace surrounded by three sliding glass doors to let the sun shine in! Mountain and nature views from every direction! Near Candlewood Lake, the largest lake in Ct. with over 5,400 acres and 60 miles of shoreline. Great recreational area, offering some of the best all-season sports and activities.( Swimming, boating, snowmobiling, ice skating). Property is located approximately 1 1/2 hours from New York City, and about 1 1/4 hour from Hartford, Berkshires, Tanglewood. Close by are beautiful parks : Mohawk Mtn 30 mins., White Memorial State Park 25 mins.( canoe here early in the day to see the beavers!), Kent Falls State Park 20 mins, Mt. Tom State Park 20 mins., Appalachian Trail 12 mins. , Bulls Bridge Falls, 12 mins. 10 minutes from New Preston and Lake Waramaug. Raft, kayak, or canoe the Housatonic River or the mighty Shepaug River! The Kent School, Canterbury School, and South Kent School are all within a 12 minute drive! Close to restaurants, town, theater, stores, mall. Stunning Fall Foliage on and surrounding property. Wineries, Wine Trails, farms, orchards. Travel scenic roads, stroll through quaint and historic villages, shops, festivals, country fairs, flea markets, antiques, museums. Hike numerous trails, preserves, overlooks, waterfalls, covered bridges, wildlife sanctuaries. Spring and Fall foliage tours. Winter snowmobiling, ice skating, ice fishing, and ice boats, cross country and downhill skiing, snowboarding. Much to do in this beautiful location, information and maps provided. Owner is a reiki and reflexology practitioner, and can offer therapy for an additional fee. Massage therapist within a 5 minute drive! Ah, paradise! ( This is a no smoking, no pets allowed rental.) Guest Access 1 or 2 bedrooms, living room, kitchen, full bathroom, outdoor sitting area. Interaction with Guests As much as you would like! The Neighborhood This is on a designated scenic road, in a scenic area! + More
rules: House Rules No pets, no smoking. Maximum 4 guests. + More

description: Description Interaction with Guests We can be as invisible as desired. about: Cozy accommodations with private bath located close to Cheshire Academy, Choate, Quinnipiac and Yale. Centrally located for the traveler seeking to explore all of that which the Nutmeg State has to offer. Delicious breakfast each morning!
description: Description The Space You are our only guest so you receive our undivided attention. The room is cozy with gleaming oak floors, custom window treatments which allow you to 'black out' the room, a full antique bed and and antique furniture, along with a private bath. You can work at the secretary desk, lounge on the love seat or just collapse into the top quality (URL HIDDEN) electric stove adds to the ambiance... Guest Access Cheshire Academy, Choate, Quinnipiac, Yale, Pilot Pen Tennis, the Travelers Golf Championship, Farmington Canal Linear Trail...midway point between Boston and New York City...superior option to hotel accommodations! Interaction with Guests I love hosting guests so I will engage you to the level that you seek; if you enjoy socializing, you got it. If you prefer quiet solitude, I will respect that...and any level of interaction in between. I'll be there to help settle you in and see you off when you depart. The Neighborhood While our house is not 'in town', it's only about a mile from shops and restaurants. Getting Around Parking off street in our driveway. We live on the side of a 'mountain' so be aware of deer and other wildlife. Other Things to Note Please come to the front door only. The back door is for family. Wi-Fi available. No TV in the room at the present time. A home made hearty breakfast will be served in the morning. Unfortunately, no children are allowed. + More
rules: House Rules As you are a guest in my home, I will give you the very best in service and accommodations. In return, I expect courtesy, no loudness and no unreasonable requests. Pets may be considered on a case by case basis. NO SMOKING. + More

about: Cozy 2 bedroom, 1.5 bathroom house fits 2-4 comfortably and is situated in the historic area of Fair Haven [in New Haven] right near the banks of the Quinnipiac River. Off street parking and driveway available. Enjoy comfortable surroundings and open floor plan on the first floor with gourmet kitchen, farm sink and new appliances and a half bath. Bedrooms are upstairs with a full bath. A washer/dryer is in the basement. There is easy access to 91 and 95.
description: Description The Space Please message me via AirBnB about this space before making a reservation. I would like to make sure we are a good fit first. Thank you. This house has been totally recently renovated and has all new appliances, new bathroom fixtures and two zone natural gas heat. It's 1200 sq ft so not too big but very comfortable for two to four people. I rent the whole house on a weekly or monthly basis. I rent rooms by the night. Guest Access Full access to house and outside areas. Enjoy the kitchen, fully stocked with kitchenware, dishware and some stock foods like spices and oils. Washer and dryer in basement. Interaction with Guests The house is your own private space. More than 4 people will be an extra charge. If 2 people, you can use one of the bedrooms for an office during your stay. The price includes ALL utilities. The Neighborhood Fair Haven is an old fashioned neighborhood with lots of great old homes and wonderful waterfront views. LOCATION It's located in the eastern part of the city of New Haven, Connecticut located between the Mill and Quinnipiac rivers, and by I-91 (in the vicinity of Exit 7/8). The main through routes of the area are Grand Avenue, Blatchley Avenue, and Ferry Street. The northeast section of the neighborhood is also known as Chatham Square. Fair Haven is located about two miles east of the New Haven Green. Check out Chatham Square Neighborhood Association for more info on our awesome community! (URL HIDDEN) HISTORY Prior to its founding by European settlers, Fair Haven was used by the Momauguin group of Quinnipiac Native Americans for (URL HIDDEN) is said that in 1639, when Captain Richard Russell first viewed the harbor, "The sight of the harbor did so please the Captain of the ship, that they called it a Fayre Haven." In 1640, the area currently called Fair Haven was named 'The Neck'. Fair Haven was originally a village formed in 1679 to house industrial workers, as the area was a source of oysters and other products of the rivers and nearby harbor. It is said to have produced almost 5,000 gallons of oysters per day in season when at its peak. Besides oyster houses, manufacturing plants and a brewery were established. In the beginning, Fair Haven could only be reached by boat, on foot, or on horseback. In time, dirt roads were laid, for use by horse-drawn vehicles. Getting Around Public transportation is right around the corner and downtown New Haven is ten minutes by car. Easy access to 91 and 95. We are very close to a marina and there is a lovely Boat House Cafe open for breakfast lunch and dinner within easy walking distance. Other Things to Note There is a great wine store across the Grand Avenue bridge called Grand Vin. Lovely River park down the street for fabulous views of the river and homes. Boat House Cafe down Front Street on the water. Neighbors are friendly and we have a neighborhood association called Chatham Square where we continue to improve the area and build relationships. Unique place to live. + More
rules: House Rules Full house rental details to be discussed in person. Regular room rentals: Check in is between 5-10pm, later check must be agreed upon before booking. Check out by 12pm. Smoking OK outside. Pets are not allowed. No loud noise after 10pm. You may keep food in the refrigerator but you must take it with you when you leave. Prefer no shoes in the house. Backyard firepit and outdoor space available. Life is very busy so I do not normally allow for inquiries on the day of arrival so please book at least 48 hours ahead. Thank you! + More

about: It is absolutely gorgeous here and has so much to offer. We have a lovely downtown village with shops and eateries within an easy walk. Lake Waramaug , numerous hiking trails and private schools are all here. Enjoy outdoor activities or antiquing!
description: Description The Space This is a very comfortable apartment in a great location. The kitchen is very easy to use, is equipped with everything you will need and has an eat in dinette. The living room is roomy with tall ceilings. One of the two couches is comfortable if you did need to have a third person visit. The bathroom, although small has a nice tile shower and is very clean. The bedroom has a double bed which is very comfortable(URL HIDDEN) Guest Access The apartment has a private entrance, parking and nice side yard. Interaction with Guests I have never rented this apartment before, but am more than willing to give you my time and any information that you may need. The Neighborhood This apartment is in such a lovely area that will let you enjoy many activities. We have a lovely Village with many shops and restaurants within a short walk. NYC is just 1 1/2 hours away and Bradley Airport is 1 hour away. We have numerous private schools in our area. Rumsey Hall, Cantebury, Gunnery, Deveraux, Kent School and more. Lake Waramaug is a moderate walk or 5 minute drive, the famous Mayflower Inn is 10 minutes away. There are many opportunities for hiking with Steep Rock, which is right in the neighborhood, having 35 miles of beautiful trails. The Appalachian Trail is about a 10 minute drive. Biking is enjoyed by many as is birding and kayaking. Getting Around There is no public transportation available in the immediate area, but I may be available to drive you if needed. + More

about: Private ensuite bedroom with private bath located in the peaceful Silvermine section of Wilton, CT, and just one hour outside of NYC.
description: Description The Space This two acre property is located on a quiet cul-de-sac street in the Silvermine section of Wilton. The large bedroom, which features a queen size bed, is located above the garage and is largely separated from the rest of the house, assuring complete privacy. The guest controls the heating and cooling of the room, and the bathroom has heated floor tiles. The large suite has both a desk and a leather sofa for the business or leisure traveler. Guest Access Guests will have access to the kitchen and living areas. They will also have access to free WiFi, off-street parking, and our two acre property which includes a screened-in porch, a deck, a patio, and a tire swing. Interaction with Guests As often as desired. The room allows for the guest to come and go as they please, however, I am a 26 year resident of Wilton and can offer insights of the town and surrounding areas. The Neighborhood The 5000 sq ft property is located on a quiet cul-de-sac in Wilton. Getting Around Unfortunately, the only way to get around in our area is by using car. We do offer off-street parking and the train to the NYC is a short ten minute drive away. + More

about: Classic 1930s beach cottage available for 30+ DAY RENTALS only -- the perfect place to unwind and settle in for a long break......
description: Description The Space NOTE: although our listing displays a 14 nights minimum stay, it is only available for 30+ night rentals. (It is listed as 14 nights because it does not show up on the Airbnb browser if a 30 night minimum stay is noted. I'm sorry for any confusion this may cause.) A classic 1930s beach cottage with an uncluttered interior, beautiful light, incredible views and an inviting deck. It's a great place to unwind with friends or just a special loved one. It's perfect for two couples as there's a bedroom and living area on each floor. But it's also a wonderful place for families, with lots of room to play inside and out. The cottage, recently re-constructed and furnished by local artists, has an open floor plan and casual furnishings. In addition to a bedroom, the first floor has an open kitchen, eating and living area that opens out onto a large deck overlooking the water. A second bedroom with dressing room and a spacious living area comprise the second floor. The recently renovated bathroom has a rainfall shower head and pebble shower floor. When the temperature dips, a wood stove provides warmth and adds to the charm. The upstairs living area has a daybed which can be used for a fifth guest. You'll find yourself on the deck at all hours. It's a fantastic place to relax and enjoy a drink and the view. [ NOTE: When Hurricane Sandy stormed through our region, it ripped our deck off. We won't have the deck fully repaired until this fall. In the meantime, we've replaced it with a smaller deck which you see in the photos above. Luckily the rest of our cottage is fine and is as shown in the photos. ] Walking and biking are favorite past times. Sailing, wind-surfing, golf, fishing, and bird watching are other popular activities. Make sure not to miss a trip to Marnick's, a venerable seaside diner just down the way, for ice cream and family meals. Amenities include wireless internet, cable television, dishwasher, gas grill, and parking for three cars directly behind the house. Quality 100% cotton linens and towels are included. The cottage is located only minutes off of interstate I-95, and is quickly accessible from Stamford to New Haven. Local train service from Stratford and Bridgeport to New York, Stamford, and New Haven is easily accessible. + More

about: Historic but thoughtfully renovated; while appreciating the 5 fireplaces & wide-board floors, you will also enjoy the deep soaking tubs in the floor heated bathrooms. Is in a beautiful garden-filled setting next to hiking trails. Gourmet breakfast.
description: Description The Space The Abigail Room faces South and East. You will see our front yard and entranceway from the four 9 over 6 windows on both walls. Beautiful Asian artifacts decorate the room that you will enjoy viewing while propped up on the down pillows and under the down duvet or in the wing-back chair. Many books and magazines are available for your reading pleasure in the bookcase in the room. Guest Access You will have access to the newly renovated bathroom shared with any guests across the hall. The skylight in the bathroom will bring light into either the shower or soaking bath. Your feet will be warmed by the radiant heat, as well. You can choose to read in the library downstairs or enjoy the fire in the living room in winter or the porch swing in the other months of the year. Breakfast will be served on the porch or in the dining room, whichever you prefer. Tea/coffee is available at all times. Enjoy the plants and animals in garden and on the farm. Interaction with Guests Jasmine and I will be happy to tell you about the attractions, food, performances, and other goodies in the area. We'd love to sit and talk with you about our individual adventures or leave you to yourselves if that is what you prefer. The Neighborhood Henrietta House is located in Ashford, CT, which just celebrated its 300th anniversary. We are located in the "Quiet Corner"/Last Green Valley of Connecticut, one we consider to be one of the most beautiful in the area. Many adventures await you here: hiking, biking, swimming, kayaking, horse-back riding among other nature loving activities. In addition, antiquing, gourmet dining, professional performances, sporting events, wine-tastings, as well as more down-home activities, such as local fairs, pick-your-own, and farmers' markets can be found within minutes of our house. One very bright spot on our event calendar is "Walktober." Please visit in October to take part in the many, many activities offered by the towns and villages throughout our region. Getting Around To really enjoy all that our area offers, a car is pretty necessary. However, hiking trails are adjacent to the house and biking can take you into other areas fairly close by to explore. With advance notice and a few dollars, we might be able to pick you up from the bus, train station, or airport. Buses run from nearby Storrs to Hartford and from Hartford buses and trains are available to take you anywhere you desire. Other Things to Note We are just beginning to farm our property and have recently planted over 100 blueberry bushes, 50 strawberry plants, 4 fruit trees, and multiple herbs. We plant a big organic garden every year and will be adding more fruits and veggies this next year. We also plan to have animals so that we can grow most of the food we serve for our breakfasts and snacks. You are welcome to help out if you care to but get our permission before starting. + More
rules: House Rules We allow no smoking in the house or close to it and especially not in the barn. We love to have visitors and expect you to act courteously as we will act toward you--this includes quiet time between 10 pm and 8 am. + More

description: Description The Space Enjoy beautiful Litchfield County, CT from a well appointed art filled, one bedroom cottage that perches on a hill with sunset views of Hatch Pond. Access is by private road. Open floor plan in the living/dining/kitchen area with new stainless appliances. Very quiet and relaxing decor with large windows looking out to wooded areas. Front porch deck overlooking Hatch Pond, shade garden, hammock, stone patio area, parking place for two vehicles, privacy, and four short miles to the town center of Kent. Stone fire place, hardwood floors, indoor dining area, gas grill and table for four on front deck during late spring to late fall. Kent is a four season area. Winter brings both down hill and cross country skiing, spring beautiful gardens, hiking and biking, summer fishing and swimming, and fall beautiful changing of the leaves, mums and pumpkins. Lake View Cottage is near many boarding schools including South Kent school the next street over, fishing, biking, on CT wine trail, Appalachian Trail, near Kent Falls and Bulls Bridge, antiquing on scenic Route 7, swimming in Lake Waramaug, great restaurants and shops in Kent, CT. This is the perfect place if you want quiet and relaxation, to read, sit by the fire or on the deck depending on the season, and just get away from it all. Kent is very low key and casual. If you are looking for night life or craziness this is not the place you want to book.......... Must be okay with cats as two sometimes live here.............. + More
rules: House Rules The cottage is not really appropriate for children but please feel free to inquire. Once Lake View Cottage is booked there is an extensive list of neighboring places to go and suggestions. Pets of any type cannot be accepted and please do not book more than two months in advance. Many thanks. + More

about: Sun filled Glass River Retreat - addition to a 250 Year Old Home with full bed & fast Internet. Perfect for 1-2 people visiting for NYC biz/pleasure. Easy walk to waterfront and kayaks. Easy off street parking. 2 m to train & Greenwich restaurants.
description: Description The Space This sun filled glass greenhouse guest room looks out over a nearly one acre organic maple grove forest, fledgling chutney orchard, and the Mianus River. We can offer sunset paddling as well as hilltop views over the top of an evolving organic veg/fruit/herb garden to the 52 acre river beyond. The Cozy Glass House Companion Listing comes to life in the warmer weather. The plants then migrate to their winter digs and guests can continue to enjoy a greenhouse guest room experience throughout the winter. This River Room is attached to the house and has centralized radiant heat. It is a wonderfully light place to rest and/or use as a base for exploring the area. Come to this gracious home on a peaceful, spacious property that is convenient to a wide range of ways to spend your time. Airbnb earnings will be donated to the ongoing water-energy research underway at the Burleson Institute. As a result, guests may engage with the river at the same time as be able to deduct taxes for contributing to our 501(c)3 educational nonprofit organization. While the house is a 250-year-old barn used to bring potatoes by boat to New Amsterdam, it is newly renovated and the glass sunroom is perfect for one or two people. The house is solar powered! We tap our maple trees and can offer solar maple scones on some weekends. The nearby Mianus River Gorge is the first piece of land ever set aside by the Nature Conservancy. The next stretch of water is owned by the water company and well preserved from regional development. We benefit from being able to wander out the backdoor and walk down a 2-minute path to our dock where we spend many afternoons kayaking down to where the river opens into Cos Cob's harbor on the Long Island Sound. The wildlife benefits from an aquatic habitat that qualifies as backup drinking water and that features a fish ladder at the edge of the small hydro dam that helped power train transport to and from NYC. Herons and other shore birds often sit on the dam to fish for dinner. Guests have a full bed. Water is from the river (via the water companies state of the art purification process). We have a wide array of books if you would like to explore birding, wildlife, global geopolitics, sustainability, and literature. We offer a days worth of coffee, tea, sugar, and milk and a few staples if you arrive late and have not had an opportunity to buy food. We are easy going, kind people who would like to make sure you feel welcome and cared for in what has been for us a wonderful place to feel peaceful. We write and curate rotating water, energy, climate Institute expos on behalf of our nonprofit Burleson Institute. We also gather information on watershed wildlife and contribute to Cornell's northeast bird count. We donate 20% of proceeds from hosting guests to our Burleson Institute's sustainability research initiatives. Feel free to count the wildlife you see while kayaking. By volunteering with the wildlife citizens science service learning and staying with us, you can help advance our energy-climate-water network of evolving best practices. Our neighborhood is not free from lawn services using mowers but it often is a tranquil get-away while also offering a trampoline from which to explore foodie and cultural options galore with substantial boating, hiking, fishing, etc. Our front step is a historic mill stone and our rooms within offer an eclectic array of artwork, instruments, and much loved multi-media research library encompassing: naturalist, international law, and innovative ways to respond effectively and equitably to the pressing issues of our era. We consider one or two members of our wildlife community semi-wild pets given their peaceful presence in our backyard. Peter and Ben Bunny can often be spotted chomping on grass in the backyard. Blue Herons and Egrets take refuge at our dock as do migrating families of ducks. Baby ducklings and swan signets are common in the late spring and summer and turtles can be seen sunning themselves on rocks and logs until the river freezes and makes way for cross country skiers, skaters, and ice fishermen. Enjoy our solar loft library including great artwork, books, instruments from around the world, and music recordings. David is fluent in Spanish and Betsy creatively conversant. We can offer use of a portable DVD player / and a range of films as well as internet. Shopping for groceries ranges from a Shop and Stop 2 miles away to Trader Joes, Fairway, and Whole Foods within 10 miles. The town excels at offering foodies an exquisite range of culinary opportunities. We would be happy to share our favorites (a seafood restaurant around the corner from the Norwalk Maritime Center where we like to see the latest Imax film. We also like picking up famous CT pizza from Pizza Post (better than Mystic Pizza) and having picnics at the beach. Folks have been enjoying the Little Pub, Mumbai Times, Louie's, Thai Basil Restaurant, Meli-Melo, and Versailles. Crossing over to the NY Historic Hudson Valley or hop a train into NYC changes the flavor of the culinary and cultural offerings. We often prefer to experiment with our garden harvest and CSA organic veg box by making curries, stews, chilies, chowders, gazpacho and the like. Our maple syrup cookbook is expanding into a solar cookbook and international cookbook... all still evolving. The glass house features a solar cooker for you to have fun with if the weather permits. Alternatively, you can bring back goodies and store them in the solar powered DC fridge. Backup house power is also available for the boat batteries that run the hilltop amenities. For anyone who lived through Superstorm Sandy, Katrina or their siblings, we seek to offer hands on innovation opportunities with resilience resources. Solar power has cut our electric bill in halve and a separate off grid array allows solar glass house guests a unique glamping experience. Enjoy Greenwich downtown pedestrian marketplace with outside eateries, interesting shops, and a small farmer's market on Saturdays (other towns in the area have farmer's market days throughout the week). There are many fine restaurants to choose from, and enjoy NYC's vibrant arts scene, with museums, galleries, and dozens of music and performances daily. There are very few places to stay in the area that have the rare combination of kayaking off a waterfront dock in the backyard as well as easy train access into NYC and a cosy comfy bed at a reasonable cost. Plush bedding and fluffy spa towels allows guests to have a soft energy footprint in style. Guest Access We offer local riverbank honey, muesli, and fruit. Bed sheets, towels/washcloths, shampoo/soaps, and a few dishes/utensils are provided in a creative manner that hopefully will make you smile at the choice and layout of amenities. Our sun room also serves as the institute library's international collection. Generally, we would like to keep the guest list to 2 as we already wear many hats with consultancy and NGO energy-climate work. We have a great deal of experience hosting United Nations and nonprofit folks since we moved to our beloved river in 1981. We have more than enough to do as authors publishing on strict deadlines but are also happy to offer any expertise on the area. David's wife, Nan can out-kayak all of us put together and is wonderful at spotting birdlife, having been an Audubon teacher naturalist since 1991 and Nature Conservancy naturalist prior to that. Yet, she is now creatively fishing for words at almost 80. She will speak of getting the soup out of the trees when discussing our maple syrup. We seek to model resilience gracefully. One private parking space will be marked with the Airbnb logo. There is a safe area to store bikes and storage of one or two bags. In addition to games/puzzles, we can offer hammock, tetherball, zimzam tennis pole and kayaking. We might also be willing to rent out our waterproof cannon camera for wildlife photography if it is not needed for institute activities. David is generally around while Nan and Elizabeth are often outdoors in the late afternoon. The doorbell is on the outside of the entryway rather than right next to the front door. Interaction with Guests When we travel we enjoy unique, comfortable, convenient lodging experiences. When hosting, we strive to offer the same. We have explored all 50 states in the US and a good portion of the world (over 60 countries). We greatly enjoy being out in nature and hosting the kind souls that have graced this retreat since 1981 (while we are new to hosting through Air bnb). We often keep to ourselves and are quiet but are happy to offer ideas for activities in the region. We often are engaged in independent projects including Bu(URL HIDDEN) but also really enjoy sharing ideas for things to do in the area (e.g. NYC museums, nature preserves in New England, boat trips, etc.) We enjoy a bit of gardening, plant knowledge, wilderness wandering and wildlife photography. We can chat over cups of Ben and Jerry's or maple scones... and can point out good coffee shops, restaurants, deli shops that can prepare picnic sandwiches for a day in the woods or on the water. As we live on site, we can be available to help and give any recommendations you might like to have - we've lived here for over 30 years and know the area. The Neighborhood Relax and unwind in this back bank river hideaway. Quiet, family-friendly neighborhood, where folks walk dogs, jog, etc. I love the neighborhood as it is walking distance to wooded parks with extensive trails for hiking, cycling, and cross country skiing. The river is stocked with trout and many wading fly fishermen brave the chilly Feb. waters in late winter/early spring. This extensive forested trail system encompasses over 300 acres of woods. You would not know that you are 30 miles from the heart of NYC. Yet, there are one or two renovations underway in the neighborhood. Coastal views can be enjoyed at the Cos Cob Park year round and with open access to Greenwich beach in the winter and access with purchased day passes in the summer. We have some of these passes available at the house. Stunning sunsets over Long Island Sound can be enjoyed while picnicking out at the beach. Many folks dock boats in Cos Cob Harbor, both seasonally and as they rock hop up and down the Atlantic Coast. Cos Cob's fish shop, cheese shop, artisan smoothie shop, tea house, farmers market and quiet historic neighborhood streets allow for a peaceful yet cosmopolitan get away without a substantial trek from regional hubs. The town is celebrating its 375th year in 2015 and has several revolutionary era museums including the Bush-Holly House and Putnam Cottage. Science and art exhibits can be viewed at our Bruce Museum and National Audubon Center as well as in NYC (my favorite is the Frick collection of Dutch art for its use of light and contrast). Visitors often alternate days in the big apple with relaxing seafood forays up the Connecticut coast, stopping at the Norwalk Maritime Center www.m(URL HIDDEN) to see marine life of Long Island Sound, including loggerhead turtles, sea horses, tiger sharks, and harbor seals. A ferry ride can take visitors to tour a historic lighthouse. In addition to Native American, naturalist, maritime, and revolutionary / colonial cultural opportunities, this area has become a diverse cosmopolitan community (despite still calling itself a town). The students at Greenwich High School speak over 35 languages. Lonely Planet notes that the "southwestern corner of Connecticut, otherwise known as the Gold Coast, was once home to potato farmers and fishermen until 19th-century railroads brought New Yorkers north. With their blue-chip companies they transformed Fairfield County into one of the wealthiest regions in America with the affluent town of Greenwich at its heart." One of our favorite summer activities is to take a ferry out to Great Captains Island and/or Island Beach to enjoy Long Island Sound then return and kayak/swim on the Mianus River. We cross country ski and skate the river (chatting with ice fishermen) and surrounding woods in the winter and into the spring. Daily hiking and swimming at base camp inspire us to do extensive outreach in our areas of humanitarian and climate coordination globally. We find Cos Cob a wonderful place from which to mix all of these experiences together. We have been known to muck out to the far reaches of the beach for shell fish then dash home to put on suits to attend heads of state negotiations at the United Nations. Feel free to fold into our sustainability initiatives at our institute headquarters, meditate along the river bank, or day trip up and down the coast. Getting Around Restaurants, nature centers/trails, arboretums, farmer's markets, sailing, swimming, kayaking, theatre, museums, high end shopping, and movies are all available within several miles. It's a 10 minute cab ride to the train station and then a 50 minute Metro North train ride to Grand Central Station (jumping off point for NYC fun). Check out weekly events posted by Timeout New (EMAIL HIDDEN) Many guests take a taxi to and from JFK or other regional airports. If city savvy and not pressed for time, hop the train into Grand Central and then cross the street to the express airport buses for Newark, JFK, or Laguardia (they leave from slightly different streets within a few blocks from Grand Central Station (costs under $20 one way for the bus while the train depends on whether one catches a peak or off peak train but will generally set one back $15 one way.) A faster, easier way of reaching the airports includes several shuttles that leave from hotels (including my standard approach of taking the Red Dot Shuttle from Greenwich Hyatt which leaves roughly every two hours throughout the day.) Buses become less useful in Greenwich beyond the main arteries. Amtrak express options stop at nearby Stamford station, which is a roughly $12 taxi ride away. We have maps for planning road trips north, south, or west. We can download nautical maps in the eastward direction or help determine coastal ferry schedules. Other Things to Note Very cozy and close to the beach and town. Perfect for a weekend getaway. The property is a river bank National Wildlife Federation Nature Preserve. Marina, Water Club, Greenwich Racket Club, Tennis, and Golf are all within 2 miles. 15 minute walk (5 minute drive) to beautiful 300 acres natural reserve. This sun filled room commands a gorgeous river view. Bring layers as New England weather can be variable throughout the day and from season to season. We cross country ski the river and woods in winter, tap maple trees in spring, kayak as long as there is a free channel of open water, and swim from June to September. Guests fish and shellfish, hike, boat inland and coastal waterways. There are a number of restaurants that will deliver. Otherwise, we would advise a car unless a half mile walk to restaurants is enjoyable for you. While close proximity to the city and easy safe parking for a car, we are neither remote wilderness nor urban. There are one or two renovations underway in the neighborhood. We are a unique river front with easy train access to mega NYC cultural and foodie offerings while also offering our backyard dock from which to launch kayaks. This is a suburban area where public transport is at least a mile walk. Great birding (esp. since we have no pets so are pet allergy friendly - anyone allergic to maple forests should strategize accordingly.) The glass house is a colorful tiny clear glass cabin (with optional curtain screens) perched at the top of a glacial erratic outcropping that has evolved into a rock garden, which looks over a large sunny lawn and forested river bank. It is about 80 sq ft so compare it with a tent rather than a hotel room experience) but is well finished with a very comfortable full bed. It is cozy, creative, and clean. It also has electricity and an electric space heater. The inside river room glass greenhouse is overflow for the glass house (in the warmer months) for families that bring a third person (glass house only fits 1-2). We generally block the river room listing in the summer but occasionally list it so do check with us. It is often listed throughout the cooler season. Five minute drive to Cos Cob egg/bacon sandwiches or elegant tea house meals served in high style (pastries, 4 tiers of tea sandwiches, and perfect espresso). 10 minute drive to Greenwich Ave. restaurants and other attractions. Greenwich is known for its vibrant downtown full of many shops, restaurants for all budgets (we like eating gyros at John's concession at Greenwich beach looking out over the ocean and happy children playing in the sand and picking up sea stuff (drift wood, mussel shells, Irish Moss) The area has an active arts and music scene. + More
rules: House Rules We use the sunroom often for our own guests and we live on the property in a historic 250 year old barn built from American chestnut. We request that our guests be respectful of our quiet, peaceful neighborhood. (Quiet time from 9:45 pm to 8:45 am). We welcome our one or two chosen guests - not parties or loud behavior. Please park in front of the garage parallel to the road so we can keep the circular driveway free. We are not a hotel nor a bed & breakfast. This is our home and in the spirit of Airbnb we share our gorgeous waterfront with global travelers who seek to experience a unique sunroom sustainability retreat. We would be happy to exchange stories about global exploration or let guests enjoy our National Wildlife Federation nature preserve where it is easy to spot turtles, herons, egrets, king fishers, osprey, swans, ducks and an occasional bald eagle. This is a smoke/alcohol free property -- both inside and outside. Pets are not allowed (service animals are the only exception). Off street parking is available for one car in our driveway. This can be particularly important in the winter. If you would like to have one or two people over for a short time then please check with us ahead of time. We reserve the right to approve other people to avoid having gatherings that disturb kind neighbors. Check-in is at 3 pm and Check-out by 11 am. We sometimes can be flexible if you discuss your plans with us first. In the New England tradition, we generally take off our shoes and leave them in the mudroom by the front door or in the back entryway. We also expect folks to use water and energy wisely. Please check with us before lighting candles or fires of any kind as we take precautions against fire spreading. Portable barbeque grills may not be used on the property. We have a solar powered electric grill and may offer an outdoor wood fire in one of two outdoor fireplaces if there is not a local fire restriction due to overly dry conditions. We make sure there is a plentiful supply of water in the rainwater harvesting buckets and that the hose is turned on and ready for fire backup use. Fortunately, New England does not experience as many fire/drought issues as out west but we still respect the power of fire. Have a peaceful stay! Thanks, Elizabeth + More

about: Spend some time in a charming New England rural town. New Preston CT, a quick 90-minute drive from New York City, provides rustic charm and outdoor attractions, as well as shops and restaurants.
description: Description The Space The 7C Herb Garden Bed & Breakfast is a labor of love for Hansel & Alicia Collins (My parents). By way of Jamaica, they've lived in this house since 1968, and have been running the bed and breakfast since 2000. Situated on 4 acres in the Berkshire Hills and surrounded by fields and woods, it's easy to forget that New York City is only 2 hours away. Although it's close by to state parks, hiking trails and other outdoor activities, and only a short drive to shops and restaurants in New Preston and Washington Depot, it can be hard to move beyond a sunny spot in the yard or the shade of the maple trees. The bed and breakfast offers 2 spaces: The Suite is actually 2 adjoining rooms with 2 beds (one queen, one single) that share a full bath. The other space, "The Breeze", which is this listing, is one room with a queen bed and a private bath. Guests have full run of the property, access to the kitchen, use of the washer and dryer. There's free high speed WIFI in the rooms, but no TV. Your'e free to relax in your room or sit and chat with Alicia and Hansel. You have a choice of breakfast each and every morning, cooked to order, that's included with your stay. Any special requests should be made the day before to allow time for grocery shopping and preparation. Many guest choose a traditional Jamaican breakfast, but anything and everything from pancakes to waffles, omelets to oatmeal can be requested. This is New England, with rolling hills and old colonial towns tucked between orchards, farms and vineyards. You'll find numerous antique shops and small mom-and-pop stores, as well as cafes, restaurants and pubs. New Preston and Lake Waramaug are a short, 5-minute drive, and Washington Depot is about 10 minutes away. To explore the area, a car is a must. There's ample free parking. Pricing is as follows: $120 per night - double occupancy CANCELLATION POLICY: You will receive a full refund if you give us at least 7 days notice. Guest Access Guests have full run of the property, access to the kitchen, use of the washer and dryer. There's free high speed WIFI in the rooms, but no TV. Interaction with Guests Your'e free to relax in your room or sit and chat with Alicia and Hansel. You have a choice of breakfast each and every morning, cooked to order, that's included with your stay. Any special requests should be made the day before to allow time for grocery shopping and preparation. Many guest choose a traditional Jamaican breakfast, but anything and everything from pancakes to waffles, omelets to oatmeal can be requested. The Neighborhood This is New England, with rolling hills and old colonial towns tucked between orchards, farms and vineyards. You'll find numerous antique shops and small mom-and-pop stores, as well as cafes, restaurants and pubs. New Preston and Lake Waramaug are a short, 5-minute drive, and Washington Depot is about 10 minutes away. Getting Around To explore the area, a car is a must. There's ample free parking. Other Things to Note Pricing is as follows: $120 per night - double occupancy CANCELLATION POLICY: You will receive a full refund if you give us at least 7 days notice. + More

description: Description The Space A three bedroom house in a charming house in New Haven's Historic City Point District, mere blocks from the sound, and a short drive to downtown. The backyard includes a tiny forest. It is magical. You'll see. Outside parties and events allowed for a small fee. Please let us know the number of guests, time frame of the party, and occasion, and we will send a quote. Well behaved dogs considered for a fee, thanks to our large outdoor space. Other animals are considered on a case by case basis. Guest Access Guests will have access to the following amenities: Three bedroom, 1.5 bath House with: kitchen, dining room, living room, laundry in unit, and study space. Flexible check-in/check-out. -Furniture as viewed in the photographs -A full kitchen -Onsite parking, as well as street parking -Central Air and Heat throughout the house -Roof Deck access -Outdoor Barbecue Grill -Fire pit -Hammock -Washer/Dryer -Full bathroom -Private half bathroom Interaction with Guests You are welcome to email and text as much as needed. We are happy to help! If you see us in the kitchen, we'll say hello! We love meeting fellow airbnb-ers. (Really, we can chat as often or as little as you'd like. No pressure.) The Neighborhood Our neighborhood offers the best of New England: gorgeous, plentiful trees, Cape Cod style homes, and fresh sea food! We are right in the heart of New Haven's historic City Point District, blocks away from The Sound School, Pequonnock Yacht Club, Sage American Grill where you can go for fine dining, or Dockside Deli, when you're in the mood for more casual fare. Want flavors you're familiar with? Dunkin' Donuts, Dairy Queen, McDonalds, and Popeyes Chicken are conveniently walk-able in the other direction. If the time of year is right, you can watch the locals fishing on the pier. Getting Around Hop on a train from JFK, LGA, PVD, or BOS, or a shuttle from Bradley BDL and Tweed HVN. You can take a $10 taxi ride downtown in 6 minutes. There are also several bus stops and buses headed downtown throughout the day. + More

description: Description The Space Wilton family offers relocating families a great home-base during their search for a new home or international families a chance to experience life in an lovely American suburb while still being just an hour away from New York City. We are a family of 5 who live in the lovely Silvermine area of Wilton on the border or both Norwalk and New Canaan. Our home is a 4,000+ sqft midcentury modern ranch on 2 acres with a pond and a pool with hottub. Our home is walking distance to a quaint restaurant which offers breakfast and lunch everyday and dinner on weekend nights and The Silvermine Art Center, which offers classes to old and young alike. Great neighborhood for family walks or bike rides. I am a school teacher and would love to host international families this summer (July or August). We would consider other times but could offer much less attention and coordination of activities. Included in the price is: * A private room and bath with it's own entrance and off street parking. * Cot and or portacrib for up to 2 children. *All meals eaten at home and unlimited use of the main kitchen and food in the pantry. *Full use of extensive playroom and entertainment room (equipped for children from newborn to tween years) and outdoor play ground and pool. For international families I also offer coordination of activities during the week which could include: ******Shopping trip to an Outlet Center ******A day at the Westport Beach ******Children's day out at Stepping Stones Children's Museum or Stamford Nature Center ******Visits to local family events like story time in the library and free concerts in the parks. For an additional cost I would also be happy to: *coordinate transportation to and from our home. Depending on your arrival time, dates and location the round trip cost could be as little as $100 or as much as $350) *coordinate overnight stay in New York City and help you plan your visit. *Sign-up your kids for classes (ballet, sports, etc...) *Hire a babysitter (evenings out or time to go shopping) We have three girls (4, 10 and 12 years old) the eldest loves languages and knows a good deal of French and Mandarin. I can understand a bit of French but would prefer a family who is comfortable in English. My husband speaks much more than I do but he would only be home after 6:00 PM on weekdays. We also speak Spanish. Feel free to e-mail me with any questions. I can send pictures of our home and our family and would be happy to speak to you by phone or (website hidden). I know I would love to experience life like a real Parisian, italian or spaniard Family and have my children play with children their own age, that is why I would like to coordinate this experience for your family. Best regards, Margarita + More

about: This is a four bedroom apartment on the second floor of a Victorian 3 family home in Barry Square.
description: Description The Space Welcome to my beautiful apartment steps away from Trinity College, the Institute of Living and Hartford Hospital. The apartment is newly renovated and fully furnished with brand new furniture. There is a front and back yard, with a wrap around porch, perfect for barbequing and entertaining. Feel free to use the space for a gathering of friends, a party or a celebration. There are also two private terraces in the apartment, one with a beautiful view of the sunset overlooking the Trinity chapel. There is parking in the backyard for up to 9 cars. The house is safe and has a ADT security system with cameras. There are restaurants, grocery stores and shops near by, as well as public transportation. I hope you decide to stay here, please contact me if you have any questions. Guest Access Guest will have access to the front wrap-around porch and second floor front and back balcony both are furnished with a wicker patio set. Coin operated laundry machines are located in the basement. Up to four parking spaces can be reserved for guests. Guests are free to enjoy the backyard however they see fit as in a picnic, tossing around a ball of any kind, or just to hang out in general. The kitchen is furnished with a toaster oven, microwave, and coffee pot. If you require anything, or would like to request any sort of accommodations please feel free to ask. That is how we got a microwave in the unit. I love to always add improvements and make the place more inviting :). Interaction with Guests I'm available as need be, but I like to give guests there space. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is very close to downtown and a very convenient location to anyone working at any insurance company, in the convention center, at the hospital or in the college. Getting Around The main attractions, restaurants, theaters and bars are all downtown which is a five minute drive or about a 25 minute leisurely walk. We have the Bushnell Theater and Front Street Movie theater, fine dining at the Max's Resturant, Trumbell Kitchen, Salute and many more, bars such as City Steam, Black bar and other very popular locations. Aside from fine dining we have great ethnic eateries like Aladdin's (Mediterranean), Royal Masala (Indian), and Fire and Spice (Vegan) and many different Spanish, Chinese and American places. Lastly Dunkin Dounts is about three blocks away for early morning coffee and breakfast. Other Things to Note I welcome all inquiries and requests. + More

about: Spinnaker Apartments is located in historic Downtown Milford across from the harbor and walking distance to the Metro-North Train Station. Our apartments offer washer and dryers, fully equipped kitchens, and wall-to-wall carpeting.
description: Description The Space Compass Furnished Apartments at Spinnaker Apartments situates you in historic downtown Milford, across from the harbor and walking distance to the metro-north train station. A relaxing, peaceful and rejuvenating environment gives you the option to live with an entirely new perspective. Spinnaker Apartments with Compass include Spinnaker Square, Spinnaker Walk, and Spinnaker Wharf. Each of these properties offer apartments with washer and dryers in each unit and fully equipped kitchens. The harbor, shopping, restaurants, nightlife, parks, tennis and more are at your doorstep when staying at this desirable property. APARTMENT FEATURES - WALK-IN CLOSETS - WASHER/DRYER IN UNIT - CARPETING IN LIVING ROOM & BEDROOM COMMUNITY FEATURES - BEAUTIFUL HARBOR VIEWS - CLOSE TO SHOPS & RESTAURANTS - CLOSE TO TRANSPORTATION (MAJOR HIGHWAYS) - CONVENIENT TO TENNIS COURTS, PLAYGROUND, BASKETBALL COURTS, AND BASEBALL FIELD - FITNESS CENTER - PARKING AVAILABLE ** NOTE: VEHICLE INFORMATION IS REQUESTED WITH 1 SPACE INCLUDED. PARKING STICKER MUST BE ON CAR AT ALL TIMES - WALKING DISTANCE TO TRAIN STATION - LOCATED IN DOWNTOWN Guest Access Guests will have access to all of the amenities on the property including the Fitness Center located at Spinnaker Wharf. They also have access to the entire apartment. Interaction with Guests We will provide step by step interactions before, during, and after the reservation. We will provide move in and move out instructions in order for the resident knows exactly what to expect. The Neighborhood Situated in historic downtown, across from the harbor and walking distance to the Metro North train station, Spinnaker is every renter's first choice. Located very close to shops and restaurants, the Milford green, and post roads with tons to do! Watch the harbor come to life with the morning sun, walk out your door and relax by the docks as picture-postcard sunsets turn the skyline golden. Getting Around - Metro-North Train Station is located across the street - Close to Major Highways Other Things to Note -$1000 security deposit for 30 day or more stays -$200 cleaning fee for 30 day or more stays + More

about: We treat our guests as if we were the guests. We never liked staying in hotels/motels ourselves because we never new if the space was really clean. We really clean here so rest assured bedding is washed after each stay as well as the floors and bathroom. If you are visiting the area don't overlook The Old Sindelar Farm. Feel at home because we will treat you like family. Join us around the campfire. Many attractions close by for you to enjoy or relax on the deck.
description: Description The Space Located on the Old Sindelar Farm home of a great granddaughter of Elsie the Borden cow. It is clean and cozy with a small Koi pond out front and a nice deck out back. Use the outdoor charcoal grill. Guest Access The entire house. Interaction with Guests This is a duplex ranch and we are available next door if needed. Join us for a bon fire. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is quiet and in a country setting. This is The Old Sindelar Farm started anew with chickens, a pig (Macon Bacon) and our calf Midnight Red. Getting Around There is public transit, just ask. We have two small, local grocery stores as well as very nice restaurants, a theater and two golf courses in town. Other Things to Note House is furnished, a master bedroom with a Queen memory foam mattress and two bedrooms with double beds as well as a full size futon in living room. All have 1800 count sheets. Only small dogs are accepted. After several reviews that stated our water has a sulfur smell I installed a whole house filter system which has taken care of the problem. + More
rules: House Rules Absolutely no smoking in house and if outside please don't trash the butts on the ground. Please respect the quiet nature of the neighborhood. It has not rained much so we appreciate your being considerate with water usage. + More

about: Unique second floor, loft-style apartment in historic carriage house. Located in beautiful Wooster Square, close to Yale campus, downtown New Haven, train stations. Grocery store and farmers market in easy walking distance. Bedroom, separate office, and spacious living area could be all yours!
description: Description The Space This historic carriage house received an architectural merit award when it was renovated into loft-style apartments. Unique open-beam construction, a cupola, and immense windows create a light and spacious environment. Beautiful original hardwood floors in front room. Surprisingly quiet given its central location; set back from the street amidst lovely dogwood trees. --Large front room with futon (converts to double bed), fainting couch, comfortable armchairs, eating area, and fireplace. --Fully equipped, recently renovated (2013) galley kitchen with granite counters and dishwasher --Fully-renovated bathroom (2014) with stone tile floor and tub/shower combo; all-new fixtures! --Pleasant, light bedroom with *brand-new queen bed* (Sept. 2015) and separate, bright office both overlook a park Coin op laundry located on site. Guest Access Shared Yard / Garden, Air Conditioning (Window), Hardwood Floors, Stove, Dishwasher, Microwave, Washer / Dryer Access Coin Op, Fireplace (working) On street parking (with visitor permit, provided) Interaction with Guests I will not be present when you are, though I will be available should you need any advice. The Neighborhood Wooster Square is quite simply the best neighborhood in New Haven! Known as New Haven's "Little Italy," Wooster Square features some of the best pizza in the US. During the summer, there is a farmer's market just up the street. Getting Around Easy access to shops, theaters, and more! Walk to Yale and Downtown New Haven in mere minutes. Train stations with service to New York and Boston are also within walking distance. A public bus stop and a Yale Shuttle stop are located within half a block. Other Things to Note The place is spacious for 1 person and comfortable for 2. Keep in mind that you shouldn't mind hearing each other (open-beam construction = no interior ceilings, except for over bathroom). + More
rules: House Rules Please remove shoes, especially high heels! The antique wood floor is very soft No smoking inside; outside is okay as long as you clean up after yourself. No pets, please. Treat neighbors with respect; they are all wonderful people. Leave the place tidy. Housekeeping does not do dishes, so please be sure they're clean. + More
