about: Amazing victorian house in the trees. Drive under a covered bridge and see the house on a hill above the quaint town. There's three places to Ski one is right in town! A painstakingly preserved and decorated 3 story house with French mirrors, Moroccan lamps, and Persian carpets.
description: Description The Space As featured in New York Magazine! Amazing historic victorian (ca. 1870) in front of a stream, in Historic West Cornwall, right past the covered bridge, nestled over 3 floors on a small hill in the middle of the trees. There is no house like it. Retaining every historical feature. Oozes of charm & style. With a farmers market right across the street! The house has historic detail in tact, with new plumbing, heating, and electric. It has amazing furniture retaining a great historic feel while adding a lot of charm and style. It's perfect for artists and couples wishing a romantic get away from the city. The house is on 3 floors overlooking the stream and town, right over the covered bridge and minutes away from 2 restaurants, a coffee shop, antiques, and the Housatonic River. With a great garden and huge stone steps. Enjoy views of the creek from the front porch and from patio on the second floor. Located in a historic West Cornwall, right past the covered bridge on the Housantic River about 2 hours from NYC. Accommodates 4 people comfortably in 2 bedrooms in 1,400 square feet of space over 3 floors. - 2 bedrooms (1 queen bed, one queen 4 poster bed)  3rd floor extra single sofa bed - 1 old claw foot bathtub and separate toilette. No shower. - 1 main living room with huge cathedral ceiling - 1 historic kitchen, dining room, and fantastic day bed - 1 large front porch and patio on the second floor All utilities are included: Heating, hot water, electricity, wifi, Fully furnished. Pets are considered. No smoking. Linens/towels included. Washer/dryer. From the May 20th 2013 New York Magazine article "Even the drive to this three-story 1870s Litchfield County Victorian is picture perfect: Pass through a covered bridge and you'll spot it peeking through the leaves, perched on an oak-dotted hillside. The two-bedroom, one-bath house has undergone a top-to-bottom interior restoration and a systems overhaul, which means you can bask in period charm (bay windows, a claw-foot tub, exposed-beam ceilings) without forgoing the ease of modern conveniences (reliable plumbing and electricity). The dcor is a shabby-chic mix of plush velvet chairs, Shaker furniture, perfectly weathered Oriental rugs, and knickknacks from local haunts like Michael Trapp's antique shop (7 River Rd.; (phone number hidden)), just up the road. Fill your days with walks to the nearby stream, afternoon dips in Cream Hill Lake, and kayaking excursions on the Housatonic River." Most amazing, unique experience you can have in a truly character filled country house. The house is set on 1 acre, on small hill in front of a creek. About 3/5 the property is wooded on a hill. The sloped nature of the land combined with the woodland and water edges give the property a private feeling in summer, but with the walkable amenities of a country hamlet (post office, restaurant, caf, antique shop  all in view of the covered bridge). Nearby are the historic towns of Kent, Lakeville, Litchfield, Great Barrington, and Millerton. Guest Access Entire house. Front porch, second floor stone terrace, outdoor seating including 2 benches, 1 chez, 1 outdoor chair, and a small outdoor dining table. Interaction with Guests Happy to help with any questions. Mary our neighbor who helps to manage the house is there for you. The Neighborhood West Cornwall is right over the covered bridge. There is a farmers market across the street, Wandering Moose Cafe for breakfast, lunch, or dinner, and you are a short drive from at least 5 great towns. Lot's of great skiing in Catamount and Butternut! Getting Around It's a bit over a two hour drive from New York City. + More
rules: House Rules Keep the place as you found it. Garbage goes in the trash cans by the post office. Check in is at 4pm. Checkout is at 11am. Email and call Mary to arrange an arrival time. + More

about: My lovely 600 sq ft apartment, is located a few blocks from downtown Stamford if you are in town for business or simply enjoying the peace and quiet of the suburbs--this is the place! and its only 45mins to the heart of Manhattan.
description: Description The Space Occupancy is maximum of two people, but ideal for one person. I've owned this property for 8 years now, and I've put a little bit of my heart into making it a comfortable living space as possible. Its a perfect space for professionals visiting or working in the area. It is also a great location if you are visiting New York city as it's only 45 mins away on Metro-North (walking distance from downtown Stamford) Guest Access This is a one bedroom apartment. The living room can be used as a second bedroom, if you don't mind sleeping on the sofa. There is a full bathroom and the kitchen has all standard amenities and is available for guests to use. Gym is located in the basement. Interaction with Guests If place is listed, most likely I am traveling - but just an e-mail away. The Neighborhood Stamford is a vibrant, cosmopolitan and diverse city. The "little-big city"-- It's a 45 minute commute to NYC. Great restaurants, beautiful beaches and an overall safe city. Getting Around Walking distance to downtown (4 blocks), easily accessible to shops, restaurants, bus and train station, Metro- North will take you into the NYC in 45 min short ride! Close to I-95 (exit 8) + More

about: 1 bedroom, small sitting room ,good size bathroom and full kitchen. In quiet rural town. Near 2 state parks and walking distance to beautiful waterfall. Family friendly with pool and basket ball court. Beautiful setting for artistic persons getaway
description: Description The Space Furniture may be arranged to accommodate up to four guests. Two separate rooms each have their own access to a common bathroom. Guests have a private entrance from the outside. There is a washer and dryer which may be used by arrangement. The gardens are full of flowers in mid-late summer. Guest Access We have a old tennis court with basketball hoop at one end. We have a canoe which may be rented for day trips to nearby Huntington Park. 1 hour to beautiful Kent Water falls or Lake Waramaug Interaction with Guests We live on site. One of us is frequently working in the yard as the lawns and gardens require a lot of attention. We are available to answer questions and visit as much or little as guests desire. The kitchen in the main house is gluten-free and we enjoy sharing some of our gluten-free delicacies with guests who are so inclined. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is quiet, wooded, and is connected to miles of scenic roads which are perfect for country bike rides. Getting Around We are a 15-minute drive to the train to Penn Central Station, and a 30 minute drive from the train which takes you into Grand Central Station. The Port Jefferson ferry is 30 minutes away, and there is a wonderful grocery store 12 minutes away. Several fine restaurants are within a few minutes drive. Other Things to Note We are child-friendly. We have toys available for guests to use as needed. For guests staying for a full week, we like to provide a snack basket for your arrival. Please let us know your food preferences. + More
rules: House Rules The age restriction for boarders is 25 unless accompanied by parent. Sorry, no pets (we have pet allergies) or smoking. Minimum stay 2 nights + More

about: Warm and comfortable private home conveniently located within minutes of the railroad station, I95 and the Wilbur Cross Parkway. Ten minutes to New Haven and a bit over one hour to New York City.
description: Description The Space This home includes two bedrooms and one bathroom on the main level along with a large eat in kitchen, separate dining room, formal living room and large family room. Downstairs consist of a finished heated basement large family/play room, large laundry/workshop, two bedrooms and a fully bathroom with walk in shower. Some of these areas may or may not be made available to renters. Large three section deck off sliders to kitchen with built in hot tub. Relaxing screened in porch with sliders. Well landscaped private backyard with pool. (Not available off season-October thru May 31}. Guest Access Most all spaces will be available with the exception of one or two rooms in basement. Interaction with Guests Owners are always available by email, texting or phone. The Neighborhood Our home is located in a quiet residential neighborhood close to schools and churches. Within walking distance to downtown where one will find many interesting shops, restaurants and the Head of the Harbor where boaters are welcome to moor their vessels on an hourly basis or overnight. Getting Around Public transportation can be found only a few blocks away on the Boston Post Road. Amtrak along the Northeast corridor to New York and Washington South and East to New Haven, and Massachusetts is within walking distance to the Station. Other Things to Note Renters are responsible for all utilities. There is no hard phone line included with rent but cordless phones are available should renters choose to activate service. Desktop computer and printer available downstairs. + More
rules: House Rules Guest are expected to treat our home as they would there own home with respect and safety. Report any damage and/or problems immediately. No pets and no drugs. Cleanliness and general maintenance is very important and should be undertaken on a regular basis. + More

about: 3-floor colonial nestled among trees and water provides for a wonderful, relaxing, quiet stay. Walk to any of the resources you may seek: market, restaurant, bank, liquor store and more. Your room is characteristic of a boutique hotel.
description: Description The Space Beautiful, new-construction (read forced air central-heating and a/c, superb water pressure, "unlimited" hot water supply), luxury hotel-like room (see confirmation in reviews) with private en-suite adjoining bathroom. Access to home's "grounds" with stream, hammock, pond, deck with lounge chairs... Guest review selected quotes: "...far exceeds any hotel accommodations in the area.", "room with its connected private bath was comfortable and well appointed", "the room is like a Manhattan suite, we felt like in a luxury hotel...", "highly recommend this for anyone who likes the feel of a luxury hotel but would rather spend less for the same thing (or better)", "the room is super clean, cozy and with a really chic bathroom", "the Henkins' luxury suite provides chic comfortable accommodation that actually rivals a number of boutique hotels we have stayed at in Europe and the US recently"... These references say it better than I could ever convey. Read through more reviews to get an idea of the service side of one's stay here. Our aim is to please. You are close to the action with quaint South Norwalk's historical seaport area - which includes an aquarium and iMax theater. You also are just five minutes away from the boutique shopping of Westport. Train from Westport (nearest sta) is one hour from New York City's Grand Central Terminal. Features: WiFi Internet Access. Sun deck. Market, bank, pizza, nail salon, liquor store and restaurant in walking (3-4 blocks) distance. Shared access to all living quarters and professional-grade kitchen (Sub-zero, Wolf Stove, gas Weber Grill on deck). Custom requests welcome...need something special in your room, access to computer, computer VoIP or chat, printer, international calls, a ride to train station, NYC or airport? Let us know. We can often accomodate atypical requests - some at no charge. If you expect it in a luxury boutique hotel, we will try to have it for you. Guest Access You have access to your private room with en-suite bath as well as all the shared space of the home - of which there is a lot. Separate dining room, kitchen, living room, deck and grounds. Interaction with Guests You are welcome to mingle with us or spend all your time in private. Someone is typically around during weekdays. Again, I'll include some review excerpts here to give you a sense of the interactions with us in the home: "Julian and his family were fantastic!!", "Julian was a great host!", "Julian and Mariola were fantastic hosts, very friendly and did everything they could to make me feel at home...", "So glad I decided to go this route rather than stay in a hotel...", "it was such a pleasure meeting this great family. We would highly recommend this place to anyone. Overall fantastic choice for our first experience with airbnb. It truly surpassed our highest expectations!" Enough said, let us surpass your highest expectations. We will not be content with anything less! The Neighborhood The neighborhood is rather typical suburban with immediate access to the two major transportation arteries in the area. We are also 5 - 10 minutes from everything, such as train station, Westport shopping, historical SoNo (S. Norwalk), parks, playgrounds, beaches - we have it all. Getting Around There is a nearby (2 blocks) bus stop. And, all that you need is in walking distance. We can pick up and drop off from the local (Westport) train station. Other Things to Note Our personality and reason for doing this is to be able to share with others. Please look at our reviews and guidebook. You cannot find a better place or better value lodging in this area. + More

about: Private First Floor Apartment of an 1849 historical home in the heart of Middletown, CT. One block to Main street with many great restaurants, Wesleyan University & across from the public library. Lovely fenced in yard, ornately covered side porch.
description: Description The Space Full and private First Floor Apartment of 1849 Greek Revival Brick Home with Italianate detail. Wide floor boards, giant wood moldings, exposed brick in the beautiful and semi professional kitchen and floor to ceiling windows. This apartment features a spacious and lovely master bedroom with a decorative fireplace, plaster ceiling details and a Sleep Comfort California King size bed. A second bedroom/office features a twin bed and gets great light all day long. There is also a pull out couch in the living room with extra padding. All rooms feature heart wood floors, except the bathroom is tiled. Kitchen has a lovely bump out bay area with floor to ceiling windows featuring a round wooden table creating a cozy and beautiful eating area. The kitchen opens to the fenced in backyard with a patio and fire pit as well as areas of shade and sun. We have a quarter of an acre in the Downtown Village Historic District. The main entrance to the apartment is private on a covered side porch featuring wrought iron railing work and outdoor seating area. Guest Access There is a lovely large kitchen if you are a cook and want to prepare a meal you may do so. We ask you to clean up after yourself if you choose to do any cooking. There is an automatic dishwasher as well as detergent and other cleaning supplies under the kitchen sink. You are welcome to enjoy the yard as well as sitting on the side porch. You will have access to a shared laundry area. Interaction with Guests We are available to meet with guest and answer any questions. Although we are the owners and designed and remodeled this as our personal apartment space, we have moved to another house and desired to share this magnificent home with others. We are currently living in town and visit the house often. We love meeting new folks from all over and also respect that people may require or desire privacy. This is an independent apartment in a multifamily historic home. All other spaces are occupied with long term tenants who are all gracious and friendly. They enjoy meeting others as well and are happy to answer questions and engage in conversation if you see them. The Neighborhood Our home is located in the heart of downtown Middletown in the historic district just 3 blocks uphill from the beautiful Connecticut RIver. This home is on a less active, one way street conveniently situated just 1 block down from Wesleyan University which has a lovely campus as well as constant arts and cultural events. Our huge and amazing public library is on the corner just diagonally across the street, which has up to date movies, music, books, magazines and computer access. We are also just one block up from Main Street which features over 40 restaurants (Including Eli Cannons Pub, Orourke's Diner, Brew Baker's {bagels and coffee}, Klekolo for coffee and you'll find almost any style and nationality of food you can imagine) along with many boutique and other great shops. We have several funky coffee/cafes and even a Fine Resident Chocolatier (Roberto). Middlesex Hospital is just blocks away. And we have easy access to the smaller more rural surrounding towns. There are several great natural areas for hiking and swimming close by (Millers Pond, The Ridge Trail, Wadsworth). There is an artist community here that supports an artists walk on Main Street every first Thursday of the month. As well, we have Kid City Museum, Oddfellows Playhouse Theater, and Wesleyan Potters and a multiplex movie theater within short walking distance of the house. This is really a centrally located property for Middletown and also for Connecticut. We have easy access to Hartford, New Haven, the shoreline, the Casinos. We are half way between New York City and Boston. Getting Around Middletown is a Rebirthing city on the Connecticut River, just 15 miles south of the capitol city of Hartford and about 25 minutes north of New Haven. It is easy and comfortable to walk or bike around town but for further away trips a car is the best bet. We do have public transportation available on Main Street for in town travel (connections to the major cities) as well as to surrounding towns. But it is not the same or as complex as larger city public transit systems. Other Things to Note There is a lovely large kitchen if you are a cook and want to prepare a meal you may do so. We ask you to clean up after yourself with any cooking. there is a dish wash as well as cleaning supplies under the kitchen sink. You are welcome to enjoy the yard as well as sitting on the side porch. + More
rules: House Rules We have a no smoking in the house or within 100 feet of the entries and windows of the house. If you do laundry we ask that you use our unscented laundry detergent and dryer balls. We are not attached to the brand just that it is unscented to prevent any issues for others with allergy/sensitivities. Other than that we simply ask you to be respectful of others in the house with the noise level between the hours of 10pm and 8am. + More
availability: On Fridays and Saturdays the minimum stay is 2 nights.

about: Bright, Spacious and Private. Enjoy the area while living "home away from home" in a clean, well appointed private apt. in Victorian home. PRIME location. Just minutes from tourist attractions, restaurants, beaches and casinos.
description: Description The Space Our Space - Your Space Enjoy two story living with bright sunshine and a private entrance. Your HOME AWAY FROM HOME IS: A fully furnished apartment with everything you need to feel right at home. Sleeping accommodations: This property comfortably accommodates up to 6 guests. Bedroom 1 has a full-sized bed and 1 Twin sized Daybed with an additional 1 twin sized trundle unit under the daybed Bedroom 2 has a full-sized bed. Living room has a queen-sized futon Living room has a sofa with a queen sofa bed. A queen-sized air mattress is also available. Full kitchen: Take advantage of the full-sized kitchen to prepare your own meals. -Refrigerator with freezer -Electric stove with oven -Coffee maker -Toaster -Microwave -Pots & pans -Plates & bowls -Glassware -Flatware & knives -Serving utensils -Soap, towels, etc. -Herbs & spices -Baking essentials (flour, sugar, oil, etc) Full bathroom: You will be provided with fresh towels for up to 6 guests. The bathroom is newly renovated with a double vanity and a shower unit. Other amenities: On-site laundry (full sized washer and dryer) for use by guests staying for a week or longer. High speed internet Cable TV (32" LCD Smart TV in living room) Gas grill Games Puzzles Please let us know if there are any amenities needed for families traveling with children. Guest Access Guest Access Private 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment in a side-by-side Victorian style home with full kitchen, living room and dining room. Guests have a private side entrance. They can enjoy use of an outside grill as well as a delightful outdoor shower for those beach days. Interaction with Guests As your 'home away from home' hosts, we are here to meet your needs to make it a wonderful vacation experience. For families, just ask - we just might be able to have 'necessary items" you won't have to bring. We are available as you are sharing a "side of our house", but it is totally private. We do have a small dog. The Neighborhood We are located in Historical Groton Bank. So much history within a few minutes. Fort Griswold, Nautilus Museum, Eastern Point Beach where you can enjoy wonderful picnics and watch all the sail boats pass by. See the Thames River from your window and you just might catch a submarine passing by! Getting Around Street-parking available. Less than 5 minutes from Amtrak station and Long Island Ferries. EZ Access to 1-95. Walk to 24 hour diner or library. Minutes from restaurants, grocery stores and shopping plaza's. Just a GREAT location to EVERYTHING!!!! Close to area colleges and Coast Guard Academy. Other Things to Note Private laundry facilities available for long term guests or on individual request. + More
rules: House Rules In essence, you are sharing "the other half" of our house. No pets. No smoking in house or on property please. Private laundry access for guests staying a week or longer. We expect all our guests to respect our space and leave it as clean and nice as you found it. + More

about: Very comfortable room and en suite private bath in New London's historic Post Hill District. Close to I95, Connecticut College and US Coast Guard Academy. A 10 minute walk to downtown New London for art, antiques, music and fabulous restaurants.
description: Description The Space New London is filled with history and the Post Hill District, recognized in the National Registry of Historic Districts, is packed with vintage homes. 48 Vauxhall Strreet is part of this historic district and mentioned in the national registry. The house is spacious and open with high ceilings and lots of windows including an original stained glass window that stands on the main staircase landing. The house is nicely furnished - I think it's pretty but not the least bit stuffy. Just comfortable. Its a great house for entertaining. From searfaring captains' homes to the early industrialists of New London, the Post Hill District was home to New London's finest. Now the Post Hill District is a wonderful family neighborhood and only a short walk to downtown New London and its vibrant arts community and great restaurants. Guest Access Guests can relax in their rooms, in a second floor library or on a really nice wrap-around porch complete with loads of vintage wicker. Interaction with Guests I am always available by cell. The Neighborhood My neighborhood is one of beautiful vintage homes. I love them and appreciate them. I never get tired of looking at houses from all different eras. As lovely as the houses are, the neighbors are even lovelier - warm and friendly and welcoming. Getting Around New London is located on the Thames River and is halfway between New York and Boston. It is a short drive to Essex and the Connecticut River and a shorter drive to Mystic and the Mystic River. And yes, there really is a Mystic Pizza. But there is also the Mystic Acquarium and the Mystic Seaport. But New London has it all. First, it is home to some of the oldest homes in the state, the Hempstead Houses. Really interesting especially if your visit coincides with some of their living history weekends. New London is also home to the Maritime Society that operates the New London Customs House - the oldest customs house in the state. Beautiful and very interesting. New London is also the transportation hub of southeastern Connecticut with an Amtrak stop, bus and taxi service and of course ferries to Fisher's Island, the north shore of Long Island and Block Island. Local public transportation is a little iffy but it's there and you can reach the surrounding towns and the two nearby casinos by bus. Downtown New London has an interesting mix of the performing and visual arts, an extensive array of restaurants from Thai, Sushi, Italian to good old American steaks, burgers, wings and fries. There's a great waterfront park where visitors can walk along the Thames River and take in the local river traffic including the occasional submarine making its way to the New London Submarine Base in Groton. + More
rules: House Rules I don't have a lot of rules. I want you to relax and enjoy your visit. All I ask is that you be respectful of other guests and of the house. It's been my personal money pit for 11 years and I would hate to see it hurt. + More

about: Downtown property minutes walk from all things Mystic. On-site parking, front veranda for people watching and rear deck for grilling.
description: Description The Space Our home is located in the heart of Historic Mystic between the Mystic Art Center and Captain Daniel Packer Inn. You are within easy walking distance to all Downtown Mystic restaurants, shops and attractions. Our recently renovated historic 2-bedroom home offers both late 19th century charm and 21st century convenience. On the main floor you will enjoy a comfortable living room, spacious eating/sitting area and fully equipped galley kitchen (range/oven, refrigerator, dishwasher, garbage disposal, microwave oven, coffee maker, toaster, pots, pans, dishes and cooking/eating utensils). The two bedrooms and bathroom are located on the second floor where you will also find a cozy reading nook with its own great view of the Mystic River. Both bedrooms have queen size beds, a comfortable sitting area, dresser drawers with full size mirrors and plenty of closet space. If needed, the living room sofa converts into an additional queen-size bed. The second floor bathroom has been completely renovated and includes a full-size tub/shower combination and custom vanity/sink with mirror and handy electrical power outlets. Fresh towels and bed linens are provided for the number of guests shown on your reservation request. Our home is fully furnished and decorated with an eclectic collection of Americana, period pieces, folk art, curiosities and other items of local interest. For convenience and comfort you will find HDTV, high-speed wireless internet access, remotely controlled lighting and ceiling fans in both the living room and eating area and a state of the art heating and air conditioning system. The elevated front veranda offers an awesome view of the Mystic River, local marinas and boat traffic. It's also a great place for people watching. There is a large rear deck with table, chairs and gas grill facing a massive ledge outcrop that provides a unique backdrop if you prefer a more private setting. There is on-site parking for two vehicles. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking No pets please. Limit 2 cars on-site parking on left side of driveway only. This property is furnished not only with all the essentials needed for a comfortable stay but also with a diverse collection of folk art, period pieces, rare books and Americana for your enjoyment during your visit. But please keep in mind that these items have been placed here for the enjoyment of all our guests. Nothing is for sale but all pieces do have an assigned value. While a guest with us you are responsible for the safe keeping of the collection. Missing or damaged items will be charged against your security deposit at the values assigned in the 26 Water Street Collection Catalog" and/or reported to local law enforcement. A photographic inventory and list of values are provided on site. + More

about: This cottage would make Laura Ingall's jealous! Featuring a large one bedroom with kitchenette (grill, hotplate, microwave, no oven) and bathroom. Bright and sunny with views. Last house at the end of a quiet road. Approx. 600 sq ft. 1 queen, 2 twin.
description: Description The Space Furniture and house essentials provided at the Memory Lane Farm Cottage: (1) Separate Wifi router, same password as house (2) Leather love seat couch with throw pillows (3) Kitchenette dining table, seats 4 (4) One kitchenette/living area with personal, remote control A/C and heat (5) One bedroom with personal, remote control A/C and heat (6) Small coffee table (7) Queen size bed with side table (8) Two twin beds, (9) Closet with hangers (10) Desk with chair (11) Shaded and curtained windows (12) Bathroom with shower and small shelf for toiletries (13) Kitchenette (some plates, bowls, cups, mugs, wine glasses, and tea cups provided). Guest Access Kitchenette in cottage has two tall mini fridges with freezer compartments, large 'Oster' toaster oven, microwave, and hot plates. Wifi, bathroom (includes general toiletries), towels, patio (with grill), outdoor fire pit, yard. Horseback riding lessons and horsemanship lessons available for all ages at additional rates, by appointment only. Please inquire in advance if interested. Interaction with Guests I typically stay in my house when the cottage is rented so I am there if you have questions, but will leave you alone if you prefer privacy. Also, I work in NYC through the week so wouldn't be there during the day. My personal assistant, Mariah, lives on site with us and is usually around the property during the day, she'll be helpful and present if you need or quiet and out-of-your hair if you'd prefer. The Neighborhood Private lane, no traffic and quiet. Lovely walking trails right outside. Getting Around There is no public transportation. You need a car or taxi to get around/into town/the train station from this property. Other Things to Note For an additional fee, if organized in advance I can provide breakfast, picnic lunch, dinner, beach chairs, and daily beach passes for guests. There are three beaches in Greenwich. Horseback riding lessons/pony rides are also available for an additional fee. Please inquire if interested. Sorry no pets accepted. + More

about: 2 BR spacious guest quarter with private entrance, bath, kitchenette, cozy sitting area and nice views. Huge BR, 2 beds over 2 car garage. Spacious 2nd bedroom. Whether you are here on business or pleasure, our guest apt is awaiting to welcome you.
description: Description The Space Our guest apartment is a private section of our large home. Access the apartment via the garage and a private staircase. The huge studio bedroom over the 2 garges is on the left of the foyer. It has a nice view with a queen bed, a futon couch/bed, a dresser, tables/chairs and cabinets. The queen can fit 2 people and the full size futon can accommodate additional 2 more guests if needed. The sitting room next to the foyer is cozy and can be used as extra space to eat or work. There is an adjacent spacious bedroom with a full bed, dresser and a table which will fit comfortably 2 more guests. The bath room is spacious with a shower tub overlooking the backyard of park-like setting The kitchenette is equipped to prepare a simple meal or reheat take-outs. It has a freezer/refrigerator, glass cooktops, microwave and toaster oven. It is stocked with basic necessities such as glasses, cups, dinnerware, silverware, cooking utensils, pots, pans and condiments. The entire spacious guest quarter will comfortably fit 6 people. Guest Access Apartment entrance: The entrance to the apartment is via the garage door and a private staircase. Please close the garage door after each use. Security surveillance system is installed to monitor the perimeter of the property and inside the garage. Interaction with Guests We are passionate hikers and love to travel and hike. Our home is our sanctuary where we find peace and quiet. We try to provide the type of experience each guest expects to have. We like our guests to think the apartment is their private quiet space, their sanctuary. It's up to our guest what level of interaction they wish. A handy booklet is provided to familiarize them on what's in the neighborhood, local stores, restaurants, dry cleaner, local business and sightseeing attractions. We are reachable via text message and phone calls. Therefore, after our guests check in and settle down, we respect their privacy and they would not be bothered by us. The Neighborhood Our house is on a quiet country road, the west side of Danbury, conveniently located near local major corporations, easy access to major highways, 5 minutes to Danbury Fair Mall, Tarrywile hiking trails, 0.5 hr to over 200 hiking trails in Westchster county. We are only a train ride or 1.5 hr drive to NYC. If you are here on an extended stay and want some excitement on weekends, take the train to New York City for a day trip and can still return to your apartment the same day. Plan your day and choose among multiple museums, Broadway shows and off Broadway shows, restaurants and more. Commuter parking is free at the nearby MTA train station on weekends. If you choose to drive to New York City, start your day early to find free street parking in Manhattan on Sunday. There are many local attractions if you like to stay around Danbury: Danbury Fair in the Autumn, Danbury Fair Mall with Carousal, Danbury Railway Museum, EastBranch Reservoir in the Autumn, Farrington Pond, Hammond Museum Japanese Garden, Harley Davidson, Richter Park and Golf Course ... and more Getting Around Hart bus is the local public transportation in Danbury. Our house is not on a bus route so you will need a car to get around. MTA Metro North Railroad has 2 lines going to Grand Central, NYC. They are the Harlem Line and New Haven Line. Nearby airports Westchester County airport (HPN) White Plain, NY 32 miles 32 minutes Stewart airport (SWF) Newburgh, NY 40 miles, 51 minutes Bradley airport (BDL) , Windsor Locks, CT 77 miles, 1 hour 18 minutes LaGuardia airport (LGA), Flushing, NY 57 miles, 1 hour 3 minutes John Kennedy airport (JFK) Brooklyn, NY 65 miles, 1 hour 11 minutes New Haven airport (HVN) New Haven, CT 44 miles, 1 hour 7 minutes Other Things to Note Please advise in advance if your arrival or departure time has changed. Disclosure: The perimeter of our house and entrances are monitored by surveillance cameras and inside our garages. + More
rules: House Rules Please be respectful of our property and refrain from smoking inside the house. No drugs and no pets please. Please close the garage door after you enter or exit the house. We are advocates to conserve energy and water. We appreciate your help to conserve the limited resource on this earth. If you must travel with your pet, please inquire in advance. The decision to allow your pet is decided on a case to case basis. There will be a surcharge for each pet. Please do not remove our items from the apartment. Thank You! + More

about: Quaint, private, rustic log cabin on acres of private land. Easily accessible from the center of Redding, but more likely to see wildlife than people. Cozy fireplace, back porch perfect for evening dinner or morning coffee, and pool just steps away.
description: Description The Space Our log cabin will transport you to a much simpler, quieter time. Only 1.5 hours out of NYC, surrounded by preserved land, the cabin is a perfect retreat  with great restaurants, trails, and shops all within a short drive. The cabin, situated back on the property and secluded from the main house, has two bedrooms with brand new queen-size beds, a clean bathroom with full tub, working kitchen, laundry room with washer/dryer, and unbelievably relaxing back porch. Ceiling fans keep the rooms comfortable and cool on summer nights, and the wood-burning stove and baseboard heaters keep the place cozy and warm on chilly nights. We provide the basics: linens, towels, toilet paper, tissues, soap, kitchen utensils and cookware, pots, pans, oil, spices, plates, cups, tea, coffee, and coffee maker. Guest Access Guests may explore the property in all its beautiful expanse, which includes the shared pool area, the yard, pond, hiking trails, and stone-patio with fire pit. Interaction with Guests Matt and I are easy-going and available to help out with anything you might need. We live in a separate house on the property, not too far away. We don't like to disturb you, so we'll leave it to you to choose how much contact you'd like. Feel free to send us a text with a question, or just meet us outside by the fire pit/garden/pool. The Neighborhood Quiet and beautiful, Redding has many outdoor opportunities, including trails for hiking, snow-shoeing, and cross-country skiing; ponds for canoeing and kayaking; reservoirs and streams for fishing; farms for picking and petting; and more. For shopping and restaurants, you'll have to drive to Georgetown, Wilton, or Bethel. Ask us for recommendations! We have a few favorite spots. Getting Around You will need a car to get to any nearby stores as there is no public transportation. We have 4 adult bicycles that we can make available to you for riding nearby. Enterprise Rent-a-Car is located in Ridgefield, the next town over: 227 ETHAN ALLEN HWY RIDGEFIELD, CT (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Tel.: ((PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Other Things to Note Pets are always welcome. (We love animals.) We compost our food scraps, and you can too! The compost bin is located out the front cabin door, down the hill to the left, beside the vegetable garden. Please limit compost material to plant-based matter (no eggs, dairy, meat). + More
rules: House Rules Please no smoking and treat our cabin and the nature around it respectfully. + More

about: This listing is for 2 bedrooms within a large home, adjacent to Yale campus. (It is not an entire apt/house.) Good area for walks.
description: Description The Space Enjoy old-world luxury in a home that was built in 1910 to last for centuries. This architecturally designed home includes 4 fireplaces, an elegant entry hall and staircase, and many beautiful details. We are happy to walk guests through and give share the history of the house and its former occupants. Guest Access One bedroom includes a sitting area, as well as a double bed. The other is smaller (about 12x12 ft) with a twin bed and a small sofa. Guest are welcome to store food in the refrigerator, and relax in the parlor. Interaction with Guests We are happy to meet new people, hear about their lives, and share advice about what to do in New Haven. These conversations are typically over coffee in the morning or when guests arrive and settle in. But we also respect people's privacy if they wish to be left alone. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is beautiful, full of historic single-family houses with lovely gardens. We have a guide to the nearby homes available for interested guests. Getting Around Public transportation and the Yale Shuttle are within a couple blocks of our home. Yale and downtown New Haven about a mile away. Other Things to Note This listing is for the use of 2 bedrooms in a large home. It is not the entire home or apartment. Due to the quirks of the Airbnb listing system, it is posted in the entire home/apt category in order to show that it includes two bedrooms. + More
rules: House Rules Guests can come and go during their stay. It is useful to know when guests will arrive at the house, so that we are sure to be available to let them in. + More

about: My cozy & comfortable three bedroom apartment in a two family house is nestled in a cul-de-sac just blocks from all kinds of shops restaurants grocery stores cafs liquor stores Dunking Donuts Starbucks walk to all Fits 8 Comfortably Sorry no pets.
description: Description The Space NEW back deck with a new grill a table and chairs for BBQ'S. We can accommodate eight people Sorry no pets. and this is the apartment lay-out: Master Bedroom with Queen size bed, The 2nd bedroom has a queen bed. The 3rd bedroom has a full size bed. All rooms have large closet space. There is a fold out bed in the Love seat in the living room. NEW kitchen and bathroom. PLEASE don't let any one jump on the beds! I had to replace two bed frames in 8 months! We have hardwood floors and tiles throughout, with carpeting in the bedrooms and living room. Separated front and rear entrance from the other apartment. The Laundromat is about a mile away. There is a local store for last minute snacking and a super market for buy groceries, Bakery, small home town lunchette, three liquors' stores and two gas stations. But it still has that small town feeling. For our Guests we constantly maintain the property through-out the year. The unit is always kept fresh and as clean. PETS AND SMOKING ARE NOT PERMITTED. There are plenty of on & off street parking spaces for your use. Guest Access For the summer I have passes for the town beach and for parking also have a grill on the back deck for BBQ'S. Sorry no pets Interaction with Guests I am there to greet my guests and to show them around and answer any questions or concerns They may have The Neighborhood There is a Italian Restaurant within walking distance from the house (right across the street) Other Things to Note Sorry no pets. Please leave my house as clean as you found it + More
rules: House Rules Some house rules apply: Please leave my house as clean as you found it. Sorry no pets. Enjoy the Apartment as if it is your own. Respect the tenants downstairs. No Smoking, No Drugs anywhere in the Apartment If you must smoke outside in the open air is fine but please pick up your butts. Turn of all the lights when you leave the Apartment. You must leave the Apartment clean and orderly before you check out. This includes washing dishes you've used. No overnight guests not included in reservation. All guests must be included in reservation. If something is GREAT, tell your Friends. If something isn't right, tell us! You must leave a review on Airbnb after your stay. We expect our guests to be mature, respectful, and responsible. No Drugs, No Drama. We do not charge a cleaning fee to keep your cost low, in return we ask that you clean up after yourself. What ever you use, please clean it after use. We have a trash bin located outside which you can empty your trash upon departure. All garbage and recycles are picked on Tuesday morning. + More

about: 4 bedrooms in a private part of the house with your own living room, hallways + en suite bathroom, part of the 3200 square foot country mansion, built in 1841, State Registered Historical Site situated on 4 acres of lawns, gardens and open fields.
description: Description The Space There is space for up to 8 people. The Italianate style house was built in 1841. Out of a total of 11 rooms we rent out 4 bedrooms and a large double parlor living room, all on 2 floors with 2 hallways and your own private entrance. A queen size bedroom a bedroom with a full size bed and a bedroom with 2 single beds are on the 2nd floor together with an en-suite full bathroom. The 4th bedroom in on the first floor and is used to accommodate parties of 7 or 8 people. The rented part of the house will provide ample privacy for you. Our own bedrooms are on the other far side of the house. We rent the 3 bedrooms upstairs to only one party at a time. 3 bedrooms have 3 windows each, 1 bedroom has 2 windows - the rooms have ample light with garden views all around. We serve a light breakfast in the morning. We have 2 indoor cats. The Spirit of 76 House is named after a mural on the West side facade. The House has been in the family for over 100 years. and we continue the family tradition of hospitality and quaint country living. Enjoy the New England countryside in this charming estate situated on 4 acres of lawns gardens and open fields. We are located in the Connecticut River Valley in the village of Higganum which was founded in 1663. The surrounding areas are used for many recreational water crafts, fishing, swimming, hiking and dining. We are located in the center of Higganum, where you find 2 restaurants, a pizza place and a food store. We are a 25 minute drive from the Connecticut shoreline and a 2 hour drive to either New York or Boston. Within a 5-10 minute walk from the Spirit of 76 House lies the Higganum Reservoir, or, as the people of Higganum call it lovingly, THE RES. The Higganum Reservoir gives us the pleasure of fishing, swimming and watching the local grey heron fly by. Hours: Year-round, dawn to dusk, Free Access Handicap Accessible: Fishing platform Founding Date: 2003 The original dam was constructed in 1868 by the 2 brothers George M. and Thomas J. Clark of the Higganum Manufacturing Company called the Clark Company. Their firm, later known as Clark Cutaway Harrow, was one of Higganum's most successful industries, produced an extensive line of farm equipment including 400 types of plows, disk harrows, cider presses, hay spreaders and carriage jacks. The factory, located at the site of the now empty Rossi lumberyard, was powered by water from the reservoir and Candlewood Hill and Bible Rock Brooks. The factory burned in the early 20th century but the dam and reservoir remained until its 2003 reconstruction as Higganum Reservoir State Park. The new dam is 20 feet high and has a walkway which allows you to gaze at the water rushing over an old stone spillway down into a beautiful clear brook. Watershed Area: 6.6 Square Miles Lake Area: 32 Acres Higganum Reservoir State Park covers 137 acres. Meandering trails through the woods surrounding the lake are ideal for short hikes and mountain biking. Enjoy a vacation stay and discover the charm of New England: Higganum Village - Once a commercial hub for shipbuilding, primarily for whaling in the 1600's and 1700's then a place of manufacturing during the 1800's; Higganum is now a qaint little community nestled at the river banks and home of the Spirit of 76 House East Haddam Village - home of the the Goodspeed Opera House and final destination of the River Steam Boat Chester Village - a beautifully restored little village with art and design galleries and restaurants all along main street Deep River - situated on the Connecticut River banks; many restaurants, small shops, and a piano-key factory Essex Village - home of the Griswold Inn, one of the oldest operated inns in the country open for business since 1776; many boutiques, restaurants, art galleries and the Connecticut River Museum; situated right where the Connecticut River meets the Long Island Sound; board the historic Essex Steam Train Old Saybrook - visit the marina or one of the public beaches right at the Long Island Sound; once the home town of Kate Hepburn the town named their new cultural center after the late actress; visit the many shops and restaurants Westbrook - a quaint shoreline community with several public beaches right at Long Island Sound between New Haven and New London Middletown - home of the Wesleyan University; enjoy their cultural program open to the public ( (website hidden) ) or, visit the local movie theater A 45 min. drive away you find two large casinos offering gambling, dining, spas and entertainment: Mohegan Sun Casino and Foxwoods Resort Casino Guest Access The downstairs double parlor living room which has a cable TV , a Baby Grand piano and stereo music system with a large collection of vinyl records is for guest use only; continental breakfast is served in this living room. Interaction with Guests My wife and I are living in the other part of the house and are available for any questions. about: Enjoy a warm welcome in a museum-quality, Revolutionary War era home built by Connecticut's "first millionaire", Jabez Bacon. Our antique double bed (with a new mattress) fits two cozily. The room is large and bright and beautifully paneled.
description: Description The Space Enjoy 18th century hospitality at the gateway to the Litchfield Hills. Stay in a large, elegantly paneled room with a private bath and fireplace (not useable), built circa 1760 on the most historic street in the center of Connecticut's antiques capital. We are about 90 minutes from New York, 45 minutes from New Haven, and close to museums of all sizes and varieties, walks, hikes and scenic drives. Interstate Route 84 is minutes away, and Bradley International Airport, outside Hartford, is about 50 minutes away. There is bus service from New York to nearby Southbury. Our room sleeps two in a double bed and if needed we can accommodate additional people in other rooms for an extra charge (they would have to share a bathroom). Continental Breakfast is offered for short stays. Will share kitchen facilities for weekly or longer rentals. Pets are okay. We've got internet access, plenty of parking, but no television. Guest Access Guests may use the kitchen if they need to, though that is usually more for longer-term stays. Guests may use all the downstairs rooms. In the summer, there is a screened-in porch that is available. Interaction with Guests I will interact with guests as much or as little as they desire. I am usually around, but respect my visitors' privacy. The Neighborhood The street is just off the main street, and is one of the most historic in the community. There are two historic house museums on the street, one of which has the only extant garden designed by famed English garden designer Gertrude Jekyll. The other was built circa 1690 and is the oldest house in Litchfield County still on its original site. There is a lovely town park across the street, with access to the Pomperaug River at the far end of it. Orenaug Park, also within walking distance, has a fire tower with views of the valley. Getting Around There is no local public transit. Restaurants, grocery stores, and other amenities are within walking distance. + More
rules: House Rules The house is currently on the market, so please be sensitive to the possibility of someone coming in to view it. Children are welcome. Pets, okay, but dogs should be kept in a crate or under control while in the house. + More

amenities: Amenities Kitchen Kitchen Space where guests can cook their own meals Internet TV Essentials Essentials Towels, bed sheets, soap, and toilet paper + More
about: This beautiful studio Guest Apartment in a quiet New England town is an hour from New York City, Hartford & New Haven. Minutes to lakes, rivers, hiking, wine & antique trails, and great food all make this a great hide away or base-camp for day trips.
description: Description The Space Our studio Guest Apartment has its own entrance, both front and back, as well as a covered front porch area. Inside you will find a large full bathroom (shower only) with soft, fluffy towels and bathrobes to greet you. The bathroom is handicapped accessible. The small yet efficient kitchenette offers a refrigerator, freezer, two-burner stove, large toaster oven, microwave, and Starbucks Verismo coffee machine. The kitchen is stocked with all the basics condiments, pots and pans, plates, silverware for cooking or enhancing take out if that's your preference. Flat screen TV with DVD player and radio are also included. The room is very cozy, and well appointed with lovely antiques and an exceptionally comfortable queen sized bed, complete with sumptuous pillows and down comforter. Although a perfect space for two, a couple with a baby or little one would also fit right in. Our guest space is a wonderful place to hide away from the "real world" or use as your base-camp for beautiful drives and day trips to both city and country destinations. We are right on the CT Wine Trail. Guest Access You will have access to the Guest Apartment, the front and backyard, hammock, hen house, above ground pool, and if you are on an extended stay, the laundry facilities in the main house will be made available to you if needed. Interaction with Guests Our Guest Apartment has it's own entrance and we are dedicated to providing the type of experience each guest is looking for. In light of this, the level of interaction a guest has with us is entirely up to each guest. We would like our guests to think of the space as their own private sanctuary if that's what they are looking for. If our guests would like to hang out in the backyard, lay in the hammock, take a swim, or collect eggs in the morning for breakfast, they may see more of us! In either case, when guests are in need of assistance in any way, such as questions about the apartment or advice on the area, we are happy to help. If we aren't home, we are always just a phone call away. Whichever experience you're looking for, once you are checked in, you will not be bothered unless you need us! We provide a handy booklet with extensive information on all things good in our area. The Neighborhood We live in a small, beautiful New England town of New Fairfield, which is surrounded by lakes, reservoirs, and an abundance of outdoor recreational opportunities. Candlewood Lake, Squantz Pond State Park, and Ball Pond are all in New Fairfield. The area lakes are great for a relaxing day of fishing, canoeing, kayaking and swimming, or an exciting day of water skiing and water sports. In the winter months, many people enjoy ice skating and ice fishing. Outdoor enthusiasts will enjoy the many walking and hiking opportunities in New Fairfield. Bear Mountain Reservation, Pootatuck State Forest, Pootatuck Preserve, Squantz Pond State Park, Hidden Valley Nature Center, Finn's Land Preserve, Titacus Mountain Preserve, and Sweetcake Mountain Preserve all offer a variety of hiking trails and unique spots for picnicking, bird watching, or any other sort of communing with nature you are interested in. With only thirteen houses on a street with no outlet, and each one on 2+ acres, our neighborhood has an open feel and is very quiet. Bountiful trees and woods surround the homes on our street. Spring and summer are very green, and the fall is particularly beautiful. Winter is often white with snowfall and is also quite stunning. Lots of rocks walls, ferns, and woods adorn our backyard. Abundant wildlife make our backyard and neighborhood their home chipmunks, squirrels, deer, groundhogs, fox, wild turkeys, owls, countless species of birds, and even coyotes. There are no street lights in our neighborhood so when it's dark, it's dark! We love to take blankets in the front yard, lay on the hill, and look up at the stars. The area is mildly hilly and is popular among runners and the very dedicated cyclists. Full disclosure regarding noise requires us to say that you may often hear coyotes howling in the evening and chickens clucking during the day. And please don't be alarmed if you are here on a Sunday morning and you hear a "bang" or two after 10:00am, that's just the local shooting range nearby! Getting Around Although to some we are a suburb to New York City, Hartford, and New Haven, this is the country. You need only drive a quarter mile to see a cow! We are three miles from town and you definitely need a car! Other Things to Note New Fairfield has some very nice restaurants in town and many more nearby. American, French, Italian, Indian and Mexican and an excellent deli for creating the perfect picnic! Please note there is a TV and DVD plater in the apartment but no cable. We are close to lakes, ski areas, rivers, and many hiking and rock climbing areas. The Connecticut Wine Trail is just up the road, and if you like to hunt for antiques and funky-finds, this is a great place to call base-camp! The famed Elephant Trunk Flea Market is just fifteen minutes away! We are two miles from the New York state border and the beautiful Hudson River Valley area and less than an hour to Yale University and Western Connecticut University is just a few miles away. There is ample room for your car at the top of our driveway. Although our cats do not spend time in our guest apartment, we do have four cats and a rabbit (as well as seven hens). + More
rules: House Rules There is no smoking of *any* kind within the apartment. No pets. No loud music/noise after 11:00pm. Please remove your shoes when entering. You are responsible for any damage caused to the interior (including dishes, appliances, pots/pans, etc.) or exterior of the apartment. If you spill something in the apartment or on bedding/rug that you are not able to completely clean yourself, please let us know immediately so we may properly clean soiled items. For example, if you spill coffee or other "stainable" food/liquids on the sheets and don't let us know prior to your departure, you may be charged for a new set of sheets. Guest who leave the kitchen as clean as they found it will find they receive the best reviews! Thank You! + More

amenities: Amenities Kitchen Kitchen Space where guests can cook their own meals Internet TV Essentials Essentials Towels, bed sheets, soap, and toilet paper + More
about: Pristine guest room and bath in beautiful cedar home on 3 acres located in New England village, under an hour from New York City. Organic gardens, old stone walls, rivers and waterfalls, biking, walking trails offer scenic beauty in all seasons.
description: Description The Space High ceilings, large windows to view the gardens and rolling green (well, white in winter!) hills. Queen bed with new tempurpedic mattress, is like floating on air. Cozy down comforters and pillows. Serene artists painting on walls. Love seat, closet, TV, WiFi. Very quiet, peaceful atmosphere. Private bath with hand painted antique sink, bath, shower. Lite breakfast included in price. If dinner wanted; $20 pp. Guest Access My guests may enjoy the Living Room, filled with English antique pine, Persian carpets and Kilims and a swing! Apple TV; Wood burning FP in winter. Large cedar deck with stairs leading to chairs and hammocks on the property. Huge chefs kitchen filled with Italian ceramica. Interaction with Guests I can be of help when needed. I am a single homeowner and will be your host. The Neighborhood The village of Silvermine, which is a unique area in Wilton, offers New England charm combined with the very best restaurants and bistros to suit all tastes. The Silvermine Guild of Artists and the Silvermine market, where residents go to enjoy a morning coffee and newspaper, is a short walk away. The 2 mile walk around the Silvermine River(right across from my driveway) is very enjoyable, passing ducks, geese, swans and many different styles of antique houses. It is a favorite path for bikers and joggers as well. The town is committed to preserving open space..we have 27 trail systems that range from an easy stroll to a challenging hike. There are concerts all year round. Close proximity to all highways and NYC transport. Getting Around A car, rented at the airport or locally, is necessary. Taxi service is also available. For those who like to pedal, my guests can have use of my bikes. Other Things to Note Ten minutes to Metro North Railroad to NYC. 55 minute express trains. Great shopping in Westport and New Canaan. Beaches on Long Island Sound; sailboat and kayak rental. 5 Star dinning and bistros. Minutes to Norwalk waterfront; boat tours. Maritime Aquarium; IMAX theater. SoNo seaport. + More
rules: House Rules There is no smoking anywhere on premises. Sorry, no pets allowed. This is a low impact, peaceful household. + More

about: 12 room country mansion, State registered historical site, Connecticut River Valley,
description: Description The Space The Italianate style house was built in 1841. You enter the mansion through the main entrance door and hallway, both for guests only. At the end of the hallway on the first floor you will find your quaint bedroom with 3 windows - all with garden views. This bedroom has 2 single beds that can be comfortably connected with a special doubling system to a king size bed. Across the hallway is a large double parlor living room for guest use only. Sometimes we do rent out the upstairs 3 bedrooms to groups of 3 people and more who will also have access to the double parlor living room on the first floor. Clark of the Higganum Manufacturing Company called the Clark Company. Their firm, later known as Clark Cutaway Harrow, was one of Higganum's most successful industries, produced an extensive line of farm equipment including 400 types of plows, disk harrows, cider presses, hay spreaders and carriage jacks. The factory, located at the site of the now empty Rossi lumberyard, was powered by water from the reservoir and Candlewood Hill and Bible Rock Brooks. The factory burned in the early 20th century but the dam and reservoir remained until its 2003 reconstruction as Higganum Reservoir State Park. The new dam is 20 feet high and has a walkway which allows you to gaze at the water rushing over an old stone spillway down into a beautiful clear brook. Watershed Area: 6.6 Square Miles Lake Area: 32 Acres Higganum Reservoir State Park covers 137 acres. Meandering trails through the woods surrounding the lake are ideal for short hikes and mountain biking. Other Things to Note Enjoy a vacation stay and discover the charm of New England: Higganum Village - Once a commercial hub for shipbuilding, primarily for whaling in the 1600's and 1700's then a place of manufacturing during the 1800's; Higganum is now a qaint little community nestled at the river banks and home of the Spirit of 76 House Starting in Higganum Center, follow the scenic route #154 south towards Old Saybrook and the shoreline. The modern street is build upon the historic route dating back to the 1600's; it follows the Connecticut River all the way to the Long Island Sound. Along this road you will pass through the picturesque historic villages of Haddam, Chester and Deep River, Essex and Old Saybrook. East Haddam Village - home of the the Goodspeed Opera House and final destination of the River Steam Boat - (URL HIDDEN) Chester Village - a beautifully restored little village with art and design galleries and restaurants all along main street; at the Chester street crossing on route 154 you can also turn away from Chester and towards the river. You will get to the Chester-Hadlyme Ferry, in service since 1769. It will take you to the other side of the Connecticut River and further on to the Gillette Castle State Park Deep River - situated on the Connecticut River banks; many reaturants, small shops, and a piano-key factory Essex Village - home of the Griswold Inn, one of the oldest still operating inns in the country, open for business since 1776 - (URL HIDDEN) ; many boutiques, restaurants, art galleries and the Connecticut River Museum; situated right where the Connecticut River meets the Long Island Sound; board the historic Essex Steam Train - www.(URL HIDDEN) Old Saybrook - visit the marina or one of the public beaches right at the Long Island Sound; once the home town of Kate Hepburn the town named their new cultural center after the late actress - www.katharin(URL HIDDEN) - visit the many shops and restaurants Westbrook - a quaint shoreline community with several public beaches right at Long Island Sound between New Haven and New London Middletown - home of the Wesleyan University; enjoy their cultural program open to the public - (URL HIDDEN) visit the local movie theater A 45 min. drive away you find two large casinos offering gambling, dining, spas and entertainment: Mohegan Sun Casino and Foxwoods Resort Casino + More

description: Description The Space Our beautiful bed and breakfast is located in the Connecticut River Valley Shoreline. We are just 1,5 block walk to Long Island Sound. All of our guest rooms have private baths, soaking tubs, fireplaces, Cable TV, Wi-Fi, DVD and CD players, bathrobes, hair dryers and mini fridges. Breakfast is NOT Included with the airbnb rate. Guest Access Guest will have access to all common areas and our grounds. If entire Inn is rented access to the kitchen, washer and dryer Interaction with Guests As much interaction as our guests need. We are not underfoot, but are at your beck and call if need be. Just a phone call away. The Neighborhood A lovey quaint safe shoreline community, just minutes from the Connecticut River too. Charming villages and small towns. Fine dining,small boutiques, shops, outlets, hiking, nature preserves, museums.. Mystic Seaport,Foxwood and Mohican Sun Casinos just 40 minutes from the Inn. Just Two hours from NY and Boston Getting Around Amtrak, Shoreline East and local car rentals available. Other Things to Note Prices quoted are per room per evening based on availability. There is also a 15% Room Use Tax. Breakfast is not served with the Airbnb rate.. + More
rules: House Rules TIME TABLE AND TERMS Guests may check in any time after 3 PM. We do ask that guests check out by 11 AM, so that we may prepare the rooms for the next arrival. If we are not able to personally greet you. Keys and directions to your room will be left in an envelope in the mailbox to the left of our front door. Children over 10 are welcome. If you have children under 10, please check with us and we will try to accommodate them. For the comfort of all our guests, we cannot accommodate pets or smoking . Payment may be made at the time of your reservation by cash, personal check, MC, Visa, Discover, Amex. a 15% Room Use Tax will be applied to your room rate. We regret having to implement this rule but red wine is not allowed do to previous guests spilling causing damage to our linens, walls, furniture and carpeting. There will be a fee charged for damage do to red wine. Guests will be charged the cost to clean and replace any item that is destroyed do to behavior that is excessive of normal wear and tear. CANCELLATION RULES: IF YOU MUST CANCEL YOUR RESERVATION, PLEASE NOTIFY US FOURTEEN DAYS PRIOR TO YOUR ARRIVAL DATE. HOLIDAYS ON BOTH WEEKENDS AND DURING THE WEEK AND SPECIAL EVENTS REQUIRE A THREE WEEK CANCELLATION NOTICE. IF YOU HAVE RESERVED THE ENTIRE INN A FORTY- FIVE DAY NOTICE IS REQUIRED FOR HOLIDAYS ON BOTH WEEKENDS AND WEEK DAYS AND SPECIAL EVENTS. A THIRTY DAY NOTICE IS REQUIRED FOR ANY OTHER TIME . THERE IS NO REFUND OF WEDDING DEPOSITS. IF WE CAN NOT FILL YOUR VACANCY YOUR CREDIT CARD WILL BE CHARGED FOR THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF TIME YOU RESERVED AND AN ADDITIONAL _ 25.00 SERVICE FEE PER ROOM IS CHARGED. THERE ARE NO CREDITS FOR LATE CHECK IN OR EARLY CHECK OUT. THERE ARE NO REFUNDS FOR INCLEMENT WEATHER DURING THE WINTER SEASON. YOU CAN RESCHEDULE YOUR STAY WITH US FOR ANOTHER TIME WHEN WE HAVE A VACANCY. ALL MASSAGE THERAPY AND WELLNESS SESSIONS ARE SUBJECT TO OUR CANCELLATION POLICIES. ALL GIFT CERTIFICATES ARE SUBJECT TO OUR CANCELLATION POLICIES. ALTHOUGH WE ALWAYS TRY TO ACCOMODATE YOUR REQUESTED ROOM, DUE TO UNFORESEEN CIRCUMSTANCES WE CANNOT GUARANTEE A SPECIFIC ROOM. BEDSPREADS, COMFORTERS MAY BE DIFFERENT THEN WHAT IS DEPICTED IN THE PICTURES. + More

description: Description The Space I live in an eleven room house 100 yards from Long Island Sound. The bedroom for rent has a double bed. The shared bathroom is large with two sinks. There is a half bath and a walk in shower on the first floor. Depending on the season, you can swim in the Sound and/or walk on the beach which is rarely crowded. You will be less than twenty minutes from New Haven with it's great theaters and wonderful art museums. You will also be an hour and forty minute train ride from New York City and the train is within walking distance from the house. Milford Point is 5 miles away and one of the best birding sites on the east coast of North America. Downtown Milford is the home of many boutique shops and very good restaurants. Milford is a colonial town, the historical society is just a short walk away, passing several 18th and 19th century houses along the way. What makes my place unique is that it's between Boston and New York. It's a small city with great amenities close to New Haven, a center for great music, theater and art. The Neighborhood The sunrises, the sunsets, the walk along the beach, the closeness to downtown restaurants, Post Office, Library and Theaters. Getting Around 20 minute walk from downtown and the train station. Two minute walk to the beach. Other Things to Note I don't offer breakfast but I do offer coffee and fruit. There is a $50 cancellation fee. + More

description: Description The Space The house is unique because it combines beautifully the rustic and the modern. It's one of the few single family homes in Wooster Square. The views are very pretty and the location is ideal for whatever you would like to do in New Haven or Yale. Other shared areas of the house can be used for reading, eating, or relaxing. Guest Access Access to Wi-Fi, single bedroom, common areas (kitchen/fireside lounge, outdoor deck), and private full bathroom. Interaction with Guests My wife and I will be in the house during your stay if you are one person reserving one bedroom. We will not be in the house if the entire house is rented (see our other listing for the same property if you have a large group). The Neighborhood Best neighborhood in New Haven. Great area for walking or jogging. Getting Around Off Street Parking is available at the house. You can use the car or bike, or you can walk less than ten minutes to get Downtown. + More

about: Located 10 minutes from Mohegan Sun & Dodd Stadium, 15 minutes from Foxwoods, Connecticut College & the USCG Academy, midway between Boston and New York, you'll be well located to visit great places!
description: Description The Space Enjoy the comfort of a two bedroom apartment within a two-family home. Apartment has its own entrance. *Please note: this is a ground floor apartment but it is down a flight of stairs. If you're a new Airbnb guest, the following link will take you to a very helpful starter guide for guests explaining the difference between hotels and Airbnb lodging, written by a seasoned host. (URL HIDDEN) Guest Access Make a quick trip to the market or have all the provisions delivered to the door by Shoprite or Stop & Shop. The kitchen has all the tools you'll need to enjoy meals by your favorite chef--YOU. Set up the crock pot in the morning and dinner will be ready when you return from a day of exploration. Take a hot shower or soak in the claw foot tub and get a restful sleep for another great day. Interaction with Guests I'll be available if needed but out of your way. Let me know your arrival time and I'll have the place cozy and ready. Please let me know if you'll be celebrating a special occasion. The Neighborhood This is an old neighborhood. The homes are charming and diverse early 20th century construction and no two homes look alike. Please note, if you prefer carbon copy developments this won't be to your taste. The neighborhood and residents are quirky and genuine. My home was built in 1905. The back yard has a small body of water teeming with peep frogs and a pair of ducks each spring-haven't seen or heard the ducks yet this year. The side yard is a meadow of wild flowers. There's a Starbuck's, Dunkin Donuts, Dairy Queen, McDonald's, Wendy's, Burger King, Five Guys, Little Caesar's and 99 Restaurant all within three miles. There's a great northern Italian restaurant, and an Indian restaurant within walking distance as well as a good Irish pub, Vietnamese restaurant (Monday to Friday) and Thai about a mile away. Mohegan Sun hosts numerous restaurants and shopping and is just 10 minutes away. Getting Around There are many great destinations in Connecticut! Mohegan Sun is 10 minutes away; Foxwoods is 15 minutes. In New London, the Garde Arts Center, Connecticut College, The Coast Guard Academy and Lyman Allyn Museum are about 15 minutes away. It's only half an hour to Mystic (Seaport and Aquarium); an hour to New Haven (Toad's Place, Yale, craft brewery, entertainment and night life); 30 minutes to Hartford (Trinity College, City Steam craft brewery, entertainment at XL Center and night life); 20 minutes to Willimantic (Eastern Connecticut State University, Willibrew craft brewery); 40 minutes to Storrs (UConn). Explore the CT Wine Trail or hike at Devil's Hopyard or Lantern Hill. In Essex, just 40 minutes away, visit the CT River Museum, charming shops and the Griswold Inn, (one of the oldest bars in the country) where The Jovial Crew performs sea chanteys and other maritime music every Monday from 8 to 11 p.m. It's a unique form of entertainment that draws visitors from around the world. Recently the Griswold Inn appeared on the Huffington Post's list: The "10 Most Historic Restaurants and Inns in the World", with a nod to The Jovial Crew! Visit Gillette's Castle or catch a great show at The Goodspeed Opera House. You'll be well located for the next leg of your vacation continuing on to Boston, Providence, New York, New Hampshire or Vermont. Other Things to Note Full bed, twin bed and full size futon allow for a family of four to stay comfortably at a great low price. There's a washer and dryer in the basement. You'll have all the conveniences of home! + More
rules: House Rules Please treat my home and neighborhood as you'd want me to treat yours. **No smoking or pets on premises. There will be a $100 PER DAY fee for smoking inside.** *Quiet from 10 p.m. to 9 a.m. (I will be too). + More

about: This stone solar-powered cabin is nestled just above our spring fed hilltop pond. It has a queen bed and a double futon couch. The large deck overlooking the pond is perfect for getting a good dose of the outdoors, star gazing and some quality R&R.
description: Description The Space This cabin, along with 6 other rental cabins, is set on Sticks and Stones Farm. The location is perfect for anyone wanting to come to the country: nature lovers, hikers, bird watchers, photographers, artists and writers all find it a welcome haven. Guest Access 60 acres of woods, trails, bio intensive garden and farm stand, river, ponds, unique structures, stone barn, commercial kitchen, ping pong table, yoga room, 54' moss and stone Chartre Labyrinth, zig zag moss path, rustic kitchen, outdoor shower, kayaking. If arranged ahead there is also massage, private yoga classes, personal wilderness guide ad fishing trips for an extra fee. Please be advised that during drought our two ponds may be too low for swimming and boating. Interaction with Guests Guests can be secluded as they want tucked away in their cabin, or can come on out and be social and join in with farm and retreat activities. If prearranged at the time of booking you can join us for a scrumptious, clean, and simple $10 breakfast. The Neighborhood There is lots to do in the towns surrounding Sticks and Stones Farm; Newtown, Monroe, Easton and Fairfield, but most of our guests prefer to kick back, stay put and enjoy the quiet energy of the farm setting. Getting Around Metro North trains run to Westport from Grand Central and one can rent a car in Westport near the train station at Avis (less expensive and more availability then in NYC) or you can take a train to Fairfield and take a cab to the farm (about $75 one way without tip). With plenty of notice and working around our farm schedule, we will do pick-up for $100 round trip, (no tip necessary) We ask that all guests arrive before 7 pm. Are you a seasoned biker? You can bring your bike on Off Peak trains and bike to the farm! Other Things to Note TO BRING: ~Good walking shoes ~Flashlight or headlamp each. ~Umbrella ~Layered clothes for warmth... one never knows! ~Bug repellant if you use it. ~Each should bring your own towel/washcloth/toiletries and bathing suit! ~We have oil vinegar, S&P and cookware and dinner ware. ~We have shampoo and body wash ON DOGS: Guide dogs only WE HAVE CATS! + More
rules: House Rules Guests MUST arrive well before dark. Please take traffic conditions into condition especially on holiday weekends and allow plenty of travel time. One of our focuses is providing a healthy environment for anyone on our property and thus we are a smoke free, drug free, alcohol free farm. A beer or a glass of wine in the privacy of your cabin is fine, but we do not hold public functions with alcohol, nor is it a "party place". There is absolutely no smoking allowed anywhere on the property (no E-cigs) either please. If there is anything you need during your stay, please come find one of us and we will attend to it promptly. We do love sharing our lifestyle at the farm and appreciate how respectfull all of our guests have been. Much aloha and peace to all during your visit at Sticks and Stones Farm! + More
