about: Experience Historic and Diverse New Haven: Charming Rustic 1900-Oysterman's House in Quinnipiac Fair Haven Village. Entire cottage, 2 br, 1.5 bath, kitchen, LR, Wifi. 2 miles from downtown/Yale (Uber or D-bus). Walk to the marina for breakfast.
description: Description The Space EXPERIENCE NEW HAVEN DIFFERENTLY IN FAIR HAVEN. Built in 1900, this house is a piece of New Haven Quinnipiac river waterfront history. The New Haven oyster industry was a major enterprise in the last quarter of the nineteenth century and in the early years of the twentieth century. (New Haven's oyster industry:(phone number hidden), by Virginia M. Galpin. New Haven Colony Historical Society, 1989) Single family house, two bedrooms, kitchen, LR, private backyard, and parking for 2 cars. Enter through the second floor with an open floor plan from living-room to kitchen that flows through French doors to private stone patio; full bathroom with shower. There is one bedroom (Queen-size bed) and a half bath upstairs, on the third floor. There is a second bedroom (full-size bed) on the first floor. River views from living room and bedroom loft. Check out the pictures. Watch the Oyster boats putter just yards from your front door. Walking distance to the Boat House Cafe breakfast place on the river. Coffee and tea on the house, you can cook your own meals, or get a take out. Oven and dishwasher. The space is warmly decorated, has fresh linens and towels. Washer and dryer on site. Lots of books. WIFI. No TV. (NEW ADDITION: Central Air will be installed in the spring for the summer months.) Sit in the backyard and watch the birds in the tall trees. Walk down the street to look at historic houses, and watch the boats at the marina, rent a canoe or kayak to experience our beautiful river, check out the antique store across the street open on weekends, get a bottle of wine at classy Grand Vin across the historic Grand Avenue bridge. Relax in the cozy living room, lots of books available to you. There is a desk if you need to work. Iron table and iron available if you need to get ready for an interview or business meeting. New Haven has lots of restaurant to choose from, especially downtown. But diversity is also offered in our Fair Haven neighborhood. Along the busy and eclectic Grand avenue, you'd find bakeries, and small eateries, with delicious sandwiches, pastries, and hot meals, of italian and latino flavors. We'll share our favorite addresses with you. Read the recent article: (URL HIDDEN) Ask us questions, and we'll try to answer them. I just want you to enjoy your stay, whatever the reasons you have to come to town. Guest Access Don and I will be your hosts. We will get you oriented. We will provide a peace of mind. We live a few houses down the street. Check out the profile and review pages for more information. Stay in your own space, cook your own meals, enjoy your privacy in the entire house. Relax in the peaceful backyard with beautiful trees. There are 2 bedrooms, an office space, river views. All furnished. Sorry no TV. Interaction with Guests Don and/or I 'will greet our guests with a smile at their arrival and welcome them to the neighborhood and New Haven at large! We will share information as needed, and answer questions. They'll enjoy a safe stay and treat the house as if it were their own. They will leave the place the way they found it, neat, and well organized. The Neighborhood The Quinnipiac river historic neighborhood is one of the most overlooked neighborhoods of New Haven. Diversity of people and birds. City life with proximity to shops on Grand Avenue, and beautiful natural open spaces. Our bridge is an "asymetrical steel swing bridge". This side of town next to the Q river, also called Fair Haven, is beautiful, rich in history, cultures, arts, family-friendly, community-oriented, and safe. Parks, restaurants, shops, schools. People live here, work here, and do interact with each other. (URL HIDDEN) Getting Around On D-bus - 2 miles or 10/15 minutes from downtown Or use Uber - you'll be downtown in 5-10 minutes. Other Things to Note At the end of the stay, guests will dispose of their trash and recycling into city bins that are collected weekly; they will undo the bed and fold the sheets at the bottom of the bed; they shall wash all dishes. All doors will be locked. + More
rules: House Rules I give special attention to MUTUAL RESPECT, COMMUNICATION AND NEATNESS. It's okay to be shy, or confident; it's NOT OKAY TO BE RUDE, oblivious, or snob. During their stay, guests will respect the place as if it were their own. At the end of the stay, guests will tidy up the place, dispose of their trash and recycling into city bins that are collected weekly; they will undo the bed and fold the sheets at the bottom of the bed; they shall wash all dishes, empty the dish washer, clean the kitchen. All doors will be locked, Heat turned down. in addition: - Please keep your outdoors shoes at the door. - Please keep the doors locked, the same key operates on all doors. - There is no smoking in the house. If you smoke outside, please collect your cigarette butts into a safe place. - Please empty trash cans into the respective city bins in the driveway, regularly throughout your stay, and upon departure (Note, we recycle). - Food should only be stored in the fridge or in sealed containers. - Upon departure, please leave your towels on the bathroom floor, and the sheets at the bottom of the bed. - KEY RETURN: I can meet you or you can drop out the key @ 29 GRAND AVE. + More

about: This is a studio apartment within a historic home. Cozy for... a weekend country retreat, Boston-NY mid-way meet-up, or graduation celebration!
description: Description The Space Are you wanting to come to Storrs to catch a show, visit friends or family nearby or at UConn, or just to get away? Come! The Space: A private studio apartment within a historic home that we live in. The home is located on a quiet lovely street, also flanked by historic homes of lovely neighbors. 1.5 miles from UConn, with trails to the Nipmuck and Fenton River. Cozy for a weekend retreat, Boston-NY midway meet-up, or graduation celebration! The apartment will someday be for aging mothers, but for now they visit only from time to time! About us: We are young, professional, and tidy. We also love to live, laugh and have fun. We are often away with our new baby visiting family on the weekends. In a world of giant houses but limited community... we are looking forward to making a bit of extra money and to sharing our great space with you. In particular, the house has a rich cultural and artistic history and we look forward to sharing it! Warmly, Jess and Andrew Guest Access Guest Access: Full access to entire studio apartment. Access to common lounge that has piano and full kitchen. Additional amenities: We play music (there is a piano and there are electric and acoustic guitars you are welcome to use), garden a bit (there is a pond, 7 acre property, gazebo, gardens, boat, and ample picnic and BBQ spaces you are welcome to use), and have a small baby (there is a pack-n-play crib and various useful baby things available upon request). Interaction with Guests Interaction with guests: We anticipate that interaction would mostly be minimal. We are happy of course to communicate to answer any questions. The Neighborhood Neighborhood Overview: Safe town and neighborhood, beautiful property, hiking trails directly behind house, lovely neighbors, 1.5 miles from UConn. Getting Around We generally walk the trails and around the property, bike to the grocery store, but drive elsewhere. Other Things to Note Please note: The access to the studio apartment requires ascending a 18 foot spiral staircase. + More

description: Description The Space Here's your perfect guest house to use as a base while visiting kids at area prep schools, visiting parents at the McLean continuing care community, participating in events at the International Skating Center or exploring Connecticut. We offer three bedrooms and two bathrooms, all on the 2nd floor, with expansive living areas and gourmet kitchen access. Our home is in a quiet residential area, a short walk to McLean and a two minute drive to Simsbury Center. Guests describe it as a very comfortable and spacious house with park-like private grounds. Guests may have three bedrooms, two with double beds and one with a queen bed. We supply linens and towels, plus down comforters and quilts. The living room has a large flat-screen television with cable, and the kitchen is well equipped for any need. There is off-street parking and wi-fi is available. There is always a chance I will not be on-site, but I have a handyman available in case of an emergency. Guest Access Guests may have use of the bedrooms and bathrooms on the second floor, along with open access to common living space and the kitchen on the main floor in case you want to cook. There is a laundry room with a washer and dryer plus an ironing board and iron in the basement guests are welcome to use. Interaction with Guests Our goal is to provide guests with a comfortable and relaxing home away from home. Depending on our schedule, we may be on-site after check-in. We will always be available via cellphone to answer any questions or address any concerns. The Neighborhood Simsbury is a classic New England town, with restaurants, several parks, an acclaimed public golf course and offers direct access to the multi-state rails-to-trails bicycle pathway. Westminster and Ethel Walker prep schools are also in town, as is the International Skating Center. The town also hosts the Talcott Mountain Music Festival, a series of concerts in the summertime. The Farmington River runs through the town and there are outfitters which offer kayak and canoe rentals as well as guide tours offered by the Farmington River Watershed Association. Simsbury also features the second busiest and well-equipped public library in the state, a wonderful resource. Getting Around There is no public transit in Simsbury other than commuter buses on weekdays. Bradley Airport has car rental firms, and there is an off-airport Enterprise Car Rental office in Simsbury, which is typically less expensive. Several locations in town offer free bicycle and helmet loans and there are some great rides and trails. Other Things to Note - The cleaning fees are higher for parties of three or more and will be quoted at the time of a reservation inquiry + More

about: Country setting with an immediate feeling of peace when you arrive. Tranquil environment, nature, southern exposure.
description: Description The Space Charming 1930's cape nestled deep in the woods. Writers, artists, health and wellness oriented people gravitate here and enjoy the feeling of being tucked away surrounded by nature. If you enjoy privacy, organic gardening, and are looking to kick back than this is the place for you. Listen to the owls, walk to the lakes, dozens of hiking trails, or curl up and read your favorite book. There is a large vaulted studio bedroom that is light and bright. Your own full private bath with a shower. There is a dorm size refrigerator, microwave & table in your room. A memorable stay, as you enjoy the views looking out the window or sitting on your private upper deck. Great spot for a workshop inside or out. Amenities: -Coffee maker, dishes, flatware, utensils. -Mini-fridge -Towels and soap --WiFi -Lots of interesting books Other things to know: There is no kitchen Quiet contemplative - not a party environment 2 people maximum (one double bed) As to children --- there is only the one bed No smoking No pets Plenty of space for parking Area includes hiking, horseback riding, shopping, summer theater. The center of town offers coffee shops, grocery stores, a $2 movie theater,summer theater, library and restaurants... Newtown is located about 75 minutes from Manhattan, one hour from Bradley International Airport near Hartford and about 2.5 hours from Boston. Train stations Metro North in nearby towns, 1 Hour drive to New York. Gardens, pathways We are active outside in the garden, when it is warm. We honor people's privacy. Deer, turkey, rabbit, hawks, lakes, hiking trails, close proximity to center of town, quick access to I-84..... Nearby: There is a train station in Bethel, Danbury, Fairfield, Westport, CT & Brewster, NY. Bonanza Bus is in Southbury and Danbury, CT. Guest Access The upper deck, the property. + More

description: Description The Space Sleep, Create, Rehearse!! We are located on nine wooded acres at the foothills of the Berskhire Mountains and surrounded by state parks (Kent Falls, Macedonia State Park and more!), private schools, and the Appalachian Trail. We're a short distance from two traditional New England covered bridges and just three miles from the charming town of Kent, an enchanting travel destination situated beside the Housatonic River. You can stroll around town and take advantage of Kent's great restaurants, galleries and shopping. We provide internet and breakfast, along with two loving dogs and two evil parrots. A perfect escape from the city, and only two hours away, we offer our home as a place to come and unwind. There are so many things to do but if you want to just sit in the sun and read that's fine too. We have wi-fi and if you have work to do, there are plenty of tables on which to set up your computer. There is an art studio you can work in. Just bring your supplies or, if you want, you're welcome to use my potter's wheels and and there is clay you can purchase from me. We have hiking trails all around the house. If you have a car, the state park is just a few minutes down the road. There are great biking roads and the rail trail isn't too far away. There are wonderful restaurants in Kent and sweet little shops for clothing, art and crafts. There is a coffee and chocolate shop with outdoor tables - just perfect for people-watching. There are a couple of wineries that are fairly close by. You may see us around, but the house is large enough to get lost in. On warm days you can have breakfast on the screened-in porch. It's on the second floor so you'll feel like you're in the trees canopy with lots of birds to watch. Breakfast items will be provided, i.e. cereal, fruit, toast, etc. Coffee and tea are included. We also have an additional building of 3400 sq. ft. which houses a pottery and art studio and can also be used as a rehearsal space (theater, music, lecture hall, etc.) Please call or email for hall rental pricing. Adequate verification is required. We prefer check in by 5PM. Please understand that we have two parrots and two very friendly dogs, but with that you sometimes get the noise and smells associated with them. Other Things to Note Friendly dogs are welcome, but there is a charge of $10 per dog, per night, to be paid upon arrival. + More
rules: House Rules Check-in before 5PM, or call or email to let us know when you will arrive. No eating, drinking, or painting your nails in bed, please. + More

about: Westport home near town and on the shuttle line to Saugatuck station of Metro North to GC. We are listed as a private room with bath near by but our home has additional bedrooms if you are more than two people. Four legged family members welcome!
description: Description The Space Clean, bright bedroom(s). Queen bedroom with hall bath. All to yourself. Hardwood floors. This listing showcases the primary bedroom with private bath there is a bunk room next to it should you be a family and additional sleeping quarters available. The end of our street is a pick up for the town bus service that takes commuters to and from the Saugatuck Train Station, New Haven line...Grand Central/Westport. Walk to Westport Town Center, 3 miles to Longshore (public golf course/pool/sailing) 3.5 miles to Compo Beach. Next to Town tennis courts! One acre, park like lawn, great back yard for touch football, barbecue (coal fired). Winter cozy to a full size wood burning fireplace in living room or the glass enclosed room overlooking the back yard warmed by the pellet stove...a lovely spot for morning coffee and the New York Times. This property backs onto 8 undeveloped acres. Deer, fox, coyote, red tailed hawks as well as cardinels, bluejays, squirrels and assorted standard wildlife are our neighbors and pass this land. We are a pet friendly home so if you have a dog who is lives for the chase make sure a leash is on when outside. Our two dogs are small, 6 lb maltese who is princely and hardly leaves the front door. Guest Access Kitchen, Laundry, Sun Room, Back deck Interaction with Guests As little or as much as desired. The Neighborhood Two cul de sac streets in a true walk to town (and the new Java Hut) location. Getting Around The end of our street is pick up for commuter shuttle to Saugatuck Train Station of Metro North to go to Grand Central Station. + More
rules: House Rules As our primary residence we are pleased to welcome you to our home. We are casual and easy going. description: Description The Space A clean and comfortable bedroom with shared bath in Torrington. Minutes away from historic Litchfield, a great drive to Route 7. A great drive all year long, but especially beautiful during autumn. Visit Kent Falls, Nodine's Smokhouse, The Litchfield Green, Great Barrington or Stockbridge. See a show at the Warner Theater or The Mahawie in Great Barrington. Go antiquing up Route 7. Great fun! I have a chihuahua named Charlie who likes to bark, but will jump in your lap after a few minutes, but he sheds, so I wouldn't recommend wearing black. I have a cat named JR who spends most of his time prowling outside, though he loves being pet. Smoking is allowed on the deck or the porch. The guestroom has a single bed, but I don't charge any extra for two people, so if you want to bring a guest that's fine. And I can cook any meals you request for an extra charge, I love to cook! A TV with DVD player is available. ***Small pets are allowed*** Bedroom is located on second floor next to master bedroom. Bath located on same floor. Shower/bath. Brand new carpet on the second floor. + More

about: This homely nook is located on a private road in Lakeville, CT within walking distance from town lake and restaurants. This cozy accommodation is a short proximity from boarding schools, Lime Rock Park, Winery's, Golf Club's and Appalachian Trail's.
description: Description The Space ***This Hideaway*** If you love the four seasons and you're looking to disconnect from the city's hustle and bustle lifestyle then we've got a quiet getaway apartment for you, come on over and relax to the babbling brook and become one with nature again. This apartment is fully furnished, it houses all the accommodations for you to cook, eat, entertain and dream, it is an open concept with combination Full Kitchen, Living space, Dining area, and King size Bedroom with sitting area. We do not carry a land line, but if you need to make a call just step out into the fresh air and go for it. Limited WiFi Access is available, (stream one movie at a time) but you're welcome to disconnect and enjoy peace and tranquility at your own discretion. ***Something about the Country outdoors*** If you love to walking, running, cycling, camping and hiking then this is the place to be, but if you need to visit our area events and attractions you'll need a car, again If you need something just ask. ***NOTE:*** *A car is necessary to get around, *Space available for Bikes/Skis *Access to Netflix on 47 in" flat screen TV in Living area *Sleeps 4 : 2 on the King bed and 2 on a air mattress if needed *This is the country life, don't be alarmed by spiders, insects, squirrels, and birds. Guest Access Feel free to wonder around the lawn area and possibly sit next to the brook, the deck area is under construction and off limits at this time. It will be available next seasons, so let's keep in touch. Interaction with Guests First of all you're a guest at our home, of course we would love to meet you. If you prefer to not to be disturbed we definitely understand. I'm also available by phone , by email or just knock on our door, please feel free to introduce yourself and let me know how I can make your day and stay comfortable. Any suggestions, question or issues, just call us! The Neighborhood ***Welcome to the Neighborhood*** We are located just off a dirt road with friendly neighbors. Depending on the season you might hear an occasional lawn mower or snow blower. Getting Around *** No public Transportation *** *** Walking Distance to local Restaurant and Convenient Store *** *** Taxi Arrangement could be arrange for a price *** Other Things to Note This apartment is perfect for parents visiting private schools - Hotchkiss, Salisbury Boys, Indian Mountain, Berkshires, Maplebrook, and Kildonan Lakeville Lake for swimming, boating and fishing Harney Tea , Irving Farm Coffee Lion Rock Farm or Interlaken Inn weddings and retreats Music Mountain Summer festivals Lime Rock Race Track Sharon Playhouse- Tri Arts Butternut, Catamount and Mohawk skiing. Horse back riding Appalachian trail hiking Harlem Valley Bike Trail Scenic roads for cycling Housatonic River for canoeing or fishing Kent Falls, Bash Bish Falls Winery's and Art Galleries Salisbury Ski Jump Hotchkiss, Salisbury, Indian Mountain, and Berkshire Schools Metro North Station - Wassaic Golf Clubs and Courses Historical Buildings and Churches Buy Local Shops and Eateries + More

about: Very clean and well kept! Close to town, train, beaches, shops, and more!!
description: Description The Space You have your own room with TV and wifi access, use of full kitchen, during spring and summer months out door patio with freestanding fire pit, and BBQ to enjoy too. Walk to park with small man made lake, tennis courts, baseball field and a large work out gym at end of the street. If you are a runner it's great area for running. Beaches, shops, and restaurants 5 minutes away. You can also walk to the train station to take you in to other areas of CT and NYC without driving! Beaches are 5 mins away by car or 15 on bike. Guest Access You will have access to the whole home except the master bedroom. There is a shared master bath and a half bath downstairs. There is an office space if you need to use copier, computer, wifi. Interaction with Guests Im not always here, as I travel for work, when I am I love to cook and show you around town. I'm easy going and love to entertain. The Neighborhood Walk to park with small man made lake, tennis courts, baseball field and a large work out gym at end of the street. If you are a runner it's great area for running. You can also walk or ride a bike to the train station to take you in to other areas of CT and NYC without driving! Walk orchids a bike to town, trains, and beaches. There is a bike available for your use too! Getting Around Train station in walking distance, bike, and off street parking for your car. Other Things to Note I'm told that my place has more appeal than what I am telling...secure and safe environment. + More

about: Hello, and thanks for looking at our listing. My name is Michael and my roommate is Travis. Our house is 5 minutes from downtown, 10 from the beach and 45 from NYC (5 minutes to the train).
description: Description The Space Our house was recently renovated to be very modern. This includes a completely updated kitchen, hardwood floors, furniture and more. We have a large backyard and driveway parking. Guest Access Guests will be able to access the room they're staying in, both bathrooms, living room (with fireplace (just double check with one of us first)), kitchen and backyard. Interaction with Guests Travis and I both leave Connecticut often for work / travel, but one of us will always be home. While you're here, we can make suggestions on what to do / see, where to eat / drink, train times and more. The Neighborhood Neighborhood is a lovely residential area with a High School close by. Our house is situated perfectly in the best part of Norwalk. Getting Around Most attractions are a short cab ride away. You can get downtown with a cab / Uber in a matter of minutes - so it shouldn't cost much. Transportation to NYC from our house is very close and super convenient. Other public transportation isn't the best. Other Things to Note We have a bullmastiff. Rugbert Alfred Dawson (real name) is very people friendly. He's also pet friendly but we'd prefer you didn't bring a pet (however, this is negotiable). + More
rules: House Rules The most important rule is to always use a coaster! The kitchen counters are marble and stain easily. Almost all of the furniture is also brand new. Fireplace can be used but we just ask for a heads up (we can help out!) + More

about: This 3 bedroom ranch style home is conveniently located in central CT for easy access to everything. Minutes from I91 and RT9 you can go to the beach, the CT River, casinos and entertainment in no time. Boston and NYC are 2 hours drive as well.
description: Description The Space This house is ready to call home. Bright and cheery with a laid back flair, the floorplan flows beautifully. This fully equipped home will welcome you back after a day of sightseeing, or business meetings to enjoy dinner or just relax. Guest Access You will have access to the entire house and yard. The finished downstairs room is ideal for quiet time away. The "office" can be a great work or computer space. The 2 car attached garage makes for easy access to the house with bags. The main level laundry room is easily accessible. The fully equipped kitchen is a great place to gather as a family and enjoy meals together. If meals out is your preference, there are many fine eating establishments within an easy drive. Interaction with Guests Our Riverbend community is a safe and friendly neighborhood. All of our neighbors are nice and helpful. The Neighborhood Our neighborhood is unique in that we have a diverse mix of families racially and age wise. We love the diversity and hope you will too. There is a 5 mile paved bike/walking trail that runs throughout the community for jogging, bike rides, or strollers. Getting Around Middletown has a transit system and busses come by regularly. We do recommend a car however, to access all that our beautiful state has to offer. Other Things to Note We prefer long term guests, so do consider extending your stay and explore beautiful Connecticut. + More
rules: House Rules We live in a planned unit development, so there are some association rules. Please no loud parties after 9 p.m., no trailers on the property. No pets or smoking; no laundry draped outside. Trash is to be placed in receptacles and brought to the curb on Thursday mornings. + More

about: Great location, walk to town & only steps to the Connecticut River. Great for train aficionados- you can watch and photograph the famous Essex steam train in action.This historic factory built in 1874 has manufactured sails, metal objects and lastly Lace. Enjoy your private comfortable apartment with river views.
description: Description The Space This private apartment overlooks the Connecticut River, Essex steam train and Becky Thatcher Riverboat. It is part of an old factory. You have your own private entrance and deck. Guest Access Please feel free to use our kayaks, and play with our dog and chickens. Interaction with Guests Angus and I both work a lot but we are home every night and would be happy to hang out with you for a bit. On a good night maybe we'll take a boat ride or go for a paddle! Or walk into town with you to check out the pub up the street. The Neighborhood Our neighborhood is awesome, the river is right across the street we get to see everybody because they walk their dogs down here. There is a park across the street. You can walk into town it's less than a mile away. This building is a yen event venue. We are three seasons and do weddings from April to November. Weekends would not be available as we have weddings and your space doubles as the bridal suite!!! Getting Around Public transportation is a little bit tricky, although you can take a train to Saybrook which is about 15 minutes from us and either take a taxi or Uber or possibly we can pick you up at the train station if that is your motive transportation. Other than that we are very close to the highway and a convenient drive. + More
rules: House Rules We expect you to enjoy yourself, but treat our property with respect. + More

about: Beautiful home across street from ocean. Enjoy a private bedroom, bathroom, living area with amazing view of ocean. WIFI, parking. Easily accessible to I-95, Merritt Pky, Route 1, & train station. Share with myself and cute persian cat named Gizmo.
description: Description The Space Quiet, peaceful enviornment with the sound of the ocean in the background. My home is immaculate! Enjoy a private bedroom on second floor with a Queen Bed. Full bathroom next to bedroom. Living area for private use on top floor which has waterviews or enjoy the main floor living space with gas fireplace, TV. WIFI throughout the house. Friends describe my home as peaceful, warm, comfortable and inviting. Guest Access WIFI, kitchen, private bedroom, bathroom, private living space if wanted, or enjoy the main living room. Washer/Dryer Interaction with Guests I reside here, but you will find me out and about socializing or working. The Neighborhood Milford is a coastal city in Southwestern New Haven County. It has over 14 miles of shoreline facing Long Island Sound. Easily accessible to Interstate 95, US Route 1, and The Wilbur Cross Parkway. MetroNorth New Haven line is 7 minutes away. You can hop the train and spend the day in Manhattan which is an hour and a half away. Points of interest in Milford are Silver Sands State Park, and Charles Island. Westfield Milford Mall is 5 minutes away to enjoy shopping or a movie at the 13 theatres within. Three local resturants are within walking distance from my home, which I enjoy on a weekly basis. Walking or riding a bike around the beach area is enjoyable as every day is a different day when you live near the water. Visit the Pez Museum for fun or go to Mohegan Sun Casino and Foxwoods. New Haven is a short ride which homes Yale University, unique shops, fine dining and theatre. You won't be disappointed staying in Milford, its convienent to everything you could hope to do! Getting Around Busline, Metro North Milford Station, Interstate 95, Merritt Parkway within 5 minutes Other Things to Note Gizmo, a shy, friendly white Persian Cat resides here as well. + More
rules: House Rules I would expect common courtesty and cleanliness. I love my home, please respect it! No pets. Smoking allowed in the garage or outdoors on the decks/patio. + More

about: Clean, modern and large, our guest house has all the amenities and comforts of home. Full kitchen, king bed, gas fireplace, laundry and spacious grounds with meditation hill, fire pit, stone fences, path in the woods and nearby hiking trails.
description: Description The Space Welcome to the gentle countryside of southern Connecticut. Gorgeous stone fences, small roads for walking and cycling, Aspetuck River tributaries amongst the trees and of course, a beautiful, clean home to relax, laugh, read, and just enjoy. We've hosted writers, artists, vacationing entrepreneurs and families. We look forward to meeting you too! Guest Access You have your own driveway as well as own entrance to your house. Guest house shares a wall with main house, but there is no access between the two. You are welcome to share our outdoor pool (available May to September) and explore the grounds anytime. Interaction with Guests We are delighted to greet you, get you settled in, and are available to answer questions and help if you need supplies. We work from home in the main house most days, but are always reachable by text or email. You will see us on the property during your visit and we are happy to interact. We are also respectful of your privacy and thank you in advance for the same. The Neighborhood The area is perfect for walking and biking. We are 20 minutes from Fairfield and Westport with lots of shopping, beautiful restaurants, and a 1 hour train ride into Manhattan. There are also many fun, delicious restaurants within 5 minutes. We have tried most so are happy to advise you. Getting Around The Metro North train stops many times during the day heading both north and south in nearby Fairfield. Taxis to and from the house are approximately $100, so it's best to rent a car or drive your own. However, we are happy to work with you to pick you up and drop you off for a nominal fee. Just ask when you inquire for your reservation and we'll let you know our availability. Other Things to Note We are happy to create a simple agreement with daytime guests who would like to utilize the house as your studio or workplace. Long term overnight guests (28 or more days) will be asked to sign an additional rental agreement. + More
rules: House Rules We accept pets on a case by case basis, and charge as an additional guest based upon our discussion. Please be in touch with details and we are happy to consider it. + More

about: 2-room suite with private bath, in unique custom architect-designed post-and-beam country home. On a 10-acre private estate overlooking a 1/2 acre pond, teaming with wildlife, high atop a hill with stunning panoramic views of distant mountains.
description: Description The Space Bedroom has antique 4-poster double bed with featherbed and vintage Laura Ashley linens; 2 windows and skylight; flat-screen television with DVD player; Bose radio with CD player. Adjoining sitting room with sofa has computer with internet access and DVD player. Wifi throughout the house. Both rooms and bath have individual thermostats you can set to your own comfort level. Enjoy our main floor living room with comfy sofas in front of the fireplace, flat screen tv and DVD player. AMENITIES: ~ Fishing in our bass-stocked pond (there are bait stores nearby) ~ Boating on the pond (we have a rowboat) ~ Continental breakfast (typically fresh fruit, cured meats and cheeses, cereal, coffee/tea, and pastry, toast, English muffins or bagels.) ~ Free wifi accessible throughout the property ~ Free phone calls to 50 states + Puerto Rico ~ Free computer with wired internet for your use ~ Extensive DVD library ~ Down or synthetic pillows available (down unless otherwise requested) ~ Off-street parking ATTRACTIONS: [See our "GUIDEBOOK" section for more ideas] ~ 5 minutes from Ski Sundown (downhill skiing) ~ Farmington River, famous for fly-fishing and river tubing ~ New Hartford center... historic, quaint and Victorian ~ State boat launch on beautiful West Hill Lake ~ New Hartford is home to 2 wineries, with 3 more within 15-minutes; there are now 25 wineries on the CT Wine Trail! ~ Enjoy top-notch New England fall foliage with our superb panoramic view! Guest Access We encourage our guests to enjoy the living room, sunroom, deck and yard. In the living area for your enjoyment are a fireplace, flat-screen tv, DVD player and DVD library. Our panoramic view can also be enjoyed from chairs in the sunroom -- especially nice in inclement weather. The 'overlook' in the yard has a sitting area with a chiminea (if you're in the mood for an outdoor fire); it's a nice spot to enjoy a glass of wine at sunset. Feel free to chill beverages or put perishables in the refrigerator. Just ask if you have need for ice, ice bucket, beverage glasses, corkscrew, firewood (for the living room fireplace or chiminea), or for cushions for the deck chairs if they've been stored away. Interaction with Guests We strive to find the right balance between welcoming our guests and interacting with them, and respecting their privacy. We generally take cues from our guests. We enjoy meeting the diverse and interesting people we host! The Neighborhood This is secluded countryside with no neighborhood per se. We think that's the attraction of the property, and it's geared for those seeking relaxation and nature. There are restaurants, groceries and shopping centers about 5 miles away. Getting Around There is little public transport in the area. There are train stations in Waterbury (@ 25 minutes from us by car) and Hartford (@40 minutes by car). There is bus service from Hartford to the area but not within walking distance of the house. + More
rules: House Rules Please let us know your approximate arrival time the day before your reservation. We do not permit guest cooking in the kitchen (due to previous mishaps with our equipment). Guests use the pond and boat at their own risk. We do not supply personal flotation devices. BYO fishing rod + More

description: Description The Space Legends BNB Lodge, located on the banks of the scenic and wild Farmington river is an outdoor enthusiasts dream. Private direct river access to the world famous Greenwoods Pool. Fly fish 12 months a year, kayak,hike,bike,ski,snow shoe, go antiquing or just relax by the river. Take a room or the Lodge for your next family outing. Guest Access Direct river access, private decks, grill, beautiful grounds, spacious den with river views, fireplace and commercial kitchen (lodge renters only) Interaction with Guests Owners live on the premises and only interact with guests while preparing breakfast or setting up rooms. The Neighborhood Restaurants, drive in movie theater,antique shops and shopping within a mile of the lodge. Ski Sundown is less than three miles from Legends and offers evening skiing and snow boarding. Great fun for the whole family!! + More

about: Your own fully equipped & furnished urban oasis, all utilities provided. Don't pay downtown prices for downtown access. An easy walk or bus ride to the entertainment district, Yale campuses, Hospitals, Smilow Cancer Center.
description: Description The Space Spacious, bright 2nd floor of 3-family house. Yale employee landlord lives next door. Wifi Internet in every room. Eat-in kitchen w/ all appliances, table & chairs, microwave, pots, pans, dishes, flatware, etc. Dining area w/ table & chairs. Large bathroom w/towels. Living room with convertible futon sofa, DVR & 300-channel TV. Bedrooms w/ beds, linens, bureaus, desk. Local maps & take-out menus provided. Guest Access An old-fashioned, late Victorian house, the apartment has a living room, a central gathering room, a dining room, a separate eat-in kitchen, two bedrooms & a bathroom. Interaction with Guests My wife Marie & I live in the house next door, and the back yards connect. Brian is semi-retired and does most of the face-to-face hosting activity. We give our guests a maximum of privacy while remaining close by to deal with situations day or night. The Neighborhood We have lived for 14 years in this gentrifying neighborhood among residents from a variety of ethnic, racial, religious and socio-economic backgrounds. Multi-family houses and numerous small shops, stores and restaurants make for a dynamic and lively street scene. It's not a gated community, it's a lively urban setting. Come prepared for diversity! Getting Around Plenty of free parking on street in front of house. Other Things to Note Coin-op washer & drier in building. Outdoor table & chairs in fenced-in back yard. 3 city bus lines nearby. Walk to supermarket, near-by park for jogging/bicycling, Yale athletic fields, seasonal farmer's market, Dj Brew caf; natural food store/restaurant, Chinese grocery. Yale campus and downtown New Haven are about one mile (1 _ km) away. + More
rules: House Rules  Respect other tenant's rights to privacy, peace & quiet.  Please turn off AC (or turn down heat) when leaving the apartment.  No smoking in the apartment. + More

description: Description The Space Beautiful historical home in quiet neighborhood in New London, Connecticut. Built in 1852, the house offers spacious common areas indoors and out. WIFI is available throughout the home. We're a short walking distance to downtown New London where you can hop a ferry to the North Shore of Long Island (Orient Point/Greenport with connections to Shelter Island and South Shore), and Fishers Island. Mid-way between Boston and New York, New London has Amtrak service, and Union Station is a 10 minute walk downtown. A 10 minute drive gets you to Ocean Beach Park, on the water. Mystic, its Seaport and Aquarium are a 15 minute drive across the Thames River bridge. The casinos are a short drive, too. There is plenty of off-street parking available. There are restaurants and night spots of all shapes and sizes downtown (walkable), local bus service, and a spare bike or 2 as well. The master suite has a queen size bed in an enormous, airy room with an equally enormous master bath. The master bath has a large, classical style, claw foot bath tub and an amazing double shower. This room can be rented by itself, or can include an adjoining room to make it a suite. The additional room comes with its own half bath and has two twin beds, making the suite option perfect for families. If you are interested in booking the additional room, or any combination of the 4 rooms we have available, please send a message for pricing details. Ours is a big lovely old house - lots of stairs, corners to get comfortable in, views to take the breath away. Come enjoy it, and the Whaling City, as much as we do. NOTE: We have 3 other rooms available, and can accommodate larger parties. Full (hot) breakfast served Saturday and Sunday; continental breakfast Monday-Friday + More
rules: House Rules Smoking outside only, please. And since we (Grandmother, Grandfather, Mother/Daughter and Two Great and Charming Grandchildren, 6 and 8) live here, too, and have to slog off to work and school, no REALLY LOUD NOISE after 11, thanks. + More

about: Our comfortable home in Mystic is on a large lot adjacent to a nature preserve, and a 5 minute walk from our Mystic River kayaking/boat launching area. Use of ultra-modern kitchen included.
description: Description The Space Welcome to our pleasant, sunny, modern home in Mystic, CT, which backs up to a beautiful nature preserve, and yet is close to restaurants, Mystic Seaport, Mystic Aquarium, and the beautiful Mystic River. Bring your kayaks and bicycles! Or just sit on our large deck and enjoy! You can also bring your pets! Our friendly fox hound, Andy, a Rescue Dog, will greet you with open paws! He is gentle and very loving. We have two lovely rooms available, each of which will sleep two: the cozy Riverbend Room, or the sunny and larger Princess Room, whose Queen-size bed also sleeps two. These rooms share a modern semi-private bath. The Riverbend Room is $99.00 a night plus a $25 cleaning fee; the Prince/Princess Room is $119/night, plus the $25 cleaning fee. Weekends are an extra $10/night. We'd prefer a two-night minimum stay, but we are flexible. Singles, couples, and families are welcome! We can also provide transportation from train stations in Mystic, New London, or Westerly, RI, as the Amtrak train stops regularly at one or more of those stations. Welcome! Guest Access Private room, shared bath, access to kitchen, dining room, and grounds Interaction with Guests Interaction with guests: we like people, but also respect the need for privacy. We are pretty easy-going... The Neighborhood Quiet, safe, beautiful, good neighbors, well-kept. Getting Around You can walk to shopping (about 15 minutes) but a car is advisable, Other Things to Note Enjoy! + More

about: Newly renovated space atop charming Victorian home in the breezy east side of tiny Stonington Borough, a charming 18th c. fishing village. Views of coastal CT,RI, and NY, comfy beds, lovely bathrooms, just minutes from beaches, ports, and shops.
description: Description The Space Our house is located in the Lower East side of the village, within a block of the water, surrounded by stately mansions and an old barn, yet strangely private and quiet. Shops and restaurants are within a three minute walk from the house. A three-story Victorian built in 1902, it is a house full of character and yet recently renovated and comfortable with two new full bathrooms and a new kitchen. Enjoy the breezes by sitting on the rear deck or sitting in the cottage garden surrounded by roses, a pear tree, grape arbor and an ancient quince. The third floor is entirely private with two sleeping areas divided by a stair case, one containing a sturdy, comfortable pull-out twin bed and the other with an antique twin-plus bed and a twin trundle beneath it which can be placed in the adjacent yoga room for more privacy if desired. The space sleeps three comfortably. Please be aware that the stairs to the third floor are steep and somewhat narrow. Please see the photo of the staircase if this is a concern. Also, the ceilings in the dormers are 5'11, so one must mind one's head in places. The sun will waken you as the windows on the eastern side face the water directly and the windows let in full sunshine, so pull down the shades to sleep in after dawn. Stunning views of Watch Hill, Little Narragansett Bay, Fisher's Island Sound and Stonington Harbor can be seen from vantage points throughout the space. There is a small yoga and meditation room attached to the sleeping areas via a doorway complete with a yoga wall with ropes, for those who wish to begin or end their day with yoga practice. Feel free to use the bicycles, kayaks, and beach chairs during your stay. We often lay out an informal, complimentary continental breakfast for our guests, though it is not a listed amenity. UPDATE: We have just adopted two short-haired cats. They are not allowed in any bedroom areas and they keep to themselves. Guest Access Guests may use living room, deck, porch and garden. They may use the 2nd floor bathroom which will be shared, though we will do our best to use the lower floor bathroom to give you freer access to the upper bath. There is only one front door and one rear door to the house. Please use the front door only. If breakfast is offered, which is an informal complimentary continental meal, guests may access the kitchen. Interaction with Guests We are new Airbnb hosts and we hope to evolve as we go along, responding to the needs of our guests. We will be delighted to give you tips about the area but we also respect visitors' need for privacy. Life here is casual and my husband Stuart and I flow in and out of the house constantly, and leave our guests to their own devices . We often lay out a continental breakfast for our guests, but please don't enquire nor depend on this hospitality as it is not included in our amenities. The Neighborhood Stonington, CT was listed in Yankee Magazine's Top-10 Coastal Towns in 2015. The Borough is a unique fishing village situated on a small peninsula with public access to the shoreline throughout. With its history extending back to pre-Revolutionary times, the houses and architecture here span almost three centuries. Main St. is a charming place to stroll, window shop on Water St., enjoy great restaurants, visit the Point with its vistas of the Harbor, Fisher's Island, Watch Hill, Mystic Seaport and Groton in 270 degree views. Visit the beach or walk out on the old stone pier, take a sailing lesson at NESS, or pull in to Dodson's Boatyard on your own boat. The Lighthouse Museum is down the street and offers walking tours of the historical village. The area is chock full of antiquing, thrift shops, farmer's markets, lobster and seafood shacks, and don't miss the Velvet Mill which contains a whole variety of craft artisans, a brewery, a cheese shop, a bakery, galleries and shops in an old brick textile factory on the village outskirts. Mystic Seaport and Village, Pequot Museum, Mystic Aquarium and the vibrant town of Westerly, RI are all within a few miles of Stonington. And in the Autumn, leaf peepers make a pilgrimage to this lovely area to take in the stunning New England Fall foliage display. The stone walls themselves are numerous and mysterious, and seem to give this magical place its true name. Stunning beaches of Rhode Island are within a 20-minute drive, for swimming, surfing and sunbathing. But boating seems to be the favorite sport hereabouts and there are plenty of coves, harbors and miles of shoreline to explore. Barn Island is a wildlife sanctuary full of trails for hiking, boating, hunting and fishing. Getting Around There is no public transportation, so you will need your own two feet, plus a boat, bike, or automobile to get around. Uber taxis are available, Enterprise car rentals and the Amtrak train stations connecting Boston to DC are close by in Mystic, CT, Westerly, RI, and New London, CT. Southeastern CT Coastal train lines connect to New Haven and NYC. Other Things to Note In summer the Borough of Stonington is busy and full of people, cars, especially on the weekends. Street parking can get tight, though we have a driveway which can accommodate two vehicles when necessary. The week days are much more quiet here, especially after mid-October when the pace and population of the village slows down to only its year-round inhabitants. + More
rules: House Rules Guests are requested to keep things low-key and quiet between the hours of 10 pm and 7 am. Smoking is allowed in the outdoor living spaces. Please no pets without advance permission which we would grant on a case by case basis. We don't lock our doors, so if that concerns you, you might want to take whatever steps you need to feel secure. There is almost always someone present in the house day and night. We provide towels and linens. + More

description: Description The Space The glassed-in porch that wraps around the house has the best view of New Haven and West Haven sound, harbor and then skyline at night. The house is bright, has the most spectacular sunsets, and resort like feeling. It is a direct waterfront and the waves will lull you to sleep. The rooms are spacious. Guest Access 2 kitchens, living room, bar room, porch, laundry room, outdoor patio, use of kayaks with life jackets. Interaction with Guests I am a nurse and have lived in the area most of my life so I am available to help with directions, advise about the best restaurants especially the gems only the locals know about, events, activities, etc. The Neighborhood One block from Light House Point Park with beach, biking, walking trails, pavilions with grills, snack bar, a ride on the carousel on Sat & Sunday for .50. Minutes from Woodward Ave. park with tennis courts, soccer fields, playground, walking and biking trails along shore. Beach head, Sandpiper seafood restaurant and Tollis excellent italian food with pizza take out. Downtown New Haven offers world famous pizza at Pepes and Modern. Amarante's Deck on Tuesday nights offers dancing and dining overlooking the sound only 4 houses away. Getting Around Public transformation is one short block away and G line to New Haven. Must have exact change current price $1.50. Uber is a very reasonable alternative to a taxi service. Other Things to Note Tweed New Haven airport is a short drive. Morris cove is a safe neighborhood at all times. + More

about: Your own fully equipped & furnished urban oasis, all utilities provided. Don't pay downtown prices for downtown access. An easy walk or bus ride to the entertainment district, Yale campuses, Hospitals, Smilow Cancer Center.
description: Description The Space Spacious, bright top floor of 3-family house. Yale employee landlord lives next door. Wifi Internet in every room. Eat-in kitchen w/ all appliances, table & chairs, microwave, pots, pans, dishes, flatware, etc. Dining area w/ table & chairs. Large bathroom w/towels. Living room with convertible futon sofa, DVR & 300-channel TV. Bedrooms w/ beds, linens, bureaus, desk. Local maps & take-out menus provided. Guest Access Coin-op washer & drier in building. Outdoor table & chairs in fenced-in back yard. 3 city bus lines nearby. Walk to supermarket, near-by park for jogging/bicycling, Yale athletic fields, seasonal farmer's market, Dj Brew caf; natural food store/restaurant, Chinese grocery. Interaction with Guests We live next door and are available if needed. Otherwise, we respect your privacy. The Neighborhood We have lived for 14 years in this gentrifying neighborhood among residents from a variety of ethnic, racial, religious and socio-economic backgrounds. Multi-family houses and numerous small shops, stores and restaurants make for a dynamic and lively street scene. It's not a gated community, it's a real life urban setting. Come prepared for diversity! Getting Around 3 public bus lines within 2 blocks, connecting to Yale campus and downtown. Other Things to Note Please be aware that we are offering an entire apartment. We do not rent individual rooms. + More

about: Cozy 2 room apartment with private entrance, fully equipped kitchen & bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub & shower.
description: Description The Space Enjoy a private (separate) entrance to this cozy 2 room, lower level apartment with lots of light, lovely appointments and off-street parking. Accommodations: * Enter into the kitchen/dining/living room which includes fully equipped kitchen (gas range & full sized stainless refrigerator) with lots of cabinet space, dining table & chairs and a microfiber sofa-bed. * Bedroom with full closet, queen sized futon bed. Dresser and desk with window facing the backyard. * Bathroom has a jetted Jacuzzi bath tub (as well as shower) and private cabinet space. * Includes high speed internet (wired and private wireless), large HD flat-screen, cable, & Blu-Ray DVD with Netflix. * Guests have full access to use the back yard and patio outside the apartment door, overlooking a lovely landscaped waterfall in the warmer months. NO SMOKING PLEASE! Guest Access This is a stand alone apartment that does not require access to nor share anything with the rest of the home. The bathroom is shared during the day with a small business in the home. Interaction with Guests Homeowners are a a small family of long time North Haven and New Haven residents and happy to assist in any way, or leave you to your privacy. The Neighborhood Quiet and safe! Lovely suburban family oriented neighborhood. Getting Around Includes off street parking for at least 2 cars. Located less than 10 minutes by car to Yale and Quinnipiac Universities; 2 minutes from I-91 as well as Wilbur Cross Pkwy (Rt. 15). Every major shopping store one could desire is within a 5 minute drive, as well as plenty of restaurants close by. Other Things to Note Bathroom is being shared during the day with small home office of one employee. Kids up to 14 years are not paying if accompanied by parents. + More

about: Quiet Getaway to the charming retro town of Winsted in Northwest CT, Litchfield County...2 hour drive from NY and 2 1/2 hrs from Boston. A private fully furnished bright apartment on the top floor in an owner-occupied majestic Victorian.
description: Description The Space Quiet Getaway to the charming retro town of Winsted in the Northwest Corner of CT, Litchfield County...2 hour drive from NY and 2 1/2 hrs from Boston. A private fully furnished bright modern apartment on the top floor in an owner-occupied majestic Victorian with your own entrance and key. Tastefully appointed apartment complete with kitchen, living room, dining room, bathroom and bedroom. Trundle bed in living room. The owners will act as your concierges by sharing with you all the wonderful places and happenings in the area: antiques, music/Infinity Hall next town, art, skiing. Lenox, Great Barrington, Berkshires are 35-40 minutes away and Hartford is 40 minutes away. You can walk downtown to restaurants, a movie theatre that serves drinks and dinner, bowling,health food store, supermarket and more. Peter Pan Bus from Port Authority drops you off in downtown and walk 2 blocks home or will pick up if you don't have a car. Two night minimum, $85 per night - weekly and monthly rates available. More Photos on request. All the comforts of home away from home. Guest Access The third floor apartment ( 2 flights of stairs-one in the apartment) is theirs for the stay with full privacy and their own locked door. We have a long front porch filled with wicker chairs. Interaction with Guests We like to give recommendations for activities, restaurants, directions to explore the beauty of the Northwest Connecticut, Litchfield County, Berkshires etc. The Neighborhood The town has a retro feel to it. Walk to Gilson Movie Theatre, movies and food served. Ralph Nader's American Museum of Tort Law, Duckpin Bowling Antique Stores, Highland Lake Getting Around Peter Pan Bus from Port Authority drops you off in downtown and walk 2 blocks home or will pick up if you don't have a car. Downtown is down the hill. + More

about: Guest bedroom w/ Queen bed & bath attached by a private hallway. Down the hall: bedroom w/ 2 XL twin, shares same bath (we never book separate parties). Access to kitchen, TV & family room. Near historic Guilford Green, but back yard is the country.
description: Description The Space Beautifully decorated and renovated antique home owned by the family since 1984. Two bedrooms available on the second floor with access to one bathroom. "Pink Room" Queen bed "Schuyler's Room" 2 XL Twin beds with room for portable crib or aerobed The host family has their own en suite. Pink or Blue Room with detached bathroom for guest's sole use. Access to kitchen and upstairs laundry. Off limits: Host Family Master Suite Host family arrives home from weekday jobs at 3pm and at random times. Usually home on weekends doing projects. Evening schedules vary with community meetings and relaxing at home. We have a 13 year old terrier mix named Jasper. Parking available. Guest Access Guests may have access to our upstairs TV Room, eat-in kitchen, Parlor and Dining Room. There is also a full bath downstairs off the Family Room. There is also a TV in the Kitchen. Interaction with Guests Interaction with guests is by chance. We will meet our guests on the first day of arrival, and then allow them independence from then on. We can be reached by cell phone if there are any questions or problems. Our dog, Jasper, is retained within our yard by invisible fence. He can come in and go outdoors as he wishes. The Neighborhood We love the vibrant activity all around the Guilford Green. There is easy access to the post office, bank, art gallery, stores, retaurants, coffee shops and 4 churches. Great sidewalks for walking. You can visit the oldest house in CT on foot or by Segway. Two other museum houses within a half mile. Back porch and patio seating to enjoy the outdoors. Two outlet shopping centers, movies and Hammonasset State Beach are 10-15 minute drive away. Many hiking trails in Guilford. Getting Around Shoreline East Railroad is less than a mile away takes you to Union Station in New Haven where you can catch a Metro North train to New York City. Or take Shoreline East to Old Saybrook for an Amtrak train to Boston. Shoreline bus service stops at the opposite corner of Green. There is also a local taxi service. Other Things to Note Both guest rooms and guest bath are on the 2nd floor. Guests use the back stairway...hosts use the front stairway. Both guest rooms share the same bathroom. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking or alcohol on property. Feel free to enjoy your drinks at local establishments. + More

about: Step out of the ordinary, and stay on a lovely sailboat in Stamford Harbor! Our 1966 Pearson is a charming old yacht, with a wood burning fireplace, heat and AC, and right next to two of Stamford's waterfront restaurants! 1/2 mile from Metro North Train station, taxi accessible.
description: Description The Space **As featured in CTNews: Unique Places to Stay in CT** **New Off-Season Reduced-rate Pricing, now through March of 2015** Step out of the ordinary, and stay on a lovely sailboat in Stamford Harbor! Our 1966 Pearson is a charming old yacht, with a wood burning fireplace, cherry interior, and a slip right next to two of Stamford's waterfront restaurants and walking distance to Stamford's own Half Full Brewery! As fall is in the air, stay cozy and warm on board using our electric heating system, or relax around the wood-burning stove with a good book and a glass of wine. Walk down the gangway and step aboard the Extra Dry: a 1966 Pearson Alberg 35 (a 35 foot sailboat!). Accommodations for two in the forward vee-berth, or two in the main cabin, make for a cozy and charming stay! She is well-appointed, with a wood-burning stove, galley and grill, and A/C unit for use in the summer, and heating unit for the fall/winter. Enjoy board games around the cabin table, relax in our hammock, and enjoy the harbor night life! You will have full access to the boat (on the slip, only...guests are not allowed to take the boat out on the water, as per AirBNB terms of service). You will also have access to a tandem kayak in which you may explore the harbor and surrounding areas! However, "captained charters" are available to guests upon request. We will take you sailing around Long Island sound, show you the ropes, anchor near the lighthouse for some swimming, and grill up delicious food! The marina has showers and bathrooms, which you will also have access to. There are two great restaurants at the marina: The Crab Shell, and Dolce Cubano. Taxi service to downtown Stamford is readily available. Across the harbor (accessible via our kayak, or via the free water taxi on summer weekends) are three great restaurant/bars: Paloma, World Of Beer, and Sign of the Whale. What better way to arrive to cocktails and dinner than by kayak? The small galley has a toaster and a coffee maker (which can be used to boil water for tea or instant soups). The grill in the cockpit is also available for guests. If you are interested in having us take you out sailing, we can discuss cruise options! Cruises/charters will be negotiated on a case-by-case basis, and are not part of the AirBNB stay. Our "neighborhood" is the harbor! Lovely waterfront walks, a fishing pier, restaurants and nightlife. Walking distance to the Half Full Brewery, which offers tours and tastings. Live music on the weekends at the Crab Shell...only steps from the dock! There is taxi service to downtown Stamford readily available. Within Stamford there is a free trolley that will take you to various parts of town. There is free parking at the marina if you are driving. We are five minutes from the Stamford train station on the Metro-North line, which is a 45-minute express train from Grand Central. On weekends in the summer there is a free water taxi that will bring you across the harbor to the new Harbor Point development, or you can take the kayak across yourself! There is a takeout breakfast/lunch spot called "Henri's" in the park by the fountain, as well as "World Of Beer", which has 500 craft beers and pub fare. "Paloma" offers upscale Mexican waterfront dining, and "Sign of the Whale" is Stamford's only roof-top bar! All are easily accessible by kayak or water taxi from the boat. Guest Access You will have access to the boat (on the slip, only). The boat is not available for guests to sail on their own (as per AirBNB terms of service), only for use on the dock and as a place to stay. Private captained charters can be arranged on a case-by-case basis! Please inquire! The marina has showers and bathrooms (we ask guests not to use the toilet on board, but you are welcome to use the sink for washing up), which you will also have access to. There are two great restaurants at the marina: The Crab Shell, and Dolce Cubano. Taxi service to downtown Stamford is readily available. Interaction with Guests If you are interested in having us take you out sailing, we can discuss cruise options! Cruises/charters will be negotiated on a case-by-case basis, and are not part of the AirBNB stay. A typical afternoon cruise (for two) from 12-6 p.m. is $300. The Neighborhood Our "neighborhood" is the harbor! Lovely waterfront walks, a fishing pier, restaurants and nightlife. Live music on the weekends at the Crab Shell...only steps from the dock! (Note: on weekends in the summer the music can go until midnight) Getting Around There is taxi service to downtown Stamford readily available. Within Stamford there is a free trolley that will take you to various parts of town. There is free parking at the marina if you are driving. Other Things to Note A/C is available during the summer, and heat is available during the cooler months. Kitchen includes a coffee maker (can also make hot water for tea) and toaster. Grill on deck available for other cooking needs. 2-person inflatable Kayak, paddles, and life jackets are available for guest use Board Games on the boat: Scrabble, Backgammon, Fluxx, Connect 4, playing cards, Ticket to Ride, Kill Dr. Lucky + More
rules: House Rules There is no smoking on the boat, but right outside on the pier is fine. No pets, please. We ask all guests to be considerate of the fact that this is a boat, not a house! Please, no shoes in the cabin, and only non-marking boat shoes on deck. We also ask that guests use the marina facilities rather than the on-board toilet, as it requires emptying. The marina bathrooms include showers, toilets, and laundry, and are 100 yards from the boat. + More

about: This gracious home overlooking our Equine Therapy Center provides therapeutic,recreational and educational activities away from city bustle. Close to all area attractions- CT and RI Beaches, Mystic Seaport and Aquarium, and I-95 and I-395 corridors.
description: Description The Space The home is an elegant Maryland-Style Farmhouse with a gracious foyer and library as you enter leading to the elegant Fireplaced Library where breakfast is served each morning. Each guest bedroom has an en-suite private bath and keyed entry. Ironing Board, Iron, and housekeeping supplies are available in the closet in the bedroom wing hall. Relax with a lovely continental breakfast between 8 and 10 in the library featuring organic produce grown on site or locally sourced. Cable TV in Library. WiFi access at "FARM GUEST." In addition to your participation in our various Volunteer or Ecotourism weekend vacations, workshops, lectures, clinics and events, a private farm tour may be arranged at 10 am on Sunday morning or by appointment outside of program hours. We can accommode meetings, gatherings, or conferences for up to 30 people in our Library/ Conference room. All proceeds support Horses Healing Humans Equine-Assisted Activities and Therapies, a 501 (c)(3) non-profit serving people with physical, cognitive, and emotional challenges. EIN (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Guest Access Guests park right at the lovely front entrance. Your stay includes access to Library/ Breakfast Room, Lawns and Patio. Fees for workshops, clinics, and events are additional. Please respect Private and Business use areas. On Sundays and Monday Mornings you may use the sensory trail system to hike- please advise if you plan to be on the trails. Interaction with Guests Volunteer Vacation- Arrive Friday night for Volunter training- learn about Equine Therapies for people with various disabilities and challenges, and the ways we assist them. Assist with mounted or unmounted programs or facilities/ gardening projects on Saturday from 10-2 pm, afternoon and evening on your own to enjoy our beautiful natural environment and surrounding community. Sunday breakfast is a lovely time to relax and process your experience before heading back out to area amenities. Ecotourism Weekend- spend a relaxing day or two learning and practicing organic gardening and composting techniques, how to buld a "Pasture Paradise" or PT paddock, trail building and maintenance, conservaion methods. Ecotourism is now defined as "responsible travel to natural areas that conserves the environment, sustains the well-being of the local people, and involves interpretation and education" (TIES, 2015). Education is meant to be inclusive of both staff and guests. Hosts Jim and Lee live and work on-site. Outside of scheduled workshops we allow guests maximum privacy, and are happy to make recommendations and give directions to area attractions to enjoy during your free time! The Neighborhood This is a quiet rural neighboorhood. Please respect the solitude of our neighbors. There is much to do to stay busy in this area from hiking and water sports to museums, art galleries, casinos, shopping, and nightlife. Area guides are available in each room. Getting Around We are close to the I-95 an I-395 corridors midway between Boston and New York City. Amtrack, car rental, or taxis are just a few minutes away in iether Mystic, CT or Westerly, RI. We are not on a public transit route. 5 1/2 miles from Main St, Mytsic (9 min) Restaurants, attractions, shopping 13 1/4 Miles to Watch Hill, RI (22Min) Ocean House, Beaches 7 miles (15 min) to Stonington Borough Shops and Restaurants 12 miles (15 min) to New London Ferries and shopping 6.5 miles (13 min) to Foxwoods Casino Other Things to Note Booking are available for faculty, guests, and participants of HHH workshops, clinics, and special events. See website www.horses(URL HIDDEN) or call (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) for activities and events schedule. Fees from all bookings help support Horses Healing Humans, a 501(c)(3) Charitable organization offering Equine-Assisted Activities and Therapy programs to clients with Physical, Cognitive, and Emotional challenges. Some of these clients help with the care and maintenance of our airbnb rooms as part of our vocational skills program. + More
rules: House Rules Please maintain the peaceful rural nature of our property at all times. No Parties/ No Loud Noises! No Smoking please except in posted areas. (outside in the "Cowboy Kitchen") Please do not eat or drink in the bedrooms-the Library and Patio is available for your use. We are happy to provide you with glassware, corkscrew, etc. The barn is a private Therapeutic Program space - please respect the privacy of our clients. Do not wander the trails or the barn areas or visit with the horses without express permission or appointment. + More

about: We are not a bed and breakfast. Great private bedroom and bath on second floor of 1830's house on Starr Street in downtown, New London, CT. 5 Minute walk from Amtrak, minutes from many great restaurants of every kind from Thai to Burgers.
description: Description The Space Starr Street is legendary in the area. Restored 1830 Greek revival homes in the center of the city. Walking distance to everything. 5 minutes from train to NYC or Boston as well as Ferry to Long and Block Islands. Bed room is air-conditioned for the summer plus TiVo and a wireless internet connection for your laptop or tablet. Queen size bed. There is a private bath with tub. This is the only guest room with a simi-private entrance in the home of a retired couple. A one night stay requires a $30.00 turnaround fee which IS NOT required for a stay of more than one night. Although New London is a very walk-able city there are two bicycles and a bicycle built for two available for your use too! (Bring your own helmet) Our house is a 5 minute walk from everything in the city. There are 21 restaurants and bars, Public Library the legendary Garde Arts Center and the oldest continuously operating Customs House which is now also a museum featuring the story of the Amistad crew. . We are 3 minutes' walk from the transit hub for Amtrak, Cross Sound Ferry and Greyhound bus. We accept all major credit cards . Guest Access Through a simi-private door way that leads directly to stairs to your accommodation on second floor. There is off street parking for your car. Interaction with Guests When and as we see you coming and going, we're friendly but like our privacy and will respect yours. Although we do not offer breakfast, tea and coffee are available early in the morning and there is a complementary snack basket in your room. The Neighborhood Everybody loves the style of the street, so we love telling folks we live there and getting positive feedback about the location. New London is a very walkable city...everything, except the beach, is a five minute walk from our place at 18 Starr Street. Getting Around Bus, train and ferry service is a five minute walk from our place. We have off street parking for your car. Other Things to Note People always remark about how clean the place is. There is a complementary snack basket in your room. We provide beach towels and extra linens and bath towels. + More
rules: House Rules Keys: You will enter and exit through the side door (off the driveway);the door is unlocked during daylight hours but if you're out in the evening be sure to take your key as it may be locked when you return. Leave the outside light on. Steep stairs! The stairs leading to your room are steep (remember the house is 180 years old!) be sure to use the hand rail. No, it's NOT a ladder!! We also suggest you leave the light ON at the top of the stirs between the bed room and bath room. Closet space: There are hangers and space in the closet to the left of the fire place. there is also a hanging devise on the door opposite the entry door to the bedroom. Coffee available, usually by 5AM (as your host is an early riser, hopefully his bumping around in the kitchen will not disturb you)! The coffee pot is almost hidden on the left side of the refrigerator. Cups and other essentials are on the island. Parking is restricted on Starr Street to residents, however, there is room for 3 cars in our driveway; if you have to park on the street be sure you place the visitor parking" notice on your dashboard or you'll receive a $25.00 parking ticket (for which WE will not be responsible!). Lynda (white Accord ) and Frank (white Kia) will stack their cars on the left of the driveway. You can park on the right side of the driveway as close to the house as possible. We suggest you lock your car overnight. No pets are allowed. No exceptions. We provide morning tea and or coffee but there are no kitchen facilities available. description: Description The Space Privacy, tranquility, and only 2 miles to the action. You're not alone, but we can leave you to your own devices to relax inside or explore our 2 acres around you. rules: House Rules TENANT HOUSE RULES 2015 - Addendum 3 928 Shepard Ave, Hamden, CT 06514 KITCHEN 1. Electric Cooktops are not like gas. Most foods COOK on MEDIUM temperature of 4; SIMMER on 2. BOIL on 6. 2. Cooktops can only be cleaned with a SPECIAL COOKTOP liquid. Do not use scouring pads. 3. Counters are GRANITE, WOOD or FORMICA (Plastic). Do not place hot items directly on ANY counters. They burn. 4. Do not CUT foods on ANY counters. There are cutting boards. 5. The TOASTERS, MICOWAVES, OVENS and other SMALL APPLIANCES should NEVER be left unattended. 6. OVENS should NEVER be left unattended or used for household heating purposes. 7. Please use an OVEN TRAY to catch spills. This avoids burning while baking. 8. Silicone Rubber Oven Mitts are in the drawer right of the stove. USE GHEM. 9. Do not dispose of COOKING OIL or FOOD in the sinks or toilet. Once cooled, put unwanted OIL in a disposable container with lid then placed in REGULAR TRASH. 10. Use a STRAINER in the SINK at all times to catch discarded food. 11. CABINETS should not be overloaded. Do not SIT or STAND on cabinets. 12. Tile should be cleaned with gentle soap and water. Remove FOOD SPLASHES immediately. 13. UNPLUG Portable APPLIANCES (toaster, blender, coffee machine, etc.) when not in use. 14. SMELLY FOOD and trash should be double bagged separately and discarded immediately. BATHROOM 1. Do not use HAIR DYES on our premises. Use NON-ABRASIVE cleaners on acrylic showers, tile walls, all counters, and floors. 2. Waste GRINDER TANK is located in the wall behind some toilets. Discard TOILET PAPER ONLY in the toilet. 3. Do not use DRAIN CLEANER in the toilet, lavatory or shower AT ANY TIME. 4. Use the VENT FAN at all times while showering to prevent rust and mold build-up in the bathrooms. LIVINGROOM 1. Laminate and Wood floors are easily cleaned with SWIFFER Wet Wipes. Do not use ammonia or bleach. SPILLS should' be fully cleaned immediately. 2. Fabric soils on SOFA and STOOLS should be cleaned immediately with gentle soap and water. ELECTRICITY 1. HEATERS should not be left ON or unattended. Please do not place near curtains or bedding. 2. Adjust HEATER settings accordingly. 68-70 degrees is average. HIGH HEAT is NEVER required. 3. LIGHTS should be turned OFF when you go to bed or leave ANY ROOM, or premises, especially bathrooms & kitchens. 4. Electronics (TV, DVD, Stereo, Heater, Laptops, Blow Dryers, etc.) require a SURGE PROTECTOR. CANLE, INTERNET, & PHONE 1. Internet and Cable are provided by FRONTIER. You will be responsible for any damage to the boxes or remotes provided. 2. Network = ______________________ Password = __________________________ 3. No ON DEMAND services should be charged to this account. 4. LANDLINE service is available for OUTGOING CALLS only. Incoming calls can be routed to your cell phone. You must purchase your own phone to coordinate with the existing system. 5. No INDEPENDENT Internet, Phone or Cable services shall be installed. + More
