about: The Edward Denison house was built in 1710 and is one of the oldest homes in Stonington. Located just steps from the Road Meeting House and a 5 minute drive from Stonington Borough. This is a wonderful area for biking, also has many walking trails.
description: Description The Space It is said, If you have two pennies, with the first buy bread and with the second buy hyacinths for your soul." Our 1710 colonial home, offers THREE large guestrooms (each rented separately), private jetted baths, fireplaces, gardens and quiet country setting near the heart of Mystic. NONE of our rooms accommodate more than 2 adults and 1 small child so plan accordingly when requesting your reservation. Rental is priced per room and we can and do accommodate multiple groups of travelers. The base price is for 1 person and there is an additional $20 for a second person in that room. If you have 4 people in your group, that would be 2 rooms plus $20 extra each room for double occupancy. Airbnb calculates the rate as if all 4 people fit in one room but that is not what you would be renting! Hope this makes sense but some folks have been confused so we're trying to explain it. :) Within three miles of downtown Mystic, historic Stonington Borough, the Aquarium, and the Seaport, our home sits on 4 1/2 acres of gardens, fields and forest. Excellent opportunities abound for quiet, romantic walks or secluded hideaways for reading. Relax in the ambiance of a home that has for three centuries provided shelter and respite. Our three guestrooms are beautifully appointed including such amenities as WiFi, hair dryers, cable TV/DVD/VCR, individual refrigerators, and irons and ironing boards. All guest rooms are on the second floor accessed by a staircase (no elevator.) Sleeping options include a king bed or two twins in one room, a queen bed in another room and a queen and a twin in the two room suite. All of our guest rooms have private baths. Free off street parking, wander our grounds or walk through the wood at the Avalonia Land Trust trails a quarter of a mile away. The Mystic Train Station is about 4 miles, local cab service is available as well as bike and car rentals. Coffee, tea, hot chocolate, cookies and snacks are always on hand. During the week, continental breakfast is included: muffins, fresh fruit, cheese, cereals (including gluten free granola). On weekends, our deluxe 5-course breakfast is included. There's a great coffee shop (The Yellow House) two miles away in Stonington Borough as well as several great cafes and restaurants for those who want a heartier start to their day during the week. (Lots of Dunkin Donuts and a Starbucks, too!) Jim works full-time at Mystic Seaport in the Shipyard, doing antique engine restoration and sawing logs for the Charles W. Morgan project. Sandra is a registered nurse, currently working in assisted living and skilled nursing facilities. We have a dog named Kelly, two cats, Hobo and Kirby, a horse named Tommy Dorsey and a miniature horse, Inspector Morse. Please let us know why you're visiting the area so that we may better answer your questions. Please note that we favor longer visits and may not accept a one or two night booking more than a couple of weeks in advance. However, it never hurts to ask! Guest Access Bedroom, library, dining room with coffee maker/tea kettle, gardens. Interaction with Guests It depends on the day as to how much we're home and also on guest sensibilities. The Neighborhood Quiet, very country setting but only 3 minutes from the interstate and 5-7 minutes from shops, restaurants, etc. (by car.) Getting Around Unfortunately, there is no convenient public transportation available. Bike rental is available from a local company or you can bring your own. + More
rules: House Rules Our guests are given keys and are free to come and go as they please; we do ask everyone to be respectful of others. No smoking indoors. Guests are welcome to smoke outside and on the covered side porch. There is a guest parking area with room for three to four cars next to the barn as well as a circular driveway for unloading luggage right next to the house. We do allow one guest pet by prior arrangement and for a $25 fee (onetime fee). Please note that for the safety of your pet and the security of our home, we do not allow your pet to be left alone unless he/she is happily crated. Of course, you can come downstairs for a cup of coffee! But don't ditch the dog for 3 hours while you go sightseeing. :) There is a library for the use of our guests (with books, magazines, maps, games, puzzles and a Lionel train set) and lots of outdoor space, including a covered porch with chairs and tables. There is no kitchen use; if you'd like to do your own cooking please consider renting our other property, the Red Barn. Otherwise, we assume guests will behave as responsible adults and we've never had a problem. Welcome, wilkommen, bien venue! + More

about: Private suite includes bedroom, sunroom and bath with separate entrance and access to giant screened porch and fenced backyard. Gulf Beach is a short 10 minute walk in one direction; the Milford Green shops, restaurants and MetroNorth train station are a 15-20 minute walk the other way.
description: Description The Space This is more than a room--it is a suite that includes outdoor space as well. The bedroom includes bed, dresser and loveseat. Sun-room has small eating area with coffee pot and microwave. Screen porch with sitting/eating area, for summer and fall. Outdoor stone patio with fire-pit is a nice place to relax in the evening. The fenced yard includes horse shoe pits and will accommodate a guest dog--though owners will be expected to "scoop the poop." There are a dog and a cat in residence but they are generally excluded from the guest suite. A circular drive provides ample parking though it is also possible to arrive via train--the house is a short cab ride (1.1 mile) or a 15-20 minute walk from the station. Milford is one stop from New Haven on MetroNorth Railway so easy to get to Yale or other New Haven locations if your stay in the area is academic/business related. Gulf Beach offers lovely swimming in the Long Island Sound. Guests are welcome to take beach chairs from the house. There are many, many restaurants in the area and some within walking distance. A large mall and movie theaters are a few miles away. Whether here for business or pleasure, Milford is in a great part of Connecticut. Guest Access Guests have private entrance to room and attached areas; long term guests may have kitchen privileges. Bath has a shower, no tub. Interaction with Guests The house will be empty most week days until 5 pm and hosts are in and out on the weekends. Weekday breakfasts are simple--pastries, fruit, beverages. Weekends can vary. Getting Around There is parking for one car. MetroNorth train station with service between Grand Central Terminal and New Haven is a 20 minute walk. With luggage a cab my be preferable--about $5. Closest Amtrak service is New Haven. + More

about: Our private top floor guest suite is fully equipped and easy on the budget. Sleeps 4 in comfort in queen bedroom and TV room with an upgraded pullout sofa. Free wi-fi, Roku TV, Free calls anywhere in the US.
description: Description The Space We welcome you to our home. You will find your guest suite clean, comfortable and private with everything you need. The bedroom is large and fitted with a well supplied kitchenette. The smaller TV/sitting room offers an upgraded pullout sofa to accommodate 2 extra guests. Kids are welcome and we have a pack n play, safety gate and high chair available for little ones. The sky lit bath is supplied with a hairdryer, soaps and shampoo. Guest Access You have use of the entire 2nd floor. The entrance is shared but private. Our living areas are separate. You will see as much or as little of us as you want. We will take our cue from you. Interaction with Guests We are happy to help with questions. Your privacy will be respected at all times. The Neighborhood Hungry? We recommend The Painted Pony for lunch and dinner. Right out of the driveway, approximately one mile on the left. Huge menu! Breakfast on the go? Try Little Town Deli on East St. Right out of the driveway, turn right at blinking light at the green. Tasty breakfast sandwiches and Green Mountain coffee. Or head down the hill (left out of driveway) to Big Daddy's at the corner of 61 and 6. Hearty breakfasts are served here along with a helping of local flavor. Bethlehem is approximately halfway between New York City and Boston in beautiful Litchfield County. It's next door to Woodbury, noted for its many antique shops and near stops on the Connecticut Wine Trail. Historic homes like Bellamy-Ferriday House and Garden and Glebe House are just minutes away or see how native Indians lived at Washington's Institute For American Indian Studies. If you want to hike on miles of well marked trails White Memorial Foundation is for you and only 15 minutes north. Less than 2 miles away March Farms offers cherry, strawberry, blueberry, peach, pumpkin and apple picking in season, baked goods and a terrific play area for kids as well as seasonal events and activities. Getting Around You will need a car. There is no public transportation. Other Things to Note We have 3 rescue dogs who may get excited and bark when they hear someone enter, mealtimes, etc but settle down quickly. They aren't allowed in the guest area as a courtesy to those who may be allergic. + More
rules: House Rules Quiet hours are 11 PM to 7 AM. Please keep TV and conversation low and we will do the same. Please, no smoking allowed in the house. You may smoke outside well away from the house. + More

about: "Ellis" is a cute camp cottage built in the 1960's by the students of Ellis Tech. It has two bedrooms and sleeps 4. The detached bunkhouse is included and has 3 single beds. Very peaceful lakeside location on Beach Pond. Walking distance to trails.
description: Description The Space Ellis has two bedrooms, one with a queen bed and one with two single beds. Included in the price is a detached bunkhouse that has 3 single beds. The space new remodeled and very cozy! Full kitchen with 2 burner gas stove and oven, refrigerator, and microwave. The kitchen has a table with 4 chairs and a small loveseat. The bathroom has a shower, small sink and toilet. There is no TV. (you won't miss it, we promise!) Ellis has a lovely porch on the front with views of Beach Pond. Guest Access Guests have private access to the entire cabin and bunkhouse. A short 300 foot walk from the porch leads to the property's private beach which guests are welcome to use. There is a picnic table and multiple fire pits for campfires. Guests are also welcome to use our 10 person wood fired Finnish sauna. The sauna has a lakeside deck and direct access to the water for a dip. Guests are welcome to use kayaks, canoe, paddle boat, paddle board, and row boat. Interaction with Guests Typically, we will be on the property for some part of every day as we live in the main house. If for some reason, we are not around, we have a list of phone numbers in the cabin if you should need assistance with anything. The Neighborhood This is a small, rural, lakeside community. There is far more activity on the lake in the summer months and it is very quiet in the winter. We have one neighbor on either side of our 7 acre property and both are rarely occupied summer homes. Getting Around There is no public transportation here. The nearest train station is Westerly Rhode Island, or New London, CT both of which are about 40 minutes away. The nearest airports are Providence, RI (PVD) and Hartford, CT (BDL). Other Things to Note We have another cabin on the property, two camp trailers (in the summer) as well as two main houses. We have many family members on the property at any given time and all are friendly and happy you are staying with us! Just remember that there are other people living here, so we expect respect for them as far as noise. + More
rules: House Rules Check-in is 3 PM Check-out is 12 PM No smoking inside the cabin or on the porch. You may smoke a distance away, but please do not throw your butts on the ground. Please leave the cabin in the same condition you found it. This cabin has been rented to the same families for 44 years. Multiple generations have grown up here coming every summer. They love it and have many fond memories of it. Let's preserve it for the next 44 years! Please sweep and tidy up before you leave. Life jackets are required when taking any of the watercraft out on the lake. We have plenty that you can borrow. Pets: We do allow pets, however we expect our guests to take care of them. Please pick up pet droppings immediately and dispose of them property. If you need to leave your pets in the cabin when you go out, they MUST be in a kennel. We can provide one if needed. This is to protect our cabins from damage. Many pets get fearful when left alone in a new place. We've have dogs break screens and get out while owners were away. That is why we instituted the kennel rule. + More

about: These two adjacent rooms, which can accommodate up to 5 people, are drenched in mid-morning and afternoon sunlight. Private bathroom, off-street parking, free WiFi, and baked goods with tea/coffee for breakfast are included. Beautiful neighborhood.
description: Description The Space Located on the second floor of our home, these 2 adjacent rooms (separated by a door), are perfect for 2 couples or a family coming for Wesleyan Univ. events. The larger room has a queen-sized futon bed and the smaller room, accessed via the larger room, can accommodate a queen sized inflatable mattress bed or, if you prefer, two twin inflatable mattresses (we have both). Gorgeous mid-morning sunlight. The private bath has a beautiful antique claw-foot tub (and shower!) which is likely original to this 100+ year old home. Guests may utilize the expansive backyard during their stay. This is our home, so we will be available to answer any questions you have, make restaurant recommendations, etc. We look forward to chatting with you. Our home is multi-lingual (English, French & Spanish). We are located on a quaint one-way street. We are practically on the campus of Wesleyan University, so we are a very convenient option for those coming to town for WesU events. Downtown is a short 10-minute walk away. There is free off-street parking available. description: Description The Space Now that the kids are grown my husband and I have a ton of extra room going to waste, and we'd love some company! Centrally located in Connecticut in a safe suburb of Newington, we're proud to share our spacious home surrounded by an acre and a half of well-maintained property. The house is set back four hundred feet from the street with tons of parking, is clean and well-kept, has plenty of space and privacy as well as open gathering places, and is occupied by a very friendly family of three (two during the academic year when my son is at school in Ithaca, NY). Set alongside a cliff overlooking Piper Brook, spring, summer, and fall days are extremely pleasant amid the gardens and greenery, while in winter a hill for sledding tempts families to go outside. If you're just looking for a place to crash for the night, that's fine too! There are three available rooms, as well as additional couch space allowing for a maximum of nine guests. The largest of the three rooms has an very comfortable queen size bed as well as a futon, is at the farthest end of the house offering the most privacy, and has a porch overlooking the backyard. The blue room has a queen size bed, and the green room has a trundle which converts to two twin beds or one queen size bed. All three have access to the same full bathroom, and there is a half-bathroom downstairs. See "Beautiful Property, Friendly Home" 2 and 3 for the other available rooms. Amenities include wi-fi, washer and dryer, 30-foot above-ground pool (June-September), grand piano, hammock, multiple porches, chiminea, air hockey, foosball, and basic exercise equipment. Five minutes from CCSU, fifteen minutes from the University of St. Joseph, twenty minutes from the University of Hartford, and halfway between NYC and Boston. This listing is for the largest and most secluded of the three rooms. + More

about: In a semi-rural area, two bedrooms, (Queen& Twin), available individually ($90) or together ($160). Between them is a wide hall with bathroom, large closet and an alcove with some kitchen equipment, stocked to make one's own Continental Breakfast.
description: Description The Space Two bedrooms, facing south, look out on gardens and woods. Each is very large, accommodates two people and has sitting and desk area. If only one bedroom is rented, other will be kept vacant. Another area offers the convenience of having a full refrigerator, microwave. electric appliances, dishes etc.. There are children's toys, games and sports equipment available for young guests. A cat is in residence but only on the first floor. She is very shy and guests are unlikely to see her. Guest Access While guests will have total privacy with exclusive use of entire 2nd floor, they are also welcome to watch TV in the Family Room, use the stove in the kitchen or enjoy other spaces downstairs, including a spacious deck. They may leave dishes to be put through the dishwasher. Interaction with Guests Interaction with guests will depend on their wishes and interests and my time; I am often at home and enjoy talking to people. The Neighborhood Lyme is a beautiful area with many places to enjoy nature by walks in one of the many Preserves, bicycling on rural roads, fishing on lakes or streams, kayaking on Hamburg Cove, swimming in a nearby Swimming Hole or a pristine lake in our State Forest or just sitting on our deck watching birds and enjoying the sun. Although the house is on a paved road, only a 1/2 mile off a state road, it is quiet and peaceful. Another house with a big red barn is the only property in sight and bedrooms are on the back of the house and especially quiet. It is 7 miles to Interstate 95 that easily takes one to interesting Shoreline towns, many restaurants and shops, and two State Parks with Long Island Sound beaches. In Old Lyme, is the Florence Griswold Art Museum where one can enjoy the art, gardens and beautiful property on which, in October, artists create enchanting Fairy Houses. Two miles away if the Fox Hollow Golf Course. Getting Around On-site parking. No public transportation. Airports in Hartford, CT and Providence, RI about an hour away, by car. Other Things to Note Re: pets: I love dogs but need be assured by guests who want to bring one that it will be well-behaved. I do have a cat and she would be very upset and noisy if another cat was in the house, so no cats welcome. The house has a generator that starts whenever power goes out and maintains power for everything in the house. + More

about: Enjoy complete privacy and 500+ square feet of living space in our ground floor suite.
description: Description The Space This is really a nice, cozy apartment - with ample living space! Pull into a private garage that is attached to your suite. Walk into a bright and serene sun room, perfect for reading or to enjoy a glass of wine. The radiant floors in this room are super cozy on your feet during the winter. Take a left through french doors into your living room, and stretch out on the large sectional sofa and enjoy a program on the big screen cable TV. Order take out and sit down at your 4 person dining table. Although there is no kitchen in this suite, we do have a microwave, mini fridge, Keurig coffee service and a toaster oven in the dining area for your convenience. And you may use our gas grill with side burner, if you'd like to prepare a meal; just ask, and we'll set you up! The bedroom has a roomy closet and a king bed. The bed can remain a king or be separated into twins. The three piece bathroom has a shower. A queen sized, good quality air mattress can be set up in the living area, if needed. Another set of french doors in the sun room take you outside, steps away from a large in-ground pool to enjoy from Memorial Day thru Labor Day. If you want to take a snooze or read a book and listen to the birds, there is a hammock nestled between two shade trees on the side of the house. There are two swings for the kids. We also have lawn games for the family to enjoy: soccer ball, croquet set, Frisbee and boccie ball. If you feel like hanging out in the family area, come upstairs to our large deck. Sit under the pergola during the day and enjoy an icy beverage, or enjoy a nice fire in the fireplace, any season of the year. Guest Access Gym grade elliptical trainer. Pool. Hammock. Garage. Use of family BBQ possible, if requested in advance. Interaction with Guests Our family will not enter the ground floor suite while you are staying with us. You will have complete privacy. However, we will be on hand either in person, or by phone/email, if you need some help or have a question. The Neighborhood Enjoy classic Connecticut coutry living. We have a gorgeous yard, with three acres of nature, trees and privacy. There are a number of excellent walking and biking trails in Monroe. Good restaurants. The town park has wonderful amenities. However, our back yard is probably all you will need for your stay: hammock, pool, lawn games, BBQ and fireplace. Come and relax! Getting Around You'll need a car. We are an hour to Hartford CT, 2 1/2 hours to Boston and only 90 minutes to Midtown Manhattan. There is train service to/from NYC from Bridgeport, CT. We are a 25 minute drive from the train station. It is a 90 minute train ride to Grand Central Station in NYC. Other Things to Note NO FORMAL KITCHEN However, there is a dining table that seats 4, and a microwave, a toaster oven, Keurig coffee maker, blender and small refrigerator in the suite for your use, plus an extensive list of restaurants in the area. Several deliver. POOL Pool is open from Memorial Day thru Labor Day. Children must be accompanied by an adult when on the pool deck. + More

about: One large private room/suite on its own separate floor plus a stand alone bath, shower etc. goes with this room.
description: Description The Space Beautiful Country Retreat w/ outdoor living area, heated salt water pool spa and pool house! Gorgeous four story custom home, secluded on 26 wooded acres. When you stay in a room you have access to our entire home, pool and property. There are amazing hiking trails into the woods from the home. Upscale laid back environment along some beautiful scenery and great country roads in Eastern CT. Stop in on your way if you are traveling between Boston or NYC. We are 5 minutes off highway 84. and 15 minutes from the MA border in Sturbridge MA. Motorcycles are A-ok as husband rides and we have a second garage for storage. We live in the home full time, and have three rooms available. It is really too large for us as we have 3 kids gone now. 1. The entire 3rd floor is a large, private beautiful room with a queen bed, couch and plenty of room for an aerobed or two. There is also a full bath that goes with this room. $80 per night, $100 per night in July and August. $25 per person per night over two guests. The pricing on the page is reflective of this room; a special offer will be sent for the other two rooms. 2. A smaller twin sized room. A twin sized aerobed is available for a second guest in this room. For this smaller room, there is no discounted pricing for longer stays as the price is already very low. $55 per night; $65 in July and August. $10 per night for a second person. Again there is a full bath that goes with this room. 3. Queen aerobed set up in our TV room with glass French doors (curtained of course.) The room is very pretty and comfortable. $55 per night; $65 in July and August. $10 per night for a second person. The cleaning fee for a 1-2 night stay is $15, (this will be the one that automatically shows up in any reservation); for 2-4 nights it is $25, for 5-7 nights it is $35, and for stays over a week the cleaning fee is $50. Lovely views, lake view property, gorgeous hiking trails and waterfall are just steps away. Inground pool and hot tub are available in the warmer seasons. Room is very private and nicely appointed. It comes with television, cable, wifi, a sitting area, a desk, and a queen sized bed. The second room is a smaller twin room with a comfy pillow top twin bed and lovely views. It also has a TV with built in DVD and VCR players. We have a large movie library, books, and magazines. Full use of kitchen is available. Our home is lived in, laid back, and comfortable. Just 15 minutes from UConn; 15 minutes to Sturbridge MA: 30 minutes from Hartford, 45 minutes from Worcester, 1 hour from Providence and just over an hour from Boston. We get guests from NYC that love the quiet and privacy. We are about 2.3 hours from NYC. Gorgeous private country retreat setting. Free WiFi, seasonal heated inground saltwater pool with attached spa/hot tub, hiking trails in a nature trust which abuts the property for year round hiking, including a waterfall. Full kitchen, full bath, cable TV, flatscreen TV, DVD player in room, landline in room with unlimited long distance calling, lake view, swingset, sand box, trampoline, fireplace, outdoor fire pit, star gazing, large movie library, books and magazines. We are available and home most of the time. Total privacy or relaxed, friendly company is available, depending on guest's preferences. The only public transportation available is a cab in a nearby town. This is a country retreat setting. Beautiful, quite country neighborhood with lovely scenery. We are located 1/2 mile off the road. Beautiful, private retreat. Come relax and unwind! Guest Access Whatever your needs are we are here to help. If you have any special requirements or have questions before you book drop us a note. You will have full access to the house including; Full Kitchen, dishes, second fridge/freezer, glasses silverware etc, dishwasher. laundry facilities, seasonal inground heated saltwater pool and hot tub, pool house w. 3rd pool side fridge, outdoor stereo, changing room and couch. BBQ grill, bonfire pit, living room, TV room, hiking trails, Wifi, cable TV, large DVD collection, Netflix, trampoline, small fire pits, deck overlooking woods and lake. Walking trails to waterfall, stream and old forest. Our home backs to 100's of acres of land trust and you will find plenty of space and privacy. Interaction with Guests We are here to chat with you, or offer you privacy...whatever you like! Tracy has chronic illness and depending on how she feels, you may not see too much of her. The boys are friendly and helpful but not intrusive in any way. Blake is available for anything you need! The Neighborhood The neighborhood is a lovely, rural New England town. You will see cows, deer, lots of trees and gorgeous hiking trails. We are 1/2 mile off the road and very secluded. We have no neighbors in immediate view. Getting Around The area is very rural. The only public transportation would be a cab and it is rather costly as it is in another town. There is no public transportation to UConn. Renting a car is your best bet. UCONN Storrs campus is appx 15 minute drive. Shopping, stores and restaurants in same area. Other Things to Note If you want to go back in time to an old growth forest and a natural stream our property has a direct trail to Joshua's Trust. You can read more here (website hidden) Our home is laid back and lived in and welcoming ! Your room and bathroom will be very clean, but as in most homes; you may see some mail or laundry laying around, a pile of things here or there, or some dishes in the sink. We love a clean home but please expect it to look lived in! :) Our driveway is rough. It is a 1/2 mile long and has some potholes from the harsh winter. Please expect to have to drive slowly down it and to have to avoid some potholes. Consider the driveway to be an adventure! If you have a rental car, no worries! We have two dogs and a cat. Our German Shepard looks and sounds very vicious at first, but we can assure you she is really just a big scaredy cat! She will not bite you! She looks scary but she isn't! She is a big baby. She really is more afraid of you than you are of her! + More

East Norwalk is home to the annual Norwalk oyster festival. 15 minutes walk to the east Norwalk train station and an hour away from the Big Apple. 7 minutes drive to Calf Pasture beach. 20 minutes drive to Cranbury park for a romantic picnic or simply a hike Other Things to Note First Aid Kit available. about: Sun filled Glass House & Patio Overlooking River: full bed, fast Internet, glamping in style. Perfect for 1-2 people visiting for NYC biz/pleasure. Easy walk to waterfront and kayaks. Easy off street parking. 2 m to train & Greenwich restaurants.
description: Description The Space This great New England river front glass house lives on our nearly one acre organic maple grove forest and fledgling chutney orchard. The companion Riverview listing is available when the Cosy Glass House is closed for the cooler season. The plants migrate into our greenhouse/glass house attached to our 250 year old house. Both listings offer sunset paddling as well as hilltop views over the top of an evolving organic veg/fruit/herb garden to the 52 acre river beyond. airbnb earnings will be donated to the ongoing water-energy research underway at the Burleson Institute. As a result, guests may engage with the river at the same time as be able to deduct taxes for contributing to our 501(c)3 educational nonprofit. Come to this gracious home on a peaceful, spacious property that is convenient to a wide range of ways to spend your time. In addition to easy access to NCY by train, we are a 25 minute drive from tours of the famous Philip Johnson Glass House. Ours differs in style and prestige being a Junior Victorian, actively used, greenhouse. We love sharing our waterfront access to a very special river. The nearby Mianus River Gorge is the first piece of land ever set aside by the Nature Conservancy. The next stretch of water is owned by the water company and well preserved from regional development. We benefit from being able to wander out the backdoor and walk down a 2-minute path to our dock where we spend many afternoons kayaking down to where the river opens into Cos Cob's harbor on the Long Island Sound. The wildlife benefits from an aquatic habitat that qualifies as backup drinking water and that features a fish ladder at the edge of the small hydro dam that helped power train transport to and from NYC. Herons and other shore birds often sit on the dam to fish for dinner. The glass house is perched atop a glacial erratic rock garden that marks the end of the last ice age. We love these stone outcroppings of standing stones and all the literarily lore that comes with ancient rock. While the house is a 250-year-old barn used to bring potatoes by boat to New Amsterdam, the glass house is a cosmopolitan newly renovated retreat that is wonderful for one or two people. We offer a contemporary solar powered green house with separate entrance and rainfed/heirloom gardens. We tap our maple trees and can offer solar maple scones on on some weekends. Guests have access to a full bed, camp chairs, tipi closet, shelf, toiletries, extra curtains tucked under shelf if privacy is preferable to clear view, solar powered electric portable DVD player, Internet, mini fridge, heater, grill, electric kettle, and French press coffee maker. Water is from the river (via the water companies state of the art purification process). We bring this water up to the glass house from the main house. The hilltop pebble patio area features patio chairs, tables and an outdoor historic stone oven / fireplace suited to making pizza. Feel free to use our heirloom garden herbs. The neighboring houses are well within view and there are one or two renovations underway in the neighborhood. If coming from city life it is very rustic. If coming from wilderness it may seem urban. We find that kayaking within 35 miles from all that NYC has to offer a real treat that mixes cultural and environmental interests. We have a wide array of books if you would like to relax on the hilltop. We can offer a days worth of coffee, tea, honey, milk and a few staples if you arrive late and have not had an opportunity to buy food. Extra curtains can help block heat/cold while a fan and skylight windows help cool the loft. We are easy going, kind people who would like to make sure you feel welcome and cared for in what has been for us a wonderful place to feel peaceful. We write and curate rotating water, energy, climate Institute expos on behalf of our nonprofit Burleson Institute. We also gather information on watershed wildlife and contribute to Cornell's northeast bird count. Feel free to get involved. We donate 20% of proceeds from hosting glass house guests to our Burleson Institute's sustainability research initiatives. By volunteering with the wildlife citizens science service learning and staying in the glass house as guests, you can help advance our energy-climate-water network of evolving best practices. Our neighborhood is not free from lawn services using mowers but it often is a tranquil get-away while also offering a trampoline from which to explore foodie and cultural options galore with substantial boating, hiking, fishing, etc. Our front step is a historic mill stone and our rooms within offer an eclectic array of artwork, instruments, and much loved multi-media research library encompassing: naturalist, international law, and innovative ways to respond effectively and equitably to the pressing issues of our era. We consider one or two members of our wildlife community semi-wild pets given their peaceful presence in out backyard. Peter and Ben Bunny can often be spotted chomping on grass out back. Blue Herons and Egrets take refuge at our dock as do migrating families of ducks. Baby ducklings and swan signets are common in the late spring and summer. Turtles can be seen sunning themselves on rocks and logs until the river freezes and makes way for cross country skiers, skaters, and ice fishermen. Enjoy our solar loft library including great artwork, books, instruments from around the world, and music recordings. David is fluent in Spanish and Betsy creatively conversant. We can offer use of a portable DVD player / and a range of films as well as internet. Shopping for groceries ranges from a Shop and Stop 2 miles away to Trader Joes, Fairway, and Whole Foods within 10 miles. The town excels at offering foodies an exquisite range of culinary opportunities. We would be happy to share our favorites (a seafood restaurant around the corner from the Norwalk Maritime Center where we like to see the latest Imax film. We also like picking up famous CT pizza from Pizza Post (better than Mystic Pizza) and having picnics at the beach. Folks have been enjoying the Little Pub, Mumbai Times, Louie's, Thai Basil Restaurant, Meli-Melo, and Versailles. Crossing over to the NY Historic Hudson Valley or hop a train into NYC changes the flavor of the culinary and cultural offerings. We often prefer to experiment with our CSA organic veg box by making stews, chilies, chowders, gazpacho and the like. Our maple syrup cookbook is expanding into a solar cookbook and international cookbook... all still evolving. The glass house features a solar cooker for you to have fun with if the weather permits. Alternatively, you can bring back goodies and store them in the solar powered DC fridge. Backup house power is also available for the boat batteries that run the hilltop amenities. For anyone who lived through Superstorm Sandy, Katrina or their siblings, we seek to offer hands on innovation opportunities with resilience resources. Solar power has cut our electric bill in halve and a separate off grid array allows solar glass house guests a unique glamping experience. Enjoy Greenwich downtown pedestrian marketplace with outside eateries, interesting shops, and a small farmer's market on Saturdays (other towns in the area have farmer's market days throughout the week). There are many fine restaurants to choose from, and enjoy NYC's vibrant arts scene, with museums, galleries, and dozens of music and performances daily. There are very few places to stay in the area that have the rare combination of kayaking off a waterfront dock in the backyard as well as easy train access into NYC and a cosy comfy bed at a reasonable cost. Plush bedding, fluffy spa towels, and use of a solar powered washer/dryer allows guests to have a soft energy footprint in style. Guest Access We offer a sampling of culinary goodies to get glamping off to a fun start including local riverbank honey, a diversity of granola / muesli, and juice). The glass house is perfect for two people, so on rare occasion we might be in a position to offer a futon for a third family member in the main house (also commanding stunning river views but not nearly as unique an experience as the solar glass house.) (Occasional backup inclement weather access to recently renovated shared family guest bathroom in late 1800s main house). David is 83 and can walk the 2-minute pebble path to the glass house, that said, the incline might be steep for a self propelled scooter. A family member could likely push a wheel chair up to the glass house. This would be an occasion upon which to offer a futon in the sunroom of the main house that is otherwise part of the institute library's international collection. Alternatively, there is plenty of lawn space to pitch the occasional tent in nice weather. Generally, we would like to keep the guest list to 2 as we already wear many hats with consultancy and NGO energy-climate work. We have a great deal of experience hosting United Nations and nonprofit folks since we moved to our beloved river in 1981. We have more than enough to do as authors publishing on strict deadlines but are also happy to offer any expertise on the area. David's wife, Nan can out-kayak all of us put together and is wonderful at spotting birdlife, having been an Audubon teacher naturalist since 1991 and Nature Conservancy naturalist prior to that. Yet, she is now creatively fishing for words at almost 80. She will speak of getting the soup out of the trees when discussing our maple syrup. We seek to model resilience gracefully. One private parking space will be marked with the Airbnb logo. There is a safe area to store bikes and storage of one or two bags. In addition to games/puzzles, we can offer hammock, tetherball, zimzam tennis pole and kayaking. We might also be willing to rent out our waterproof cannon camera for wildlife photography if it is not needed for institute activities. Bed sheets, towels/washcloths, shampoo/soaps, and a few dishes/utensils are provided in a creative manner that hopefully will make you smile at the choice and layout of amenities. David is generally around while Nan and Elizabeth are often outdoors in the late afternoon. The doorbell is on the outside of the entryway rather than right next to the front door. Interaction with Guests When we travel we enjoy unique, comfortable, convenient lodging experiences. When hosting, we strive to offer the same. We have explored all 50 states in the US and a good portion of the world (over 60 countries). We greatly enjoy being out in nature and hosting the kind souls that have graced this retreat since 1981 (while we are new to hosting through Air bnb). We often keep to ourselves and are quiet but are happy to offer ideas for activities in the region. We often are engaged in independent projects including www.Bu(URL HIDDEN) but also really enjoy sharing ideas for things to do in the area (e.g. NYC museums, nature preserves in New England, boat trips, etc.) We enjoy a bit of gardening, plant knowledge, wilderness wandering and wildlife photography. We can chat over cups of Ben and Jerry's or maple scones... and can point out good coffee shops, restaurants, deli shops that can prepare picnic sandwiches for a day in the woods or on the water. As we live on site, we can be available to help and give any recommendations you might like to have - we've lived here for over 30 years and know the area. The Neighborhood Relax and unwind in this back bank river hideaway. Quiet, family-friendly neighborhood, where folks walk dogs, jog, etc. I love the neighborhood as it is walking distance to wooded parks with extensive trails for hiking, cycling, and cross country skiing. The river is stocked with trout and many wading fly fishermen brave the chilly Feb. waters in late winter/early spring. This extensive forested trail system encompasses over 300 acres of woods. You would not know that you are 30 miles from the heart of NYC. Coastal views can be enjoyed at the Cos Cob Park year round and with open access to Greenwich beach in the winter and access with purchased day passes in the summer. We have some of these passes available at the house. Stunning sunsets over Long Island Sound can be enjoyed while picnicking out at the beach. Many folks dock boats in Cos Cob Harbor, both seasonally and as they rock hop up and down the Atlantic Coast. Cos Cob's fish shop, cheese shop, artisan smoothie shop, tea house, farmers market and quiet historic neighborhood streets allow for a peaceful yet cosmopolitan get away without a substantial trek from regional hubs. The town is celebrating its 375th year in 2015 and has several revolutionary era museums including the Bush-Holly House and Putnam Cottage. Science and art exhibits can be viewed at our Bruce Museum and National Audubon Center as well as in NYC (my favorite is the Frick collection of Dutch art for its use of light and contrast). Visitors often alternate days in the big apple with relaxing seafood forays up the Connecticut coast, stopping at the Norwalk Maritime Center www.m(URL HIDDEN) to see marine life of Long Island Sound, including loggerhead turtles, sea horses, tiger sharks, and harbor seals. A ferry ride can take visitors to tour a historic lighthouse. In addition to Native American, naturalist, maritime, and revolutionary / colonial cultural opportunities, this area has become a diverse cosmopolitan community (despite still calling itself a town). The students at Greenwich High School speak over 35 languages. Lonely Planet notes that the "southwestern corner of Connecticut, otherwise known as the Gold Coast, was once home to potato farmers and fishermen until 19th-century railroads brought New Yorkers north. With their blue-chip companies they transformed Fairfield County into one of the wealthiest regions in America with the affluent town of Greenwich at its heart." One of our favorite summer activities is to take a ferry out to Great Captains Island and/or Island Beach to enjoy Long Island Sound then return and kayak/swim on the Mianus River. We cross country ski and skate the river (chatting with ice fishermen) and surrounding woods in the winter and into the spring. Daily hiking and swimming at base camp inspire us to do extensive outreach in our areas of humanitarian and climate coordination globally. We find Cos Cob a wonderful place from which to mix all of these experiences together. We have been known to muck out to the far reaches of the beach for shell fish then dash home to put on suits to attend heads of state negotiations at the United Nations. Feel free to fold into our sustainability initiatives at our institute headquarters, meditate along the river bank, or day trip up and down the coast. Getting Around Restaurants, nature centers/trails, arboretums, farmer's markets, sailing, swimming, kayaking, theatre, museums, high end shopping, and movies are all available within several miles. It's a 10 minute cab ride to the train station and then a 50 minute MetroNorth train ride to Grand Central Station (jumping off point for NYC fun). Check out weekly events posted by Timeout New (EMAIL HIDDEN) Many guests take a taxi to and from JFK or other regional airports. If city savvy and not pressed for time, hop the commuter train (Metro North) into Grand Central and then cross the street to the express airport buses for Newark, JFK, or Laguardia (they leave from slightly different streets within a few blocks from Grand Central Station (costs under $20 one way for the bus while the train depends on whether one catches a peak or off peak train but will generally set one back $15 one way.) A faster, easier way of reaching the airports includes several shuttles that leave from hotels (including my standard approach of taking the Red Dot Shuttle from Greenwich Hyatt which leaves roughly every two hours throughout the day.) Buses become less useful in Greenwich beyond the main arteries. Amtrak express options stop at nearby Stamford station, which is a roughly $12 taxi ride away. We have maps for planning road trips north, south, or west. We can download nautical maps in the eastward direction or help determine coastal ferry schedules. Other Things to Note Very cozy and close to the beach and town. Perfect for a weekend getaway. The property is a river bank National Wildlife Federation Nature Preserve. Marina, Water Club, Greenwich Racket Club, Tennis, and Golf are all within 2 miles. 15 minute walk (5 minute drive) to beautiful 300 acres natural reserve. This Victorian glass house commands a gorgeous view at the top of a hill that takes about 2 minutes to walk up to from the main house. Bring layers as New England weather can be variable throughout the day and from season to season. We cross country ski the river and woods in winter, tap maple trees in spring, kayak as long as there is a free channel of open water, and swim from June to September. Guests fish and shellfish, hike, boat inland and coastal waterways. There are a number of restaurants that will deliver. Otherwise, we would advise a car unless a half mile walk to restaurants is enjoyable for you. While close proximity to the city and easy safe parking for a car, we are neither remote wilderness nor urban. We are a unique river front with easy train access to mega NYC cultural and foodie offerings while also offering our backyard dock from which to launch kayaks. This is a suburban area where public transport is at least a mile walk. Great birding (esp. since we have no pets so are pet allergy friendly - anyone allergic to maple forests should strategize accordingly.) The glass house is a colorful tiny clear glass cabin (with optional curtain screens) perched at the top of a glacial erratic outcropping that has evolved into a rock garden, which looks over a large sunny lawn and forested river bank. It is about 80 sq ft so compare it with a tent rather than a hotel room experience) but is well finished with a very comfortable full bed. It is cozy, creative, and clean. Has electricity (option 1: extension cord to solar powered main house or option 2: solar charged boat battery with red on/off switch on side and 2 regular outlets) and electric space heat. Five minute drive to Cos Cob egg/bacon sandwiches or elegant tea house meals served in high style (pastries, 4 tiers of tea sandwiches, and perfect espresso). 10 minute drive to Greenwich Ave. restaurants and other attractions. Greenwich is known for its vibrant downtown full of many shops, restaurants for all budgets (we like eating gyros at John's concession at Greenwich beach looking out over the ocean and happy children playing in the sand and picking up sea stuff (drift wood, mussel shells, Irish Moss) The area has an active arts and music scene. + More
rules: House Rules We use the glass house often for our own guests and we live on the property in a historic 250 year old barn built from American chestnut. We request that our guests be respectful of our quiet, peaceful neighborhood. (Quiet time from 9:45 pm to 8:45 am). Please part in front of garage closest to the road so we can keep the circular drive free. We welcome our two chosen guests - not parties or loud behavior. We would be happy to facilitate fishing but ask that fish/seafood cleaning not occur in or immediately near the main house or glass house. This is not a place for gatherings or parties, rather a "retreat" in what really is a tiny glass house. It is glamping (glamorous camping) in a strategic (hotel cost in Greenwich range from $250-$300 nightly) and inspiring rare river access and city fun. Sustainability offerings include: (1) Off-grid composting toilet and solar powered shower, kettle, heater, fan, when renewable energy is on offer. (2) Extension cord and town water line when less adventuresome travelers do not want a complete off-grid experience and (3) Inclement weather occasional backup options to share a downstairs family guest bathroom. The outdoor experience is a rejuvenating one. We are not a hotel nor a bed & breakfast. This is our home and in the spirit of Airbnb we share our gorgeous waterfront with global travelers who seek to experience a unique glass house sustainability retreat. We would be happy to exchange stories about global exploration or let guests enjoy our National Wildlife Federation nature preserve where it is easy to spot turtles, herons, egrets, king fishers, osprey, swans, ducks and an occasional bald eagle. This is a smoke/alcohol free property -- both inside and outside. Pets are not allowed (service animals are the only exception). Off street parking is available for one car in our driveway. This can be particularly important in the winter. If you would like to have one or two people over for a short time then please check with us ahead of time. We reserve the right to approve other people to avoid having gatherings that disturb kind neighbors. Check-in is at 3 pm and Check-out by 11 am. We sometimes can be flexible if you discuss your plans with us first. In the New England tradition, we generally take off our shoes and leave them in the mudroom by the front door or in the back entryway. We also expect folks to use water and energy wisely. Please check with us before lighting candles or fires of any kind as we take precautions against fire spreading. Portable barbeque grills may not be used on the property. We have a solar powered electric grill and may offer an outdoor wood fire in one of two outdoor fireplaces if there is not a local fire restriction due to overly dry conditions. We make sure there is a plentiful supply of water in the rainwater harvesting buckets and that the hose is turned on and ready for fire backup use. Fortunately, New England does not experience as many fire/drought issues as out west but we still respect the power of fire. Winter river bon fires are good fun. We love roasting corn and kabobs and having an occasional back bank cookout. Have a peaceful stay! Thanks, Elizabeth + More

about: A secluded country retreat.
description: Description The Space This secluded studio apartment is the second floor of a workshop/barn and is separate from the main log home. Enjoy the deck overlooking private landscaped gardens, which include a water feature. The apartment has a comfortable double bed with pull out sleeper couch. A small kitchen area with vintage dishes and original art will help you feel right at home. Guest Access Hike on our 12 acres or play 18 holes of disc golf -then cool off in the pool or the jacuzzi bathtub. Interaction with Guests We love being hosts. Over the years we have hosted 16 foreign exchange students. We have hosted friends made from our travels to South America, Africa and Europe. We love to get to know guests; however, interaction is up to you. If you would prefer a private stay that is fine with us. The Neighborhood This is country living. Our home is up a driveway that is a quarter of a mile long. From our home you can drive to the casinos (Foxwoods is 10 minutes), Mystic/Stonington (20 minutes), RI Ocean Beaches (30 minutes). You can also enjoy local golf courses and tour the CT Wine Trail while you hunt for antiques . Getting Around You will need a car. Other Things to Note Fresh eggs (when available) from our chickens/ducks and coffee will be left for you in the apartment. We are active supporters of the Chikumbuso Women and Orphans Project in Lusaka, Zambia. We donate 10% of all Airbnb profits to this project. You might want to visit the little store on our property. It features handmade items from Chikumbuso Project a micro-enterprise that supports widows and orphans in Zambia. Thanks for your help. + More
rules: House Rules NO smoking inside. You may smoke on the deck. Please leave the apartment clean. No pets. + More

description: Description The Space Enjoy this well appointed, spacious room and attached bath, located in a private residential neighborhood half way between downtown Mystic and Stonington Borough. There is a garden level private entrance at the back of the house. The room can be set up with two extra-long twins or a king bed. There is also a full size couch that a child will find comfortable. Your privacy and comfort are important to us and although our paths may not cross during your stay we're more than happy to help with suggestions for dining and a wide variety of local activities. There are two shy cats at Cedar View who never enter the guest suite. Be prepared to be lulled to sleep by the distant sound of the fog horn and awake to deer grazing at the perimeter of the property. Cedar View is located about 3km from the Mystic train station. Car rental is conveniently located a short walk from this station. In fine weather Stonington/Mystic is a great place to cycle however car transportation will also be necessary. If you do not have an Airbnb profile then sharing a few words about yourself would be appreciated. In Your Room... Compact Fridge Microwave Coffee Maker (Pete's Coffee and Half and Half provided for short term guests. Electric Tea Kettle TV/Basic Cable Wireless Internet Docking Station Hair Dryer Guest Access Outside Shower is available for guests. The Neighborhood Cedar View is in a quiet residential neighborhood, a comfortable bike ride to Stonington Borough and Mystic center. Getting Around A car is recommended for local travel. If you arrive via the Mystic train station Enterprise Car Rental is a very short walk from the station. Other Things to Note Interested in Cedar View-Please understand that I look for guests with a posted profile. If your profile does not include a few words about yourself please do not inquire. Thanks very much. Please note that the house number is sometimes difficult to find by the front door but the # is clearly posted on a small sign at the street edge/by the driveway that you'll park on. + More
rules: House Rules Daytime we appreciate low voices and music and quiet between 10PM and 7AM. No smoking on the property and the hot tub is not shared with guests. Cedar View can not accommodate pets. + More

description: Description The Space Unwind in the woods! Our two bedroom two bathroom home is situated on 19 beautiful acres on the famous Music Mountain Road in Falls Village, Connecticut. The first bedroom has a full sized bed and private bathroom with standup shower. The second bedroom is not furnished, however, a twin sized futon mat can be provided for the floor upon request, as pictured. Please note, there is only ONE "real" proper bed in the house, it is the full sized in the master. The interior is vintage modern, with a quirky but clean mix of treasures both inherited and collected throughout my travels. Outdoors, the scenery is divine any time of year. You will be surrounded by nature, disconnected from the modern world, immersed in peace and quiet. Take a walk through the forest, or down the dirt road to a picturesque stream. In addition to hiking, our area is well known for fly fishing, skiing, biking, and the amazing antique stores. There is also a wide array of culture including America's Oldest Continuous Chamber Music Festival right here at Music Mountain (URL HIDDEN) Lime Rock Race Track (we have a garage with parking for one vehicle,) Infinity Music Hall, TriArts, MassMOCA, Dia:Beacon, The Wassaic Project, and Storm King are all within a reasonable drive... and New York City is just a two hour train ride away. My kitchen and all it's contents are at your disposal! If you'd like to cook yourself breakfast you will find the fridge stocked with local eggs and essentials. Also feel free to help yourself to the giant delicious kale, or whatever else is growing in our garden. Sorry, we are a no bacon household! But "downtown" there is Toymakers Cafe and The Falls Village Inn, or you can venture out to a neighboring town for other great eats in Salisbury, Cornwall or Kent, CT, Millerton, NY, or Great Barrington, MA. The Tri-State area has a lot to offer! We hope you'll come visit! + More

about: This house sits naturally on the front straight of lime rock park . It's close to all the area has to offer . I have 3 different bedrooms available , one with a queen size , one with 3 twins and one with 2 twins .
description: Description The Space If your working at lime rock or racing this is the spot for you . Guest Access You will have access to a fairly new jacuzzi tub , a large outdoor firepit and walking access to lime rock park . Also kitchen is available to use when owner is home . All rooms have tv and ac and comfortable bedding . The front porch is inviting as well with a glass of wine whether it's raining or not . The Neighborhood The neighborhood is insulated by the Trinity College, the learning corridor(three magnet schools), the Institute of Living and Hartford Hospital and the Boys and Girls Club. Brownell Avenue has 33% less residential homes than the rest of the city because of the institutions that surround it and thus the neighborhood is very quiet and tidy. Also it goes with out saying that with tons of security from these institutions that the neighborhood is very safe. about: Ground floor monumental artistic apartment in building of 12 friendly neighbors. Near Mark Twain House betw West-Hartford & Downtown Hartford, both 10 min by bus. Living rm w piano+ 2-pers. bed couch; sun rm+ bed couch; kitchen; bed rm; back porch.
description: Description The Space We LOVE our 1st floor apartment, it 's a very inspiring place to be! We feel very safe and private but still with a family feeling because of our friendly and helpful neighbors from the same building, 3 floors, 4 apartments per floor. The apartment is child-friendly. If you want to come with more than two persons, that's possible. Have a look at the floor plan . The apartment is not big, there is one real bed, 1 bed couch and 1 air mattress, all queen sized (about 74,5 by 55 inch) plus there is a bed couch slightly smaller than a queen sized bed (80 by 47 inch). Guest Access to see if you like itYou will have access to the apartment, back porch, basement with commercial cloth washer /dryer, shared garden in the back, 1 designated parking spot on the property (see instructions), maybe two, only after consulting Frank, not any other resident. Interaction with Guests We will most likely not be there, but our friendly neighbors will be your guides. Frank, who handles the keys and the parking [NB by phone only calling works because he "doesn't do text"]; the cleaning lady from the 2nd floor, and for general support and questions, our best friend on the 3rd floor. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is very green, of course the Mark Twain House nearby as well as two centers of Hartford, that is: Downtown Hartford and West-Hartford. Getting Around The busses are running frequently and the bus stop is very nearby, next to the Mark Twain House. Other Things to Note Check in is between 3 pm until 9 pm; check out is at noon. Baby's also count as a person for a reservation. + More
rules: House Rules At least 1 day prior to arrival you are required to text or email to us a photo of your picture ID (passport or drivers license). At arrival you need to show this picture ID. In general, please be gentle with our beautiful apartment. We do our very best to to keep it clean and well maintained but it has little flaws because it 's at age. No smoking in the apartment please! And also not at the back porch! You can smoke in the community garden at the back of the house. No pets please! Only 1 parking spot on the property, maybe 2, only if approved by Frank who is in charge of the building. Pls take good note of where to park or you could be towed. Ask Frank for instructions where to park is the best, other look in the guidebook in the apartment. Parking in the street is for free. + More

about: This lovely and bright house is perfect for a little vacation and relaxation. Get a taste of living off the grid. While cellphone service is excellent and cable is ready, you feel like you're in a place that is ridiculously peaceful and picturesque.
description: Description The Space Can you picture yourself waking up to a memorable sunrise with a strong brew of coffee? As you stroll down to the dock you have a choice of gliding with the kayak to a nearby island or taking the boat out for a swim in the tranquil waters. Enjoy the warm weather and take advantage of countless activities on the lake. The fish are jumping and the boat is ready. We are nestled in the vibrant town of Guilford, Connecticut. Only a short drive to town and Yale, centrally located between Boston & New York. Situated on the property is a 5,000 square foot country residence. Enjoy taking a refreshing swim in the crystal clear lake or take a tranquil hike around the lake to one of the many fishing spots to catch largemouth bass, pickerel, or trout. Free use of kayaks and boat. Nothing better than being on the lake. It's just a cool place that is quite unique. Winter is fun too with ice skating, sledding, and the occasional weekend hockey game. Autumn is beautiful and so is Spring and there are two bikes for your use. Two bedrooms available (with a single and double bed in one room and a queen size in the other room) There are hiking and biking trails close by and the New Haven Sportsmen's Club is right across the lake Food: Red or white wine upon your arrival Coffee, Tea and Juice for breakfast with oatmeal or yogurt. The kitchen is available for whatever you'd like to cook. Guest Access Flat screen High Def TV With Cable Fire pit for evening camp fires WiFi and good cell service BBQ Gas Grill Four decks with picnic tables washer and dryer boat with trolling motor fishing poles 4 kayaks 4 bikes fishing and swimming off the dock or beach Interaction with Guests Share kitchen, living room and bathrooms. The Neighborhood Quiet country setting Getting Around There is the train station in Guilford and I've picked up lots of guests coming in by train. Other Things to Note There are three small dogs in the house so don't book here if you have a pet allergy. They are well-behaved and social. Olive is 1 year old and 100% pug, Tater is 10 years old and 75% pug and Chili is 11 years old and 50% pug/beagle + More

about: Welcome to your own private studio in a quiet residential area near beaches and historic Fairfield. Find tranquility in this light-filled and cozy Zen studio and enjoy the convenience of its central location.
description: Description The Space The Zen Studio is an elegant, simple and cozy apartment that has all the amenities you need to rest and rejuvenate. The full-size bed is comfortable and surrounded by oriental textiles. There is a desk for writing or doing work and a large sofa for reading or relaxing. The space is inspired by my travels in Asia with the goal of providing visitors creative inspiration and comfort. Guest Access You will have your own private entrance, located through the backyard, separate from the main front door. Interaction with Guests If there is anything you need or special requests, please let me know. I am happy to provide visitors with any help I can offer! The Neighborhood The Zen Studio is an elegant, creative and comfortable living space within minutes of Fairfield's best restaurants, cafes and beaches. Enjoy the convenience of the Zen Studio's central location within a quiet, peaceful property. Getting Around Very Walkable Area: Jennings Marina and Beach is a 7-8 minute walk from the house and there are many cafes, grocery stores (whole foods, CVS, etc) within a 10-15 minutes walk. Downtown Fairfield is also a nice 10-15 minute walk through historic Fairfield. Public Transportation Access: There are two train stations in Fairfield, both within 15 minutes walking distance. The onramp to I-95 is a quick drive on the other side of Post road. There is local taxi service and bus access within minutes if desired. Fairfield University is 1 mile away or a 15 min.walk. GE HQ and Sacred Heart are a 20 minute drive. Easy access/walkable to car rental locations are within 2 blocks. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking. No open flame in unit or outside. No recreational drugs. No pets. Please respect your neighbors and keep the noise down after 10pm. There is a $20 fee for lost keys. Common courtesy is very much appreciated. + More

description: Description The Space The apartment is in the former servants quarters in a historic New Haven house. There are three rooms with a fully equipped kitchen, full bath, and a room we call 'the library'. Furnishings are a mix of antiques and modern, oriental carpets, art and of course, books! The apartment has its own private deck overlooking our gardens and koi pond. For guests who stay for longer periods of time, there is a laundry room in the basement. Guest Access FREE PARKING right out front! You have unrestricted access 24-7 to the apartment with your own entrance and key! Feel free to relax on the your own deck, and walk around the neighborhood or enjoy the 600+ acre park across the street. Interaction with Guests We are usually around, but leave it up to our guests as to how much interaction they want. It is great to meet so many interesting travelers. The Neighborhood This is a convenient, beautiful old tree lined neighborhood, on the edge of Downtown New Haven. We are close enough to walk most everywhere in town, but still enjoy the quiet, park-side location, and free, safe, on-street parking. We have a guest guidebook in the apartment to help you enjoy your surroundings. Getting Around We are a block from the Yale shuttle lines and close to everything in New Haven. We have safe street parking right out front. Other Things to Note This is the best livable neighborhood in town: restaurants, markets, and sights are all within a very walkable distance. The beautiful East Rock Park is across the street! We are one block from the Yale shuttles and city buses. + More

about: Tucked away in the historic village and beautiful farmland of Connecticut (and not far from the base of the Berkshire Mountains), enjoy a beautiful sun filled studio in this lovely circa 1789 majestic home and gentleman's farm.
description: Description The Space A large bright studio apartment with beautiful wood floors, a full bath with shower and a galley kitchen equipped with a small fridge and stove. The decor is classic elegance with modern simplicity and chic/eco-conscious. Additional amenities include: organic cotton sheets + towels as well as hypoallergenic pillows. Imported linen hand screened designer pillows decorate the room, along with original watercolor paintings. Located in a breathtaking area, Granby is noted for its working farms and horse friendly community. Our beautiful rural character is rooted in the New England agriculture tradition. We feature a variety of 20 unique, small working farms, fruit orchards and dairy farms that shouldn't be missed. *During the spring/summer months, the suite is shaded by beautiful large maple trees, which keep it naturally cool. *All cleaning products (dish soap, shampoo etc.) are organic. Guest Access Private, with own entrance. Interaction with Guests We will greet you upon arrival and available if you need us. The Neighborhood Enjoy a peaceful stay in a majestic center chimney 1789 colonial, surrounded by beautiful gardens and exterior spaces. Gorgeous wide American chestnut and pine floors throughout, along with beautiful hand planed mantel and raised panel walls extend the entire length of the suite. Nestled in the hills of the Historic District of West Granby Connecticut , we are minutes from farmers markets, the famous "garlic farm", horse farms...and (we think) the best hiking in Connecticut and the Berkshires. In addition, we are located a 2 hour drive from Boston and 2.25 to NYC, and one hour from the Connecticut shoreline. Suitable for one person, or couple. Getting Around This is a great place to bike, or hike, but we suggest you have/rent a car. Other Things to Note We are a cozy place to stay/ home base for apple, and berry-pickers, farmers market lovers, hikers and bikers. Local attractions include (please see guidebook): Not all listed link/shows in the guidebook, so I have included many additional favorites below: :: The Garlic Farm (a five minute walk) a noted CT farm that grows a special "Hard neck German" garlic :: Bushy Hill Orchard (10 minute drive) a fabulous bakery with seasonal produce, berries and pick your own peaches and apples. :: The Lost Acres Vineyard Hand crafted fine wines and tastings. :: Lost Acres Orchard Pick your own apples, plus seasonal "farm kitchen" with fresh baked goods and soups. :: Hiking Mclean Game Refuge The Granby Land Trust Enders State Forest Talcott Mountain State Park/Hueblein Tower Barkhamsted Reservoir :: Biking The "Rails to Trails" system which takes you for miles from CT to MA and beyond :: Boat Rentals & Swimming Barkhamsted Reservoir has a "secret" public beach (Lake McDonough). Kayak and Canoe Rentals at Collinsville Kayak and Canoe Company, or Barkhamsted Reservoir Rental area. :: Fishing We have some of the best fly fishing in the area along the Salmon Brook (within minutes from the apartment), or the Connecticut River at various locations. The Department of Environmental Protection stocks the Salmon Brook with Trout in the spring and you will find the "fish release" information/map on their website. :: Day trips -The Litchfield Hills Quaint village with shopping, art galleries, cafe's and pubs. You will also find the famous, White Flower Farm here. -Kent, CT Scenic drive, art galleries and more. -Connecticut Art Trail Seventeen world-class museums and historic sites from bucolic farms, art studios and former artists' boarding houses to grand and modern art museums in vibrant downtowns. :: Longer excursions: Northampton, Amherst , Great Barrington, Tanglewood and Jacob's Pillow for music and dance in MA. :: Fall Foliage (Late September- Early October) You will find some of the best fall foliage, just from the window of our suite. The hiking and biking trails are spectacular this time of year, along with the local bakeries and restaurant serving fresh apple cider donuts, and root vegetable soups. :: Upon arrival you will find this information in our "welcome note" along with corresponding websites for further details. *Pet friendly with a limit to one cat, or dog per guest. + More

about: Charming beach cottage, clean, well maintained interior,central AC. Cottage located on dead end street, 4 houses from LI Sound. Residents share PRIVATE BEACH.View of ocean and salt marsh from porch!
description: Description The Space Charming beach cottage, clean, well maintained interior,central AC. Cottage located on dead end street, 4 houses from LI Sound. Residents share PRIVATE BEACH.Guests of property also have beach rights to adjacent PRIVATE BEACH. View of ocean and salt marsh from front porch. Short walk to TOWN BEACH PLAYGROUND, WATER PARK AND 2 FULL SERVICE RESTAURANTS! Enclosed front and outdoor porches, fully equipped kitchen,gas stove,washer,dryer,blender,lobster pot,microwave,mixer. Cable,broadband internet. New quality linens, BEACH TOWELS, paper goods,soaps, toiletries,coffee, spices,beach chairs, floats, Welcome Gift. Sleeps 4. For Weekly rentals Friday- Friday.Check in 4:00 Check out 10:00am Guest Access Guests have access to entire property. Interaction with Guests I like to meet my guests at least once during their stay. I am available more if requested. The Neighborhood This is a small community. Many families have owned houses here for generations. It is very safe and friendly. The beaches are never crowded and are often deserted. It is unusual to be able to enjoy the sunrise and sunset on the same beach. You will feel like staying in the neighborhood so it is convenient that there are two restaurants on the street within walking distance. Once you come you will feel right at home. I love this area because of the local Italian food, and the beach! Yale University,Wooster Street's little Italy is 5 minutes away with the best pizza in the country! The location is central for New England sightseeing. A short trip from the big metropolitan areas of New York, Boston using either i-95 or the Shore Line Train. Short trip to Vermont, The Berkshires,Block Island. Trolley ride through salt marsh,Old New England Towns,Mohegan Sun and Foxwoods Casinos,shops, antiquing, historical landmarks ,Museums, factory outlets,Mystic Aquarium,Yale University, Long Wharf, Shubert,Palace, Goodspeed Opera House Theaters and easy access from i-95 and i91 If you did want to leave the beach there is plenty to do! Getting Around There is a bus line within a short walk. The property has a driveway for parking and an area in front of the house for additional parking. It is 10 minutes from the local airport. From Bradley International you would use I91 to I95. Other Things to Note Rental Agreement is required to rent this property. All payments will be through Airbnb. + More

about: Walk to downtown Middletown, a small city on the Connecticut River, and Wesleyan University. This bedroom has a king bed and shares a bathroom with one other room. Guests may also use the kitchen, garden, and hammock (weather permitting).
description: Description The Space Clover Nook is set next to a ravine complete with a creek that can become a torrent in the spring. It is a two-family house with a door between the kitchens. The space is very flexible. I can offer one or two bedrooms with access to the kitchen or all of my side of the house except my office. The large bedroom (this listing) is at the back of the house, has a king bed, and faces the rising sun. Guests in this room share a bathroom with the small bedroom. I usually cannot accommodate last-minute bookings. Guest Access Guests are welcome to use the kitchen for making beverages or simple meals. The house has wireless Internet, but we do not have TV. There is only one TV. When the weather is good, guests are welcome to use the garden and the back area. I hesitate to call it a patio because it is where I pot plants, but it is where we grill and build fires. We have a battered fire pit and plenty of wood. I work at home, so my office is pretty much off limits, but everything is negotiable. Interaction with Guests I will be in the house during your stay. I may sleep in the small bedroom or in the apartment next door, so if any questions or problems come up, I'll be right here. If you need to do laundry, you must pass through my office to get to the laundry room, which is fine with me. The Neighborhood This is an ethnically and culturally mixed neighborhood, and it is mixed zoning. Clover Nook once housed a beauty parlor; we found two of those old-fashioned hair dryers with the huge hoods in the basement. Toward the end of the street stands a collection of very small houses that were probably built to house mill employees. At the very end is the house where the songwriter Henry Clay Work was born. Among his best-known tunes are "Marching Through Georgia" and "My Grandfather's Clock." There is a statue of Work on Middletown's South Green, which is a few blocks from the house. Downtown Restaurants (listed in order of distance, farthest away first) Tibetan Kitchen Located at 574 Main Street, Tibetan Kitchen is an unassuming little place with great food. I have no idea whether it is authentic, but it's certainly delicious. There is something for everyone here: curries, soups, dumplings, and more and lots of vegan and vegetarian options. BYOB (there is a corking fee). Bring patienceservice can be slow and the place can get very busy, but the wait is well worth it. Also bring cashno checks or credit cards are accepted. Closed Sundays. Iguanas Ranas Taquer_a Iguanas Ranas, 484 Main Street, is a family business that started small and keeps growing. I like everything I've had there but adore the fish tacos. The place gets noisy at night, so we usually go for lunch and try to get a table in the window. Full bar. Closed Sundays. Caf 56 Caf 56, at 102 Court Street, is one of our favorite Middletown restaurants. Open for breakfast and lunch, it features foods and culinary traditions from different countries and ethnicities. From the website: The goal at Caf 56 is to provide the customers with the experience of the different tastes from around the world." The chef and owner is Sabrina Cortes, who is from Guatemala City. She also serves, buses tables, chats with everyone, and generally sees to everything. Ed Thereault bakes scones, croissants (real ones), country buttermilk biscuits, cinnamon rolls, and a variety of coffee cakes and muffins every morning. He also creates delicious desserts; some of his specialties include the Caf 56 red velveteen cake with caramel buttercream icing and a coconut lime cake. Closed Sundays. Fiore II Restaurant This Italian restaurant, at 332 Main Street, is very pretty inside and out. All the food looks wonderful, but I always end up ordering scampi and trying to talk someone into sharing a bowl of lobster bisque. Beer and wine are available. I don't know whether other alcohol is served, but I'll find out and revise this. Closed Mondays. Amici Italian Grill Amici's, 280 Main Street, specializes in northern Italian cooking. It has a full bar and is often crowded, especially on weekend nights. Open every day for lunch and dinner. Getting Around Middletown does have a bus system, and I have a schedule, but most people drive, walk, or bike. Parking at Clover Nook is available in the driveway. Other Things to Note When a guest arrived recently, she asked if we could recommend a good massage therapist. We said sure--ours. Lugging her table, Joan made a house call. Everyone was pleased, and Joan decided she would be happy to do it again. If anyone who books at Clover Nook would like to arrange for a massage, I will pass along Joan's number after the booking, and Joan and the guest can make whatever arrangement they like. We have an ancient cat who has the run of the house; however, she was never allowed in the large bedroom and hasn't been in the small bedroom for years. + More
