about: This 2 BR apt is located in the heart of East Rock. Just a few blocks from East Rock park and a mile from downtown, it's a perfect spot for a family or a group of friends to stay. It is on the 2nd floor of a 3 family home with a shared backyard.
description: Description The Space This 2 BR apartment has hardwood floors, a full kitchen, a dining area and a living room and a bathroom. 1 bedroom has a queen bed, 1 bedroom has a full size futon and there is a full size futon in the living room. Starting in mid-January, we will also have a pack n play. There is street parking across the street. Guest Access The apartment has its own front and back door entrances. We'll provide you with a key. The apt is located on the 2nd floor. You can also use the back staircase to access the basement for laundry or the shared backyard. Interaction with Guests We are available through phone, texts or email or even if you want to knock on our back door (first floor!) if you have any concerns or questions. We want you to feel welcome and are here to make sure you enjoy your stay in our home and in New Haven. The Neighborhood We are a few blocks from East Rock Park which has beautiful trails for hiking and the Mill River for boating. People also love to run in the park and it has a fun playground for the kids. We are a few blocks from restaurants and shops on State street and about a mile from downtown New Haven. You can take the Yale shuttle, the bus, drive, walk or bike downtown easily. Along the way on Orange Street you'll find some cute local shops - Romeo & Cesares around the corner has a deli counter, great cheeses & produce, Orange Street Liquors has beer/wine/spirits, Nica's has a deli & other food and if you continue down further towards downtown you'll find many other shops & restaurants. A few doors down is Archie Moore's for drinks & food and on State street there are many great restaurants and bars. Here is a great local food guide: (URL HIDDEN) Getting Around The bus stops on the corner of Orange & Willow. You can get an uber or taxi easily. There is street parking right out front. Other Things to Note We do have 3 cats who roam the house (but not your apt) and use the outdoors. The backyard is yours to use as well as the laundry room in the basement. There is tea and coffee (with a press pot) for you to make at your leisure. Street parking is available, across the street. + More

about: This sunny corner apartment is on the top floor of an historic building in the heart of hip downtown, and just a moment's walk from Yale's main campus and some of the best food in the city.
description: Description The Space Sunny corner apartment on the top floor of an historic downtown building. It's right next to New Haven's finest luxury hotel in the heart of hip downtown -- but here, you'll have better accommodations at a fraction of the price. The location is unbeatable. We're one block from Yale campus, across the street from the Yale Art School, and one block from both Yale art galleries as well as the Yale Repertory Theater. Some of the best coffee in New Haven is in the cafe on the bottom floor of our building. Three large corner windows offer a panoramic view of the city, and sunset makes the whole place glow. Within a one block radius, you'll find a local gastropub with a great beer list; a cozy coffee shop bookstore; Indian, Thai, locavore haute-cusine, and a nationally-acclaimed sushi restaurant. If you're a night owl, there's falafel and fresh-baked cookies available till three in the morning. The living room and bedroom are separated by French doors. You'll have a fully furnished kitchen with a gas stove, microwave, a full set of spices and a floor-to-ceiling wall of pots and pans. You'll have an Aeron chair, two desks, three typewriters, a Bose surround-sound stereo system, and a comfortable queen-sized bed with a tempur-pedic mattress. And trust me, there's plenty to read. If you need an extra bed, there's a queen-sized air mattress you can set up in the living room, and the leather couch is comfortable too. Also, there's a wall-sized American flag. See the photos. + More

description: Description The Space A quiet retreat near open fields with grazing sheep and forested hillsides, our house is only two hours from New York City, but feels like it's in the middle of Vermont. Scenic drives, cool shops and galleries, and delightful restaurants are scattered throughout the quaint, historic towns of the Litchfield Hills. We have a large, rambling, country colonial in rural NW Connecticut, close to hiking, biking, swimming, boating and skiing. The house is surrounded by Nature Conservancy land and minutes from Mohawk State Forest and Ski Area, the Housatonic River, and abundant lakes, back roads and nature preserves. Area private schools--Hotchkiss, Kent, Salisbury, Marvelwood and Indian Mountainare within a 20 minute drive. Great Barrington, Massachusetts and Berkshire attractions are 35-45 minutes away. We can direct you to great spots for plein air painting, or offer you a quiet space to work. Hiking, biking, paddling and skiing (x-c and downhill) information is also available. Cozy bedrooms are in their own wing with two separate staircases. There is one bedroom with a queen bed, one with a double bed, and one with two single beds. Two bathrooms are adjacent to the bedrooms. This listing is for the twin bedroom with an adjacent bathroom. There are two other bedrooms available with separate listings. Families of 4-6 people can be comfortably accomodated. Guests have use of a spacious living room and free WiFi. Many wonderful markets and restaurants are a short drive away. Guest Access Guests have use of WiFi in their rooms. Kitchen access, laundry facilities and TV may be available if pre-arranged. Interaction with Guests I will be present during guest stays, and enjoy conversing with guests. If you prefer to be alone, there are several rooms to escape to, and a screen porch in summer. + More

about: Chris and Rachel are steps away from beautiful preserved wetlands & Lighthouse Point Park -- one of the best birding spots on the East Coast, and one meal on the back porch will show you why!
description: Description The Space We have a good size bedroom with queen size bed, room darkening shades, and its own full bath and shared kitchen on the ground floor of our spacious house. Just bring your bags because Tweed New Haven Airport is walking distance and the bus to downtown New Haven stops right across the street. We are about 15 minutes door-to-door by car to the Yale campus. There are buses available the pick up and drop off across the street from us, but it takes about 30 minutes to get to the campus via bus. Please see the following bus schedules for more information before asking. We can't tell you any more than is in these schedules. Thanks! Weekdays (URL HIDDEN) Weekends: (URL HIDDEN) Quiet and considerate a must. The house has wood floors, central heat and air, laundry facilities in the basement. Were less than a five-minute walk to the quiet, public Morris Cove beach and about 0.7 mile to the beach and beautiful sunsets at Lighthouse Point Park. We're in the heart of the fairly quiet Morris Cove neighborhood. The busiest times are July 4 when the cars begin lining up before sunrise to get to the park at the end of the road; and during the winter when Easter Seals sponsors the Festival of Lights, when the cars line up for more than a mile to pay the $10 entry fee and see the holiday light sculptures ranging from animated lobsters and sailboats to electronic snowball fights. Krauszer's deli and quick mart is also minutes away by foot and has just about anything you might need from morning java (also available here at home) to veggies and the morning newspaper. Across the street from Krauszer's is Joey D's Italian food/pizzeria for lunch or dinner specialties. The neighborhood is walk-friendly with lots of runners and dogs. We love food here at what we call The Lighthouse. Our garden provides us with fresh strawberries, raspberries, black seeded Simpson lettuce, arugula and spinach when it's season. We hope to be pickling cukes before long and should have our own crop of Connecticut field 10" pumpkins. The sage, dill, basil, parsley, oregano, marjoram, chives and thyme from our herb garden add lots of pizzazz to a spinach omelet and we regularly perk up our tea or lemonade with fresh spearmint, too. The sunflowers should be in bloom outside your window by the late summer as well. Just write if you want more pictures or more information. Guest Access House and garage are accessible to guests if you want to lock up your bike or one of ours. Admission to Lighthouse Park is free for pedestrians and cyclists. There is safe on-street parking and there is one space in the very far rear of the driveway due to there currently being two cars in the garage. Check in is best after 6 p.m. during the week seeing as we both work, but this should be discussed in advance as one of us may be able to meet you here earlier. Weekend check-in times should also be discussed as they would be dependent on our availability. Interaction with Guests If we're home and not busy with blogging or some such thing, then we're fairly early to bed and early to rise, but aside from that, we're pretty friendly folks, as is most of the neighborhood. The Neighborhood We are in a fairly quiet neighborhood on the other side of New Haven Harbor from Yale and downtown New Haven. We are about a 10-15 minute drive from Yale and about a 30-minute bus ride. The bus stops across the street from us and runs from about 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. You'll have to check the (URL HIDDEN) website for more detailed information on bus schedules. Getting Around The bus stops across the street and we're about a 10-15 minute drive from downtown New Haven. Other Things to Note While we love most animals, we don't have any or allow any in the house. We have a Keurig coffee machine, so if you drink coffee, you can bring your cups. When Chris drinks coffee it's decaf, so we don't usually have high octane in the house. + More
rules: House Rules We appreciate quiet and considerate guests. Ask us any questions about the neighborhood, restaurants in New Haven, what's where in the kitchen. We want you to feel comfortable and have a great stay. :) + More

about: A warm & welcoming antique barn cottage suitable for both a couple or small family. Enjoy the gardens from your private patio, take a dip in the pool, read a book surrounded by fall foliage. The Benedict House Cottage is a place to call home while exploring the area.
description: Description The Space Escape to a 5-acre estate in scenic and pristine Bethel, CT just 70 miles from NYC. This exquisite piece of New England history: The Oliver Benedict House on Codfish Hill. was built in 1796 and has had an incredible list of owners, including the one of the first families in Bethel (The Benedict Family), The (P.T.) Barnum Family and Helmsley/Spear Families. Your stay on Codfish Hill will be in the 200 year old converted milk barn with private entrance, beautiful loft, exposed barnwood beams, tons of natural light, Jacuzzi tub, and full bath with wilderness and wildlife all around you. The barn cottage (where you'll be staying) is flanked by beautiful gardens and adjacent open space. Codfish Hill is a great place for a relaxing getaway approximately 1hr from NYC. We are situated for day trips to state parks, ski hills, beaches, museums in Hartford and New Haven and several wineries on the CT Wine Trail. ________ Guest Access Enjoy the seasonal swimming pool, private patio surrounded by gardens, high speed WiFi internet and close proximity to Fairfield/Litchfield County attractions including state parks, amusement parks, ski resorts, apple orchards, Interaction with Guests We will be here when you arrive to greet you and show you around (if desired). We love our little farm property and can't wait to share it (and its stories) with you! The Neighborhood Bethel, CT is a charming town nestled in southwestern Fairfield County and is part of the Danbury metropolitan area. Bethel offers a rich colonial history, local flair and breathtaking rolling landscapes. The town is mostly residential and its main thoroughfare Greenwood Avenue has been designated as a Historic District. You can visit the other historic homes of Rev. John Ely and Seth Seelye - both on the National Register of Historic Places  The town is home to the Blue Jay Orchards for apple picking, Putnam Memorial State Park, Bennett Memorial Park and Taunton Pond. Also, for those who like to go antiquing, we have a variety of antique stores within 25 minutes in nearby Southbury and Woodbury. The Codfish Hill area of Bethel is among the most historic, rural and beautiful areas in New England. Located just north of Huntington State Park in Redding, hiking, biking, kayaking, snowshoeing and a host of other outdoor activities are right in our backyard. Getting Around As we are in the country, you will need a car. Some guests from NYC take Metro North to Bethel on the New Haven Line or Southeast on the Harlem Line and have Enterprise Car Rental meet them. If you need help figuring this out, we're happy to assist! There are also lots of car shares in the area. If desired guests can also rent our electric car (on site) through Turo (previously relay rides) at a discounted rate. Other Things to Note In 1976 the Bethel Historical Society and Bicentennial Commission published a book entitled A History of Bethel, A Commemorative Book". There is a chapter of the book highlighting Bethel's eighteenth-century houses, one of which is our home. Because all early records were destroyed in the British Burning of Danbury not all historical data for our home has been readily available. So we have done some digging of our own. :) Oliver Benedict (the original owner of the farm at our address) and the Benedict family were one of the first families to have settled in Bethel, CT. In fact, Oliver's father, Benjamin was one of the original seventy-one members of the First Congregational Church in Bethel which was established in 1759. We know that Oliver's first child, Ira was born on June 3, 1772, and that he was paid 5 pounds In 1792 for his losses from the British as aresult of their march towards Danbury. This would confirm that he was living in Bethel in 1777 when 2,000 British troops led by General Tryon marched through Bethel on their way to burn the Revolutionary stores at Danbury. There are stories that tell of local patriots warning the Bethel citizens of the British advance. One such story tells of a lone rider seeing the British approaching from the top of Hoyts Hill and rode not unlike Paul Revere to alert their neighbors. The British, as the story is told, thinking they were being met by a considerable army, halted their forces and sent scouts ahead to see if they would be met by rebel forces. A descendant of Thomas Taylor (one of the early Bethel settlers and friend of the Benedict family) told a story that her grandmother was riding home when she sighted the British and dashed into Bethel shouting, The British are coming! The British are coming!" We know in the coming days of 1977 some type of damage (likely to the house and outbuildings) was inflicted upon our home, our home also likely played a role in the British Invasion/plan. Codfish Hill Road was an established foraging camp during the invasion (for crops or animals for food), and many homes in the area were damaged at that time. + More
rules: House Rules We love this home and know you will too. As such, of course we have a few ground rules. - No pets. - No smoking or other drugs, ever. - No shoes in the bedroom, please. - Enjoy the complimentary slipper socks. :) - If you pick it up, please return it where you found it. - The Benedict House Cottage is full of antiques that have been dug up (quite literally) on the property from the various owners over the years. Handle them sensibly and please enjoy them as we have. - Kids are always welcome! + More

description: Description The Space Sleep, Create, Rehearse!! We are located on nine wooded acres at the foothills of the Berskhire Mountains and surrounded by state parks (Kent Falls, Macedonia State Park and more!), private schools, and the Appalachian Trail. We're a short distance from three traditional New England covered bridges and just three miles from the charming town of Kent, an enchanting travel destination situated beside the Housatonic River. You can stroll around town and take advantage of Kent's great restaurants, galleries and shopping. We provide internet and breakfast, along with two loving dogs and two evil parrots. If you're hiking the Appalachian Trail, we will provide transportation to the trail head. A perfect escape from the city, only two hours away. If you don't have a car, and we're available, we can pick you up and deliver you from the Harlem Valley/Wingdale station on the Metro-North Line. Our fee for this service is $40 round trip, to be paid on arrival. We offer our home as a place to come and unwind. There are so many things to do but if you want to just sit in the sun and read that's fine too. We have wi-fi and if you have work to do there are plenty of tables on which to set up your computer. There is an art studio you can work in. Just bring your supplies or, if you want, you're welcome to use my potter's wheels and and there is clay you can purchase from me. We have hiking trails all around the house. If you have a car the state park is just a few minutes down the road. There are great biking roads and the rail trail isn't too far away. There are wonderful new restaurants in Kent and sweet little shops for clothing, art and crafts. There is a coffee and chocolate shop with outdoor tables - just perfect for people watching. There are a couple of wineries that are fairly close You may see us around, but the house is large enough to get lost in. On warm days you can have breakfast on the screened-in porch. It's on the second floor so you'll feel like you're in the trees canopy with lots of birds to watch. Breakfast items will be provided, i.e. cereal, fruit, toast, etc. Coffee and tea are included. We also have an additional building of 3400 sq. ft. which houses a pottery and art studio and can also be used as a rehearsal space (theater, music, lecture hall, etc.) Please call or email for hall rental pricing. We must have adequate verification, including a phone call through airbnb. This is a basement room. Other Things to Note Friendly dogs are welcome, but there is a charge of $10 per dog, per night, to be paid upon arrival. + More
rules: House Rules Check-in before 5PM, or call or email to let us know when you will arrive. No eating, drinking, or painting your nails in bed, please. + More

description: Description The Space A quiet retreat near open fields with grazing sheep and forested hillsides, our house is only two hours from New York City, but feels like it's in the middle of Vermont. Scenic drives, cool shops and galleries, and delightful restaurants are scattered throughout the quaint, historic towns of the Litchfield Hills. We have a large, rambling, country colonial in rural NW Connecticut, close to hiking, biking, swimming, boating and skiing. The house is surrounded by Nature Conservancy land and minutes from Mohawk State Forest and Ski Area, the Housatonic River, and abundant lakes, back roads and nature preserves. Area private schools--Hotchkiss, Kent, Salisbury, Marvelwood and Indian Mountainare within a 20 minute drive. Great Barrington, Massachusetts and Berkshire attractions are 35-45 minutes away. We can direct you to great spots for plein air painting, or offer you a quiet space to work. Hiking, biking, paddling and skiing (x-c and downhill) information is also available. Cozy bedrooms are in their own wing with two separate staircases. There is one bedroom with a queen bed, one with a double bed, and one with two single beds. Two bathrooms are adjacent to the bedrooms. This listing is for the queen bedroom with an adjacent bathroom. There are two other bedrooms available with separate listings. Guests have use of a spacious living room and free wifi. Many wonderful markets and restaurants are a short drive away. Guest Access Guests have use of WiFi in their rooms. Kitchen access, laundry facilities and TV may be available if pre-arranged. Interaction with Guests I will be present during guest stays, and enjoy conversing with guests. If you prefer to be alone, there are several rooms to escape to, and a screen porch in summer. + More

about: This gracious home overlooking our Equine Therapy Center provides therapeutic,recreational and educational activities away from city bustle. Close to all area attractions- CT and RI Beaches, Mystic Seaport and Aquarium, and I-95 and I-395 corridors.
description: Description The Space The home is an elegant Maryland-Style Farmhouse with a gracious foyer and library as you enter leading to the elegant Fireplaced Library where breakfast is served each morning. Each guest bedroom has an en-suite private bath and keyed entry. Ironing Board, Iron, and housekeeping supplies are available in the closet in the bedroom wing hall. Relax with a lovely continental breakfast between 8 and 10 in the library featuring organic produce grown on site or locally sourced. Cable TV in Library. WiFi access at "FARM GUEST." In addition to your participation in our various Volunteer or Ecotourism weekend vacations, workshops, lectures, clinics and events, a private farm tour may be arranged at 10 am on Sunday morning or by appointment outside of program hours. We can accommode meetings, gatherings, or conferences for up to 30 people in our Library/ Conference room. All proceeds support Horses Healing Humans Equine-Assisted Activities and Therapies, a 501 (c)(3) non-profit serving people with physical, cognitive, and emotional challenges. EIN (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Guest Access Guests park right at the lovely front entrance. Your stay includes access to Library/ Breakfast Room, Lawns and Patio. Fees for workshops, clinics, and events are additional. Please respect Private and Business use areas. On Sundays and Monday Mornings you may use the sensory trail system to hike- please advise if you plan to be on the trails. Interaction with Guests Volunteer Vacation- Arrive Friday night for Volunter training- learn about Equine Therapies for people with various disabilities and challenges, and the ways we assist them. Assist with mounted or unmounted programs or facilities/ gardening projects on Saturday from 10-2 pm, afternoon and evening on your own to enjoy our beautiful natural environment and surrounding community. Sunday breakfast is a lovely time to relax and process your experience before heading back out to area amenities. Ecotourism Weekend- spend a relaxing day or two learning and practicing organic gardening and composting techniques, how to buld a "Pasture Paradise" or PT paddock, trail building and maintenance, conservaion methods. Ecotourism is now defined as "responsible travel to natural areas that conserves the environment, sustains the well-being of the local people, and involves interpretation and education" (TIES, 2015). Education is meant to be inclusive of both staff and guests. Hosts Jim and Lee live and work on-site. Outside of scheduled workshops we allow guests maximum privacy, and are happy to make recommendations and give directions to area attractions to enjoy during your free time! The Neighborhood This is a quiet rural neighboorhood. Please respect the solitude of our neighbors. There is much to do to stay busy in this area from hiking and water sports to museums, art galleries, casinos, shopping, and nightlife. Area guides are available in each room. Getting Around We are close to the I-95 an I-395 corridors midway between Boston and New York City. Amtrack, car rental, or taxis are just a few minutes away in iether Mystic, CT or Westerly, RI. We are not on a public transit route. 5 1/2 miles from Main St, Mytsic (9 min) Restaurants, attractions, shopping 13 1/4 Miles to Watch Hill, RI (22Min) Ocean House, Beaches 7 miles (15 min) to Stonington Borough Shops and Restaurants 12 miles (15 min) to New London Ferries and shopping 6.5 miles (13 min) to Foxwoods Casino Other Things to Note Booking are available for faculty, guests, and participants of HHH Workshops, clinics, and special events. See website www.horses(URL HIDDEN) or call (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) for activities and events schedule. Fees from all bookings help support Horses Healing Humans, a 501(c)(3) Charitable organization offering Equine-Assisted Activities and Therapy programs to clients with Physical, Cognitive, and Emotional challenges. Some of these clients help with the care and maintenance of our airbnb rooms as part of our vocational skills program. + More
rules: House Rules Please maintain the peaceful rural nature of our property at all times. No Parties/ No Loud Noises! No Smoking please except in posted areas. (outside in the "Cowboy Kitchen") Please do not eat or drink in the bedrooms-the Library and Patio is available for your use. We are happy to provide you with glassware, corkscrew, etc. The barn is a private Therapeutic Program space - please respect the privacy of our clients when not participating in a worshop or clinic session. Do not wander the trails or the barn areas or visit with the horses without express permission or appointment. + More

Close driving to Connecticut College, Coast Guard, Mystic Seaport, Nautilus Submarine Museum and Mohegan Sun, but near the beach and very peaceful and quiet. Walking distance to O'Neill Theater Center and the gorgeous Waterford Beach. Guest Access Access to open style kitchen and cooking, back yard, living room, piano, wireless. description: Description The Space Comfortable Immaculate Accommodations Prices are for one bedroom ( two people max) and access to common areas; dining room & parlor, porches, gazebo. There is no kitchen access. Dining room has coffee maker, tea kettle, and small microwave. Parlor has baby grand piano. Over 100 movies available for guests' enjoyment. description: Description The Space Beautiful historical home in nice neighborhood in New London. Built in 1852, the house offers spacious common areas indoors and out. WIFI available throughout the home. Walking distance to downtown New London where you can hop a ferry to Block Island (Memorial Day to Labor Day), the North Shore of Long Island (Orient Point/Greenport with connections to Shelter Island and South Shore), and Fishers Island. Mid-way between Boston and New York, New London has Amtrak service, and Union Station is a 10 minute walk downtown. A 10 minute drive gets you to Ocean Beach Park. Mystic, its Seaport and Aquarium are a 15 minute drive across the Thames River bridge. The casinos are a short drive, too (about 20 minutes). Plenty of off-street parking available. There are restaurants and night spots of all shapes and sizes downtown (walkable), local bus service, and a spare bike or 2 as well. This room features a queen bed and an adjoining bath. Ours is a big lovely old house - lots of stairs, corners to get comfortable in, views to take the breath away. Come enjoy it, and the Whaling City, as much as we do. NOTE: We have several other rooms available. Full (hot) breakfast Saturday and Sunday; continental breakfast Monday-Friday. + More
rules: House Rules Smoking outside only, please. And since we (Grandmother, Grandfather, Mother/Daughter and Two Great and Charming Grandchildren, 6 and 8) live here, too, and have to slog off to work and school, no REALLY LOUD NOISE after 11 on weeknights, thanks. + More

about: This new addition of 1-2 BR brings modern living to the nearly century old stone-built house. Enjoy the peaceful stone garden view. Listen to the running water down the creek. Feel the flow of positive energy in motion. Enjoy the beauty of nature.
description: Description The Space Our addition to the stone-built house is at the ground level of the stone main house, which sits on top of a stone wall. It has a separate entrance at the rear deck. The first room is the bedroom with a full-size bed. The larger corner room at the end of the hallway can be used as a sitting room or a temporary second bedroom. The full/queen futon couch can be converted to temporary full/queen bed for a child, if needed The modern bath room has marble tiled shower and travertine tiled floor. 2 rooms have separate doors accessing the full bath. The kitchenette has a double sink with high-arc faucet. Prepare quick meals on the glass cooktops. There are 2 undercounter frig to keep your food fresh. The double French door delineates the new addition of your entire private space from the century old stone house. In addition to the private space, with prior arrangement, guest can access the living room and dinner area in the main house. Energy star A/C is installed in each room. A thermostat to adjust the heating temperature is located in the larger bedroom. Guest Access The entrance to the Addition is via the rear deck. Park your car facing the creek, walk through the arbor of the stone garden and up the rear deck. We have limited parking space. If you have more than 1 car, please advise in advance to procure a second parking space at the parking lot further up the road. Guests can access the indoor common area and outdoor ground provided they comply with our house rules. There is a patio table and chairs for guests to relax at the rear deck. Interaction with Guests After the guests check in and settle down at their private room, we might not be present all the time during their stay, though we can be reached via telephone or text messaging. We respect their privacy and they will not be bothered by us. It is up to the guest to interact at the level comfortable to them. The Neighborhood Our house is on a quiet private country road, the west side of Danbury, conveniently located near major corporations, 5 minutes easy access to I84, Rt 7, I684 and Danbury Fair Mall. Sample local seasonal and year-long attractions are Ivy Concert Park, Richter Golf Course, East Branch reservoir, Danbury Fair Mall carousel and more. 5 minutes to Tarrywile hiking trails, 0.5 hr to over 200 hiking trails in Westchester county. We are only a train ride or 1.5 hr drive to NYC. If you are here on an extended stay and want some excitement on weekends, take the train to New York City for a day trip and can still return to your studio in the evening. Getting Around Hart bus is the local public transportation in Danbury. MTA Metro North Railroad has 2 lines going to Grand Central, NYC. They are the Harlem Line and New Haven Line. Nearby airports Westchester County airport (HPN) White Plain, NY 32 miles 32 minutes Stewart airport (SWF) Newburgh, NY 40 miles, 51 minutes Bradley airport (BDL) , Windsor Locks, CT 77 miles, 1 hour 18 minutes LaGuardia airport (LGA), Flushing, NY 57 miles, 1 hour 3 minutes John Kennedy airport (JFK) Brooklyn, NY 65 miles, 1 hour 11 minutes New Haven airport (HVN) New Haven, CT 44 miles, 1 hour 7 minutes Other Things to Note Please advise in advance if your arrival or departure time has changed. Disclosure: The perimeter of our house and entrances are monitored by surveillance cameras. + More
rules: House Rules Indoor: Please refrain from smoking inside the house. If you wish to use the common area please agree and comply in advance with additional house rules. Please do not leave your personal belongings in the shared space outside your private bedroom. We ask that our guests keep the upstairs kitchen area and Living/dining room clean after each use, including countertop, stove, microwave and sink. Outside your private space, please be respectful of other's belongings, private space and private rooms. No drugs and no pets please. If you must travel with your pet, please inquire in advance and follow pet's rules. The decision to allow your pet is decided on a case to case basis. There will be a surcharge for each pet. Always lock the exterior door when you leave the house. We advocate conservation on energy and water. We respectfully ask that you comply and save the limited resource on this earth by conserving electricity and water. Turn off lights and A/C when you leave your room. Outdoor: If you use the outdoor grounds, please be careful crossing over the small bridge to the BBQ picnic area. There are many boulders along the creek. Sometimes the bridge, the boulders and the picnic area ground can be slippery, especially after a light rain. Please use the area at your own risk. Thank You! + More

about: Bedroom and bathroom are separated by roomy hallway that serves as a sitting area. There is a microwave and a mini fridge. Up 1 flight of stairs that makes it nice and private. There is a 2nd bed room available for additional charge.
description: Description The Space The bedroom has a a wonderfully comfortable bed with 400-count cotton sheets. It has it's own bathroom and a private hallway with a small table and chairs, a refrigerator, microwave, and coffeemaker. There's lovely view of the pool and backyard. Guest Access Guests will have access to the pool, deck, outside table and chairs and the tennis court with a basketball hoop. The kitchen in the main house is available for their use if they would like for their food preparation. There's also a gas grill on the deck they may use. There's a good supply of toys available for children to use if needed and a full-size crib is available for a small fee. Interaction with Guests We will interact with our guests as much or as little as our they like. The Neighborhood The street is quiet and wooded. Our home is near the end of a road with a cul de sac so there is almost no traffic. The gardens are full of birds and you may spot a deer, raccoon, a flock of wild turkeys, or fox. We are within 5 miles of 2 state parks with hiking and bike trails, and lakes for canoeing. Half an hour to the south, there are a number of Connecticut beaches available. There are a number of scenic roadways nearby for road biking. Getting Around We are 15 minutes from the train station that will take you into New York City. Other Things to Note We provide snacks ready for their arrival along with items for a light breakfast their first morning. We also have towels available for their use at the pool. + More
rules: House Rules We would like our guests to feel free to enjoy the property taking care not to disturb our neighbors as they would in their own homes. The property has over 2 acres, so it is relatively private. + More

about: Family friendly environment. Guests are treated like family. There's always fresh eggs and coffee in the morning. 3 bedrooms are available and all must be booked separately and will accommodate roughly 6 guests or the entire home to sleep 10.
description: Description The Space What people love: *Lots of room *large outdoor spaces *new kitchens and baths *great for jogging or walking, lots of sidewalks *unique historical property *family environment Things to note: *older home, can be drafty, lots of character *located about 3 miles off the exit, away from downtown in a rustic setting *suggest using a gps *no central air but there are window units in all except the captains room *shared bath The green room offers a queen size bed with hardwood floors and a shared bath. The room is about 12'X14'. There's plenty of room for a young child to stay on the floor or an extra mattress. Built in the early 1900's Sea Glass is historically unique with 9' ceilings and listed on the National Historic registry as a Colonial Revival, with baths and the kitchen redone in 2010. All living areas have been updated and completed, however we're always taking on more projects. Close to the Coast Guard Academy, Casinos, colleges and public transportation. Family friendly with 2 indoor cats and 1 small dog. The home has a unique history and was even a nursing home at one time. At one time, there was a wine cellar in the basement, beautiful gardens in the back, a large gazebo behind the house in the woods and functioning servant's quarters in the attic. The old owners were such garden enthusiasts that they used cold boxes outside with electricity running to them for early planting. All bedrooms are on the second floor. We share our home with our rescued pets. Our family consists of myself, husband, and five year old son. Guest Access Guests have access to the entire house Interaction with Guests We live onsite and are happy to offer advice. We are an active family but can always be reached via our cell The Neighborhood It is a beautiful neighborhood nestled in the heart of historic Quaker Hill. Many of our neighbors will wave to you while you stroll around on wide sidewalks taking in the beautiful turn-of-the-century homes. Close to new London, montville, Norwich, niantic, old Lyme and many more shoreline towns. Getting Around The Yellow Cab company as well as others is just a phone call away and it's about a $20 fare to Mohegan sun. We're about 4 miles away from the new London train station and also have a main bus line called the SEAT. Uber is offered in the area as well and is our choice Other Things to Note We live in a rural/rustic area. Down town and the casinos are a straight shot in either direction and about 6-12 minutes away. We're early risers and have a toddler that enforces it. He's well behaved but does make "child noises" :) Coffee, morning munchies and fresh eggs are provided. You are welcome to cook yourself breakfast-if we are around we're happy to pitch in! + More
rules: House Rules All smoking should be done outside. There is an ashtray on the front porch. We do allow pets on a case by case basis. Ask permission before bringing guests into our home that Are not registered. Tidy up after yourself such as: if you cook a meal clean and put away the dishes, wipe counter tops and other surfaces. Finally, please remove shoes upon entering and DO NOT roll your luggage. We're trying to preserve our 100 year old hardwood floors :) + More

about: Spacious and sunny 5th floor studio right in Downtown New Haven. 5 mins from Yale's campus and 3 mins from Chapel St. stores and restaurants. Hardwood floors and a wide view over the rooftops! Free on-street parking available.
description: Description The Space The studio is spacious and stocked with anything you might need: linens, towels, dishes. The kitchen comes fully equipped for cooking, and the bathroom features a lovely window that lets in natural sunlight right above the tub. Since I spend a lot of time up in Boston with my family, I try to keep the space clean and clutter-free for my guests. Guest Access -- Excellent WIFI -- Free on-street parking -- Free shuttle to Union Station only a short 5-block walk away -- Clean laundry room in the basement of the building Interaction with Guests I will meet you in person to give you the keys and answer any questions they might have about the space or New Haven. Then, I get out of your hair! The Neighborhood You will be conveniently located: - 5 mins walking time from the Yale Art Gallery and Center for British Art - 5 mins walking time from Cross-Campus at the heart of Yale - 3 mins away from Chapel St. and Broadway restaurants and stores Did I mention that the apartment building is just across the street's from one of New Haven's most famous eateries, Mamoun's? Getting Around Free shuttles run between union Union St. and the New Haven Common. From there, you're just a short walk away! + More

description: Description The Space Enjoy old-world luxury in a home that was built in 1910 to last for centuries. This architecturally designed home includes 4 fireplaces, an elegant entry hall and staircase, and many beautiful details. We are happy to walk guests through and give share the history of the house and its former occupants. Guest Access The guest room includes a sitting area, as well as a double bed. Guest are welcome to store food in the refrigerator, and relax in the parlor. Interaction with Guests We are happy to meet new people, hear about their lives, and share advice about what to do in New Haven. These conversations are typically over coffee in the morning or when guests arrive and settle in. But we also respect people's privacy if they wish to be left alone. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is beautiful, full of historic single-family houses with lovely gardens. We have a guide to the nearby homes available for interested guests. Getting Around Public transportation and the Yale Shuttle are within a couple blocks of our home. Yale and downtown New Haven about a mile away. + More

about: A private room and half bath in the garden level of a gorgeous Victorian brownstone condo. Quiet, comfortable space, walkable to everything downtown. Shared shower upstairs.
description: Description The Space This apartment is lovely. Soaring ceilings, historic detail and impeccable decorating make it a beautiful (and comfortable) space. The private bedroom and half bath is in the garden level (half basement) of the apartment. The main living quarters are upstairs on the first floor. The shared shower is upstairs. The bed is a Queen with a super comfortable tempurpedic-style mattress. The room has an armchair, wardrobe, and the other basic comforts of home. Our backyard is a small private park! There is a friendly dog on the premises, however she rarely if ever goes in the guest room. *The calendar is blocked off by default. Feel free to message with requests about certain dates. Guest Access Your room is adjacent to the den with comfy couch, desk, and TV. You are welcome to use it as well as our kitchen (within reason, if you'd like to cook just ask in advance). There is also a lovely porch you are welcome to sit on. Interaction with Guests As much or as little as necessary. The Neighborhood Close to everything downtown, on several major bus lines including the new CTFastrak, we are in a very convenient spot. Our small, historic neighborhood is a friendly community. We love being a part of it! Getting Around Easily walkable to bus/train station and the Bradley Flyer bus to/from the airport. 1-6 blocks from every major bus line including the new CT FasTrak. Several blocks from the MegaBus stop. + More

about: Private access to the entire 3rd floor in this historic W. Hartford home. Walking distance to Hartford's historic West End & across the street from the oldest municipal rose garden, Elizabeth Park. Close to WH center, St Joseph and UConn Law School.
description: Description The Space You will enjoy the privacy of the entire third floor including your own bath. The bedroom has two twin beds and there is an entirely separate sitting area with a flat screen TV. Mini fridge and microwave are available on the third floor. You may use the coffee maker in the kitchen. Interaction with Guests Dodger is the world's friendliest dog. May bark when you enter, but only looking for love. I am happy to offer sightseeing or restaurant suggestions but am presuming that you would like your privacy. The Neighborhood The home is right across the street from Elizabeth Park, the country's oldest municipal rose garden. In addition to the flower beds, there are free summer concerts, tennis courts, baseball fields, playscape and a restaurant- The Pond House ((URL HIDDEN) that features both fine dining and casual snacks. Getting Around The home is located less than 2 miles from Route 84, east or west. It is only a few additional miles to 91. There is a bus stop in front of the house that goes either into downtown Hartford or West Hartford. Additional lines are a block away. Other Things to Note The house is on the corner. It faces Fern Street, but the driveway is in the rear on Concord Street. There is no parking on Fern Street and no overnight parking on Concord street. Please park in the driveway, which is on Concord Street behind the house, on the left hand side. + More
rules: House Rules Overnight parking is not allowed on the street. Please park in the driveway on the left side. + More

about: Welcome to my comfortable 1898 Queen Anne Victorian in the West End of Hartford, a diverse and welcoming neighborhood of historic homes. Close to the Mark Twain House, many colleges, downtown and West Hartford Center.
description: Description The Space It's on the Historic Register, as most homes nearby. Cozy living room with gas fireplace, small but modernized kitchen, large front porch with rocking chairs, inviting and private back yard patio. Good place to walk - you will meet friendly neighbors if out strolling. Many very different type of Victorian houses to see. A variety of neighborhood restaurants 2 blocks away. Less than 1 mile from historic Elizabeth Park Bus line is one block away. Less than 2 miles from the train/bus station. 15 miles to Bradley Airport (BDL). The Bradley Flyer provides semi-express bus service from BDL for a one-way fare of $1.50 to Union Station in downtownHartford. What to see: Many nearby colleges The CT Science Center Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art (founded in 1842) The Mark Twain House & Museum Harriet Beecher Stowe Center Connecticut Convention Center Cedar Hill Cemetery Connecticut Historical Society Bushnell Park Mortensen Riverfront Plaza CT Convention Center The Bushnell Performing Arts Center Hartford Stage Company Real Art Ways XL Center XFINITY Theatre Guest Access Shared 1.5 baths, kitchen, dining & living rooms. Bedroom 1 has a full bed and a love seat. A 2nd bedroom (under a separate listing) has a pull-out sofa bed as well as a full-size couch. WiFi is available. Sorry; no TV! In season, nice front porch with rocking chairs and private back yard. Coffee & tea always available in the kitchen . . . help yourself Interaction with Guests I think I'm friendly and welcoming, yet aware that you are not coming to see me! The Neighborhood It's a friendly, diverse neighborhood, good for walking with interesting old architecture to see. 5 minute ride to downtown Hartford and West Hartford Center Getting Around Bus line is one block away. Guests have found Uber very convenient! + More

description: Description The Space Now that the kids are grown my husband and I have a ton of extra room going to waste, and we'd love some company! Centrally located in Connecticut in a safe suburb of Newington, we're proud to share our spacious home surrounded by an acre and a half of well-maintained property. The house is set back four hundred feet from the street with tons of parking, is clean and well-kept, has plenty of space and privacy as well as open gathering places, and is occupied by a very friendly family of three (two during the academic year when my son is at school in Ithaca, NY). Set alongside a cliff overlooking Piper Brook, spring, summer, and fall days are extremely pleasant amid the gardens and greenery, while in winter a hill for sledding tempts families to go outside. If you're just looking for a place to crash for the night, that's fine too! There are three available rooms, as well as additional couch space allowing for a maximum of nine guests. The largest of the three rooms has an very comfortable queen size bed, is at the farthest end of the house offering the most privacy, and has a porch overlooking the backyard. The blue room has a futon, and the green room has two twin beds. All three have access to the same full bathroom, and there is a half-bathroom downstairs. See "Beautiful Property, Friendly Home" 2 and 3 for the other available rooms. Amenities include wi-fi, washer and dryer, 30-foot above-ground pool (June-September), grand piano, hammock, multiple porches, chiminea, air hockey, foosball, and basic exercise equipment. Five minutes from CCSU, fifteen minutes from the University of St. Joseph, twenty minutes from the University of Hartford, and halfway between NYC and Boston. This listing is for the guest room with two twin beds. + More

about: Enjoy a private bed and bath on the second floor of a historic home in Hartford's West End. In walking distance to Elizabeth Park and UConn Law School. Also nearby the West Hartford Center and I-84.
description: Description The Space As you enter the house, it may appear as though you've stepped back in time. The original woodwork and damask walls look as good today as they did in 1901. However, you will still enjoy the comforts of a modern bedroom suite with cable television and wireless internet. Guest Access Guests will have access to the bedroom and bathroom suite on the second floor of the house, as well as the entrance parlor off the front staircase. Entry to the house will be through the front door. Interaction with Guests Although Rugby the Australian Shepherd may bark at you when you arrive, rest assured: he only wants to herd you, not hurt you. We will always be available to make your stay more comfortable. The Neighborhood Hartford's Historic West End offers a diverse community with beautifully-maintained homes. You can spend hours walking through the neighborhood or stopping by Elizabeth Park to smell the roses. We are also nearby the Mark Twain House and the Harriet Beecher Stowe Center, as well as The Connecticut Historical Society. Getting Around The home is located less than 2 miles from Route 84, east or west. It is only a few additional miles to 91. There is a bus stop in front of the house that goes either into downtown Hartford or West Hartford. Additional lines are two blocks away on Farmington Avenue. Other Things to Note Even though you will enter the house through the front, please park your car in the driveway on Fern Street. There is no overnight street parking. + More
rules: House Rules Because of our dog, we cannot accommodate other pets or children. We also require that you do not smoke on the premises. + More

about: Fully furnished room in a huge light airy apartment! The entire second floor of a house, it boasts off-street parking, free laundry, a private enclosed sun porch, oversized living space. One block from the Farmington Canal Trail - bike, jog, hike!
description: Description The Space Wireless internet with password, free laundry in the basement, off-street parking space. The Farmington Canal Heritage Greenway is one block away - a multi use trail for hiking, running, biking, etc. Full kitchen, microwave, Keurig machine, french press with Lavazza coffee, waffle maker, George Foreman tabletop grill, rice cooker, full sized juicer, rocket blender, and complete set of Calphalon cook and bakeware made available. The bedroom pictured has a queen sized platform bed, large desk, two nightstands, a four drawer dresser, and a large closet. If needed, a queen air mattress can be set up in the dining room as well to accommodate a third person. Every window has venetian blinds and gauzy white curtains for maximum control of privacy and sunlight. Getting Around Yale Shuttle (red line) and public CT Transit ("O" route) pick up directly across the street. Steps from Science Hill, three blocks from "The Whale," eight minute walk to SOM, fifteen minute walk to central Yale campus. Other Things to Note There is a cat and a friendly eight pound dog (maltese) that live in the apartment. Though the apartment is frequently and thoroughly cleaned, if you are highly allergic to animals, unfortunately this apartment may not be the right fit! The dog in particular can stay elsewhere if this is a problem. Feel free to ask if he will be present during your stay when you submit an inquiry! Please note that any bookings from 6/27/15 - 8/8/15 will have a maximum stay limit of one week. + More
rules: House Rules Please be respectful of the space, remove your shoes when inside the apartment, and clean up after yourself as much as possible. No smoking in the apartment or on the enclosed porch - back porch or outside only please. + More

about: Two private roomsone with a full sized bed and private half bathroom, another with a workspace, sofa bed, and direct access to a deck . A few minutes walk to the beautiful New Haven sound, and a few minutes drive to Yale. Wifi, and mini-fridge.
description: Description The Space Two private rooms in a charming house in New Haven's Historic City Point District, mere blocks from the sound, and a short drive to downtown. The backyard includes a tiny forest. It is magical. You'll see. Outside parties and events allowed for a small fee. Please let us know the number of guests, time frame of the party, and occasion, and we will send a quote. Well behaved dogs considered for a fee, thanks to our large outdoor space. Other animals are considered on a case by case basis. Guest Access Guests will have access to the following amenities: Shared kitchen, dining room, living room, laundry in unit. Flexible check-in/check-out. -Furniture as viewed in the photographs -A full kitchen -Private mini fridge -Convenient street parking and onsite parking for an additional fee -Central Air and Heat throughout the house -Deck access -Outdoor Barbecue Grill -Fire pit -Hammock -Washer/Dryer -Full bathroom -Private half bathroom Interaction with Guests You are welcome to email and text as much as needed. We are happy to help! If you see us in the kitchen, we'll say hello! We love meeting fellow airbnb-ers. (Really, we can chat as often or as little as you'd like. No pressure.) The Neighborhood Our neighborhood offers the best of New England: gorgeous, plentiful trees, Cape Cod style homes, and fresh sea food! We are right in the heart of New Haven's historic City Point District, blocks away from The Sound School, Pequonnock Yacht Club, Sage American Grill where you can go for fine dining, or Dockside Deli, when you're in the mood for more casual fare. Want flavors you're familiar with? Dunkin' Donuts, Dairy Queen, McDonalds, and Popeyes Chicken are conveniently walk-able in the other direction. If the time of year is right, you can watch the locals fishing on the pier. Getting Around Hop on a train from JFK, LGA, PVD, or BOS, or a shuttle from Bradley BDL and Tweed HVN. You can take a $10 taxi ride downtown in 6 minutes. There are also several bus stops and buses headed downtown throughout the day. + More
rules: House Rules In short: Be responsible. Be kind. Treat the house with care. Do not smoke. At the end of your stay, remove sheets from the bed, roughly fold them up, and leave them on the floor for us to wash. Otherwise, we look forward to finding it as clean as you found it. + More

about: This large 1 bedroom apartment in the heart of New Haven's historic Wooster Square neighborhood is a 10 minute walk from the center of Yale's campus. It's a quaint, tree-lined residential street blocks away from the famous Frank Pepe Pizzeria.
description: Description The Space This is a really nice 1 bedroom. It's large, the bed is very comfortable, and the kitchen was recently remodeled. It's on the second floor of the building, so you only have to walk up one flight of stairs. Interaction with Guests If I'm in New Haven when you arrive, I'll give you the keys and introduce you to the space. If I'm not in town, I'll give you the code to a lock box that has keys in it and refer you to the informational guide that I've put together for guests. The Neighborhood Wooster Square is quiet, but full of culture and history. Just around the corner is the famous Lucibello's Italian Pastry Shop. A few blocks away on Wooster St. is the neighborhood's main strip, home to New Haven's, and the world's, best-known pizza (specifically, "apizza") spots, including Frank Pepe Pizzeria Napoletana and Sally's Apizza. The square itself is very pleasant--great for getting some air or taking a long stroll. Getting Around You can walk to most anything in New Haven from this location. Ubers are also readily available and cheap. An Uber to or from the train station costs about $6. Other Things to Note On the weekends, there is free parking on site in the driveway next to the building. During the weekdays, there is plenty of street parking in front of the building. I have a visitor's parking pass you can use so you don't have to worry about any time limits. Washer (cold water only) and dryer are in the basement and are coin-operated. + More
rules: House Rules No loud parties No smoking inside No pets + More

about: Private 1 BR with private entrance, full bath, kitchenette, cozy sitting area and a huge bedroom with nice view. Can arrange 2nd bedroom for extra cost. Whether you are here on business or pleasure, our guest apartment is awaiting to welcome you
description: Description The Space Our guest apartment with a nice view has a queen bed, a futon couch/bed, a dresser, tables/chairs and cabinets. The queen can fit 2 people and the futon can accommodate additional 2 more if needed. The sitting room next to the foyer is cozy and can be used as extra space to eat or work. Up to 4 people will comfortably fit in the apartment. 2 people can also use the couch which opens to a full size bed. There is an adjacent spacious bedroom with a bed, dresser and a table which can be made available for additional cost if you prefer more privacy. The bath room is spacious with a shower tub overlooking the backyard. The kitchenette is equipped to prepare a simple meal or reheat take-outs. It has a freezer/refrigerator, glass cooktops, microwave and toaster oven. It is stocked with basic necessities such as glasses, cups, dinnerware, silverware, cooking utensils, pots, pans and condiments. Extra bedroom: If you need an extra bed/bedroom, an adjacent, separate bedroom can be made available for added privacy. The guest uses the same apartment entrance. The additional bedroom has full size bed, dresser and table. It will comfortably fit 2 people. A surcharge will be added if you need this extra bedroom. Please inquire on the availability. Guest Access Apartment entrance: The entrance to the apartment is via the garage door and a private staircase. Please close the garage door after each use. Thanks! Interaction with Guests Our home is our sanctuary where we find peace and quiet. We try our best to provide the type of experience each guest expects to have. We like our guests to think their room is their private quiet space, their sanctuary. It's up to our guest what level of interaction they wish. A handy booklet is provided to familiarize them on what's in the neighborhood, local stores, restaurants, dry cleaner, local business and sightseeing attractions. We are reachable via text message and phone calls. Therefore, after our guests check in and settle down, we respect their privacy and they would not be bothered by us. The Neighborhood Our house is on a quiet country road, the west side of Danbury, conveniently located near local major corporations, easy access to major highways, 5 minutes to Danbury Fair Mall, Tarrywile hiking trails, 0.5 hr to over 200 hiking trails in Westchster county. We are only a train ride or 1.5 hr drive to NYC. If you are here on an extended stay and want some excitement on weekends, take the train to New York City for a day trip and can still return to your apartment the same day. Plan your day and choose among multiple museums, Broadway shows and off Broadway shows, restaurants and more. Commuter parking is free at the nearby MTA train station on weekends. If you choose to drive to New York City, start your day early to find free street parking in Manhattan on Sunday. There are many local attractions if you like to stay around Danbury: Danbury Fair in the Autumn, Danbury Fair Mall with Carousal, Danbury Railway Museum, EastBranch Reservoir in the Autumn, Farrington Pond, Hammond Museum Japanese Garden, Harley Davidson, Richter Park and Golf Course ... and more Getting Around Hart bus is the local public transportation in Danbury. (URL HIDDEN) MTA Metro North Railroad has 2 lines going to Grand Central, NYC. They are the Harlem Line and New Haven Line. (URL HIDDEN) (URL HIDDEN) Nearby airports Westchester County airport (HPN) White Plain, NY 32 miles 32 minutes Stewart airport (SWF) Newburgh, NY 40 miles, 51 minutes Bradley airport (BDL) , Windsor Locks, CT 77 miles, 1 hour 18 minutes LaGuardia airport (LGA), Flushing, NY 57 miles, 1 hour 3 minutes John Kennedy airport (JFK) Brooklyn, NY 65 miles, 1 hour 11 minutes New Haven airport (HVN) New Haven, CT 44 miles, 1 hour 7 minutes Other Things to Note Please advise in advance if your arrival or departure time has changed. Disclosure: The perimeter of our house and entrances are monitored by surveillance cameras and inside our garages. + More
rules: House Rules Please be respectful of our property and refrain from smoking inside the house. No drugs and no pets please. If you must travel with your pet, please inquire in advance. description: Description The Space Beautiful historical home in nice neighborhood in New London. Built in 1852, the house offers spacious common areas indoors and out. WIFI available throughout the home. Walking distance to downtown New London where you can hop a ferry to Block Island (Memorial Day to Labor Day), the North Shore of Long Island (Orient Point/Greenport with connections to Shelter Island and South Shore), and Fishers Island. Mid-way between Boston and New York, New London has Amtrak service, and Union Station is a 10 minute walk downtown. A 10 minute drive gets you to Ocean Beach Park. Mystic, its Seaport and Aquarium are a 15 minute drive across the Thames River bridge. The casinos are a short drive, too. Plenty of off-street parking available. There are restaurants and night spots of all shapes and sizes downtown (walkable), local bus service, and a spare bike or 2 as well. This airy room has a two twin beds and a half bath, with a shower down the hall. It's on the street side of a fairly quiet street, with eastern exposures. Ours is a big lovely old house - lots of stairs, corners to get comfortable in, views to take the breath away. Come enjoy it, and the Whaling City, as much as we do. NOTE: We have 3 other rooms available, and can accommodate parties of up to 6. Full (hot) breakfast Saturday and Sunday; continental breakfast Monday-Friday + More
rules: House Rules Smoking outside only, please. And since we (Grandmother, Grandfather, Mother/Daughter and Two Great and Charming Grandchildren, 6 and 8) live here, too, and have to slog off to work and school, no REALLY LOUD NOISE after 11 on weeknights, thanks. + More

description: Description The Space Walkout basement apartment with plenty of windows and separate entrance. You have the entire apartment to yourself. Bradley Airport in CT is an hour drive. about: Family friendly environment. Guests are treated like family. There's always fresh eggs and coffee in the morning. 3 bedrooms are available and all must be booked separately and will accommodate roughly 6 guests or the entire home to sleep 10.
description: Description The Space What people love: *Lots of room *large outdoor spaces *new kitchens and baths *great for jogging or walking, lots of sidewalks *unique historical property *family environment Things to note: *older home, can be drafty, lots of character *located about 3 miles off the exit, away from downtown in a rural setting *suggest using a gps *no central air but there are window units in all except the captains room *shared bath Our orange room offers a full sized bed, hardwood floors and is about 12'X10'. It has an dresser and closet that you are welcome to use. Built in the early 1900's Sea Glass is historically unique with 9' ceilings and listed on the National Historic registry as a Colonial Revival, with baths and the kitchen redone in 2010. All living areas have been updated and completed, however we're always taking on more projects. Close to the Coast Guard Academy, Casinos, colleges and public transportation. Family friendly with 2 indoor cats and 1 small dog. The home has a unique history and was even a nursing home at one time. At one time, there was a wine cellar in the basement, beautiful gardens in the back, a large gazebo behind the house in the woods and functioning servant's quarters in the attic. The old owners were such garden enthusiasts that they used cold boxes outside with electricity running to them for early planting. It is a beautiful neighborhood nestled in the heart of historic Quaker Hill. Many of our neighbors will wave to you while you stroll around on wide sidewalks taking in the beautiful turn-of-the-century homes. All bedrooms are on the second floor. We share our home with our rescued pets. Our family consists of myself, husband, and five year old son. Guest Access Guests have full use of the house. Interaction with Guests Our family lives on site and are usually around and are happy to give local advice. Although we like to travel too :) The Neighborhood Historically unique home, with baths and kitchen added in 2010. Close to the Coast Guard Academy, Casinos, colleges and public transportation. Great for running and walking. Getting Around The Yellow Cab company as well as others is just a phone call away and it's about a $20 fare to Mohegan sun. We're about 4 miles away from the new London train station and also have a main bus line called the SEAT. Uber is also available in the area and our first choice. Other Things to Note We live in a rural/rustic area. Down town and the casinos are a straight shot in either direction and about 6-12 minutes away. We're early risers and have a toddler that enforces it. He's well behaved but does make "child noises" :) Coffee, morning munchies and fresh eggs are provided. You are welcome to cook yourself breakfast-if we are around we're happy to pitch in! + More
rules: House Rules All smoking should be done outside. There is an ashtray on the front porch. We do allow pets on a case by case basis. Ask permission before bringing guests into our home that Are not registered. Tidy up after yourself such as: if you cook a meal clean and put away the dishes, wipe counter tops and other surfaces. Finally, please remove shoes upon entering and DO NOT ROLL your luggage. We're trying to preserve our 100 year old hardwood floors :) + More

Getting Around There's Yale shuttle free and open to everyone that picks up a block away on orange. There's also bus service on that same street and state street too. description: Description The Space The suite comes fully furnished and decorated. Space and amenities for your exclusive use include: full bathroom, sitting/living area, microwave oven, small refrigerator, Keurig coffee maker, toaster, clothes washer / dryer, iron / ironing board, hair dryer, computer with DVD player, CATV with Apple TV (for private movie access), wireless Internet access and USB charging plugs (with international combinations). In addition to being an easy train ride from NYC, an across-the-street walk to Fairfield University and a 5 mile drive to GE Headquarters, this space comes with access to a working pottery studio on the grounds (for visiting, playing or serious work). In combination, these features make for a truly unique listing for 1 or 2 people (possibly with a young child; "Pack N Play" also available). Guest Access In addition to 330 square feet of private space including small appliances listed above, you'll enjoy shared access to a dining area, a large, well-furnished kitchen and the living room. Access to the pottery studio is by arrangement with the potter, but she loves to show off her space and welcomes people that want to explore, learn, play or even work seriously (for the latter, a studio fee may apply) at making things from clay! Interaction with Guests The space is private enough that if the guests want total privacy, they can have it and not feel cramped. On the other hand, we enjoy meeting people and want them to feel welcome in our home, so we'll interact as they wish. The Neighborhood While we are on a fairly main road in Fairfield, the space is nevertheless quiet and peaceful. We're only about 1.25 miles from downtown Fairfield with its restaurants and shops. Getting Around We include a parking spot in our driveway for guests, but will also provide transportation to/from the Fairfield train station which connects our town to New York City in the south and New Haven and Yale University in the north and still further, via the Shoreline East train system, to lovely Old Saybrook and New London, CT. + More

about: Steps away from Yale, our studio is designed with oak furniture and has strong air conditioning for the summer months. It is centrally located at the corner of Trumbull and Whitney and has a large private back yard with a garden.
description: Description The Space The space is located very close to the heart of campus -- essentially on campus -- and right next door to the best restaurant in town, Caseus Fromagerie. I've also worked hard to furnish the apartment with nice wood furniture, desk and book cases. Guest Access Guests have private access to the whole apartment which includes a private back yard with overhanging pine trees and dogwoods. There is a full bed as well as a full inflatable airbed should you need space for more than two people. There is $1 washer and $1 dryer in the building. The apartment has a small kitchen, a typewriter, oak table and writing desk, and books which you are welcome to read. The bathroom is white tile and looks out onto the back yard. The apartment has Wifi internet, heating, and air conditioning. Interaction with Guests I am usually away when the studio is rented, however guests have my best friend who lives in New Haven to call for whatever questions or issues they would like addressed. The Neighborhood The apartment is in the most lovely and safe part of New Haven the -- campus/downtown area of East Rock. Getting Around There are Yale and New Haven City bus stops just around the corner. But because this studio is very much centrally located chances are that you will probably be able to walk everywhere you want to go. + More

about: We have transformed the lower floor of our three story country home into a lovely "Villa". It has its own private entrance surrounded by the beauty of nature in all seasons. Two rooms and a full bath include living room, bedroom and eating area.
description: Description The Space The "Villa" is a lovely, newly renovated space with a private entrance. We offer a full sized bed for two as well as a futon mattress for additional guests. We are close to five picturesque New England towns offering a variety of restaurants and shops. We are 10 minutes from Mohawk Ski Mountain (a great family ski area), a beautiful mountain lake, endless hiking trails and we're only 2 _ hours from Manhattan! No extra charge for children. $25.00 for dogs. Guest Access The lower floor is yours! There is a private entrance. You can even ski or sled to your door! Guests are welcome to enjoy the property, walk through the woods, use the grill, fire pit and hammock. Interaction with Guests Yes, we will be home to welcome you and offer assistance and support during your stay. The Neighborhood Our neighborhood is a quiet, country setting with a handful of homes spaced widely apart. We are surrounded by a nature preserve on one side and woods and a marsh on the other. Getting Around We are 10 minutes to a town. There is no public transportation here. Wild turkeys, pheasants and deer are frequent visitors as well as an abundance of bird life. Other Things to Note We do have two cats and a small, non-allergic dog. The cats rarely go into the Villa. We also offer a dinner of homemade soup, salad and fresh bread for $15.00 per adult, $5.00 per child. Twenty-four hour notice please. YOGA classes are available by certified yoga instructor. Private, semi-private and family yoga. $100 per session. + More

about: The sunny garden suite, in our modern home, has a private entrance & bath, new daybed, that pulls-out to a king size for couples. There's a kitchenette, with snacks for morning, a closet, desk, & comfy reading chair. Close to Yale, with FREE parking
description: Description The Space This is your own space while you visit! A great garden apartment on a quiet, safe block in the East Rock neighborhood of New Haven. This is a small suite, that is great for parents, couples and single travelers visiting New Haven or Yale. We have had individuals stay with us for months, and couples stay for a few weeks at a time. With couples, it can start to feel a bit tight. What is great about this apartment is, you are just a few blocks walk to Yale's Divinity School and Science Hill, and thirty minutes walk to Old Campus and the New Haven Green. The suite, in our mid-century modern home, overlooking the front garden. It has its own private entrance, private bath, a comfortable day bed, that can pulls-out from a single bed too a king size for two. There is a full closet, small desk, and large dresser. The kitchenette has a small refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, hot plate, and coffee maker. The large windows let in great light, and have views of the lush front garden. There is free Wi-Fi available. We have two nice vintage English 3 speed woman's bike that guests can use to get around town during their stay. You can come-and-go as you please, with your own keys, without worry of disturbing us, your hosts. We are just upstairs if you have any questions, need directions or just want to say hi. There are neighborhood shops if you need to grab a coffee, bite to eat or to stock up your fridge with goodies. Just minutes away downtown, you will enjoy some of the best restaurants, shops and museums in Connecticut, and you'll be able to return to your private tranquil suite to relax. There is free, safe parking 24/7 just out front, public trans and the Yale shuttle are around the corner, although we tend to ride our bikes or walk to get around the neighborhood. We want to offer our guests a quiet, neighborhood experience in a beautiful garden setting. Guest Access FREE PARKING right out front! You have unrestricted access 24-7 to the apartment with your own entrance and key! Feel free to relax on the porch, swing on the rope swing and walk around the yard and neighborhood. Interaction with Guests We are usually around, but leave it up to our guests as to how much interaction they want. It is great to meet so many interesting travelers. The Neighborhood This is a convenient, beautiful old tree lined neighborhood, on the edge of Downtown New Haven. We are close enough to walk most everywhere in town, but still enjoy the quiet, park-side location, and its FREE PARKING! Getting Around We're on the Yale shuttle line and the public bus runs by every 10 minutes. Both buses will get you downtown in 10 minutes. We also have bicycles that guests can use, we walk or ride almost everywhere. Other Things to Note We love that we can walk our kids to school, walk to work, and to local markets, wine shops, and coffee shops. + More

Interaction with Guests I like to make sure that I'm available to meet guests when they 1st arrive to show the space & hand over the key so please let me know if your arrival plans are delayed. However, if kitchen use is desired, meat, fish, onions, and garlic are not allowed due to food preferences and allergies. A homemade organic breakfast, lunch, or dinner is available for an extra charge upon request. about: Two bedrooms in the 1752 house create a suite. (private entrance) One is a bright bedroom, with bathroom, & walk in closet the other is a sitting room with work space, TV, & light food prep area. My Windsor is Art, Jazz, History, and diversity.
description: Description The Space This house was built by hand 260 years ago. Native people lived nearby and USA did not exist. Every historic homecoming, someone waited here. The house is warm, sheltering and, being here, you feel part of something very special. Guest Access The suite is on the second floor with its own entrance through the front. It is a very private space. Interaction with Guests I enjoy telling about the house's history and showing the details. If a guest wants a tour I am there for them. If they want to be alone, the space is autonomous. The Neighborhood Windsor, Hartford area supports upscale eateries, and the small local purveyors of ethnic and regional cuisines are well worth finding. The cultural diversity here is striking. Jazz, latin music, Salza socials, A-list performers, Hartford Stage all flourish in an unpretentious environment. Getting Around 15 min from Bradley International Airport 10 min by car to downtown Hartford 1 mile from route 91 bus stop directly in front of house 3/4 mile to Windsor center and Amtrak station (to Springfield, Hartford, New Haven and NYC) Other Things to Note I have surge protectors in both rooms and new smoke detectors. I ask that you NOT run the microwave, toaster oven, electric fireplace or vacuum at the same time. It's just a pain to reset everything. + More

about: Welcome to the West End of Hartford, a diverse, welcoming neighborhood of historic homes. Close to Trinity, Divinity School, U of H, St. Joseph's, UConn's Law School, School of Social Work, Medical School, Mark Twain House and downtown.
description: Description The Space My home is on the Historic Register, as most homes nearby. Cozy living room with gas fireplace, small but modernized kitchen, large front porch with rocking chairs, inviting and private back yard patio. Good place to walk - you will meet friendly neighbors if out strolling. Many very different type of Victorian houses to see. A variety of neighborhood restaurants 2 blocks away. Less than 1 mile from historic Elizabeth Park and the Mark Twain House. What to see: Many nearby colleges The CT Science Center Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art (founded in 1842) The Mark Twain House & Museum Harriet Beecher Stowe Center Connecticut Convention Center Cedar Hill Cemetery Connecticut Historical Society Bushnell Park Mortensen Riverfront Plaza CT Convention Center The Bushnell Performing Arts Center Hartford Stage Company Real Art Ways XL Center XFINITY Theatre Guest Access Shared 1.5 baths, kitchen, dining & living rooms. This roomy bedroom has a sofa bed and full size couch. Shared bath; half bath on the 1st floor. WiFi is available. Sorry; no TV! In season, nice front porch with rocking chairs and private back yard. Coffee & tea always available . . . help yourself Interaction with Guests I think I'm friendly and welcoming, yet aware that you are not coming to see me! The Neighborhood It's a friendly, diverse neighborhood, good for walking with interesting old architecture to see. 5 minute ride to downtown Hartford and West Hartford Center. Getting Around 2 minutes off off Rte 84. Bus line is one block away. Less than 2 miles from the train/bus station. 15 miles to Bradley Airport (BDL). The Bradley Flyer provides semi-express bus service from BDL for a one-way fare of $1.50 to Union Station in downtown Hartford. Guests recommend Uber! Other Things to Note There is street parking right in front; also a small driveway on the side, if you prefer. + More
