about: Sunny & spacious 1-bedroom condo! Close to I-84 & RT-9, CCSU & UCONN Health Center. Large living room, flat screen TV, cable & wifi. Convenient to universities, parks, highways & shopping - plus free parking!
description: Description The Space Welcome to our home away from home! Our condo is located on the 3rd floor of a 40-unit building, accessible by stairs or elevator. The building was built in 1968, and is a no-frills, basic, clean building. The condo is very sunny and has a spacious living room with large windows to let in maximum light. There is a queen bed in the bedroom, a queen pull out sofa in the living room, and a queen air mattress. The condo comes complete with wifi internet, a 40-inch flat screen cable TV, kitchen, free parking and a common laundry area in the building. Guest Access Guests will have access to the whole condo. Interaction with Guests We won't be present at the listing but we follow up to make sure that guests are enjoying their stay, and we are always available by phone or email. The Neighborhood Our condo is centrally located in New Britain, CT on a quiet street across from AW Stanley Park and Stanley Golf Course. You'll have entertainment, fine dining, and shopping centers at your doorstep, as well as easy access to major highways - I-84, I-91, Rt 9. We are located only minutes from Target, Costco, Trader Joe's, Bed Bath & Beyond, Westfarms Mall and West Hartford Center, and only 10-15 minutes to downtown Hartford. The park across the street features a large outdoor pool, picnic tables, basketball courts, and a children's playground. Try a zip line canopy tour with Go Ape Treetop Adventures at the park or enjoy a day golfing at Stanley Golf Course, a beautiful 27 hole public course and driving range. Nearby Attractions: - AW Stanley Park (across the street) - Stanley Golf Course (across the street) - Westfarms Mall - West Hartford (1.5 miles) - West Hartford Center & Blue Back Square (5.5 miles) - Downtown Hartford (8 miles) - Central Connecticut State University (0.8 miles) - University of Connecticut Health Center (2 miles) - University of Hartford (8.5 miles) - New Britain Rock Cats (AA) Baseball Stadium - New Britain Museum of American Art - Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art - Mark Twain House - Hartford - Connecticut Science Center - West Hartford Getting Around Uber is available in this area. about: Comfortable home away from home. Perfect for travelers visiting central CT or professional work related extended stays. We offer a completely separate, fully furnished one bedroom unit. Owners on site. Very clean, safe location.
description: Description The Space We are new here to Airbnb. We have created this space for short term stays ie: job assignments, visiting family, snowbirds over the summer etc. This space is an individual apartment unit set-up just like a vacation club with everything you will need. Kitchen with granite counters. Full size stove and refrigerator. Microwave, coffee maker, toaster oven. All kitchen accessories. Towels and bed linens. Complimentary toiletries upon check in. Apartment unit is located on the second floor with private entrance. Front and back porches. Nice large yard overlooking scenic pond and park. Guests have use of picnic tables and grill. We live on on-site but respect our guests privacy. Please feel free to stop and chat with us or ask us about the area. The area is residential but borders the center of town which is within walking distance. Easy walk to town. Convenient shopping, banking and restaurants. Berlin Amtrak Station in center of town with rail service to Hartford, NY and Boston. This apartment is one of two on the second level. Guest Access You will have ample off-street parking. Unit is located on the second floor with front and back access. There is a large yard overlooking The Papergoods Pond. Adirondack chairs, picnic tables and grill available to guests. description: Description The Space THE HOUSE IS SPACIOUS, WITH OPEN AIRY FEEL.A LARGE OVERSIZED BEDROOM WITH CATHEDRAL CEILINGS, CEILING FAN AND PRIVATE FULL BATHROOM WILL EASILY ACCOMODATE 2..QUEEN BED. about: Stay in this gorgeous loft located on the historic Quinnipiac Park & River. Fresh linen, full kitchen, laundry, free parking on premises. Queen bed, futon, couch. Kid friendly.
description: Description The Space Exposed-brick loft-style duplex condo. No doors except for the bathroom. 1 queen sized real bed and 1 futon with a real (full) mattress (see pics). I've had two adults share the futon comfortably (see Hana's review), but I've also been told that it is only good for one adult. Fresh linen, full kitchen, washer/dryer, central heat & A/C, ceiling fan, relaxing courtyard, free parking, stunning views of park and river and life on it: boats, kayaks, jet skiis, fishing, etc. Guest Access Entire condo. Please respect the property and the neighbors in the condo community. Ask me about bicycle access. Interaction with Guests I try to welcome you personally as much as possible, but we may not get a chance to meet. Text/call me when you are about to get into New Haven and we can take it from there :) The Neighborhood Fair Haven has had a bad reputation for being "hood" & "sketchy" for my international friends, that means 'poor and not well maintained' :/ But it's a lovely place. Fair Haven as well as our building (a former beer factory) has a lot of history. I've lived here for 6+ years. It's urban and it is in a city, so it can be a scary experience for some, but you'll be fine. Just be alert like you would be in any city or some place new. Cool things to note: Condo is nested in a lively and beautiful river community: fishing, jet skiis, commercial boats and kayaking, canoes, seagulls, swans and even rare osprey. 2 boat marinas on Front St. 2 movable bridges: Grand Ave Bridge (swing bridge) and Ferry St Bridge (bascule) Walk 5 minutes on Front St to Grand Ave and there are tons of restaurants. Most are "Hispanic" Latin American-centric foods, food trucks, etc. 10 minutes walk NE (on Front Street) you get the marinas and the boat house cafe with views of historical homes of Fair Haven along the way. 1.5 miles to downtown, Yale University and Morris Cove beach. Cab & Uber ride to train station/downtown is $8-15 C-Town and Rite-Aid are 5 blocks away - use Ferry St, by Citgo Gas Station. This part of Ferry St is as mentioned above, rough looking. I walk by there all the time and other than the cat-calls, it's fine. Getting Around Walking/cycling: 30/10 minutes gets you to downtown (restaurants, cafes, theatre, movies) Driving: 5-10 minutes to everything and I-95, I-91. Super traffic on Chapel & Grand during rush hour. Other Things to Note HIDDEN DRIVEWAY ALERT! Expect to get a little confused at entrance - it's a tricky entrance and GPS sometimes confuses our building with one next door. PRINTABLE GUIDE: New Haven is known for housing Yale of course, but it's also known for being a foodie town with a TON of history and things to do. Things to do & Tips: (Also see pics) Short walk: walk/jog around the park, Grand Ave Bridge, Ferry Street Bridge. Front Street around the marinas/Anastasio's Boat House Cafe. Long walks: Quinnipiac Ave, Lenox St, Lexington Ave, East Pearl, Lewis Street, Chatam Square; Chapel St to Wooster Street (Little Italy), Wooster Square Park & downtown. Buses: D or G across from Chico's on Chapel Street will take you to downtown. $1.50  make sure you have the exact amount (bills & coins are fine) Grocery: C-Town (a few blocks away); Shop Rite (8 min drive East), Walmart, Stop & Shop (there are a few around, so best to go downtown since there is one near Edge of the Woods (Organic/Vegan, etc.), Elm City Coop (organic, expensive; downtown); Whole Foods & Trader Joe's are in another town, about 20 minutes outside New Haven. Shopping: IKEA, Target, Walmart, Rite Aid, CVS, Walgreens, Home Depot. Urban Outfitters, Westfield shopping mall (20 min out of New Haven) has H&M, GAP, Macy's, Forever 21, Uniqlo, Target. Parks: Quinnipiac Park & River, Wooster Square Park, East Rock, Sleeping Giant Park Coffee: Fuel, Koffee?, Blue State Coffee (York Street), 2 Starbucks downtown Downtown: Louis Lunch (first burger sandwich in the world); Frank Pepe's, Sally's Pizza and Modern Pizza are always top 10 in America. Kasbah Garden, Tikkaway, Istanbul, Pacifico, Miya's Sushi, Soul de Cuba, Barcelona, Cave a Vin; Mezcal, L'Orcio. Family: Modern Pizza, Rice Pot, Kitchen ZINC, Claire's Corner Copia, Miso's, Thali, Royal China (no MSG) Bars: Owl Shop (smokey), Ordinary, Rudy's, Cafe 9, Firehouse 12, Anna Liffey's (futbol watching) Colleges in town: Yale, Southern Connecticut State University (SCSU), Albertus Magnus, University of New Haven, Gateway Community and nearby Paier School of Art & Quinnipiac University. Traveling: Amtrak trains run from Boston to DC; Metro North trains run from New Haven to Grand Central, NYC ((website hidden)) Getting to/from airport: CT LIMO (It's not a limo, it's a shuttle) OR from JFK/LGA  take NYC Airporter shuttle ($18) to Grand Central and take Metro North to New Haven. TIP: You can take Amtrak train DIRECT into Newark Airport (EWR) from New Haven 1.5 hours train ride to New York City, 3 hours to Boston, 5 hrs to DC. Safe Travels! + More

The location is idealopposite the Art School, adjacent to the stylish Study Hotel. Best of all, it's right next to the Yale Campus. The apartment gets plenty of light, overlooks Yale's bell-towers, has hardwood floors, a full-size bed, comfy reading chair, snug kitchen, and custom closet for longer-term stays. The neighborhood is my favorite part of New Haven. Take the elevator down to JoJo's cafe for a morning coffee. On the same block you'll find boutique shops, plenty of restaurants, theaters, galleries and museums. What I love about this apartment is how quiet it is while being so centrally located. It's right next to shops and campus but when you get home you feel like you're in a sanctuary that's all yours. + More

about: Magical private apartment on our 11 acre organic vegetable farm. 10-15 minute drive to New Haven/Yale, and minutes from beaches, dockside restaurants, and beautiful hiking trails. Less than one mile from the Yale sailing club. We have a second private queen bedroom for additional guests-$60 extra.
description: Description The Space We offer a true New England country getaway, with the convenience of a 10-15 minute commute to New Haven, and a five minute drive to the adorable town center of Branford. Our farm is laid back, spacious, and beautiful. Our listed apartment is the perfect place for a vacation getaway, or for someone looking for a quiet place to work. Also, we are less than one mile from the Yale Corinthian Yacht Club, so this is an excellent place for sailors and their families. Guest Access You will have keys to both your entrance to the house, and to the apartment. You will pass through a shared hallway to get to your apartment, but will be able to lock it if you choose. Your private full bathroom is downstairs below the apartment. We have a second private bedroom downstairs (off the same shared hallway) that we airbnb as an addition to the apartment for larger parties of 4 or more, but also use to host our personal guests. Our guests would only enter the bedroom to sleep; they will not use your bathroom. We have ample safe, free parking. You will have use of our hammock, and massive yard. We share laundry which is located in the shared entrance hallway. Interaction with Guests Kit farms most days at home, and is usually around to answer questions, and show you around. We will not enter your space or disturb you unless you have questions! We are only a knock or text away :)!!! The Neighborhood Our farm is tucked away in a quiet, riverside, suburban neighborhood with easy access to all that the CT Shoreline has to offer. Getting Around We are walking distance to the public bus, and only a short cab or uber ride from the New Haven, though having a car will make your life more flexible, and is recommended. I am happy to explain a non-highway bike route to New Haven to bicycle enthusiasts. The trip takes 20-40 minutes depending on your level. Other Things to Note Fresh linens, nice fluffy pillows, and beach & bath towels are all provided. Breakfast is not included, though I leave coffee, tea, and sugar for your morning (or afternoon!) pick me up. I do not stock milk because it goes to waste if no one uses it. + More
rules: House Rules We welcome you to walk the farm, and pet our two adorable mini donkeys, we only ask that you do not go into their field, or into our gardens without permission. Dogs are allowed anywhere on the property, but like our guests, we ask that dogs not go into the vegetable gardens or the donkey field. There is plenty of other space for them! (Our tenant has a cat who does not come into our house or your apartment, but roams the property so only cat friendly dogs are allowed :). We have a second private bedroom downstairs with a queen bed, which can be rented for an additional $60 a night (that includes its cleaning fee). It is cozy, and comfortable with big windows looking out at the river, and AC/radiant floor heat, a dresser, and a non-cable TV with a dvd player. + More

about: Enjoy a spacious and homey master bedroom suite with private bath in our tastefully decorated colonial reproduction in Woodstock, CT. Enjoy access to the sitting room, TV room and kitchen, and deck. Wifi, ROKU are included!
description: Description The Space Experience the quiet corner by staying in a lovely colonial reproduction nested in the north-west corner of Woodstock. Close proximity to Sturbridge, MA, Putnam, CT, 84 and the pike, our home offers comfort and convenience in a beautiful neighborhood! Guest Access As a guest you will have a private master bedroom suite. The whole house is available in my other listings. Please enjoy the sitting room, TV room, kitchen & dining room at your leisure, but you may be joined by others. You also have access to the deck and yard. Interaction with Guests We may or may not be present in the house during your stay, but we will usually be a short drive away if you are in need of anything. The Neighborhood Center Road is located within a quiet residential neighborhood. We are about 10 minutes to the center of Woodstock, 15 minutes to Putnam, and 15 minutes to Southbridge and Dudley, MA. Also 15 minutes to route 84. Woodstock, Connecticut is considered part of the "Quiet Corner." It is known for its "tranquility, history and pastoral good looks," according to the guidebook 1,000 Places to See Before You Die. Woodstock is located in the northeastern corner of Connecticut. Area-wise, it is actually the second largest town in CT. Our population is still small (7,986 residents as of 2014) but growing. Our town is a rural, historic community with an agricultural background. Woodstock has more operating dairy farms than any other town in Connecticut. Support for open space conservation and the farming community is strong. The town also encourages light manufacturing and welcomes small businesses. There are many types of farms, craft shops, antique shops, and restaurants intermingled with light industry such as the manufacture of electrical switches, jet aircraft components, microporous plastics, fancy soaps and toiletries, fiberglass components, fine furniture and kitchen cabinets. A third of residents have college degrees, and a number of professionals run small businesses or telecommute from their homes. The scenery is spectacular, and the residents are friendly. In order to preserve the town's rural character and agricultural base, residents have adopted "The Right to Farm Ordinance" and created The Woodstock Land Preservation and Land Acquisition Fund." Getting Around We have parking available for our guests. There are no public transportation options nearby. Other Things to Note Though the rental is for a private room, there will not be any other guests staying during the time of your visit. Your bathroom is connected to your bedroom, so you will have complete privacy! If you have children staying with you, they will have their own full bathroom as well. There is a half bath on the first floor that is also available for your use, and shared with the owners or other guests. + More

rules: House Rules House rule is the GOLDEN RULE "The Golden Rule or ethic of reciprocity is a moral maxim or principle which may appear as either a positive or negative injunction: One should treat others as one would like others to treat oneself (positive or directive form)." ps this is a pet free smoke free home smoking is only allowed outside if you promise to put your butts in a can provided One would assume most people to be already familiar with basic etiquette but I will present a brief outline here in hopes to avoid awkward or confusing situations in advance. this is a NON SMOKING home You can smoke outside as long as you promise to throw your butts in a can provided thank you Schedules are majorly important if you are a night owl this would not be a good fit for us. although if you work 3rd shift thats fine Personal space must be 100% respected It is very important to pay attention to social cues and not to take advantage or cross boundaries. You can not come back after check out and hang around. You can not help yourself to anyone elses personal belongings or groceries unless they are offered or its part of the deal we agreed to for example if breakfast is included it will be on your own shelf in the fridge/freezer/cabinet The arrangement we make and agree upon together is meant to be kept in order to benefit both guest and host I really enjoy having house guests. as you can see Im more concerned about people than things things are made to be used and sometimes they break but if you break or damage something more than $20 value you must be willing to fix or replace it. It is my 100% goal for you to feel welcomed, to be comfortable and have a memorable experience. I will go out of my way to help make your stay as happy and cozy as much as my time permits. Im so thankful for this opportunity on Airbnb its been a very fulfilling opportunity for many lets all do our part to keep it that way thank you very much Sincerely Andrea + More

about: We have renovated our half-basement space to create this comfy suite. Plenty of sun with windows on three sides! Two large rooms plus a private bath, private entrance, and off-street parking. Quiet, safe and friendly neighborhood a mile from downtown
description: Description The Space First room is large and sunny, 16x20 with queen bed, desk, couch and TV, kitchen table and chairs, toaster oven, coffee maker, small refrigerator, and dishes. Recently converted half-basement with windows on three sides. Second room is 13x17 with futon couch, chairs, window seat, second TV plays dvds. Private bath with new tub/shower. Private entrance, off street parking, electric heat, two thermostats which you control. Guest Access Guests are welcome to enjoy the yard and garden with fishpond. Lovely small park next door and great walking neighborhood. Interaction with Guests We enjoy meeting people and sharing a glass of wine, a walk etc, but equally respect your desire for privacy. Weekdays we are a busy family on a school schedule (early risers). We are usually around and available, but your space is totally separate and private, downstairs. The Neighborhood This neighborhood is safe and quiet and friendly. There is a small park next door. Town center i just a mile and a half away, with Whole Foods, great restaurants, convenient highway access. 45 minutes to shoreline, 10 mins to Hartford, 25 mins to Middletown. Glastonbury is a classic New England town with a beautiful historic Main St. Working farms and hiking trails among the many charms. Getting Around This is a suburban area, generally car oriented. Walk to town in 20 minutes. Very bike friendly and we have a bike available for your use. Also bus runs on Main street (2 minute walk from house). Other Things to Note Just ask us if you need ANYTHING, because we have almost EVERYTHING, and we want your visit to be a real treat, and the first of many! It's a wonderful area, with lots to see and do, or just relax! + More

about: Downtown location, easy travel access for commuters and adventurers alike! Fresh paint throughout updates this 1920's multi---family New England home. Many books, toys and children's accessories makes this a perfect travel destination for families!
description: Description The Space Welcome to Le Petit Manoir! Where there's plenty of room to sleep, play and eat! There are books on the shelves, games in the drawer, and plenty of clean linens! You'll find fresh snacks, kids toys and supplies if you'd like. Located in the northwest corner of CT you'll be an hour to Danbury and Hartford, 2 hours to New York City and Boston, and right next to plenty of outdoor adventures! This apartment is close to the Warner Theater with world class shows and concerts and skiing is right around the corner. Visiting family and friends, looking for a place to crash while on business or trekking on the next adventure you'll find Le Petit Manoir and hosts warm, friendly and helpful! Hotel prices with much more! Le Petit Manoir is a two bedroom, 1 bath apartment with a large kitchen, dining and living room. Sleeps up to 6, includes laundry, a front porch and is close to restaurants, grocery, and rt 8 for travel convenience. Free internet, free parking, private entrance. Guest Access The First floor is a private full 2 bedroom apartment that is entirely available to the guests. Interaction with Guests Host is available for advice on local activities, apartment needs and for casual conversation. The Neighborhood A downtown location full of 1920's style multi family homes and close to downtown, shopping and the local highway. Getting Around Very close to Rt 8 which provides quick access around the state. 2 Parking spots are available for this property. + More
rules: House Rules House Rules for Le Petit Maison  Parking: If you are facing the house on the street, park in the small lot to the right. There are two spots available back to back against the stone wall. DO NOT Park on the street overnight (10pm-7am) between Nov 1 and April 1. You WILL get a parking fine from the city. No Smoking or Pets in the apartment. Please be sure to leave apartment clean after your stay. Quiet times are 10pm-7am. The kitchen floor is very slippery when wet. So wipe if you must, but leave the mopping to us! Please to not leave wet towels on radiators or door knobs. They are legit real metal and will rust. The kitchen door is an emergency exit. Please use for that purpose only. Please do not move appliances. Wifi connection is called lightswitch and the password is Deut6:4-5 There are lots of items in the unit including condiments and kitchen supplies, toys and extra linens, cleaning products books and more. Please use, but don't remove these items! Trash cans are located in the back of the house beside the garage. Do not remove batteries from smoke detectors. The fire extinguisher is under the kitchen sink. ______________________________________ + More

description: Description The Space 100 year old, well maintained antique two story home. Two separate bedrooms each with a twin bed. Two travelers can each have their own room or rent one room individually. Bath is on the first level. The rooms do NOT have their own private bathroom. There is one full bah in the home. The shower is clean and nice and hot. The wrap around porch is very pleasant to sit out and enjoy the day or evening. we are close to Hartford CT (15 min) and about 2 hours from NYC. We are 2 hours from Boston. Very popular scenic area for Antique shops, country fairs, tubing on the river , Kayaking, fishing, golfing, shopping of all kinds, pumpkin and farm stands, Historic district and sites... Unionville, CT is part of Farmington, CT which is an affluent community. It is a very clean and well groomed New England Town. It is NOT a city..a very pleasant place to be. The roads are newer..There are nice restaurants and we are one town over from the chain stores but our town has the small shops. I have lived here 30 years. It's a nice place to be with progressive well educated people. We have some farms here and a river. + More

description: Description The Space My sister Carol will be onsite to answer any questions and help in anyway. She knows the area very well. about: This spacious comfortable one bedroom apartment is located in the East Rock neighborhood of New Haven, a safe and quaint area with many local favorite cafes and restaurants.
description: Description The Space This is an old apartment (dating back to the 1880's), which means it's full of character: high ceilings, decorative fireplaces, beautiful moldings, large windows, and a cute old fashioned kitchen sink. -This is a private unit, so you will NOT be sharing it with anyone else. -All utilities are included (including high speed wireless internet & AC) -Basic furnishings: bed, couch, table, chairs etc. -Hardwood floors -Large bedroom -Spacious living room with decorative fireplace -Separate kitchen with small table -Bathroom with bathtub and shower -Street parking -First floor Guest Access Guests have full and exclusive access to entire apartment. Interaction with Guests I'm more than happy to answer any questions you might have throughout your stay. Since I won't be staying in the apartment, please text/call/email me if you need any help. The Neighborhood This apartment is in the WONDERFUL neighborhood of East Rock, within 1 block from restaurants & cafes. It's also a short walk to Yale and 1 block from a free Yale shuttle service. Easy access to everything in New Haven! Getting Around This apartment is located in the East Rock neighborhood of New Haven which is clean, quiet and safe. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to campus, but the free Yale Shuttle (Orange Line) also stops 1 block from the apartment if you don't like to walk. There are several markets, cafes, restaurants and laundry mats within 5 minutes walking. + More

description: Description The Space Rent my guest room! its small, clean, modern, and private. You'll have access to your own bathroom, plus our kitchen, gardens, and shared living space downstairs. The house is very energy efficient! It has solar electric and solar hot water panels on the roof to offset most energy needs. Additionally, its well insulated, and surrounded by flower and veggie garden beds in the spring and summer, and 6 hens who provide us with fresh, local eggs year-round. I strive live as sustainably as possible without sacrificing comfort or style. Inside, the house is full of art and other interesting details. Its a modern style house, built in 1997 by the Yale School of Architecture. The house has cork and bamboo floors, throughout, an open floor-plan, and a clean, yet funky aesthetic. The house is a 15 minute walk to downtown New Haven, with all the shops, restaurants, theaters, and bars. We're located in a residential neighborhood, close to parks and the hospitals, convenience stores, and we're on the bus line. Guest Access Guests will have access to all common areas - including the kitchen, living room, dining area, and shared bath vanity on the second floor. Guests will have private room and private shower/tub and toilet. Interaction with Guests We love hosting and have enjoyed getting to know so many wonderful, smart, funny, kind folks in the process. We welcome the opportunity to socialize, but also respect the privacy needs of our guests, and if you'd prefer to keep to yourself, you will find plenty of peace and quiet at our place. The Neighborhood West River is an urban neighborhood, adjacent to the heart of downtown New Haven, with all it has to offer. The Yale campus is 1-1.5 miles, and a15-25 minutes walk from our place. Our neighborhood features a central park (Monitor Square), a community garden, a mobile farmers market in the summer, and a variety of small convenience stores, including a package store, a local bar, a pizza place, and Chinese food. A ten minute walk down Chapel St. - our main shopping and dining street - brings you to the heart of downtown, with access to shops, theaters, and a wonderful variety of dining and bar options. The neighborhood is a mix of families and single adults. Getting Around We are right on the F bus line, which connects downtown with all other bus lines, the free transfer to Amtrak and Metro North Rail lines and the Yale shuttle. + More

about: This spacious private stone room is custom-built with w tray ceiling, dimmer recessed lights, stove/fireplace and stone walls, really. LR with fireplace, cathedral ceiling. Built in the 1930's. A perfect getaway home. It comfortably fits 2.
description: Description The Space Our spacious guest stone room is at the upper level of the main stone house, with private entrance from the rear deck. It is furnished with a queen size bed, a chest drawer dresser, desk and an antique armoire, cable TV, WIFI / internet. It has a wood stove inside the fireplace, recessed lights and tray ceiling. The 2nd bedroom is optional. The full bed can comfortably fit 2 additional guests. Fully equipped kitchen with granite counter top, glass cooktops, full size frig, built-in wine-rack, breakfast bar and more. A unique cozy bathroom with stained glass window is located next to the breakfast bar. As you enter the living room, you will find a stone fireplace with a food warmer one side and an inset to store fire logs below it. The majestic wood beams create an appealing cathedral ceiling in the living room. During the summer months, the stone bedroom is usually cool. During the winter months, a small heater is provided to supplement the cast-iron heater inside the stone room, if needed. As the stone is warmed up, it retains the heat for the rest of the night. Guest Access The entrance to the stone house is via the front and the rear deck. Park your car either near the door or in the lower parking lot facing the creek. We have limited parking space. If you have more than 1 car, please advise in advance . Guests can access the common ground provided they comply with our house rules. Interaction with Guests After the guests check in and settle down at their private room, we might not be present all the time during their stay, though we can be reached via telephone or text messaging. We respect their privacy and they will not be bothered by us. It is up to the guest to interact at the level comfortable to them. The Neighborhood Our house is on a quiet private country road, the west side of Danbury, conveniently located near major corporations, 5 minutes easy access to I84, Rt 7, I684 and Danbury Fair Mall. Sample local seasonal and yearlong attractions are Ivy Concert Park, Richter Golf Course, East Branch reservoir, Danbury Fair Mall carousel and more. 5 minutes to Tarrywile hiking trails, 0.5 hr to over 200 hiking trails in Westchester county. We are only a train ride or 1.5 hr drive to NYC. If you are here on an extended stay and want some excitement on weekends, take the train to New York City for a day trip and can still return to your studio in the evening. Getting Around Hart bus is the local public transportation in Danbury. MTA Metro North Railroad has 2 lines going to Grand Central, NYC. They are the Harlem Line and New Haven Line. Nearby airports Westchester County airport (HPN) White Plain, NY 32 miles 32 minutes Stewart airport (SWF) Newburgh, NY 40 miles, 51 minutes Bradley airport (BDL) , Windsor Locks, CT 77 miles, 1 hour 18 minutes LaGuardia airport (LGA), Flushing, NY 57 miles, 1 hour 3 minutes John Kennedy airport (JFK) Brooklyn, NY 65 miles, 1 hour 11 minutes New Haven airport (HVN) New Haven, CT 44 miles, 1 hour 7 minutes Other Things to Note Please advise in advance if your arrival or departure time has changed. Disclosure: The perimeter of our house and entrances are monitored by surveillance cameras. + More
rules: House Rules Indoor: Please refrain from smoking inside the house. If you wish to use the common area please agree and comply in advance with additional house rules. Please do not leave your personal belongings in the shared space outside your private bedroom. We ask that our guests keep the kitchen area and Living/dining room clean after each use, including countertop, stove, microwave and sink. Please do not remove items from this home. Some antiques and decors are especially furnished at this house. No drugs and no pets please. If you must travel with your pet, please inquire in advance and follow pet's rules. The decision to allow your pet is decided on a case to case basis. There will be a surcharge for each pet. Always lock the exterior door when you leave the house. We advocate conservation on energy and water. We respectfully ask that you comply and save the limited resource on this earth. Outdoor: If you use the outdoor grounds, please be careful crossing over the small bridge to the BBQ picnic area. There are many boulders along the creek. Sometimes the bridge, the boulders and the picnic area ground can be slippery, especially after a light rain. Please use the area at your own risk. Thank You! + More

about: Located on the quiet side of campus, three doors down from the admissions building, our home is extremely convenient to Wesleyan Univ. A lovely private room w/ queen bed, attached private bath, and its own entryway. Free, off-street parking.
description: Description The Space We offer a lovely room on the first floor, with a queen-sized memory foam bed, attached full bath and plenty of closet space. The suite has its own entryway. Off-street parking is available. There's a small refrigerator, coffee-maker with a selection of coffees & teas in the room, as well as an alarm clock with USB port for recharging your portable devices (free WiFi too). In addition, there's an iron, ironing table, hair dryer and suitcase rack for your convenience. On occasion, we have squeezed in a 3rd person (at a nominal fee; we supply the sleeping mat) to share the room. Homemade baked goods and fresh fruit are offered in your breakfast basket in the morning. Please let me know of any dietary restrictions and I will do my best to accommodate. Guest Access Guests who stay for a week or longer will have access to the kitchen and laundry facilities. Interaction with Guests This is our home, so we'll be around and happy to answer any questions you have, make restaurant recommendations, etc. We look forward to chatting with you. Our home is multi-lingual (English, French & Spanish). The Neighborhood We are located on a quaint one-way street. We are practically on the campus of Wesleyan University (the quiet side), so we are a very convenient option for those coming to town for WesU events. Downtown is a short 10-minute walk away. Getting Around There is free off-street parking available behind the house. Other Things to Note We have 3 cats (2 are mostly outdoors and 1 is strictly indoor), but none of them are allowed inside the private room & bath at any time. We also have a young child (preschooler) whose bedroom is on the 2nd floor. + More
rules: House Rules This is our home, so we kindly ask that you refrain from smoking in or near our home or using strong fragrances. Also, we ask for quiet hours between 10pm and 6am. Regrettably, we cannot accept pets. + More

about: Take a journey back in time in the comfortable guest room in our colonial-era Georgian farmhouse. Our country home includes period charms like wide wooden floorboards, an original beehive oven, and parson's cupboard used during colonial times.
description: Description The Space This is a place where you can relax in a spacious yard, surrounded by towering spruce and maple trees. Or maybe you prefer to sit and read a book beside a babbling brook filled with koi fish. Our guest room is downstairs, separated from the rest of the bedrooms in the house. There is a half bath that is primarily used by the guests right outside the bedroom door. The shower is located in another bathroom two rooms away on the same floor. The queen-size bed is made up with crisp white linens and our guests tell us it is very comfortable. The room also includes a clock radio with a jack to plug in an iPhone. During the summer, a fan or window air conditioning unit is available to keep the room comfortably cool. In the event that you would like to house more guests, that can be arranged upon request. The guest room attaches via a small hallway to a formal living room. Our guests often like to use this as their own private sitting area, as our family rarely uses it. Each season here has its own appeal. During the summer we love to grab an ice cream at Durham DariServe or drive 25 minutes down to Hammonassett State Beach. Fall means amazing maples dropping their jewel-colored leaves or taking in a Yale football game down in New Haven. In winter we can ice skate on frozen ponds in Durham or nearby Middlefield and then warm up with hot chocolate and nutella crepes at our favorite local coffee shop, Perk on Main. The comes spring and everything returns to life. Our yard looks like a Monet painting, with pastel leaves pushing their way out of the wooden branches. Please feel free to contact us with questions. We look forward to hosting you soon! Guest Access Guests enjoy free wifi and the run of our 1 1/3 acre property. Interaction with Guests We are delighted to incorporate guests into our family life or give them their space. This is a very family-friendly property (we have three children of our own!), but we have also been happy to host couples looking to enjoy time away. You are welcome to join in our routines -- enjoying a shared television with cable or cooking in our modern kitchen. If you prefer, we're also happy to give you your space. It's up to you! The Neighborhood We love the rural character of our area. The location is terrific -- just 30 minutes from both New Haven and Hartford, convenient to Wesleyan University and minutes from Highway 91. Durham itself is a charming town with other colonial houses clustered around a classic town green, just a five minutes drive from our house. If you want to venture beyond our property, you can hike on 60 acres of town-owned open space across the street. When you are done, perhaps you would like to sip creamy milk fresh from the jersey cows who make their home at the farm on that land. Getting Around Pick-up and drop-off is available at the New Haven train station for a small additional fee, making a visit to our home easy for those in New York or Boston looking for a break from city life. Even without a car you can enjoy our lovely rural setting. Some guests have borrowed bikes from us and taken a ride to nearby Wadsworth Falls State Park for a hike to a lovely waterfall. Our house is a two mile walk from downtown Durham where you can get lunch or browse in a few small shops. Other Things to Note We share our home with Luther, a lazy Basset hound. + More
rules: House Rules We are flexible about most things. Just a couple of absolute dealbreakers. We ask that you not smoke in or near the house. We also ask that you observe quiet hours between 10 pm and 7 am. We expect our children to do the same! A note about the kids: our children are generally well-behaved, but they are children and they make normal kid noises. We ask that they are quiet upon waking, so their play should not disrupt your sleep. + More

description: Description The Space * Beautiful clean and comfortable suite with access to a lovely large kitchen and waterfall that can be enjoyed. * Access to computer and office equipment. * High Speed Internet and WiFi in your room * The closed in sun porch has no air conditioning or heating. Spacious bedroom on first floor with comfortable double bed. Bathroom shared during swimming pool season - late May thru September. Airbnb guests have access to pool. Parking beside house. Guest Access Use of swimming pool. Large yard with table and chairs, double-wide hammock. Morning coffee, tea. about: This is a bright, colorful double bedroom ideal for visitors to New York or Southern New England. 3rd floor location provides privacy. Bathroom may be shared with another guest. We do not accept smokers.
description: Description The Space This is a bright and sunny bedroom suite with separate bathroom on the 3rd floor of my large family home in Old Greenwich, Connecticut. The room has double bed with television set/cable/dvd player and a sitting area. The bathroom has a tub and shower and a washer/dryer. If the adjoining room is rented, you may find yourself sharing the bathroom. I strive to confine this circumstance to guests of the same gender but it is not always possible. Use of the washer/dryer is confined to guests staying 3 or more days. On the second floor there is a small table where guests can look out over the front garden, eat, read or have their morning coffee and tea which are provided. A small fridge is located here for your use. Meals are not included. There is street parking but a car is not essential. Guest Access You are welcome to eat at our kitchen table or on our back deck in good weather. Interaction with Guests I work from home so during the day I am available to answer quick questions but cannot take time from my work day for socializing, unfortunately. Of course I always like to get to know our visitors on arrival. The Neighborhood This is a suburban area with village charm. Downtown Old Greenwich is one block away with shops, cafes, restaurants, pubs, a post office and a supermarket. There are several beautiful parks and areas to hike. A bike is available for riding to the beach 1 mile from the house. Depending on the season and the time of day, entering the beach may require a $5 guest pass obtainable from the community center nearby. Everyone is friendly. Everything is nearby. We love our community and you will too. Getting Around This is a wonderful place to stay while visiting the New York metropolitan area or southern New England. The train station is a 7 minute walk from our home. It provides service to New York city and all the suburban stops through Westchester County. Taking the train north will get you to Stamford, Bridgeport and New Haven and all the stops in between. Amtrak service is from Stamford, one stop away by Metro North. In addition everything you need for your stay can be obtained at one of the shops in our village which are 2 blocks away. + More
rules: House Rules The owners are highly sensitive to the smell of smoke therefore we regret that we cannot offer our home to smokers. We do not allow pets. Please do not ask. There are an abundance of tables in our home, please do not eat on upholstered furniture or on the bed. Guests should recognize they are staying in a family home. + More

about: Queen bedroom w/ personal A/C and heat. Quiet, private room in house on horse farm. Private room. Enjoy use of kitchen, patio, and fireplace. You'll feel like a princess high in a tower with 3rd floor window views... minus an actual dragon;)
description: Description The Space Quiet country lane, privacy, peace and quiet abound. Walking trails right next door and the lane is also lovely for walking. Guest Access Kitchen (fridge, freezer, stove, oven, toaster oven, no microwave in main house), Wifi, bathroom (includes general toiletries), towels, patio, outdoor fire pit, indoor fire place (limited availability), yard. Horseback riding lessons and horsemanship lessons available for all ages at additional rates, by appointment only. Please inquire in advance if interested. Interaction with Guests I am there if you have questions, but will leave you alone if you prefer privacy. Also, I work in NYC through the week so wouldn't be there during the day. My daughter's nanny, Mariah, lives on site with us and is usually around the property during the day, she'll be helpful and present if you need or quiet and out-of-your hair if you'd prefer. The Neighborhood Private lane, no traffic and quiet. Lovely walking trails right outside. Getting Around There is no public transportation. You need a car or taxi to get around/into town/the train station from this property. Other Things to Note For an additional fee, if organized in advance I can provide breakfast, picnic lunch, dinner, beach chairs, and daily beach passes for guests. There are three beaches in Greenwich. Horseback riding lessons/pony rides are also available for an additional fee. Please inquire if interested. Sorry no pets accepted. + More

about: Our "boys room" has grown up. Now we offer a Queen size bed.2nd floor location. Ideal for visits to New York, Westchester and Fairfield. We cannot accommodate smokers.
description: Description The Space With my boys off at college, I have spruced up their bedroom to make it comfortable for travelers but the toys and games are still there for guests to enjoy. You will share the space in the closet with some of their things. This sunny and cheerful bedroom has grown up. Now we offer a Queen size bed, easy chair dresser and desk. There is cable television and wifi is reliable and fast. The room is on the second floor. On occasion, you may share the newly renovated hall bathroom with another guest. There is a tub and shower and pedestal sink. The window in the shower fills the room with daylight. Down the hall there is a small table where people can eat, read or have their morning coffee or tea which is self service and look out over the front garden. Meals are not included. You are welcome to prepare simple meals in our kitchen. Prompt clean up afterward is expected. There is street parking but a car is not essential. Guest Access You are welcome to eat at our kitchen table or on our back deck in good weather. A 2nd floor table and fridge is also available. Laundry is for the use of guests staying a week or longer. Interaction with Guests I work from home so during the day I am available to answer quick questions but cannot take time from my work day for socializing, unfortunately. Of course I always like to get to know our visitors on arrival. The Neighborhood This is a suburban area with village charm. Downtown Old Greenwich is one block away with shops, cafes, restaurants, pubs, a post office and a supermarket. There are several beautiful parks and areas to hike. A bike is available for riding to the beach 1 mile from the house. Depending on the season and the time of day, entering the beach may require a $6 guest pass obtainable from the community center nearby. Everyone is friendly. Everything is close. We love our community and you will too. Getting Around This is a wonderful place to stay while visiting the New York metropolitan area or southern New England. The train station is a 7 minute walk from our home. It provides service to New York city and all the suburban stops through Westchester County. Taking the train north will get you to Stamford, Bridgeport and New Haven and all the stops in between. Amtrak service is from Stamford, one stop away by Metro North. In addition everything you need for your stay can be obtained at one of the shops in our village which are 2 blocks away. + More
rules: House Rules The owners are highly sensitive to the smell of smoke therefore we regret that we cannot offer our home to smokers. We do not allow pets. Please do not ask. There is an abundance of tables in our home, please do not eat on upholstered furniture or on the bed. Guests should recognize they are staying in a family home. + More

about: This is a double room; a double bed, a double dose of windows so lots of sun and light on the second floor of our suburban New York home. Full dresser, full closet. Hall bathroom may be shared with another guest. We cannot accept smokers.
description: Description The Space Our home is large and comfortable and our guests have told us they enjoy staying here. This double red room is on the second floor facing our quiet street with western and southern exposure from the two windows. It has a double bed, two small tables, a chair and a dresser and a television with basic cable. Wifi is robust throughout the house. The newly renovated bathroom across the hall has a tub/shower, pedestal sink and a window so it is very cheery. You may be sharing it if another guest is staying on the floor. Down the hall there is a small table where two people can eat, read or have their morning coffee and look out over the front garden. Morning coffee and tea are available but meals are not included. You are welcome to prepare simple meals in our kitchen. A small refrigerator is available for your use. It is a very short walk from the house to the train to New York City, Greenwich and Stamford. There is street parking but a car is not essential. Guest Access You are welcome to eat at our kitchen table or on our back deck in good weather. The family room television is available for the shared use of guests. Laundry facilities are only available for guest staying a week or longer. Interaction with Guests I work from home so during the day I am available to answer quick questions but cannot take time from my work day for socializing, unfortunately. Of course I always like to get to know our visitors on arrival. The Neighborhood This is a suburban area with village charm. Downtown Old Greenwich is one block away with charming shops, cafes, restaurants, pubs, a post office and a supermarket. There are several beautiful parks and areas to hike. A bike is available for riding to the beach 1 mile from the house. Depending on the season and the time of day, entering the beach may require a $5 guest pass obtainable from the community center nearby. Everyone is friendly. Everything is nearby. We love our community and you will too. Getting Around This is a wonderful place to stay while visiting the New York metropolitan area or southern New England. The train station is a 7 minute walk from our home. It provides service to New York city and all the suburban stops through Westchester County. Taking the train north will get you to Stamford, Bridgeport and New Haven and all the stops in between. Amtrak service is from Stamford, one stop away by Metro North. In addition everything you need for your stay can be obtained at one of the shops in our village which are 2 blocks away. + More

about: Our cute, artsy apartment in downtown Fairfield is centrally located on a quiet suburban street, just a 5 minute walk to downtown shops/restaurants. Bike to the beach or walk to train to NYC. Enjoy free wifi, a 46" HDTV, & a fully equipped kitchen!
description: Description The Space Our cute, artsy apartment in downtown Fairfield is centrally located on a quiet suburban street, just a 5 minute walk to downtown shops/restaurants. Bike to the beach or walk to train to NYC. Enjoy free wifi, a 46" HDTV, & a fully equipped kitchen! One private bedroom fully furnished, with a full sized bed, closet space, a dresser, nightstand, and east facing bay window, in a sunny two-bedroom, second floor walk-up, non smoking apartment in downtown Fairfield, CT. A great location - Just minutes walk away is a great local gourmet grocery store called The Pantry (5 min walk), as well as Rite Aid (5 min walk). Additionally: local boutiques (7 min walk), and great restaurants (5-10 min walk), post office (8 min walk), FedEx Office/Kinkos (7 min walk), Starbucks (5 min walk), Las Vetas - a local coffee shop (7 min walk), and the Metro North Train Station (10 min walk). A 5 minute walk to downtown Fairfield, 10 minute walk to the Fairfield train station, (**NOTE: If you're coming by train it's the FAIRFIELD Station not "Fairfield Metro" Station**) and 30 minute walk (or about a 5 minute bike ride--we have a bike you can use) to Fairfield Penfield/Jennings beaches. Train ride into the city (Grand Central Station, NYC) is 1 hour 6 min, or New Haven is 25 minutes -- and the train to New Haven is walking distance to the Yale University campus. Other nearby schools include: Fairfield University, Sacred Heart University, Bridgeport University, all within a 15 minute drive. The common areas are shared with a young professional female. You'll have access to a 46" HDTV in our living room, use of your own bicycle, fully equipped shared kitchen and bathroom. The kitchen is equipped with an electric stove/oven, full size refrigerator with freezer that you're welcome to store food in, microwave, coffee maker etc. Brand new bathroom has a sliding glass door shower and clean towels are provided. Free wi-fi included, and paid laundry services (washer/dryer units) available in the basement. No pets and no smoking. Daily rate is listed here. Minimum stay is 3 nights. Long-term rental is also considered Guests have access to wifi, fully equipped kitchen, a bicycle to bike to the beach 1.5 miles away, and a shared 46" HDTV. Guests have access to wifi, fully equipped kitchen, a bicycle to bike to the beach 1.5 miles away, and a shared 46" HDTV. + More
rules: House Rules House Rules for This Rental: 1. Smoking is NOT allowed. 2. People other than those in the Guest party set forth above may not stay overnight in the property without prior owner approval. Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of Guest. 3. The owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. The Homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guest. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise. 4. Keep the property and all furnishings in good order 5. Only use appliances for their intended uses. 6. NO PETS permitted. 7. Parking: There is street parking available across the street. 8. Housekeeping: There is no daily housekeeping service. While linens and bath towels are included in the unit, daily maid service is not included in the rental rate. 9. Utilities such as electricity, heat, hot water, and internet service are included. Cable TV is also available. 10. As this is a shared apartment, it is expected that Guests are respectful of keeping common areas clean and orderly, respectful of housemate(s), and leave apartment in the same condition as arrival. 11. You're welcome to use our pantry/fridge to store food etc. Please be respectful of food already stored. Common cooking items such as olive oil, spices, etc are communal. + More

about: My home is a totally renovated, immaculate, beach house with all new kitchen and added 2nd full bath. Radiant heat in the winter and A/C in the summer..if you need it..but most don't because of the cool beach breeze.
description: Description The Space It is a ranch style, all on one floor, with 14 feet of closet in the master bedroom. 2 full baths and an outside shower aprs beach. There is a large backyard for children and a BBQ grill. Guest Access Outdoors, you have full access to front and backyards, the Association Beach, playground and McCook's park. Indoors, the entire house and basement for some small storage. Interaction with Guests I can be supportive with recommendations. I am offering a paid excursion to the New York Botanical Gardens while you are staying in my house. I will visit occasionally with a day's prior notice. The Neighborhood Walk 1 block to private beach on Long Island Sound; quaint New England seashore. The front porch rockers avail you to the neighbors passing by on their way to the beach or town. Summer lobster festival and craft shows on the green are an annual event. I am a member of the private Crescent Beach Association and Crescent Beach is one block from my house. All 4 town beaches are protected with lifeguards and family oriented.(walk to town park with playground) Niantic is a quaint New England village where people love to stroll day and evening. There is a movie theater, bike shop, seafood, and the best ice cream on the shoreline. It is minutes to Rocky Neck State park with a beach, hiking and campground. Getting Around More adventurous? By car it is 25 minutes to historic Mystic Seaport & Aquarium,30 minutes to Mohegan Sun Casino, 1.5 hours by train to New York City, or Boston. Train station to either city is 15 mins.away. Niantic holds dear the pace of lazy, summer days of ones childhood in a small town that cares about its boardwalks, beaches and parks. As you can see, a car is not a necessity in lovely Niantic. Other Things to Note Yard maintained professionally. + More
rules: House Rules I treat homes I stay in as if it were my own. I expect my guests to do the same. I might allow a small pet with a security fee. There is absolutely no smoking allowed. + More

about: Come relax in a spacious, comfortable, private room in the East Rock neighborhood of New Haven. It is a great area with some of the best coffee shops and restaurants yards away, and New Haven green is 1 mile away. Free wi-fi and ample parking.
description: Description The Space East Rock is a wonderful part of New Haven. Our home is located around the corner-as in yards away-from wonderful restaurants (mezcal, cave a vin, oak haven table and bar) and coffee shops (the coffee pedaler). Modern Apizza is 0.4 miles away, and the New Haven green is a mile away. In addition, you are .25 miles from orange st. which also has many cafes, and 0.5 miles from the base of East Rock park. We love this space because of its location, but also because everything has been completely redone as of 10/1/2014. In addition, we have a lovely back yard, and a beautiful park 2 houses down. The atmosphere on the street is very safe and community minded. Guest Access You will share the kitchen, bathroom, and living room with my boyfriend and I-we have a bedroom in the back of the house. You are welcome to use our coffee grinder, stove, oven, fridge-and you're more then welcome to prepare and store food. There is also a hair dryer here which you are welcome to. Towels and bath products will be provided. My boyfriend is a chef so if you're here on a night he's not working, you will most likley reep the benefits of a home cooked meal. You are also welcome to use the TV which has HBOGO, netflix, and hulu access. In addition, weather permitting, we have a lovely back yard which you can use for sunbathing, relaxing, or snowball fights if you so desire! Interaction with Guests We may or may not be here when you book your stay. However, if you would like any guidance or companionship during your stay, we would be happy to provide. We are both busy at work (I work during the day, my boyfriend works at night), but always enjoy good company! Getting Around Most everything you would want to get to in New Haven is walkable from our house. However, the yale shuttle stops on our doorstep, and there is ample parking on our street if you are coming by car. + More
rules: House Rules Pets on a case by case basis, and smoking is OK in the back yard, but not in the house. You may use anything in the kitchen you please, just please keep things tidy. + More

about: Large private bedroom in my home, perfect for business travelers. It is minutes from I-95, the Merritt Pkwy, Rt. 7 & Metro North trains, Wifi, TV, central air, private parking. Self-serve breakfast 7-9AM for all & kitchen access 6-8pm by approval.
description: Description The Space Your large, private bedroom is sunny and on a pleasant residential block, with private parking on the premises. Location is only minutes from the SONO Restaurant area, Metro North train stations, (only 50 min. to NYC!), Routes I-95, the Merritt Parkway and Route 7. It is ideal for business travelers on the go. Fully furnished with desk, chair, good lighting, and ample closet space for you in your room. Your sheets and towels will be freshly laundered on arrival. There is good sized closet space, a desk, and bureau space and good light for reading in the guest room. Guest Access In addition to their private room, guests have access to my living room/dining areas (includes TV) as well as fully furnished eat-in kitchen and washer/dryer. There is private parking on the premises, Central air, and Wifi throughout. Apartment is the full first floor of a two family house. Breakfast is self-serve and I provide eggs, corn flakes, teas, coffee, 2% Lactaid milk, toast and seasonal fruit. Guests may add their own extras. A partial shelf can be provided in the refrigerator on request. Kitchen access hours are 7-9am in the morning and 6-8pm at night only. Guests must be careful with my things and clean up after themselves in a timely manner. This includes washing their own dishes. Guests can dine at the kitchen table, but please not in bedroom, on the sofa or lounge chairs as I prefer to avoid unhappy drips on the carpets or upholstery. I like things neat and clean so reserve the right to withdraw kitchen privileges if house rules are not respected and observed. A washer dryer is available for guests to wash their sheets, towels and personal items. Interaction with Guests I will welcome you upon arrival and make sure you have everything you need. Please call or text 45 minutes prior to arrival. Preferred check-in time is 6pm and check-out time is 10am, but I am willing to do my best to accommodate the schedules of my guests. I am self employed with an office off-site but sometimes need to work from home so I prefer guests who are in town for professional or personal activities outside the home during the day. The Neighborhood Close to trendy SONO restaurant area. Walking distance to East Norwalk Metro North Station. Two convenience stores 3 blocks away. Quiet residential neighborhood. Getting Around We have UBER in Nowalk as well as several taxi services. Other Things to Note The Metro North train ride to NYC is 50 minutes and runs hourly. The East Norwalk Train Station is in walking distance. Scenic Calf Pasture Beach is a 5 minute drive and a wonderful place to unwind at the end of the work day. Breakfast is self-serve and I will provide eggs, corn flakes, seasonal fruit, tea, coffee, & 2% Lactaid milk. Extras? please bring on your own. First aid supplies available. I am always available to answer any of your questions. + More
rules: House Rules Kitchen privileges are extended only to those who are careful with my things and clean up after themselves. Meals must be eaten at the kitchen or dining table, not in guest room or living room. Night time cooking privileges are from 6-8pm only. Towel bars and hooks are provided in bathroom and guest room, please use them for drying your wet towels. Guests do their own laundry. Washer, dryer, and detergent is provided. + More

about: These 2 bedrooms are on a separate private level sharing a den, living room, bath and a separate walk out entrance. Close to Stamford with 37" flat screen LCD TV, Optimum HBO, Showtime, Starz, Encore On Demand, free Wifi and off street parking.
description: Description The Space Nice room in Greenwich, CT (close to Stamford) with 37" flat screen LCD TV, with Optimum HBO, Showtime, Starz, Encore On Demand, free wireless internet in a nice 5 bedroom home. Private level with den, living room and separate above ground walk out entrance. Peaceful atmosphere, there are no children in the house, just 2 adults. NOTE: There are 2 private rooms with newly acquired full size beds in our home on a separate level with separate living area, separate entrance. We are used to living with au pairs but the boys have grown and moved to NYC. We enjoy meeting new people. * Includes, cable TV (Optimum On Demand with HBO, Showtime, Encore, Starz) and wireless internet. 37-inch flat panel TV, wireless router to connect to internet. Use of kitchen, full use of patio with barbecue. Private bath. Laundry facilities. * 12-15 minute walk to Riverside Metro North Station, 10 minute walk to Starbucks at Riverside shopping center. Convenient to Exit #5 off I-95. Nice, safe residential neighborhood in Riverside section of Greenwich. Great area for walkers and joggers. Late arrivals ok. Guest Access Large refrigerator, microwave, Keurig coffee maker. Interaction with Guests Ask us about recommendations for local dining, transportation and things to do. The Neighborhood Residential neighborhood convenient to highway 95. Walk to Metro North Riverside Station. Getting Around Residential neighborhood convenient to highway 95. Walk to Metro North Riverside Station. Other Things to Note Off street parking on separate side driveway. + More

about: Private, spacious bedroom and bathroom with A/C in West Hartford home of a friendly couple and their gentleman dog. Walk to the restaurants, bars, and shops of West Hartford Center, Blueback Square, and Park Road. Short drive to everything else!
description: Description The Space Welcome to our home! The guestroom is spacious, warm, and has everything you need for a comforatable and productive stay in West Hartford. The bedroom features a full sized, temperpedic bed, desk/vanity, dressing mirror, and adequate closet space. We just got a brand new A/C unit to make your stay even more comfortable. For groups of 3-4 only ($20/person after 2 guests), the sunroom has a daybed and popup trundle, so they can either be setup as 2 twins or a king. These two spaces share the downstairs 3 piece bathroom with full sized tub/shower combo. Guest Access Guests will have access to all main floor shared living spaces including... -well appointed kitchen with all major appliances, espresso machine, Note: no microwave. -living room with cozy wood burning fireplace, TV, playstation 4. Note: no cable, only HD antenna local channels. -dining room -4 season sunroom with yoga space -large fenced backyard to play with our dog, Scootie! -washer/dryer in the basement Interaction with Guests Face to face interaction with guests will depend on the day. I am a field scientist and my fiancee, Brett, is in the medical field, so needless to say, our schedules are fairly variable. That being said, we will always be available to answer questions, give guidance about the area, and make sure your stay is supremely comfortable. The Neighborhood West Hartford, CT is a fantastic neighborhood to stay to enjoy all the New England has to offer. From our house you can walk to: -Park Road Business district: Hall's Market, Quaker Diner, 3 Sisters Antiques, J. Rene Coffee Roasters and Cafe, Park Tavern, Plan B burger bar, Thai, pho, wings, pizza -West Hartford Center (~1/2 mile): a picturesque few blocks of brick sidewalks with tons of restaurants, bars, boutiques, etc -Blueback square (~1/2 mile): REI, movie theatre, more restaurants, Crate and Barrel, Cheesecake Factory, Whole Foods, lots more! -Trout Brook walking/biking trail: paved trail that takes you to Blueback square. The greater Hartford Area boasts many attractions that include: -the Mark Twain house -the Harriet Beacher Stowe center -XL center -several local breweries Easy Day trips are limitless, but include: -CT coast (40-50 minutes): Many adorable New England costal towns such as Mystic and Old Saybrook. Beaches here are on Long Island Sound, so waves are minimal. -RI coast (50 minutes): Westerly and other famous New England beach towns are an easy day trip. These beaches are open to the ocean, so the water can be rough. -Boston (1.5 hr) -New York City (2 hr, no tolls!): parkway 15 runs strait into Manhattan, rarely has traffic, and there are no tolls! -Vermont: Reach the natural beauty of southern vermont in 1.5 hr and the Canadian boarder in 4 (not really a day trip). Getting Around -The closest airport is BDL (Hartford Bradley) and is about 20 minutes north towards Springfield, MA. There is no shuttle, or public transportation into Hartford that I know of. -Rental Cars are inexpensive from the airport and several locations around Hartford. There is an Enterprise ~1/2 mile from our house on Park Road. -City Buses: There is a bus stop at the end of our street and goes directly to downtown Hartford. Trip time is around 30 minutes. -Amtrak: Union Station in downtown Hartford is about an 8 minute drive. Several trains pass through on their way to New Haven (1 hr), New York (2 hr), Vermont (depends), etc. -Uber is now available in the Hartford area! Fares are low, $4-$20 just about anywhere in the Hartford area. + More
rules: House Rules -No smoking in the house. Smoking is OK in the back yard as long as respectful disposal of butts is practiced. -Feel free to play with our pup, Scootie. He is allowed in the backyard without his leash, but not the front as he will chase a squirrel into the next zip code. A few table scraps are OK as long as he earns it! He knows sit, laydown, wave, shake, play dead, stay, and backflip. -Please be respecful of inside noise. Sometimes Brett is on a night shift and will have to sleep during the day. We will let you know ahead of time if this is the case. + More

about: A large private apartmen for longer term stays. This bright flat is on a quiet tree lined street, with large kitchen, livingroom, bedroom, & STUDY! Just 10 min. walk to Yale & downtown. Great for visiting professionals, Grad's & small families.
description: Description The Space This is our best and largest apartment in this beautiful, 1902 Victorian town home. The original details, like slate mantels, crown molding and large window have been maintained, while adding a spacious kitchen and small but efficient bathroom to this second floor flat. The bright large and airy, 4 rooms are newly furnished and are designed to accomidate a couple or small family. The master bedroom has a SMALL BONUS ROOM that can be used for an office, study or childs room. There is also a very large walk-in closet and standard sized closet off the master bedroom. The living room has built-in bookcases and a slate mantel. The large eat-in-kitchen has a lot of storage space, full size appliances, microwave, coffee maker and toaster. It has large south facing windows that looks out over the garden. I am looking for visiting professionals, Graduate students and guests who need longer term accommodations, but do not need a full year lease, therefore I'm not accepting stays shorter then (14) days. Safe, free street parking Wooster Square park area Guest Access There is full laundry facilities and extra storage in the basement. A large back yard for relaxing, gardening, and cookouts, and plenty of FREE on street parking. Interaction with Guests I live ten minutes away and visit the apartments all the time. You have direct contact to me any times, I own and maintain the building personally. The Neighborhood This is a great quiet and safe location and we are only (6) BLOCKS to the New Haven Green (city center) and Yale University. You can shop the open-air farmers market for local farm-fresh food, in historic Wooster Square Park just (4) blocks away. WALK to Little Italy - the best pizza in town - and to downtown restaurants, clubs, shops galleries and YALE old campus in minutes. Enjoy the tree lined streets of this convenient hidden-away neighborhood that is "right downtown". Getting Around We are only a few blocks from the Amtrak Trains to NYC You can WALK!! We are very close to downtown, but in a quiet park setting. The YALE shuttle stops at the end of the street, and connects students to YALE old campus, YALE Medical, and Science Hill. + More
rules: House Rules This is a large Historic town-home that is converted into 3 separate apartment. The neighbors on the first and third floor have lived here for years, this is their home. Utilities, Heat, Electric, Cable TV and internet access are included in the monthly rental price. I reserve the right to charge additionally for these utilities IF the tenant over uses these amenities. These charges will be added to the rent, and or deducted from the security deposit. There are fresh clean linens, towels, cooking equipment, pots pans and dish ware for you to use. *You are responsible for maintaining the apartment during your stay and cleaning and leaving the place in the same neat and tidy order that it was in upon your arrival. *Please remove food and all personal belongings when you leave. *The garbage and recycling should be set out in the receptacle at the front of the building for Monday morning pick-up. + More

description: Description The Space Your space includes a large living room/bedroom space, a summer kitchen, a full bath (shower, no tub), two closets, and 3 windows. The washer and dryer are on your level. The living room upstairs has a working fireplace and you are welcome to use it. You will also have access to the large yard and off street parking. You control your own heat (but please be conservative--it is costly oil heat). There is wireless internet and "fully loaded" cable with record & watch anywhere DVR and a small TV. I can set you up with whatever kitchen needs you have (pots, plates, etc.) Everything is clean! Guest Access You have access to the rest of the property including the living room with working fireplace and the yard, laundry, and off street parking. I have housemates, cats and a dog. We are a quiet (no barking or noisy people) and an environmentally conscious household, conserving energy and water use as well as recycling. Interaction with Guests I am social and if around (I work too much!) willing to share a glass of wine or a meal. The Neighborhood The neighbors are quiet and friendly! Getting Around The bus stop is two blocks away and the bus takes you into downtown New Haven where business and Yale and medical center and cultural events and restaurants and shops abound! It is a 15 minute bus ride and they come every 20-30 minutes, depending on the time of day (none late at night but cabs are available). You can walk to get groceries, eat at local restaurants, some shopping, etc. Other Things to Note If you are allergic to animals you will not want to hang out in the living room upstairs. We are a to bed early and rising early household, so we have assigned parking for logistical reasons and no blasting music/parties. But I do host a dinner party once in a while and if you are here during one, join us! + More

about: Our newly built and comfortable home has the amazing feeling of a get away retreat.This room comfortably fits 2 and is in walking distance to Ski Sundown and hiking trails. Enjoy a private room, gourmet kitchen and the CAFE. We have 2 rooms available
description: Description The Space Our newly built and comfortable home has the amazing feel of a get away retreat. It comfortably fits two and is in walking distance to Ski Sundown and the CT. Blue Ridge Hiking Trails. Enjoy a private room, gourmet kitchen and the CAFE. Kayak, Hike, Bike, Tubing all here. Adventure Cycling Association- Atlantic Coast Section 2 we are 1 mile from RT 219 on Ratlum RD. We have another listing of this one not available. www.airbnb.com/rooms/(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Take a hike during the leaf changing season and enjoy the beautiful colors of nature. It is absolutely breath taking. (Sept to Oct). During the snow season enjoy skiing and snow boarding at Ski Sundown which is in walking distance from our home. After a fun filled day of skiing enjoy a cup of hot coco or coffee by our relaxing wood burning stove. Guest Access -Your accommodations are a spacious private bedroom with a queen size bed. Private door leading to a shared full bathroom. Bedroom window shows beautiful views of the forest. -Use of fully equipped gourmet kitchen, inviting great room with many french doors that lead to an oversize deck with chairs and a table to sit, relax and enjoy your morning coffee. -Second room available with a twin bed to accommodate additional guests, at an additional cost. Interaction with Guests We will be present in the home during your stay and will interact with you if you like or give you as much privacy as you wish. The Neighborhood Our neighborhood is quiet and I enjoy listening to the sounds of the morning birds and the river flowing behind our home. Peoples State Forest is located in the Pleasant Valley section of Barkhamsted. The forest was established in 1924 through the efforts of the Connecticut Forest and Park Association. The West Branch of the Farmington River, designated as a Wild and Scenic River by the National Park Service, is the center point of river-based recreational activities including trout fishing, canoeing, kayaking and tubing. Other attractions include the 200 year old white pine picnic groves in the Matthies Grove and Whittemore Recreation Areas, over 11 miles of hiking trails, the Barkhamsted Lighthouse and other cultural and historic sites. Near by trails you can enjoy. Indian tail, Tunix trail, Ratlum mountain, lake McDonough and people state forest. Hiking can be 2 miles or 4 miles. Pack a lunch and enjoy a full day out in nature. We can drop you off and pick you up at trail locations. Getting Around -Plenty of parking space on property. -30 minutes from Bradley International Airport. Other Things to Note We have 3 beautiful dogs: Preston, Primo and Sage. They do not have access to kitchen or bedroom areas. Occasionally they will bark so if you don't mind the sounds of them speaking then you will be okay here. + More
