about: Just renovated room for woman or couple only. Cozy country cottage, extensive gardens. Share kitchen, bath and living spaces with owner and cat. Near S. Kent and Kent School, Appalachian Trail, in scenic rural Litchfield County.
description: Description The Space People love my funny little house and I love it too. It's a 1946 lake cottage with lots of character, being lovingly renovated and with great views. The cheerful good-sized guest room has views in three directions - up the mountain into my gardens, out to the lake and through an old apple tree. It is uncluttered and colorful, with a good reading lamp, computer desk and empty bureau. The single bed has a roll-out lower trundle that can be raised higher (almost, but not quite to the level of the upper bed) or used at floor level. Beds can be positioned side-by-side or rolled apart. The bath is shared - it's a one bathroom house. New mattress covers, pads, sheets, blankets and quilt cover the beds, which guests report are quite comfortable. There is great cellphone service in this neighborhood - not always the case in this mountainous area. Guest Access Full access to the kitchen and guests are welcome to help themselves to tea and coffee. A former sunporch across the front of the house is now a sunny winterized living room with a big couch ( a dreamy napping place), an armoire full of records and CDs and a dining/work table looking out over the lake. A big woodstove takes the chill off in winter, and open windows keep it breezy all summer. You're welcome to make yourself at home there or in the adjacent dining room. A big artist-made picnic table, bench and chairs give lots of places to enjoy the outdoors. If you've been out on the Appalachian Trail and need to do some laundry, you're welcome to use my machines. Interaction with Guests I often work at home, so some days I'll be in my office all day, some days I'll be on the run, it just depends on my schedule. I do enjoy company, especially at meal times, and have had a great time with guests who like to pitch in and do improvisational cooking together. Or if you prefer to be on your own, I'm happy to get guests situated, give directions and suggestions, and send them on their way to explore this beautiful part of the world. On weekends I'm more available. I'm always happy to give the grand tour of gardens and answer questions. The Neighborhood This is the country and there is no public transportation. It is just plain beautiful here - woods and water, mountains reflected in the lake. It's not fancy or pretentious or overdeveloped, just nice. The historic Bull's Bridge, one of the few still-operating covered bridges in the state, is around the corner and is a sight to see when the waters are rushing by. Kent is full of permanently protected open space and it's a short drive to access to miles and miles of hiking trails from easy to challenging. It is dark and quiet here at night. Kent Falls and Lake Waramaug are nearby along with art galleries, antiquing opportunities and great restaurants. Getting Around There is no public transportation. I'm happy to pick up AT hikers in town or at Bull's Bridge if my schedule permits. The South Kent School is a very short walk - you can see the hockey rink lit up at night from my house. Other Things to Note I hope that you will be comfortable and have an enjoyable stay. Please let me know if there is anything you need or if you would like restaurant, hiking or other recommendations. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking, no drugs, no parties and please, no visiting pets or unannounced visitors. We're in the country and it is very safe here, but I still lock my doors, so please lock up doors and first floor windows when you go out, and during the heating season, turn down the heat. If you are new to Airbnb, the idea is that I'm not renting a room, but rather sharing my home. I live and work here, and enjoy meeting new people. It's like having old friends visit, not like a hotel. You are welcome to make yourself at home in the common living areas and to use the kitchen, but please leave everything as clean and put away as you have found it. As we will be sharing a bathroom, I appreciate your tidying up and keeping personal items in your room. If we are up at the same time in the morning I'll gladly make breakfast and clean up. Otherwise, I'll show you where everything is and you are welcome to fix your own, but please do clean up afterward. If you play music, please keep it at low volume. It's an early-to-bed, early-to-rise household; please be considerate about returning at late hours; I appreciate knowing ahead of time if a late arrival is expected. The cat is not allowed outdoors  she can be sneaky so please don't leave doors open and keep an eye out for her. + More

description: Description The Space Share space in my home in a quite charming residential community within Fairfield County, CT The room is approximately 250 sq. ft with 2 window that views the landscape around the house. There is a queen size bed,clean bedding with closet and draw space. A large marble desk to get some work done & a book shelf filled with interesting books to read. Including full size private bath with towels and a parking portal if you have a car. wireless internet access. . The area is lovely and quite. My home sits on 1 acre on a hill with many trees and landscape. The house is large and there is plenty room for privacy. My hobby is interior design and my home reflects an artistic view of the world . Less than 2 miles away is a pharmacy and shopping area with 2 casual restaurants and few shops. 7 miles to Sacred Heart University and Metro North train station if you wish to travel to NYC and other major cities. There is a bus line on the corner by my house which can take you to the local mall shopping area with many stores and eatery. Trumbull, CT approximately one hour and a half north of NYC by train. However, a car is recommended. Note: I have two dogs a Siberian Husky named Layla and a West Highland Terrier named Rio. They are lovable and friendly. We are two adults both with busy schedules but would love to welcome you into our home. Perfect for an academic or professional away from home. Guest Access Guest will have a private bathroom, car port, and access to store a small amount of food in the the kitchen. I will ask your needs regarding cooking, the kitchen is rather small and I request limited cooking. Interaction with Guests In general all my guest have been on some sort of work assignment and their schedules fit nicely with mine.On occasion, we may meet up in the evening and they are flexible and casual about their needs and comfortable to asking questions . The Neighborhood My neighbors are friendly and will always say good morning . We help each other out, during snow season. Getting Around Getting around is easy. I am centrally located to all major highways and less than 10 minutes away from the train. There is also a bus stop near my home to travel to the mall and a few eateries. Other Things to Note I will let travelers know in advance if there are other needs that will impact their stay. + More
rules: House Rules Primarily you have access to your room and bathroom. On limited occasion, we have watched a movie in the family room. Some access to the kitchen, I would need to know how often you want to cook and we can work out a schedule. House rule to keep you bathroom clean at all times because it may be used as a guest bathroom at times. If you need cleaning service extra cost will apply. As a general rule, the price is fixed + More

about: We have a newly remodeled home one street back from the beach. Beautiful backyard, garden, living room. New appliances. Very comfortable. We have 1 furnished room available - perfect for a student visiting Yale West Campus, or just vacationing!
description: Description The Space Currently we have our Master Bedroom available while we are out of town. We are across the street from the beach with nice furniture/appliances. Backyard perfect for entertaining friends as well. Fine dining within walking distance. Housemates on 2nd and 3rd floor. Professionals, 20's, busy. There are three awesome dogs on site. Weekends are busy for us but if we can, we'd be happy to show you around. Weekdays aren't an issue. Regarding check in/out times: those pertain to the actual room - so that we have time to change over the bedding etc - that said, you're welcome to arrive a little earlier or spend the afternoon of your departure at the beach etc and keep your stuff near the front door - just let us know ahead of time so we can properly accommodate; we're pretty flexible. Guest Access Bedroom and all common areas - Kitchen, Living Room, Dining Room, Patio/Backyard, Bathrooms Interaction with Guests Everyone's usually pretty busy, esp. weekends, but it would be easy to arrange a time to show some one around should they be interested! The Neighborhood Beautiful beach community. Popular vacation spot! The neighbors are incredibly neighborlee - we regularly swap food, visit. The beach is across the street. There are two nice restaurants right near by - a byob gourmet pizza/italian spot across the street as well as Anchor Gulf about a 5 minute walk. All well within walking distance. There's groceries, dunkin donuts, gas, ice cream, atm 10 minutes walk down the road as well. Getting Around Bus stops right in front of the house, goes all over the Fairfield County area - New Haven et al. That said - its still a rather relaxed residential area, w/ just a couple of random luxuries (restaurants/bus stops) shuffled in the mix! Other Things to Note If you are bringing a pet - that counts as an "extra guest" so please select the appropriate number. There are 3 rooms upstairs. They are rented to two younger professional guys who work most of the time. The house is often very quiet, but thats not to say there isn't occasionally activity at the house on weekend nights - if you have any concerns about that, let me know so we can see if that particular weekend would be a good fit! There are 3 chill dogs on site. + More
rules: House Rules the golden rule: treat others/things like you would want others to teat you/your things. also - if there is any issues, please give us the opportunity to address them! we strive for a great review! + More

description: Description The Space Explore our area after a delicious homemade breakfast and return home to relax with an evening glass of wine preceeding a good night's sleep. We provide a 1st floor, cozy, private room with queen size fold away couch made extra comfortable for your sleeping pleasure. We recently upgraded the mattress to a natural, pure latex over memory foam which is hypoallergenic. If both rooms are booked, there is a 1/2 bath upstairs for your use, shower needs to be shared. Our home is on four acres of land with beautiful organic vegetable and flower gardens. Guest Access Aside from your own sleeping area, please relax in our family room, play our baby grand piano in our living room, cook your meal in our kitchen and enjoy it at our dining room table, on the deck or on our patio surrounded by gardens. Interaction with Guests We will be available to provide assistance in ways that will make your stay more comfortable, enjoyable and memorable. The Neighborhood We are located within fast and easy access to major highways, our town center has a central green in old New England style. We are about 1/2 mile to a gorgeous reservoir that invites a relaxing stroll or vigorous walk or beautiful bike ride on a dirt road. Take a picnic lunch on one of many huge, boulders and enjoy nature at its fullest. Enjoy fishing with appropriate license. No swimming allowed. Authorized boats available to fishermen only, no rental fee. Must have own life jackets. Getting Around Easy access to I-84 and many interesting and enjoyable sites as mentioned above. No public transportation except for taxis or a bus about 2 1/2 miles from our home. Other Things to Note In close proximity to UCONN campus. Conveniently located, 20 minutes to Hartford's Mark Twain House, Atheneum Museum, and several stellar theatrical venues. Close to many area universities, Sturbridge Village, the Pequot Indian Museum and Mystic Seaport. Wifi available on site. + More

about: Not fancy but comfy private accommodation in my 1889 Victorian home.
description: Description The Space Welcome to my 1889 Queen Anne Victorian house which is still a work-in-progress but (I think) a great home nevertheless. I'm offering my 2nd floor parlour as a guest room, comfortably fitted out with a double bed, wardrobe, dresser, work desk, IKEA chaise, cube fridge + microwave and TV w/DVD player and ROKU box (sorry, no cable TV but on master antenna system for local channels). House offers shared bathroom, kitchen, sunspace/dining room, living room and TV room. Broadband WiFi (average 20-25 mbps) and off-street parking also available. Breakfast items usually on offer include coffee, tea, yoghurts, bananas, oranges, cereals + milk, toast + jams and OJ. House is close (walkable 10-15 mins) to train/bus station and downtown venues (15-20 mins) as well as the West End; West Hartford (4 miles west) is best reached by bus or car. Local bus service is available right outside the front door ((URL HIDDEN) Route #76). There's also local (hourly) bus service from the airport (Route #30X) to downtown ($1.50 exact change) with an easy transfer (free upon request) to my neighborhood bus. The household is gay-friendly and everyone is welcomed for a night or longer stay. See special pricing by the week and month. Guest Access Guests have access to the main (ground) floor of the house as they wish. For extended visits the sunroom makes a nice place to enjoy the day reading and relaxing and looking at the yard and gardens. For any extended stays, use of the basement laundry facilities can be arranged. Interaction with Guests I generally enjoy meeting and chatting with my guests which is why I like to serve breakfast in the sunroom. However, if you really prefer your privacy I can always set out breakfast items in the kitchen which can be taken to the guest room for your private consumption. Getting Around UBER operates in the Greater Hartford area. Local bus service (CT Transit, one-way fare = $1.50) information can be (EMAIL HIDDEN) A system-wide map is there, as well as detailed maps and all schedules for local routes for Hartford and out to the suburbs. My neighborhood service (Route #76) runs from 6AM - 11PM (various frequencies throughout the day). There's a downtown loop shuttle - the Dash shuttle - which is free and serves all the hotels, the Convention Center and the bus/train station. The bus/train station is serviced by AMTRAK, Peter Pan and Greyhound (but not Megabus which stops on Morgan Street). The Bradley Flyer (Route #30X) runs from the bus/train station to Bradley Airport on an hourly basis. My house is within a mile of the bus/train station so is an easy walk or, if my schedule permits, a convenient pick-up point to meet you and get you to the house. + More
rules: House Rules I share my house with 1-2 other resident housemates so any guests would be sharing common space with up to 3 others of us living in the house. However, the guest room is a private room. Quiet time is 10PM - 7AM. There's no smoking in the house but smokers are welcome to go outdoors on the front and back porches as necessary. No pets. I can accommodate 1 car parked in the backyard driveway. Breakfasts can be arranged ahead of time so I can have the basics available for your eating pleasure and fresh coffee ready when you are. + More

about: Take over the downstairs floor of our rad house. We're in a great, super safe neighborhood, just a few minutes from downtown/Yale. Off street parking, easy access to public transportation and an easy bike ride to most of the city. Two beds, a jacuzzi tub and a fireplace.
description: Description The Space You'll mostly have your own floor of the house (finished walk out basement) with a king size bed and a big futon so that you can very comfortably sleep up to 4 in two separate areas. There is some stuff we might need access to, but generally we don't have much need to be down there. We may or may not share a bathroom when it's convenient for you (I think that shower is so much nicer!), but otherwise we generally keep away from your floor. Don't wanna wear pants to the bathroom in the morning? This is the perfect spot. You also get French doors that open up into the backyard right next to the bed, a gas fireplace and a jacuzzi tub. We're in a great neighborhood that avoids the biggest issue in New Haven; crime. Being just across the harbor we're insulated from the bad neighborhoods that run up against all the nice spots closer to downtown. We have parking behind the house (that you can use if you like) but I prefer to park in the street and have never had an issue. We live around all the firefighters and new professors! We have easy access to public transportation and are close enough to downtown and Yale that I typically ride my bike over there when I'm headed to the area. If you have a car, it's about 5-10 mins to downtown/Yale and we have easy access to I95/91. There are three other roommates you'd maybe bump into at some point, but only one of them ever needs to come downstairs other than laundry. I've moved some furniture around since AirBnB took the photos that are up so the bed is now a king instead of a queen, and some of the shelving has changed. It is also important to note that a 55 lb pit bull lives here. He is the cutest, cuddliest dog you will ever meet but if you are allergic to dogs this may not be the best fit for you. He is not allowed downstairs when guests are here unless you specifically want him to be, but he is allowed in that space otherwise so we can not assure a dog hair free zone. Guest Access You'll have access to all of the common areas in the house including the kitchen, dining room, and deck. You'll have access to the washer/dryer as well. Interaction with Guests New friends are awesome so we're happy to hang out, go eat or whatever so long as we're not too busy. That said, if you'd rather just pretend we're not here and we mostly ignore each other, that's totally fine too. If you're here on a Tuesday night, we host Taco Tuesday every week at the house unless I am away for work. I cook for about 20ish people and everyone hangs around eating and drinking. You'd be more than welcome to join us, or not, though it's usually not the most restful environment so if you need a silent house to sleep at 10pm we're probably not the best fit on Tuesday nights. Other Things to Note Our standard check in time is after 3pm and check out before 1pm, but these are pretty flexible and we're happy to move them around or hold luggage or whatever so long as it doesn't conflict with other guests. + More
rules: House Rules The big rule is just to be respectful and positive. Also, no smoking cigarettes in the house and no pets. The dog that lives here does not get along with other animals, despite loving people. + More

Private direct river access to the world famous Greenwoods Pool. Fly fish 12 months a year, kayak,hike,bike,ski,snow shoe, go antiquing or just relax by the river. Take a room or the Lodge for your next family outing. about: Enjoy a private room in our home along the Connecticut Shoreline. Overlooks a spacious backyard enclosed by trees for privacy. Beautiful in all seasons. Start your day with a homemade breakfast including coffee, tea, and juice, just to your liking.
description: Description The Space In addition to your private room, our home has an entertainment room, full kitchen, living room, deck with dining area and a spacious (1 acre) back yard. In the back is a small pond with some fish, birds and frogs. Guest Access Guests will have access to all common spaces and grounds. We do ask that guests stay out of the basement as it is unfinished. Additional amenities: HBO, Netflix, shower speaker, towel warmer, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, piano, games/cards, kitchen aid mixer and blender Interaction with Guests We would be happy to offer recommendations for local restaurants, bars, shopping and other attractions. We both work during the week and are generally around the area on weekends. We will always be available by email or phone. We will also provide breakfast in the morning! Once you book we can discuss preferences. Some of our favorite breakfast items include waffles, omelets, homemade muffins, cereal, and of course some fresh fruit. The Neighborhood We have a great location, near lots of fun things to do including: - Hammonasset State Park: Includes 2 miles of beach with some boardwalk, walking and biking trails, fishing, carry-in boating and a nature center. Great destination spring through fall. 3.0 miles way -Clinton Crossing Premium Outlets: High end brands at reasonable prices. Mall has over 60 stores including Banana Republic, Chico's, Coach, J. Crew, Nike, Nine West, and Swarovski. 2.5 miles away -Charmed Vineyards: A local vineyard with 20 acres of grapes. Explore the grounds and then taste their special wines while enjoying farm-to-table meals at their bistro. 1.5 miles away -Athletic facilities: We are within a 5-10 minute drive of multiple public sports fields, tennis courts, a running track and basketball courts. Additionally, there are multiple yoga studios and gym facilities with classes for a fee in the area. In addition to these attractions, there are plenty of restaurants, bars and other local activities. We will be happy to provide recommendations and inform you of any seasonal events. Getting Around We are in a residential area that is relatively flat so it is perfect for walking or biking around (no sidewalks but not too busy). Uber also serves our area and we have free parking for your personal vehicle. We are about a 5 minute drive from the Shoreline East Train Stations in Madison and Clinton and can arrange a pick up/drop off for guests using the train. Other Things to Note We do have a English Foxhound named Holley who is very sweet. She can stay outside during the day and has a doggie door to get in an out. She won't bother you but just be aware she will be around. + More
rules: House Rules General courtesy rules apply, just be mindful that it is a shared space and treat it with care. No smoking inside. Feel free to smoke outside as long as butts are disposed of properly. If you use the kitchen, please clean up when you are done. Please do not bring any of your own pets. + More

about: Private BR in renovated, cool, cozy and tastefully decorated home. Located on quiet street in historic West End. Steps from bus stop. About 1.5 miles from Downtown Hartford and West Hartford Center. Hardwood floors and granite countertops.
description: Description The Space The pictures say it all! Newly renovated! Hardwood floors. Granite countertops. High ceilings! Spacious! Bright! Private bedroom in third floor apartment of owner occupied three family house. -Free WiFi -Central Air Conditioning In bedroom: -40" flatscreen tv, AppleTV, Netflix , HBO Go -desk -closet to hang clothes -iron/ironing board available upon request -stereo -alarm clock radio Full kitchen access. (food/beverage policy: take some, leave some!) Kitchen: Granite countertops. Stainless steel appliances. Keurig, Dishwasher, French Door refrigerator, gas stove, garbage disposal. Peninsula bar-height setting for four. Full living room and additional office space access. Living room: 55" flatscreen TV, premium cable, AppleTV, Netflix, HBO Go. Large sectional that seats 6 comfortably. *There is a full size futon in office that can sleep two additional guests for $20 additional per guest per night. I am a 26 year old single male. Full time employed and part time student. Born and raised in the West End Of Hartford. Graduated from Boston University with Biomedical Engineering Bachelors Degree. I work for Apple, help manage the best Chinese restaurant in Greater Hartford, work in community outreach/development and I am a real estate agent. I love Hartford and my neighborhood. I have lived here since birth (other than college). I bought a three family home, three years ago and have renovated this awesome apartment for your enjoyment. AirBnB allows my dreams of being a host at a bed and breakfast and a tour guide in the city of Hartford to merge and come true. I know of great places to eat and play! If you are balling on a budget or have deep pockets, I have just the suggestion for you. If you love fine dining or the great outdoors, we can find something for you. If you prefer a stay in solitude I will sleep at another location down the block to give you your space. If you do not mind a housemate, I promise, I am decent company. The historic West End of Hartford. Great dining, great bars, shopping, just steps away. Young professionals, young families, retired couples, students...the neighborhood has it all! Just over a mile from Downtown Hartford and West Hartford Center. Two minutes from the highway (I-84). Steps from public bus stop with direct access to Downtown Hartford or West Hartford Center. Also direct access to Union Station with Train and Bus access. If I'm not working, I'd love to drive/show you around! Free parking on street in front of house. Can arrange for one parking spot in driveway if necessary. There is an additional full size futon in office area to sleep up to two more guests for $20 additional per night per person. Perfect for guests visiting Hartford or West Hartford for all/any of the following: Work, Conference, Conventions, UConn Law School, UConn Health Center, University of Hartford, Trinity, Marathons, Concerts, Theatre, Sporting Events, Rentschler Stadium, XL Center, Xfinity Theater, the list goes on and on... Guest Access -Free WiFi In bedroom: -40" flatscreen tv, AppleTV, Netflix , HBO Go -desk -closet to hang clothes -iron/ironing board available upon request -stereo -alarm clock radio Full kitchen access. (food/beverage policy: take some, leave some!) Kitchen: Granite countertops. Stainless steel appliances. Keurig, Dishwasher, French Door refrigerator, gas stove, garbage disposal. Peninsula bar-height setting for four. Full living room and additional office space access. Living room: 55" flatscreen TV, premium cable, AppleTV, Netflix, HBO Go. Large sectional that seats 6 comfortably. *There is a full size futon in office that can sleep two additional guests for $20 additional per guest per night. Interaction with Guests I am a 26 year old single male. Full time employed and part time student. Born and raised in the West End Of Hartford. Graduated from Boston University with Biomedical Engineering Bachelors Degree. I work for Apple, help manage the best Chinese restaurant in Greater Hartford, work in community outreach/development and I am a real estate agent. I love Hartford and my neighborhood. I have lived here since birth (other than college). I bought a three family home, three years ago and have renovated this awesome apartment for your enjoyment. AirBnB allows my dreams of being a host at a bed and breakfast and a tour guide in the city of Hartford to merge and come true. I know of great places to eat and play! If you are balling on a budget or have deep pockets, I have just the suggestion for you. If you love fine dining or the great outdoors, we can find something for you. If you prefer a stay in solitude I will sleep at another location down the block to give you your space (additional charge may apply). If you do not mind a housemate, I promise, I am decent company. The Neighborhood The historic West End of Hartford. Great dining, great bars, shopping, just steps away. Young professionals, young families, retired couples, students...the neighborhood has it all! Just over a mile from Downtown Hartford and West Hartford Center. Two minutes from the highway (I-84). Getting Around Steps from public bus stop with direct access to Downtown Hartford or West Hartford Center. Also direct access to Union Station with Train and Bus access. If I'm not working, I'd love to drive/show you around! Free parking on street in front of house. Can arrange for one parking spot in driveway if necessary. Other Things to Note There is an additional full size futon in office area to sleep up to two more guests for $20 additional per night per person. Perfect for guests visiting Hartford or West Hartford for all of the following: Work, Conference, Conventions, UConn Law School, UConn Health Center, University of Hartford, Trinity, Marathons, Concerts, Theatre, Sporting Events, Rentschler Stadium, XL Center, Xfinity Theater, the list goes on and on... + More
rules: House Rules Friends and family describe me as a bit of a neat freak. This means there is an awesome clean apartment for you to enjoy. Please respect the space and cleanliness. No smoking and no pets. Two rules: -no shoes in the apartment -enjoy your stay + More

description: Description The Space Your bedroom includes a new and comfortable queen bed with lots of pillows. The bathroom with heated floor has a separate shower and oversized air-jet tub where you can relax in seclusion with an idyllic view of the pine trees. A double closet, plenty of mirrors and loveseat add to your comfort. Vintage movies on the VCR! Room on the soft carpet for your yoga workout! Cot available for a child. You are welcome at the breakfast bar to enjoy fresh coffee and muffins with special new England jams or to enjoy s'mores on the patio. Our two acres are in a rural residential zone with neighboring homes in similar settings. But we are amazingly close to the interstate so that you can travel easily. You will need a car as there is no public transportation nearby. 12 minutes to downtown Hartford and 25 minutes to the airport or the University of Connecticut campus in Storrs. Guest Access Enjoy coffin and muffins at the breakfast bar, and, In warmer months, you can sip lemonade on the outdoor patio. In colder months, you are welcome to build a fire in the firepit on the patio, or enjoy a nightcap or a game of chess in front of a warm fire in the fieldstone fireplace in the living room at the end of the day. Interaction with Guests The owners will be delighted to greet you and answer your questions and make recommendations for places to visit in the area. Let us know your interests and we'll put on our thinking caps to suggest places you might enjoy. The Neighborhood This home is in a rural residential area with neighboring homes in similar private settings. Nearby outdoor activities include hiking on Case Mountain or around the reservoir, a bicycle trail to town and an entrance to Interstate 384 are very convenient, just 1/4 mile away. Getting Around You will need a car as public transportation is not available. 15 minute drive to downtown Hartford, 30 minutes to the airport, the University of Connecticut Law School or the Storrs campus and lots of places of interest in the Hartford area. Other Things to Note This home is conveniently located in a country setting east of Hartford, approximately midway between New York City and Boston. Although our setting is rural, we are close both to the highway and to hiking trails, art museums and charming restaurants! If you enjoy a morning run, we are located on the route of the annual 4K Manchester Road Race and you can test your stamina. Coffee, organic teas, muffins and special jams are available for you each morning. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking, parties or pets. But you are welcome to play your musical instrument or choose a book from our library. + More

about: Large private room in Hartford suburb. This second floor, front room has two sun-lit windows. Room furnished with beautiful king-size bed, nightstands, and dresser. PRIVATE BATHROOM ACROSS THE HALL.
description: Description The Space Spacious furnished private room (13x13) in single family home in Belle Woods section of Glastonbury. Room includes king-size bed, night stands, and dresser. Large bathroom has full tub/shower. Free on-street parking always available. Animal-friendly Guests are appreciated since we do have 2 small indoor dogs. The dogs are not permitted in your room or bathroom but do have access to the common areas on the first level. The accommodations are best suited for one or two Guests who have planned activities during their stay. We start our days early, but are happy to leave coffee, tea and yogurt and cereal for you to enjoy! PLEASE NOTICE *Not suitable for those with dog allergies. *Our home and the offered space are not suitable for children. We offer an adult friendly environment. *The space is not suitable for those who would have difficulty climbing a flight of stairs. Guest Access As our guest, you will have access to all common areas and outdoor gardens. Enjoy your morning coffee on one of two backyard decks. A little communing with nature is a good thing! Interaction with Guests Hey it's our house so we will be here. Interaction is up to you. If you want to talk, that's great! We love meeting new people and exchanging stories. The quiet type? That's fine too. After all, your bedroom has a door that you are welcome to close and we will leave you be. We are very familiar with the local area and can make great food and drink and/or sightseeing recommendations. The Neighborhood THE NEIGHBORHOOD - Belle Woods section of Glastonbury, CT This is a quintessential New England neighborhood. Traditional style homes on tree lined streets. We have an Apple Harvest Festival annually every October during the apple harvest season. The festival is a town-wide event lasting three days that includes various rides and attractions, including booths from many of the local town businesses and politicians. Other events include the Under a Strawberry Moon Festival in June and various events held by the local town historical society. Beautiful suburban neighborhood near Rt. 2, 83 & Rt. 94; I-84 east/west; I-91 North and South. There is a large variety of restaurants and shops in downtown Glastonbury. You MUST have car as closest bus stop is miles away and schedule is infrequent. Easy commute, however, to local universities, colleges and large corporations. This is a great place to stay while looking for an apartment or home or home base for sightseeing in New England. Boston is 2 hours away; Mystic and shorelines are within an hour; Hartford's downtown is 15 minutes. Getting Around There is no functional public transportation. You must have a car to get to my house and to get around the area. Other Things to Note *We are happy to help you with the Airbnb process. *We are flexible for check-in and check-out times, as our schedules permit. *We provide the full address due to safety reasons, upon accepted reservations. + More
rules: House Rules We ask the following questions to make sure that this is what you are looking for and the right fit for your needs. What is the purpose of your trip? What brings you to our area? What will you be doing during the day? What are the full names of the adults staying in the room? Please tell me a bit about them. Do you have any allergies? Do you smoke? Where do you live now/what do you do? Reminders from our Listing: This is a private home. The listing is for one King bedroom and shared use of the bathroom in the hallway across from the bedroom. You have full access to the first floor common areas. Other bedrooms are off-limits. You need a car to get around. There is no public transportation. Not bookable by those who have dog allergies or fear of dogs. We have 2 small dogs that live inside and are permitted in all common areas  not upstairs where the bedrooms are. Not bookable by smokers. This house has permanent residents with asthma and smoke sensitivities. Smokers who book anyway without disclosing that they smoke will not be admitted and will not receive a refund. Only pre-listed guests are allowed to stay in the listing. No visitors allowed No guest pets or animals allowed We are looking forward to hosting you. Please let me know if you have other questions. + More

description: Description The Space Great location and some of the nicest, most intelligent people I know live here! Considerate and courteous. 5 blocks to downtown . 10 minute walk to Yale University, Yale Hospital, Yale Medical School. You have your own laundry which only 1 other person shares . You share a gourmet kitchen . Some bedrooms have private baths. Others share with one person. I am often on site ensuring my guests comfort . Yale shuttle 800 yards away! rules: House Rules Behave like professionals and adults. This is not a party house, though we encourage guests to interact and learn from each other. House Rules 1. The reservation is a (1) one person room only and does not support extended visitors to reside there. Guests are allowed to visit but in a manner so as not to disturb other tenants. In the event that a guest is expected, Landlord and other tenants shall be notified as a courtesy. A $50/week guest fee is strictly enforced. 2. Utilities are included in your rent, however, there is an allowance given for electricity/gas per unit, on a monthly basis. If it is exceeded this will be charged to you. Please be vigilant in turning off lights and not running heat/cool air constantly or using dryer excessively. Turn off lights when not in use. 3. The bathrooms and kitchen must be cleaned after every use. No exceptions. 4. Be courteous to your roommates. Be mindful of noise levels and keep common areas tidy. Under no circumstances are you to enter another roommate's room without permission. 5. Absolutely no smoking or burning candles in the house. Cigarettes are to be smoked outside and disposed of properly. 6. Parking of 2 vehicles is allotted on the side of the building. It is a shared lot and available on a first come-first serve basis. As it is a tandem lot, if you block a car in, you must move it for the car in front of you. On-street parking is available if these spaces are full. Landlord is not responsible for any damage to the vehicle, or its contents. 7. You will be given a front door code to access building. Please do not share this code with others. It is for your safety and the safety of other tenants. As a second line of security, it is advised that you also keep the front door to your unit locked at all times. We will distribute one front door key to each tenant. Each copy of the unit key must be returned after lease ends. 8.If tenant is found to be drinking heavily, using non-prescribed drugs, two or more weeks late on the rent or breaks any of the house rules, the Landlord may terminate his/her Rental Agreement pursuant to Clause J.2 in Lease. 9.Trash and Recycling receptacles are in the back of the unit. (2) Brown bins are for trash and (1) Blue bin is for recycling. Please contribute to wheeling out bins to the curb on Monday night for Trash Pick up Tuesday morning. 10. All communication with Landlord should be directed via listed contact info. + More

about: Enjoy a queen sized bed in our private guest room. Easy access to NYC via New Haven Line/ Metro North, literally a 7 minute walk from our home. We are a nice walk/drive to shops, restaurants, and the beach: kayak, or stand up paddle board!
description: Description The Space If you want a taste of both the country and the city, our little 1830's house, with wide hardwood floors is in the perfect spot for you to enjoy both worlds! The house dates back to the 1830's or earlier. The room you'd be staying in is upstairs adjacent to our room.(must be able to walk up stairs) and has a large queen bed, brand new mattress, warm comforter, and fluffy pillows. Because our house is older, when you walk onto the wide plank floors, they may creek a bit. The doors creak too. Also, another interesting feature of the home is the lower ceilings on the second floor, where you'll be sleeping. If you are 6 1/2 feet, your head will be touching the ceiling! We have a shy but very sweet cat, who may visit you or hide under the bed. The bathroom/shower room is shared with us, but there is a downstairs powder room you can use as well. Guest Access You will have access to your bedroom,the downstairs powder room, and access to the upstairs shared shower. The dinning room is for you to use to eat any meals, as well as our outdoor patio. You may store things in the refrigerator or freezer. You may use the microwave and any utensils/ plates/ glasses. Please ask before using anything else in the kitchen. Please no cooking full meals. We provide you with clean linens, full body towels and hand towels/wash cloths, as well as shampoo and (website hidden) of soap or body wash for showers. We ask you please hang your towels to dry after use so you can reuse the same towel. We try to be friendly in conserving water. Unless you stay with us for a week, please no using the washer machine. There is a very close laundry mat if you are desperate. Interaction with Guests We will try to be there when you arrive but as we both work, it depends. If not, we'll have the keys in a lock box and will give you the code just before you arrive. You can interact with us as much or little as you would like. We are friendly and interested in our guests! The Neighborhood We LOVE that we can walk to get dinner or drinks within 10 minutes in down town!!! Also, a 7 minute walk to the Metro North Train (New Haven Line) into Grand Central Station. (90 Minutes into NYC) There is a duck pond behind the lovely town hall. The beach is a 20 minute walk or a 10 minute bike ride! For those who have a car, quick drive to mall and other stores ( We have just about everything, it's route 1)You can stay in Milford and walk around our little town green and enjoy some great local restaurants and businesses, such as Bistro Basque ( an authentic Basque Tapas style restaurant), Cafe Atlantic (Delicious Panini's and large salads), Stone Bridge (fine dining / bar scene with large outdoor patio and bar) SBC (great food and drinks), Rainbow Gardens (right down the street from us, amazing panoply of food, and my favorite cocktail the Flirtini), Eli's is a great place for draft beers and yummy apps and entrees, it's a cool scene. All these, and more, within walking distance! For boat lovers, the marina downtown is a 10-15 minute walk, and has ice cream in the summer time (Scoopy Doo's). Bring your bike for a nice bike ride to one of several beaches (Fort Trumbull, Silver Sands, Walnut Beach-the nicest)or rent one from the bike shop at Walnut Beach (Scoot and Paddle) If you want to head to NYC for a day trip, you are in luck! The Metro North Train station is literally a 7 minute walk from the house! It's about a 90 minute train ride to Grand Central Station from here. See a Broadway show, or gallivant around the city with no particular plan! Late trains back to Milford! Parking, internet, cable available. You'll need a car to explore the greater CT area. Plenty of things to do, hiking, wine trails, beaches, and more! Looking to visit Yale University?? a 15 minute train ride into New Haven with even more restaurants, and the BEST pizza in the whole wide world...I'm not kidding....really it's the best..(Pepe's Pizza in Wooster Square neighborhood) Getting Around Metro North Train into Grand Central (South) or New Haven (North). A lot within walking distance. Local bus stop or taxis available as well. Rental Car agency's are close by. Hertz, Other Things to Note The controls for the heat/ air are downstairs, it's not room by room, unfortunately. So if it is too cold or hot, please let us know. We will also be happy to show you how to use the thermostat if we are not home. The floors are creaky in certain areas and the staircase upstairs is narrow and slightly steep. The interior doors are latch doors. There is no means to lock them. We have a cat who may curl up with you! + More
rules: House Rules No smoking on property!!! No cooking please. Single/ couples only. No children or pets (the house is not childproof) No drug use on or off premises. No weapons. No extra guests that have not been already approved pre- booking. Please be respectful of house and neighborhood. We expect you treat our home and property with respect and care. Please just be tidy with shared spaces. As your room is next to ours, we just ask to be courteous with noise level after 11:30pm during the work week. + More

about: My apartment is located 1 block away from Yale campus, 10-min walk from Yale Hospital, next to all restaurants/bars and fun stuff to do in New Haven. The apartment is large, tastefully decorated.
description: Description The Space I have a huge, spacious 2-bedroom apartment right in Downtown New Haven located on the 1st floor of my building, 1 block away from Yale campus. My building is directly in front of a pizza restaurant and Mamoun's Falafel (open til 3am everyday!). The neighborhood is really nice and walking distance to everything in downtown New Haven and the medical school/hospital. You will be staying in the 1st floor bedroom with a Queen size bed, a huge closet, and a large dresser for your clothes and belongings. I also have washer/dryer in my apartment you are welcome to use, a real fireplace, a piano. I also have a parking space available if needed. Guest Access You have access to your room with private entrance through the back door if you wish that goes through the parking lot, or you can use the front door. You can also use anything in my kitchen, washer/dryer, living room. STREET PARKING is close by, but just beware of the street cleaning days and meters. The best way to get around the city is by walking through Downtown and the Yale campus. Interaction with Guests I love to take my guests out and explore the city! As you can see from my previous reviews, I do enjoy hanging out with my guests if they would like. I also give privacy and space too The Neighborhood The neighborhood is great! Located from one of the best late night spots, 1 block from Yale campus, 10 minute walk from Yale-New Haven Hospital (my job). Very close to the New Haven Green and all the best bars and restaurants in the city! Also really close to the Yale Shuttle and public bus. Getting Around Walking is the BEST way to get around New Haven... my apartment is 1 block from Yale and located in Downtown, walking distance from all the good bars/restaurants and attractions. Biking: You can use Yale's Bike-share system called Zagster. I will share my account with you so you can use a bike for free Parking: Street parking is easy to find. Metered parking is free from 9pm to 7am outside the building. There is plenty of non-metered parking on other side streets nearby (but please read the street cleaning signs) Public Transit: Using the Yale Shuttle is the best way to get around. Orange/Blue lines take you to East Rock Park and East Rock neighborhood. Red line goes to Union Station. + More

about: Run, walk, or paddle a canoe. Blocks away from beautiful East Rock Park and minutes from Yale campus. description: Description The Space We're located in the Dwight neighbourhood which is under a 10 minute walk to the main Yale campus and about the same to the med school area. Dwight is an urban area and we're on the ambulance route so if you're looking for something super quiet, you're better off checking out a place in East Rock. However, if you're used to big cities, you'll find Dwight comparatively tranquil. There are a few bars and restaurants down the street, though our particular block is mainly residential. Our place is on the first floor of the building, and is a two-bedroom apartment. The room we're renting out doubles as guestroom and office, and the bed is a pull-out sofa-bed which is ideal for one person but can fit two (the bed measures 46 x 80 inches). The guestroom contains a number of bookshelves, a desk and chair, as well as a small built-in closet which guests are free to use. It's a bright room and super sunny in the mornings though we have dark curtains for those who prefer to sleep in. The apartment has a central heating system and we have smaller electric heaters as well. There is only one bathroom in the apartment, so we'll have to share. You're also welcome to use the kitchen and our washing machine if you need to do laundry. We *do not* provide breakfast. On-street parking is usually plentiful, though there are also paid parking lots close by. We're three blocks away from the Yale shuttle stop on York/Chapel, and the bus-stop for CTTransit route F is just outside our door. There's a large Stop & Shop about a 5-10 mins' walk from our place, as well as a number of smaller grocery stores, a liquor store, a Dunkin Donuts, our very own neighbourhood comic book store (!), and a 24-hour Walgreens all within a block or two. + More
rules: House Rules Most of these aren't exactly house rules, but we do ask that you note the following BEFORE requesting a booking: - Please send us a message telling us a little bit about yourself and why you're in town. - We *do not* provide breakfast. You are welcome to use the kitchen and have things in the fridge, but please keep everything clean and tidy. - We have a hamster. His name is Seamus. He's very cute, but if you're allergic you may not agree. - Linens and towels are provided, but please bring your own shampoo/bathwash/etc. - No smoking, no pets. - This is a shoes-off household. + More

about: EXPERIENCE NEW HAVEN DIFFERENTLY in Historic Fair Haven riverfront: Stay in an unusual modernized 1840-home, meet genuine hosts, discover the busy, diverse, and culturally rich neighborhood, 2 MILES EAST of downtown and Yale.
description: Description The Space Elegant and warm guestroom (full-size bed, soft), in modernized historic house that feels like home. Walk or run along the Quinnipiac River and grab a breakfast sandwich at the marina's cafe; Get a Peruvian or Mexican fare down the commercial street (read: (URL HIDDEN) ; or drive 2 miles, 10 minutes to downtown to visit the University, museums and international cuisine. Off-street parking and much more. Shared Bathroom, kitchen, living room, backyard. I like to make my guests feel comfortable, offer snacks and coffee, provide information to make their stay smooth, and I respect their privacy. But this is not a hotel. The Quinnipiac river historic neighborhood is one of the most overlooked neighborhoods of New Haven. I love everything about the neighborhood: the community, the city life, diversity in people, and the river life. People live here, work here, and do interact with each other. It's half city-life, half waterfront. Our bridge is an "asymetrical steel swing bridge". This side of town next to the Q river, also called Fair Haven, is beautiful, rich in history, cultures, arts, family-friendly, community-oriented, and safe. Parks, restaurants, shops, schools. Easy access from I-95 and I-91. 10 minutes to downtown. D-Bus line at the door steps. Interaction with Guests I like to make my guests feel comfortable, offer snacks and coffee, but do not serve breakfast; we provide information to make their stay smooth, and respect their privacy. The Neighborhood The Quinnipiac river historic neighborhood is one of the most overlooked neighborhoods of New Haven. It is both busy with people and calming with parks along the river. Our bridge is an "asymetrical steel swing bridge". This side of town next to the Q river, also called Fair Haven, is beautiful, rich in history, cultures, arts, family-friendly, community-oriented, and safe. Grand Avenue is a busy commercial street with lots of people. Parks, restaurants, shops, schools. People live here, work here, and do interact with each other. Getting Around Easy access from I-95 and I-91. 10 minutes to downtown. D-Bus line at the door steps. Other Things to Note We live on a busy street. There is traffic, there are people. Buses take you directly downtown, two miles away. We love our location: the proximity to everything (shops, pharmacies, schools), there are people talking, children playing, music, and we also love the proximity of the quiet river. People and birds come with diversity; this is a very diverse neighborhood. So if you are looking for a hotel, quiet, with minimal interaction with people, this is not the best place for you. + More

description: Description The Space 1 room in a 3BR apartment. The room comes furnished with a bed, closet, desk, chair, and dresser, blanket, linens and pillows included. There is also toiletries in the event you forget yours! Iron and ironing board available. Portable heater and portable fan in your room, so you can manage your room temperature to your liking. Guest Access Guests have their own room and share common full kitchen, bathroom, dining and living area. Interaction with Guests Interaction with guests varies. I live in New Haven and I'm available if you need any info, help, recommendation or suggestion. My work and personal life varies in intensity so there are times when I'm more available than others. Since we will share the space, please feel free to let me know your preferences and requirements. I hope that each guest get the most out of their visit, be it reflective time to read and study, and so on or time to engage with the host, or local scenes and activities. The Neighborhood Did I say best location? The access to all of the prime spots in New Haven within easy walking distance is the best part about the location. Access to the Yale shuttle is just around the corner. A stone's throw away from all the downtown activity, a variety of great restaurants, pubs, shops, museums, theatres. There is also a local laundromat about a block away. Getting Around The Blue and Orange shuttle stop is around the corner and it's free. Between 7pm-7am door-to-door Yale Shuttle is available. Uber and cabs are available in New Haven. Several car rental companies, as well as zipcar are within 3 blocks away. Other Things to Note Please mention your affiliation with Yale or the purpose of your visit. + More
rules: House Rules Hi! I'm a grad student at Yale and I am happy to have you as my roommate. My place is a typical grad student's apartment and I promise you an authentic experience that will remind you of gradschool! I like hanging out, having some chit chat, and sometimes going out with my roommates. Please feel free to ask questions if you need anything. Consider yourself staying at a friend's house. I love a reasonably clean and tidy apartment. I'm sure you do as well. Maybe it's an important consideration for you when choosing an accommodation. Great! I am hopeful that you will treat my apartment as if you do live there. Please keep the place looking reasonably clean that you would feel comfortable staying there. No pets, no smoking, no parties, no loud music. I'll give you a set of keys to use for your stay. The cost for replacement is $20 if you loose it. Anything that makes the space unpresentable for future guests will be charged from your deposit. I hope you enjoy your stay and see you soon! + More

rules: House Rules Behave like professionals and adults. This is not a party house, though we encourage guests to interact and learn from each other. House Rules 1. The reservation is a (1) one person room only and does not support extended visitors to reside there. Guests are allowed to visit but in a manner so as not to disturb other tenants. In the event that a guest is expected, Landlord and other tenants shall be notified as a courtesy. A $50/week guest fee is strictly enforced. 2. Utilities are included in your rent, however, there is an allowance given for electricity/gas per unit, on a monthly basis. If it is exceeded this will be charged to you. Please be vigilant in turning off lights and not running heat/cool air constantly or using dryer excessively. Turn off lights when not in use. 3. The bathrooms and kitchen must be cleaned after every use. No exceptions. 4. Be courteous to your roommates. Be mindful of noise levels and keep common areas tidy. Under no circumstances are you to enter another roommate's room without permission. 5. Absolutely no smoking or burning candles in the house. Cigarettes are to be smoked outside and disposed of properly. 6. Parking of 2 vehicles is allotted on the side of the building. It is a shared lot and available on a first come-first serve basis. As it is a tandem lot, if you block a car in, you must move it for the car in front of you. On-street parking is available if these spaces are full. Landlord is not responsible for any damage to the vehicle, or its contents. 7. You will be given a front door code to access building. Please do not share this code with others. It is for your safety and the safety of other tenants. As a second line of security, it is advised that you also keep the front door to your unit locked at all times. We will distribute one front door key to each tenant. Each copy of the unit key must be returned after lease ends. 8.If tenant is found to be drinking heavily, using non-prescribed drugs, two or more weeks late on the rent or breaks any of the house rules, the Landlord may terminate his/her Rental Agreement pursuant to Clause J.2 in Lease. 9.Trash and Recycling receptacles are in the back of the unit. (2) Brown bins are for trash and (1) Blue bin is for recycling. Please contribute to wheeling out bins to the curb on Monday night for Trash Pick up Tuesday morning. 10. All communication with Landlord should be directed via listed contact info. + More

about: Bright & Spacious 1st floor Suite with French Door, and with your own private exquisitely tiled full bath, luxurious queen-sized vintage iron bed with cozy linens, & duvet, Flat Screen premium cable TV, & wifi.
description: Description The Space Bright & Spacious 1st floor Suite with French Door, and exquisitely tiled full bath, luxurious queen-sized iron bed with cozy linens, Your accommodations are a very spacious private bedroom suite on the 1st floor with Queen size bed, & full private bathroom, walk-in closet, Flat screen TV, & WiFi Internet access. -Second room available with a twin or full size bed to accommodate additional guests, at an additional cost. -We do have a friendly cat named Pepper. The Town of Simsbury is the quintessential New England town, situated on the Farmington River. Enjoy a stroll through town, dinner at one of our towns casual or fine dining restaurants, shopping or ice cream parlors. Simsbury Meadows is home to the Talcott Mountain Music Festval and The Hartford Symphony, where many gather during the Summer months with a picnic basket & bottle of wine for a night of music & dancing. The East Coast Greenway runs through Simsbury and provides bikers, runners and walkers an opportunity to enjoy the Beauty of the Farmington Valley. Bikes are available free of charge in several locations throughout town. There are also many parks, pools & golf courses in town. Our location is convenient to the surrounding towns of Avon, CT, Canton, CT, Granby, CT, East Granby, CT, New Hartford, CT, Farmington, CT, West Hartford, CT & Bloomfield, CT. Our home is privately located at the end of a quiet cul de sac in a suburban neighborhood about a mile from Simsbury town center. It is located near scenic bike trails & you can enjoy a nice walk/run anytime of the day. 15 Minutes From Bradley International Airport Guest Access - Use of fully equipped Gourmet Kitchen, Inviting Family Room with walls of French doors that lead to sunny deck with Adirondack chairs to sit & relax on warm days. Interaction with Guests We will be on the premises during your stay. The Neighborhood Our Newly built Nantucket shingle style home is located at the end of a quiet cul de sac set on 4 1/2 acres close to town Ethel Walker & Westminster Prep Schools, McLean & International Skating Center. Getting Around You will need a Car to get around, Taxi & Uber is available. + More

rules: House Rules House rule is the GOLDEN RULE "The Golden Rule or ethic of reciprocity is a moral maxim or principle which may appear as either a positive or negative injunction: One should treat others as one would like others to treat oneself (positive or directive form)." One would assume most travelers to be already familiar with basic etiquette but I will present a brief outline here in hopes to avoid awkward or confusing situations in advance. this is a NON SMOKING home You can smoke outside as long as you promise to throw your butts in a can provided thank you Schedules are majorly important if you are a night owl this would not be a good fit for us. although if you work 3rd shift thats fine Personal space must be 100% respected It is very important to pay attention to social cues and not to take advantage or cross boundaries. You can not come back after check out and hang around. You can not help yourself to anyone elses personal belongings or groceries unless they are offered or its part of the deal we agreed to for example if breakfast is included it will be on your own shelf in the fridge/freezer/cabinet The arrangement we make and agree upon together is meant to be kept in order to benefit both guest and host I really enjoy having house guests. as you can see Im more concerned about people than things things are made to be used and sometimes they break but if you break or damage something more than $20 value you must be willing to fix or replace it. It is my 100% goal for you to feel welcomed, to be comfortable and have a memorable experience. I will go out of my way to help make your stay as happy and cozy as much as my time permits. Im so thankful for this opportunity on Airbnb its been a very fulfilling opportunity for many lets all do our part to keep it that way thank you very much Sincerely Andrea + More

about: Room with queen-sized bed, dresser, closet and private bath in lovely house in the woods in the Unionville section of Farmington CT. Quiet and peaceful and lovely view of back gardens. Access to shared kitchen, laundry and screen porch and patio.
description: Description The Space 3500 square feet home on secluded 2.5 acres in Unionville CT. House has five bedrooms /3 bath rooms /2 fireplaces and is shared with a female Professor from the Medical School. Commute: 15 to 20 minutes to the Medical School and 12 to 15 min to Highway 84. Plenty of Parking. No smoking/ no pets. Upstairs there are nine foot ceilings, four bedrooms. One occupied by host. Two bedrooms are available if your group is larger than 2 people: one with a queen bed and one with a single bed. Bedrooms on the second floor have lovely views of the garden. Guest Access Full house, kitchen, laundry and yard privileges. On first floor: a large kitchen with mahogany counter tops, two sinks, large island in a great room with lovely fireplace and breakfast nook with views of the garden; full dining room; Living/sitting room with second fireplace and built-in cabinets and comfortable furniture, flat screen TV; full bath with shower; mudroom; large spacious front hall; wood floors and ten foot ceilings. Lovely front porch with 12 ft bench and secluded and quiet back screen porch over brick patio with grill and outdoor furniture surrounded by gardens. Interaction with Guests Either I or a neighbor will welcome you to the house and show your around. I work full time and will not always be around but will be glad to give you tips about how to get around in Farmington. Grocery store nearby as well as restaurants and the lovely Farmington River. The Neighborhood House is secluded on a private drive but convenient to stores, restaurants, bike trails, walking trails along the river (short drive away). Getting Around A 5-10 min walk to a bus route that goes down Farmington Ave into Hartford. The bus also stops at University of Connecticut Medical School. Other Things to Note During the summer I get a farm share, and if you would like to participate and have fresh vegetables you can for $35 per week. + More

about: This private room with private bath in our modern and eclectic home is located in a safe and quiet neighborhood surrounded by nature. Shopping, gyms, and recreation are nearby. We're close to I-84, Route 8, Waterbury Hospital & St. Mary's Hospital.
description: Description The Space The room features a single bed and a futon and is decorated with original artwork. The private bathroom has a full tub, decorated in a 19th century style. The outdoor raised deck offers a relaxing getaway to unwind in the Adirondack chairs amongst colorful flowers that attract a wide variety of birds, especially hummingbirds in the summer! The resident cats Daffy, Frankie and Penny are all very friendly and playful. Enjoy day trips to Connecticut's cultural treasures, from Hartford to New Haven. Bordering on the gateway to the Litchfield Hills, explore the beautiful fall foliage and rolling hills of Northwest Connecticut, or take a drive into the Berkshires. Metro-North is also nearby, so New York City is only a heartbeat away. Nature trails can also be found right around the corner. Waterbury is a very ethnically diverse city with lots of great ethnic restaurants. Everything is close and convenient and the neighborhood is very safe and quiet. Please contact us for any special offers for long-term inquiries. We are flexible and open to extended stays. Medical residents are welcome! Guest Access There is high speed wifi/internet, a washer/dryer and off-street parking in our driveway. Kitchen privileges are included and we have an outdoor grill. Interaction with Guests We are a professional couple, part-time artists / musicians, progressive and open-minded. We love interacting with our guests, or if you prefer quiet, that is okay, too! Getting Around The public bus is down the street and the Waterbury train station is 4 miles away, with connections in Bridgeport, CT to New York City and Amtrak. + More

about: Offer a cozy apt with a spacious bedroom in our guest quarter. Space includes a foyer, sitting room, bath and kitchenette. Access via a private staircase from the garage. Room comfortably fits 2 people. Optional extra 2nd bedroom over 2 car garage
description: Description The Space The apartment is in the guest quarter of our large home. It has a nice view at the park-like backyard, bordered with miles of wooded area. Our house is on a cul-de sac, quiet and peaceful. If you like walking, take a short stroll to the nearby Farrington pond and go fishing, or drive 2 miles to the East Branch Reservoir which is right across the New York state border and row boat. The guest room is spacious and quiet. It has a full bed, mirror/dresser, writing table/chairs. The room comfortably fits 2 people. The bedroom in this listing is the spacious bedroom in the guest quarter. Entire private space also includes a cozy sitting room next to the foyer, bathroom and a kitchenette. The bath room is spacious with a shower tub overlooking the backyard. The kitchenette is equipped to prepare a simple meal or reheat take-outs. It has a freezer/refrigerator, glass cooktops, microwave and toaster oven. It is stocked with basic necessities such as glasses, cups, dinnerware, silverware, cooking utensils, pots, pans and condiments. The guest room will comfortably fit 2 people. If you need an extra bedroom, the 2nd bedroom next to the foyer can be made available. The 2nd bedroom has a queen bed, futon couch, dresser and fits additional 4 people. Guest Access Guest quarter entrance: The entrance to the private room is via the garage door and a private staircase. Please close the garage door after each use. Thanks! Interaction with Guests Our home is our sanctuary where we find peace and quiet. We try our best to provide the type of experience each guest expects to have. We like our guests to think their room is their private quiet space, their sanctuary. It's up to our guest what level of interaction they wish. A handy booklet is provided to familiarize them on what's in the neighborhood, local stores, restaurants, dry cleaner, local business and sightseeing attractions. We are reachable via text message and phone calls. Therefore, after our guests check in and settle down, we respect their privacy and they would not be bothered by us The Neighborhood Our house is on a quiet country road, the west side of Danbury, conveniently located near local major corporations, easy access to major highways, 5 minutes to Danbury Fair Mall, Tarrywile hiking trails, 0.5 hr to over 200 hiking trails in Westchester county. We are only a train ride or 1.5 hr drive to NYC. If you are here on an extended stay and want some excitement on weekends, take the train to New York City for a day trip and can still return to your apartment the same day. Plan your day and choose among multiple museums, Broadway shows and off Broadway shows, restaurants and more. Commuter parking is free at the nearby MTA train station on weekends. If you choose to drive to New York City, start your day early to find free street parking in Manhattan on Sunday. There are many local attractions if you like to stay around Danbury: Danbury Fair in the Autumn, Danbury Fair Mall with Carousal, Danbury Railway Museum, EastBranch Reservoir in the Autumn, Farrington Pond, Hammond Museum Japanese Garden, Harley Davidson, Richter Park and Golf Course ... and more Getting Around Hart bus is the local public transportation in Danbury. MTA Metro North Railroad has 2 lines going to Grand Central, NYC. They are the Harlem Line and New Haven Line. Nearby airports Westchester County airport (HPN) White Plain, NY 32 miles 32 minutes Stewart airport (SWF) Newburgh, NY 40 miles, 51 minutes Bradley airport (BDL) , Windsor Locks, CT 77 miles, 1 hour 18 minutes LaGuardia airport (LGA), Flushing, NY 57 miles, 1 hour 3 minutes John Kennedy airport (JFK) Brooklyn, NY 65 miles, 1 hour 11 minutes New Haven airport (HVN) New Haven, CT 44 miles, 1 hour 7 minutes Other Things to Note Please advise in advance if your arrival or departure time has changed. Disclosure: The perimeter of our house and entrances are monitored by safety cameras + More

about: The Harkness Tower Rom: Large room with a queen sized bed and love seat sofa, has a lovely street view of the Yale Arch and Harkness Tower.The room is equipped with a dorm frig and microwave, also the house has a large living room and two kitchens.
description: Description The Space The space is very sunny and spacious with a comfortable love seat and nice desk and cabinet space. Our residents and visitors are usually here completing grad student work or are visiting for a Yale conference. Also, we have a variety of room sizes and can accommodate couples and those traveling with family members with advance notice if an extra bed is needed. We proudly serve STARBUCKS French Roast Coffee beans, which you may grid as you prefer, and use drip, French Press or conventional coffee makers. With our cereals, herbal teas and coffees, we also offer Stevia, Organic Sugar, and honey. We often have Chobani single serve yogurts on weekends, plus occasionally offer fresh pancake batter. All breakfasts are self serve, and guests only need clean up after themselves. Guest Access Guests may use any one of two large kitchens and there is a self serve breakfast included consisting of coffee, tea and cereals, including a gluten free option. We have a very large living room where we host various events and residents may reserve the living room space for special activities. Since this is a shared house, all residents and guests are welcomed to all planned activities. During the school year, there is a special service and dinner from 5-7 on Sunday evening. The last one for 2015 is on Dec. 13. Interaction with Guests Either the Director or Live In House Manager can assist you with all your needs and questions. The Neighborhood Only one block form the Yale Museums, Yale Rep, Starbucks, Chapel Street Shops, and the finest cafes and restaurants, we have a perfect location to easily and quickly access the Yale campus and all of downtown New Haven with the Schubert Theater one block away, and the city as well including the New Haven Green. Getting Around Taxis and buses are readily available and we have excellent service. The Yale Shuttle is free and the APP can be installed on your phone, it is TRANSLOC and is an active site so that you may see exactly when your bus is arriving. + More
rules: House Rules We are a quiet, scholarly guest house and yet, are happy to entertain and allow you to have a guest over or your special interest group if you reserve the living room. Since we are a shared house, the living room must be open to all residents even during your activity and even if the room is reserved. The living room is very large and can be easily used by a musical group, we have a piano, and it was just tuned. + More

about: Within 3 blocks from Schools: Art, Architecture, Drama, Law, Music, Engineering & Science, Public Health, Medicine; All colleges; YNH Hospital, Yale Art Gallery, Sterling-Bass-Beinecke Library, Payne-Whitney Gym
description: Description The Space 1 room in a 3BR apartment. The room comes furnished with a bed, closet, desk, chair, and dresser, blanket, linens and pillows included. There is also toiletries in the event you forget yours! Iron and ironing board available. Portable heater and portable fan in your room, so you can manage your room temperature to your liking. Guest Access Guests have their own room and share common full kitchen, bathroom with shower and bath tub, dining and living area. Interaction with Guests Interaction with guests varies. I live in New Haven and I'm available if you need any info, help, recommendation or suggestion. My work and personal life varies in intensity so there are times when I'm more available than others. Since we will share the space, please feel free to let me know your preferences and requirements. I hope that each guest get the most out of their visit, be it reflective time to read and study, and so on or time to engage with the host, or local scenes and activities. The Neighborhood Did I say best location? The access to all of the prime spots in New Haven within easy walking distance is the best part about the location. Access to the Yale shuttle is just around the corner. A stone's throw away from all the downtown activity, a variety of great restaurants, pubs, shops, museums, theatres. There is also a local laundromat about a block away. Getting Around The Blue and Orange shuttle stop is around the corner and it's free. Between 7pm-7am door-to-door Yale Shuttle is available. Uber and cabs are available in New Haven. Several car rental companies, as well as zipcar are within 3 blocks away. Other Things to Note Please mention your affiliation with Yale or the purpose of your visit. + More
rules: House Rules Hi! I'm a grad student at Yale and I am happy to have you as my roommate. My place is a typical grad student's apartment and I promise you an authentic experience that will remind you of gradschool! I like hanging out, having some chit chat, and sometimes going out with my guests. Please feel free to ask questions if you need anything. Consider yourself staying at a friend's house. I'm not one of those clean freak roommates who post a chores schedule, remind everyone to do chores and scream every time I find a hair in the bathroom. However, I do love a reasonably clean and tidy apartment. I'm sure you do as well. Maybe it's an important consideration for you when choosing an accommodation. Great! I am hopeful that you will treat my apartment as if you do live there. I hope that at the very least, you know how to clean after yourself. You know, something like, if you hate hairs in bath sink drain, then take care of yours if you have hair falls when you're taking a shower. I don't have time to clean the bathroom every hour. The place is a gradschool student's apartment after all, not a mall. So, I would appreciate it if you would take care of yourself and keep the place looking reasonably clean that you would feel comfortable staying there. No pets, no smoking, no parties, no loud music. I'll give you a set of keys to use for your stay. The cost for replacement is $20 if you loose it. Anything that makes the space unpresentable for future guests will be charged from your deposit. I hope you enjoy your stay and see you soon! + More

about: Cozy and private room is a soothing color and full of sunlight on the 3rd floor of our family home. All you will need in compact space. Spacious bathroom with tub and washer dryer may be shared with another guest. We do not accommodate smokers.
description: Description The Space This is a bright and sunny single bedroom suite on the 3rd floor of my large family home in Old Greenwich, Connecticut. (Note Old Greenwich is an area of Greenwich with its own separate train station.) The room has a twin bed with trundle, a sitting area and a separate writing desk by the window overlooking the front garden. There is cable TV and high-speed Wi-Fi. The bathroom has a deep tub and shower. When the other room on the floor is occupied, you may be sharing the bathroom. The washer/dryer is reserved for guests staying 3 days or more. There is a $10 cleaning fee. On the second floor there is a small table where two people can eat, read or have their morning coffee and look out over the front garden. Morning coffee and tea are available but meals are not included. You are welcome to prepare simple meals in our kitchen. There is street parking but a car is not essential. Guest Access You are welcome to eat at our kitchen table or on our back deck in good weather. The family room television is available for the shared use of guests. Interaction with Guests I work from home so during the day I am available to answer quick questions but cannot take time from my work day for socializing, unfortunately. Of course I always like to get to know our visitors on arrival. The Neighborhood This is a suburban area with village charm. Downtown Old Greenwich is one block away with charming shops, cafes, restaurants, pubs, a post office and a supermarket. There are several beautiful parks and areas to hike. A bike is available for riding to the beach 1 mile from the house. Depending on the season and the time of day, entering the beach may require a $5 guest pass obtainable from the community center nearby. Everyone is friendly. Everything is nearby. We love our community and you will too. Getting Around This is a wonderful place to stay while visiting the New York metropolitan area or southern New England. The train station is a 7 minute walk from our home. It provides service to New York city and all the suburban stops through Westchester County. Taking the train north will get you to Stamford, Bridgeport and New Haven and all the stops in between. Amtrak service is from Stamford, one stop away by Metro North. In addition everything you need for your stay can be obtained at one of the shops in our village which are 2 blocks away. + More
