about: Our urban vibe red room is our den and favorite spot to display art against the vivid walls. We had a window installed just to take in the bay view down the street. Cozy quarters.
description: Description The Space The house is a graceful three-story Victorian era house which we have recently renovated to make it a comfortable home for us and for our guests. The red room is a small 2nd floor bedroom, usually our TV den, accessible easily from the front door at the top of the first flight of stairs. The full bathroom with double sinks is for guests' use. Please note: the bed is a twin futon style bed suitable for only one person, so only single guests may use this room. We have another room with more beds which is a bit more spacious on the third floor. That listing is under "Cozy Crow's Nest with Coastal Views" and sleeps up to three people in comfort. We often lay out an informal, complimentary continental breakfast for our guests, though it is not a listed amenity. Guest Access Guests may use living room, deck, porch and garden. They may use the 2nd floor bathroom which will be shared, though we will do our best to use the lower floor bathroom to give you freer access to the upper bath. There is only one front door and one rear door to the house. Please use the front door only. If breakfast is offered, which is an informal complimentary continental meal, guests may access the kitchen. Interaction with Guests We are new Airbnb hosts and we hope to evolve as we go along, responding to the needs of our guests. My husband Stuart and myself are self-employed and are always about, in and out of the house. We will be delighted to give you tips about the area. We often lay out a continental breakfast for our guests, but please don't enquire nor depend on this hospitality as it is not included in our amenities. The Neighborhood Stonington, CT was listed in Yankee Magazine's Top-10 Coastal Towns in 2015. The Borough is a unique fishing village situated on a small peninsula with public access to the shoreline throughout. With its history extending back to pre-Revolutionary times, the houses and architecture here span almost three centuries. Main St. is a charming place to stroll, window shop on Water St., enjoy great restaurants, visit the Point with its vistas of the Harbor, Fisher's Island, Watch Hill, Mystic Seaport and Groton in 270 degree views. Visit the beach or walk out on the old stone pier, take a sailing lesson at NESS, or pull in to Dodson's Boatyard on your own boat. The Lighthouse Museum is down the street and offers walking tours of the historical village. The area is chock full of antiquing, thrift shops, farmer's markets, lobster and seafood shacks, and don't miss the Velvet Mill which contains a whole variety of craft artisans, a brewery, a cheese shop, a bakery, galleries and shops in an old brick textile factory on the village outskirts. Mystic Seaport and Village, Pequot Museum, Mystic Aquarium and the vibrant town of Westerly, RI are all within a few miles of Stonington. And in the Autumn, leaf peepers make a pilgrimage to this lovely area to take in the stunning New England Fall foliage display. The stone walls themselves are numerous and mysterious, and seem to give this magical place its true name. Stunning beaches of Rhode Island are within a 20-minute drive, for swimming, surfing and sunbathing. Or simply walk 2 minutes to DuBois Beach on the Point. Boating seems to be the favorite sport hereabouts and there are plenty of coves, harbors and miles of shoreline to explore. Barn Island is a wildlife sanctuary full of trails for hiking, boating, hunting and fishing. Getting Around On and off-street parking are available. There is virtually no public transit, so walking, biking, boating and driving are the main modes of transportation in the Borough and its surroundings. Other Things to Note Stuart and I are almost always at home or nearby, and are ready to be of assistance to guests. + More

about: You'll have the whole basement to yourself--including a giant bathtub!--in our East Rock house. Tucked away on a quiet side street, we're just steps away from local eateries, markets, and East Rock Park, and a short ride to Yale and downtown on the Yale shuttle.
description: Description The Space This is a fully furnished basement room of a 19th century house with its own bathroom and entrance to the house; this is not a "shared" space. You'll have full privacy to make yourself at home and do work while you are here, and enter & exit as you please without worrying about our schedule. The room comfortably sleeps two on a comfy futon, and gets nice light through the windows despite being in the basement. We've also added a small refrigerator to the room! Guest Access You will be provided with a key to go in & out of the house through the basement entrance. You will also have a spacious bathroom (with a giant bathtub) to yourself. While we are happy to help you get around town and help with any issues you have, we prefer to keep our living space on the first & second floor separate. Interaction with Guests While we will be staying in the house while guests are here, we would like to maintain our own privacy and space on the first and second floors. We're happy to help you with any questions you have or problems you may encounter, but we are not looking to share our space. The Neighborhood We're located in the north part of the East Rock neighborhood of New Haven, just a hop, skip, & jump from the restaurants & markets of East Rock. It's a tucked-in filled with young families where everyone knows each other and you'll see kids running around playing together. Check out our Guidebook for several recommendations of places in the neighborhood and downtown! Archie Moore's restaurant & bar is just down the street from us, and Romeo & Cesare's market is about a 2 minute walk away. There are also several markets & cafes within walking distance on Orange St., and many restaurants on State St. just a 10 minute walk away. We're also only a 2 minute walk from the beautiful East Rock Park, which has hiking trails and athletic fields for you to explore while you're here. If you hike up to the top of East Rock (about a 40 minute hike), you'll be treated to the best view of New Haven there is! It's about a 20 minute walk to Yale campus and downtown New Haven, but we're also on the Yale Shuttle route that will get you there sooner. There are also city bus stops located nearby for routes serviced by the CT Transit system. Getting Around There is street parking outside the house, and always spaces on the block. Both the Yale shuttle system and the CT Transit public buses have stops nearby our house. We're also very conveniently located for biking or walking around town. Please make arrangements ahead of time for getting from the train station to our house. You will likely need to hop in a taxi at the station to get to our address, unless you're up for about an hour long walk. Other Things to Note We are a married couple with an 9 year-old son and three dogs (2 greyhounds and 1 American pit bull terrier). The dogs do not go into the basement, so you will have little--if any--interaction with them, but they are part of the family and do make dog noises so light sleepers please take note! Please let us know if you have any concerns about the dogs and we're happy to work with you to make sure you're comfortable. We are usually up around 7:30 a.m., so you will hear us moving around in the morning, but we try to keep it down for our guests comfort. + More
rules: House Rules We will respect our guests' space and expect guests to respect ours. While you are welcome to make the room your own while you are here and and come & go as you please. We are flexible about pets, but have three dogs of our own, so please contact us to tell us about your pet, so we can decide whether or not it will work out. No smoking in the room or in the house, but you can go outside to smoke. + More

description: Description The Space If you're looking for a beautiful, quiet setting that is convenient to several major destinations in the Greater New Haven area, you'll find our location perfect. about: 2 bedroom suite w. private bath in separate area of large home. Private entrance. Spacious rooms, ample storage, comfortable mattresses. Tasty breakfast served. Next to trails. MA towns 5 miles. Bradley Airport/I-91. Hartford/Springfield 20 min.
description: Description The Space While the typical AirBnB accommodation is a single room next to other actively used areas of a private home, this space is a two-bedroom suite with private bath on the second floor, no other adjacent living space on the same floor. The rooms are large with plenty of closet, drawer, and other storage space. This suite is within a large home where the host lives. There is ample off-street parking and a garage bay for snowy day parking. The home is set within a beautiful wooded 6+ acre lot with a southwest mountain view. A unique feature is the beautiful koi pond and outdoor seating area (back lawn) as well as a large secure front lawn and paved area for sports and play. Guest Access Guests enter via a dedicated outside door which opens directly up the stairs to their suite. Adult guests may use the living room of the home which has a door for privacy when desired. Children may use the family room on a shared basis as well as the front yard, and back yard seating area with koi pond (adult supervision). On snowy days a bay in the attached garage is available for parking. The kitchen is open on a shared basis for occasional stove-top cooking, as well as refrigerator and cupboard space. Note that the guest bathroom also has a mini-fridge, microwave, and storage space. Please note that no guests beyond those specified are permitted to visit the property or stay overnight. Interaction with Guests The private entrance enables guests to come and go with or without interaction depending on their inclination. I take a concierge approach to hosting. I am very interested in people and enjoy having guests. My priority is to ensure guests feel welcome, comfortable, and well served. I can suggest local activities and sights based on your interests. Many items area are available for loan to support your visit so please don't hesitate to ask for assistance and advice with anything that can make your stay more enjoyable and convenient. While I greatly enjoy meeting people, listening, and engaging in conversation, if your preference is to have limited contact I respect that. Just let me know when you are available for communications needed for me to be a good host. I greet you upon arrival and am present at night and parts of the day. Please communicate house guidelines to others whom we have agreed will be staying here. The Neighborhood My neighborhood has mountain/sunset views and large wooded lots with lots of wildlife and birds. While secluded, it is five miles to Bradley Airport and many international corporations in my town and neighboring industrial towns of Windsor Locks and Windsor. You can walk or ride a bike to the Farmington Valley Greenway, part of the national Rails to Trails system. A public golf course is also just down the road. Within a 5-10 minute drive are many stores such as Starbucks, CVS pharmacy, Stop & Shop supermarket, and health food stores/deli's. A large variety of excellent restaurants are also a short drive away. Getting Around Bradley Airport is five miles away. Depending on flight times and my schedule, I can give you a ride to and from the airport. The Amtrak station is a few miles away - best way to get to New York City. There is also an express bus to Hartford which leaves from the same location. Express buses to NYC and Boston leave from Hartford (a 20 minute drive) frequently. Metro North to NYC departs every hour from New Haven, an hour's drive from my home. Boston is a 1 1/2 hour drive, all highways. For most local travel you will need your own automobile transportation. I have ample secure off-street parking and an attached garage space is usually made available on snowy days. Other Things to Note Guests will be asked to be considerate of water and electricity usage. + More
rules: House Rules I am opening up my home of many decades to share with others with the expectation that guests will be respectful of the care and attention that has been given to making this a comfortable, peaceful, attractive, and well-maintained property. about: A large bright & airy one bedroom & own private ensuite bathroom awaits you in a shared 2 bedroom/2 bathroom apt in the beautiful East Rock neighborhood of New Haven. Very convenient for travel to Yale, walk (20mins) or take Yale Shuttle (5mins)
description: Description The Space You have a large private bedroom with a very comfortable queen bed that can accommodate 2 adults. You have your own private ensuite bathroom complete with all amenities (shampoo, toothpaste, towels). In the room there is a large desk with office chair to spread out any work you may have. Finally there is a large walk-in closet to store any items you may bring with you and if you need additional storage then we have that as well. We will share the kitchen, living and dining space which all have lots of natural light and are tastefully decorated. I welcome guests to stay for a couple of days or a couple of months. I am flexible to meet your needs while you are staying in New Haven whether short term for Homecoming or long term for an internship or the school year! Guest Access Guests will receive their own key and can use the entire apartment and its amenities (kitchen, dining room, living room, sun room, BBQ & parking space) and of course WIFI is provided. Interaction with Guests I am very easy going and work during the day so we will see each other during the evening and on weekends, but I am very respectful, quiet and accommodating. If there is anything that you need please let me know! The Neighborhood This apartment is in the very beautiful and convenient neighborhood of East Rock. The neighborhood is young, hip and vibrant. There are many small boutique grocery stores, bars, restaurants and cafes that dot the tree lined streets of the neighborhood. It is very safe and inhabited by mostly Yale University students and professors. The apartment is near the end of a quiet street therefore noise is never an issue. Getting Around East Rock is convenient for walking, but we are right on the Yale Shuttle line which can get you to Yale in 5 minutes. There is included private and secure parking in the back of the apartment. We are also around the corner from Interstate 91 on-ramp which is a great jumping off point to get to Hartford in the North or Interstate 95 to travel to New York. Other Things to Note I am just moving into the apartment therefore it may look a little bare, but by the time you arrive it will be completely homey for your stay! + More
rules: House Rules No smoking or pets will be allowed to stay in the apartment. Other than that, just common courtesy is requested by guests. + More

about: Our private one bedroom is a cozy, quiet retreat that comfortably fits two. We are located in the historic Westville neighborhood of New Haven and are a short walk to the local park, the downtown busline, cafes, restaraunts and shops of Westville.
description: Description The Space This quiet, comfortable private room features a full size bed, writting desk, a large closet and beautiful natural lighting. Guest Access Guests will have access to the kitchen and bathroom as well as the back yard. Parking is ample. Wifi, heat and air conditioning are all also available. Interaction with Guests We lead full and somewhat busy lives so we will most likely be in and out during your stay. We are very friendly and love new people, but are also happy to respect your privacy and quiet time. The Neighborhood Westville is a historic nieborhood right outside downtown that offers a retreat from the city center but is still quite urban. Our house is a block away from Edgewood park and Westville offers several breakfast locations, dining, and modest entertainment. Please note we are not located in downtown New Haven and it is a 20 minute walk or about a 10 minute drive with traffic. We are centrally located between I95 and Rt. 15 the Merrit Parkway. Getting Around We are a block away from two direct downtown bus lines and a dedicated bicycle route. Walking, it takes about 15-20 mins to reach the city center, by car it takes less than 10. There is always street parking next to our house and we can advise you on how to park in downtown New Haven efficiently. Other Things to Note Our apartment is located on the third floor. We have another room in our apartment listed on airbnb so you may be sharing the bathroom/kitchen with other guests as well as Gary and Lisa. We have two friendly cats. Usually we keep them out of the guest room, but you are more than welcome to invite them in during your stay. {Please enter your actual travel dates to ask a question or book.} + More
rules: House Rules You are free to come and go at any time but we ask that you refrain from cooking and keep relatively quiet past 10pm. You will have full access to the kitchen and bathroom, there is a wing of the apartment that is kept private and is indicated as such. We ask that you clean up after yourself and label any personal items in the refrigerator to avoid confusion. This is a smoke free household. + More

description: Description The Space The location is ideal for someone looking for a base as they explore Conn. If you do not have a car, the house is located within walking distance to two city bus lines. We are walking distance to shops, dining and many amenities. Guest Access The House is a shared space, you have access to all of the common areas: Living Room, Dining Room, Kitchen, bath, powder room. Patio, yard. The bedrooms are private with Key lock access. about: Come enjoy the charm you can only get in a 1920's Tudor. Our relaxing guest bedroom is decorated to be a calming retreat. It has a queen sized bed that comfortably fits 2 people. Located with easy access to I-91, I-84, and I-691 in the middle of CT.
description: Description The Space Our house is a lovely brick Tudor style with a modern kitchen, updated bathrooms, and a fireplace in the formal living room. We have a spare bedroom with a queen size bed that is clean and well maintained. The room comfortably fits two people. There is a walk-in closet, 2 dressers, and a rocking chair for your use in the room. The bathroom is shared with us (1.5 bathrooms in house). We also have 2 cats and a beautiful Koi pond in the back yard. We have wifi access for our guests throughout the house. We provide our guests with coffee and tea and a light breakfast that may consist of oatmeal, fruit, and English muffins or bagels. Large flat screen TV with PS4 (Blueray) and streaming Netflix and Hulu in the TV room only. Air conditioning in the bedroom only when it is really hot (typically July and August). Parking is on street and always available. During the weekdays check in is after 6:30pm and checkout by 10am. Please check with me if you would like to check in/out earlier or later before you book. On Saturday or Sundays you can check in after 4pm and checkout by noon. Guest Access You are welcome to use the TV room, kitchen, dining room, formal living, sun porch, elliptical and workout area, and yard during your stay. Interaction with Guests We will be at home during your stay, but we give our guests as much privacy as they want. We are also happy to get a drink/dinner with you and chat. Interaction will be dependent on whatever the guest prefers. :) The Neighborhood We are a few minutes walk or drive to the Meriden Mall, Hubbard Park, walking/bike trail, grocery stores, restaurants, etc. We are about 25 min south of Hartford, 25 min north of New Haven (Yale), and 15 min west of Middletown (Wesleyan University). Getting Around There is an Amtrak train station just a few minutes away (~1.5 miles away). Other Things to Note **I require at least a day in advance notice for a stay. I can not accommodate you on the day that you request as I do not always keep the room ready for guests and need time to clean the room/house and put on clean sheets. Thank You! + More
rules: House Rules We do not allow smoking in the house and do not allow guests to bring pets. We also request that you try to be quiet between 11pm and 8am. Please be sure to turn the lights and air conditioning off in your room when you leave the room to save on electricity. Parking is on the street in front of our house. The road is a side street and is not heavily trafficked. + More

about: Charming detached loft bedroom [a 1/2 bath is just inside the backdoor to the house & the full bath is on the second floor of the home]. The loft has its own small table & chairs to eat at, a frig & a coffee maker, also an outside sitting area on a private deck, a full sized futon & a new queen sized bed. The stairs to the loft are steep [not for the elderly] It is walking distance to restaurants, banks, supermarket, & gas stations. You may see deer, racoons, or rabbits, definitely cows!
description: Description The Space Charming Dutch Colonial home surrounded by acres of farmland yet within walking distance of all amenities [restaurants, banks, supermarket, gas stations]. Yet, none are visible from the home which has views of the farm. There are often cows in the pasture, deer roam in and out of the yard at night, and yes you can hear both cicada & coyotes! Expect a quiet stay with a worldly hostess. There is a private loft over the garage a lovely bright southern exposure with a view of the rye field. The bathrooms are in the main house and would be shared. Come pick strawberries in Spring/Summer, then blueberries & your Christmas Tree in winter. I am a half hour from Yale in New Haven, an hour and a half from NY City, hour from Hartford, CT [Mark Twains home], and 3 hours from Boston, Mass. I am also a Massage Therapist trained internationally & a Reiki Energetic Healer, these services would be available to as well as guided hikes on the Blue Dot Trail. Guest Access The second floor of the house for showers. The first floor bathroom by the backdoor is the guests bathroom for their stay. Interaction with Guests As much interaction as the guest would like, from me being totally out of sight, to tea & coffee chats, to suggestions of fun things near by to do. The Neighborhood I love that it is NOT a neighborhood. It was a private farm years ago and the original owners family lives next door & raised beef cows. He hays the fields in the fall which is great fun to watch. Getting Around I am in walking distance of a bus route but a car is the most likely means of transportation. Other Things to Note Charge for more than 2, $15 extra. [There's a full size futon bed in the loft as well as the queen sized bed, so it could sleep 1-4 people. The loft over the detached garage is 15 x 24 and has a frig. and a coffee maker. Not really a good place for small children, or those having trouble with stairs. More of a place for singles and couples. Massages are available at $80 an hour & Reiki sessions for $60 an hour. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking, no pets. Unplug the frig when you leave & turn off the air conditioner / heat & the lights. Take the used coffee grinds from the maker & the garbage into the house proper. Remove the sheets and leave them in the first floor half bath. More of a place for singles and couples. Park in the driveway in front of one of the garage doors. + More

rules: House Rules Behave like professionals and adults. This is not a party house, though we encourage guests to interact and learn from each other. House Rules 1. The reservation is a (1) one person room only and does not support extended visitors to reside there. Guests are allowed to visit but in a manner so as not to disturb other tenants. In the event that a guest is expected, Landlord and other tenants shall be notified as a courtesy. A $50/week guest fee is strictly enforced. 2. Utilities are included in your rent, however, there is an allowance given for electricity/gas per unit, on a monthly basis. If it is exceeded this will be charged to you. Please be vigilant in turning off lights and not running heat/cool air constantly or using dryer excessively. Turn off lights when not in use. 3. The bathrooms and kitchen must be cleaned after every use. No exceptions. 4. Be courteous to your roommates. Be mindful of noise levels and keep common areas tidy. Under no circumstances are you to enter another roommate's room without permission. 5. Absolutely no smoking or burning candles in the house. Cigarettes are to be smoked outside and disposed of properly. 6. Parking of 2 vehicles is allotted on the side of the building. It is a shared lot and available on a first come-first serve basis. As it is a tandem lot, if you block a car in, you must move it for the car in front of you. On-street parking is available if these spaces are full. Landlord is not responsible for any damage to the vehicle, or its contents. 7. You will be given a front door code to access building. Please do not share this code with others. It is for your safety and the safety of other tenants. As a second line of security, it is advised that you also keep the front door to your unit locked at all times. We will distribute one front door key to each tenant. Each copy of the unit key must be returned after lease ends. 8.If tenant is found to be drinking heavily, using non-prescribed drugs, two or more weeks late on the rent or breaks any of the house rules, the Landlord may terminate his/her Rental Agreement pursuant to Clause J.2 in Lease. 9.Trash and Recycling receptacles are in the back of the unit. (2) Brown bins are for trash and (1) Blue bin is for recycling. Please contribute to wheeling out bins to the curb on Monday night for Trash Pick up Tuesday morning. 10. All communication with Landlord should be directed via listed contact info. + More

about: This room in MY HOME is painted calm, subdued grey and blue-great for unwinding and sleeping. Share my bathroom, kitchen and living room-more of a typical B & B experience than my larger listing
description: Description The Space Except for your guest room, my home interior is painted bold, vibrant colors. There is a medium size dorm fridge in your room. Though my cat sleeps upstairs with me, she is allowed in every room except the guest rooms. Guest Access The main floor kitchen, bathroom and living room are open for guest use. My personal living space is on the upper level and is NOT open for guest access. I don't have cable TV but I do have an extensive video library for use in the living room. Interaction with Guests I only accept bookings on nights that I can be home from work so I can really make myself accessible to my guests. I'll provide a few treats in your room and we can discuss breakfast preferences--I make great omelets and muffins! **Please let me know at the time of your booking what food allergies or sensitivities you have so I can begin snack and meal planning. The Neighborhood This is an old neighborhood. The homes are charming and diverse early 20th century construction and no two homes look alike. Please note, if you prefer contemporary developments this won't be to your taste. The neighborhood and residents are quirky and genuine. My house only has on street parking. There's plenty of room, as I have a long frontage, but it isn't to everyone's taste. My home was built in 1905. The back yard has a small body of water teeming with peep frogs and a pair of ducks each spring. The side yard is a meadow of wild flowers. There's a Starbuck's, Dunkin Donuts, Dairy Queen, McDonald's, Wendy's, Burger King, Five Guys, Little Caesar's and 99 Restaurant all within three miles. There's a great northern Italian restaurant, and equally fantastic Indian restaurant within walking distance as well as a good Irish pub and Vietnamese (the Pho is delicious) restaurant about a mile away. Mohegan Sun hosts numerous restaurants and shopping and is just 10 minutes away. Getting Around You'll need your own vehicle because the bus service here is poor. Taxis are available for casino and other local jaunts. There are many great destinations in Connecticut! Mohegan Sun is 10 minutes away; Foxwoods is about 15 minutes. In New London, the Garde Arts Center, Connecticut College, The Coast Guard Academy and Lyman Allyn Museum are about 15 minutes away. It's only half an hour to Mystic (Seaport and Aquarium); an hour to New Haven (Toad's Place, Yale, craft brewery, entertainment and night life); 30 minutes to Hartford (Trinity College, City Steam craft brewery, entertainment at XL Center and night life); 20 minutes to Willimantic (Eastern Connecticut State University, Willimantic Brewery (Willibrew craft brewery); 40 minutes to Storrs (UConn). Explore the CT Wine Trail or hike at Devil's Hopyard or Lantern Hill. In Essex, 40 minutes away, visit the CT River Museum, charming shops and the Griswold Inn, (one of the oldest bars in the country) where The Jovial Crew performs sea chanteys and other maritime music every Monday from 8 to 11 p.m. It's a unique form of entertainment that draws visitors from around the world. Recently the Griswold Inn appeared on the Huffington Post's list: The "10 Most Historic Restaurants and Inns in the World", with a nod to The Jovial Crew! Visit Gillette's Castle or catch a great show at The Goodspeed Opera House in East Haddam. You'll be well located for the next leg of your vacation continuing on to Boston, Providence, New York, New Hampshire, Vermont or any place else that beckons. Other Things to Note The most important thing to know is that I have a very friendly cat who will want to befriend you. I don't allow her in guest rooms but she has free access to every other room in the house so you will probably be loved up. ;) My house has only on street parking so please park on the same side of the street as the house so my neighbors won't be upset. Please park on the same side of the street as the house (preferably within my property frontage) to avoid upsetting my neighbors. + More
rules: House Rules Please remember that this is my home and treat it and my neighbors as you would want me to treat your home and neighbors. NO PETS OR SMOKING. Relative quiet between 10 p.m. and 9 a.m. to honor my tenant and me, please. + More

description: Description The Space 10 minute drive to YALE. 1890 victorian on the Quinnipiac river . The location makes for great day trip to train to NYC. Adjacent to the historic district. Clean, quiet and comfortable. Private basement apartment. Funky style, stone walls, painted concrete floors, exposed beams, pipes and wires. Perfect man cave / luxury camping under ground. But just around front you share an amazing porch overlooking the Quinnipiac River. Share patio, yard and grounds, outside shower and hot tub. It is a very old house and you can hear people walking around upstairs so if you're an early riser (and we have other guests) you may hear other people. Usually earplugs are not needed for sleeping but if you want to sleep in or want absolute silence keep that in mind. Ideal for the people who love unique, crazy, old, eclectic, industrial, historic, odd with a modern flare. It is not the Hilton, it's a basement. Pets are considered an extra guest. $20 per night Guest Access Private entrance, gated parking, full access to grounds. (You must check in before 8pm house manager is not available after 9pm unless it is an emergency.) Interaction with Guests We are available in person or by phone or email to answer any questions. The Neighborhood Historic oyster village just blocks away in the historic district. 10 min to downtown. Getting Around Bus stop in 1 block away. Takes you to downtown new haven. Train to NYC is every hour Other Things to Note To be clear, This is a basement apartment. It has no view from inside. It gets good light for a basement, but I took the photos at night to show it at its darkest. It has a ton of cool lights, a dehumidifier, air conditioning as well as a gas furnace, cable, wifi and well appointed kitchen. + More
rules: House Rules No partying, smoking or visitors without permission. All adult guests must provide ID and children must be related to registered guest. description: Description The Space full kitchen living room access no TV but I do have WiFI available Guest Access this is a homeshare opportunity so I will be on premise to let you in Interaction with Guests depending on your needs during travel, if you would like recommendations or if you prefer privacy I can be flexible to accommodate let me know your intentions for your stay Im much obliged I can even offer valet service from airport if requested for fair additional charge The Neighborhood HOME OF ESPN LAKE COMPOUNCE PARK, MEMORIAL MILITARY MUSEUM, AMERICAN CLOCK+WATCH MUSEUM, CAROUSEL MUSEUM, HARRY BARNES MEMORIAL NATURE CENTER, CHECK OUT BRISTOL CT OFFICIAL WEBSITE (URL HIDDEN) Getting Around Im in close proximity to Rt 6 Farmington Ave if you need to shop for anything groceries, clothes shoes sneakers ...also Bristol has a brand new bus system ! check out (URL HIDDEN) for scheduling Other Things to Note this is a quiet home inside but I wanted to let you know that Im on a busy city street. if you are a light sleeper you should consider that you can hear the traffic... Ive lived in this town since 1998 I run a lil hair salon here as well! It was voted "Best in Bristol" in Readers Choice Awards so if your hair needs TLC we can arrange that as well! + More
rules: House Rules House rule is the GOLDEN RULE "The Golden Rule or ethic of reciprocity is a moral maxim or principle which may appear as either a positive or negative injunction: One should treat others as one would like others to treat oneself (positive or directive form)." One would assume most people to be already familiar with basic etiquette but I will present a brief outline here in hopes to avoid awkward or confusing situations in advance. this is a NON SMOKING home You can smoke outside as long as you promise to throw your butts in a can provided thank you Schedules are majorly important if you are a night owl this would not be a good fit for us. although if you work 3rd shift thats fine :-) Personal space must be 100% respected It is very important to pay attention to social cues and not to take advantage or cross boundaries. You can not come back after check out and hang around. You can not help yourself to anyone elses personal belongings or groceries unless they are offered or its part of the deal we agreed to for example if breakfast is included it will be on your own shelf in the fridge/freezer/cabinet The arrangement we make and agree upon together is meant to be kept in order to benefit both guest and host I really enjoy having house guests. as you can see Im more concerned about people than things things are made to be used and sometimes they break but if you break or damage something more than $20 value you must be willing to fix or replace it. It is my 100% goal for you to feel welcomed, to be comfortable and have a memorable experience. I will go out of my way to help make your stay as happy and cozy as much as my time permits. Im so thankful for this opportunity on Airbnb its been a very fulfilling opportunity for many lets all do our part to keep it that way thank you very much Sincerely Andrea + More

about: This is a newly finished third floor private very quiet room with beautiful light, extraordinary views overlooking woods and gardens and Hartford skyline in the distance, hardwood floor, carpet, walk-in closet. You are literally in the treetops!
description: Description The Space This is a newly finished third floor private very quiet room with beautiful light, extraordinary views overlooking woods and gardens and Hartford skyline in the distance, hardwood floor, carpet, walk-in closet. Your own heating/cooling controls. You are literally in the tree tops. Amazing sun. Full kitchen, living room and very attractive and clean bathroom are shared with one other person. If you seek a long-term or temporary place to stay that is friendly, comfortable and beautiful, feels more like home and is less expensive than other options, staying here may be for you. The environment is friendly and relaxed. This is a warm and welcoming home, full of sun and surrounded by gardens including a pool and next to acres of woods, walking trails and a golf course. It is less than 10 minutes from Hartford and West Hartford, only 15 minutes from Bradley airport. We heat with a wood stove in winter and it is very cozy. We have a cat and a Lab. It is a 4-floor house. Artwork and quilts adorn the walls, vases of cut flowers from the garden in summer. You have full use of pool/gardens/ decks etc. Room is furnished. No smokers please. My three children (ages 13-15) live here half time and enjoy the people who share the home, and vice versa. Neighborhood is quiet and safe. Great place to walk, run, bike. Large beautiful golf course and reservoir with waterfall right next door. Guest Access Guests are welcome in all common areas of house and outside. Getting Around The house is .8 miles from nearest bus stop. + More

about: I have one large private guest room with office desk available and one private small guest room available. Updated kitchen to use and ample parking. Great location on a quiet residential street - 10 minutes to New Haven city central and to Sleeping Giant National Park.
description: Description The Space The large guest bedroom is very spacious and has a full sized bed with a desk/chair and also dressers. The small guest room has a storage queen bed with a closet. Guest Access The guest bedroom, wifi, kitchen for cooking/storing food purchases, downstairs half bath, shared full bath, laundry in basement, street or driveway parking available. Interaction with Guests I may or may not around for your entire stay - I will ensure you feel comfortable in the house and give you helpful hints to navigate the area. Guests are welcome to eat with me or not, to join in conversation or not, etc. if you have already stayed with me you can request to stay even if I am not there for the beginning of your trip. Females only unless men are accompanied by another female friend/partner. The Neighborhood It is very walk-able and it is close to everything - you can walk to a nearby Irish Pub, a local neighborhood grocer, a library, a trail, and the bus stop. Getting Around You can easily access public buses - a 5 min walk. It is about a 15 min bus ride to Yale. Other Things to Note I am a mid-30s professor at a local university who at times works from home. The house stays pretty quiet and I have no pets or kids. Please provide at least a couple of days notice before requesting a reservation and a message including some information about yourself and the reason for your stay. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking at all (either indoors or outside), no drugs, no excessive drinking, no pets, I just ask that you respect my home. Food is not provided but access to the kitchen is! about: Hi! Our names are Andrey and Marissa, and we are a couple of young professionals who have just relocated to West Hartford from Boston for Teach for America. We love people and we love to cook and to make music. Welcome to our home, new friends.
description: Description The Space We have a creative, warm space that embodies our idea of a true home. Our two-bedroom, two-floor apartment in West Hartford has several sleeping arrangements available. There is a private room available for rental with up to three on single air-mattresses, a futon that sleeps two, and an XL bean bag chair that comfortably sleeps two average adults. Guest Access There are two bathrooms (one shower/bath) that are cleaned regularly (we live here too!), and a full kitchen. We also have a computer station and a piano/keyboard in the living room that is open to guests. Guests have access to the PS4 and the Apple TV, with full Netflix access. Ride service is available upon request for an additional fee. Laundry is $1.50 per load per washer or dryer. (Laundry service available for additional fee.) Interaction with Guests As much or as little as you would like! We are happy to respect your time and privacy, but we are also would love to get to know you along your travels. Choose your own adventure with us! The Neighborhood West Hartford is a vibrant community that is home to artists, entrepreneurs, and educators. Adjacent to the City of Hartford, West Hartford is a clean and safe area that is family friendly. There is a bi-weekly farmers' market, and many seasonal festivals and events. Getting Around There is a public bus system that runs regularly. Other Things to Note We are a pair of Bostonians with business degrees and big dreams, and we also happen to be elementary school teachers and entrepreneurs. + More

about: Our newly built and comfortable home has the amazing feeling of a get away retreat.This suite comfortably fits 4 and is in walking distance to Ski Sundown and hiking trails. Enjoy a private suite, cozy living room with TV, WIFI.
description: Description The Space Our newly built and comfortable home has the amazing feel of a get away retreat. It comfortably fits two and is in walking distance to Ski Sundown and the CT. Blue Ridge Hiking Trails. Enjoy a private room, gourmet kitchen and the CAFE. Kayak, Hike, Bike, Tubing all here. Adventure Cycling Association- Atlantic Coast Section 2 we are 1 mile from RT 219 on Ratlum RD. We have another listing of this one not available. www.airbnb.com/rooms/(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Take a hike during the leaf changing season and enjoy the beautiful colors of nature. It is absolutely breath taking. (Sept to Oct). During the snow season enjoy skiing and snow boarding at Ski Sundown which is in walking distance from our home. After a fun filled day of skiing enjoy a cup of hot coco or coffee by our relaxing wood burning stove. Guest Access -Your accommodations are a spacious private bedroom with a queen size bed. Private door leading to a shared full bathroom. Bedroom window shows beautiful views of the forest. -Use of fully equipped gourmet kitchen, inviting great room with many french doors that lead to an oversize deck with chairs and a table to sit, relax and enjoy your morning coffee. -Second room available with a twin bed to accommodate additional guests, at an additional cost. Interaction with Guests We will be present in the home during your stay and will interact with you if you like or give you as much privacy as you wish. The Neighborhood Our neighborhood is quiet and I enjoy listening to the sounds of the morning birds and the river flowing behind our home. Peoples State Forest is located in the Pleasant Valley section of Barkhamsted. The forest was established in 1924 through the efforts of the Connecticut Forest and Park Association. The West Branch of the Farmington River, designated as a Wild and Scenic River by the National Park Service, is the center point of river-based recreational activities including trout fishing, canoeing, kayaking and tubing. Other attractions include the 200 year old white pine picnic groves in the Matthies Grove and Whittemore Recreation Areas, over 11 miles of hiking trails, the Barkhamsted Lighthouse and other cultural and historic sites. Near by trails you can enjoy. Indian tail, Tunix trail, Ratlum mountain, lake McDonough and people state forest. Hiking can be 2 miles or 4 miles. Pack a lunch and enjoy a full day out in nature. We can drop you off and pick you up at trail locations. Getting Around -Plenty of parking space on property. -30 minutes from Bradley International Airport. Other Things to Note We have 3 beautiful dogs: Preston, Primo and Sage. They do not have access to kitchen or bedroom areas. Occasionally they will bark so if you don't mind the sounds of them speaking then you will be okay here. + More

about: Enjoy a stay in a 1950s cottage designed like an old farm house. Enjoy the view of the private, large, park-like backyard, surrounded by woods from your bedroom window. You may see deer grazing or wild turkeys in the early morning or at sundown.
description: Description The Space Welcome budget-minded travelers, outdoor enthusiasts, quiet, considerate, friendly folks! PLEASE, KINDLY TAKE A MOMENT TO READ THIS DESCRIPTION. IT SHOULD ANSWER MANY OF YOUR QUESTIONS... Offering a lovely, cozy, single-dwelling HOUSE that is designed like an old farm house with the kitchen as the center of the house. It is in a quiet neighborhood. The bedroom is the sun porch of the house. It has windows on 2 sides that look out on a private backyard surrounded by trees. There is partition that closes off the sleeping area so you have privacy. The closet is outside the sleeping area. You enter the bedroom area through the kitchen and down one step. The bathroom is off the kitchen in a sitting room. NOTE: There are 5 indoor cats, all friendly and quiet except at feeding time, and a small 20 pound dog who is very friendly. If you have allergies to pets, this is not a good place to stay. But if you love pets, you will love these 4-legged characters. BEDROOM: Comfy, full size, double bed, typically for single individuals due to space and size of bed. However, two can sleep well, depending on your size and needs, I accept $30 add'l cost per person per night. Small flat screen TV in room where you can play DVDs. WiFi is available for your laptop. This room was originally a sun porch, as mentioned above, converted to a bedroom for guests so it is bright and cheerful with windows on 2 walls facing the side and back of the house. When you look out of the windows, it feels like you're looking out of a tree house because you are one story above the yard. In order to maintain a way to get to the deck and maintain your privacy, there is a partition of bi-fold doors (which can be seen in one of the photos). The sleeping area on one side of the partition is almost 8 ft deep x 10 ft wide, with a closet outside the sleep area. ADDITIONAL GUESTS: I can accept a 3rd person who can use the queen-sized sofa bed in the living room. Not much privacy but it's great for a child, especially if s/he likes a cat to curl up with. Because it is a shared bathroom, when there is more than one guest, short stays are best. The add'l guest fee is $30/pp. BATHROOM: SHARED WITH HOST (and the occasional add'l guest(s). No private bathroom facilities are available. Shelf available for personal toiletries. FRESH TOWELS/LINENS PROVIDED. Guests who stay for more than 1 night will use same bed linens. Stays that exceed a week will have their linens laundered. **Guest(s) may use the shampoo, shower wash and soap. **SORRY, no LAUNDRY facilities are available for short-term stays (less than 7 days). KINDLY READ/HONOR THE "HOUSE RULES" & "HOUSE MANUAL". Just some basic, simple requests are stated. Airbnb provides these details also on the confirmed ITINERARY sent to each guest. Please take the time to read it thoroughly, I cannot take responsibility for you in that realm. EAT-IN KITCHEN has all the amenities  refrigerator, stove/oven, extra cabinet space, shelf in fridge, toaster oven, coffeemaker, great selection of utensils, microwave, dishwasher. Host offers some teas, and coffee. If you have a preference, bring your own preferred morning beverage and use the coffeemaker! THE DRIVEWAY is a slope downward below street level. It, at first may feel a bit daunting, but once you've driven it, you'll see that it isn't bad at all. I've lived here for 5 years and don't even think about it. Because the house is on a curvy road, there is a blind spot on one side of the driveway. Once I tell you the "secret" of how to make sure there is no oncoming traffic from that side when you exit the driveway, you will find getting out of the driveway easy. OTHER CONVENIENCES: High speed internet available. Sorry, no computer available. Living room has a 32" flat-panel TV. If you want to bring/rent DVDs to watch, that's fine with me. If you want to use the living room TV instead of in the bedroom, please check with me to be sure I have nothing scheduled for that time frame. ADD'L PETS? Sorry, cannot accept add'l guest pets -- although I might consider, if pet is small and can be kept in the room. There would be an add'l fee and pet deposit. NEARBY: The house is on a well traveled country" road north of downtown Danbury. Restaurants, shopping, hospital parks, and public beach and boat ramp (if you have a boat with you) (Candlewood Town Park) are less than a 1/2 mile away. Hiking trails are about 10 minutes away. The house is 5 minutes from the hospital and Western Connecticut State University. It's very easy to get around this town and there are a lot of outdoor activities in the Fall, Spring and Summer months! Pleased to meet your acquaintance!!  Shelley Guest Access Guest has access to their room, the shared bathroom, kitchen, deck/yard, living room. Interaction with Guests I'm self-employed and tend to be in and out throughout day and eves. When I'm here, I'm happy to chat w/ the guest(s) and share experiences, or help them with where to go and what to do. Happy to be at your disposal. The Neighborhood Quiet residential neighborhood in north Danbury. Close to trails/parks. House is surrounded by woods on 3 sides. It is a private, park like setting, There is a large deck w/ table and chairs and a lounge chair. Sometimes in the morning or evening you can see deer grazing in the backyard from the bedroom window. My home is about 3 miles from downtown Danbury and WCSU downtown campus Getting Around Having a car s critical to getting around. Danbury has a bus system but I never use it. Other Things to Note NOTE: There is a security system and after you make your reservations, You will find out the code for the alarm and how to use it after registration. PARKING: Guests can park in the driveway. The driveway is a steep slope down from the street to the base of the front yard, next to the house. At first it may seem intimidating, but it is really pretty easy to maneuver. + More
rules: House Rules MAIN GOAL: COMMUNICATION. Please communicate (and respond when I do) via email (either Airbnb or personal), home phone or cell. This is important. If you need something or something is lacking or there is a problem, I cannot know or help you unless you share it with me DURING YOUR STAY. INTERNET ACCESS (WiFi)- location: I will give it to you after registration.  Please, NO smoking of tobacco or other "smokeables" inside or within 100 feet of house. Much appreciated.  Prefer: Snacks/meals/food to be eaten in kitchen/dining area, NOT bedroom: Water/clear liquids okay- but please: No red wine, coffee, dark foods/beverages, or meals consumed in bedrooms!! Thanks for your consideration  Quiet (tip-toe_) by 10 pm latest. I usually wake up before 7 am most mornings. I will be respectful of your sleeping habits as well.  Shared bathroom w/ host & occasional other guest(s).  Thermostats control temps for winter and summer for main level of house. I keep it pretty constant at 69_ -70_ in winter  In summer, the central A/C is set to 75_-78_  There is a shelf in the fridge available for guests on the top right side (marked). Also, cabinet shelf available for use in upper cabinet, to the right of refrigerator.  Please rinse & put dirty dishes in dishwasher (unless it's full or just cleaned, and not emptied yet).  You will find out where the Key for entry to front door of house is after registration. Please return the key to that spot upon departure, PARKING: Off street parking in driveway I welcome you with hospitality and appreciate you honoring the above requests. It is best to let you know the house rules before you register so you know what to expect. Thank you. Thank you for your respect and I hope you have a comfortable stay.  Shelley + More

about: Furnished bedroom available from January near Yale-New Haven Hospital. The bright and airy 3-bedroom apartment is located in historic riverfront neighborhood. Modern kitchen, laundry in building, off-street parking and restaurants nearby.
description: Description The Space Located in a small historic riverfront district of New Haven, the apt is located 10 min driving distance to Yale University and Yale-New Haven Hospital and downtown New Haven. Guest Access You will have full access to the whole apartment: the living room, the dining room, kitchen, 3 decks, the yard, laundry room. Interaction with Guests I'm happy to share where to eat, go, entertain, etc in and around New Haven. There are also some great towns nearby in New England that you must visit if you're new to the area! The Neighborhood The Boathouse Cafe, The Yacht Club Getting Around You should bring a car to get around, but there are public transportations on Grand Ave. Other Things to Note Travel RN's Welcome! I'm a full time RN at the Yale-New Haven Hospital. I've had travel RNs before and had great experiences. + More

about: Our room is located in Norwalk, CT walking distance to South Norwalk's trendy restaurants, bars, theatres and the train station. New York is an hour by car or train and the Amtrak to Boston is less than 3 hours.
description: Description The Space Our room is located in Norwalk, CT walking distance to South Norwalk's trendy restaurants, bars, theatres and the train station. New York is an hour by car or train and the Amtrak to Boston is less than 3 hours. You can visit the best of the Northeast in just a few days! Guest Access We will provide fresh sheets and towels. The bathroom is shared and you are more than welcome to use our kitchen and leave your groceries in our fridge. We also have free parking on premise (off-street). Interaction with Guests While we will be as accommodating as possible with your travel needs, we only ask that you please arrive by 10 PM as we both are up early for work. The Neighborhood The district is pleasant and quiet. Getting Around Train station of South Norwalk close. + More

about: Access to living room w/ fireplace, porch, yard, eat-in-kitchen, 1-1/2 baths, cable/internet. 2 blocks to Main St., highway & bus. Off street parking. 2 friendly cats. I am an environmentally conscious college professor and we share the full bath.
description: Description The Space The fireplace, back yard and porch, and fully loaded cable/DVR promote relaxation. Cooks will love the well stocked kitchen utensils, pots, etc. and the grill. Non-cooks will love the many restaurants 2 blocks away on Main St. Just a few minutes by car or bus from Yale Univ., Yale New Haven Hospital, and downtown New Haven. 5 zone heat/AC keeps it the temperature you prefer. You must be a quiet, neat, non-smoking individual or couple. Only shorter stays and an extra charge for two people. I can't accommodate more than one person for longer than a week. Environmentally conscious household with two friendly cats. Guest Access Full house available for your use as well as yard, grill, and porch. Modern appliances, including laundry and dishwasher. Interaction with Guests I can enjoy socializing and meeting new people, but it depends on how busy I am at work. I typically work from home in the mornings, and sometimes all day Friday (I am a college professor), returning home in the evenings in time for dinner. I am respectful of privacy if you want quiet time in your room. The Neighborhood East Haven is a small town minutes from downtown New Haven, Yale Univ. and other area colleges, as well as Yale New Haven Hospital by car (or bus). Main Street (2 blocks away) has many restaurants, a library, town green, ice cream shop, bakery, etc. The shoreline (Long Island Sound) is 2 miles south. Very close to all major highways. Getting Around The bus stop for travel in to New Haven is 2 blocks away and buses converge in downtown New Haven making transfers easy. However late night public transportation other than taxis is not available. Free off street parking is available at the house. Tweed airport is just minutes away by car. Bradley airport is an hour away. Trains and buses into New Haven are 10 minutes away by taxi. Other Things to Note My home is bright, cozy, cheerful, clean, quiet, well-cared for, and friendly. Feel at home with a kitty on your lap in front of the fireplace watching a movie sipping wine, or enjoy your privacy in your large comfortable room with cable, phone and internet. + More
rules: House Rules Quiet, neat, non-smoking. Gentle and loving with animals. Respect recycling house rules. + More

about: Escape to the Litchfield County. Our spacious room with a full bed and attached bathroom, overlooks the beautiful Farmington River. Feast on our organic breakfast. Spend the day enjoying our great outdoors or just relaxing!
description: Description The Space This space is easily accessed via our front door, up a set of stairs. It is a great additional room for families that have booked our first room and need more space. Guest Access You will have access to the room, attached bathroom and kitchen access. Breakfast is included. Interaction with Guests We are readily available on the property and also have cell phone access that we will provide to you, upon booking. Other Things to Note Our area is one of the most scenic in New England. Our home sits directly on the Greenwoods Pool fly fishing area of the Farmington River. It has easy access to People's State Forest for hiking. We have 3 bikes available for your use while you are here. In the winter months, we have snow-shoes available and we are 5 minutes from Ski Sundown and 45 minutes from Butternut in Great Barrington, Ma. We have some of the finest dining in New England with a wide range of farm to table restaurants in Litchfield County. For an additional charge, we have a massage therapist and yoga instructor affiliated with my business, Passiflora, a local organic caf in New Hartford, Ct, who can be booked for private sessions. Our chef can provide a customized cooking class, as well, with an eye to vegan, vegetarian, gluten-free and plant-based eating. You can feast on this class as your dinner while on our property. + More
rules: House Rules You are welcome to bring your pets, but since they may love it here in the country, make sure to keep them close at hand. We do not allow smoking in our home. We have an organic garden, and we are in to a very natural, organic healthy lifestyle. This is your kind of place if you are into a meditative, nature-based environment. For example, we do not have TVs in the rooms. We expect you to be quiet and peaceful while in our home. Only fully registered guests may enter our home. + More

about: Charming private room in 3 bedroom home at the foot of East Rock park, minutes from downtown New Haven and Yale; quiet, safe neighborhood with plenty of free parking; convenient to public transportation with bus stop on the corner.
description: Description The Space Large, bright, private room with 2 single beds and a bunk bed for the kids. Coffee and tea provided. Coffee maker and mini-fridge in your room. Wi-fi available throughout the house. Guest Access Guests have a private room with a shared bath and limited use of the kitchen and laundry. Interaction with Guests We live in the house with our sweet dog, Lola and our grumpy cat, Ruby. You will have a key to the house so you may come and go as you please. We just ask you to be quiet on your way up to your room if it's late. We are happy to help with information, directions and anything you may need. We really want your stay to be a pleasant one! The Neighborhood We are right on the border between New Haven and Hamden, convenient to Yale, Quinnipiac, and Southern Connecticut State University. The neighborhood is safe and quiet. Getting Around There is a bus stop on the corner--buses to downtown New Haven and Yale campus. + More

about: Very comfortable living space in bucolic, quiet neighborhood. Easy access to highway, bus line, supermarkets and nighttime activities. Balcony facing street is a great place to relax, read or dine weather permitting. Room has a/c and ceiling fan.
description: Description The Space Condo is extremely cozy and very conveniently located to supermarkets, shopping, library, movie theater, restaurants. Situated on 2nd floor of a 3 story older building housing 6 units. It is a few blocks from the highway and 1 block from the bus line. Room offers lots of drawer space, closet, desk, ceiling fan and a/c in window when needed. Bedroom is several rooms away from my bedroom for added privacy. My dogs are not allowed in your room without your permission. They are kept close to me and gated in whatever part of the house I might be in. They are very social pets and are very use to strangers since they are with me at my retail business every day I am very social and can chat away for hours but will respect guests' need for privacy. Area is very pretty with old maple and oak trees, vintage brick buildings built in the 1920's. Neighbors always dog walking, running, walking, biking. Hanging out on balconies, sipping wine & reading when weather permitting bus line 1/2 block away Taxi/Uber available from airport or I can pick up guests for a $45 fee Highway is 5 blocks away Parking is available around the corner at Church parking lot for nominal fee of $4/night. Payable to me. I reserve space for guests. Parking on street not permitted by town from 2 AM till 5 AM Must like dogs but have no pets of your own. Guest Access washer/dryer, fireplace, kitchen, balcony, one shared bathroom, living room dining room Interaction with Guests as little or as much as they want. I've lots of great stories and love to chatter but will respect guest's privacy if they need their space. The Neighborhood very bucolic, quiet neighborhood close to everything. Sports clubs nearby, ice skating rink/indoor swimming pool in town. Bike, hike, walk at the Reservoir 2miles up the road. Getting Around 1/2 block from condo - bus Bradley airport is 1/2 hour or less - limited transportation from airport Exit 43 off Rt 84 I charge $45 for pick up at airport Other Things to Note Restaurants, Super Markets, Shopping, Cinema, library all within blocks of condo. + More
rules: House Rules keep their room reasonably neat and clean; wash their dishes, etc. when cooking; keep the bathroom clean after usage. participate in cleaning common areas or pay 1/2 for housecleaner of common areas if long term stay. No Smoking No Pets (my own dogs love other people) + More

about: Just minutes from East Rock Park, we have a wonderful private room with an en-suite bath. The building is atop a hill, creating a sunny peaceful vibe, and just minutes walk from Yale's science hill and plenty of restaurants and stores.
description: Description The Space Sunny, clean and peaceful. Our apartment is in a beautiful old apartment building on top of a hill between Whitney and Orange. The building is reminiscent of an old school building. There is a lovely green space in front of the building. It is great to sit under the tree and enjoy a book. Guest Access High speed internet, large kitchen, piano, 42" TV with HDMI input for computers, private bathroom attached to the room, air mattress is available for additional guests. Interaction with Guests During the summer of 2015 there will be barley anyone in the apartment. One of the three roommates may be back occasionally. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is wonderful. The apartment is a short walk to Yale's school of Forestry and Environmental Science, as well as the Divinity School and other facilities on "Science Hill." We are a walkable distance from downtown, but it could take 20 minutes. It is only a 2-5 minute drive downtown. There are three lovely Italian deli's within a few blocks. The Wine Thief is a choice liquor store across the street. One of the best things about the neighborhood is East Rock park, offering trails, a pond and sports fields. Getting Around The Yale Shuttle runs past our corner at Whitney and Linden. Other Things to Note We love this place and hope you will too! + More
rules: House Rules Treat the space as if it was your own. We are pretty relaxed, and dont own much stuff, but the stuff we do have we really cherish. Feel free to enjoy the piano and record player, just treat it as if it was important to you too. + More

about: 3 furnished rooms available in quiet, relaxing, peaceful home located in safe residential area. 1 room is a single room. Another room is a shared room for 2 people (2 separate beds), and a third room is a room for 1 person or a couple (has 1 larger bed). Home is 10 min walk to bus stop. By car, it is 7 min to shopping mall, 20 min to the lovely West Hartford Center/Blueback Square, 20 minutes to UCONN-Storrs, just 1+ mi from downtown Manchester.
description: Description Guest Access Guests will have access to 2nd floor apartment where there is a full kitchen, full bath, and 3 private bedrooms. I live on the first floor apartment and am accessible when home. Guests are welcome to use the deck on the first floor, or sit out on the lawn. Interaction with Guests I am happy to interact with guests as you desire when I am home from work. Sometimes I go to work late and work late, other times I go to work early and come back early. Variable schedule. I am happy to recommend places to visit, best ways to get somewhere, things to do, best ways to save money on travel, etc. Getting Around Home is located 8-10 minute walk from the nearest bus stop on Hartford Road. From there, you can take bus in one direction into Hartford (where you can then transfer to other routes), or in the other direction to the Buckland Hills Mall in Manchester. Depending upon your travel goals/purpose/destination, it may be more time efficient to rent a car. + More
rules: House Rules Please clean up after yourself in the kitchen and bathroom, which are both shared with other guests/tenants. Please keep voices down in common areas during sleeping times. Absolutely no smoking in the house or on the property. No drugs or illegal substances. No pets allowed, as I already have "a zoo" on the first floor... 2 dogs and a cat! :) + More

about: Welcome to The Regency!
description: Description The Space This contemporary raised ranch has been completely renovated over the past three years. There are three private bedrooms available, each room can accommodate up to two adults. All bedrooms feature large windows, closet space and comfortable full/queen mattresses. One full bathroom is shared between the occupants in the Morning Light and Northern View bedrooms. The Reflections bedroom features a larger space and private bathroom. Morning Light and Northern View bedrooms are $50/night. The Reflections bedroom is $70/night. Please specify how many rooms you desire to book. Weekend check in times are flexible. Guest Access Wifi, off street parking, bedding, towels, and shared kitchen (pots, pans, plates, silverware and appliances) are included. Enormous kitchen with new stainless appliances, ample natural and artificial lighting, and a breakfast bar style island. Kitchen is open to the vaulted great room and elevated rear deck which overlooks the .5 acre grassy lot. Interaction with Guests More interaction between host and guest results in a better experience for both parties! :-) The kitchen island quickly converts into a superb ping pong table, challengers encouraged. about: Walk to downtown Middletown, a small city on the Connecticut River, and Wesleyan University. This small room has two twin beds and shares a bathroom with one other room. Guests may also use the kitchen, TV (in the parlor), garden, and hammock.
description: Description The Space Clover Nook is set next to a ravine complete with a creek that can become a torrent in the spring. It is a two-family house with a door between the kitchens. This bedroom is small and most suitable for kids, the budget conscious, and small people--the beds are short. It does not have air conditioning, but it does have a window fan. It's on the driveway, which we share with the house next door, so it can be noisy during the daytime. The room shares a bathroom with the larger bedroom down the hall. It's suitable for a maximum of two people. I usually cannot accommodate last-minute bookings. Guest Access Guests are welcome to use the kitchen for simple cooking or just as a place to hang out. The house has wireless Internet. I don't have much in the way of TV (very basic cable), but I do have Netflix. There is only one TV, which is in the parlor. When the weather is good, guests are welcome to use the garden and the back area. I hesitate to call it a patio because it is where I pot plants, but it is where we grill and build fires. We have a battered fire pit and plenty of wood. Interaction with Guests I will be in the house during your stay. I work at home, so if you need me for anything, you will find me in my office--or the garden. The Neighborhood This is an ethnically and culturally mixed neighborhood, and it is mixed zoning. Clover Nook once housed a beauty parlor; we found two of those old-fashioned hair dryers with the huge hoods in the basement. Toward the end of the street stands a collection of very small houses that were probably built to house mill employees. At the very end is the house where the songwriter Henry Clay Work was born. Among his best-known tunes are "Marching Through Georgia" and "My Grandfather's Clock." There is a statue of Work on Middletown's South Green, which is a few blocks from the house. Downtown Restaurants (listed in order of distance, farthest away first) Tibetan Kitchen Located at 574 Main Street, Tibetan Kitchen is an unassuming little place with great food. I have no idea whether it is authentic, but it's certainly delicious. There is something for everyone here: curries, soups, dumplings, and more and lots of vegan and vegetarian options. BYOB (there is a corking fee). Bring patienceservice can be slow and the place can get very busy, but the wait is well worth it. Also bring cashno checks or credit cards are accepted. Closed Sundays. Iguanas Ranas Taquer_a Iguanas Ranas, 484 Main Street, is a family business that started small and keeps growing. I like everything I've had there but adore the fish tacos. The place gets noisy at night, so we usually go for lunch and try to get a table in the window. Full bar. Closed Sundays. Caf 56 Caf 56, at 102 Court Street, is one of our favorite Middletown restaurants. Open for breakfast and lunch, it features foods and culinary traditions from different countries and ethnicities. From the website: The goal at Caf 56 is to provide the customers with the experience of the different tastes from around the world." The chef and owner is Sabrina Cortes, who is from Guatemala City. She also serves, buses tables, chats with everyone, and generally sees to everything. Ed Thereault bakes scones, croissants (real ones), country buttermilk biscuits, cinnamon rolls, and a variety of coffee cakes and muffins every morning. He also creates delicious desserts; some of his specialties include the Caf 56 red velveteen cake with caramel buttercream icing and a coconut lime cake. Closed Sundays. Fiore II Restaurant This Italian restaurant, at 332 Main Street, is very pretty inside and out. All the food looks wonderful, but I always end up ordering scampi and trying to talk someone into sharing a bowl of lobster bisque. Beer and wine are available. I don't know whether other alcohol is served, but I'll find out and revise this. Closed Mondays. Amici Italian Grill Amici's, 280 Main Street, specializes in northern Italian cooking. It has a full bar and is often crowded, especially on weekend nights. Open every day for lunch and dinner. Getting Around Middletown does have a bus system, and I have a schedule, but most people drive, walk, or bike. Parking is available in the driveway or on the street. Other Things to Note When a guest arrived recently, she asked if we could recommend a good massage therapist. We said sure--ours. Lugging her table, Joan made a house call. Everyone was pleased, and Joan decided she would be happy to do it again. If anyone who books at Clover Nook would like to arrange for a massage, I will pass along Joan's number after the booking, and Joan and the guest can make whatever arrangement they like. We have an ancient cat who has the run of the house; however, she hasn't been in the small bedroom for years. + More
rules: House Rules No smoking is allowed in the house. I cannot welcome pets at this point because of the cat, but in the future, I plan to accommodate well-behaved dogs. + More

about: I am subletting my room for the summer in a 2 floor apartment with perks as follows:
description: Description The Space I am a Yale School of Management student that will be away for the summer, so I am subletting my fully furnished room in a huge two floor apartment. There are four bedrooms total with two bedrooms on each floor. One of my current roommates who is also a Yale School of Management student will be staying in his room during the summer. The other three rooms, including mine, will likely be occupied by other subletters. The space is absolutely giant and offers two living rooms, so sharing the tv is usually never a problem. Also, we have two giant couches perfect for movie watching and relaxing. Also my room has an a/c unit in it. Although it is a bit old but with the ceiling fan, they should keep you cool during the summer. Last, my apartment is about a 10 minute walk to SOM and Science Hill. It is also about a 5 minute walk to beautiful East Rock park where you can enjoy a walk by the river or a hike up East Rock to see a beautiful view of the city. It's a perfect spot for a run or a picnic. + More

about: A comfortable room in a charming house in a safe neighborhood! Minutes to Yale, easy parking, and plenty of room for a longer stay. I love helping guests find their way and am happy to help out with tips and hints to make your stay memorable.
description: Description The Space Spacious bedroom with full-size bed and workspace in charming Victorian home with all mod-cons: updated kitchen, jacuzzi tub, and high-speed cable internet. No TV, but you can stream over wireless, and settle in by the wood stove on chilly winter nights. AC available in the summer for your bedroom. Downtown New Haven is a short, ten-minute drive or quick bus trip down Whitney Avenue, and Whitneyville village is three blocks away. The neighborhood is safe and walkable, and you will find Books and Co. (with its attached coffee shop), the Whitneyville Food Center, and the Playwright Pub among the many small shops around the corner. Also within walking distance is Soup Girl, with a delectable selection of daily soups (and ridiculously good cupcakes), and Le Petit Gourmet, which has a small but yummy selections of sweet and savory foods to eat in or take out. This room is a great place to settle in for a longer stay and I have hosted several month-long lodgers. You will have your own walk-in closet with dresser and plenty of hanging space, and you will have access to an ironing board, iron, hair dryer and other homey things you might need, but wouldn't want to bring with you. During longer stays, you will have access to fresh sheets and towels every week to change at your convenience. You will also be welcome to share some cereal and coffee/tea during the first few days of your stay, but should plan to make your own breakfasts if you'll be here for more than a week. The house is "shoes off upstairs" so plan to bring some house slippers for the cooler months. Personable cat in residence. Guest Access Guests are welcome to use the kitchen, dining area and living room during the day and evening as well as the washer and dryer on the premises. The kitchen is available for making breakfast and light food prep -- please contact me in advance if you would like to prepare more than the occasional meal at home during your stay. Parking is on the street, but always available. Quiet hours from 11 pm to 7 am. The main bathroom/shower upstairs is shared, and there is a half bathroom on the first floor. Interaction with Guests I like to make sure that I'm available as needed by my guests. Whether you need a restaurant recommendation or a lift to the train station downtown, I'm mindful of what it is that you might need most to make your stay better. Sometimes it's quiet undisturbed space to unwind after a day meetings and interviews, and sometimes it's a long chat over coffee and breakfastevery stay is a little different. The Neighborhood Whitneyville is the old village that housed the workers at Ely Whitney's cotton mill. I live a couple of blocks from the "center" which has a well-appointed food market, a bookstore/cafe, a gourmet bistro, a homey pub, and a marvelous soup and cupcake shop. The neighborhood is filled with 1920s houses, is safe and walkable, and has a great vibe. Larger grocery stores and chain restaurants are close by on Dixwell ave. Getting Around It usually takes no more than 15 minutes door to door to get anywhere in downtown New Haven (including parking). The route is a straight run down Whitney Ave. right to the green and the heart of the Yale campus. There is half-hour to hourly bus service to downtown New Haven from a stop approximately four walked blocks from my door. Other Things to Note A simple breakfast will be provided (cold or hot cereal, coffee/tea, yoghurt, fresh fruit, etc.). + More
rules: House Rules Non-registered guests (that is, anyone not registered to stay at the house) not allowed without advance notice. No smoking, no pets. Use of the woodstove is strictly forbidden. No exceptions. Quiet hours from 11pm to 7am. + More
