about: Our beautiful two bedroom apartment in this 1880's multi-family home in Wooster Square is fully furnished, tastefully decorated, and just a 10-15 minute walk from the downtown area and the Yale campus. Perfect for a couple or visiting researchers.
description: Description The Space From the exterior, this 1880's house is charming and inviting. The front door is your private entrance, which opens up into a large second floor space that feels like a cross between a tree house and a modern loft. The dynamic architecture offers both privacy and bright and free-flowing spaces. Inspired by European libraries, the living room has a high, cathedral-like ceiling and a warm, cozy feelperfect for reading, studying, and entertaining. The master bedroom is equipped with two closets and a queen bed. Upstairs on the third floor there is a seating area and entertainment room with a half bath, which can easily be used as a second bedroom. The kitchen comes fully stocked with ample counter space and a gas stove. Utilities are included. Guest Access Washer and dryer are free and shared with the other units. Bed linens, towels, and a queen air mattress for guests are available upon request. Interaction with Guests Though we will not be here during your stay, we will put you in contact with the building engineer should you lose your keys or anything be in need of repair. The Neighborhood The historic Wooster Square neighborhood is beautiful, quiet, and charming. The place is just one block away from Wooster Square park and a five minute walk from Little Italy, where the famous Frank PePe Pizzeria is located. Farmers markets are every Saturday at the park, where you can often find some of New Haven's best food trucks. The Wooster Square neighborhood is centrally located (just a 10 minute walk to the New Haven Green and the Chapel Street area and a 15 minute walk to the Yale Campus), making this place ideal for a visiting scholar or researcher. Getting Around Free parking is available in the back of the building (no permit required). The State Street station is just a few blocks away and Union Station (the main train station) is about a 15 minute walk. Other Things to Note While there is no air-conditioning (as is typical for historic houses like this one in the area), there is a window unit in the third floor bedroom, which keeps the room very cool and comfortable. Rotating tower fans are available for the second floor spaces should you need them. While the move-in and move-out dates are flexible, we are looking for someone who can ideally sublet through June, July, and maybe part of August. Stays shorter than one month cannot be accommodated. + More
rules: House Rules Since most of our furniture consists of irreplaceable family heirlooms, we ask that you treat it with care. Smoking is not permitted inside. Pets are not allowed. + More

about: Our private one bedroom is a cozy, quiet retreat that comfortably fits two. We are located in the historic Westville neighborhood of New Haven and are a short walk to the local park, the downtown busline, cafes, restaraunts and shops of Westville.
description: Description The Space This quiet, comfortable private room features a queen size futon mattress, a reading area, a large closet and beautiful natural lighting. Guest Access Guests will have access to the kitchen and bathroom as well as the back yard. Parking is ample. Wifi, heat and air conditioning are all also available. Interaction with Guests We lead full and somewhat busy lives so we will most likely be in and out during your stay. We are very friendly and love new people, but are also happy to respect your privacy and quiet time. The Neighborhood Westville is a historic neighborhood right outside downtown that offers a retreat from the city center but is still quite urban. Our house is a block away from Edgewood park and Westville offers several breakfast locations, dining, and modest entertainment. Please note we are not located in downtown New Haven and it is a 20 minute walk or about a 10 minute drive with traffic. We are centrally located between I95 and Rt. 15 the Merritt Parkway. Getting Around We are a block away from two direct downtown bus lines and a dedicated bicycle route. Walking, it takes about 15-20 mins to reach the city center, by car it takes less than 10. There is always street parking next to our house and we can advise you on how to park in downtown New Haven efficiently. Other Things to Note Our apartment is located on the third floor. We also have another room in our apartment listed on airbnb for rent so you may be sharing the bathroom/kitchen with other guests as well as Gary and Lisa. We have two friendly cats. Usually we keep them out of the guest room, but you are more than welcome to invite them in during your stay. + More
rules: House Rules You are free to come and go at any time but we ask that you refrain from cooking and keep relatively quiet past 10pm. You will have full access to the kitchen and bathroom, there is a wing of the apartment that is kept private and is indicated as such. We ask that you clean up after yourself and label any personal items in the refrigerator to avoid confusion. This is a smoke free household. + More

about: Large sunny bedroom, private bath, in charming cape-style home with porch. Very close to Foxwoods, Mohegan Sun, Mystic, Connecticut Wine Trail, etc. Lovely orchard right up the street! Long-time local (my mom) Betty will give you the insiders' scoop.
description: Description The Space You will have the top floor to yourself - a large sunny bedroom with a queen-size bed. There is currently only one room available so you will have your own bathroom as well. Both bathrooms are newly renovated. You can certainly use the fridge and porch just off the kitchen but let us know if you are planning to do a lot of cooking. We are always sprucing things up and are planning to have the house painted soon. Guest Access Close proximity to gorgeous beaches, Mystic Seaport and Aquarium, Foxwoods and Mohegan Sun Casinos. Gales Ferry/Ledyard is less well known but has a lot to offer- a historic village on the Thames River, an annual Regatta with Harvard and Yale, a county fair, weekly fireworks displays in the summer, wine vineyards, and a lovely little orchard where you can pick your own berries, apples, etc right up the street. Just 15 minutes away you can hop on the Amtrak or take a ferry to Block Island. An hour and a half from Boston by train, 2 1/2 hours to New York City - this is the perfect place for a relaxing weekend or as a stop between cities. Interaction with Guests My mom Betty will be hosting you. She is a firecracker, full of information about the local area and will give you as much space as you need. I am helping with the communication since she is not too tech-savvy. We have lived in the area a long time and know all the hidden gems! My sister Jen lives locally and is very connected to the local farm scene. She can point you in the right direction or arrange a tour if you are interested. The Neighborhood This is a quiet residential area just 5 miles (10 min) from Mohegan Sun, 8 miles from Foxwoods and 12 miles to Mystic. Getting Around We are about 15 mins from Amtrak stations in New London and Mystic. A car is helpful to explore this area but if you are an avid cyclist there are lots of picturesque country roads to travel. Other Things to Note We ask that you park in the side yard (left of house) and use the entrance off the back patio. We really don't use the driveway or front door. If you are arriving late or we're not at home we will tell you where to find the key. Thanks! + More
rules: House Rules Please no smoking or pets. The room is ideal for a couple. No young children at this time but we hope to open more family-friendly rooms in the future. + More

about: Walk to the Ave or the train station in 10 minutes. Free parking off street, central air, very quiet. A cozy room, shared bath with clawfoot tub. It's only 2 mins from I95. You've found your room! Note: we are Airbnb Super Hosts
description: Description The Space The room is in my 95 year old house. The queen bed is topped with memory foam. Central AC in the summer. Thick plaster walls make it pretty quiet, altho you are in a private home, and you will hear people move about. There is a clawfoot bathtub that is excellent for a good relaxing soak. Free off street parking in our private lot (parking is precious in Greenwich). You will have access to this bedroom and the adjoining shared bathroom only; you may not access any common areas or the kitchen. This is best for folks who are out and about during the day... There may be construction noise between 8:30am and 3:00pm. Guest Access Come and go electronically - no keys needed. Please text me when you expect to arrive. Interaction with Guests I am always available by email or text or phone. You will have plenty of privacy, though, since I tend to stay in the background. The Neighborhood The room is located in a house that is a 10 minute walk to Metro North trains to NYC and Norwalk, Darien etc. The train station is at the base of Greenwich Avenue, which has many stores and restaurants, including an Apple Store, Tiffanys (!), Sax Fifth Avenue and many boutique shops and cafes. It is a 2 minute drive to I95; Stamford is 4 exits away, Port Chester is only one exit away, and White Plains is about 8 minutes from the house by car. Nightlife includes many restaurants, some with outdoor seating, and nearby Stamford and Port Chester have many late night spots. Greenwich is filled with scenic roads and the North Greenwich area is home to many lavish homes and mansions. It's a fun drive, and especially in the fall, very colorful. You will be in a quiet residential area and the parking area is not visible from the street. Getting Around Walk to Metro North trains and Greenwich Avenue (a short walk) and also walk to local restaurants. Uber is in Greenwich. There is a park a few doors away, and the room is 2 minutes from I95 access. There are bus stops on the corner that go to Stamford, Norwalk, etc. Other Things to Note Your safety is assured with my electronic key system and a Nest Cam covering comings and goings at the House entrance. Additionally, I am on site and almost always here. + More
rules: House Rules This is a quiet place and preferred activities include reading, surfing the net, and sleeping. No smoking anywhere on the property, no partying, no pets. No shoes in the house... and, I guarantee you will not be disturbed. You will have access to the room, and the shared full bathroom... sorry, no kitchen or living room access. There is no food or drink in the house. Bottled water or cups with lids OK. No guests under 21 please. The house is 95 years old, so the floors creak a bit, but then again the walls are thick and it is not problem (altho doors need to be pulled shut and not slammed). It's got central air, so no open windows please. See you soon! + More

description: Description The Space The room is in the basement; It's got 2 windows as shown. Also in the room are a small computer desk with work lamp. The shared bathroom is 2 flights up. FYI this is the quietest room in the house, and includes ironing board and iron, and privacy. It's excellent for people who are out and about during the day... Sometimes there is construction noise between 8:30am and 3pm. Guest Access You'll have access to this bedroom and the full bath on the second floor (two flights up) only - you have no access to the kitchen or common areas. The room, however, is fairly spacious. Off street parking is a valued commodity in Greenwich, and you have it directly behind the house. Uber is available as well, and finally you are within a short walk to a car rental. Interaction with Guests I'm available 24/7 by email and text and am on site most of the time... But i do stay in the background and will respect your privacy. It is a 2 minute drive to I95; Stamford is 4 exits away, Port Chester is one exit away, and White Plains is about 6 minutes from the house by car. Nightlife includes many restaurants, some with outdoor seating, and nearby Stamford and Port Chester have many late night spots. Greenwich is filled with scenic roads and the North Greenwich area is home to many lavish homes and mansions. It's a fun drive, and especially in the fall, very colorful. You will be in a quiet residential area and the parking area is not visible from the street. Getting Around Walk to Metro North trains and Greenwich Avenue (a short walk) and also walk to local restaurants. Uber is in Greenwich. There is a park a few doors away, and the room is 2 minutes from I95 access. There are bus stops on the corner that go to Stamford, Norwalk, and Port Chester. Other Things to Note Your safety is assured with my electronic key system and a Nest Cam covering comings and goings at the house entrance. Additionally, I am on site and almost always here. + More

about: Small private room and full sized bath on 2nd floor of 2-story, 4 bedroom home in safe, quaint and historic neighborhood with a large backyard, pool, and trampoline. Room furnished with full sized bed, drawers, and closet.
description: Description The Space Moderately sized 12 x 11 private room in single family home in Farmington. Room includes full sized bed, drawers, and closet. Full size bathroom has full tub/shower. Parking is in the driveway and near the bushes that parallel the street. Animal-friendly guests are welcomed as we have one pug and one kitten. They are not permitted in your room but they do have access to the other parts of the home. The accommodations are best suited for one guest that has planned day activities. We start our day early, but feel free to partake in coffee, tea, cereal, cinnamon raisin bread, and/or fruit each morning! Please note that these accommodations are: * not suitable for those who have dog or cat allergies. * not suitable for those who have difficulty climbing a flight of stairs. Guest Access You will have access to all common areas, back and front yard, and basement laundry facility. Interaction with Guests Feel free to interact and meet our family! My children will try to show you everything they are making or doing. In fact, they may even test your prowess in Math, Spanish, or dinosaur hunting skills...?! If you would prefer quiet, that is fine too. Feel free to close the door to your room and we will respect that. For the most part, our home is very low key and quiet anyways. We can always recommend a place to dine or visit - feel free to ask. The Neighborhood We live in Farmington; a bedroom community of Hartford and the sixth oldest communities in the state. Settled in 1640, Farmington is known for its history, charm, stately homes, quaint lodgings superb restaurants, Miss Porter's School, antiques, Farmington Historical Society, Unionville, Museum, Shopping, ballooning, river rafting, and much more! The Stanley-Whitman House exhibits Colonial lifestyes. The beautiful Hill-Stead Museum contains Pope family treasures which include Impressionist works by Monet, Degas, and Manet. Take a walking or bus tour which might include events about the Revolutionary War, Tunxis Indians, Amistad, or Underground railroad. Our home is two miles from the historic town of Farmington, Miss Porter's School, Hill-Stead Museum, Stanley Whitman House, Tunxis Community College, and Metacomet Trail. We are about five miles from UCONN hospital and the West Farms Mall, and I84. This is a great place to stay while looking for an apartment or home, or for sightseeing New England. Boston is just under 2 hours away; New York City is just under 2 hours; 15 minutes from Hartford; and the coastal Connecticut towns are about 1 hour. Getting Around You will need a car, as there is no public transportation available. + More
rules: House Rules We ask a some questions before we confirm a booking to make sure this is the right for your needs: * What brings you to the area? * What will you be doing during the stay? * Have you stayed in a Airbnb shared-home rental before? * What is the full name of the adult booking the stay? * Do you have any allergies? * Where do you live now and what do you do? * If this is your first Airbnb stay, and you have no reviews, we may ask for your identification upon arrival. Here are some house rules: * The listing is for one bedroom/bath with full access to the first floor common areas, basement laundry, and yards. Other rooms are off-limits. * You need a car, as there is no public transportation. * We have two pets who live inside and are not permitted in your bedroom. * No smoking allowed inside. * Only pre-registered guests are allowed to stay on our property. * No visitors allowed. * No guest pets or animals allowed. * Dishes/silverware must be placed in dishwasher and pans washed in sink immediately after use to prevent feedings from rodents, bugs, or from our pets. + More

about: Cozy room; private bath and entrance. Off-street parking and tent pitch. Enjoy canoeing on the Quinnipiac; guided tours free of charge. We are happy to provide breakfast; eggs fresh daily from backyard coop. Pet friendly. Massage therapist on site.
description: Description The Neighborhood Interesting maritime neighborhood with lots of history and charm. Explore the river with a canoe equipped with paddles, life vests, and a boat cart for easy transport to the launch, which is a block and a half away. A great and relatively unknown part of New Haven. A block away you'll find a convenience store, restaurant, and wine shop are block away. A short walk up the west bank of the Quinnipiac brings you to Anastasio's Dock Side Cafe. A short walk down Grand Avenue will bring you to Grand Apizza, one of New Haven's finest classic pizza restaurants. They have a full menu as well. + More
rules: House Rules Make yourself at home! We allow pets; the neighborhood is dog friendly. + More

about: Stay at the Nash. Located in New Haven's East Rock neighborhood, the Nash is right around the corner from well-reviewed restaurants along New Haven's State Street. We're 15 minutes walking to Yale and only 25 to all the restaurants downtown.
description: Description The Space The Nash is a quaint home in the Goatville (URL HIDDEN) section of the East Rock Neighborhood of New Haven. The rooms are small, and except for the added on room (the Rio), the floors are wood. Currently there is no cable and only one shared bathroom (we have plans to put a 1/2 bath in the front). The patron of house works as a massage therapist, a service we provide guest for at the rate of $40 an hour. Guest Access Guests have their own room and share common kitchen, bath, dining and living area- although sometimes this is needed for in-home massages. There is a washer & dryer on premise, but for safety and security, the host would do any laundry if you would like something washed here. There is also a local laundromat about a two blocks away. Additionally we will do pick-up and return dry cleaning for any guests who would like with New Haven's best cleaners. You would only have to call in a card number to them, and we would do the rest. Interaction with Guests Interaction with guests varies. My work and personal life varies in intensity and demands so there are times when I'm more available than others. Also, of course, the guests needs and desires come first many need a quiet place and time without much social interaction in between what they came to New Haven for, others like to spend more time talking over coffee, or even going out and seeing part of New Haven together. At the Nash, we want each guest to get the most out of their visit in New Haven, be it reflective time to read and study, and so on or time to engage with the host, or local scenes and activities. The Neighborhood The East Rock Neighborhood is known affectionately as the Grad Ghetto because of the large number of graduate students, phd candidates and other academics. The neighborhood is very diverse with many families living here as well. The Nash is two doors down from a quaint park available to BBQ in season. Getting Around We're one or two blocks away from either nearby bus routes, and we're walking distance to most sights in town. We're close to free Yale Shuttle stops, and not far from a variety of great restaurants, pubs, shops, museums, theatres, the East Rock Park and of course, Yale itself. Seth has also provided rides for people in need with transportation difficulties. People wanting bike rentals are referred to our friend, found on (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN); Goatville Cyclesmith, Joel LaChance. + More
rules: House Rules We are a small home and ask guests to be respectful of general tidiness and of each other's personal space. We've never had any problems, but for additional privacy and security each guest receives not only the keys for the front door but a key to their own room Pets- sorry, due to some guests' allergies, no pets allowed. Smoking- so sorry, no smoking in the Nash. Smoker may enjoy are backyard, front patio, and the few New Haven establishments that permit smoking ( The Owl; (URL HIDDEN) is the best known). Children- Sorry, for safety and consideration of all, no children under ten at The Nash. Additional Guests- while friends and family are welcome to visit at The Nash, additional overnight guests in your room are an additional $25 per guest. Thank you. + More

about: Stay at the Nash. Located in New Haven's East Rock neighborhood, the Nash is right around the corner from well-reviewed restaurants along New Haven's State Street. We're a 15 minute walk to Yale, and only 25 minutes to all the restaurants downtown.
description: Description The Space The Nash is a quaint home in the Goatville section of the East Rock Neighborhood of New Haven. The rooms are small, and except for the added on room (The Rio), the floors are wood. Currently there is no cable and only one shared bathroom. The patron of house works as a massage therapist, a service we provide guest for at the rate of $40 an hour, half of top dollar for massage. Guest Access Guests have their own room and share common kitchen, bath, dining and living area- although sometimes the latter is needed for an in-home therapeutic massage studio. No breakfast is currently served. There is a washer & dryer on premise, but for safety and security, the host would do any laundry if you would like something washed here. There is also a local laundromat about a two blocks away. Additionally we will do pick-up and return dry cleaning for any guests who would like with New Haven's best cleaners. You would only have to call in a card number to them, and we would do the rest. Interaction with Guests Interaction with guests varies. My work and personal life varies in intensity and demands so there are times when I'm more available than others. Also, of course, the guests needs and desires come first. Many need a quiet place and time without much social interaction in between what they came to New Haven for, others like to spend more time talking over coffee, or even going out and seeing part of New Haven together. At the Nash, we want each guest to get the most out of their visit in New Haven, be it reflective time to read and study, and so on or time to engage with the host, or local scenes and activities. The Neighborhood The surrounding area is known affectionately as the Grad Ghetto because of the large number of graduate students, phd candidates and other academics. The neighborhood is very diverse with many families living here as well. The Nash is two doors down from a quaint park available to BBQ in season. The block holds four holiday parties a year here, anyone is welcome. Getting Around We're one or two blocks away from either nearby bus routes, and we're walking distance to most sights in town. We're close to free Yale Shuttle stops, and not far from a variety of great restaurants, pubs, shops, museums, theatres, the beautiful East Rock Park and of course, Yale itself. Seth has also provided rides for people in need with transportation difficulties. People wanting bike rentals are referred to our friend, found on (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN); Goatville Cyclesmith, Joel LaChance. + More
rules: House Rules We are a small home and ask guests to be respectful of general tidiness and of each other's personal space. We've never had any problems, but for additional privacy and security each guest receives not only the keys for the front door but a key to their own room Pets- sorry, due to some guests' allergies, no pets allowed. Smoking- so sorry, no smoking in the Nash. Smoker may enjoy are backyard, front patio, and the few New Haven establishments that permit smoking ( The Owl; (URL HIDDEN) is the best known). Children- Sorry, for safety and consideration of all, no children under ten at The Nash. Additional Guests- while friends and family are welcome to visit at The Nash, additional overnight guests in your room are an additional $25 per guest. Thank you. + More

about: This clean bedroom sleeps two guests with private half bathroom, close to Yale University and a short walk to the beautiful New Haven Sound. WiFi, full size bed, linens, towels. Full kitchen access and your own mini fridge! (Bring your own food).
description: Description The Space A private room in a charming house in New Haven's Historic City Point District, mere blocks from the sound, and a short drive to downtown. The backyard includes a tiny forest. It is magical. You'll see. Outside parties and events allowed for a small fee. Please let us know the number of guests, time frame of the party, and occasion, and we will send a quote. Well behaved dogs considered for a fee, thanks to our large outdoor space. Other animals are considered on a case by case basis. Guest Access Guests will have access to the following amenities: Shared kitchen, dining room, living room, laundry in unit. Flexible check-in/check-out. -Furniture as viewed in the photographs -A full shared kitchen -Private Mini-Fridge -Convenient street parking and onsite parking for an additional fee -Central Air and Heat throughout the house -Deck access -Outdoor Barbecue Grill -Fire pit -Hammock (seasonal) -Washer/Dryer -Private Half Bath -Full bathroom Interaction with Guests You are welcome to email and text as much as needed. We are happy to help. If you see us in the kitchen, we'll say hello! We love meeting fellow airbnb-ers. (Really, we can chat as often or as little as you'd like. No pressure.) The Neighborhood The accommodation is located in the historic City Point Neighborhood with Pequonnock Yacht Club, fine dining at Sage American Grill, and the Dock side Deli within a few blocks. Or for convenience Dunkin' Donuts, Dairy Queen, McDonald's, and Popeyes Chicken are walk-able in the other direction. Getting Around A train ride from JFK, LGA, PVD, BOS, and shuttles available to Bradley BDL and Tweed HVN. $10, 6 minute taxi ride to downtown New Haven. There are several bus stops and many buses leaving for downtown throughout the day. + More
rules: House Rules We expect the house to be a treated with the utmost care. No smoking. Please keep the apartment as clean as you found it. At the end of your stay, remove sheets from the bed, roughly fold them up, and leave them on the floor for me to wash. + More

about: Perfect for someone looking for a private campsite that is near a nature preserve and trail network but also accessible from a back country road.
description: Description The Space The authentic camping experience. This camp site is located on a private lot off of Fuller Mt. road in the quiet woodsy town of Kent Ct. Unlike public "camp grounds" where you pitch your tent in between two neighbors this site is all yours. Once you pull in with your car of RV you are in your very own secluded nature getaway. You can pitch one or several tents anywhere you'd like. There is always dry* fire wood by the stone circle and some bug spray in case you forgot your own ; ) Guest Access The entire 2 acre lot is yours. Interaction with Guests I live about 30min away in Litchfield so if there is anything you need feel free to call or message me at ANY TIME and I will do everything I can to accommodate your needs. Getting Around Coming from the city? Enjoy a beautiful train ride along the Metro North! Although this camp site is located in a secluded part of the state it is still only a 15 minute drive to the Ten Mile River station on the Metro North line. (about 2.3 hours from Grand Central Station) Other Things to Note I am familiar with the area as far as local hikes and restaurants and am always happy to give directions or recommendations. + More

about: This charming cottage style room features crown molding, white and dark pine furnishings. Two twin size beds in a trundle. Please specify if you need ONE bed or TWO beds for this room. Plenty of outlets. Trundle is a small fee extra.
description: Description The Space Efficiency features one twin bed and one trundle available for an additional fee. Plenty of outlets available. One table lamp and side table. Guest Access Kitchen (fridge, freezer, stove, oven, toaster oven, no microwave in main house), Wifi, bathroom (includes general toiletries), towels, patio (with grill), outdoor fire pit, indoor fire place (limited availability), yard. Horseback riding lessons and horsemanship lessons available for all ages at additional rates by appointment only. Interaction with Guests I am there if you have questions, but will leave you alone if you prefer privacy. Also, I work in NYC through the week so wouldn't be there during the day. My daughter's nanny, Mariah, lives on site with us and is usually around the property during the day, she'll be helpful and present if you need or quiet and out-of-your hair if you'd prefer. The Neighborhood Private lane, no traffic and quiet. Lovely walking trails right outside. Getting Around There is no public transportation. You need a car or taxi to get around/into town/the train station from this property. Other Things to Note For an additional fee, if organized in advance I can provide breakfast, picnic lunch, dinner, beach chairs, and daily beach passes for guests. There are three beaches in Greenwich. Horseback riding lessons/pony rides are also available for an additional fee. Please inquire if interested. Sorry no pets accepted. + More

about: A large private, furnished bedroom (master) and private (URL HIDDEN) floor living in a suburban West Hartford neighborhood. Not fancy, but clean and comfortable accommodations. Wi-fi, cable tv. Shared use of living room, dining area and kitchen.
description: Description The Space The original master bedroom and bath of my 1957 ranch. My home is a work in progress but I enjoy it. In the meantime, I try to keep it tidy. You can expect clean sheets and towels. If you have a special request I will try to help. I live in a residential neighborhood great for walkers & joggers. There is a bus stop 5 minutes away that will take you into downtown Hartford. See the Ct-Transit schedule at their website for specifics. Remember to ask for a transfer once on the bus, if you'd like to connect to the Bradley Flyer bus route that will take you to and from the airport. If you have a car there is a paved spot here for you. I offer a nice weekly and monthly rate as well. Im new to this, but like the concept and hope to do some traveling one day myself. Guest Access I have a spacious living room, dining room and a kitchen with all the basics for your use as well. Keep food if you'd like and prepare your meals. It is clean but modest and a bit dated a good friend of mine shared. The nerve! Haha. He called it "state of the art", then said, provided that the year is 1991 :) Interaction with Guests Happy to describe it in more detail or if you are in town and would like to preview, that's fine too. Im new to airbnb and hopeful to provide a pleasant experience. You will enjoy your privacy here, but Im glad to give you recommendations on local points of interest, point you in the right direction or chat a bit and offer support. As mentioned, other areas of the house are available to you to relax, read, watch tv, cook, etc. The Neighborhood Suburban neighborhood built in the late 1950s. Convenient to Starbucks, groceries, restaurants, banks, (5 minute drive or a 15 minute walk) I mile to University of Hartford 1.3 miles to University of CT 2 miles to UCONN Law School 1.5 miles to St. Josephs College 2 miles to Cigna /Metlife corporate campus 2.8 miles to West Hartford Center Bus stop a 5 minute walk Getting Around See details above, C-Transit, etc. + More
rules: House Rules Guests need to be respectful of my neighbors. At night, it is very quiet. No smoking on the premises. Double occupancy by special arrangement. Slightly different pricing. No pets. Room will have fresh sheets. Morning coffee included, but you may have to make it yourself. Must do your own dishes. All utensils, etc are there for you to use. No visitors. + More

about: An ideal stop when traveling the 1-95 NYC - Boston route. 5 minutes drive time to Uni. of New Haven, VA Hospital & to the Metro North train station to NYC (ride is only 1.5 hours)! Yale U , IKEA & downtown New Haven are just 10 - 15 minutes away.
description: Description The Space Size of room is approximately 12' x 15' in and it has a generous lighted walk-in closet. The room is cozy, clean, and furnished with a full sized bed that sleeps 1 - 2 adults, and we can provide an air bed or an additional comfortable single Thai mattress made available to guests who may need an option to sleeping on the floor (by the way, the floor is clean because no shoes are allowed in the house). Guest Access Room is accessed by a shared entrance and through the house. Located upstairs on the 2nd. floor of the house. WALKING DISTANCE TO WHAT'S NEARBY: The house is within 5 minutes walking distance to downtown West Haven green, minutes walk to the laundromat, convenience stores, restaurants, bank, pharmacy, parks, tennis courts, soccer and baseball fields, and even the West Haven beaches. You can even walk 15 - 20 minutes to the train station. DRIVING TIME TO PLACES OF INTEREST: Universities: University of New Haven (UNH) is just 5 mins, Yale University is 10 minutes, Southern Connecticut State University (SCSU) is 15 minutes, and Quinnipiac University (QU) is approximately 20 minutes. Hospitals: Veterans Affairs (VA) Hospital West Haven is 5 mins, Yale New Haven Hospital and Yale Smilow Cancer Hospital are 10 - 15 minutes (depending on traffic), and IKEA New Haven is 10 minutes. Shopping: Westfield Mall Milford - 15 mins Clinton Crossing Pemium Outlets - 25 mins Westbrook Tanger Outlets - 35 mins OTHER AMENITIES: A shared bathroom is just 3 to 4 steps outside the bedroom. High speed wireless internet access is included during your stay. As a guest, you will have access to kitchen where you will find the microwave to reheat food and a Keurig single cup coffee brewer, and the coffee cart. There are some light snacks in the room to keep your tummy happy during the wee hours of the night! Interaction with Guests I am a friendly yet energetic gal and my hubby is a quiet individual whom you will hardly see (yes, he is a man of very little words and loves his man cave, LOL!). We have been been hosting friends, families, students, and folks from all over the world way before AirBnB was a trend. I love meeting and connecting with new people. I work from home and you will see me from time to time throughout the day. I would be happy to show you around as long as you check with me on my availability ahead of time. I love food and that makes me frequent local coffee shop, bistros, and restaurants. Please ask me if you would like to hang out sometime. Depending on location of venture, hubby may or may not accompany us. *smile* The Neighborhood House is located on a quiet and safe secondary street. There is ample street parking available. Depending on the season, you may want to check out the West Haven beaches and parks nearby. Getting Around Public Transportation and Access to Connecticut roads are as follows. Connecticut (CT) Transit (bus services): Transit "B" bus line to University of New Haven, Veterans Hospital, and "J" bus line to Yale University. Minutes to Connecticut I-95, Rt. 15, Rt. 34, and Rt. 1 (Boston Post Road). 5 minutes walking distance to the bus stop. Taxi: Metrotaxi CT is available in the area. Uber or Lyft You can also use the Uber or Lyft apps to request drivers. Other Things to Note NOTE: Planning a longer stay (60 - 90 days?) DO NOT DO THE INSTANT BOOK! I will send you a special pricing. And if it is right, you can go ahead and book it. The room provides comfort for 2 guests. A maximum of 3 adults is allowed for this room. Just so you know, the house is an older house and since our household either sleeps late or wake up early (5 am), the floors may make slight creeks when walked on. So, if you're a light sleeper and are ok with that, then that's good. We are not noisy people too, just my occasional laughters. :) I am a super relationship builder so, having a picture and stories on your profile will give you a better chance to book the room. I value your comfort and your privacy and ask that you give the same respect to other members of my household. Communication is key and I always enjoy a good conversation that carries loads of energetic laughters. + More
rules: House Rules Love guests who follow standard living rules. Please respect others in the household and clean after yourself. Please treat items on the property as if they are yours, handle with care. If you are a long term guest (30 days or more), we would appreciate any help with you helping up with the upkeep of your living space - take out trash from your room and you can also use the vacuum to clean your space. - NO DRUGS - NO ALCOHOL - NO SMOKING INDOORS! - NO SHOES IN THE HOUSE We also practice a "no shoes" policy in the house so we request that guests leave their shoes on the rack provided at the entrance of the home. To ensure comfort to everyone, no pets and no smoking allowed, and preferably no alcohol on premises. - KITCHEN USE You may use the kitchen to do light cooking. The only thing that we ask is, please, no pork and other pork based products when using our pots, pans, dishes, and silverware in the kitchen. - TURN DOWN TIME We ask that loud music or other audio should be kept at a minimum starting midnight to respect turn down time for others. + More

about: Comfortable and clean bedroom in Norwalk, CT.
description: Description The Space Our condo is in Norwalk, CT and is within easy walking distance to several stores, diners and restaurants. The bus takes you to SONO (South Norwalk) in about 5-7 minutes where you can find nice restaurants and bars, movie theaters, the beach, museums and the aquarium. JFK and Newark airport are about an hour away by car. You can take the Metro North to NYC (50 minutes) and the Amtrak to Boston (3 hours) so you can get the best of the North East in just a few days. We can provide car rides to the train station in the mornings and we are more than happy to help with suggestions about things to do around NYC and Norwalk. Guest Access You will be staying in your own room which has a single bed, a desk and closet. We will provide fresh sheets and towels. The bathroom is shared and you are more than welcome to use our kitchen and stash your groceries in our fridge and cabinets. You can also use our washer and dryer but for a fee. We have a medium sized lab mix, so please be comfortable with pets. The Neighborhood It has plenty of shopping, 15m away from local mall. It is 3m from maritime aquarium. local beach is 5m away. i95 takes you to NYC in about 45m. Boston is about a 3hr drive. so you can get the best of the North East in just a few days. Getting Around Metro north takes you to NYC and Amtrak takes you to boston. busses take you to SONO where there are many restaurants and bars. Other Things to Note We have a Drop cam that monitors who comes in and out of our home for safety. + More
rules: House Rules We want you to be comfortable in our home, but please remember that this is not a hotel but our ordinary home. You will be sharing this space with my wife and I. We expect you to respect our things and be considerate when using the shared areas: Clean up after yourself, Keep your room clean, No Smoking, and lastly, please don't bring any guests home. + More

rules: House Rules Please be quiet and courteous. The preferred activities are reading, surfing the net, working on a laptop, or sleeping. Folks may cook and eat once or twice daily. No smoking in the house. Smoking outside on the balcony is allowed. No parties. No shoes on beyond the hallway. Bring house shoes if preferred. No pets. No kitchen access. Please ask if you need to store something in the refrigerator. There are many restaurants within walking distance and most will deliver. You may use the washer and dryer, but please ask first. No dirty towels left on the bathroom floor, please put them in the hamper in the laundry room. Only park in spaces clearly marked with a "V", as most parking is assigned. + More

about: I have a 2BR condo 1 mile south of the center of downtown Hartford. It's walking distance from corporate and govt offices and Hartford Hospital. Willing to rent the spare BR. Off-street parking and an in-unit washer/dryer.
description: Description The Space It is a nice, clean 2 BR very close to everything that might bring people to Hartford, CT - corporate & government offices, Hartford Hospital, Trinity University and the UConn Hartford-area campuses, and Hartford's dining, nightlife and cultural attractions. Guest Access Guest has private room and shared kitchen with big fridge that always has extra space, living room, bathroom and free in-unit washer/dryer Interaction with Guests Interaction with guests can be as much or little as the guest wants. The Neighborhood It is a historic neighborhood with beautiful brick buildings built around the turn of the century and is in a very convenient location. Past residents of the neighborhood include notable industrialists Colt (firearms), Borden (dairy), Pratt & Whitney (aeronautics) . Getting Around Bus service is excellent in Hartford with regular bus stop 1/4 mile away and a stop for the free downtown shuttle 1/2 mile away. + More

description: Description The Space The combination of wood floors, exposed brick, and lofty ceilings gives this room a streamlined, spacious feel. All the amenities are very clean and new. Guest Access You'll have access to a queen-sized bed, linens, towels, soap, and a fully-equipped kitchen. Coin-operated laundry is in the basement. Interaction with Guests I will not be in New Haven during your stay, but can be contacted easily via phone and email. I will also have a friend who can help out should any problems arise. Close to Pepe's and Sally's pizzerias, Lucibello's and Libby's pastries, Ferraro's grocery store, and the Saturday Farmer's Market. about: Bright, airy room in East Rock house -- very close to Yale and on shuttle lines. The room is private, but you should know it has curtains instead of a door. It has a private bathroom, Apple TV, and desk. Great for prospective students visiting Yale.
description: Description The Space We are four Yale healthcare students living in East Rock. We are incredibly close to campus (Science Hill, Forestry School, Divinity School, etc.), and on the shuttle lines for the free Yale shuttle. This is a former bedroom that we use as a living room. It has a private bathroom attached to it. There is no door, but rather, a heavy curtain in the doorway that separates it from the rest of the house (the bathroom is en suite). It is private and the room and bathroom are only used by you while you're staying there. There is a couch and a love seat that you're welcome to crash on, and we have an air mattress as well. There is a desk in there as well if you need to get some work done. Technology: We have wifi, and a wireless printer you're welcome to use if needed. The TV in the room has Apple TV, and you can use HBO Now, NetFlix, or stream music. Guest Access You're welcome to use all common areas, including the kitchen and backyard. We have a grill in the backyard that you can use! Check-in is at 3:00pm and check-out is at 11:00am unless alternate arrangements are made. Feel free to ask ahead of time and we will work with you! Interaction with Guests We are all pretty social, and are more than happy to chat with you. That being said, if you want some solo time, we are more than happy to give you that as well! The Neighborhood We are incredibly close to campus (Science Hill, Forestry School, Divinity School, etc.), and on the shuttle lines for the free Yale shuttle. Getting Around Yale Shuttle Lines, if you need to borrow a bike, we can probably help you out. Other Things to Note Because the room is attached to the kitchen and dining space, there's a chance that you might hear us up and about in the kitchen and getting ready. + More
rules: House Rules Be a good human. Nothing illegal, quieter after 11pm. No guests that weren't in the original reservation. + More

about: Only minutes from UConn & ECSU, you can stay in an over-300 year home on over 2 acres of wooded serenity, with direct access to local trails. Experience the charm of colonial Connecticut, yet with all the modern conveniences.
description: Description The Space Our guest room is on the first floor of our unique 1713 colonial-era home, with a private bathroom just around the corner. In the cooler months, enjoy a cheerful fireside experience, and in the warmer months, all the outdoor beauty New England has to offer. Guest Access You have access throughout the first floor of our house, which includes your guestroom, the guest bathroom, the kitchen, dining room, living room, and library. Feel free to enjoy any of it, as well as our outdoor surroundings--2 1/2 acres of lovely old woods. Interaction with Guests We are both Protestant pastors, which means our schedules vary quite a lot! We can always be available, whether in person or by phone, to answer questions, assist you in enjoying your stay, or provide suggestions on how to explore all that Connecticut has to offer. The Neighborhood We're on a quiet street with direct access to the Hop River State Trail, a part of the East Coast Greenway, a great place for walking or biking (bikes may be available upon request). A great selection of restaurants await you in nearby Willimantic or Storrs. Also in Storrs is the main campus of the University of Connecticut (UConn), which offers a variety of activities and cultural/arts events throughout the year. Downtown Hartford is less than thirty minutes away, with all of the history, recreation, and attractions it has to offer. Getting Around Parking available onsite. We're easily accessible right off the US 6 corridor, which connects Hartford and Providence RI via Willimantic. Bradley International Airport (Hartford/Springfield) is forty to forty-five minutes away. Nearby destinations include Hartford (30 minutes), New Haven CT (1 hour), Providence RI (1 hour), Boston (1 1/2 hours), and New York City (2 1/2 hours). Other Things to Note Due to our work, we are unable to welcome news guests on Sunday mornings before 2:00 pm. + More
rules: House Rules -- No smoking indoors. -- Pets accepted on a case-by-case basis. Please discuss this with us as part of the booking process. -- Please don't let our dog out... he's a runner. (But don't worry, he usually goes to work with us.) -- But feel free to pet the kitty... he's very soft! + More

description: Description Guest Access My guests will be able to use the kitchen if they choose to do so. They will have access to the pool in the summer time.There is also a play area with a basketball court and swing that will be available to all my guests. Interaction with Guests I am always here to make my guests feel comfortable,however it will be their choice how much they would like to have interaction with me. about: Relax in a nice woodsy quiet area away from downtown but 5 min walk to bus stop, deli & coffee depending how fast you are.
description: Description The Space What's unique is this is a safe lovely big house (2000 sqft), yard, deck & A LOT of common space (kitchen, living rooms, office & quiet rooms), at a cul de sac dead end!! PLEASE READ IMPORTANT NOTE ON BOTTOM BEFORE YOU BOOK. Many places w/such amenities charges $100+ more per night.. so it's a great value! House has some furnishings, available to share: -Large wood dining table & small kitchen table too -Chill area, chairs/rocking chair, corner tables, to read, Den chair & sofa, Magazines (mostly music), etc. -Outside Deck within railings.. (please no leaning!) -Quiet room (unfurnished, but chairs available). -HDTV/Monitor & speaker system for micro-usb devices or laptop available in den area upon request. -(1 GUEST) - Room with 18" Twin Deluxe Air Bed, feather padding on top. -(2+ GUESTS) Room with 18" high Queen Deluxe Air bed. - If you need more than 2.. There are plenty of space to "camp" (if you wish to bring your own sleeping bag or futon). It's not a luxury hotel, but a home I'm sharing. If you don't feel this & amenities listed, is enough, please let me know what you need, or try booking elsewhere that meets your standards. - Due to expenses running the home, Please count all guests coming! - Weekly/Monthly booking is available.. please ask! - Please excuse paint/cleaning/boxes/supplies around, I'm constantly improving home & it's out of the way. If it's bothersome I can move it. IMPORTANT NOTE PLEASE READ: There has been misunderstandings w/cleanliness-- I do clean the older upstairs bathroom regularly. I have health issues with dust/dirt. The reason why tub/floor/tiles look stained/dirt is because its design, older, faded & scratched. I've tried cleaning for hours with the most *powerful* chemicals, cannot remove & cannot afford more renovation than I already do. ***If you have an issue with appearance, please use the newer downstairs bathroom. Thank you! Many questions you have, parking, room, etc is usually in this description listing. You will receive additional guide information upon booking where items are located. CANCELLATION POLICY: Please read Airbnb's policy carefully. Airbnb does not refund fees & charges host's pay when you cancel. I've been generous/flexible to allow changes day prior, (when other hosts need 1 week), even when I lose out. However, it's been *really* tough with my busy schedule, when waiting for guests (that are sometimes 3-4+ hours late), taking much time coordinating, questions, preparing, checking in, touring & cleaning. - So guests will no longer receive full refund (minus fees) if you cancel/change after booking starts.*** There are only some exceptions. If guests cancel/change last minute, I can't easily schedule another guest last minute, and guests normally do not book the day of, so I lose those days & weekend. CANCELLATION PAYMENT: - Airbnb automatically gives full refund (minus fees), according to policy before booking starts. - If you request after booking, they refund partial according to cancellation policy. - I am not required submit a request to Airbnb & for additional refunds, but if I do **Airbnb needs time & makes the final decision on what to refund to you.** - Please be honest why you're canceling, if you find something that better fits your location, schedule, preferences, etc, please state it's your decision. Or else Airbnb team will contact hosts to try to dispute. Guest Access - Generally I don't feel comfortable allowing check-ins without my presence. Upon booking, you will receive instructions on how to lock/unlock door. CHECK IN / CHECK OUT / ARRIVAL Please ask my availability to check you in. Normally weekdays after 6pm and weekends anytime I'm around. - Please know, homes are *not* hotels with full time staff to check you in anytime, and I often delay/reschedule/cancel my own plans to check in guests, so please respect my time like I do for guests. - I'd appreciate a 1 hour maximum time slot in case you're delayed, but please arrive the time you say you will. - Guest can have access to all common areas, such as kitchen (to prep your own food/groceries), shared bathrooms (1 with tub or 1 with walk in stone shower), dining room, yard, deck, & upstairs living room, and downstairs lounge area. If you're a musician/creative/student, etc who needs some quiet time, there is an empty quiet room downstairs to jam! I even have a small karaoke machine! Yes, KARAOKE! - High speed, WIFI available upon request. - Aid items such as Bandaids, rubbing alcohol, cotton, hydrogen peroxide, etc - Filtered water in a jug to hydrate & ice dispenser in kitchen fridge. - 1 towel per person, 1 clean pillow case over pillow, 1 clean sheet, and 1 clean cover or blanket. If you need more, please bring more. -Sorry, I'm not a maid service so I won't be cleaning your laundry or sheets daily, there is laundry access downstairs, but I can clean all borrowed items after you leave. Interaction with Guests Currently, my schedule is unfortunately hectic, time & budget is small, so my interaction with guests may be minimal. I'd be happy to suggest awesome food & recreation nearby you can go to. The Neighborhood Town next to Orange & Minutes from downtown New Haven, and downtown Milford, etc. Not too far from NYC (1.5 hr train ride). Minutes from Yale (New Haven, and West Campus in Orange), VA hospital, New Haven University (UNH), and Southern Connecticut State University (SCSU) This is not downtown, but nice woodsy area. Please be prepared for your own transportation. Guests had no problem using Taxi, Uber, Bus or Bike. Plenty of shopping, recreation & nightlife near by, but transportation needed. A Deli & coffee shop is walkable distance. My neighborhood is very nice and pleasant, very quiet, sometimes dead quiet. It's at a dead end. My neighbors are nice. They have families. I'm probably one of few who aren't living with a family. It's nice living away from city noise, but close enough to events, happenings. Though CT looks vast in lands, there are a lot of variety of things to do or experience. It's also a photographer's dream. Getting Around Minutes from Milford and New Haven train station. Walkable distance to bus line (5-10min) that leads to downtown. Bikeable distance to downtown. 10 minutes by car/taxi/uber without traffic & 20-30minutes downtown or UNH by bus. ::PARKING - FREE & EASY:: - Park perpendicular (instead of parallel) facing my house (so 3 cars fit) - Diagonal in front of LEFT neighbors at a slight diagonal, (so 2 cars fit, without blocking either driveways) - Or park off to the side parallel on side near the bushes (away from blocking the mail boxes). For winter/snow, we can discuss arranging our cars to be out of the way from the snow plows. Guests are generally responsible for their own transportation, but sometimes if I'm in the same area & heading home at the same time, as drop off (e.g. downtown New Haven train/station), I can pick you up. Other Things to Note If necessary, will ask for ID verification and video chat before booking, especially with longer stays or you don't have many reviews, I may ask for appropriate documents: e.g. ID, . Credit Report, Utilities/Rental History, etc + More
rules: House Rules Please be clean, kind, courteous, respectful. - Wear warm clothes during cold weather. Heating can cost $30+/day if we have to turn it up high 24/7, so to kindly keep AirBnb $$ costs down for you, I'd ask you to be efficient with electric & oil heating. Of course minimum is provided at 65degs F, but often for guests 68-70 & we turn down when we are out (to minimum so pipes don't freeze). If you need high temperatures for heating, please add $15/day. I'll show how to turn it down. Please be kind. If this is an issue, please try another location, but this area expensive, so trying to help you out :) - Please turn off all lights if not in use. - If there is a draft please let me know.. it's a double pain window so if you open or touch the lock & not close properly there is a large gap & cause large draft. No drugs or illegal activity. No pets at the moment. - Shoes off (please help keep carpet/hardwood floor clean, free of dirt/scratches). Shared guest slippers available. ...I'm having severe dust/particle/odor allergies this year.. - So If you smoke cigarettes, please smoke outside, but extinguish it completely in a non flammable ash tray provided, not yard, deck, street or garden please. (I will end up having to pick it up or neighbors will). Then place in a trash bag after it's put out (or fire can occur). - If you have excessive trash, food trash, or recyclables, please bag them well, and place in Black trash bin, and recyclables in Blue trash bin outside. I could be fined by the city if they are not recycled or cleaned before recycling. - PLEASE do not eat other people's food. Believe it or not, My chocolates stored away were eaten a few different times, that were meant to be gifts my mom & I also had chocolates from another country that were not sold anywhere else. Thank you! + More

about: Close to Yale, great restaurants, and right in the heart of famed Wooster Square, this is a beautiful apartment in a great location.
description: Description The Space The guest room is the front room - the most light-filled, spacious, and welcoming of the three bedrooms! There are two, brand-new, queen sized air-beds for guests. Fresh, clean bedding, blankets, and towels are provided for each new guest. Guest Access You have privacy in your room and have full access to the shared bathroom and large eat-in kitchen. Interaction with Guests We are two friends in our 30's, both working professionals. We are social but if you prefer not to socialize, that's fine too. You have as much privacy as you like, and we are here to help as needed. We can provide recommendations for orientation to New Haven including where to go for all things Yale, transport, shopping, entertainment, and dining. As needed, we can also provide recommendations and orientation for the rest of Connecticut and travel to New York City. Let us know! The Neighborhood We're right in the heart of historic Wooster Square! It's a beautiful, safe, charming neighborhood with lots to offer and is just a short walk from Yale and the downtown commercial district. Food: For restaurants, the famed Pepe's and Sally's pizza restaurants are known as having some of the best pizza in America, and there're also plenty of other fine and inexpensive italian restaurants in the neighborhood. On Saturdays, enjoy the popular Wooster Square farmer's market just 50 yards from the doorstep where vendors sell everything from produce to crepes, pastry, grilled cheese and smoothies. There's also a great liquor store right on the corner. For groceries, there're both inexpensive and gourmet grocery stores within a 3-5 blocks. Things to do: Wooster Square Park is also one block away - a large, wide open, beautiful park filled with cherry, maple, oak, and sycamore. If you want night clubs, bars, and downtown shopping, it's also just 5 blocks away by the downtown Yale campus. This is a prime location with easy access to everything you'd need. And if you have any questions, just ask! Getting Around If you want to get to different parts of the sprawling Yale campus or around town, hop on the free shuttle or walk to the central Yale campus just 5 blocks away. Also, there's Uber in New Haven, and there's also Zipcar spots near here. Hertz has a rental location a few blocks away, and there's also a place to rent bicycles a few blocks away. If you're driving, there's quick and easy access to and from I-95 and I-91 (both North & South) within a couple minutes. The train station is also close enough to walk to. When I go to New York City, I usually walk so I don't have to pay for parking at the garage, and it only takes about 10 minutes to walk there. From there, you can take a train up to Hartford or up and down the coast. It takes about 2 hours and costs about $16-22 each way to go to New York City from New Haven's Union station. Other Things to Note Breakfast is self-service and includes items we have on hand such as oatmeal, granola, plain yogurt, maple-syrup or honey, fruit, coffee, or tea. Please be aware the room has a full-privacy doorway curtain as the threshold is not suited for hung, wooden doors. The room is at the far end of the apartment away from common areas and has plenty of privacy. We are on the third floor, so there are some stairs to climb, but not too many, and there is a railing and plenty of space in the stairwell. + More
rules: House Rules We expect guests to be considerate of the space. Keep things tidy in common spaces, and generally respect the space and others. No pets or smoking is permitted in the house. + More

about: This charming Dutch colonial has loads of space, driveway and garage, high speed internet, premium cable, security system, cappuccino machine, washer and dryer, and views of East Rock and West Rock. Walk to Westville Village with shops and restaurants. Beautiful, safe, walkable neighborhood.
description: Description The Space This would be your own private home with lots of vintage charm. A very friendly house cat would be your only guest (who will welcome you in exchange for you filling her food and water dishes once daily). Entertain guests with a combined kitchen/den area, grand piano and warm and inviting pellet stove on those chilly nights. On ground floor the entryway leads to a large living room with pellet stove and piano on one side of the house, and dining room, kitchen, den and (heated) sun room and deck on the other. There is also a small, very 70s powder room off entry. Upstairs there are three bedrooms, two of which are suitable for guest use. The back bedroom is fully renovated and boasts amazing views across New Haven--great for watching sun and moon rises. It has a full futon bed and dresser. The master bedroom is over-sized with a queen bed and closets. The bedrooms would ideally suit a couple with a child, a couple and a single guest or just a couple. There is also a twin bed that could be used to to accommodate an additional guest. Guest Access Access to entire private home, garage, partially finished basement including laundry. Interaction with Guests We will meet on the day of your arrival so I can give you keys etc. Then I will be away while you are staying here so you don't have to worry about sharing space or anyone dropping in. If you need anything you can contact me by email and I can try to send a friend or relative over to help you with whatever you might need. The Neighborhood This is a friendly, safe, quiet, walkable neighborhood. In a 10-15 minute walk (or 2 minute drive) you are in the heart of Westville Village with its restaurants, coffee shops and boutiques. A ten minute drive will get you to downtown New Haven. Getting Around A short walk will take you to the Q or B bus line that can bring you downtown, from there you can get the Metro North train to New York and many other destinations. Other Things to Note This house is in the process of having minor cosmetic updates so there are a few spots where there is peeling paint, older wallpaper or the paper wallpaper backing on the walls. The downstairs is in fine shape. Upstairs one bedroom is not suitable for guests at this point, leaving a fully renovated guest bedroom and a master bedroom for guest use. This house also has a resident feline, who is incredibly sweet and affectionate. Conditions of your stay mean feeding her and giving her water daily, not letting her outside (she doesn't generally try to escape) and perhaps refreshing the litter box. If you do not want litter duty and plan to stay more than a week I will send my brother-in-law over once to change it. It is out of the way in the basement. + More
rules: House Rules Please be respectful of neighbors--keep the grounds tidy and keep noise down after 10pm. Respect my property and cat. There is a home bar/liquor cabinet--help yourself to an evening drink but if you finish a bottle please replace it. Please do not smoke indoors, there is a back deck where you can smoke. Please dispose of cigarette butts in the trash responsibly. I can provide an ash tray on the deck. This is our home and is generally not rented so please just treat it with care. + More

description: Description The Space The house offers a unique living experience with other international professionals visiting a variety of programs through Yale or other universities and hospitals. You can relax comfortably in your own space while having the opportunity to meet others from around the globe! + More
rules: House Rules House Rules 1. The reservation is a (1) one person room only and does not support extended visitors to reside there. Guests are allowed to visit but in a manner so as not to disturb other tenants. In the event that a guest is expected, Landlord and other tenants shall be notified as a courtesy. A $50/week guest fee is strictly enforced. 2. Utilities are included in your rent, however, there is an allowance given for electricity/gas per unit, on a monthly basis. If it is exceeded this will be charged to you. Please be vigilant in turning off lights and not running heat/cool air constantly or using dryer excessively. Turn off lights when not in use. 3. The bathrooms and kitchen must be cleaned after every use. No exceptions. 4. Be courteous to your roommates. Be mindful of noise levels and keep common areas tidy. Under no circumstances are you to enter another roommate's room without permission. 5. Absolutely no smoking or burning candles in the house. Cigarettes are to be smoked outside and disposed of properly. 6. Parking of 2 vehicles is allotted on the side of the building. It is a shared lot and available on a first come-first serve basis. As it is a tandem lot, if you block a car in, you must move it for the car in front of you. On-street parking is available if these spaces are full. Landlord is not responsible for any damage to the vehicle, or its contents. 7. You will be given a front door code to access building. Please do not share this code with others. It is for your safety and the safety of other tenants. As a second line of security, it is advised that you also keep the front door to your unit locked at all times. We will distribute one front door key to each tenant. Each copy of the unit key must be returned after lease ends. 8.If tenant is found to be drinking heavily, using non-prescribed drugs, two or more weeks late on the rent or breaks any of the house rules, the Landlord may terminate his/her Rental Agreement pursuant to Clause J.2 in Lease. 9.Trash and Recycling receptacles are in the back of the unit. (2) Brown bins are for trash and (1) Blue bin is for recycling. Please contribute to wheeling out bins to the curb on Monday night for Trash Pick up Tuesday morning. 10. All communication with Landlord should be directed via listed contact info. + More

about: The most convenient location in New Haven. Perfect for Yale visits!
description: Description The Space This is a small studio inside a very safe building. Only five other studios in the building. It is located on the top floor, so there are no disturbances or noises coming from the other studios. Feels very private. The studio gets lots of natural light. I am a very clean person, so you should have no worries on that matter. Bathroom and kitchen will be particularly clean at your arrival. If you want to cook or use anything in the kitchen, you are more than welcome to it. Clean linen and towels will be provided, as well as a small welcome basket with toiletteries. There is a Walgreens less than a block away and at least 5 coffee shops and bookstores in a one-block range. Two parking garages next door, in case you are bringing your car. It is a small space, so I would not recommend it for more than two persons. Perfect for a couple. + More

about: I have been renting rooms in my home for over ten years. The property is on a back lot, surrounded by woods and next to a horse stable. You would have access to a pool, the kitchen and laundry. There is Wi-Fi and cable TV too.
description: Description The Space It is a quiet space with plenty of comfortable areas for meditative walks and reading. Guest Access The kitchen, living room, yard and pool are common areas. You will have a private bath. Interaction with Guests I live in the house and will be available most days. The Neighborhood This is an ideal setting in the country. The house is pretty isolated with plenty of room in between properties. It is only minutes to two Casinos as well as numerous tourist attractions. I am only a half hour from the Coast Guard Academy, Pfizer and Electric Boat. Getting Around With the exception of a lone city bus once a day there is no other public transportation from the house. There are two Amtrak train stations, one in Mystic and one in New London. You can get a greyhound bus in New London and both Mohegan and Foxwoods Casinos. Taxi's are available also. Other Things to Note I have two small dogs who are very friendly. There are other full time renters in the house. + More
rules: House Rules My house is your house for the length of your stay. I like to have quiet especially in the evenings, so there is no loud music or TV, cooking or laundry after 9pm. There is no smoking on the property. + More

description: Description The Space Close proximity to gorgeous beaches, Mystic Seaport and Aquarium, Foxwoods and Mohegan Sun Casinos. Just 15 minutes away you can hop on the Amtrak or take a ferry to Block Island. An hour and a half from Boston by train, 2 1/2 hours to New York City - this is the perfect place for a relaxing weekend or as a stop between cities. Guest Access Private Bedroom and Bath. Shared Kitchen, Dining, Entertainment, Living centers. Interaction with Guests I have lived in the area a long time and know many fun things to do and the best places to eat! You will have as much space as you need. Getting Around This is a quiet residential area just 5 miles (10 min) from Mohegan Sun, 8 miles from Foxwoods and 12 miles to Mystic. We are about 15 mins from Amtrak stations in New London and Mystic. A car is helpful to explore this area but if you are an avid cyclist there are lots of picturesque country roads to travel. Other Things to Note I have 3 scottie dogs and a very small cat (who will hide most of the time). + More
rules: House Rules Please no smoking or pets. Shoes off in the house. The room is ideal for a single person or couple. Live by the Golden Rule, be respectful to each other and our guests. We tend to get quieter after 10 pm and before 8 am. Always clean up after ourselves in the public areas. If you have any questions or special needs, just let us know. + More

description: Description The Space Enjoy a calm and tranquil stay in a private room at Fair Haven Farmacy, a unique urban farm experience in Fair Haven, a New Haven neighborhood right on the banks of the Quinnipiac River. Quiet room sleeps two, shared full bath right next door. Guest Access You have access to the kitchen and bathrooms, washer and dryer are in the basement. Nice yard with garden and firepit for bonfire nights in cool weather. Coffee and tea provided. Interaction with Guests I really enjoy meeting people and have been renting out space in my home for 20 years since I lived in Memphis, Tennessee and then New York City. Am always open for conversation or glass of wine, tea or plain ol' water! The Neighborhood Cozy house situated in the historic area of Fair Haven right on the banks of the Quinnipiac River. Old fashioned neighborhood, where community comes first. I love this neighborhood for so many reasons and I hope you do too. It's unlike any other area in New Haven. Getting Around Fair Haven is 2 miles east of the New Haven Green. Public transportation from downtown is available. The Q bus will drop you off right at the corner, D bus is a few blocks away. Downtown New Haven is ten minutes from the house by car. Easy access to 91 and 95. Other Things to Note We are right up the street from the Quinnipiac River where wild parrots now live...many birds to watch! We are very close to a marina and there is a lovely Boat House Cafe open for breakfast and lunch within easy walking distance. Shopping on Grand Avenue at CTown. Elm City Market offers organic and natural foods on Chapel Street downtown. There is a great wine store across the Grand Avenue bridge called Grand Vin. Lovely River park down the street for fabulous views of the river and homes. Neighbors are friendly and we have a neighborhood association called Chatham Square where we continue to improve the area and build relationships. Unique place to live. + More
rules: House Rules Check in is between 5pm and 10pm, arrival beyond that must be agreed upon prior to booking. Check out is 12pm. I just ask that you be respectful and not too loud especially after 10pm. Cable TV is available but prefer not too much TV. I invite you to enjoy the neighborhood and we can have meals together if interested, just let me know. + More
