about: A private bedroom with bathroom in a 2-bedroom apartment. Great wall-to-wall ocean view with huge windows for an ocean breeze. Access to livingroom, kitchen, balcony and washer/dryer. 12 min from Yale & 5 minutes from I-95 or Metro North train.
description: Description The Space This is a two-bedroom apartment and I am the only occupant. This is a secure, 8-story apartment building overlooking Long Island Sound less than 100 meters from the beach. The building entrance requires a key that you will have. Parking is free and in a private lot next to the building. There are many nearby restaurants from Italian to Turkish - you name it. Details below. Your room has: A beautiful, wall-to-wall view of Long Island Sound from the 5th floor, A private bathroom with double sink and tub-shower combination, A queen-size bed. High, glass table with two stools by the window, Bureau and closet, Personal AC/heat, Access to livingroom, balcony, fully equipped kitchen & washer/dryer in the apartment, Small, hotel-size refrigerator for convenience in addition to plenty of shared space in the main fridge. Note: I have three very sweet cats. They are not allowed in your bedroom and the apartment has two air-cleaners, but if you have a strong allergy to cats, this may not be for you. Guest Access Guests are welcome to use the washer-dryer, anything found in the fully-equipped kitchen, the living room, balcony, and the high-speed WiFi and basic cable. Kitchen equipment includes a cappuccino and espresso maker, regular drip coffee maker and French press coffee maker, crock-pot, rice-cooker, bread-maker, toaster oven, microwave, electric stove and oven. Interaction with Guests I enjoy talking with guests but interaction is generally just passing in the kitchen and I have no expectations. The Neighborhood The beach, walkable for miles, is less than 100 yards (meters) from the front door. Within a mile, the beach goes from fairly urban to an isolated jetty used mostly for fishing, and sandy beach all the way. You can go fishing, see crabs, collect shells, and watch gorgeous sunrises and sunsets. The West Haven boardwalk, just above the beach, allows for running, walking and biking on a well-maintained, non-commercial, paved trail. There are concerts and dances in one of the parks on the Boardwalk during the summer. Other shore parks nearby within 10 minutes include Silver Sands State Park, a bird sanctuary and another lovely nature preserve with a boardwalk that runs through a beautiful salt marsh along the shore. The immediate neighborhood has restaurants of all types: Italian, Mexican, Peruvian, West Indian, Japanese, Turkish and more. There is seafood, of course, up and down the shore including Stowe's, a great place that you can see from your window. Please note that this is a highly diverse, urban neighborhood. Getting Around Uber is active in the area. Buses: The last bus M-F from downtown New Haven to me is 11:45 PM. Saturday it's 9:45 PM and Sunday 7:30 PM. You can get full bus (EMAIL HIDDEN) (if the URL doesn't show here, it's the abbreviation for our State followed by transit and then the most common url ending. That site has a nice app that lets you put in your start address and destination and date and time and it tells you how to get there by public transportation. There's also Metro-North - see below. Trains: There is a new Metro-North train station 5 minutes away by car (1.7 miles). Union Station in New Haven is the easiest train stop from which to get a bus to me. Across the street from the front of the station, catch a J7 or J5 West Haven bus. The bus takes about 20 min. Tell the driver you want to go to the corner of Washington Street and Capt. Thomas Blvd. in West Haven. Other Things to Note What's Nearby: Here's a guide to beach walks, parks, restaurants, night life, grocery stores and farmers' markets! Beach Walks: South beach-walk (away from New Haven) Go to the beach and turn right on the Boardwalk. This is a nice, urban beachwalk with little parks along the way. At the end of the Boardwalk, after a half mile or a mile is Veterans Walk, with benches right on the water and rocks to sit on, too. A larger park just before this one has weekend concerts one or two evenings a week all summer. Along the way on the right is Jimmies Restaurant, which you can also get to from the beach itself or driving on Capt. Thomas Blvd. Jimmies is very old and famous and that, apparently, is the only reason it's still in business. The food reviews are pretty horrible, unless you want nothing but expensive fried clams and hot dogs. It's a nice place to get a drink on the water, though. The view is great. Better seafood is in the other direction, at Stowe's. Veterans Walk is the end of the Boardwalk, but not your beachwalk! A wide, fine-sand beach extends from there and you can walk it for another couple of miles, either on the sand or on a sidewalk. There is beach volley-ball (town-organized league play) on certain nights and weekends in the summer. North Beach-walk: (towards New Haven) Coming from the apartment, cross the parking lot to the beach and turn left on the Boardwalk instead of right for a very different beachwalk. The Boardwalk quickly turns into sidewalk, and I recommend the beach itself instead of the sidewalk. Less than a block away is Stowe's Seafood - very good food at a very reasonable price, and further on is Chic's Restaurant, a popular fried-seafood place with more of a hang-out atmosphere. A fun clam-shack. Keep going and watch this urban beach turn into a beautiful, isolated jetty going far out into the harbor where there are no people except a few serious fishermen and women. Just beautiful. This is actually a protected bird-sanctuary, so don't venture far into the dunes. Milford: Driving a bit south into the next town, you can find a wildlife sanctuary with a boardwalk going right through a beautiful salt marsh along the shore. This is Silver Sands State Park. Local Restaurants: I'm new in the neighborhood, so this is a work in progress. There is a very wide variety of restaurants! Your favorite review site, like Urban Spoon, Trip Advisor, or Foursquare will have a more complete list than I could possibly provide, but here are a few suggestions: Pizza Why a category for Pizza? Because New Haven has a few of the most famous pizza restaurants in the U.S. Pepe's and Sally's are at 157 and 237 Wooster Street, respectively, in New Haven, and Modern is at 874 State Street. Sally's has recently fallen in ratings, but you have to try at least Pepe's and Modern  you just do. Fast Food: There's a Subway across the street in the little strip mall. Vegie/Vegan: New Haven has tons, and in West Haven, there's Georgie's Diner (URL HIDDEN) which has vegan and gluten-free meals as well as regular diner classics. More Restaurants: Caseus, 93 Whitney Ave, New Haven. Outstanding, reasonably priced and unique. This is a cheese shop with a restaurant specializing in cheese dishes. Extremely good reviews - #1 in New Haven of all Restaurant types on Trip Advisor. Abate, next door to Pepe's Pizza on Wooster Street in New Haven, gets high marks for general Italian cuisine. There is also a pretty good Italian restaurant right across the street from my building. Seafood: There are three seafood places right in the neighborhood, and the best one, Stowe's, is right across the street! There's also a good ice cream parlor just a block away. There is also very fresh seafood to be found at all the Farmers' Markets. See below. Immediate Neighborhood: Take a walk up Campbell Ave and you find everything! Italian, Indian, Puruvian, Turkish, you name it! There are even a few $2 breakfast places! Clubs/Bars There's a good list of New Haven hot spots at the Info New Haven website under "Nightlife." It's a 25 min. drive, but a unique experience is Captain's Cove Seaport in Bridgeport. This is a family destination during the day and a hot, local rock scene at night with a rare, mixed-ages crowd (that means plenty of middle-aged folk along with the younguns). It has indoors and outdoors bars and dance-floors, all on the harbor, and on a boat! Check the online schedule for activities, bands and line-dancing nights! Theater, Museums There's a big list on the Info New Haven website under "Culture-Listing." The Yale Peabody Natural History Museum is free on Thursdays from 2-5 PM. The Yale art museum is free all the time! Local Grocery Shopping & Farmers' Markets: A block away is a little strip mall with a package store and two, dollar-type stores. The first one is like the old General Store. It has a surprising amount of groceries, including a considerable selection of Spanish and Chinese foods, and if you need a pair of jeans, a pressure-cooker, a lawn chair, a USB charger or rachet-straps to hold that mattress on the roof of your car, well, it's got that, too! There's a Stop n' Shop a mile or so away. Go up Campbell to Elm, turn left and keep going. That's also where Georgie's Diner is, with regular diner fare and vegan. Farmers' Markets  Find one on Thursday, Saturday or Sunday. West Haven on the Green (go straight up Campbell) every Thursday and Saturday, 10-2. BEST: In New Haven, the Wooster Square Market is open every Saturday May 4 -December 21, from 9am-1pm. Location: Russo Park, corner of Chapel Street and DePalma Court. Take the F or G bus to Wooster Square. There is also a Farmers' Market at Edgewood Park, corner of Whalley and West Rock Avenues in New Haven May 5  December 22, Sundays, 10:00am  2:00pm. + More
rules: House Rules No smokers. No pets. No parties, although a guest or two is fine. If you use the kitchen, please leave it just as clean as you found it. Please turn off lights and the heat in your room if you go out for the day. It's a strong, brand-new unit and it will heat up the room very quickly when you return. + More

about: Large en-suite bedroom with queen-sized bed in New Haven's safest, hippest neighborhood. Minutes walk from Yale, on Yale shuttle route. Cafes, bars, restaurants, grocery stores just around the corner. Free bicycle! Looking for cat-friendly people.
description: Description The Space Our flat is simply gorgeous. Spacious, full of sunlight, modern, open plan arrangement. Plenty of free parking spots around. Situated in one of the best neighborhoods of East Rock, featuring a small, cozy, and secluded garden. Hidden from the street, provides optimal security for our guests. Bedroom has a queen-sized bed with a brand new Sleepnumber mattress (look it up guys!) that me and my girlfriend just adore, and I know you will too. The mattress is adjustable in terms of firmness (individually for each side!) and also comes with an electric blanket under the sheets for those coooold winter nights (also adjustable for each side). Of course, house will be heated throughout the day (oil). We live here with our friend and flatmate Vujo (also a Yalie), who will be around during most days of the Xmas break. Guests are fully independent, with their own en-suite bathroom and toilet. Colombo, our cat, is a friendly companion and a nap master! Send me a message if you have any questions, I will be happy to answer. Guest Access Guest(s) will occupy en-suite bedroom, totally independent from flatmate. Can use common room, kitchen, washer, dryer etc, and I can give you my bike if you need one. Yale-affiliated guests will be preferred. Interaction with Guests I will be available by email and phone, but my flatmate Vujo will also be around to help you with anything you need. + More

about: Room w/ full bed (2 max) + LR couch space for 2-3 more. I am a Yale Ph.D. student--clean, easygoing, and I have a small dog. You'll have full access to kitchen, bath, backyard, internet, etc. & I am most happy to help you find your way around.
description: Description The Space Steps from Science Hill, the 'Whale' (the famous Yale Hockey Rink), the hospital, undergrad dorms, the delicious food carts, downtown, and on the Yale Shuttle line. We have a big back yard with a fire pit that can be used for BBQs and suchlike. Street parking is generally plentiful. Guest Access You will have free range of the apt: kitchen, bathroom, etc.. Technically up to 5 people could stay here since we have a regular couch plus one that turns into a full-size bed. This is a bit snug, but it's doable! Interaction with Guests I will most likely be in and out, and generally make myself scarce when over 2 people come to stay. I am often free to give rides or advice, and I often enjoy impromptu snacks, dinner, wine, coffee, and/or random chats with my guests. The Neighborhood The location is EXTREMELY close to everything Yale has to offer: the museum, downtown, Wheeler auditorium, old campus, the libraries, etc. Getting Around You can walk everywhere. Also, the Yale shuttle runs up and down Prospect and stops on Winchester as well. Other Things to Note My dog will bark when he hears people coming in, but is otherwise extremely sweet and friendly. He is slightly hyper when he first meets people, but calms down after the greeting phase. + More

about: Spacious farmhouse with 5 acres of privacy. Hiking trails, quiet road, yet 10 minutes from highways and the airport. The one room rental is a large playroom above a 3 car garage with a TV and your own thermostat with central air and heat.
description: Description The Space This room has twin trundle beds and a couch. I have a noise machine for privacy and the room has it's own staircase. Coffee maker and small kitchen table in the room. We have a large eat in kitchen, there is an extra refrigerator in the basement for your use if desired. The bathroom with a stand up shower is not upstairs in the room, it is on the fist floor in the mudroom, off of the kitchen. No one else will have access to the guest bathroom during your stay. We have a large family and this is a very kid friendly house with chickens and a pet rabbit. Guest Access As mentioned, this is a large room over a 3 car garage with private staircase access. The kitchen and bathroom are at bottom of stairs. Basement contains additional fridge. There is a study on the first floor with a computer and internet access. 5 acres of property with a front farmer's porch. Back patio with seating as well. Parking in driveway. Interaction with Guests I am home with youngest child most days but I am in and out. I certainly will make every effort to be available to greet you and help you get settled. I will have a phone at all times as well. I will have light breakfast most days and will communicate this ahead of time with you I you are interested. The Neighborhood Quiet street with hiking trails behind us and a tree farm and small crop across the street. More walkers, bikers, and joggers than cars. There is a small garden, dome apple trees, and fresh eggs when the seasons permits. This is a lovely retreat from the city. Close to Springfield hospitals and jobs, but a quiet country retreat. Getting Around Our driveway is ample and you can park in front of the first garage stall. There is no walkable success to public transportation. 10 minutes to Bradley International Airport. Other Things to Note As I have children, daytime sleep is not always an option though I do have fans in addition to white noise. There are toys in the room but they will be neatly put away. + More

about: An ideal stop when traveling the 1-95 NYC - Boston route. 5 minutes drive time to Uni. of New Haven, VA Hospital & to the Metro North train station to NYC (ride is only 1.5 hours)! Yale U , IKEA & downtown New Haven are just 10 - 15 minutes away.
description: Description The Space Size of room is approximately 12' x 12' in and it has a generous lighted walk-in closet. The room is cozy, clean, and furnished with a twin sized bed that sleeps 1 adult, and we can provide an air bed or an additional comfortable single Thai mattress made available to guests who may need an option to sleeping on the floor (by the way, the floor is clean because no shoes are allowed in the house). Guest Access Room is accessed by a shared entrance and through the house. Located upstairs on the 2nd. floor of the house. WALKING DISTANCE TO WHAT'S NEARBY: The house is within 5 minutes walking distance to downtown West Haven green, minutes walk to the laundromat, convenience stores, restaurants, bank, pharmacy, parks, tennis courts, soccer and baseball fields, and even the West Haven beaches. You can even walk 15 - 20 minutes to the train station. DRIVING TIME TO PLACES OF INTEREST: Universities: University of New Haven (UNH) is just 5 mins, Yale University is 10 minutes, Southern Connecticut State University (SCSU) is 15 minutes, and Quinnipiac University (QU) is approximately 20 minutes. Hospitals: Veterans Affairs (VA) Hospital west Haven is 5 mins, Yale New Haven Hospital and Yale Smilow Cancer Hospital are 10 - 15 minutes (depending on traffic), and IKEA New Haven is 10 minutes. Shopping: Westfield Mall Milford - 15 mins Clinton Crossing Pemium Outlets - 25 mins Westbrook Tanger Outlets - 35 mins OTHER AMENITIES: A shared bathroom is just 3 to 4 steps outside the bedroom. High speed wireless internet access is included during your stay. As a guest, you will have access to kitchen where you will find the microwave to reheat food and a Keurig single cup coffee brewer, and the coffee cart. There are some light snacks in the room to keep your tummy happy during the wee hours of the night! Interaction with Guests I am a friendly yet energetic gal and my hubby is a quiet individual whom you will hardly see (yes, he is a man of very little words and loves his man cave, LOL!). We have been been hosting friends, families, students, and folks from all over the world way before AirBnB was a trend. I love meeting and connecting with new people. I work from home and you will see me from time to time throughout the day. I would be happy to show you around as long as you check with me on my availability ahead of time. I love food and that makes me frequent local coffee shop, bistros, and restaurants. Please ask me if you would like to hang out sometime. Depending on location of venture, hubby may or may not accompany us. *smile* The Neighborhood House is located on a quiet and safe secondary street. There is ample street parking available. Depending on the season, you may want to check out the West Haven beaches and parks nearby. Getting Around Public Transportation and Access to Connecticut roads are as follows. Connecticut (CT) Transit (bus services): Transit "B" bus line to University of New Haven, Veterans Hospital, and "J" bus line to Yale University. Minutes to Connecticut I-95, Rt. 15, Rt. 34, and Rt. 1 (Boston Post Road). 5 minutes walking distance to the bus stop. Taxi: Metrotaxi CT is available in the area. Uber or Lyft You can also use the Uber or Lyft apps to request drivers. Other Things to Note NOTE: Planning a longer stay (60 - 90 days?) DO NOT DO THE INSTANT BOOK! I will send you a special pricing. And if it is right, you can go ahead and book it. The room provides comfort for 2 guests. A maximum of 3 adults is allowed for this room. Just so you know, the house is an older house and since our household either sleeps late or wake up early (5 am), the floors may make slight creeks when walked on. So, if you're a light sleeper and are ok with that, then that's good. We are not noisy people too, just my occasional laughters. :) I am a super relationship builder so, having a picture and stories on your profile will give you a better chance to book the room. I value your comfort and your privacy and ask that you give the same respect to other members of my household. Communication is key and I always enjoy a good conversation that carries loads of energetic laughters. + More
rules: House Rules We appreciate guests who follow standard living rules. Please respect others in the household and clean after yourself. Please treat items on the property as if they are yours, handle with care. If you are a long term guest (30 days or more), we would appreciate any help with you helping up with the upkeep of your living space - take out trash from your room and you can also use the vacuum to clean your space. - NO DRUGS - NO ALCOHOL - NO SMOKING INDOORS! - NO SHOES IN THE HOUSE We also practice a "no shoes" policy in the house so we request that guests leave their shoes on the rack provided at the entrance of the home. To ensure comfort to everyone, no pets and no smoking allowed, and preferably no alcohol on premises. - KITCHEN USE You may use the kitchen to do light cooking. The only thing that we ask is, please, no pork and other pork based products when using our pots, pans, dishes, and silverware in the kitchen. - TURN DOWN TIME We ask that loud music or other audio should be kept at a minimum starting midnight to respect turn down time for others. + More

description: Description The Space Private TV and closet included in room with access to Netflix and Hulu. Attached enclosed porch with a beautiful yard abutting the forest. Gorgeous views of the area and a short drive to the beautiful Connecticut river. Guest Access Guest will have access to private room, shared bathroom/shower, full kitchen and living/sitting area Interaction with Guests I'm usually in and out of the house throughout the day but I respect people's privacy. We will be sharing the kitchen and bathroom but other than that I usually am working on school work as I'm in a Master's program at a nearby college. The Neighborhood There is a small park with a playground, baseball field and basketball court within walking distance of the residence Getting Around Uber costs about $12-16 get to Bradley international airport. It's about $18-25 to both Hartford or Springfield. Other Things to Note I have a 7 year old small parsons terrier who is trained. He loves being around people and being pet. + More

about: Perfect spot for adventurous travelers looking to get off the grid and enjoy a historic neighborhood and some peace and quiet. Very comfy queen size sofa bed is waiting for you! Come enjoy Fair Haven and see the lobster boats on the Quinnipiac River!
description: Description The Space Perfectly comfortable queen-size Ethan Allen sofa bed with super soft plush Tempur Pedic cover and many pillows available for those who are in for a bit of adventure and like to live outside the box. Sofa is in the living room of a traditional "old style" home with immediate access to a private half bath and kitchen stocked with beverages,fruit, yogurt, coffee and teas, and kombucha if you are in the mood. This adventure includes sharing the house with me, your host and sometimes other house guests. I am pretty quiet and expect the same. But I do love a good conversation if the situation strikes. If not, no problem. I go with the flow. I am a casual girl and so you won't find formalities in this house except for an overall common sense approach to neatness and friendliness. This "shared" room is located in a newly renovated home in the historic area of Fairhaven, which is right next to the Quinnipiac River. You can leisurely walk to the marina and get some food at the nearby Boat House Cafe, or walk along the river and watch the Grand Avenue Bridge go up when the lobster boats come in. Public transportation is right around the corner from the house. 15 minute ride to Amtrak or Metro North. Quick access to 1-95 or 1-91. Beautiful ocean vistas, lakes, or mountain hiking are literally minutes away. New Haven is known for its variety of ethnic cuisine and a very good wine store and local breweries are close by. Guest Access You have access to the kitchen and bathrooms, washer and dryer are in the basement. Nice yard with garden and firepit for bonfire nights in cool weather. Coffee and tea provided. Interaction with Guests I really enjoy meeting people and have been renting out space in my home for 20 years since I lived in Memphis, Tennessee and then New York City. Am always open for conversation or glass of wine, tea or plain ol' water! The Neighborhood Cozy house situated in the historic area of Fair Haven right on the banks of the Quinnipiac River. Old fashioned neighborhood, where community comes first. I love this neighborhood for so many reasons and I hope you do too. It's unlike any other area in New Haven. Getting Around Public transportation is right around the corner and downtown New Haven is ten minutes by car. Easy access to 91 and 95. We are very close to a marina and there is a lovely Boat House Cafe open for breakfast lunch and dinner within easy walking distance. Other Things to Note There is a great wine store across the Grand Avenue bridge called Grand Vin. Lovely River park down the street for fabulous views of the river and homes. Neighbors are friendly and we have a neighborhood association called Chatham Square where we continue to improve the area and build relationships. Unique place to live. + More
rules: House Rules Check in is between 5-10pm, later check must be agreed upon before booking. Check out by 12pm. Smoking OK outside. Pets are not allowed. No loud noise after 10pm. You may keep food in the refrigerator but you must take it with you when you leave. Prefer no shoes in the house. Backyard firepit and outdoor space available. Life is very busy so I do not normally allow for inquiries on the day of arrival so please book at least 48 hours ahead. Thank you! + More

about: This is our second listing. Its a big room on the first floor with nice bay window looking out the front of the house, close access to living room, kitchen and bathroom.
description: Description The Space Nice clean and Spacious fully furnished room, in a ranch style home. Located just 45 minutes from Bradley Airport, 60 minutes from Mohegan Sun and Foxwoods Resorts Casinos, just 90 minutes from Boston Quincy Market, Just a 2 hour ride to New York Time Square. Located just minutes from grocery stores and restaurants, 15 minutes to Buckland Hills Mall and The Promenade shops at Evergreen Walk. If your a beach lover it's less then an hour to Rhode Island beaches. Located just down the street Town of Vernon Rails to Trails System bike, walk or run on 44 miles of well maintained trails Take a close look at my location you will find everything needed to enjoy your time here. Bill P.S. 3 bigger bed rooms, nice back yard with campfire pit Guest Access You enter the home through the front door, second access would be through the garage. The Showcased room is in the basement, so you head down stairs through the kitchen, at the bottom you turn left to enter the room through a door which has a lock. The room is large as seen in the picture. Shared full kitchen, washer and dryer Interaction with Guests I have a bedroom up stairs, so I am in and out with my daily routines. Depending on your wants and needs I will provide assistance as needed. Plenty of parking Getting Around I will make my self available for rides, tours, walking, biking, kayaking, rock climbing, geocaching, backpacking. description: Description The Space This home is located in a hilltop setting in central Waterbury. It is on the Westward side of the hill so afternoons are very sunny with great sunsets. This is a 3 story house with a large apartment on each story. Each story has its own full kitchen and bathroom. The nearby houses are all smaller single family houses which makes the area more quiet and peaceful than a setting with rows of 3 family houses. Getting Around There are basic bus routes that service the City of Waterbury and connect it with other cities and towns in Connecticut. You can see more detailed information on this by visiting CTTransit. There is also the Waterbury Station of the Waterbury-Bridgeport, CT line which connects to the New Haven-New York Metro North Commuter Railroad line. This gives you access to all Coastal Connecticut Cities and New York City. This also gives you the ability to go from JFK airport to Waterbury completely through transit. You can also use a private limousine service to get to and from Waterbury to JFK/LGA (New York) or BDL (Hartford) airports for somewhere around $100 to $150 for a private trip (door to terminal). As always, if you are simply travelling by car that is the most independent way to get around the state of Connecticut. From Waterbury, CT you can drive to NY or Boston. + More

about: Come stay in this great apartment right in Barrry Square close to downtown Hartford!
description: Description The Space Large air-conditioned queen bedroom steps away from Trinity College, the Institute of Living and Hartford Hospital. There is a front and back yard, with a wrap around porch, perfect for barbequing and entertaining. Feel free to use the space for a gathering of friends, a party or a celebration. There is parking off-street parking in the backyard. There are restaurants, grocery stores and shops near by, as well as public transportation. I hope you decide to stay here, please contact me if you have any questions. Guest Access Guest will have access to the front wrap-around porch and the second floor back balcony both are furnished with a wicker patio set. Coin operated laundry machines are located in the basement. A parking space will be reserved for guests. Guests are free to enjoy the backyard however they see fit as in a picnic, tossing around a ball of any kind, or just to hang out in general. If you require anything, or would like to request any sort of accommodations please feel free to ask. I love to always add improvements and make the place more inviting :) Interaction with Guests I'm available as need be, but I like to give guests there space. The Neighborhood The neighborhood is very close to downtown and a very convenient location to anyone working at any insurance company, in the convention center, at the hospital or in the college. Getting Around The main attractions, restaurants, theaters and bars are all downtown which is a five minute drive or about a 25 minute leisurely walk. We have the Bushnell Theater and Front Street Movie theater, fine dining at the Max's Resturant, Trumbell Kitchen, Salute and many more, bars such as City Steam, Black bar and other very popular locations. Aside from fine dining we have great ethnic eateries like Aladdin's (Mediterranean), Royal Masala (Indian), and Fire and Spice (Vegan) and many different Spanish, Chinese and American places. Lastly Dunkin Dounts is about three blocks away for early morning coffee and breakfast. Other Things to Note I welcome all inquiries and requests. + More

about: Come stay on a queen size comfortable pull-out couch. Great for those travelling on a budget. AMAZING water views, almost like living on a boat. Shared bath, fully stocked kitchen & laundry. Restaurants just within steps. Metro to NYC 2 blocks away.
description: Description The Space This space is wonderful if you need a clean, quiet and peaceful night sleep. Loft living on the water at its best. You won't find a better view of the Harbor. The living room couch can can comfortably sleep up to 2 people. If in a real pinch there is an air mattress we can offer for use as well. But Ideally, this space is for a single person or traveling couple. Guest Access You will have access to the living room, downstairs 1/2 bath, kitchen and laundry. Full bath upstairs in loft is limited hours. The Neighborhood There are VERY FEW communities this close to NYC with quaint, picturesque views of the Long Island Sound with amazing nightlife all within 2 blocks from the house. Award-winning Restaurants, Beer Gardens, Martini Bars, Shopping, Movies, an aquarium, boat trips to the nearby lighthouse and more. Getting Around From Grand Central Station, South Norwalk (SONO) is only a short 50 min express train ride to the nearby MetroNorth station, 2 blocks away. If coming for an overnight stay, long weekend or mid week vacation (URL HIDDEN) CAR IS NEEDED. This is a very walk-able area, modern, sleek new apartment lofts that New Yorkers are flocking to move. Bring your bike for even more flexibility! Many of my visitors come in from NYC with their bikes! + More
rules: House Rules No Smoking No Pets No Drugs No Parties No loud music No Visitors No Overnight Guests Firm Check-in and Check-out times to turn the space around. This is not a child-proofed home. + More

about: This is a modest space; a front living room/office, former wellness space that serves as your large bedroom with its own set of lovely french doors separating it from the rest of the apartment. Access is via the front porch/front door.
description: Description The Space I am traveling during the first half of January 2016, so the space will not be (EMAIL HIDDEN)mon front room of a main street apartment in Deep River, CT that can be closed off for privacy. Shared bath and kitchen. I live in the back. The location is right in the center of Deep River village. The Connecticut River is a pleasant 15 minute walk from here. If you stay more than one night, you can have a key to come and go. The kitchen is available to use and I would be happy to show you around a little! Deep River has a couple of restaurants, shops, grocery store, hardware store and laundromat a short walk away! A dog and cat live here as well. The front room faces Elm Street, which can be a bit busy in the morning. In the summer, more so than the winter, the sounds of traffic begin early. Although it is somewhat intermittent, it can be loud at times as the town hall is across the street and its three story, brick facade reflects and amplifies the sound. The bath is small, and the kitchen very modest. In fact the entire place is quite modest, so if you are used to luxury, this may not be the listing for you. The bed is a full size futon that can sleep two. I can also set up a camp cot for a third person! Wifi is available. Guest Access Guest have access to the front room, porch, galley kitchen and bathroom. Interaction with Guests I am around a lot and happy to try to be helpful with knowledge of the area! Dolly the dog and Pietra the cat live here. They will interact with you. Both are super friendly, but if you aren't comfortable with either, please consider a different listing. The Neighborhood Deep River is a nice, little village with all the needed services - grocery, laundry, hardware store, restaurants and banking services. Getting Around Everything is accessible by walking. There is also a small, regional bus service called 9-Town Transit that can be accessed across the street. Other Things to Note You will have your own access through the front door. There are three apartments in this building. I am on the ground floor and there is a numeral '2' on the front door, which is accessed from the front porch. + More
rules: House Rules Kitchen is available to cook your own food and should be left clean and tidy. There is a hot pot for making tea/coffee on the shelf. Bathroom is small - a towel left over the shower bar is used as a floor mat. Clean bath towels are on the shelf and may be used by guests. A basket is left in the front room for used towels. Linens are provided. There is a computer in the room that may be used. Also, the wifi password will be written on a piece of paper and left near the computer. Shades for privacy are on all the windows in addition to curtains and bamboo (translucent) shades. No smoking in the house, of course and pets are probably not a good idea because Dolly, as friendly as she is, is also protective. + More

It's fully furnished, with a full-sized bed and a large futon, as well as additional comfortable seating within the space. The bed can easily fit two as well as the futon, which opens up to about an extra long full-sized bed. The dining table sits four and the kitchen is fully stocked with equipment! about: Room in our beautiful, well-lit three-bedroom home in bursting-with-life East Rock. Huge yard; close to downtown and Yale (very near free shuttle!); full kitchen; air conditioning; washer and dryer in unit; colorful, large common areas; pets welcome.
description: Description The Space This time of year is perfect, and our huge backyard is right there for you to take advantage of. It's a lovely little house, with wood-paneled kitchen/dining area and a cozy set of couches in the living room. The bedroom is fully furnished but otherwise empty, before a longer-term tenant moves in. Guest Access Our home is your home: stocked kitchen is yours to use; full bathroom is shared; spacious dining and living rooms are comfortable for lounging or chatting; washer and dryer are in-unit in the basement. Interaction with Guests There will be one other person in the house with you (lovely guy), but the two of us who live there regularly won't be around, but a neighbor across the street is happy to help in emergencies. The Neighborhood Modern Pizza (one of the "big three" for New Haven-style apizza) is just a block away--we recommend the eggplant. Try the Pantry and their cinnamon roll pancakes for breakfast, Mezcal for their cocktails and great upscale Mexican, or Cafe Romeo for a coffee break, sandwich, or salad. Groceries are also just a block away, at either Nica's Market or the corner store convenience mart. Walk around in the evenings and enjoy the burgeoning gardens. East Rock itself is a very nice walk, too, and gives a great view over the city. Getting Around You can catch a Yale shuttle (free to the public) two blocks away to head downtown or to Yale's campus. + More

about: Escape to the Litchfield County, Ct. Our spacious room with private entrance, overlooks the beautiful Farmington River, on 6 lush acres. Feast on our organic breakfast. Spend the day hiking, biking, kayaking, fly fishing or just relaxing!
description: Description Guest Access This room has separate access and you have full access to the second floor of this building for your stay. Interaction with Guests We are glad to help you to make your stay as joy-filled and peaceful as possible. The Neighborhood Our house sits directly on the Farmington River in the Northwest Corner of Connecticut. It has direct access to the sought-after Greenwoods Pool fly fishing area, as well as a mecca for kayakers (kayaks are available). Our area is filled with Bike Trails, hiking and lakes and ponds for swimming. The dining in Litchfield country has a wide range of options with a plethora of farm to table options. We love our natural environment and work to protect it by organic gardening, re-cycling and composting. Other Things to Note This room is better suited to early risers. + More
rules: House Rules Ours is quiet, peaceful, healthful environment, in harmony with nature. We appreciate your respectful behavior. + More

about: Our room is quite spacious (25x12 ft), with a southern wall of windows that look out into a courtyard. We provide guests with two free meals a day, access to a full bathroom, laundry facilities, and free wifi. MGMT lived here! Close to Main St.
description: Description The Space We live in a historic dorm at Wesleyan University, a prestigious liberal arts school in the heart of Middletown Ct. Our room is a triple, currently only occupied by two students, with more than enough room (13x15), and an extra bed for a third guest. Not only does the room come with numerous accommodations, including free wifi and two free meals a day, it was the birthplace of the band MGMT, who got their start living together here their freshman year. Guest Access You have access to bathrooms, showers, a mini fridge, dresser and closet space, a library, and more! If you have any special needs, let us know and we can see if they can be accomedated! Interaction with Guests Though it is a dorm room, it can be partitioned and you will have as much privacy as you need. The Neighborhood We attend a dynamic college with events, ranging from concerts to lectures to dance performances, happening almost every night. We are able to recommend many of the restaurants in the area, and will be more than happy to take you to different shows. Getting Around There is limited public transportation, but if you are coming from New Haven, there is a infrequent shuttle. Campus is very walkable and close to town. + More
rules: House Rules Since we attend college, many of the buildings require keyed access. If you wanted to get into the room, you would obviously need to let us know, so we can swipe you into the building. We do not allow smoking indoors, or burning candles or incense. Other than that, we just ask that you be respectful. + More

about: Calm, friendly, professionally-minded, 5000 square feet, amazing backyard, and more! We have a furnished (full-size bed, desk) room on the 2nd floor with sunny windows, closet, and your own attic space. You would share a bath with one person.
description: Description The Space Note: the room that is available is larger than room shown- just wanted to get it listed, will update room pictures soon! It is difficult to describe how big and spacious this house really is - we use it almost like two homes! You would be using the main level has a spacious kitchen and state-of-the-art oven, living room with windows surrounding three sides, a dining room, a sunroom, a large walk-out patio, and much more. This space is far larger than most homes! The basement has an open floor plan, a dining area, living area, full kitchen/bar, and small gym area - all of which you are more than welcome to come down and use as well. You are getting far more space and much more privacy than you would get just about anywhere else, with much more cool stuff, at truly bargain price. Also - laundry is free to use (please set an alarm so you don't leave your laundry in all day) and the back patio and BBQ are wonderful in the summer! Guest Access There are no real limitations on where you can go or what you can use except for one - please do not enter any personal bedrooms. So we welcome you to make yourself at home but respect everyone's privacy. Interaction with Guests We are graduate students at UConn who like having a nice, clean, spacious, and relaxing place to come home to after a long day at the lab. With a house as sunny and spacious as this, the atmosphere is calm and relaxing but still fun (just to be make sure there is no misunderstanding of what 'fun' means, we definitely have moved on from the drama and crazy parties of undergrads). We are Air BNB-ing this summer only because we have just the summer available for this room. Like most graduate students, we are busy; for that reason, graduate school (especially at UConn) can be fairly isolating. After a long day, sometimes we'll just watch a movie and have a drink, but it is nice to have pleasant people to do it with if you choose. We don't have parties at home (it is really a home, not a party house), but like to have smaller gatherings for a BBQ. We like to get together on occasion with another house of graduate students that live close by to have dinner, go out to dinner in Willimantic, or do something active outdoors. A lot of it depends on what you like to do - some roommates have just loved to cook gourmet meals on the awesome oven and eat them on our picnic or patio tables. We prefer to study/work outside the house, but it is quiet enough to study peacefully here during the day if you want. The Neighborhood The Historic Hill District is a great part of town close to restaurants and other attractions. Willimantic is the largest town within 15 minutes of UConn and has cafes, cool stores (chocolate store, a cupcake store), the Willimantic Brew House, and more! Unlike Storrs, there are also local events (3rd Thursday, Boom Box Parade) as well. Also, unlike most towns in the area, if you don't have a car, you can walk downtown or to the bus stop (which goes to the UConn campus) from the house! We are a VERY short walk to the ECSU campus! The neighborhood is also very nice - it may be the nicest in town. We are surrounded by professionals and families. We have never had issues with the neighbors and they have always been friendly and helpful to boot. Getting Around Very walkable compared to most of the towns in this region - you can walk downtown if you'd like. It is a short walk to the bus stop (less than 10 minutes). See the Windham Region Transit District schedule here: (website hidden)_Schedule.pdf Other Things to Note We are looking for standard, common sense things: someone who is friendly, calm, professional, clean, communicative, and responsible. We have had good luck finding this type of person in the past so you can expect the same! + More
rules: House Rules Just one: respect the home and the people in it! There are a couple of other guidelines, but that is the main idea that implies everything else (courteous parking, doing dishes in a timely manner, etc). + More

about: It's a 2 bedroom apartment with availability in 1 bedroom. The area is on the west end of Hartford city. Peaceful and safe. Unfortunately only available for female guests as my roommates wouldn't be comfortable otherwise.
description: Description The Space It's a carpeted house with a fireplace and has Mark Twain Museum just across the street. Perfect place to be, if you want to get a mix of the downtown and the upper west side experience. Guest Access You can use our apartment, the wide L shaped hall, the kitchen and our bedroom. It's a cosy space in a beautiful locality. Interaction with Guests I will not be in town, but would be available throughout for any assistance. However, my flatmate is a lovely host - she will be more than happy to help you make your stay in Hartford a priceless memory. The Neighborhood Elizabeth Park and Bushnell Park are beautiful parks at walking distance. The Cheesecake Factory, World of Beers, Russian Lady, the Tavern are must visit hotspots in Hartford. If interested in museums, the Mark Twain museum is just across the street and can be viewed from the apartment. Getting Around The CT transit bus stop is 10 steps from the apartment. Union station, the closest out-station with Amtrak, Peterpan (Greyhound) and other public services, is about a 1 mile away. There is a Car Rental service RAC in 5 minute walking distance. West Hartford and Downtown Hartford are the happening areas around, less than 1 mile from the locality. Other Things to Note There's laundry washer and dryer services in the building, but they are paid services. + More
rules: House Rules Be good to my roommate. No curfew. Available only for female guests + More
